review_body: This was my first trip to any island in Hawaii.Unfortunately, this was during the whole "Covid-19" hysteria. Because of this, some services were limited or suspended at the hotel and surrounding establishments.Most importantly I would stay again.My room was comfortable and sitting out on the balcony to eat my meals or just relax after an outing was very nice. You can see the ocean from the roof top pool or the mountains north of the hotel. The hotel was a clean and vibrant colored establishment.The location was great!You're approximately 2 city blocks from the beach and surrounded by food spots and shopping like Ross (literally across the street) to the trendy high end "i spent it cause i have it" shops like Jimmy Choo and Coach.Even though things were different than usual, the service I received was solid. Cheyne was my first contact when I valeted my car. He was welcoming and answered all my questions about rates and what to expect while leaving my car with him. April checked me in and was very sweet and soft spoken. I also ate breakfast at the onsite restaurant take out only and was pleasantly pleased.I would suggest the hotel this hotel to others. It was clean. I felt safe. The location was great and service from staff met my standards.

This is a charming and centrally located hotel with great people and service. The cafe next door was an added plus. The valet car service was excellent. We were booked into an airbnb for 4 nights but the situation there was so bad we moved out after one night. I called Shoreline in the morning and they had rooms available for us in the early afternoon. They helped with luggage and information about the area. We will definitely stay with them again if we return to Honolulu!

My husband and I stayed at the Shoreline for 7 nights in February. I would definitely stay again in the future. While not directly on the beach it is literally a 5 minute walk and in the heart of Waikiki. The cost of this hotel is so reasonable for its location. The staff is very helpful, the rooms are large and clean and it has a rooftop pool with a great view.Thank you Shoreline for a great stay!

central locationclean roomssmall but clean and nice roof top poolnice bar „heavenly“ just at the site breakfast, lunch, dinnersome rooms may be noisy because of traffic and air conditioning main machine near by

The stay was nice, but the valet Cheyne was absolutely amazing, from his knowledge of the area to the care he took of our vehicle. The only reason I would come back is for Cheyne. The experience was amazing.

This hotel is in a good location and is a good value based on the surrounding properties and prices. However, I can't recommend this property. The level of customer service I received was shockingly hostile. If there is a misunderstanding/miscommunication/disagreement, prepare for a steady diet of deny/deflect/accuse. I had an issue at check-out and had documentation, that I pointed to, supporting my interpretation of the information. I was not seeking money. I just wanted some acknowledgement of my position and some form of apology/empathy. Instead I was made to feel like I was trying to rob them. Calls were not returned, emails were ignored and promises of "I will respond to you tomorrow" were broken. Even if you have documentation and the names of employees, prepare to be treated poorly. The smirk I got at check out clearly said, "We have your money and you have an Uber waiting for the airport...buh-bye".

We stayed here on a one night stopover on our way home. Location is excellent being one block away from Waikiki. The hotel is rather old, but with a new paint job that makes it look modern in photos. In real person, the carpet was stained, the air conditioning sounded like an airplane engine and bathroom was slightly moldy. Given the price paid, location, service and length of stay, it was acceptable. However, we wouldn’t return for a weeklong stay.

全てのサービス、設備が良かった！ホテルには11時頃に到着したが、チェックインをさせてくれ、さらに部屋のアップグレードまでしてくれた。部屋には無料野々村ウェルカムドリンク・フードがあり、ロビーにもフリードリンクが常備されており、とても快適だった！どこに行くにもアクセスが抜群で、コスパが良すぎるホテルだった！All services and facilities were good! We arrived at the hotel around 11 o'clock, but they checked in and even upgraded the room. There is a free Nonomura welcome drink and food in the room, and free drinks are always available in the lobby, so it was very comfortable! It was a hotel with excellent access to everywhere and the cospa was too good!

I attend schools here on Oahu and had a recent staycation before I head back home for spring break. I stayed at Shoreline Hotel and had an amazing experience. It’s located in a very convenient location for shopping and trying different kinds of foods. It’s very close to the beach (which is amazing!!) and has amazing views from the rooftop pool! The staff was very friendly and Jonathan gave me some good recommendations while I go to school in Hawaii!
I absolutely live the vibe of the hotel. It’s in a very convenient area and had excellent customer service. Jonathan was able to give me many recommendations for places to eat. 10/10 will come back

The place was clean and quiet. We loved the quirky colors and decorations. They had something different every day in the early afternoon (candy/popcorn, etc) so that was a cute touch. The front staff was outstanding, patient and did all they could to make our stay as comfortable as possible.

cute, stylish. I used to work next door, so to see this transformation was very nice. my issue: the front desk uses tall oversize computer monitors. you can't see anyone behind them, and worse, they can't see you. I went down to get pool towels (which should be at the pool IMHO) and stood in line completely unseen for several minutes. the attendant left her station without seeing me....I had to follow her to the back to get her attention. I believe it is difficult for them to see anyone walking into the lobby if they are looking at the screen

Had a great time at Shoreline. Close proximity to most of what Waikiki Beach area has to offer. Not the cheapest, but also not the most expensive; great middle ground that allowed for a very enjoyable stay. Josh was a huge help with recommendations and truly helped us make the most of our stay!

This place is a convenient escape from the hustle and bustle of downtown Waikiki. Staying here you feel like you right in the middle of things. It's a very short walk to the International Market Place, Royal Hawaiian, Top of Waikiki, and obviously the beach. If you're a couple looking for a nice and secure place to keep your things while spending most of the day out and about exploring this is the ideal spot for you. Street parking isn't readily available but they do have a garage. We had a very good experience and they've got great backgrounds for those of looking for great photos.

The Staff and the Shoreline Management ~ all continue to bring much aloha to every visit ~ I often stay in town when photographing my niece's Hula at the major Hotels orsome of Hawai'i s finest musician's at different venue's or Hotel's from the Queen of Waikiki the Moana to the Ou Rigger's Kane Ka Pila Grille~ Josh, JJ and all make my stay a my stay there a pleasant one ~ When not staying with Ohana on Oah'u The hotel is in a prime location to walk to the venue's with my camera equipment in minutes ~ Kimo

We stayed here for 4 nights and enjoyed our entire stay. Very friendly and helpful staff. They run activities for guests in the lobby, there are notices in the elevators of what’s happening during the week. There’s a pool on top of the building with great views of the area. Located within easy walking distance to the beach, shops, restaurants and bars. Anything you need is a short walk in any direction you go. Our room was directly across the hall from the elevators and we didn’t hear the sound of them at all. You can hear the city noises with the patio doors closed but you can hear that from any room in any hotel (we did stay in other hotels). I loved the cheerful decor of the hotel. Our room and bathroom were well cleaned and the hotel is very clean in general. We would gladly stay here again!

My girlfriend and I stayed at the Shoreline Hotel for one week. We would have left the first day and gone somewhere else but we paid in advance and Shoreline would only return 50% of our money so we stayed.Everywhere we went in the hotel it was dirty including the bathrooms in the lobby, the elevators, the carpet in the halls, our room etc. The clean area was the lobby itself. The room itself was small for the price we paid. There was no microwave in the room. You get two free bottles of water everyday but the bottles are only about 4 ounces so they are very small. The walls are paper thin and you can hear everything happening in the other rooms on your floor. The pool is on the roof and you must use the stairs to get to the 15th floor from the 14th. If you have trouble climbing stairs you won't be able to use the dark murky pool that awaits you. Be careful when entering the hotel. The steps leading to the front door are broken and dangerous. Once again if you have trouble with stairs this could be a problem for you. If it has been raining be careful when you make it to the top of those stairs because the pavement at the top is very slippery. Even the cheapest hotels I have stayed in offer some kind of food in the morning but not the Shoreline. The hotel only provides coffee and they had no creamer the last two days. The staff at the front desk couldn't careless about our concerns. Only housekeeping workers seemed friendly at this hotel. The decor was old and nasty. I feel like this hotel got stuck in the 1970's.Our stay at this hotel was absolutely horrible. You have been warned. Stay away from the Shoreline Hotel. I know I will never return.

Beautiful smaller hotel with great staff and a great location. The size and setup of the hotel gives you a more personal experience. Rooms and all public areas are colorfully appointed. Beach, shopping and restaurants is all within a short walk. All day coffee and water available in the lobby ad well as a daily little happening. We loved the place and will definetly go back again!

Shoreline hotel is in the perfect location and only a few hundred metres from everything you would need, the service was unreal and the staff were super helpful and so nice. I would 100% recommend and stay here again

This is a fun, fresh, well located hotel. Very helpful and friendly staff. Great amenities / extra touches such as unlimited coffee, flavoured water, good quality shower gel/shampoo, beach towels, fridge and seating area. We had a slight issue on arrival, caused by the booking agent, but resolved quickly and to our satisfaction by the hotel with issue. Happy vibe, clean and would stay there again.

Our stay at the shoreline hotel has been nothing short of amazing. Josh from guest services has been great for recommendations and accommodating needs. The hotel has something put on for the guest every day like fairy floss and lollies plus flavoured waters & coffee in the lobby everyday. Cheers for a great time.

Safety is important to me, especially traveling as a single woman. I felt safe at the Shoreline. The vibrant colors are inviting and fun. Staff were so kind and welcoming. Josh & Justine are terrific. Josh provided me with recommendations related to tourist attractions based on my interests. Thank you Josh & everyone at the Shoreline hotel.
user_name:
ramirezm0920
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed here two nights on our way to Australia from Victoria, B.C. Exactly what we were looking for, a clean healthy environment to relax in before a long flight down under.. The staff were super friendly and helpful.

This is a good hotel at a good price. It is not on the beach, not is it "premier", but it is just off the mail drag, is very near all the action, has very friendly and helpful staff and the rooms are very nice.

Staff was great. Stayed here with my teenagers for winter break and the loved the décor. Hotel is located near everything. Parking is valet only ($30 per day) There were daily activities in the lobby.

Room was basic bed with desk. Appeared to have been renovated but mostly with paint. Grout in bathroom tile was painted. Advertised beach chairs and umbrellas, however, that program was eliminated. Hallways dark blue. Roof top pool had 2 chairs.

The room itself was ok. Desperately needed a paint job as one of the walls in the room was covered in scuff marks. No ventilation in the restroom. No parking or breakfast. Valet parking service is 30 a night. Front desk employees are hidden behind huge desktops, making it difficult to interact. The only thing I really enjoyed was the location.

First, the hotel is unusual: colorful, bright, roomy. Every room has a balcony and especially rooms in higher floors offer a great view towards the ocean! There are comp snacks in the room plus water, coffee & tea and fruit infused waters in the lobby all day round, beach towels are available, a pool on the rooftop, workshops are being offered and employees are all very friendly and helpful. Josh, the receptionist, was the pure delight and as repeat visitors we got an upgrade to a suite in the top floor. It's not inexpensive, but compared to many other hotels in Waikiki it's worth its money.

Shoreline Hotel had a fun and vibrant vibe. It had daily special events for the guests in the late afternoon. The hotel is located in the center of the Waikiki shopping and hotel area. Parking is expensive and limited. We didn’t want to pay $30/day or run the risk of the hotel not having space, so we parked along the canal that is within walking distance from the hotel.

My husband and I stayed at the shoreline for our honeymoon. It was a good value and the decor from the photos looked super fun, so we thought, why not? The hotel is super instagrammy, but when you are there it does just feel like an old hotel with a new paint job, new carpets and some interesting art work. The rooftop pool was super small, with barely any room to walk around it.Some great things about it was the location! Very close to shopping and Waikiki beach. The fruit infused water in the lobby! Free Hawaiian snacks in the room! And it was on top of Heavenly which had great breakfast! So if you are looking for a fun great value hotel, this would be a good choice to stay with friends. But if you are going to Honolulu on your honeymoon or another monumental occasion, pick somewhere else.

front desk and valet was friendly and kind, the employees were very helpful, the hotel seems like a old building, elevators needs repair, good water station with variety of refreshment such as coffee and tea

The Shoreline Hotel offers good value in a location that is central to most things in Waikiki. The staff are always pleasant, cheerful and helpful. The rooms are bright and clean with comfy beds. The hotel is a refreshing change to the big chain hotels.

Super location and very clean. The staff was very accommodating and friendly. Bright and cheery colors through out. The restaurant right next door is very handy. They have an afternoon event most days off the week.

Very happy with the accommodation and its central location. Also unexpectedly received 10% off our meals at the restaurant next door. A short walk to the beach and close to lots of brand shops. Would stay again Wayne

This little hotel, just one block from the beach, features small but upbeat rooms, with comfortable beds. What you get is pretty basic, a mini-fridge but no microwave, two small bedside drawers rather than a full dresser, and the air conditioning doesn't go on high if that's what you like. But, the staff was lovely, I liked being able to open my sliding doors to a small balcony for fresh air, room was pretty quiet, I quickly got used to the bright decor and found it cheerful and overall it suited me just fine, especially since it was significantly less money than the other hotels recommended on trip advisor. Tips: I'd avoid rooms ending in 28 or 30 as they border the elevator shaft. If you are staying more than 4 nights there's a 5 nights for 4 deal.

Right in the heart of Waikiki ... clean rooms attentive staff ... would stay again especially if your happy not to pay the prices to stay on beachfront ... nice touches like free water in lobby ... staff would help you with anything

The location of the hotel is quite convenient with just some minutes of walking to the beach, shopping malls restaurants etc. But it gets quite some noise from the street and the rooms are quite dated and could need some renovation works done.Booked early check-in but when arriving it wasn't available...
user_name:
RobinInTheHood
Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam

review_body: If you’re looking for a hotel in a good location this is it. None of the reviews talk about how out dated the bathrooms are! The carpet and walls had stains. Stayed four nights and switched hotels for the rest of my stay. This is more of a motel nothing fancy about this place other than the lobby.

Feeling robbed as we came home from our amazing honeymoon. I had two brand new pairs of sunglasses I had bought in Hawaii stolen from my luggage bag! I had packed them away with all my other purchases and belongings. Did not realise until I arrived home and we couldn’t find them both, not just one, but both pairs stolen from my bag!! Lock your bags when you are not in your room because clearly the staff go through them and take what they think you won’t realise until it’s too late. Absolutely furious and really dampened our trip at the end. Enjoyed our stay here on our honeymoon minus having to have cold showers for two days because of issues with no hot water. But the feeling of someone literally going through our bag to then find both my sunglasses and steal them from me is shocking! I called Shoreline twice after we had returned home and I still have no response from a manager as I was advised - it must be a regular occurrence I would imagine! I was able to pinpoint the two days these would have been stolen from me in our room also, and still no response hence why I have no choice but leave a negative review as clearly I will never see those sunglasses. Extremely unprofessional when clearly their staff are robbing from customers who just want to enjoy a nice holiday away!

The Shoreline is a really lovely hotel in a great location. It was our second hotel in Waikiki during our honeymoon so we were already familiar with the area and it's right in the thick of it, easy to walk to everything nearby. This did mean we could hear some noise on an evening (we were on the third floor, I'm sure this isn't as much of an issue on higher floors), but this wasn't too much of a problem as our air conditioner pretty much covered that. We had a little bit of trouble with valet parking as we arrived quite late on our check-in day, but we were able to get a slot the next morning. The reception team were really helpful in directing us to a very close alternative car park. The reception is gorgeous, as vibrant and welcoming as it looks in the pictures, and the room is lovely too. Comfy beds, with a nice, big bathroom. The branding is awesome and very consistent. The welcome treats were ace too! We had a brief visit to the pool area and it's small but gorgeous, perfect for a quick dip. The Shoreline is a great hotel for anyone wanting to stay right in the middle of everything in Waikiki.

It just cool place to stay in plus it is very reasonable priced for the location! You can always walk around and be close to your hotel! It is very close and nice walking to Waikiki Beach. You will not regret staying here!

From the time I walked into the colorful happy lobby to the time I left one week later, I was in the best mood ever!! What a joyous little hotel. The staff spoils you. The rooms are so bright and cheerful. They have fun little activities in the lobby every day. The front desk, housekeeping and valet parking staff are beyond amazing!!! I will return to this vibrate joyful hotel again and again.... I wish I was there now!!!

Our toilet overflowed the first night twice, both times after simply going number 1. Staff did not clean up overflowed toilet water until we asked several times. Then they only wiped down bathroom floor but did not mop or disinfect floor.

Location was great! Perfect really. No major complaints. Room was good. Just kind of small with very little storage space for clothes and such. It was fine for me as a solo guest, but if there were two of us in the room...it would have been bad. Very reasonably priced. So, that's kind of the trade off.

I will say this was one of the smallest hotel rooms I’ve ever stayed in- BUT it’s Hawai’i, and I didn’t plan on hanging out in the room much. The hotel has a very modern aesthetic, and I really loved the restaurant that was connected, the fresh fruit-infused water in lobby, and the location and walk to beach. The rooftop pool was quite nice, too! The service was great, I really like that we had a balcony- despite it being very small. One piece of advice- do not drape your swimsuit on balcony to dry! I did this and it was gone in the morning- we were pretty high up a d it blew off! I had to buy a new swimsuit the next day. My husband and I had a good laugh about that though, especially when telling the front desk that if anyone found a teal suit on the street that it belonged to me!The complementary tray with water, macadamia nuts, and other treats was also really great- definitely makes this place worth it! The bed was comfortable and room was clean and I didn’t want for anything.Overall, really small rooms that are not luxurious, but the price was right and the extra touches they have make this a great spot!

overall the experience was very nice. It was a look different from other hotels. The different colors of even floor of the hotel was nice for me. Th price for the car of $30.00 a night was a little high for a local person I thought. As a local resident I never had to pay that much for overnight parking.

Excellent location. Average customer service. Not a very warm or inviting greeting from reception after an international flight. Air conditioning in room was a little noisy. Average housekeeping services.

We prefer to spend the majority of our money on food and experiences, so we stay at budget-friendly hotels/VRBOs. This place met our standards! It's in the PERFECT location and connected to our favorite restaurant--Heavenly. Keep in mind that you are getting what you pay for; this is not a fancy hotel. This is the first time we have stayed here, but we have known about it for years. Will definitely stay here again!
user_name:
Katharina G
Sioux Falls, South Dakota

review_body: This is an ideally located hotel - 5 mins walk to the beach and basically in the centre of everything within walking distance .Staff friendly and helpful .Towels ,chairs and umberella's provided free for the beach .Looking a little tired and in need of some updates in the rooms -i.e rusty door bolts on the patio door window that did not work ...... but again for the price and location in Hawaii cant really complain .Does not provide a laudry service except dry cleaning BUT it has a connection with a hotel just around the corner that does have washing facilities for $2.50 (coins only) you can use Would recommend

I had a wonderful time at Shoreline - it is perfectly located for a stroll through Waikiki, the decor is super funky and the little touches like complimentary cold and hot drinks and a weather report were really nice! I also loved getting a free henna tattoo as a reminder of a quick but fun trip. Lots of great photo opportunities and the staff were all super friendly - I loved my time here!

Had a five night stay. The lobby and room decor is funky and the complementary newspapers, water coolers and tea and coffee are welcomed and in room treats are super. Beds comfortable and hotel fairly quiet. Location is excellent. However, I do expect used cups and tumblers to be refreshed daily (never changed during our stay, and we used them daily). Bathrooms are careworn, with unappetizing gunk in the grout around toilet and along tub. Not sure how thoroughly bathrooms were cleaned because of residual water spots on fixtures. Shampoo and body was replenished but not hand or bath soap. Unpacking limited to what you can hang in the closet - no chest of drawers in the room. I do not like living out of my suitcase particularly for those many days. Our room location gave us daily access to the aroma from the restaurant next door. Never enough beach towels and beach chairs (the later are literally on their last legs) to go around.

We just spent six days at the Shoreline Hotel Waikiki and were delighted! The hotel is perfectly located in Waikiki, it has a wonderful smaller hotel vibe, accommodation is adequate but not luxurious (just right), and the staff are amazing (special thanks to Josh for all his help!). They accommodated our request to move to another room so that we were closer to our family, and provided helpful suggestions of fantastic tours, the easiest means of transportation and great local restaurants. The hotel also had several fun activities such as henna tattoos and shave ice - all complimentary for hotel guests. We really enjoyed our stay and would return.

Lovingly and cheerfully furnished, excellent wifi, free beverage and coffee at the Lobby, friendly and helpful staff, perfect location, close to the beach, shops, market places, Restaurants, bus stations to all directions and car rent.

I stayed on the top floor of the hotel and found it incredibly difficult to sleep due to the constant loud rumble coming from above. I don't know if it was aircon plant or pool pumps or what, but it was loud and constant. Mentioning it to Reception just resulted in shrugged shoulders and "we'll get a maintenance person to look at it". Well, it didn't seem as it anything was broken, just noisy. I didn't have an opportunity to check each floor at the time, but I could hear it 2 floors down.Traffic noise from outside wasn't great either - yes, it's the middle of the city, so there's only so much you can do, but there's no double-glazing to help reduce the effect.Other than the noise, this would be a 4.5 star review. The staff was courteous, the decor fresh and fun, the rooms clean, the fruit-infused water in the lobby was refreshing and appreciated, the location excellent, and the price was good.

Boutique hotel but near waikiki beach, opposite of ross, next to starbucks, near ABC store and has one of popular brunch restaurant, 'Heavenly' on 1st floor. There's no laundry room, dry cleaning service only but you can walk to coin laundry shop 'I do laundry' near 'OHANA waikiki east by Outtigger'. Parking is valet only with 30 usd per day.

Super location in shopping and beach area in Honolulu. Friendly staff. Easy check in. Nothing fancy. Great breakfast next door. Lots of great places to eat nearby. Pool on top of building but didn’t use

Super cool, funky, hotel. First, the staff: Very friendly, helpful and personable. Upon checkout they held our bags for us while we went shopping for some last minute souvenirs for family. They also advised us on the most cost-effective way to get to the airport, saying what the ride-share range should be and at what point it’d be best if they called us a cab. The rooms have an island, colorful, new age-chic decor. The balconies are definitely a nice touch, and the rooftop pool is a perfect way to end a beach day and watch the sunset. Rooms are clean, beds are comfy, and they give you a complimentary snack pack upon arrival!The location is fantastic. Right in the heart of Waikiki. I would definitely stay here again in a heartbeat if my travels bring me back here.

My wife and I came over to Waikiki for 3 nights to celebrate our Birthdays. We love Waikiki and come over from Maui regularly. We booked the Shoreline based on the price and location. The rooms where basic but loaded with everything we needed and they provided a great tray of snacks and leis in the room. The room itself was super basic but clean and the bed and pillows where super comfortable. You really can't beat the location - There was so many great food options and shopping all really close to the hotel and it was only a block back from the beach. The roof top pool was super cool, We were lucky and had it to our selves for a few hours one day. The hotel also offered cool lobby activities, amenities and 24hr coffee. We are use to staying in 5 star accomodation like Andaz and FourSeasons properties and I wasn't sure what to expect with Shoreline but it exceeded our expectations. It really was the perfect funky budget hotel.

Perfect location at the heart of Waikiki with easy access to the beach. Amazing service and amicable staff. Numerous complimentary services like beach towels and chairs, as well as baggage storage. Great value too!

I stayed 2 nights in the hotel in Dec 2019 on 13th floor. The front lobby ambience was excellent with nice colors on the walls and lights. And similar feeling inside my room. There was free tea/coffee and drinks in lobby which was very convenient and attractive. The front desk persons Lawrence and Ann both looked after guests very well.

We only had two days in Waikiki, and it was at the front end of our trip. We chose this hotel primarily due to price and proximity to everything we wanted to do - one block to shopping and dining, three blocks to the beach, etc. First off, *only* book through their website directly. Almost all hotels in Waikiki seem to charge "resort fees", but with the Shoreline, if you book right through the hotel's website, they waive them, which saves you a lot of cash! They also had a AAA discount (5%, I think), which was great. As for the hotel itself, you can tell it's been recently redone. It's bright, colorful, and clean. That being said, you can certainly also tell it's an older hotel that's been "freshened", so it's not going to have the ultra-polished look that new construction properties tend to - regular bathroom tile instead of sleek marble, etc. That was no problem at all for us, since we didn't plan to spend all day in the room anyway! The best parts about this hotel were the little ways they added value to the cost of the stay. Most of them were actually really minor in hindsight - complimentary coffee and fruit-infused water in the lobby, for instance - but they really did add up to make us feel like the hotel cared about the guests and wanted them to walk away feeling good about their stay. They even had a little complimentary basket of snacks in the room when we checked in! I've stayed at plenty of hotels that were multiples of this price that didn't do that. Make sure you check out the rooftop pool, even if you're not going to swim. Beautiful views of the city and the ocean - perfect for instagram! All told, it was a delightful welcome to Oahu and the perfect way to kick off a great vacation. A far better value than almost anything else we looked at!

We have stayed at the Shoreline Hotel 5 times now. We like that it's a smaller hotel which makes it quieter and more personal than the other larger Hotels in Waikiki. We like the little extra touches that are complimentary such as daily newspapers, beach chairs, beach towels, welcome basket of snacks, coffee and cold drinks available in the lobby. Although the rooms are not large they are adequate, clean and comfortable. Lets face it you do not spend alot of time in your room anyway as there is plenty to see and do in Honolulu. Great location and friendly staff. Must give a big compliment to staff member Josh. He has an incredible memory, an eye for detail, friendly, professional, on the ball and made us feel so welcome. We have stayed with other larger hotels in Waikiki that are more luxurious but keep coming back to The Shoreline Hotel because of the friendly and personal service and the great location. We have never had an issue each time we have stayed here and always have an enjoyable experience and that's why we keep coming back.

Great location. Lots of good restaurants and shopping within 2 blocks. The decor is bright and a little way out for my taste but may appeal to a younger guest. Our room was clean and adequate in size.The lobby was nicely done but getting a little tired and faded. The staff in general was very nice and accommodating. Overall a pleasant stay.

I stayed here for a week at the end of October 2019. It was very comfortable and I got a complimentary upgrade to my room. I booked directly with the hotel and if you do so, you don't have to pay the resort fee. The welcome basket was a very nice touch. Loved the cookies and macadamia nuts!The room was comfortable, had a good space for me to work on a laptop, and the air conditioning was quiet. My room was on a side of the hotel that had a lounge below it, so the music would be quite loud at night but would shut down promptly at 10 pm. The location is great. It's not far to walk to Waikiki beach, and you are very close to the main strip. The lobby decor is fun during the day, but at night the lobby lights feel like an escape room. I checked in late and the effect was kind of eerie, but didn't impact my stay. There is a great selection of refreshments in the lobby.

If you're okay with a small room, this property is ideal and I've stayed a number of times. It was recently renovated and is now very colorful. The staff have great attitudes and are willing to help with any issues. The guests are varied but tend to be a little more on the youthful side and I found them to be a bit "cooler" than the Waikiki norm. There are some rooms that don't have safes so be sure to specify that requirement if it's something you need.

My girlfriend and I recently stayed at the Shoreline Hotel in Waikiki for 7 days. Our room was on the 12th floor (near the top floor which was all I had made a special request for.) I had noted that we expected it to be less noisy and thereby easier to get a good night's sleep if our room was higher up. Without having to say another word, the receptionist went out of her way already to secure a room away from the elevator. The room itself was a bit better than what you would expect for the price, too. It was clean, complementary water replaced daily, nothing went missing from the room and the AC was both effective and not noisy. One or two of the television stations seemed to have difficulties maintaining signal, but that wasn't a concern. Again, front desk staff were always helpful with answering questions, providing beach towels and assisting us by storing luggage for us until the evening during our last day so we didn't have to carry it around in the heat for the day until our cab in the evening to the airport. There's complimentary flavoured water in the lobby, a lovely restaurant called 'Heavenly' attached to the hotel as well. Honestly, Shoreline may not have lawn chairs located next to the beach, but it is surrounded by dining and shopping options and near the only bus stop you'll ever need just across from McDonalds. The hotel may not have all of the 5 star amenities of the Hilton, but the friendly service and atmosphere provided by this hotel amounted to a 5 star experience for us. I hope you found this lengthy review helpful in determining your stay!

This was our second stay at this gorgeous hotel, the staff are all super friendly here and went out of their way to make us feel at home. Rooms although not overly large were perfectly adequate and housekeeping kept them clean and tidy. Love the location of this hotel It really is centrally located, weather visiting diamond head or the zoo or ala Moana shopping centre in the other direction. Can’t wait to visit again next year.. Thank you Shoreline and keep up the good work!

For having a very stylish lobby and website, quite a few things about this hotel didn't quite meet my expectations. I probably wouldn't stay again.It wasn't super clean. There was some mildew along the tiles near the tub--nothing you'd be weirded out by at a friend's house, but not what you want to see paying $150+ per night at a hotel.We were in a room next to the elevator shaft (refuse a room ending in 28!) and we heard the elevator shaft noise constantly. On top of that, there was a lot of noise from a nearby bar/restaurant (even 10+ floors up). So be sure to pack your white noise machine because the insulation in these rooms is quite lacking.Check-in was okay. There was no wait, and the desk attendant was friendly, but the desk also had gigantic computer monitors that meant we had to keep peeking around the edge to see the guy. It just seemed less-than-well-planned for a first impression.The location is pretty great for walking to the beach, and tons of food options are walkable.The free activities (mocktail happy hour, etc) are cute, though very light fare.

Me and my mom both liked this hotel very much. The rooms were compact, bed was good and everything worked so well. As the week went on there were little complimentary treats and drinks at the hotel lobby which was a nice suprise! Staff was super friendly and helpful. 100% would recommend, not for families with kids though, but for everybody else!Shops, restaurants and the beach were all so close to the hotel! The hotel pool was located on top of the hotel and it was so nice!

We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights.The location was perfect.The staff was absolutely amazing and so helpful. We got a complimentary bottle of wine which was really nice.We booked the birthday package through the hotel website and it was really good value for money!The only thing I would say is that if you are looking for a luxurious room, this hotel is not for you. The view from the balcony wasn’t that nice so we had to keep the curtains closed. It didn’t bother us as we didn’t spend that much time in the room.Apart from that, it was absolutely perfect and would recommend to anyone!

I highly enjoyed my stay at the Shoreline. The staff are amazing and it’s so close to the shops and beach of Waikiki. The roof top pool is peaceful and the rooms are spacious and very clean. The colourful foyer is funky that makes you feel welcome.

My husband and I had an amazing time at the Shoreline Hotel Waikiki! We had the pleasure to celebrate my husband’s birthday at the hotel. The Shoreline surprised us with Champaign which we truly appreciated! it made the occasion more special. Our room was spacious and overlooked Waikiki. We really enjoyed the the roof top pool! It was private and the view was amazing especially during sunset time. The location of the Shoreline is absolutely perfect. It’s only a few blocks away from the famous Waikiki Beach and to many nearby restaurants and shops to choose from. If you ever visit the Shoreline, don’t forget to try Heavenly! The food was so good we ate there twice! We highly recommend booking the Shoreline Waikiki Hotel if you ever plan to visit Hawai’i!

Very vibrant experience to stay in Waikiki. Great place for your money close to everything (basically walking distance from the beach). I’ve enjoyed the room snacks and beach clean towels every day plus there’s an amazing restaurant Heavenly right next door. If you don’t require staying at the beach resort this is a great option. You can always walk into any bar / hotel for the beach experience! The staff was super nice and always happy to give me tips or answer my questions. Definitely check out the rooftop swimming pool! You’re only couple steps from a grocery store and a huge shopping mall with plenty of restaurants

Beautiful modern decor and full of fun! Rooms were clean, spacious, modern and exciting with added touches that you don’t get anywhere else (eg. The welcome tray, full of delicious goodies). Shoreline staff were accommodating and friendly. They have different events in their lobby daily, such as shave ice, candy/ popcorn buffet and complimentary fruit water/ coffee and tea... which again, you don’t get anywhere else and sets them apart from your average hotel.Location, location, location... We couldn’t have been in a better spot, conveniently located to everything you need in Waikiki with a short walk to everything (beach, restaurants and a stroll through Waikiki). Reasonable rates for a perfect location. We can honestly say, we had the most perfect stay and will recommend Shoreline Hotel to anyone visiting Hawaii.The only downside (which was not a huge issue) the balconies are tiny, so not much room to sit, sip a drink and relax after a big day in Waikiki. Love Shoreline Hotel and will definitely be back!

This hotel has a great location right in the heart of Waikiki. While it isn’t on the beach some rooms have an an ocean view. The rooms are cozy and colorful which is perfect for Hawaii. The rooftop pool was great. They hotel also offered weekly events, for example an awesome DIY flower crown making class. Would recommend! 10/10.

This smallish hotel is in the perfect location close to all the shops and near the beach .Clean and very colourful with really friendly staff, complimentary snacks and sodas very welcoming. would certainly stay again if in wakkiki

The Shoreline was a great spot to stay and in central location to the beach bars restaruants and shopping centres.The rooms although not huge were very comfortable and in a quiet location and we did not have to pay a resort fee which was a bonus.The staff were always friendly and helpful.I would go back to this place.Cheers.

This is an older hotel that's been given a few updates. Loved the colorful decor, neon lights, and endless areas set up for pictures. Great location just a few minutes walk from just about everything.

Had two great stays at location. Staff very friendly & helpful. Location is central to transport, close to shops all walking distance. Rooms are clean & serviced well. Loved the "extras" on certain afternoons in the lobby-especially the lolly afternoon.

We had a brilliant stay at Shoreline Waikiki. It’s in a great location, just off the main shopping street in Waikiki and a 5 min walk to the beach. The staff at the hotel were super friendly and helpful. Rooms were always clean and had been nicely refurbed with bright colours and cool decor. The snack tray in the room was a lovely touch, you also got free water bottles each day. The hotel also does a fun activity every weekday. When we stayed one day it was free shaved ice and one day it was free sweet and salty snacks. They really went above and beyond! You could get beach towels at the front desk to take to the beach with you which was really handy. I’d recommend this hotel to anyone who wants something centrally located thats clean, reasonably priced and just fun to stay at! If we manage to get back to Hawaii we’ll certainly know where to stay!

Whilst not 5star Shoreline fits the bill for the travelers who need good clean accommodation close to everything.Waikiki Trolley is 2minutes away the only way to see Honolulu cheaply Try the Cracking Kitchen next door yum

In the madness that is Waikiki Beach the Shoreline Hotel sits just back of the main drag and is a great place to be staying. Close to most everything, restaurants, bars, the beach and of course sunsets !Rooms are good sized but beware the primary colour schemes, coming out of the lifts you are hit with everything floor to ceiling of one colour. Rooms clean and tidy, a fridge, adequate bathroom and with a small balcony. Also beach towels available to loan each day. The hotel pool is on the roof and quite small, but good to cool of in. A nice touch is a welcome tray of goodies to nibble on. Staff very friendly and helpful. Price-wise this is a bargain compared to the ridiculous costs of the major hotels. The Heavenly Island Lifestyle restaurant is attached to the hotel and serves excellent food all day.

We stayed there 4 nights, great hotel, newly renovated, the colors in the hotel are amazing, and very friendly staff especially at reception Josh was very helpful and kind, also Ann. Thank you for a great experience!

Everywhere at this hotel was cute and decorated with colors even a fridge.Staff at front desk was kind. There is 3 kinds of water, coffee and tea in a lobby all the time, which is good. The room is well maintained and has enough space to open 2 or more luggage on the floor.Just one thing i didn't like was they don't have bell boy, so you have to carry your heavy luggage by yourself though there is steps at the entrance and no slope.

Lovely hotel in a fantastic position in Waikiki. The hotel has been renovated (although not completely, signs of the old hotel remain) but is comfortable and modern. Staff are fantastic and super helpful. Would highly recommend this spot, great value in Waikiki!

This was the last leg of our wonderful 4 island holiday. Three nights. Really just to see Pearl Harbour and a couple of other things. So the Shoreline is really situated in a good place. 5 mins walk and you are on the beach. Dozens of cafes and restaurants within a few minutes walk. Fruit infused cold water on tap 24/7 along with coffee in the foyer. Great after a day trip. On that note, the Ross Store just over the road is a main pickup point for all tours so no problem even if its an early start. Rooms fine. Good value based on Waikiki prices. Recommeded.

I had searched tons of different hotels all over Oahu and I was looking for something affordable for our family. I really liked this place because of all the things they had to offer. It was affordable and in the heart of the downtown area around tons of restaurants and stores. It’s about a 5-10 minute walk to the beach. They have fruit infused water and coffee/tea every day. On certain days they have a wine tasting night, snow cone making station/ candy bar, and my favorite was the flower crown making day. There is a $100 deposit at check in and if you rent a car you can have the hotel valet it. It’s $30 a day. Everyone here is very friendly and accommodating.

Only stayed one night - family of 4 in one room (so it was a little crowded) The hotel is very clean, quiet and in a great location. If staying any longer for comfort would have definitely needed 2 rooms. Great view from the roof top pool, only a couple of loungers but worth the trip to the roof top for the view. Ross Dress for Less directly across the road and great cafe on the ground floor.

You can not go wrong staying in this cozy and chic, yet affordable hotel in the heart of Waikiki. The hotel has a cool 80s/tropical vibe with the help of highly Instagramable decor , cool lobby music and super friendly staff. They really make you feel relaxed and taken care of (what other hotel supplies free beach umbrella and chairs with fresh beach towels on the daily?!?) from the minute you step in (goodie basket upon arrival stocked with delicious Hawaiian snacks) to the moment you check out. One stand out staff member is definitely Josh at the reception desk - he really took great care of us after our unpleasant stay at the nearby Air BnB forced us to look for alternate accommodation in the middle of our vacation. After hearing about our Air BnB ordeal, he not only gave us a great room with an amazing view, but he also upgraded us to a king size bed in order to remedy the situation. Mahalo Josh for everything!! We will definitely be back! ~ Sabrina and Dorian from Vancouver, Canada

We stayed at the Shoreline for five nights during our first trip to Honolulu. It was a nice place for the price, centrally located, within a short walk of everything in Waikiki and a quick Uber or taxi ride elsewhere in the city. There’s a convenient city bus a block away and a car rental place around the corner. We’re glad we didn’t rent a car at the airport; we saved money and hassle by using the other options, avoiding a daily parking fee. Tip: ask for an odd-numbered room at the hotel, for a better location.

really loved our stay. first of just getting quick response on the email prior to the trip was amazing. room is absolutely adorable, loved loved loved the welcome tray. employees are very friendly and helpful esp Ann and the gentleman who works during the day. days of stay were 08/31 n chked out 09/02. sorry if I didn't get his name. but overall, im very pleased with everything and will def stay again.

Walking distance to great shopping and eateries. Sweet rooftop pool - picked up coffee and breakfast spam musubi (just down the street) and lounged by the pool. Vibrant colors, gorgeous view - fun to hang out. Generous complimentary snacks and NO resort fee. However, one night's deposit charged upon reservation. Easy for Uber or Lyft to pick up/drop off. Across the street from Ross...convenient if you forgot to bring something. Fruit infused water, fruit of the day available in the lobby 24/7.

Great location right near the beach and shopping. Most tours picked up nearby. Clean rooms, great friendly staff. Very helpful. Had fun things planned during the week for guests, loved the shaved ice cubes and music.

We had such a great stay here. The location was perfect for getting around Waikiki, only a block in either direction to get to food and shops and 5 minute walk to the beach! The staff were super friendly and always ready to help, plus the little extras like the candy bar and live music once a week in the lobby were such a great addition. The pool was awesome and usually quite quiet, my only comment would be that it is in need of some umbrellas or shade around the pool as it got very hot and there was nowhere to escape the sun. Overall it was perfect for what we needed and Id happily stay there again,.

We truly enjoyed our stay in this hotel. The staff are really nice and the room are clean. In the lobby, the decors is also trendy. The neighborhood is also really nice : close to the beach and to some shops. :) we couldn't hear the outside noise at night ( we were on the 12th floor). We higly recommend this hotel :)

This was my first time in Hawaii and the staff at Shoreline hotel were the best! I missed my flight and had to stay a few extra days and they did their best to accomodate me in a great room at an excellent price. The hotel itself is in a great location close to the beach and shops. The rooms were clean and well maintained. I will definitely be staying here again.

The room was nice, hotel was very close to the Kapiolani Park Beach (just walking distance) and the snacks were complimentary but the bathroom toilet was horrible. We even called the plummer to fix the toilet yet it still had problems. Therefore we had to use the lobby. Apparently we got the worst room because the rest of the rooms were fully booked because we there for the Rams preseason game so were the other guests.

Very central location in Waikiki district, right next to a decent restaurant and Japanese food mall and cheap clothing shop. The hotel's price/quality ratio is good. The quality of equipment is basic but satisfactory for similar needs. Nice staff. Didn't try any extra option, the swimming pool on the roof top is very small and not worth a visit. We stayed only one night but it was fine for a short stay over budget between 2 flights. Budget hotel, decent quality.

We stay at the shoreline because they waive the resort fee when you book on their website.Location is great. We stayed there back in March 2019. This time was not as good but it seems Waikiki was busier than normal.The hotel parking was full so we had to park elsewhere for the week which was a bit of a pain. Our room 625 has a shower head that was installed wrong and could only spray along the wall.At check-in they indicated they also had umbrellas (which would have been new since march) but that wasn't the case when we tried to get one.

was a place to stay..not impressed with it .have to pay extra for air conditioner.very loud and the colors of the halls make it look dark. the rooms are small and no microwaves. plus would be it's close to the beach about a 5 min walk.

We loved our stay at the Shoreline - it was a nice modern hotel, clean, quiet enough and it was perfectly positioned in the middle of Waikiki. We stayed there with our 2 year old who loved using the pool and getting a drink of fresh fruity ice water whenever we came and went =) Big thanks to Josh for helping us out with a great room and being a nice guy all the time! Also thanks to all the staff who were consistently friendly, helpful and accomodating. I don't think I'd ever stay anywhere else in Waikiki again!

This hotel is in a nearly perfect spot, especially if beach front resort accommodation is not within your budget. It is an old hotel that has had a slap of paint, so if you base your expectations of their instagram photos, you may be disappointed. In saying that, the rooms are neat, comfortable and well equipped - we couldn’t have asked for anything else.The rooftop pool is small with limited shade, so isn’t really useable during the middle of the day, especially not if you want to lay about by the pool. It is, however, the perfect place for a late afternoon dip after you return from your day out.The hotel often has afternoon activities for guests (free shaved ice, savoury and sweet afternoon etc) which is a nice touch. Housekeeping was as expected and we had no problems requesting a few additional towels. My only complaints would be that the bathroom is in need of a redo and that the balcony doors are not soundproof at all, so you will hear every truck that stops nearby early in the morning.The staff were always friendly and accommodating! We would definitely stay here again, especially if we were there for a quick visit and knew we would be out exploring during the days (as opposed to wanting to laze around a resort style hotel)

Shoreline is definitely an old hotel with a quick renovation. Rooms are a little bit small and some aspects are a bit dated. That being said the staff were very friendly and helpful, the location is amazing especially considering the price. If you travel like us where you only need a clean and secure room to sleep in and store your stuff while you adventure all day then you’d be hard pressed finding better accomodation for the same price. Would definitely consider staying here again.

Ummm...so the photographer whose pics are used on the website should win an award. Definitely not the chic-boutique hotel it’s made out to be. The 21 year-old version of me would’ve been okay staying here- but that’s only if I was drunk the whole time. It’s very loud (and I’m not talking about the color scheme), the pillows had the scent of ocean water (which had been sitting in someone’s hair all day), and the building reminded me of my first college apartment- a gentrified urban housing project. If you’re trying to live it up Vegas style on the cheap, this is for you. Otherwise, spend the extra $100 and go up the the street to the Marriott or something. Finally, please please please think twice about bringing your children here.

Hotel is middle of everything - if you don't mind the noise. Had very nice view of ocean, beyond the parking garage on 13th floor, that's actually a plus. Live music from Cuckoo Coconuts Waikiki was great - cuz you can definitely hear it since it's around the corner, but never ran pass 10pm (noise ordinance). Housekeeping and staff was very polite. The welcome munchie kit and 2 free water bottles a day were great! Only miss was tho it was "renovated" last year and the 60's retro theme was nice, you can definitely see some eyesores like outlet socket face plate didn't fit and some painted over, the carpeting needs a really good deep clean and bathroom has seen better days - this from a junior suite. But I'd definitely come back to stay - staff, 10% off Heavenly Cafe, and location makes it worth it. If you book directly from hotel, you can get a room discount and waived amenity fees - look under offers link.

Such a shame this hotel... as you walk in it’s so colourful and Vibrant. I walked to the front desk and ended up standing waiting 5 minutes for the man to look up and serve me. Not something you want after a flight from Australia. He was then so rude.. then looked very excited and happy saying hello to the young model couple walking past. Went to our room and it was tiny. We had our baby with us and our travel cot so when that was set up you could hardly move in the room. The bathroom is so small when you step out of the shower make sure to not to get your towel in the toilet. Doors slam from other rooms and woke us all up many times a night. The list seriously goes on. Every staff member we dealt with was rude.And I believe it’s because we don’t have the look they want to attract people to stay. We stayed for 5 days too long. Only good thing was it was pretty close to shops/food. heavenly downstairs is a nice place to eat too.Save your money and go elsewhere especially if you have a baby/child or an older couple.

Great location! Good price for money, lovely and kind personel! Also a nice small swimming pool at the top of the hotel. We got Some complementary drinks and snacks as well as a lovely Hawaiian neckless! Sweet!

Shoreline had very colorful mod decor. Very clean and amazing location if you want to be right in the heart of town. I was there to go diving so it was super easy for the dive company to pick me up. Easy check in and check out. Great value would definitely stay there again.

Second time staying here and I would keep coming back. This time it was all remodeled and very cute. Definitely a step up from before and still great price. Walking distance to a lot in Waikiki and Biki bike station is right down the block. Will get you anywhere you need to go around downtown and Waikiki. Great front desk service as well, very knowledgeable staff so if you want to do something and don’t know where to go or what to try just ask them.

Pool wasn’t clean. The water was tepid and we could see a film on top. We were Very disappointed since the last time we stayed here the pool was refreshing. We spoke with the woman at thhe front desk and let her know. We still don’t know whether it was cleaned, but we will not be staying here again. The room we stayed in was nice, however.

Shoreline is in centre of waikiki and close to bus stop which can take you around the island with ease. Reception is helpful and there is free fruit infused water and coffee available 24/7. Just the house keeping team need to be more attentive and clean the room properly, there was a cherry stem and paper i unintentional dropped but sitting on the carpet for 3 days.

Loved the lobby and the water and coffee bar. The staff behind the counter was all smiles and all business (in a good way). High recommendation from me and my friends. Great time in OahuGreat time at the ShorelineWinWin

Stayed twice at the shoreline in the last month on my way to and from Canada. The best things about this hotel are the location and Josh at reception. The hotel is situated just off the main strip and a very short walk to the beach, shops and restaurants. The discount store Ross is across from it for a quick shop of some incredible bargains. The shuttle to Waikele premium outlets is steps away near the T Galleria. The best coffee in Waikiki is a 3 minute walk to the Island Vintage company. Try the Acaii bowls and organic pesto chicken sandwich there too. Josh at reception is a star! He’s very helpful and always greets people with a smile. On my first trip last month I needed a late check-out and he very kindly accommodated us. On my second trip, I ducked out for a quick breakfast and when I got back he had finalised my bill and checked us out so I didn’t have to hang around waiting to have it done! That’s efficiency. Thank you Josh. Also really enjoyed the fruit infused water at reception. Thank you too for the welcome pack of Hawaiian snacks in the room. I booked thru Booking.com and was surprised that their rate didn’t include amenities fees etc so my bill was higher than I expected! Next time I will go direct and will hopefully give me a better idea of the costs. The negatives are the colours are too neon! The carpets in the corridor were fire engine red and when I got up at night to use the washroom I thought the hotel was on fire - the strip of light under the room door was glowing brightly red!! Although the hotel has been refurbished it’s still very old and tired. The cleaning too was substandard. I had to ask for my room to be cleaned when I got back one day at 3.30. The cleaners were doing the room across from ours when we left in the morning and must have just forgotten. I also saw a used floss-pick in the room. It’s not a cheap hotel so you’d definitely expect better!!

This hotel was nice and I would stay there again. It’s in a good location. Very central to all the shopping and restaurants in Waikiki. Just a short walk to the beach.It’s also right next door to a great cafe which you’ll find at the top of most “best breakfast” lists in the area. I can vouch that the food is delicious. The staff were nice. We turned up early and were slightly disappointed that they didn’t have our room ready early. But it was because they were holding us one of the larger rooms and it was still occupied. So, the staff are eager to turn negatives into positives.The hotel is well styled and the rooms are too. You can tell that they’re a little old and they’d benefit from a new lick of paint. But other than that, they’re great.Ammenities are adequate. There’s free coffee and water in the lobby all day. There’s a good lounge area. And there’s a nice roof top pool. Although, there’s no restaurant in the hotel unfortunately and I don’t believe they do room service.My one criticism is regarding the pool. When my partner and I went up there it was full of a family of children who were jumping, splashing and screaming at the top of their lungs. There was no space for anyone else to enjoy the water while they were in there. We thought the parents might calm them and ask them to share since we were up there, but they didn’t. It was pretty disappointing because we’d explicitly booked a smaller hotel outside of the major chains to avoid this exact issue - screaming, splashing children. My advice to the hotel would be to have noise policy for the pool area and enforce it. It was extremely disappointing that we were unable to enjoy the pool, despite paying for the use of it. We noticed one other couple come upstairs to enjoy the pool to but they left quickly after being repeatedly splashed by the children. Not great.

We felt very welcomed arriving at the Shoreline. The lobby is bright and inviting, staff was friendly and courteous. The room was clean upon arrival and it was a nice touch to have Hawaiian treats provided as a welcome package. The problem was the room was not cleaned properly during our visit, the bathtub was left dirty, the carpet was not vacuumed and the cups were not cleaned. They also failed to provide bath soap and change the tub mat. Based on the cleanliness we would not stay there again.

This is the secret to a reasonably priced and amazing Waikiki experience! I stayed here two nights and wish I spent all 4 of my nights in Hawaii in this hotel. I heart you Shoreline forever. It's only like a 5 minute walk to the beach (you do have to cross a main street and walk through a bit of an outdoor mall area, but they often have live music and hula lessons, etc there so it's actually part of the amazing experience walking there). Once you get past the shopping zone you can sneak through the Sheraton pool area for the beach access, and smell the amazing Sheraton food (can go get some if you want) and it's just such a good little walk and really not very far from hotel to beach.... No dramas at all!In fact, you are really right next to several of the most iconic Waikiki hotels that you can just waltz into and enjoy their restaurants. I drank at the Royal Hawaiian's Mai Tai bar one night and had a lovely 5 min walk back home after listening to some live music and drinking pineapple and rum all night... While I was in the ocean one day I watch a hula show from The Royal Hawaiian's back lawn too. It's really right in the centre of everything. Also, the rooms are super cute and really clean. I also liked the way the lobby looked and they have water with fruit soaking in it to rehydrate with. I grabbed a glass every-time I went back to my room. The air conditioning worked amazingly... My view wasn't great, but I spent more time on the beach and enjoying the city than I did gazing out my window.... Bed was comfy too and no loud neighbours... I never ate at the cafe there because there was so much good food nearby, but it was nice to know it was there. Speaking of food, it's like 1 min walk from the Japanese food court (I do NOT recommend the ramen shop Baikohken in that food court there though. The one with the cherry tree in the middle of the table. Horrible experience there), but so many other amazing food options in that food court. Also, they have valet parking, which I was able to use once. The valet staff were all super friendly and proactive in trying to make sure you were taken care of and happy. It was so nice to have a place to drive up to and pick up your luggage/drop off.... Someone to turn on your air con in your car for you.... Amazing... And if you can't use the valet then you can park across the street in the Ross parking lot overnight. The lady told me that I will need to re-park at 7am, but actually you can stay and it will charge you $3 an hour every half hour up until you've spent a total of $35 for the day and then it will cap there (the cost of overnighting there is $25, so it really is only an extra $10 to park there the rest of the day)... Totally worth it not to have to re-park. They also give you beach towels so it was super easy to head down to the beach whenever I wanted. I will stay here every time.

This hotel looks 10x cooler on its social media than in real life. The room was compact, but it had all the necessities. I would say that the room and bathroom were dirty, ie lots of scuffs on the wall, dirt in the grout, stains in the carpet, and the hallways and elevators smelled like dried vomit. The roof pool was small and didn’t have any lights at night so that was a no for me. The pros were the beverage selections in the lobby, nice welcome package, really great location, decent price. The bed was pretty comfy, too. I also overheard the staff a lot in the morning, especially in the morning of our departure. I’m pretty sure they were talking about us having the “do not disturb” sign up “again,” but that didn’t matter because they were very loud. They were speaking in another language (which I understood). They weren’t mean per se, just not very thoughtful. Other staff was generally nice, I’d argue the manager was the least friendly, but still okay. I was hoping this would be a good deal (slightly higher than average price with above average amenities) but it ended up being what I paid for - decent/slightly higher price, decent amenities. If I’m ever strapped for cash I’d stay here again, but otherwise I’d rather spend a tad more and stay somewhere else cleaner and a little more comfortable.

Beautiful, bright-colored hotel located in the hot spot of Waikiki. Great for the millennial crowd. Friendly staff. There's a little gift shop inside and fruit infused water that will save your life in the Hawaiian heat!The only thing more exciting than the rooftop pool was the views.

Great location as others noted. I used bus route 2 to get all along Waikiki from the Iolani Palace to Diamond Head. The stop is 1 minute away at the corner of Seaside and Kuhio. $5.50 gets you a day pass for the bus system and you can buy it right on the bus. Do have CORRECT CHANGE. The front desk staff were excellent and embodied the Aloha spirit. I did not have issues that some mention in reviews. The A/C cooled the room just fine and I am hot natured. I was directly across from the elevator and was not disturbed perhaps because I kept the fan on high as I always do when I travel. The bath linens were thick, clean, and towels were large. The shower drained just fine but the sink was a little slow but not maddening. Others might want more drawer space and you'll just have to accept tbe rooms are more Euro size but the bath larger than many Euro hotels. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

I will start with the positives of my stay. the hotel is a great spot in Waikiki, central to everything on the strip. i was willing to pay an extra $50 US for an early check in & this was waived & much appreciated. The hotel has a cool funky vibe with bright colours & very clean.My room was clean & tidy upon entry.Here is the major drawback, the bathroom had minor mold on the tiles & bath tub. just before i went to bed, i went to the toilet & the water backed up & toilet water overflowed to hit bathroom floor, not alot but still not great, water was clean. phew!! I mentioned this to the staff next morning & it was fixed quickly by their maintenance team. problem was this happened 4 time during my 10 night stay, note water only hit the floor once. Still not want you want. Also booked a shuttle pick up for trip to airport. booked 9.45am pick up , concierge tells me at 10.15 that the company made a mistake & went to wrong hotel. next pick up is 10.45, he asks me if i want to wait & /I ask how much a cab costs (i don't have Uber)He tells me around $40 but knows a driver that can do a flat rate of $30, arrives in about 3 minutes & im on my way. Overall the property is okay but do not stay in room 926.

Room is just average we aren't there all day too busy shopping spending my wallet for the missus room were clean the hotel has done a renovations and it came up nice but colour scheme wasn't our taste (possible of our age range) but the staff are super friendly and helpful...

My husband and I spent 10 nights of our honeymoon in August 2018 at Shoreline Hotel. We loved it so much we returned in April 2019 (from Sydney, Australia). Although it is a small hotel, the interior is beautiful, the location couldn’t be better and the staff are so kind. The drinks in the lobby add a nice touch, along with the complimentary snacks in the rooms. We’ve both said that every time we return to Hawaii we would like to stay here. The only thing Shoreline could benefit from is adding some of that neon beach style to the verandah’s. Can’t wait to come back!

A great Waikiki option, Shoreline is almost without fault. Not only do staff offer the best customer service in welcoming you, the location is brilliant, bed super comfy, shower good and they set you up with a tray of snack treats. Beware of a little noise from night market below if you’re at back of building - luckily it dies down by about 10. The one very small downside was housekeeping - the room only ever felt about 80% made up as though staff had to do it too quickly to do a proper job, often took most of day before it happened and the bedding wasn't changed after 3 days as promised. Small things that don't overly matter but something for management to look at. It's definitely not a reason to NOT stay here - do it. It's great value for money and the almost ideal Hawaiian stay.

This places is great. It is perfectly located just off of the main Waikiki strip, so you are close to all the action but can relax away from the crowds. The deco of the hotel and the rooms are wonderful, all the staff we came across were wonderful and helpful. In the lobby there is various teas, coffee and flavored water that you can take, as well as various pop up stalls through the week. The hotel is located within walking distance of various bus routes to take you to diamond head, downtown, Ala Moana Mall, the outlet mall, Pearl Harbor plus many others. We also got a wonderful welcome gift in our room upon our arrival. Also the restaurant attached to the hotel is well worth a visit and you get a discount on food if you show your room key. If we are ever to return to Honolulu, we would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Great location if you want to make Waikiki your home base and intend to explore the rest of the island. The rooms were sufficient and the bed was comfortable. Rooftop pool was small and underwhelming. The complimentary snacks and drinks was a nice treat. The hotel recently did significant renovations to modernize. Overall it paid off, but you can still tell the building is older. Again the best features of this hotel for my husband and I, are location and the price. The vibrant decor didn't evoke an authentic Hawaiian feel even though the towel rack said "Aloha".

Perfect location for the beach, shops, restaurants and public transport. Very Central! Ricardo and his team were very friendly and helpful with lots of tips for the area. Very comfortable, clean rooms. Would definitely stay again! Thank you Shoreline Hotel :)

this disgusting hotel with no bar, cleaning facility and is nowhere near the shoreline illegally took money form my credit card when I was on my flight home, luckily my tour operator refunded it , but they took it with out any consent, also the room was never cleaned in 2 weeks and they tried to turn the bed sheets inside out and claimed the sheets was fresh., there is no bar and the pool has cracked tiles and the ladder to get in pool was hanging by one screw, a danger to my kids, also the shoreline is nowhere to be seen, what a massive rip off, we will never stay at this disgusting hotel ever again, also the noisy trash truck from the massive hotel opposite waked us up at 5am every single day beep beep beep beep beep beep beep non stop for half an hour every sing day 5am exact

I stayed one night (from a neighbor island) and my experience could not have been better. Ricardo checked me in and was as friendly and professional as a front desk representative should be (I, too, am in the hospitality industry in Hawaii). My room was clean, fresh and inviting. You can’t beat the location. You’re within easy walking distance to many great restaurants, shops and the beach. Many thanks to Ricardo and the nice young lady who was also very accommodating. I’ll be back when I need another home away from home on Oahu. Aloha!

1) First of all you advertise Kama'aina but never give it to customer for reason's that you cannot changed original booking, how could someone book kama'aina when there os not button to click. How bad the system could be you cannot change it to kama'aina when one shows her ID. they did this in the past.2) I have stayed in this hotel many times in the recent past and one the personnel in the front line even recognize us. I couldn't comprehend how it was transformed into a pub like environment or should I liken it into a red light district where girlie bar's proliferate. When you step in to the elevator you would think twice getting in as it is very dark and scary, moreso when I get out in the corridor going towards the room, my God it is colored blood red. Color makes a lot of difference and can also influence one person's mood. Believe me it sucks!3) On into the room, the air-condition is not cooling so there we ask the maintenance to take a look. They change the filter as they said it is just dirty, did they not check that before guest come in? You bet No!. Then the guy advise us to keep the AC on and that's what we did until check out. it cooled but not very cool so we kept quiet.4) in the bathroom, the drain in the shower tub is not draining as fast and properly I should say, so my husband did the dirty job of removing the accumulated hair into it. I told him we will report again but he ask me not to bec we are both losing our temper already. The drain still not working well and water accumulates while we are showering, it goes down after a while when you already step out of the shower tub. My husband and I agreed not to go back to this hotel anymore bec if we do we will report to them what we think is wrong bec we care and we want to them to do good next time.5) One last thing, you ask them to change your money and they said no you go to the restaurant next door Tell me if that is good service!

It is a favorite hotel.However, cleaning of the room was not perfect this time.There was something missing every time.I always think, but there is no space to put in clothesI would like you to improve that point.

I love the location, right in the middle of Waikiki. We enjoyed our stay. It's an older hotel, but seems to be recently renovated, Prices are reasonable, and the popcorn in the lobby as well as fruit infused water and teas are a plus. The only problem we had was with our mini fridge in our room. It did not work. We'd definitely stay here again.

Stayed here for four days... Ricardo was a amazing host and manager... he was hospitable caring and a great guy! This hotel has a Miami feel and vibes... Cool decore and funky lights and great lounge music... They have great theamed nights and weekly events... Will defiantly be back!

Overall this hotel was good. Artsy designs throughout the hotel. Valet workers were a little rude. A peeping Tom from the across building was reported to the front desk, including a picture of him. Suggestion is to close curtains at night.

We stayed at Shoreline for our first visit to Hawaii and we're not disappointed. Thank you so much to Richard (Ricardo) who made sure all we wished to do on the island was attended to with ease - answering our questions and providing information to first timers on the island was gratefully appreciated. The hotel is fabulous with complimentary refreshments ready after each day out in the lobby and much more! Loved the trendy ambience and the adjoining organic eatery. Thank you again Richard (Ricardo) - you made our decision to return and sooner so much easier.

We went to Oahu to see and stay at this hotel. It did not disappoint. Service was great. They had a little "meet and greet" one evening with wine and music. We valet parked....So convenient. Walking distance to so many dining and shopping places. Little restaurant was connected to the hotel lobby. It served great breakfasts.

Josh was super welcoming to us and offered so many tips on food, car rentals, etc. that led us to having an adventure-filled honeymoon. The hotel is close to amazing food, Waikiki beach and shopping which will make anyone’s stay the best!

My girlfriends and I chose this hotel for a girls getaway and it was exactly what we were hoping for! Such a gorgeous boutique style hotel! We all really loved all the vibrant colors and fun decorative little features around the hotel and in the room. We took a lot of fun pictures and felt our stay was a big part of our experience. The location is EXCELLENT and is close to the beach, shops, and nearby restaurants, pretty much all walkable. Josh, Sonny, and Ricardo ALL SO AWESOME, friendly, and super helpful. I work at a 5 star luxury hotel so im somewhat of a service snob and dont give compliments freely unless they are deserving of it. The only reason I knocked off a star is because we called to ask for a fork and was advised there were no eating utencils on property. The girl who picked up also was not as warm or friendly as our other experiences but I believe she was training so of course we understand that she may not be as well versed yet. To also be fair it was pretty late at night and the hotel restaurant was closed but I still think these simple things should be available especially since people are really hungry from a late night out and need these things occasionally.
