Other than that, wonderful stay and will be back!

The hotel was in a great location in the heart of Waikiki. It was a two minute walk to the main street and just over five minutes to the beach. Lots a great shopping on the doorstop. It is an older hotel that has been repainted and renovated with a bright and fun colour scheme. The room was great for a few nights stay. The bed was comfortable and room had everything you need. This is not a big fancy resort but was good value in the very expensive Hawaii. Be aware there is still the resort fees on top of the accommodation cost.I felt safe as a solo traveller. Thanks for my welcome pack!

We chose the shoreline hotel due to its great location and because we knew that we wouldn’t spend too much time in the hotel. The value you get for Waikiki is quite good in comparison to other hotels. Another reason was the parking fee which was „only“ 30 USD per day instead of 45-50 USD in other Hotels. The design first seemed to be a bit kitschy on the photos but we were really positively surprised. Although you can see the hotel is rather old it is completely refurbished and the design is really cool. Everything you need is there and it was really clean. We liked it a lot and can definitely recommend it if luxury is not the top priority.

Aloha! My daughter & I were there in May.We both loved our stay in Shoreline Waikiki.Colors are as vibrant as Ricardo's and Josh's smiles and energy.The room was small but the theme and service made up for it.We love the convenience of the location...near the beach, food and shops! Location is key! And the friendly staff is just as amazing.They always greeted us with smiles! The decor from the entry wall to the lobby and rooftop pool and our room were all instagram ready! Oh and thanks for the welcome treats! So much aloha from day one! My daughter loved it there , she said she will be going back with her friends soon.I'm going back w my friend too in September to celebrate her birthday.The only thing we wish that can be improved is stronger air conditioning and better view from our room...Other than that...we had a wonderful time staying with Shoreline. See you soon...Mahalo from New Jersey/New York.

A boutique hotel that is trying to be extremely trendy. I get it. But please the lobby does not to be completely neon after the sun goes down. The lights are very disorienting. I feel bad for the workers that have to be in the neon lights during their entire shift. The hotel should also offer additional pillows such as “more firm”. I do think the amenity tray in the room was very nice. No umbrellas on the roof deck. There needs to be some shade since it gets blazing hot.

It was our first time in Hawaii and Josh was extremely helpful in suggesting places to go to while providing an accommodating presence. He also proactively gave us a little packet of information with directions on a map and tons of food and activity recommendations for us to check out. Of the recommendations, he gave tips that only locals knew and we had a great time avoiding the mass of tourists. Definitely a super convenient location next to Waikiki beach and great customer service!

Such a cute, fun place! The lobby is really fantastic - rooms show that it's an older property that has been updated. Especially bathrooms - not much was really done as far as updates there - they are clean, but obviously very dated.Hotel has a quirky boutique stand in the lobby, yummy fruit waters and daily events. Pool is very small, but it was always empty during my stay. You have a fantastic "welcome basket" in your room when you arrive. Anything from snacks to accessories. Loved it! I think it will be my first choice when I go to Hawaii again. Location is great - right by the Japanese food court, just steps from the beach. I paid a fraction of the price of the waterfront resorts - which are not only super expensive, but are also getting very dated, so those high prices are really not justified anymore.Now the not so good:- hallways are filled with a very strong, unpleasant smell from the restaurant downstairs (which is very not memorable by the way). It's such a great property - this is horrible and unacceptable- customer service has a long way to go. They are so slow to respond, or just forget altogether, or don't pass the information to the next shift. the service is really not there. I asked for several days for the laundry service, with no success. When I got impatient, because I had no clean clothes, the receptionist advised me to go to the laundromat - Lobby has the most inconvenient set up for a hotel - it's a long flight of stairs and no ramp or anything to pull your suitcase. I had to carry my gigantic suitcase up those stairs, which almost broke me in half. The lobby stuff doesn't come out to help you either. This is just not acceptable for a hotel
user_name:
GCK76
New York City, New York

review_body: Shoreline Hotel Waikiki is a great hotel. Very colourful. Well looked after by staff. Helpful with local information. Close to beach, restaurants, transportation, shopping, sights. Josh at the service desk is fantastic with helping tourists. Knows his way around Waikiki, advises about great tours, just ask Josh where to find great food.

good location, clean with great linen , beds very comfy. only complaint is housekeeping 1day we had noclean towels beds not made no coffee & creamer replaced I rang reception as told in 15mins (3.15)by 3.50pm went down to reception as housekeeper over at 4pm.& was asked what part of housekeeping do I need. When we returned to room yes we had clean towels coffee &creamer but beds were only top sheet pulled up, bottom sheet not touched pillows tossed on top.

Shoreline was a decent hotel. The rooms are nice sized. Good air-con and wifi. The hotel is a little older. I had not stayed in a hotel with a shower curtain in a long time. It served its purpose of giving me a place to rest my head while in Hawaii for a few days. If I was with my family, I do not think this would be my first choice. However, overall, decent for the area.
user_name:
mrrogersn
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Stayed at the Shoreline last week for a wedding. We were meant to have accommodations elsewhere but they fell through and this hotel offered a competitive rate with just 3 weeks remaining to our summer trip.The hotel is in a great spot, just 5 minutes from the beach. Additionally, it’s within a 5 minute stroll from most of the central Waikiki things to do. The employees there were friendly and polite and we took advantage of the complimentary beach towel and beach chair service. The rooms were a bit small but did the job. They also had some great complimentary snacks! All the decor was trendy and sassy but had a cheap luster to it.I would stay here again under the same circumstance.

This hotel is different from the other hotels next to the beach!It is not as big as a Hyatt or a Marriott - that's why the staff finds time to address you and your needs in a very helpful and pleasant way.The hotel itself is completely renovated and quite stylish with a lot of (neon) colors - we liked it very much!Absolutely fantastic is the cooperation with the Heavenly restaurant & bar accessible from the hotel lobby. They have awesome food (mostly local & organic) for breakfast, lunch and dinner and you get 10% off as a hotel guest.

This hotel is colorful, comfortable, nicely maintained and fun. It’s next to a great litttle onigiri shop that is good and affordable. Also, Waikiki Shopping Plaza nearby has a good Japanese food hall. They do free snacks on Tuesdays—popcorn and snow cones. Downside - rooftop pool is too small, rooms are a bit small, no extra amenities such as spa or exercise room.

As we stay every time, the staff remembers and is comfortable as correspondence is good.a drinks service in the lobby area available 24 hours a day, so I was looking forward to having a service with carbonated water and fruit ice in the afternoon.

My stay overall was pretty good. There are a few things I would change about the hotel rooms. The bed was a little small and so was the room but the price was good compared to all of the other hotels. I love the rooftop pool with the great view. This hotel is in a perfect location also.Staff was very friendly and helpful. Josh was very welcoming and he helped us booked activities for our trip. He booked the Paradise Cove Luau and HI-5 Circle Island Tour. It was an amazing experience.

Shoreline Hotel was just everything we expected, The staff, especially Josh was like a friend to us, helpful in any trouble we got into :) Perfect location, amazing staff, very clean rooms, free coffee and pineapple infused water:))))

Recently refurbished into a modern, bright hotel - very happy with the service and the room etc etc The staff were very helpful. It's located in the middle of the main area of Waikiki and very close to the main street with all the restaurants etc but far enough away not to have all the traffic noise - we will stay here again

Older style hotel that has had vibrant revamp. Rooms are comfy with complimentary snack tray full of goodies! Only a short walk to the beach, even shorter walk to Starbucks and amazing shopping! Josh and Ricardo at front desk were so very helpful and suggested a local restaurant, Uncle Bo's, that had such amazing food. Whole hotel is immaculate, would definitely stay here again.

As first time visitors to Hawaii we really didn’t know what to expect on arriving at the Shoreline Hotel especially given how bad the aud is over here (.67). We had booked 60 days in advance on their website and secured a fantastic rate compared to other hotels we were looking at on the web. To say we were stoked when we arrived both from the warm welcome Josh provided to us is an understatement. The foyer is colourful and provides all day coffee/tea and fruit flavoured waters and they have events scheduled exclusively for the guests on given days of the week. We stayed here for 10 nights and then our travels took us away for a few nights. We had 3 nights left before our flights back to Australia which we had no accommodation booked so without hesitation we contacted the Shoreline by email to enquire on availability and price. Helen responded promptly to our email advising, price and availability which we confirmed immediately. We arrived at the Shoreline this morning for our final few night and was greeted by Riccardo who remembered us and allowed us to checkin immediately instead on waiting till the 3pm standard check in time which was great customer service. My husband and I went off for the rest of the day and returned around 5pm, it was then that we noted the room we now had was not orientated as well as the initial room (the room was still fantastic don’t get me wrong) but I think that we all would agree as your nearing the end of our holidays we just want to be comfortable. Hubby went downstairs and spoke with Helen, without hesitation Helen changed our room, in a friendly, professional manner. Well done Josh, Riccardo and Helen (in fact all staff are great), your employer should be extremely proud of the customer service you are providing to guests. Once again I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough, great location, great price, exceptionally clean and with all the other little perks we will definitely stay here again.

My wife and I are currently on our honeymoon and we are loving our time here at Shoreline! The staff has all been friendly and helpful, especially Edean. Would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone!

This was my first time to Hawaii, and my girlfriend had been before, and stayed at this hotel. She recommended it based on its low price and awesome location, relaxing vibe, and proximity to the beach. I was surprised at how nice the decor of the lobby was given the reasonable price point. The rooms are small and simple, but quite comfortable for our needs; after all, who is in Hawaii for the room? The rooms come with a small refrigerator; we were also easily able to request a microwave and an electric kettle, both free of charge- excellent. The highlight of our trip was the very impressive front desk agent, Josh. He is absolute dynamite, and made our stay absolutely incredible. I worked in hotel management as an operations director for 8 years, and I can say without a doubt, he is one of the best hotel representatives I've ever seen. He went way beyond what would be expected of him; he served as a concierge, providing us with awesome recommendations and local tips and tricks to make the most of our time. He also went out of his way to take special care of us specifically; we arrived several hours early for checkin; of course, I know the hotel policy of a 3pm checkin, and I didn't have any expectations that we'd be able to get in early. Without even asking for it, he approached us with no prompting whatsoever, and told us that he'd be able to get us a room almost 3 hours early. Absolutely amazing, right off the bat. I don't want to go into too much detail, but on several occasions, he went out of his way to make us feel uniquely welcome in a way I have never experienced as a customer of a hotel. He even wrote us a hand-written note welcoming us, and another one for our farewell. It was exceptionally touching. I feel like we really had a connection with him; he's a wonderful, kind-hearted, and thoughtful person. Specifically because of Josh, when we come back to Waikiki, we will *definitely* be staying at this hotel every time.

Throughout my stay at the shoreline, josh at the front desk was an amazing help and gave great recommendations around the area! We can’t wait to come back and stay at the shoreline! Mahalo for the fantastic stay!

Friendly,helpful and clean hotel.Close to shops (Ross for less directly across the road) and beach ,easy walk and great location.Wonderful service from Josh and Ricardo,very obliging ,happy and nothing was ever any bother.Coffee,tea and flavoured water on hand in foyer.Some days snacks and snow cones .Muhalo

I had been following shoreline on social media for months prior to our stay and I was very excited to visit. I had lowered my expectations as I was aware that it was an old hotel that had been given a very nice modern paint job and for the price we were paying it would still have been a great deal.However they have lost a star from me because I can’t seem to justify their additional resort fee of $25 a night. This hotel is not a resort. On our 2 night stay the pool was closed for cleaning for one of the days (this is fine, pools need to be cleaned, but don’t tell me that the resort fee covers use of the pool and continue to charge me the full fee)If you don’t have a car, like us, then the resort fee isn’t going towards valet parking. Use of beach towels was a nice touch... but not for the price of the resort fee. And as I said I had been following on social media, we never received any of the welcome items that were described both when booking and as shown on their Instagram. I was actually really looking forward to trying the local snacks but they were never there.I understand that if your stay falls on a day where the hotel provides free events for guests this might justify the resort fee better however our 2 nights weren’t on these days.Overall I can gather that for our fee we received the use of beach towels for the pool for one use and a cup of watermelon flavoured water each for the grand price of $50I just want to make other travellers aware of this cost and perhaps the hotel could consider whether it really wants to claim to be a resort.Other issues included that the bed sheets and pillow cases had rips in them and housekeeping only made the bed and didn’t even replace the toilet roll and face tissues (which were already running very low on our arrival)Shoreline hotel have a great social media department, but really need to focus on the basics of what guests need and want from a hotel without the false promises.

We have been coming to the Shoreline for quite a few years and this was our first visit since March 2018 when the latest refurbishment had just started.The end result is certainly colourful !!!!!The English and Australian guests who prefer drinking tea will be pleased to learn that all rooms now are provided with an electric kettle - we always previously had to buy our own kettle at Walmart and gift it to the hotel upon our departure. We enjoyed our recent 14 nights at the Shoreline. Pricing is quite reasonable. Our room was on 11th floor and street noise was not an issue. The hotel location is very good being close to the beach and numerous restaurants and only about 150 metres to the bus stop on Kuhio. An ABC shop is across the road. Staff members Josh and Joseph were excellent to deal with and always had a welcoming smile and friendly greeting. The complimentary drinks and snacks tray provided to each room upon arrival was greatly appreciated. One negative issue is that room air conditioning is not overly efficient and needs to be kept running for long periods to achieve a good comfort level. Rooms are serviced every day (by 4.00 pm at the latest) and we had no complaints.We will continue to stay at Shoreline during our regular visits to Oahu.

Super cute hotel and perfect location near everything. Although when we got there the plumbing and bathtub had issues, they had someone fix it right away. The staff are all helpful and friendly, and getting our car in and out of valet was easy.

Been staying at this hotel for a very long time for the convenience and the friendliness of the staff. Hotel was renovated and it’s nice and clean. Restaurant next to it great plus you get 10% discount on food.

I cannot say enough how much I enjoyed my stay here! First impressions were wonderful! I had the pleasure of having Ricardo checking me in, not only was he extremely professional but he was beyond helpful! It was my anniversary and he had upgraded my room and put a sweet happy anniversary note above the water station! I wasn’t expecting that at all! The decor in this hotel is to die for! They allowed me to do a little photo shoot throughout the hotel which turned out amazing! I highly recommend this hotel, very clean, professional and super fun!

If you want local homeless drug-addicts lurking in the stairwells as part of your Hawaiian vacation/experience, then this is the place for you. Staff is surly & unfriendly as any I've ever encountered, very stand-off-ish. Their lone soda pop machine won't take dollar bills, and the front desk clerk said he couldn't make change (are you kidding me ?) and to go to the Heavenly restaurant next door. They could not provide change either, for 1.. lousy.. dollar.. bill. And yes, I encountered 3 different individuals wearing backpacks on 3 different occasions who were obhviously down on their luck. There are definitely safety/security concerns, with that being said.

I stayed at the Shoreline on a Saturday night. I barely got any sleep at night, because it was so loud. Mind you, I had specifically requested a quiet room. And mind you, I also slept with earplugs AND noise-cancelling headphones AND I used the AC of the room as white noise, all in a vain, useless attempt to avoid the cacophony.Maybe it is quieter on other nights of the week, but on Saturday night, there was throbbing, pounding music from somewhere that went through the middle of the night. I may have finally fallen asleep at 1:30 am. Then, because it's in the middle of Waikiki, there were loud sirens from police, ambulance, and/or fire trucks at 2 am, 3:30 am, and 4 am. Finally trash trucks came, making a ton of noise, starting at 5 am and continuing until about 6 am for all the neighboring buildings. The room had no soundproofing so it was like the ambulances and trash trucks were paying personal visits to your room.I've stayed in quite a few other hotels in Waikiki in the past, and never had any problems with noise. I chose the Shoreline this time because it was cheaper. Now I know why it's so cheap. This place is the worst!

Not only is the shoreline hotel in a prime location with a brisk half way point, 2 min walk to the main strip with all the shops and beaches and 2 min walk to Kuhio ave for the buses, bars, food etc, the staff and hospitality were truly a great experience. The staff were friendly to start and continued to do so throughout the entire trip and were always happy to help. Josh was definitely a great help and attentive to our needs. The rooms and lovvy obviously newly renovated lived up to the expectations of the photos on their website. The pool a cute fun little area to relax and though we didn't experience the cafe you can get up to 10% off your order if you display your room key.Pros- Literally everything. It's not often I walk away from a hotel and are completely happy.Cons - - No aircon in the lobby or hallways.- water pressure of shower weak - pool area could do with some shade cloth areasBut these are hardly worth mentioning. Overall I'd give the hotel a 10/10 and will 100% be returning on our next trip.

The hotel is as pictured and definitely aimed at a younger crowd. It is great for the price. Centrally located. The AC doesn’t work well and the balcony views suck. We found cockroaches in our room and they switched us rooms and only refunded us for 2 nights of parking. No other refund was given. Would have considered staying again in the future if cleanliness was properly addressed. Not one apology was given. It seemed as if we were a burden for asking to have our room switched.

Stayed at the Shoreline 5/16/19 - 5/18/19. You will not find a better hotel in a better location for this price. The hotel has been renovated but it is shows some age here and there. The rooms are smaller than your average hotel room but still have all the room you need. Nice size television in the room. Complimentary beach towels and chairs, just ask the front desk. You are just a short walk away from some of the best restaurants and shopping in Waikiki. Waikiki Beach itself is just a short walk away. The roof top pool is small with four lounge chairs. Don’t book here for the pool. However, it’s a great spot for some amazing views. Every employee at the hotel was super friendly and always greeted you with a smile. I would definitely stay here again. The in hotel restaurant is highly reviewed, hoping to eat breakfast there today. Stayed in room 1229. The walls are thin and/or door doesn’t seal very well, I could hear noise in the hallway a little louder than normal. There is AC in the room. We left ours running nonstop with windows shades closed. It’s better than not having AC but don’t expect your room to be cool like it would be on the mainland. Those are the only two not so good things but who cares my wife and I didn’t come here to stay in the room. Great hotel. Don’t hesitate to book.

This was my second stay at Shoreline Hotel Waikiki. A nice affordably priced boutique hotel in a great location. It has been refurbished with modern colourful decor in the lobby and throughout. The complimentary fresh fruit infused water provided everyday in the lobby is a nice touch + coffee & tea & snacks. The lobby also puts on daily activities.The rooms offer all the essentials and are comfortable, clean and tidy. The free wifi works perfectly.On early Check In I was advised my room was ready and I had been upgraded! I also received a welcome basket which was great.Thanks to Josh, Ricardo and Helen - all friendly and helpful on the front desk.I had a great weeks stay and would recommend this hotel to family and friends.Mahalo.

Not the easiest hotel to spot on a busy street, but friendly, clean an colorful. Beware that entering requires climbing several steps. Older property, but updated with modern, minimalist furnishings and bright colors. Location is very handy to shopping, restaurants, and entertainment. Reasonable walk to the beach. On-site restaurant (Heavenly Island Lifestyle) is among the best in the area and reasonably priced. Would stay at hotel and eat at restaurant if in Honolulu again.

One day/night stopover in Waikiki after a cruise and we needed to be central to see and do as much as possible. The Shoreline was a good choice as we dropped our cases and went off for a day of sight seeing. After a busy day the comfort of the Shoreline hotel was welcome and the bath was a bonus. After eating locally at Rivals on Kohui Avenue we slept well and got up with an early call and ready to leave at 4.00am. When we revisit Waikiki for a longer stay the Shoreline will be the place where we stsy

Great hotel and excellent location. Close to Beach and all major restaurants and shops. Special mention to Ricardo on front desk. Very friendly and helpful and always with a smile! Nothing was too much trouble for him! He is one of the reasons I will return to this hotel!

Modern hotel with a colorful 70s motif, it is a good alternative to the high-priced resorts and hotels in this tourist heavy area. It’s not on Waikiki Beach, but a short block and a half away to the middle of the Waikiki’s best high-end shopping and the beach bars. The room was comfortable if slightly smaller than those we stayed in in Maui and Kauai, but the bathroom fixtures were more modern. Parking is valet only, at $30 a night, but this drawback – parking in this area is either impossible or expensive – is outweighed by the reasonable rates: even with the parking cost included, it was still more inexpensive than our stays in Maui and Kauai.

We recently stayed at the Shoreline Hotel Waikiki. The hotel is centrally located in Waikiki and offers a perfect place to stay . The rooms are not large but come with a kettle and a bar fridge plus an assortment of local goodies for snacking. You can pick up beach towels at the front desk for use at the pool or the Waikiki Beach. The rooms are clean and quite quiet as we never knew we had other guests on our floor until we met them in the elevator.We found the staff to be extremely helpful especially Ricardo. He patiently answered questions on the hotel as well as gave us tips on visiting the area. We looked forward to seeing him everyday! This is not a top end hotel but the pricing and the location made it the best stay for us.

We stayed at the Shoreline for over a week recently and were very pleased with the cleanliness, the daily bed making and fresh towels if needed, the pleasant staff, the very low noise level at night, and all of this in walking distance to everything we wanted to do and needed to have nearby. Even the chair for use at the beach was nice! I am very glad to know of this gem of a hotel for my next visit!

This is a great, reasonably priced hotel. Near to everything, cool décor and the staff are amazing (especially Ricardo and Edean). Our room was clean and spacious and had everything we needed. We would definitely return!

It's been a few years since we stayed here. It's a different ownership than the last visit. Nonetheless, all the same things remain. It's in a great central location close to all retail, restaurants and the beach. Still moderately priced and good value considering it's location. The staff, namely Josh and James, at the Front Desk are super hospitable and the Valet staff were always ready to help us with our car. Kudos to them for driving and parking skills because that driveway and alley way are really skinny! The biggest change for us here was the new decor and branding. Super cute and super 'Gram worthy if that's what you're looking for. So many cute things to take photos of from the lobby, to your hotel room and bathroom, and the rooftop pool. Note: the pool area is not a resort sized pool but great to lounge and lay out and definitely take cute backdrop photos. We spent most of our time at the beach so the pool size wasn't a huge deal. Their #naturemeetsneon hashtag perfectly coins their brand. There were times though that I walked into the lobby at night and had to squint a little and also wondered how the front desk staff could look at that all night because it was a bit too neon at night. But during the day, it's the most colorful lobby you'll find in Waikiki!I love all the amenities and activities they offer their guests. From the welcome snacks in your room, to the paint night, and the shave ice and snacks during the week, they make sure their guests feel the love. Island Vintage Coffee, Starbucks, International Marketplace, and Marukame Udon are a short walk away and Isayume Musubi is next door for quick snacks perfect for beaching. Everything you wanted to shop for is available close by, from high end to Ross which I might add had great souvenirs you can shop for, and has anything you need that you might have forgotten at home. The only reason it's not 5-stars was the dislodged lamp that was floating in the pool. It had a cable and we were concerned about electrocution! My DH called down to report it and it wasn't readily addressed. Also, valet parking is $30/night though that is comparable to other properties in the area. But overall, always a pleasant stay and a great home away from home when in Waikiki.

Overall a nice stay close to the beach and the offerings of Waikiki. The negatives that bring down the star rating are the lack of shade at the pool, the amenities and the house cleaning. You pay an amenity fee of approx 25 usd per day for amenities however all of the beach amenities are minimal and they all severely need replacing. We were 5 people with 3 rooms and yet every time we asked for a beach umbrella they either had none available or the one time we scored one it was broken and should have been thrown out a very long time ago. The beach chairs were well worn out and there were no eskies either.At the pool there was no shade so it was very rare to see people there during 12-5 and there was no bar at the pool. Also for some reason house cleaning tends to come at 4-5pm so after you’ve been outside for the day and are coming home to shower from the beach and change for dinner is when they want to clean your room! Asides from this, a good stay in a nice area of Hawaii

This little gem is in a Great Location being a couple of blocks from the beach and only steps from shopping and the Trolley stop (similar to Hop On / Hop Off). The rooms are as colourful as pictured on the website which puts a person in a cheery mood. We were also very impressed by the super friendly hospitality of the the staff. There is a small pool on the rooftop that was very refreshing after a long hot day and the price was much more affordable than most places in Waikiki. I would highly recommend.

Comfortable room with all the amenities I need - fridge, safe, bathroom counter space. Elevators fast. Rooftop pool Great location. Staff very helpful. Love the "Nature Meets Neon" decor. See my full review at my reviewfromthehouse.com

Brilliant hotel and location. Can walk everywhere within the centre of Waikiki. 10 min walk to beach. No laundry service but laundromat is 10 minute walk from the hotel. ABC shops on every corner good for getting a quick lunch or milk for tea and coffee. For those tea drinkers out there if you don’t like all the flavours take your own teabags otherwise you can buy English Breakfast teabags from Walmart but they are expensive.

I thoughtI was getting into a boutique-budget hotel. It's really a budget hotel and at $175 if the nice hotels are $400, I would book again, that is if I was to stay for 1 night. PROS: It's really well located.Check-in process was smooth and lady was really nice. CONS: It's not super cleanBath doesn't drain properly (when taking a shower)Mattress is long overdue for replacementThe venting system has air intake from a kitchen (hello onions cooking at 8 AM)There are other cons, but I think it's to be expected in a budget hotel-shiny paint (not matte or eggshell)-doors of maintenance areas not properly shut-real life is not instagram so it may look nice on pictures but it's super cheap finishes (i.e. above bed islands is made of coroplast. looks good on pictures, looks less good in real life. -only 1 shower curtain-super cheap soap (removes any skin moisture you may have) -bathroom door super narrow. Only good if you are a person with no disability

I stayed here for five nights in a twin share room with a friend. The hotel is in a very good location. Very central to Waikiki Beach and the buses. The room was spacious. We each had a double bed and still a lot of room to move around and place our luggages. It has all the things you need i.e. tea and coffee; jug; hairdryers; safe. Not much view but we weren't in the room much so it didn't bother us. It had a complimentary snack tray with Macadamia Chocolate, Macadamia nuts, chips, biscuits. This was a really nice touch. I got to taste some of Hawaii's flavours and inspired me what to buy as souvenirs. The toilet was clean but a little dated. The staff were really great and helpful. They were always keen to help us with bookings and gave us restaurant recommendations.It also has many great eateries around. Right next door is the busy and popular Heavenly Island Lifestyle. It was great for breakfast but make sure you get there early. It gets busy when it get to around 10am. Island Vintage Coffee was also just down the road. Underground in the building next door, there is a Japanese food court with anything that you can imagine. It was packed and everything looks delicious.All in all, it was a fantastic place. Price was reasonable and location was excellent. So I say hit the book button now and look no further!

Our time share was not available on the date we needed it so we tried Shoreline and were we pleasantly surprised! Walk to Waikiki Beach, shopping, affordable tour company booth, restaurants....all the excitement of Honolulu. The room was the most comfortable we have had and so nicely decorated. Our bed and linens were the best. The lobby was very modern and bright and hosted a happy hour with entertainment and snacks for residents. We will definitely stay here again.

We enjoyed our recent 6 nights at the Shoreline. The room was large enough for two, with a large closet, complete with hangers, and adequate shelf space. The bathroom was also fairly large with adequate space to store toiletries. Although our room was across from the elevators, we were not bothered by any noise. Also, on the 12th floor the room was high enough to escape the inevitable early-morning noise of garbage trucks. The location was excellent, close to the beach, restaurants and stores. The front desk and housekeeping staff members were all friendly and helpful. We especially enjoyed the Hawaiian snacks we found in the room, the two bottles of water we received every day and the fruit-infused water and coffee and tea in the lobby. We would stay there again.

Helen and Ricardo went above and beyond the call of duty to be personable and helpful during our stay. They took the time to give us recommendations on things to do and places to go on the island, and had a great sense of humor. Because of them, we are going to make this our default hotel whenever we island hop to Oahu.

This was my 7th visit to Waikiki and I decided to try a new hotel and I'm glad I did. I cannot fault the Shoreline. Staff were friendly and very accommodating. My room was large and perfectly appointed - everything was where you would expect it to be, it was clean and decorated nicely. Nice touch with little extras like complimentary snacks & juice, daily water bottles and additional bathroom products. Location is very central. By comparison to my previous stays, the value for money was excellent. Will definitely stay again next time.

Near absolutely everything but away from noise and cars. Staff are very kind and helpful. Lobby is inviting and impressive and love the collaboration with fashion businesses like the hats and dresses for sale. Rooms are small but clean, quiet, comfortable and everything you need. Would definitely stay here again.

The staff was amazing!! They were so nice to us always smiling, saying hi, welcome etc. I had also a very special request also and they aced it!The location is awesome in Waikiki, very central, close to everything. The design of the hotel is great, and feels very unique. They had fresh fruit infused water all the time that was good. The view from the pool was awesome as well!But again the staff was amazing especially Helen, Edean & Josh. Thank you and congratulations for the great work!!

I was keen on visiting this boutique hotel the minute I saw it on Instagram. It has unique decor and a hashtag culture which I love. It’s so different than your generic hotels the same the world around. Loving it !

Everyone who works here is so kind, and after 15 hours of traveling I was pleased to be greeted by kindness and efficiency. The room itself was kind of small and kind of needed a paint touch-up, but the bed was nice and the layout was good. The view was of the building across the way which had a lot of garbage on it's balcony, so I didn't spend much time on my balcony, but that was fine as I had not paid for any sort of view. Heavenly is such a great restaurant and it was awesome to get a discount for staying at the hotel. The infused water was a nice touch, and the different things that had going on in the lobby on some days (like shave ice and popcorn) was delightful. The location of this hotel is also ideal because it's by good shopping, great restaurants, and it's not far from the beach. The rooftop pool was usually pretty empty which made it wonderful as it takes up most of the roof and there's not really room for groups, but it's ideal for two people who want to lounge and swim. I really loved my stay here and would definitely come back!

The location is good, its nearby a lot of shops right across the street from Royal Hawaiian Shopping Center and a block down from International Market Place and not too far from the beach or Ala Moana.Apart from its perfect location, the room is very comfortable and clean. Parking attendant is really courteous.The attention received from the staff was impeccable.A truly "home away from home" feel.Our family had a wonderful stay there, and if we make it back, we would stay there again because all of the staff are nice and friendly that makes it feel so welcoming and fun!!Thank you Shoreline Staff!

We had several offers to stay at hotels in the area if we would attend a 2-3 timeshare sell pitch. Those aren't for us and I didn't go to Hawaii to waste any time on that sort of thing. I told Josh at the front desk, one of the things I liked about the Shoreline was the fact it was not a timeshare hotel! What we got was a nice room and bath that took care of all our needs for the week at a very reasonable cost. As we were constantly on the go all we needed was a place to sleep and clean up and this place was just the ticket. They have a great little pool on the roof, but we never got to use it. We did take advantage of the complimentary drinks in the lobby and one day they were handing out popcorn and flavored shaved ice. Parking was $30 a day which was less than anywhere else in the area and of course it was valet as parking is scarce in Waikiki. I never once had an issue leaving the vehicle or getting it delivered. This hotel had a little cafe next door, but we went around the corner to McDonald's or a block further to IHop a few mornings. And it is only a few blocks from the beach. Several restaurants are within a few blocks like Yard House, Hard Rock and Dukes. And my wife loved going to the International Market Place, a mall less than a 10 minute walk from the hotel. For our needs this first trip to Hawaii, the Shoreline was a great place for us.

My husband and I stayed here for 4 days as part of our Maui-Honolulu trip. Here are the pros and cons:Pros:- great location. Located just off the main shopping street with lots of food options near by. Waikiki beach is just a short walk away.- free water in the lobby- the restaurant attached to the hotel has amazing foodCons:- pictures are definitely deceiving. From the pictures we were picturing a some what modern hotel but for the most part it is quite dated. They updated a few things in the room but the room is still pretty old, especially the bathroom, which I think was not updated at all.We were debating between this hotel and surf jack and opted for this one as it is slightly cheaper. I will definitely pay a bit more and stay at another hotel instead next time I am in Honolulu.

It’s in a prime location and very clean. The room was quaint The staff there was great and very helpful! You have any questions, just check with Josh, Ricardo, Edean, or Joseph! They give the best suggestions!

We enjoyed coffee and cake whilst looking out over the beach. Both coffee and cake were very nice, Secluded spot with steps leading down onto beach. Lots of cushions available to sit on the seats. Popular place and many people chose to sit inside. Good service and pleasant staff. Will call here again.

We absolutely loved our stay at the Shoreline!The interior design is really beautiful and the rooms are great! Neon everywhere is eye candy to the already natural beauty of Waikiki. We enjoyed many of the amenities such as rooftop pool (with excellent views), fresh water + coffee + tea, snacks, free towel usage for the beach, and lobby events such as live music. All of the staff, valet, and cleaning services were really helpful and kind. Not to mention the location, wow. It's perfect and absolutely close to everything. There are at least 2 local gay bars within just a blocks distance (yay)! The beach is just about two blocks of walking, there are many cute spots along the way and filled to the brim of restaurants, bars, shopping (local boutiques + larger malls), street performers. The location alone helps to you to take full advantage of your stay in the bustling city of Waikiki; hunting for that perfect balance between relaxation + running around. Absolutely take advantage of Heavenly, the restaurant within the Shoreline, for healthy conscious food, smoothies, and to-die-for omelettes.After an 8 night stay, we still weren't ready to leave. :)Thank you so much, Team Shoreline!

Started her for a week and the best thing by far is the location. It is sort close to the main strip and directly across the road from Ross.The room was a good size but the balcony very small... just enough space for one person I would say. We received a welcome tray of drinks and snacks for 2 people even though there was 3 booked in and we did have to request it as we had seen on instagram they were given out. The live music performance was very entertaining. The singer had a beautiful voice but i feel there was a very small audience due to poor promoting of the event. In the hotel it was only on the pamphlets in the elevator. Loved that the was flavored waters at all times and the reception staff were very friendly and helpful. I would stay here again.

Amazing place to stay, wonderful staff and awesome service, Ricardo was great with info and where and what to do. Stay here again anytime. Lots of things to do and the complementary drinks,food was a huge highlight

After a long day of traveling, ready to rest our weary heads, we stumble into a beautiful and vibrant neon lobby and greeted by a warm and welcoming face. Edean was the lovely receptionist that immediately made us feel comfotable and at home here at the shoreline hotel. She worked tirelessly through thick and thin to ensure that we were completely satisfied with our stay. She accomodated all of our needs without any hesitation. She truly cares about her guests and works hard to prove it. We love Edean!

Stay in this hotel last February and Naoki was helping me and my family now I came back cause it was that good of a service but it’s a real change And I’ll never stay here again waste of money poor customer satisfaction and the room was small I was put on 227 smells bad and could not room change Totally different so disappointing

This is a cool hotel in a great location. The room in lobby was really clean, and I like the vibe the hotel is going for. I didn’t have a chance to make it up to the pool, but the restaurant next-door is good, and they have good drinks to if you go in the evening.

Location perfect! TBH our original room with two doubles was quite tight for our family, but we talked with Nina and the manager James who quickly upgraded us to a larger suite that day and it was perfect! The rooms may be a little worn, but they are very clean and the entire staff is SUPER friendly and helpful. Ricardo gave us great tips on restaurants and Nina helped me get something for my son - both of them were above and beyond customer service. Everyone there goes above and beyond! The hotel is lively and friendly, they have something going on every night in the lobby - oh and delicious fruit infused water and coffee and tea in the lobby 24/7!! Our family had a wonderful stay there, and if we make it back, we would stay there again because all of the staff makes it feel so welcoming and fun!!

hotel is basic rooms are quite old an run down for a newly renovated hotel.. besides that it has mostly everything you need great location very central to beach an restaurants a few issues with house keeping very slow an abit unreliable all in all a good budget stay in Waikiki

This hotel is hardly noticeable from the outside but you go inside and there is a "WOW" factor. It's vibrant, lively, clean and lots of exciting deatils inside the property. You should check it at night. The lobby turns to several unbelivable colors illumination and it is just wonderful to watch the changes. Staff are nice and friendly, good furnishing and roomy. Good to try on short stay just to experience Honolulu & Waikiki Beaches. It is centrally located and walking distane to everywhere in Waikiki. The beach is about next block.

Cute hotel! Love the bright, vibrant colors! The whole place just brings me good vibes. Staff is awesome! Thank you Edean for always going above and beyond. Excellent customer service and bright personality. I will definitely be coming back and recommending to my friends and family as well.Much Mahalo!

This is the place to stay..!! A good start with Ricardo on the desk when entering being so welcoming and helpful. Edean was always pleasant and accommodating when we needed help with activity and places to visit. GREAT location a block away from the beach. Thank you all for an incredible experience.

We decided to stay here for a weekend staycation. As locals, we love supporting boutique hotels instead of staying at the bigger resorts. Upon arrival, their valet was full (they only have like 15 stalls in their underground garage). I went to the front desk while my fiance waited in the car. The receptionist told me to park across the street in the Hyatt Centric's parking garage or find street parking elsewhere. Street parking in Waikiki, are you serious?! We ended up parking our car in the Hyatt's parking garage.The valet told my fiance to check back with the front desk later that night to see if/when parking would become available, which is fine for us. Later that night after returning from dinner, a stall opened up and we moved our car and they did not charge us extra for parking that night. Which was appreciated!The pictures on their website are a bit deceiving, it makes the rooms look a lot more spacious and the pool looks a lot bigger, but was a bit of a disappointment in person. The prices suit the size of the rooms. The bathroom is tiny! We were in a King Suite, I don't know if all the bathrooms in the hotel are the same size, but I expected a little bigger since we were in a larger room. Also, we didn't have a balcony.. We were on the 13th floor (2nd from the top) when we looked down, all the floors below us had balconies. We still had sliding doors to let fresh air in, just no balcony. It was a little weird. Amenities like the fresh fruit infused waters, tea and coffee in their lobby was nice. The welcome basket with a 2-night stay is a nice touch (but we didn't get one upon check-in, so I had to mention it the next day to the receptionist on our way out for lunch; they provided one promptly). We invited some family over to swim in the pool with us, and without hesitation the front desk gave us pool towels for everyone. It was nice to have the pool to ourselves. but like I mentioned previously, its pretty small, I can't imagine how cramped it must be with more than 10 people up there. The pool ladder needs to be bolted down better, it was a bit rickety. Also, there wasn't a bathroom or any other amenities up there, so you'd need to head back to your room. Overall, it's a good price if you're not too picky about the size of the room/bathroom. The bed/pillows were comfy, the tv and a/c work, and the walls seemed thick, so we slept soundly. The decor is cute which makes for great pics. The location is good, its nearby a lot of shops/eateries; right across the street from Royal Hawaiian Shopping Center and a block down from International Market Place and not too far from the beach or Ala Moana.

Amazing experience. Staff were all so friendly and Nina was outstanding in her service. Rooms were so great and had everything we needed. Free minibar snacks was such a great addition and beach towels etc were excellent to have available. Price was great too. Pool a little small but all we needed as beach is so close. Loved everything. Check in and out was so easy too.

Stay for a couple of days I did not get not help from anybody hotel is nice but service is F for presentation I was expecting more also valet service is the worse and over price I read about the hotel couple of months ago and I did not meet Naoki he seems the best with the reviews I've read what a disappointment

I really felt welcomed in this hotel. The staff was super nice and attentive. In particular Edean was super friendly and gave me great suggestions for places to go. The hotel was not in front of the beach but only a couple of blocks away (maybe three blocks). Everything to see in Waikiki was close to this hotel. The hotel was nicely decorated and the room was very comfortable. They provided me with complimentary snacks and drinks (such as juice, coffee, tea, and water). Also, they gave me some discount coupons for different places (including restaurants and car rental). The restaurant next door which had access through the hotel (very convenient for breakfast and late night drinking) was very good. Staff were friendly and although it did not have a variety of meals i really enjoyed it. The pool was small but i liked that it was nice and private. Overall my stay at the hotel was great and i would definitely stay there again.
user_name:
Jennifer L
Bellerose, New York, United States

review_body: This is a nice little hotel with a great location. They do several nice things for the guests throughout the week, popcorn, shave ice, wine tasting and music. They have coffee, water and tea in the lobby. Service was good - they were all very nice. A small pool on the rooftop which is great - I had it to myself most of the while I was there since it was so small most folks go to the beach. There isn't a gym, but their sister property allows you to use theirs (Coconut) - it's basic, but has what you need. Room was 'trendy' and they give you a snack basket with water refilled daily. Only feedback for improvement would be to always do a thorough cleaning before of the room and bathroom for next guest - bathroom floors - the entire bathroom floor!, toilet basin and cups. The bathroom amenities are basic so ensure you have what you like with you. Overall a very good place to stay.

I’ve worked in the hotel business and spend 60 nights a year in hotels for work now and this place is horribly managed. Would never stay there again. Was dirty, staff was not well trained, and over priced

We had a great stay at the Shoreline.having retired from United Air Lines we spent many layovers at the old Shoreview. The remodel is amazing we loved it. The staff was great I especially Thanks again Rich and Cyndi ErhardtEdean who was very helpful

Shoreline has done a great job of changing the aesthetic of the hotel and it looks super cute. Other than that it’s an average hotel in a good location if you’re staying in Waikiki. I only stayed two nights and that was enough for me. Anything longer and I’d recommend spending an extra $50/night to stay at Moana Surfriders or one of the other higher end hotels. It’s cute and they’ve done their best, but at the end of the day it’s a small hotel with few amenities and a terrible view of a dilapidated apartment if you’re in a ‘city view’ room.

Aloha, Thank you all for your wonderful hospitality and a complimentary on our stay. Lovely atmosphere, affordable place to stay in and closer to the shops. We enjoyed our stay home away from home. We’ll be definitely coming back to Shoreline :) Mahalo, Sosara & Mathieu

I am a 72 year old American traveling with his wife and staying at Shoreline for 2 nights after missing our plane back to Chicago. The first thing I will note and which is irritating but is not Shoreline's fault is that the booking does not mention a resort fee of $25 per day. Tripadvisor and other booking sites NEEDS TO FIX THIS!! So then, this place looks like it used to be a dump. But they have refurbished the rooms and public places and it is quite nice. The rooms are modern, well lit, nicely appointed. Good WIFI. Good selection of TV channels but no HBO, The location of this place is VERY good. Just about a 3 or 4 minute walk to the beach. It is close to a LOT of nice restaurants and shopping centers. Kuhio street on one side and Kalakua on the other side. There is a ROSS store and an ABC store right across the street. The color scheme of the hotel is totally funky but not junky. Forget the pool - terrible. But that's about the only negative.

I enjoyed my overnight stay at this elegant spirited hotel. The management was very friendly. The room was lovely, clean and comfortable The flavoured water downstairs was a very elegant touch. Would stay again

Location great for beach, shops and restaurants. Staff always smiling and polite. Loved the bright tropical decor in rooms and lobby, especially little touches like the Alhoa towel rail in the bathroom. Lots of extras offered such as welcome pack in room, water bottles in fridge replaced every day, free beach towels and chairs, coffee and tea in lobby. All added up to a great, welcoming hotel. Drawbacks - rooftop pool not great, not much room and air conditioning unit made it too noisey. Also had to turn off air con and fridge in the room at night as made too much noise, but all in all a great place to stay in the heart of Waikiki.

The phrase 'lipstick on a pig' comes to mind when thinking of our stay at Shoreline Hotel. The hotels internet presence would suggest that it is all gleaming, neon, picture perfect however it is really just some cheap paint and props. The room was comfortable and clean, no complaints there. The complimentary coffee etc in the foyer was a plus. The small pool is on the top floor and is not very inviting to be honest. It is in a good location and is a reasonable price when compared with other hotels in the area.

Freshcleanloved the fresh minted water at reception as well as the hats as decorloved the live band at reception loved Heavenly cafe and their healthy foodLoved that we were across from Ross shopLoved that we were right in the midst of townLoved access to the little market Dukes

Really enjoyed the stay, the staff were so friendly and made you feel so welcome. Room had all the standards, decorum was nice and colorful! Could’ve paid more to stay somewhere else but with all the bases covered and such awesome staff I wouldn’t bother!

Ridiculous service I have stay in a room that’s so noisy I ask be ro move 2 times and need an earplugs to sleep the bed was not comfortable and the air condition is noisy also I was help by a manager James this guy don’t even know what service means I tried to speak to the GM called but no avail it’s seems the management in this hotel like to dodge customers when it matters

Have stayed in mediocre kind a hotel before but never had the worse service and very incompetent People I have to deal with front desk don’t know anything about any recommendation and could even do anything rooms was small and noisy I would not recommend this hotel at all

Shoreline has a fun atmosphere, instagrammable walls & decor, and helpful staff. Plus, the location is ideal to downtown Waikiki. From check-in to check-out, we were given great service from all staff. They even give out free beach chairs! Be sure to rent the Biki's (bike share) to get around.

This hotel is colorful, fun, and vibrant! When you walk into the lobby there is bright decor, free coffee and tea, and local retail merchandise you can buy. The stay is extremely friendly and professional. The rooms are a great size and comfortable. There is free water in your room and amazing balcony views! It’s close to a lot of shops and restaurant and only a few minutes walk to the beach! Love love love this place!

The location of this hotel is fantastic. Close to the beach and all the major shopping centres. We booked our stay months in advance and received an amenity basket and free room upgrade. Ricardo at the front desk and the hotel manager was very accommodating and helpful in finding us a new room. We loved all the activities the hotel puts on daily. Overall nice stay. :)

I had a wonderful experience at Shoreline. The aesthetics were fun and refreshing. The rooms were unique and cozy, but the reason I booked a second night was the customer service. Edean was very friendly and helpful. She really made sure I had a fun and comfortable stay. James and Lawrence were super kind and held my bags after I checked out until I had another place to stay. The whole team made me feel at home and made sure all my needs were met. The location is also right by the strip and a 5 minute walk to the beach. Amazing restaurants and shopping near by. Not a fancy resort but perfect for a unique and comfortable stay!! I’m not one to write reviews but this is an exception!

Rooms were clean and comfortable. Everything needed for a great stay was provided. Staff was exceptional, especially Ricardo which went out of his way to ensure our stay was perfect and memorable. This was our 10th trip to Oahu, we've stayed at several other Waikiki hotels that were more expensive but will only be staying at the Shoreline hotel from now on! Live music in the lobby was fantastic, a weekly thing I guess, drink station all day everyday, and fun little snack stations on certain days. Great location, amenities, roof top pool and a modern room... you can not beat the Shoreline Hotel!

Indeed I selected as well this hotel based on previous comments - and I was not disappointed! It is ideally placed in the city center of Waikiki with short walking distance to beach, bus and restaurants. The hotel is nicely and very colorful refurbished. But the most important is the great service: the personnel is very helpful, attentive, and friendly. The rooms are not huge but have all for a good stay including a water heater for tea or coffee. The WiFi is working perfectly. And I love to be able to open the windows - even in the upper floors. Breakfast or lunch can be taken in the close restaurant Heavenly.

It was a total pleasure staying at Shoreline. We were impressed of the treats left in the room. The minute we arrived the great service started. We appreciated the cheerful attitude of the employees. They always greeted us with beautiful smile like you were coming home to your own house! I would definitely recommend the hotel to my family and friends and I would come back and stay the next vacation time in Waikiki! Thank you very much to James, Josh and Naoki!

Absolutely loved my stay at Shoreline! It's a smaller, vibey, and modern hotel just one block away from the beach. The colors and vibe made me feel like I was in Miami, and the staff, especially Ricardo, AJ, and James were so friendly I 100% felt the Aloha spirit! The lobby lounge offers happy hours and amazing live music multiple days/week, and the staff helped recommend all the hot spots in the area (AJ is your nightlife specialist, and Ricardo knows the good beaches). I originally booked for only 1 night, but found myself calling the front desk 4 days in a row 10 minutes before checkout begging for one more day. Can't wait to return!!

The best things about this hotel are the great location and its super friendly staff at the reception (particularly Ricardo, who is a very nice and helpful guy!). Other than that, the hotel is below average. The so-called refurbished rooms are still very old and not nice, they are also not very clean... I just didn’t feel comfortable...

No hotel is inexpensive in the Waikiki area. This one was at least moderate as far as we could tell. The front staff was friendly and helpful. Our room was clean and had some nice unique Hawaiian touches. It had a fridge but it was so cold, even on the lowest setting, that it froze items put into it so beware. The air conditioning worked very well in the room. The hotel had valet parking but, be warned, it costs $30 per night. You can walk to the beach in just a few minutes. The did have nice activities planned during happy hour in the afternoon but the rooftop pool was not available while we were there because of storm damage. There was no offer of a price reduction because of this. One other thing that would have been nice was some sort of inexpensive breakfast in the bobby area.

Shoreline hotel is at great location in Waikiki, minutes walks to the beach and many more. A lot of tours pick is the guests from there too. Receptionist Naoki is also fantastic. He was extremely helpful and made our trip hassle free. Hotel is small but has everything you need. The only thing need to point out is that because it is a older hotel so when it comes to cleaning it needs more attention to details as older hotels tend to “ look dirty”. But overall great experience, great value for money considering the whole of Hawaii is quite expensive, polite and helpful staff and the lobby is just so instagramable.

We have one of the best time in the shoreline because of the services provided by Mr NaokiVery professional answered all our questions and concerns and also gave a good recommendationTo be also fair the rest of the staff was awesome Including Edean Wonderful girl very polite and soft spoken lady the stay was all round great we will come back again

I was blown away by the service given to me by Naoki and the rest of the staff was only there for 2 days but there are no complaints here I have a nice corner room with a nice little balcony. The restaurant heavenly was really really good I can still taste the garlic shrimp I give the shoreline 5 out of 5 for location also very close and walking distance to everywhere.

This hotel is in the middle of everything Restaurants,Shops and many sightseeing place to go me and my wife was staying at the1023 the room was big and there is a little view but the quality is very good and the price is legit affordable. My wife and I would like to thank Naoki all his help and effort to get us in a really busy restaurant wolf gang steak house this person is a very very good asset of the company.

Hotel is great!! Staff is very friendly and is in a great location. Price for hotel was the best in the area and rooftop pool is a must see. I would definitely recommend this to anyone. Will book with them on next trip!

The pool was closed for rail repairs. This was upsetting to one person in our group of 5. I’m a beach person so no bigs. The location is a block from center of city, which is awesome. The area is super safe. The people that work the front desk are crazy friendly. The restaurant connected is tasty and eggs benny were on point according to friends. The hotel isn’t 5star but the hotel for the price is legit. Go eat at Gyu-Kaku and Duke’s, those were 2 of my faves!

There is so much to like about this hotel! The location is fantastic, the neon decor is very hip and stylish and the rates are very reasonable for a place that is less than a 10-minute walk from Waikiki beach. So why am I not giving it five stars? Because of our room. We were placed in room 628, which shares two walls with the elevator shaft! We spent three nights trying to sleep while listening to the elevator traveling up and down, over and over again, ending about 2:00 a.m. and beginning again about 6:00 a.m. After the first night, I tried to talk to someone at the front desk, but a fellow named Ricardo could only say, “Sorry, it’s my very first day.” Again, there’s a lot to like about the hotel, but you have to be willing to roll the dice on your room and the staff.

The Shoreline is a unknown unique hotel that me and my girlfriend have ever stayed the moment we check in the room was not ready but able to keep it and call us when our room was ready and also delivered to the room before we got there. There are a lot of features of the hotel great partial ocean view a king bed and all the amenities that’s included. I was not disappointed at all whatsoever and we thank you Naoki for giving us the best service

Here at the Shoreline we had a very good times Got upgraded the moment we checked in and great customer service daily by Naoki and EdeanOut favorite reps enjoyed the free coffee and the infused drinks we will stay here again

Had a short stay in this amazing colorful hotel got helped by the most coolest person name NaokiCheck In was very smooth and fast no dilllydallyGot the perfect room for our honeymoon.this hotel comes with nice TV,WiFi and a lot of snacks I cannot pronounce.thank you for giving us a memorable stay.

The staff was amazing, the rooms were nice and clean and they had amazing welcoming snacks! Great location to all shopping and the beach! The restaurant beside the hotel was fabulous! Highly recommend the Shoreline!

The Shoreline is one of the best unknown hotel very good service and the staff is wonderful stayed here for 3nights and everything is perfect got a big TV hi speed internet and many more I want to thank Naoki at the front desk for giving me good recommendations and the whole nine yards you were amazing buddy thanks again

We had the most fantastic stay at the shoreline Service was amazing and have no complaints hereRoom was very big for 2 people stayed at the suiteMy wife loves the colors of the lobby and we thank you Naoki.this guy took care of us while we are hereeveryday.great experience will never be forgotten.

In the heart of the action, within easy walking distance of the beach, terrific restaurants and world-class shopping in Waikiki! Hotel staff very friendly and helpful. Decor is fun! Great selections of flavored water in the lobby. Nice restaurant just outside the door. My husband’s still raving about their curry!

Had a great week at The Shoreline. The location is great for Waikiki Beach, restaurants, shops and the public transport. There’s also a car rental just around the corner too! Would thoroughly recommend.

Our room next to the elevator was very noisy and the AC was also loud so hard to sleep well.The pool was also off limits for repairs.So while hotel has a nice sense of style the quality level is not as high as I would want.Hotel only has steps to access the lobby so not so good with luggage. The small lift for wheelchairs was locked and not accessible for luggage.

Can’t get enough of the chocolate with macadamia nuts and hot tea and coffee wonderful location also in the middle of Waikiki close to Ross and Yokocho the Japanese restaurants totally different vibe from CA. We also want to thank Naoki for the services he provided good job my friend we will stay here again someday I will recommend this hotel to everybody I know.

Very millennial style hotel never seen a unique boutique hotel before just check in and very gorgeous room very big bed King size and a cute balcony We were help by customer rep Naoki he is funny and very entertaining gave us a upgrade and also gift basket and also he made reservation for us at Taormina a Japanese,Italian fusion Restaurant can’t wait yum.

We have a great time at this hotel service was very good and also the amenities was awesome Naoki and Edean help us over and over me and my wife are very grateful we would love to stay here again and also would recommend the hotel to our friends and family.

The shoreline was great. I had the most wonderful experience there. Front desk staff were amazing, always kept a smile and was on hand to assist with anything we needed. Location was perfect. Nice quiet street a minutes walk from the all the happenings of Kalākaua ave. The cheesecake shop was just around the corner where the beach access was so it was perfect. Hotel decor just blew me away. They definitely took “nature meets neon” to another level and the photos do no justice for it at all. Once again, Mahalo nui loa to Josephine, Venus and the rest of the shoreline crew for really looking after us. See you in September

Great location and amenities. Loved the complimentary snack tray, water and juice, as well as the tea and flavored water in the lobby. Were given an upgrade to a bigger room, but unfortunately it didn’t have a balcony, which was important to us. The colors were bright and cheerful but could have used some deep cleaning. The valet parking was quick and easy. The bed was a little too hard for me but, overall, we’re very happy with our stay and would stay there again.

Modern, boutique hotel in the heart of Waikiki, but tucked away off the main strip...Its all about location and affordability here. I recommend !!!HITS- Great location in the heart of Waikiki, 5 min walk to everything- 1 block away from Beachwalk shopping, International Marketplace- Maybe a 10 minute walk to beach...1 block then cut through Sheraton Waikiki for Grey's beach- Modern, clean aesthetic - Wifi was fast- Provides beach towels- Resort fee waived when I booked direct- Eat at Waikiki Yokocho court, Sams Kitchen, and Izakaya Tako NoKi...open late, 5 min walkMISSES- Small balcony

I was drawn to this hotel by the neon colors and super fun asthetic of the lobby. Well, the lobby is really the only good thing about this hotel. The infused water, changing color lights at night, and overall look is very cute. Going from there... everything else was a total bummer. The rooms were tiny and very lackluster compared to what I was expecting, it reminded me of a college dorm room decorated with just a couple items. I was shocked on how plain the rooms were compared to the look of the lobby. The air conditioning worked, that may be my only positive about the room. I didn’t take a shower and the bed was just ok. The lighting was even kind of strange. Hotel was super noisy and the hallways seemed dark and dirty. The carpet outside of the elevator was very stained (red stains). Now, let’s talk view... there is none. Looking outside my room was laughable actually. I looked down onto trash and whatever else spills out from the restaurant next door. The building next to this hotel needs to be demolished honestly. I would have rather had a fake picture of Hawaii instead of a window.  The pool was closed, so never saw that. They suggested a sister locations’ pool, which was advertised as heated and guess what! The heater was broken. At this point I am so not shocked. I paid close to $300 for a nights stay here, I did book day of which may of had something to do with it. I could have booked (much nicer) hotels in the area for much cheaper. If I had paid $150 tops (and that’s even being generous) for this room I wouldn’t be this pissed off. It still makes me cringe thinking about this whole experience.  The staff was nice, but I really didn’t interact with them too much. They do hold your luggage for you before check in. I did like that.  Apparently I was supposed to get a necklace and some snacks upon arrival, but I never got that. I did get a reply on one of my other reviews saying they had plenty of other amenities to offer. Well, I’m maybe blaming the staff for not mentioning any of that? Yeah the water in the lobby and towels for the beach, cool. That should be standard in every “3 star” hotel. So that was a joke.  So all in all I paid double what I should have for a college dorm room I could have decorated better myself. With a closed pool and a broken pool. The only amenities are towels and water/coffee. Oh and I read someone else’s review saying the breakfast was granola bars and muffins. I can go to an ABC store for that. Don’t be fooled

Not on the beachfront but well within walking distance. Not 5 star but clean and reasonably well appointed. Terrific little restaurant at the side door; great for breakfast. Staff friendly but a bit vague (may have been our Aussie accents).Budget for Hawaii is not budget in Australia. Everything in Hawaii is expensive. A tip for Aussie eaters - only order an appetiser - main courses are for 2 or 3 people. Main courses are called entree's in the states (Huh??)

We have a wonderful stay at this hotel service was fantastic and rooms were spotless WiFi was actually really fast big TV in the room also beach towels and chairs and many more amenities too bad the pool was closed but we are able to use the pool in the sister property and special thanks to Naoki for taking care of us.

BUYER BEWARE! Booked this hotel based on the “amenities” offered such as valet parking and the pool. Upon arrival, valet parking was full. The valet attendant recommended the parking garage across the street. Checked in and got in the elevator to the room, where signs were posted stating the pool was closed and under construction. Never once was this mentioned. The next day, we go to get our car to find out there is no overnight parking and we were about to be towed. $80 extortion to get our car out. This entire experience was hands down the worst. False advertising on so many levels. Don’t advertise “amenities” that you’re incapable of offering. The hotel was ZERO help when I explained all this to them. It was basically “oh, sorry, have a good day.” Take your money elsewhere.

10 days of vacation in the shoreline never disappoints always get the best room the best service and everything is always available to me Coffee got tea snacks the whole works Special thanks to Naoki for all his help

Just checkout and help by Naoki this guy is amazingHelp us from a-z gave us a upgrade and also reserve a nice restaurant to celebrate our anniversary one of the best stay that we have ever gone through hope to come again

Do yourself a favor and find somewhere else to stay for your visit. The rooms are musty, bathroom unclean, and beds uncomfortable. Original room I was given had dirty sheets. The hotel sits right next to a run down building where a large amount of homeless individuals hang out. Really relaxing to wake up at 2am to two people absolutely screaming and getting physical right outside your window. Pool was closed for the entirety of my stay. To top it off, I had to “request” a late check out for an extra hour, which was denied, but oh don’t worry you can be approved for an extra hour for $50. Unreal. By far this stay was the worst I’ve ever had, and a disappointment for what was supposed to be a relaxing vacation. Tons of other options that will make your stay enjoyable, besides this dump.

This is a special shout-out to the front desk staff Naoki I thank you for giving me a great customer service and also for upgrading my room to a higher and bigger room really appreciated it you deserve a 10 star my friend for the service you provide.

I travelled with my husband and baby. This was our first trip to Hawaii and we were very excited. The hotel is in a great location but otherwise, the pictures look a lot nicer than the actual rooms. Unfortunately, the air conditioning did not work on the last night and the room was super hot so our baby kept waking up. Reception sent a gentleman from maintenance who came into our room near midnight and tried for a long time to fix it, but was not able to. There were no other rooms available. Needless to say, none of us slept much and it made our long day of travel much less ideal. I have been trying to follow up with the hotel manager and sent several emails, but none were replied and thus I am leaving a review.

I was very disappointed with the room and service of this hotel. The only good thing they have is location. We stayed here from the 2nd to the 12th, we had 3 adults and 1 child aged one and a half. The largest room they have is not suitable for families. When I asked if they could do something to help me, I was pretty much told NO as I did not book straight through the hotel. The point of this is to let people know the photos are not what they seem. We could only walk down the middle of the beds not the sides as there is not enough room. My son couldn’t fit in the crib/cot that they have it’s too small. The pool area is tiny and not even a place that you can just go relax. We tried to stay out of our room as much as possible and even found sitting in the lobby some what better. We also found the reception staff not very full of information and often asked other people for help. The rooms were kept clean and tidy but I don’t think the rooms are as newly refurbished as they make it when booking. This definitely was a big down point for our first time in Hawaii

Here is our last night and being help with by Naoki front desk staff amazing service from this gentlemen He knows all the places to go and restaurant to eat and shopping for my wife he have gave us a free Gift basket and made reservation for Valentine’s the whole works

Welcome experience; easy to find, with vibrant entrance and lobby.It would have been nice to have someone greet me at the entrance (and perhaps help with my bag up the stairs.) Missed "first impressions" opportunity? (I have to disclose here that I am an ex-front of house hotel manager, which may render my review bias?)I love the flavoured chilled water station, I used my own bottle, in lieu of the single use plastic cups. (why not provide some of the colourful reusable cups you have in the rooms?) I liked very much the colourful and comfortable lobby chairs, I gladly sat near the oversized fan, and flicked through the Gray Marlin photography book I found on the coffee table.I arrived early and was okay to leave my bag, the male receptionist was pleasant enough, but not overly memorable. I would have liked to have been sent a text to let me know when my room was ready? - a nice service touch? I also was not offered any neighbourhood advice, nor was I told about the hotel's facilities. I would have liked to have changed and gone to the beach, but was unsure if there was a change area close by? I gladly otherwise spent the day exploring the area. Upon my return around 3:00 pm, I was greeted so warmly by Venus. I mention her name, because she was really warm and friendly. The hotel manger needs to know this. Venus even relocated me to a quieter room with no concern. I am such an advocate that a genuine and engaged employee experience definitely makes all the difference in a hotel stay, no matter how comfortable a bed is, how instagrammable the hotel is, or how well priced.
