The room was delightfully simple, clean, with kitsch colours everywhere. I found everything I needed really easily. My bed was indeed comfortable, and despite being a "standard" room - was practical and met my needs. The bathroom was really clean too. Check out was straight forward - Venus was on shift again and gladly helped me mailing a postcard, call me a taxi and sent me off with a warm farewell.

Shoreline Waikiki is on of the best boutique hotel we have ever stayed rooms are very eclectic very millennial vibe fruit infused drinks and hot coffee and hot tea on the lobby service executed very well by Naoki customer representative able to check in early in the morning with a free uprade well done.

Naoki looked after us well after a last minute booking, wonderful hotel right in the middle of waikiki. Will come back again! Particularly loved the extra touches - towels, chairs, welcome gift box all made us feel at home.

This hotel is great for a short trip into Waikiki. We stayed over night to get a quick experience before heading up to the north shore. It is everything you expect it to be. Nothing over the top fancy, but perfectly simple. Good location, clean rooms, comfortable beds, recently renovated and updated.

Very clean room which was serviced every day with fresh towels. The beds were very comfortable. Modern interior which was great. The complimentary tray of goodies in the room was a fabulous touch and delicious. We were with a group of friends and we had booked five rooms. Perfect location to the shopping strip and beach. The hotel had a cute cafe next door with great healthy food. The foyer area was just beautiful. Fresh water with fruit was always available and topped up in the foyer as well as coffee and tea. There was always a friendly staff member at reception. We would definitely stay here again and look forward to returning soon. Thank you for an awesome memorable holiday.

What an experience we had at this hotel rooms are wonderful amenities are very good also with chocolates and nutshell necklaces and service was impeccable we’re impressed with NAOKI he knows a lot of things around great knowledge of the islandThis hotel is one of the best hotel in Waikiki.

Stay in the hotel for few days and receive a very outstanding service from Naoki and he provided us with some information about the restaurant and sightseeing places climbing diamond head was awesome.this is the place to be on Waikiki if you want the best service and convenient location.

Just checked in the hotel and the front desk specialist Naoki help us settle in amazing service this guy knows everything around the hotel already recommended to go to zip line and kualoa ranchFor outside activities omg I like the room.

We stayed here just one night, and I think we would have been uncomfortable if we stayed longer. The room was very small (standard queen room). While they have added a lot of decor that makes everything look pretty, the age of the hotel still shows through. I enjoyed the colorful lobby most. The rooftop pool is small and only has 4 chairs, good to go and take a few pictures, but not a place I would hang out at for awhile. The location is great and close to the main strip! Overall I would recommend this hotel for a young crowd or for just a short stay.

Just here for the night and I have a very nice room with King bed also got an amenity gift for freethe service in this hotel is outstanding I give Naoki3 thumbs up coffee and hot tea are all includedOne of the best stays so far that I had in Waikiki

The shoreline does not disappoint this place is very affordable and with great customer service had help with Venus and Naoki definite professionals only here for few more days and would recommend to anyone.

The A/C in the room was extremely loud, sounding like an airplane was flying over our heads every 60 seconds or so. The noises both inside the hotel and outside the hotel were also very loud and annoying when we were trying to sleep; they should really sound-proof their walls. We had a balcony but the view of the apartment across the street was so horrible we kept the blinds shut our entire stay so we wouldn't have to look at it. There is a rooftop pool but there is very little space to walk around up there between the edges of the pool and the side of the building, which I find to be rather dangerous. The pictures online make it look bigger than it is. There is also no hot tub and the compressors by the pool are very loud and distracting. To access the pool, you need to take the elevator to the 14th floor and then climb the last set of stairs, then there are more stairs once you're the roof. I found the setup very unappealing. The rooms themselves are cute when you're inside and the staff was very friendly, but between the noise and other things I've mentioned I was rather disappointed with my stay here. The restaurant downstairs is probably the best part of the whole hotel.

Just check in the shoreline and the service providedby Naoki is impressive this room is very nice and big bed king size also amazing view. Snacks in the room chocolate macadamia nuts and so much more wow I love this hotel thanks Naoki

Shoreline is a short walk to Waikiki beach and shops. A great location with a lot of amenities nearby. We got an awesome welcome gift of local snacks and two Hawaiian necklaces. They promote the cafe next door as part of the hotel, but it's a separate business. You get 10% off if you show your room card, however no room service is available. If you like the party vibe, there was a noisy bar that played loud music till late at night, sounded like a lot of fun, but not when you are trying to sleep :-)

But the room was pretty small. And the bathroom power concent for dryer didn't work. One more thing.. lot of tourists bring their carriers but they only had stairs to the entrance area. It was raining when we checked in and we had to move up and down the carriers in the rain. The location was good. There was ross and abc store right across the street. Price we paid including amenities fee seemed a bit too much compare to what they provided to the customers.

My partner found this refurbished hotel that was conveniently located to restaurants, transport and most importantly, the beach. I loved it! We grabbed complimentary towels every day and watched the sunset. We used the rooftop pool a few times and really appreciated the quiet up there (could be a bit loud at night with the market down below), but for a busy tourist town it was a great stay for 5 nights! If ever in Waikiki again, we'd stay here for sure... Shoreline was the beginning of our island-hopping, and but we chose to stay out of Waikiki on the last few nights before leaving Hawaii.

Naoki at the front desk was fantastic and went above and beyond to help us start off the last leg of our trip on the right foot. Thanks Naoki!!Rooms and lobby are very aestheticPerfect end to our trip!!

Was able to get an excellent rate on just a few minutes notice. Reception was cordial and upgraded my room to a suite (big room with couch, coffee table and big walk in closet). Room was spotless. Super trendy decor with very bright colors as pictured. I appreciate the extras like 1:00 check out, help with airport shuttle reservation and holding my bags for the afternoon. Now there is live music in the lobby while I wait for the shuttle.

The room was clean and big enough to leave two big luggages open and we were warmly welcomed with some snack boxes, dairy water bottles in the room and some coffee at the front. Especially, friendly and kind hotelman, Naoki, gave us his recommends for dinner and transportation, and also voucher for breakfast at HEAVENLY. We got many services and all were beyond its cheap price! I’d like to come stay next definitely!

Good location in Waikiki for shopping and restaurants. Hotel was one block from beach and not as pricy as beachfront hotels. Staff and service were excellent. They helped us with tourist directions/transportation to and from scenic spots. Room was clean but small.

Upgraded from the start to a floor with a view although with the warning that there would be some noise from the elevator (there was). The service was great and there were complimentary snacks in our room when we arrived. The location was great and we could walk to a lot of shops and restaurants.

Me and my husband stayed at this hotel for 4 days in Jan 2019 on our way home from New Zealand.The staff were very friendly and attentive, the rooms were clean, bright and had all the essentials at a great price for the location which was excellent

Naoki was super friendly and was excellent with helping us check into our room for the night. Great way to end our last night stay in Hawaii! Thank you naoki! We’ll be sure to stay here again when we take our next family vacation!

Just finished our trip to shoreline and it was such a cute hotel. You see pictures online and when you get there it really lives up to the hype. It’s so cute right when you walk up. It’s right in the middle of Waikiki so expect for food to be really expensive. Everything is really within walking distance and then so close to the bus stop. The staff was so nice! We were greeted by TJ when we had a super late check in and he was wonderful! And then we had Naoki help is the entire time. He helped with suggestions on places to go and how to get there! He really is a asset to the front desk. The refurbishment they did was very cute and definitely makes up for the age of the hotel. But there are some things that could have been fixed, the noise from outside was VERY loud. You could hear EVERYTHING and I am sure the staff would have moved us if we asked but our suitcase was completely exploded in the room so we didn’t let the staff know either. Honestly for the staff alone we would come back! Normally we are a Marriott family but this is a really great and fun alternative with so many fun events going on.

Me and my wife was just here for the night Naoki made everything very smooth everything was ready when we arrive and got an upgrade also from Queen to King what a difference and had a better sleep Naoki very skilled in customer satisfaction and gets a 5 star from us.

We stayed at the Shoreline for our honeymoon, and from the moment we stepped in, we were in for a great time. Venus, who greeted us and had talked to us multiple times on the phone to answer our questions before we arrived, was super nice and accommodating. In our room, she welcomed us with a bottle of champagne and local Hawai’i snacks. It was so special. Thank you, Venus! The location was super convenient for everything we wanted to do, from sightseeing tours, to the beach, to shopping and dinner. You’re literally in the heart of it all.Another bonus is the Heavenly restaurant next door. Great food! We can’t wait to come back!

Awesome lactating right in the heart of Waikiki. Easy to walk to anywhere we needed. Tourist friendly !! Staff were helpful and knowledgeable. Also a bonus we could use the laundry in the sister hotel

A fun hotel to stop in Honolulu. Vibrant colourful hotel with good staff. Stayed in a suite, had great amenities. The rooftop pool was a great hang out spot. Would recommend for a short stay. Very conveniently located for local services.

I checked in early got the nice room upgrade the bed was so big and I was help by Naomiamazing people skills he hook me up stayed in 1328and this is the room I recommend nice part ocean view with a bigger balcony

This place is one of the most unique hotel that me and my family have stayed the room was very clean and very colorful And fun the service was amazing And the front desk knows everything about the surrounding. Special thanks to Venus in the morning that help us and Naoki at night for entertainment and giving us recommendations. Shoreline management please take care of this 2 amazing assets.

A mostly really enjoyable hotel to stay at, the Shoreline Hotel is in a fantastic location - close enough to the beach but also surrounded with fantastic shops and places to get a bite to eat. The facilities were great, I loved the little welcoming touches of flavoured water & tea in the lobby, to the welcome pack in my room. There were lots of cool, instagram worthy spots especially the foyer and pool area. It was always nice to have a relaxing spot to come back to at the end of the day, with friendly staff always in the lobby to welcome you. The only negative things I would have to say is that the ceiling in my bathroom had dirty marks on it and the noise from the bar down the street was really loud at night, especially since my room faced that way - ear plugs were left in my room for me which worked well, but it's just something to be aware of.

This hotel has the most vibrant colors didn’t expect to that bright but the rooms are cleans service by Naoki was impeccable great guest service representative and knowledgeable about the whole Waikiki area gave us the best recommendation for restaurant called Taormina Italian and Japanese fusion.definately will be back for more

By far the most fun Hotel in Waikiki and Custer service was outrageously good. We we're greeted by amazing colors and friendly faces. Such a great vibe here. Complimentary fruit water was nice as we waited a few minutes to check in. We we're helped by Naoki who was beyond helpful and turned our day into an amazing one after having a rough start. He even made sure we we're doing ok after we got settled into room. The room was pristine and beautiful. So many vibrant art of all colors. The theme of this hotel is very fun and quirky but in a great way. Had breakfast at the cafe in the morning as well and it was fantastic. Kalua Pork Eggs Benedict was on point!! Can't say a single negative thing about this place. Great location, close to everything too.

My husband and I stayed at this wonderfully bright and cheerful hotel with the hopes of enjoying a night of fun and relaxation. It definitely did not disappoint! The decor was gorgeous, the atmosphere upbeat but so comfortable. Special thanks to our guest service rep Naoki who gave us outstanding service and friendly, warm conversation and recommendations. His service brought this stay to the next level and we will be recommending this place to friends and family. We will be back!

Stayed here for 7 nights and had a wonderful time with my boyfriend. We were very kindly upgraded to a king bed at check in. The room was small but comfortable for two people to live in. Housekeeping were fantastic except on two occasions where our waters were not replaced and towels just heaped onto our bed. Hotel is centrally located on Waikiki - walks straight out to the shopping strip, all kinds of restaurants within 10 minute walking distance, 5 minute walk to Waikiki Beach. Great functional hotel.

Nothing beats this hotel with the customer unlike any other hotels. Checked in late and Naoki who gave us the best service possible my wife was very impressed and the colors of the hotel is spectacular Infused fruit and water, hot coffee and tea in th lobbyThere is no mistake we are coming back here again in a couple of months

We found a bedbug in our room here on the second night. They moved us to a smaller room and we thought our clothes were contaminated. No contact from the manager. Could not give us more than $30 off our bill for the inconvenience. Poor management and worse customer service.

Spectacular stay at the shoreline hotel this place is unique very helpful staff from housekeeping to front desk we love our stay.Fruit waters snacks and all the amenities was awesome.Naoki thanks for all your great service.I’m

Greeted by the friendliest front desk employee Naoki. Check in was really smooth. Love the vibrant colors around the hotel. Spacious room and bathroom. Highly recommend. Beautiful room view. Great experience.

Loved our stay here , a block back from the beach , great room , funky and colourful decor gave it a really good vibe. Our room was large with good bathroom and small balcony and a small fridge for drinks. It is only a short walk to the beach and restaurants of Waikiki , the bed was comfy and also cleaned by the time we returned from the beach. The pool area is nice and quiet with a lovely cold pool , welcome in the hot weather. We would thoroughly recommend the Shoreline and will definitely return. The towels and beach chairs were handy and the fruit waters and hot coffee in reception very welcome. The restaurant Heavenly next door does a lovely breakfast too.

Stayed at this hotel for a few days customer service was awesome special thanks to Naoki for being able to help us with information and giving us a very good quiet corner room also to housekeeping for making our room neat daily

I dubbed this hotel the "Instagram Palace" as it seems to have clearly been designed to appeal to social media posting millennials. The bright colors and décor were just begging to be photographed.As an almost senior citizen, I felt I should seem younger & cooler just by staying there. However, it lacked too many practicalities to keep the my latent hipster from prevailing over my grouchy old lady. While it certainly was an eye-catching place the photogenic aspects couldn't make up for the lack of practical amenities one expects from a hotel room. For example, other than the small bedside nightstands there were NO DRAWERS in the room, so guests must either stack their clothes on the lone closet shelf or live out of their suitcases for the duration of their stay. The walls are thin and soundproofing poor, so despite being on a high floor, we could hear street noises: shouts of partying vacationers, trucks backing up, garbage cans clanging, etc., throughout the night. Housekeeping starts late in the morning, and the first full day of our stay our room was never even cleaned, despite our being out shopping or at the beach for extended periods during the morning and afternoon.The hotel is conveniently located in central Waikiki. Nice views from the small rooftop pool. The unheated water is refreshing.The front desk people were pleasant, polite, and eager to be of service.We appreciated the infused waters, coffee, and tea available in the lobby. Unfortunately, our stay did not coincide with 'Pau Hana' days so we were unable to sample the treats offered then. However, we did enjoy the tray of goodies in our room as well as the bottles of water, (which saved us a trip down to the lobby when we got thirsty in the middle of the night). We enjoyed the substantial and healthy breakfasts at the Heavenly Café, but hope more items will be offered in the future. I would like to have tried one of the smoothies or acai bowls, but they were not part of the included breakfast. It's also too bad that it cost an extra $5.00 to order coffee in the café as we found out our first morning there. (Who doesn't include coffee with breakfast)? On subsequent mornings we brought coffee from the hotel lobby into the restaurant.In summary, while I'm not so advanced in age that I cannot appreciate the cool, photogenic aspects and amenities of the Shoreline, I'm also pragmatic enough to expect a quiet room with adequate storage that gets cleaned daily.

The hotel is in very very good locationRestaurants and shops in every corner.The rooms are quite unique with a millennial touchBut the best part is Naoki and the services he provided to me and my girlfriend. We will definitely stay here again.

Best location for food , shopping and beach not too far. The hotel has free gifts, water and coffee. Right across from Ross store. All different price range for cheap food including $2 draft beer at the international market

Beautiful, clean and modern hotel located at the perfect location. Staff are kind and generous. The highlight of my stay was Naoki at the front desk who really went above and beyond to make our stay wonderful.. can’t thank him enough :)

Long drive with traffic from North Shore. Although we are in heaven, we are still tired from the long hot day of heavenly fun. Arrived to Shoreline and was immediately greet with excellent and brilliant service. Naomi was our front desk dude, he was courteous, professional and generous. He hooked us with a nice room and overall, I would give him a five star service. Thank yiu

This hotel is quite amazing from the moment you check in and the moment service was amazing Had great amenities close to everything literally Outside are ships and restaurants.special thanks to Naoki for proving us all the information and also giving us a great time experience very good job.

My wife and I and young child had a super time at this boutique hotel. The staff were generally friendly and helpful. However, I bumped the lid of a container which broke which they charged me to replace. I believe the container was prone to breaking easily and it was confirmed that it had happened before. I challenged being charged for this expense and was told that the General Manager insisted on it. However, the GM did not take any trouble to address the matter with me. Overall a good experience but this created some unnecessary tension in my opinion.

This is an old (not in a charming way) hotel. The lobby was updated-modern-fun. The staff were all very friendly and helpful at all hours. The hotel has two fast elevators.Our floor hallway was colorful, but, unfortunately, smelled of deep-fried seafood. Our room was a good size, but the carpet was filthy--they need a good shampooing, or better yet, ditch the carpet and replace with hardwood floors, which are easier to clean and make for a healthier environment.The bed was large, but too soft; there were loads of non-feather pillows, which is great for allergy sufferers. The nightstands on each side of the bed both had power outlets--excellent for two people charging phones and devices at beside! The room had a coffeemaker & mini-fridge, and the closet had a hairdryer, iron, and ironing board. Our room had a balcony, which was a nice addition but wasn't very relaxing, as it overlooked a carpark and other hotel rooms.The bathroom had a shower/tub combo that was free of mold--good job, housekeeping! There was ample counter space, which was great for setting out toiletries during a longer stay. The towels were nice and absorbent. The toilet paper was rough on the bum; the hotel needs to provide guests with soft toilet paper.The free WiFi worked well. The hotel has a valet carpark for $30 per night.Though I'd prefer to stay at a nicer hotel, this property is in a decent location amongst the action and just a short walk to the beach. If the price is right, I might stay here again.

My wife and I stayed in this hotel for 6 nights and totally loved it! The manager, Naoki, is extremely dedicated, friendly and helpful! He is very professional and made us felt at home right away upon arrival when we first checked in. Staffs are friendly. Rooms are clean. Location is convenient.(I mean, only a few hundred feet from the beach and Rowal Hawaiian) The design of the whole property is very artistic and is perfect if you are looking to get some nice pictures. We highly recommend this hotel and hope you can experience what we experienced with Naoki and his team!

Stayed at this hotel for a couple of days for businessMeeting it was late night check and Naoki and Lawrence did an amazing job also had a free upgrade to a king size bedroom. I also like those amenities that comes with the room chocolate macadamia nuts, chips and those pink a yellow necklaces just found out from a friend it was kukuiNutshell necklace.Naoki thank you

We recently spent 5 nights in Waikiki and stay at Shoreline Hotel on Seaside. Fantastic location in the heart of everything. Very clean and staff were fantastic. we would stay again, it was fantastic .

Really nice and colorful hotel, really well located. They offer 24h coffee and infused water (with pineapple)! The only cons is that it can get a little noisy at night (earplugs available, though).Naoki at front desk made my experience great and was super helpful and kind. I am really grateful to him. Mahalo, Naoki!

Naoki giving us the best year With your awesome customer service My wife and I enjoyed the recommendation and the funny conversationI would tell my friends and family about your hotel we’ll see you again Once again we appreciate it

Hotel Shoreline recently received a complete renovation and now comes in fresh and trendy colors. Location is just perfect - a block away from the main road on the beach - just less than 5 mins walking to the beach. Lots of shopping and restaurants literally around the corner. Small but nicely decorated and clean rooms. More on the „no frills side“ but you actually don’t spend too much time in Honolulu in the room anyhow. Comparably quiet at night given the excellent location, however somebody with a light sleep will prefer earplugs.

We stayed here to save a few bucks versus other properties in Waikiki. It’s a great location, and well designed. The restaurant next to it is very good for a more basic breakfast or lunch. The room was small but adequate, and furnished sparingly but comfortable. Some of the public areas could use a bit of updating like carpet and all, but it’s no big deal. The only issue is the noise from a bar on the ocean side of the hotel. It’s loud, but at least never went past 10pm.

This Hotel is Gold very different from other HotelService was 5 star we were help by Naoki and Terrence would recommend this place with my friends and family and everyone. I recommend room 1328 big balcony and big king size bed.

Updated hotel in bright colors. Clean sheen. Hotel is distinctive on the street with tall trees and foliage at the curb. In evenings you'll see a pink glow up to 4 stories high! In the midst of discount and top line clothing shops. ABC stores every 100 yards/ metres.Our room had a balcony and we could view the ocean from the 12rh floor. Our room was quiet and enjoyable. No breakfast was included, but an organic restaurant next door gives Shoreline guests a 10% discount. Within a 5 minute walk are an abundance of eateries for all times of day. Waikiki beach was a 10 minute jaunt and the Shoreline sends you off with chair and towel! Yes, you are charged $25 per day for this service... which includes fruit in the morning, 3 types of fresh fruit flavored drinks throughout the day, take heart, Hawaii is a bit pricey all around! This place of accommodation will cheer you up! It is the brightest spot on Seaside! We've enjoyed our room since 31 December and got a great rate on Agoda.com. We check out in 20 hours.... when you want to visit Waikiki, remember Shoreline.o

Wow! What a hotel: all the staff were friendly and caring, helping me out when injured or finding out what to do for Nye! The rooms are immaculate and include so much!The attention to detail when this hotel was renovated !Shout out to Naoki, for his endless help and smile!

Naoki is great and very approachable. He made sure everything met our expectations he went of out his way every single time to make sure we were taken care of and greeted us every single time we entered or left the hotel. I would reccomend this hotel to everyone!! 5 stars for Naoki. Made our stay here that much more amazing and most importantly we felt welcomed. Thank you !!

Omg When I walked into the shoreline hotel I got graded by the most amazing guy called Naoki he was so friendly and helpful he is very nice and gave great customer service I highly recommend this hotel me and my partner are staying here for 10 days and we have not felt more Looked after. My partner even got a tattoo of the reception where aloha chosen by Naoki 10 out of five stars.

This hotel was very nice and very impressive customer service Josh and Naoki gave us a wonderful recommendation and able to accommodate us. Hotel was very colorful with limited amenities but we give a 5 star cause of the staff me and my family will stay here again on distant future.

Pros: Handy location, fun retro refurb, really friendly and helpful staff, free mini bar snacks, free coffee and fruit infused water in lobby. Cons: Noisy aircon up at the pool was probably the worst part. Everything else ok. It’s a solid three star property - colourful, retro, true to the era!

this is a great functional hotel. Its not fancy, but its clean, and the staff are very friendly. Its centrally located in Waikiki for each beach access, easy restaurant and shopping access. You're minutes from the sand, the mall, or any type of food you can imagine. Half a block away from a great Japanese food court with 10 different Japanese restaurants to choose from.

Wow I’m impressed with the customer service in this hotel love the fruit infused water,hot tea,and free coffee the internet is not bad. Beach towels and chairs also the gift basket at the room very very different from other hotel’s that I have stayed it’s actually way better. Special shot out to NaokiThis guy’s amazing almost like the ultimate concierge/ front desk thanks shoreline for an amazing stay

I had a lovely stay at the Shoreline Hotel Waikiki. The staff were all very welcoming and helpful, the rooms were large and comfy and the welcome basket with Hawaiian goodies was so good. You're away from the main strip so it's a bit quieter but so quick and easy to be right in the heart of everything and the beach. I loved the activities put on by the hotel and really great discounts available booking on their website. The pool was lovely and on the roof, though smaller than I expected.

My partner and I stayed at the Shoreline and, with it also being her 30th birthday, they went out their way to make it a really nice stay for her and myself. It’s something out of the ordinary compared to the big resort hotels in Waikiki/Honolulu. The free coffee, fruit-infused water and free pool towels are just one of the many simple but great things about this hotel - another being the great roof top pool and vibrant and elegantly simple rooms. It’s the little things that count in life and this place went out their way to make my partner’s special day superb. It’s also next door to a great little breakfast/dinner place. Shoreline have got it spot on.

This was our first visit to Wakiki. All of the staff were friendly and helpful. The room was comfortable and clean. The hotel is close to everything. We were grateful for the refreshments in the lobby. There is a nice pool on the roof. We would go back.

My cousins and I stayed for two nights on a girls trip before heading to Maui, and the staff were absolutely amazing. Erika and her colleague, in particular, were so welcoming, friendly and helpful. They even went out of their way to present us with some champagne and chocolate delivered to our room. Not to mention, the hotel room was super tidy! Would highly recommend this hotel!!!

We loved the way the shoreline has been renovated super modern and chic. Love the pool deck. The staff is so friendly and service is great! The room could have been a touch cleaner. The hotel is a super old building and those tend to have their quirks!

I’d stay in the Shoreline hotel for 3 days got more than I’d bargain for free upgrade,amenity goods,and very very good customer service from NaokiI appreciate the things he did to make my stay unforgettable. I would recommend this place to my friends back home.

Hotel location is excellent easy to walk anywhere downtown Waikiki. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. Rooms were clean and comfortable beds. Would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

What a wonderful surprise. Colorful, well designed, great staff, comfortable bed.walking distance to the beach, shopping, and restaurants. You can eat and drinkin the adjoining heavenly restaurant, and the food is reasonable by Hawaii standards and very good.
user_name:
HAROLD B
Rio Rancho, New Mexico

review_body: It is a nice place for shopping around Waikiki.The lobby is also beautiful and the staff is kind.There was space to stop by renting a car and it was comfortable.If you want to see the sea, you can not recommend seeing from the room, so you can not recommend it.

This place is one of the best hidden hotels in Waikiki Great service provided by the staff.not to mention infused flavored water and other refreshments,snacks in the room and beach towels and beach chair. Bonus was Naoki very professional and knows the area very well, we had some great recommendations from him.

This hotel is excellent. The location is just right to stay and to go shopping. The design is so colorful and vivid.The concierge is Naoki.He is gentle and served awesome services and useful information to us.

Super stoked to have found such a funky hotel in the heart of Waikiki! We booked directly through Naoki - absolute champion! Naoki swiftly arranged a birthday upgrade and we couldn't be happier. Shoreline has crazy, happy colours that have you smiling as soon as you drive to the valet parking and through the doors. Nice comfy room and wonderful place to call home for the evening :-) Thanks Naoki!

Boutique hotel. NAOKI was excellent. His customer service and attention to details was above and beyond. Beautiful hotel. Very modern, very Hawaiian. High recommend for an unforgettable experience. Love it

My husband and I have visited Waikiki several times but this was our first stay at Shoreline Waikiki. We were delighted with the wonderful hospitality and friendliness from concierge to the room cleaners!Each morning we passed reception there was always an abundant supply of chilled fruit water, delicious apples, herbal teas and coffee. Happy hour included a popcorn machine, assorted platters, mock tails and live entertainment. The staff were extremely helpful in giving us invaluable information on getting around Waikiki and local tours. The room was recently refurbished, pillows perfect and extremely comfortable. Pricing of the accomodation was incredibly reasonable and we would most definitely be staying no where else on future visits. Maholo
user_name:
B5328KDlisaw
Sydney, New South Wales, Australia

review_body: I'm a 'color' person so was immediately captivated by the hip pics. The decor is truly fabulous. HOWEVER, there is no drip coffee maker or microwave in the rooms - just a hot water jug (and you have to hunt to find a plug for it. Mine ended up on the bedside table). And some very stingy tubes of what is euphemisticallly entitled 'freeze dried Kona coffee' - which means INSTANT COFFEE. And it's undrinkable. The lack of microwave meant I couldn't curl up with a good movie and relax if I didn't feel like going out to a restaurant - so I ended up at the local ABC store for store bought sushi two nights in a row. The air conditioning is either freeze or fry. It's cold, turns off, and you have to endure the hot & stuffy atmosphere before it kicks in again. And when it does kick in, it's really noisy. The rooms aren't insulated well from outside city noises - but hey, you're in Waikiki, so that was not unexpected. The lovely presentation of fruit, fruit water and coffee in the lobby was really nice (and appreciated) - though again, the quality of the coffee wasn't great. Sorry to sound like a coffee snob. I'm not. But you could definitely do better in the comfort arena, Shoreline - eg your bed pillows were hard. It would be lovely when your creature comforts match your gorgeous, trendy, eye-popping decor!

I’m very happy with the location and services that the hotel provided to me.only stayed for 2nights and Naoki gave me a amazing service also gave me a upgrade to a king bed also right in front of Ross and all very good restaurants around.

This is my third time staying with Shoreline. My first was in 2013, second in 2017, and now it’s 2018, my third. I see the renovated decoration which is totally different from previous ones and the color is really strong and eye catching. I like the color of the old ones better as they brought sense of calm and peace in my opinion. Second, they do not provide beach umbrellas at the front desk anymore. And interestingly, the GM letter in each room still mentions about beach umbrella, beach chair and beach towels but the documents in key pocket mention only mentions beach chair and towels. It’s not consistent. Third, the service I experienced with the reservation email is “not responding” at all. How cool is that? But apparently it fits the new renovated decoration style - cool! And also the conversation we had with the gentleman in the front desk, no smiling at his face at all, how cool is that! While we asked him about beach unbrella he just told “no we don’t provide that anymore”. I know there has been changed of management in Shoreline but I see only the upgrade and improvement of hardware (decoration and the dressing style of the staffs are colorful). Anyway I am sure the new style with beautiful trendy decoration can still attract a lot of people but sadly it’s not my nor my husband’s choice anymore. Good luck to your new business model with new targeted customers and Goodbye the old Shoreline!

I chose this hotel based on its great design & style. The real life experience lived up to its high instagramability. Warm and attentive customer service. My room was clean and I loved the colorful, bold and funky design all throughout the lobby, rooms, hallways and pool area. This area is swamped with tourists but very extremely walkable to abundant stores and restaurant options within a few blocks.

We arrived at 6am and were able to check into our room straight away. All staff are very welcoming and friendly. Close/ central location in Waikiki. Public tpt within 2 min walk. Beach 5 min walk max. Could not fault the service or atmosphere created by the people who work here. This is our second time here and will definitely keep coming back. Awesome!

Would rather sleep on the street! If you have any sort of standard regarding the quality of your living area this place is not for you.We booked this hotel very last minute after we found out about the strike affecting other properties in Honolulu just a day or two before we were to arrive in HNL. Our original hotel (Royal Hawaiian) was part of the strike and the availability surrounding Thanksgiving was sorely limited. There are so many things wrong with this hotel that I think the only way to address the problems in a concise manner is to use bullets. We were also charged a $25/night "resort fee" which to the best of knowledge paid for fruity tap water in the lobby and nothing else. This hotel is so far from a resort it is comical they can even legally charge that. it should be fraud.1. The actual hotel and the photos online are shockingly different. a. The lobby is totally renovated but nothing else is as far as I could tell. b. The pool is laughingly small.c. The "balcony" they boast for each room is only large enough to fit a single plastic chair.d. There is no "view" at this hotel. It is right in the middle of Waikiki and buildings and trash and smells. You can sort of see part of a mountain, if you squint.2. The hotel is not only not remodeled but it is in disrepair. a. The carpet in the rooms was threadbare. b. The bedding was scratchy and dingy.c. The towels were terrible,d. The toiletries were what I think they probably sell in prison commissaries.e. Barely any furnishings in the room.f. Elevator is the slowest thing possible. g. The AC in the hotel and the rooms basically do not work at all to the point that they have large commercial fans in the lobby. Not an ideal situation. I was sticky and cranky the entire time we stayed here. 3. Smells! a. Our room smelled old and moldy except when we dared to open the door and the food smells from the fast food Asian restaurants below overpowered the mold smell. 4. Sounds! a. Absolutely no sound proofing in this hotel. In room you can hear every word being said in the hallway. Every siren and loud motorcycle on the street (even 14 floors up).5. The staff! Whew, they were a real treat... NOTa. No offer of assistance with bagsb. No attempt made to greet guests exiting or returning to the hotelc. No interaction with guests at all unless forced (that I could tell)d. My husband locked his wallet in our room with his key and ID and they refused to open the door to allow him in. He had to call me to return from the shops and wait for half an hour to be allowed in.e. When we were checking out we needed to have them hold our bags for an hour or so. It was a complete and utter clusterf^&*. The gentleman working ignored us for close to 10 minutes. Then just advised we leave the bags sitting in the floor without any confirmation of the hotel taking responsibility for them. When he asked what time we planned to return he advised that was a really inconvenient time for the hotel... so we showed up early and the entire lobby was empty. He was arranging hats on the wall and ignored me again for close to 15 minutes. I have never been treated so poorly. All this is to say if you have any choice at all please do not choose Shoreline Hotel Waikiki.

They said that a welcome basket is provided with a 2 night or more stay. Got in the room & there was no welcome basket anywhere. Staff was friendly. And experience there was good. Near the Waikiki strip and walking distance to the beach. Very convenient.

It was cute and comfy. We spent a lot of time out exploring Waikiki, but we had a good night’s sleep and we enjoyed the complimentary snacks! We had a lanai facing the street and it was nice looking out over the city.

Located in the heart of Honolulu is this lovely quaint hotel, renovated in bright funky colours; quite alluring. Rooms are average & service is fine. The pool is ok, although we preferred the beach. However, don’t take tips from reception, you’ll do better making your own decisions. Certainly don’t prepay for ‘breakfast included’ as you’ll only have 4 basic choices daily & miss out on a broader range.

We absolutely Love this Hotel!!! Perfect Location, ambiance, and comfort!!!!!The employees are so welcoming and helpful!! Naoki is a true gem and an outstanding asset to the hotel!!! Will only be staying here when we are island hopping from our home on Maui!!!!

Very cool place to stay, the location and room was great, and the service was fantastic! The 24 hour front desk is super convienint if you are arriving or leaving in the dark hours of the night/morning. A big shout out to Naoki for making our experience special and looking after us! Look forward to staying again in the future.

Stay with my family for 4 days and Naoki at the front desk gave us the best customer service also provided us a free upgrade to a king bed little ocean view, my family love the neon colors very eclectic and will stay here again next year.

The location of this hotel is prime - you're within walking distance to many restaurants and bars, shopping and the beach. The hotel itself has been renovated and has fantastic colour and character - taking a modern twist to tropical Hawaii. The staff were super helpful and friendly. Shout out to Naoki for taking care of us during our stay!

We had a scheduled tour of Oahu at 7am so we had to pick a hotel at the central district. Shoreline Hotel was near everything. It was really accessible. Honestly, the hotel is too colorful for me, but hey we're in Hawaii, it should be colorful. Thanks for a great service!

This was our fourth time at the hotel, and it continues to provide great value. The location is central Waikiki, walking distance to most everything. The staff are great, really trying to be helpful. Not much of a "renovation", the rooms are very similar to before, although the TV's have been upgraded. But who wants to watch TV when you're in Hawaii? Clean and comfortable, recommended.

A new colorful hotel lies within Waikiki! Technically, it’s not a new hotel but a redesign of the Shoreline Waikiki. Say aloha to the very first neon themed hotel in Honolulu, Hawaii. From morning to night, Shoreline is filled with colors vibrating radiant energy throughout the property. From our last stay in 2015, Shoreline Waikiki Hotel re-branded themselves and are now known as the most colorful hotel in Hawaii. A total mix of #NatureMeetsNeon!The colorful entrance at Shoreline Waikiki is very welcoming with its colorful ombre wall and lounge chairs. Once you’re inside the hotel, there is a lot to see in the neon tropical lobby – retail stand with local makers and authentic Hawaiian brands, paper mache birds, leaf installations, and a beverage station filled with coffee, tea, and fruit-infused waters!Parking: Shoreline Waikiki offers a secured underground valet parking for hotel guests for $30 daily or $10 if you’re dining at “Heavenly” restaurant located right next door.We stayed in a Junior Suite room, located on the 13th floor (just a floor below the rooftop pool). Each room comes with a welcome package filled with Hawaiian snacks, beverages, and a Hawaiian kukui nut lei necklace. Our room had a comfy king bed, lounge area with sofa, chairs, and table, small lanai (balcony), work desk, mini-fridge with two water bottles inside, local coffee and tea, water kettle, and a flat-screen TV. Drinks in the room are replenished daily​!Shoreline Waikiki Hotel offers amazing service such as:Same-day luggage storageFREE Laundry/dry cleaning serviceComplimentary beach accessories (towels and chairs)Complimentary local newspaper with USA Today insertComplimentary lobby refreshments: local coffee, assorted teas, fruit-infused water and applesBell serviceComplimentary Wi-Fi100% Non-smoking hotelWe had an incredible stay at this modern and stylish Waikiki beach boutique hotel! With a picturesque decor at every corner, we couldn’t help but take photos of everything! It’s definitely a fun stay for everyone that love colors. Just being Shoreline Waikiki hotel gives off such a happy feeling!

so pleased i picked this colourful hotel to stay in whilst in waikiki. neon lighting at night. organic delicious food at their restaurant, heavenly, reasonably priced, bright and uplifting, helpful staff, clean and inviting rooms.extremely short walk to everything..

I came to Shoreline Hotel late night, tired ready to check in and rest as I booked my room hours before. I was reluctant to be helped by Naoki at the front desk. Who made me feel welcomed and made my check in a breeze. Because of him I will be coming back to stay at Shoreline on my next stay

The Shoreline do not disappoint here with my family Last week and everything that we ask has been done NAOKI gives the best recommendation,service, and accommodations.My wife love this hotel we will come again next year

We stayed overnight at the Shoreline when our flight was cancelled last minute. The reservation was simple and straightforward, and when we arrived Naoki at reception upgraded us and gave us some friendly advice about getting out and about in Waikiki. Loved the unique neon theme and decor throughout the hotel. The hotel is also conveniently located near Heavenly Island Lifestyle cafe, and a short walk to the main strip of Waikiki shops and restaurants. All round a great experience.

Shoreline hotel was in a great location. One block away from the beach and in the medium of great restaurants. Staff were super friendly and helpful. Our room was ready when we arrived but asked us to check our another room which was an upgrade. The room was on the street side on the 7th floor. Our room was compact, tv, fridge, a jug for tea and coffee. Bottled water daily. The bathroom was clean with a good supply of towels daily, Shower over the bath. The hotel had freshly made flavour waters. One night we came back from shopping and there were mock cocktails and canapes. The pool was on the roof with loungers and great views of the city. The is hotel has a very funky vibe. If you are looking for something a bit different this is the place.

Staff was very friendly, hotel is nice but our room was very small. We were there for a Birthday & Anniversary celebration and they really went above and beyond to making our stay special. Shoreline is conveniently located, walking distance to everything from the beach, dining, shopping & night life! In the six days that we stayed here, we ate at the restaurant downstairs and was very happy with all our meals, if you love a Bloody Mary, it's a must have there!

Have stayed at Shoreline Hotel two years running. Its a lovely boutique Hotel right in the center of Waikiki. Love the trendy very colorful foyer - so welcoming, with complimentary coffee and fresh water.Rooms are fresh and clean. Last year we enjoyed the restaurant next door, this year I shopped all around the area. Hotel is value for money and fresher than some of the big hotels that are becoming tired.

Called and spoke to Naoki who went above and beyond all expectations for helping me surprise my friends staying at the hotel for their anniversary! Excellent customer service! I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a getaway!

Friendly staff, comfortable lodgings, central location, and accommodating to guests needs! Early check-in, valet parking, kind staff. Affordable option with all the essentials with no unnecessary fluff bumping up the price. Would definitely stay here again!

Our room was quaint and comfy and clean. So unique with neon lighting, bright and cheery.Front desk staff was very helpful. (Naoki gets two thumbs up for his customer service)Rooftop pool was awesome!Love the lobby refreshments

Loved my stay at Shoreline, check in was quick and super easy. The new renovations look great. I really loved the activities that the hotel offered and enjoyed the free popcorn and snow cones from 3-4 pm! I will be back soon!!

Seems like they invested all their money in the lobby. The lobby looks amazing. And definitely got the boutique look. But then... The room wasn’t what I expected at all. It was more like a 2 star room. Not clean; bed not comfortable at all, result of terrible back pain. The bathroom is outdated, really needs renovation!

The staff at Shoreline are professional, but more important assist guests on vacation r business with the spirit of ALOHA .. Josh, Venus, Sonny and Edean are the best and always ion their game .. Let me also say House keeping knows how to treat guest's regardless of their busy and tedious job .. Mahalo nui loa !!! James KIMO Doiron

Our room was reasonably priced and clean. The staff was courteous and helpful. The hotel is an easy walk to the beach. We had the opportunity to participate in a painting class event at the hotel and we enjoyed that.

We had a fabulous time at the Shoreline Hotel. Fantastic location with a lovely relaxed vibe. Lovely fun decor that really made you feel like you were on holiday. Super friendly staff and Naoki especially was outstanding, he went above and beyond to help us with anything and everything and always with his fabulous cheeky smile. We will be back for sure and won't hesitate to contact Naoki and the team to book in at the Shoreline for another fabulous, fun-filled & relaxing holiday - which hopefully won't be too far away! C & R from NZ :-)

This is my second trip to Oahu this year and was excited to come back again and to be staying at the Shoreline. However, it turned out to be quite disappointing. The refresh look is very bright and popping and definitely as some would say...instagram worthy. The staff were very nice. The part that was disappointing was the room itself. It was smaller than I expected and the worst part for me overall was the bathroom. There was mold behind the toilet and the toilet ran all day and night....it just felt dirty. The door to the balcony was hard to open...kept on getting stuck. I checked out early and moved to another hotel for my remaining stay even though it meant that I was not getting any refunds....I just couldn’t stay there any longer.

7 of us stayed here for 6 nights we appreciate all the great services given to us specially to NAOKI. Also housekeeping people were very friendly Will surely come back here with a group of family sometime next year. I will totally recommend to my friends staying here because this place is so close everything. Thank you.

Naoki at the front desk makes check in a breeze and he's knowledgeable about things to do in town. Hip vibe with the service to match! Great local dining and shopping a stone throw away - Room was ice cold too.

we had a great time at shoreline hotel everything is within easy reach the staff were very helpful would recommend this hotel not far from the beach and Ross department store right across the road any problems and they have some one on it right away

Hotel is very good , well located and well managed. I have a very good experience with service. I wish to thank especially Mr. Naoki. He is a very good concierge, and a very friendly, and professional person . WELL DONE.

What a little gem this place is! In the heart of Waikiki, but quiet and good value for money. Funky fit out and thoughtful touches: free cool drinks and coffee in the lobby, free beach towels, welcome package in our room. Superbly comfortable bed, lovely thick bath towels. Friendly staff. Great café right next door. What’s not to like about this place?

My stay was flawless. I travel to Honolulu every 4 to 6 weeks and decided to stay at the Shoreline. I was not disappointed. Naoki and Josh at the front desk as well as the entire team exuded a feeling of ohana! Will visit again

So pleased we chose this little gem, out the door and right into the heart of Waikiki. We loved that they had fresh fruity water available in the foyer at any given time. Their salty and sweet afternoons were always a treat. They gave you earplugs in the room and that was a god send as we had top billing with just the best view but noisy units on the ceiling.....who cares, we were too tired after exploring to worry about it. The staff were very courteous and always greeted us when leaving or arriving. The best recommendation is "would you stay there again"?.....yes.

What an amazing hotel,this hotel is staffed by real people who care.......In particular Naoki,this man not only remembers your first and second name(which is not easy,Naoki is always smiling and never to busy to assist and ask how is your stay.The rooms as promised are very clean and the king size bed is very comfortable.This hotel was recently refurbished and congratulations on a job well done.Dont waste your time and money on nearby “Named” hotels,trust me I just checked out of one to come here after extending my stay.Excellent value combined with REAL staff that care.....keep up the great work team,I will be telling many to stay here for sure.see you next time.Thanks again Naoki for your unique service you provide 10/10 again for you!

Me and my family chose this hotel because of the location and the price was very affordable for 4 people, Arrived in the morning and got to our roomAlmost immediately Naoki and Josh was very helpful and very accommodating to our needs.The best part was the goodies in the rooms pink and yellow kukui nut necklaces. Very close to everything and had an amazing time we will definitely comeback next year.

The shoreline has recently been very tastefully retro refitted. Everything was clean and comfortable. All the staff were amazing and extremely helpful.They had random activities all the time like yoga, nibbles and drink evenings etc.A block back from the beach in the centre of Waikiki and an amazing cafe/restaurant co-joined.We would defiantly stay there again. ;)

Very pleased with the rooms and ambience. Modern, bright and cheerful decoration. Very helpful staff, particularly Naomi in reception.Well located, only a short distance from shopping and the beach. Plenty of choice of restaurants close by

Stayed here for four nights and the hotel was perfect. Very nice, clean room with two bottles of water provided daily. Coffee,Tea and iced water provided in the lobby which was very nice. The rooms were very clean and housekeeping was excellent. The location was exceptional and right in the middle of everything. A word of warning for those of you who have a wife that likes shopping, there is a Ross Dress For Less directly opposite the hotel. Highly recommend this hotel and there are no 'Resort Fees'.

9pm and just checked into my hotel. Naoki was very helpful with my check in being it was my first time here. Love the atmosphere and the lights that makes the hotel stand out. I would definitely would stay here again

My night started with looking for a place to stay on my smart phone that had value and was in a desirable location. After weeding out other hotels found the Shoreline. My first conversation with reception was over the cellular. The reservationist was clear, accommodating, and helpful. I was impressed with the hotel because the price was as advertised without lots of misleading fees. The entire staff was helpful and it was obvious the enjoyed their work and the environment. TJ and the entire staff make what this quaint, hip, wonderful, dreamy boutique Hotel what it is. The hotel is located in a great place. It is a short walk to Waikiki beach, entertainment, the BlueNote and in the middle of what I could only describe as Magic. Thank you for an amazing stay.

I Just want to thank you Josh and Naoki for making our stay at the shoreline one of the best stay and giving us recommendations to restaurants around.Me and my wife call both of you dynamic duo thanks
user_name:
jason312018
New York City, New York

review_body: Shoreline was definitely one of the best hotel me and my girlfriend have ever stayed, Service was amazing and with all the free gift baskets and lobby drinks. Special thanks to Naoki he help us from top to bottom excellent customer service. I truly recommend this hotel.

Very clean hotel, friendly staff, and quiet!! Centrally located walking distance to the beach,cute restaurant attached to the hotel good food nice staff.Would recommend this hotel for any length of stay.

Very impressed with the Shoreline. I visit Honolulu at least every five to six weeks on business and retirement planning. Have stayed at the Hilton, Halekulani and the Westin. Decided to try out the Shoreline and was impressed beyond expectations. A Welcome basket of snacks such as chips, macadamia notes, soft drinks and kukui beads awaited me. The hotel is spotless.Twice a week there is evening entertainment and various activities at other times. Coffee available in lobby 24/7.Excellent wifi. Small pool and deck but for my purposes located right where I need a hotel to be. The staff is amazing each and every person gives you the feeling of aloha. Naoki, reviewed here many times is an exceptional and professional representative and deserves all the credit and praise he receives. His colleagues are also amazing. This hotel will not disappoint. Having been born and raised in Manhattan and having the blessings to have travelled the world, the ShorelineIs up there and will be on my list to stay when I return. Congrats to the owners and to the staff for creating a spectacular environment of aloha!

Our room was spotlessly clean and kept this way for the 3 days we were there. Location is right in the heart of Waikiki so close to shops and great restaurants. Right next door is the Heavenly Cafe which is wonderful for breakfast, lunch and/or dinner too. Quick service and great food. Loved all the colourful decor in this Hotel. Staff very friendly and helpful. Thanks to Venus, Terence, Naoki, Josh and Edean for advice and help in enjoying our stay with you in Waikiki.

Great hotel with great staff. Any concerns were handled right away and the rooms are good. I had a couple of special requests due to being there for a wedding and they had no problem accommodating. Definitely a fun and vibrant hotel.

My hubby and I did a staycation, which we rarely do because of the prices for kamaina are ridiculously expensive. SHORELINE Waikiki was very affordable, staff were great and the hotel is very modern. We had a relaxing weekend and I would definitely stay at this hotel again

a friendly place to stay . close to all amenities, beach , shops , eating places.only one thing was discerning was the air conditioning so loud..one did not get a good sleep although ear plugs were provided it still was uncomfortable. very good having and eatery close by for breakfast when one was flying out early in the morning.. We found the staff were very pleasant and helpful. The bed was comfortable which is so very important when one is away from their home. We enjoyed the modern color of the Hotel interior. It was a very enjoyable stay, the day we were staying there was a Flower Festival being held fantastic floats of all kinds and the Princess from all the Islands had their own horses and fellow followers , wonderful to see, we were so lucky. only a step from the main street. The proximity of the location of The Shore line Hotel is greats

This place is obviously targeted to a younger audience looking for the perfect place to take pictures worthy for social media. This hotel is terribly understaffed...so you know what that means??? A lot of WAITING. The whole reason I chose to book here was because of the new hip & modern facelift that's been advertised throughout social media.This place may look like a great place to capture pictures, but If you are looking for excellent guest services...look elsewhere! The level of guest service here is extremely terrible. Never have I experienced such poor guest services until I stayed here for my friend's wedding during the weekend of September 7th-9th.When I arrived to the small cramped Valet parking lot, I was not once welcomed or greeted at all. Never once offered any assistance. That is truly NOT a great first impression upon arrival, or a great welcoming to arriving guests. Only ONE person working Valet, and he must've been having a bad day...or clearly HATES doing his job. It's obvious, and shows in the mannerisms and facial expressions he displayed.The front desk agent who checked me in was probably the ONLY excellent service I encountered while staying here. Upon check in, the lobby was crowded, and there was a line of guests waiting. Only 2 agents working at the time. I appreciated the fact that the gentleman who checked me in was able to get me a ready room before the standard check in time.During my second day at the resort, I came down to Valet to get my parked vehicle. This is where everything went downhill. Once again, it seemed the male working at Valet was not having a great day. After handing him my Valet ticket, he handed me my own keys and made me move my own vehicle just so he could move cars blocking mine. When do Valet make a guest move their own vehicle? The parking lot is already extremely tight & small to begin with, and I'm stuck moving own vehicle because this place is understaffed with only ONE person working!? Unbelievable! This resulted in me damaging my own vehicle. Even after my car was damaged, Valet did ABSOLUTELY NOTHING to assist.SAFETY at this hotel seems to be the least of their concern here. Safety should be the FIRST priority to guests! Valet parks your car under a tent held down by bricks. Per management Jordan, I was told these bricks are "safe" and are used to secure the tent, and are also used for guest activities. Really? Not ONCE throughout my stay did I see any guest activities happening under the tent they park cars under. They don't realize that these bricks can potentially hurt or trip guests, or WORST...damage your vehicle! Besides Valet, the pool area is also dangerous. Don't let the pretty pictures of the floral mural fool you! The metal steps to enter the deep end of the pool is extremely loose, and sounds like it will fall off when you are entering. Communication with management is extremely poor here. They seem to take pride in avoiding & dodging their guests. Nobody knows what to do in tough situations. All the managers I have spoken to (Chris & Jordan) NEVER have a transparent answer for my issues. After the incident that happened to my vehicle, there was no compassion or sympathy from anyone I spoke with. No compensation or even a formal apology was given. Management seems to always be busy & NEVER available when I would reach out to them. They lack following up with you in a timely manner, and only respond via email when it's most convenient for them.. I would ALWAYS be the one to reach out to them for a follow up. NOBODY reached out to me as I requested. As a guest, I felt like all fingers were being pointed at me for their poor guest service. I still have yet to hear from the General Manager Alvida who I requested to speak with. Still no follow up..still WAITING!Overall, may this review be a lesson to those looking to stay here. Will I ever stay here again? Absolutely NOT!

Obviously an older hotel but they have done a great job of freshening it up with a very funky vibe. Staff were very helpful, especially when we were looking to check in a couple of hours early. The room was comfortable and the complimentary snacks were awesome. Location is fabulous, we were able to walk everywhere we needed to go. Would definitely return.

This hotel located in a nice position that close to the beach. The receptionists were very nice and always helpful. They provided free fruit water drink in the lobby, although the weather is hot, can still get cold drinks. The valet parking is quite expensive, it is useful fo person who is hard to find a parking lot. One day Jealon was very nice that showed me some useful parking skills.

The hotel is smack in the middle of everything and the customer service is phenomenal! Naoki was a huge help. He took the time out and answered all of my questions and made us feel at home. I would stay here again.

I had a great time at the Shoreline. The decor was so hip and bright, the staff were extremely helpful, checking out beach towels, calling for a cab, and always being cheerful. The activities were interesting, and it was a comfortable room. I would definitely come back here again!

This Hotel is a disappointment. The lobby looks very nice and modern but the rooms are like a medicore Motel on an old Highway. We had black mold in our bathroom. The bold thing is the extra prices they charge you. First, there is the resort fee of 25$/day which our front desk guy described includes "free" beverages in our mini bar. Which are 2 mini bottles of water (100ml each) and nothing more. Also, it should include beach umbrellas and chairs which were not available on any day we ask and we needed to rent them on the beach again for a whopping 25$/2hours. Then there is the parking fee of 30$/day even for guests. So if you think going here be aware of the extra fees they charge you which includes nothing but disappointment.

We found this hotel on the net after a last minute change in plans left us without a place to stay for two nights. Very well located. Close to the beach and main shopping strip. The price was right for the location and they provided valet parking as well, which was essential for us. The foyer was the brightest we have ever seen and the accent on colour and fun carried through to the room. We didn't try the cafe but there are food courts nearby.

The Shoreline Hotel is in a great position- close to beach, shops, and restaurants. The Hotel is clean and staff friendly. The cafe adjacent to it is a great place for a meal or drink. Rooms are small but clean and well appointed.

This place is awesome close to all restaurants and takeaways - short walk to the beach and central for bus to luau, and other activities NAOKI -checked us in this guy was amazing nothing was too much trouble knowledgeable and great customer service

This boutique hotel was cute and conveniently located in Waikiki. The view wasn’t as great but for the price we paid, we were fine with it. They offered complimentary water and snacks in the room and in the lobby. We got a complimentary king bed upgrade so that they could accommodate us on the same floor as our friends! Staff was friendly and insightful with hikes and recommendations!

Where neon meets nature. Vibrant, bustling location. You couldn't ask for a better location. Right in the center of Waikiki with access to everything. A quick walk to the Royal Hawaiian to take in the exquisite vistas of Diamond Head. Around the corner from the International Market Place and so many restaurants to choose from, this newly renovated property won't disappoint. The decor is vibrant and fresh. You'll find unexpected colors clashing in palette providing a paradise for the eyes. Creative touches also add whimsy. One drawback was the pool area. There is no elevator to the pool and you had to walk up a couple flights of stairs...and it was incredibly hot with no shade provided. However, this was not a deal breaker and had a great stay anyway.

All we needed for a short stay in central Waikiki. Really helpful staff..loved the refreshments in the lobby. Easy walk to the beach. Nice pool on the roof for a quick cool down. Very accommodating when our family visited for the day.

A great option if your transiting through Waikiki for a few nights. A 10 minute walk to the beach but in the heart of all the bustle of Waikiki. The funky decor makes for a fun stay although underneath the hotel rooms are a bit dated. There is a great restaurant that shares the same building and is a good solution for all meals.

This is a great little hotel smack dab in the center of Waikiki, 3 blocks from the beach, and near all the action. Considering this is a small property without many amenities, they did an excellent job on the remodel and design, incorporating fantastic lighting, murals, and furnishings throughout all the public spaces. Rooms are decent size, everything is clean, and the staff is wonderful (thanks to Naoki for the special help). We live in Maui and try to visit Honolulu 2 - 3 times a year, and this is definitely on our list. Great value.

After a long travel day, we arrived very late night and the Shoreline hotel was certainly a sight for sore eyes! Naoki checked us in and his suggestions really helped enhance our stay. Naoki recommended places to eat, activities and most importantly - the easiest car rental option, which is located right across the street, so if you're renting a car for just a day or portion of your stay, I would check with the front desk because they partner with ABC rentals to offer a small discount. The beautiful, newly designed lobby does NOT get old - the way the ambiance changes from day/night was really special...it almost doesn't feel like the same hotel. The Shoreline hotel is also nestled in a very convenient location, just down the street from anything you could possibly need. We chose not to frequent the nearby tourist beaches, although it is just a short walk. We used the valet, which was actually relatively quick and easy for such a small/tight space. Rooms were quirky - good amount of space and beds were comfortable. The hotel staff happily accommodated all of our needs and I would definitely recommend!

For our first trip to Hawaii, we were impressed by the Shoreline. From the moment we walked in, Naoki at front desk had a huge smile and made us laugh. He was also very accommodating to our requests. The hotel is in a great location and is a 5 min walk to the beach! The Shoreline and room was very clean, no issues at all! Awesome decor and colours throughout!We also loved the fresh *real fruit* flavoured water in the lobby. Will definitely come again! Thank you!

The hotel staff were very friendly, we arrived mid morning not expecting to be able to check in. Our bags were kept for us and taken to our room once available, leaving us to go off and explore. The hotel is well located for the shops, restaurants and beach.The room was a fairly good size with everything we needed, free safe, iron & board, mini fridge and something you don’t see a lot of in the USA, a kettle, great for us English tea drinkers! The bed was comfortable but the mattress does sit on a bigger bed frame and we both banged our legs on the corner of that a few times! Not sure if the balcony adds anything as very small with only one chair! The hotel website states all rooms have a welcome pack of local treats, this is only when booked direct, if you book via a travel agent you don’t get this and the free bottles of water they say you get every day only happened twice for us.The hotel puts out cold fresh fruit infused water in the lobby and pots of coffee.

We’ve just had a great 6 night stay at the shoreline in Waikiki. The hotel had everything we needed for a comfortable stay. We messaged in advance as the other couples wedding anniversary fell while we were staying, the hotel said they would sort something and put a bottle of champagne in their room- a very generous gesture. TJ was their to greet us when we arrived and Naoki was working the majority of the time we stayed, along with all the staff - very polite and courteous people. A smile and good manners always go a very long way!!! We owe a thanks to Naoki for arranging a dinner reservation on our last night for the 4 of us. It’s just a shame we couldn’t stay longer!!

Great location and rate! Pleasantly surprised at the "welcome basket" provided... very nice touch not found anywhere else! Love the art deco meets tropical meets South beach Miami vibe/decor! Loved it!

Needed to find a hotel room for one night at spur of the moment. Everything was already booked & wasn’t really wanting to be in Waikiki but was pleasantly surprised at how wonderfully located this hotel was & reasonably priced. Had a clean & comfortable room (yes, small). enjoyed the lobby area with the tea/coffee/water etc AND the very amazing organic cafe next door called “Heavenly”!!!! Loved eating meals there.

Very nice place for family . Cute design and lovely staff. Good location near the hotel . Property good and pool very sympathic. Quiet room and a lot of suprise there. We hope we can come back again very soon !

This hotel is very well located in heart of Waikiki and clean rooms. Beach accessories were provided and the welcome pack was a very nice touch on arriving from a long hall flight. Staff very helpful and would stay again.

Great location, very close to beach, shopping and heaps of restaurants. The decor is funky and the amenities such as water, tea and coffee in the lobby are a nice touch. Due to international housekeeping week our room only had a light service for two of our five nights, which meant that water bottles and tea etc were not replenished, which was a little disappointing but not too much of an inconvenience. We also did not receive the welcome pack promised on the website. Our room was right next to the elevator and so we had some noise from that, but we got used to it after the first night. We did not use the rooftop pool or the beach chairs but good to have them available.

The hotel was perfectly located for our stay. We liked the quirky nature of the hotel, and would definitely both recommend it to friends, as well as stay there again.The bed was not very comfortable, this took some gloss off our stay.

We stayed at shoreline as the second part of our honeymoon. It was a great option for accommodation in Waikiki and was much better value than the beach front properties. We were only a 5 minute walk to the beach and in the middle of Waikiki so we could walk everywhere. The stab were also very helpful! We were able to get beach towels, beach chairs and umbrellas from the front desk when needed and even free snacks in the room! Loved it!

Well the staff are top notch and couldn’t have been more friendly. They are great. But the hotel has undergone a “facelift” of sorts. By that I mean gone are the white, timber, green refreshing beach vibe colors and feel. Instead replaced with the most bizarrely clashing color scheme I have ever seen. While the pool area needed the update. The rest of the hotel looks like a scene out of a Steven King film. All you need is the twins standing at the end of your hallway. My 2 stars are for the staff and the pool. Beyond that it’s not the place we first stayed in 3 years ago. The work also seems to have been done in a hurry and the outside paint work is already bubbling and peeling. My first review for this hotel as 5 stars now it’s 2.

We stayed three nights at Shoreline. I’ll start with the pros:Conveniently located to Waikiki Beach and all the shops and restaurants in Waikiki. Our room on the 7th floor though next to the lift was quiet. ( Music from outside venues stopped at 9pm during the week) The bed was comfy and there was a range of pillows to suit our needs. Wifi is good and the room very clean.Cons: There was no microwave or coffee machine as advertised. Other than two teacups there are no other implements including cutlery or plates etc in the room.There is no tour assistance at the hotel. We asked for a bus timetable and were told the wrong bus and that the buses leave hourly”! But when ??? We did our own research and found a app for the local bus timetable. We were incredibly frustrated with the early check in process. Our plane arrived at 5am after a long o’night flight. We tried to book early check in but were told it could not be guaranteed. We arrived at 5.45 am to be told no rooms available but come back at 3pm. The reception staff member was incredibly flippant and did not give us any options. It was obvious we were an imposition to him. Desperate to have a nap, we decided to try the hotel again at 9.30am and immediately were given a room. We we were thankful to the staff on reception this time. Hard to understand how we could not have been told this earlier.This hotel is fine if you only want the basic facilities.

This 3 star hotel is very well located to everything you need in Waikiki! A small boutique style hotel recently refurbished is cute and welcoming. It's literally only a 5 minute walk to the beach, and only a minute to the main shopping and walking strip of Waikiki. Very safe location indeed. It is Across the road from Ross and literally around the corner from The Rack. Newly refurbished rooms are a good size. Rooms have a very small balcony but not an attracting feature. Would recommend rooms on higher floors as lower ones have views of next door offices/suites but then again who would spend any time in their room when they are in such a beautiful part of the world. Bathroom is clean and a good size as are the rooms. Bed is very comfortable as are the pillows. The staff are amazing!! What can I say...... friendly and extremely helpful with every question you have. TJ, Courtney, Christopher and other staff (names I can't recall I'm so sorry) will do their very best to make your stay a great one. Always welcoming and very friendly indeed as they show their Hawaiian hospitality. Would certainly stay again!!

Overall, the hotel was a great place to stay at that was located centrally within Waikiki near shops and restaurants. The price was reasonable given the location, and the hotel was nicely redone, offering a more modern and chic design that was trendy and youthful.

Not likely, but I will say the location is great/perfect. Lots of great food and shopping nearby. The decor is cute that’s what attracted us to the hotel. But did not live up to expectations. Lobby and halls need air condition. Elevators feel castraphobic. Bed wasn’t very comfy. Pool is a bit small. Staff is nice though. Parking was interesting.

Shoreline hotel is minutes away from the beach and has an instagram worthy aesthetic.
