The staff is wonderful and there's always something going on at the hotel in the afternoons - be sure to check their schedule for events. The view from the lanais are breathtaking and the rooftop pool is really amazing! It's close to everything and was a perfect place to stay during my brief trip to Honolulu.

I have grown quite fond of staying at Shoreline Hotel Waikiki. While I weather out Hurricane Lane, luckily Heavenly Restaurant was OPEN (which is right or attached to the hotel). Majority ALL of the Stores were CLOSED. I was able to walk to CVS Store about 1 to 2 blocks away. Surprisingly it was OPENED. Maybe due to medication prescription, for the visitors. I would HATE to be away from HOME & NOT have any medication on hand. I guess it would be fortunate if there were alot of hotels with GAS Stoves, on hand, to feed the masses.

This is a great 3 star hotel just around the corner from all the fancy five star resorts that cost 3 times as much. Every staff member was a delight and they do fun activities for free like shaved ice hour or hula/yoga classes. Apparently the pool isn't very good, I couldn't say since the beach is just a few minutes walk away. If you get up early, it's much nicer and less crowded. I enjoyed Island Vintage Coffee in the Royal Hawaiian Centre for breakfast (again, get in early - like 7:30). They also have free hula classes there. Dukes is right on the beach and although the food wasn't fancy, it was good value for $18 for breakfast. I appreciated the free coffee and water in the hotel lobby and the very generous free snack box in your room. And they don't even charge a resort fee. The room is perfectly adequate and was very clean. I would only day that I would love some firmer pillows and the air con was reasonably noisy. Didn't really bother me. I'm sure none of the rooms have a 5 star view but room 2012 didn't look into anyone else. Overall, really good value, I would stay again.

Soreline hotel is very good!It is clean and colorful .Location is good and convenient.Good cafe and convenience store are next.It's a little noisy in the evening, but it isn't to the extent I'm interested.It's recommended very much.I'd like to go.

Staff were all friendly and help full.However, our room No 927 was very noisy at all times due to its location near the hotels main air- conditioning equipment. If I were to stay again I would definitely not accept this or any other 9th floor room.

Pleasantly surprised by the service and friendliness of this comfortable hotel which is close to all the action, a great little cafe for breakkie next door . The staff were so helpful when the hurricane was looming. We loved getting a fresh drink when we came back from our day and our welcome pack . Thank you Shoreline we would definitely recommend you. Great value for money

The hotel si located in a very good position full of nice shops and restaurant and the beach is very close. All staff is very kind and professional. Our room was very confortable and clean. Very good !

Surprised my son for his 9th birthday for a mini getaway...something that was on his wish list and he was definitely surprised and most of all, super excited. My little family and I enjoyed every second of the 3 nights and 4 days we stayed at that hotel. Everything about was just too cute. The vibrant colors of the hotel are so beautiful and the decor are even cuter. The pool on the roof top was so relaxing and the staff was so very nice and helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel and will for sure, 100% be coming back again....and hopefully very soon =)

Air con was noisy. Room are small.Small pool on the top of the hotel, but not really nice furnished.Very expensive carpark (30$), but same extortionist price for all hotels around. And parking space not always available.

Great location and service at this hotel. The decor is bright and interesting and we had excellent service for the most part. Housekeeping was a little below standard - forgetting to replace towels and toilet paper on a couple of occasions. Otherwise we had a really good stay.

I was quite excited to stay here again. Dealing with a staff member from overseas can cause hesistancy. But I was well served over the phone. But when I got there the day of check-in it was a whole different story. I have heard great things about Naoki on the reviews, but to our disappointment this was not the case. We are thankful that we were able to check in a little earlier, but the service was very dismissive of us. Our toilet smelt like urine, even after asking for it to be cleaned again. Everyday walking through reception was uncomfortable. I will no be staying here again.

What a cute little place! I love the retro neon decor! The bed was comfy and the staff was very friendly and helpful. Easy walk to anywhere you want to go in Waikiki! Plus free drinks and snacks in your room waiting for you, which is nice. We flew over from the big island and had a very early arrival and despite being very busy they were able to accommodate us and get us checked in early which was very much appreciated. Can’t wait to stay again!

Chose this place because of the modern decor, loved the neon vibe, lobby and the neon touches throughout. The water, tea etc. in the lobby was a nice touch. The service was great, willing to help and very informational.Location was perfect being in the busy part of Waikiki & also opposite Ross, behind H&M etc. Loved they did their best with updating with new carpet, but the rooms and amenities were still older, we had a large A/C unit that was older and loud throughout the night, the bathroom had older units but they had updated the tiles by painting them, new shower curtains & cool towel holders to update it. It is a little misleading that the whole location and venue looks new, but has only been refurbished.

For the price I paid, I was very happy with the Shoreline. The location is great, the staff was very friendly, the restaurant is quaint and yummy. If you are looking for a resort with amenities, this is not the place for you (thus confused as to why there is a "resort" fee). I spent my time at the beach or at soccer games, therefore it was great for what I needed.

Hotel is nice if you only need a shower and a bed. Bathrooms are small, and rooms are smaller than typical rooms. Design has been updated, and staff i s always friendly. Valet parking is a little difficult at times as we had to wait more than 15 minutes at times for them to unblock our car underneath. Did not see any breakfast options, but had read about a grab-and-go option - we did not see this. You're in Hawaii, you shouldn't be in the room that much anyway.

Looks just like it does in the pictures, friendly staff, beautiful decor, close to the beach, in the heart of the shops and reasonabally priced. What more could you want? If I was gonna really nit-pick, the air conditioning unit was a little loud (I could have just turned it off). If that is the biggest problem you have with a hotel, then you know that it's a winner!

My husband and I stayed for just one night after getting in late after our flight from NC to Hawaii. Shoreline is a very cool, trendy decorated hotel, environmentally conscious and energy conservative. Lots of neon and welcoming atmosphere. The associates at the desk were always very friendly. The lobby has complimentary fruit infused water, and the room had complimentary snacks, drinks, and leis to take home. The room was adequate in size, nice, colorful updates that made the place feel new, very clean. Each room has a lanai, and considering the noise of Waikiki outside of the lanai's sliding glass door, the room was noiseless. We planned on just the one night stay but would definitely have stayed longer. The valet parking was great considering we got in late (+$30), and though we did not use this service, the hotel offers free daily use of beach towels and chairs. The hotel is less than 5 minute walk to Waikiki beach, and surrounded by Waikiki's shopping and restaurants. Absolutely walkable to everything. Also-you MUST visit Heavenly Island Lifestyle restaurant attached to the hotel, delicious breakfast!

My stay at Shoreline was wonderful. Being s design enthusiast, I was wowed by the decor and overall design of the hotel lobby and room. I was especially excited for the treats that were left in the room for . me to enjoy at my leisure. My room was always tidy after my return from site seeing in the city. I will be back for another stay and would highly recommend Shoreline to friends and family.

Had a blast staying at this hotel. This is one of the coolest hotel we've stayed so far. Decors are so hip and tasteful. Love the color schemes. Service was excellent. Clean and functional rooms. Location was perfect, close to shopping, restaurants and of course the beach. Highly recommended. Great value for money.

This hotel will not disappoint. Perfect location, friendly staff, very clean, nice atmosphere, comfortable rooms, hospitality off the charts!The desk Manager Chris Anderson and his Team are absolute professionals. The Aloha spirt is alive and well in this wonderful place to relax and unwind. Chris makes sure every detail is covered-- just can't explain how awesome the Shoreline is. My new favourite place to stay in Waikiki! You will love it!

My wife and I stayed here for two nights during a visit to Honolulu. This is a nice hotel with a very modern flavor. The room was adequate in every way and the bed was comfortable. The location is very close to the heart of Waikiki which depending on your preference is either a plus or a minus as traffic and parking are a challenge. The hotel does offer valet parking.

Nice amenities such as beach towels, beach chairs, flavored waters, teas, and coffees always readily available. Staff is pretty friendly overall and free welcome snacks upon arrival into your room. I would recommend due to convenience.

Fantastic location. Love the bright cheery nature of the hotel. Nice touches like ice cold infused water in the lobby 24/7. Very comfortable bed. Really enjoyed my stay here. They also provide beach chairs... Heavenly Restaurant also an added plus!

I stayed here from Sunday to Thursday, and it was one of the best stays I’ve had in a while.. NAOKI took care of me and he was amazing and kind.. Hotel is located on a good spot and mostly everything near it. (5-10 min walk) hotel rooms are well organized and clean and they give you a snack box and free water bottles :) I will definitely stay here everytime I come visit Honolulu!!!  Mahalo NAOKI and JOSH!! PS; they chocolate candy is so good!!

The bed was surprisingly very comfortable. The room was very clean and quiet. The outside view of the nearby apartment building was....the reason the hotel is cheaper ;) Fun atmosphere in the lobby. Close enough to the Waikiki strip, but good to be off the beaten path.

Nice location for a reasonable price. Clean rooms and helpful staff. Little noisy at evening because street entertainer next corner until 10pm. Offers no breakfast, was no problem for me. Car parking 30 $ extra charge.

Loved this hotel. It has recently been refurbished and it looks lovely with a bright neon theme. The hotel's lobby is very welcoming with plenty of room to sit and jugs of flavoured ice water available. The room is a goodd size with a fridge and welcoming goodies. There is a small balcony but we didn't have a good view. The location of the hotel is so convenient to the shops and beach and another bonus is the day trip busses pick up at the shop across the road. Visiting Waikiki was a trip of a lifetime for us , staying at this hotel made it even better.

Really enjoyed our stay in this lovely clean hotel close to the beach just five minutes away. Complimentary fruit infused water in reception much appreciated. So handy to lots of shops and restaurants too and an easy walk to pick up the rental car.

The hotel was clean and well looked after. All the staff there were more than happy to help from the front desk to the cleaners. For the price you pay it is great value and only a stones throw away from the beach and all the shops. Thanks Shoreline!

While the location of the hotel is awesome in the middle if Waikiki, the hotel is quite short of services on offer. Purchased a room with breakfast included & when we checked in, were not told about it. When querying it later, found it was for the restaurant next door & were issued vouchers. Went to it the following morning but the queue was far too long & we had to meet a tour bus. Went the next morning & were only offered 4 items to have which were pretty average. Eggs benedict were undercooked & was looked at funny for sending it back. After this we obtained a refund for all the vouchers. We also didnt have airconditioning in our room on the first night & when we mentioned it the next morning, we then found that we had to insert the room key! Another thing we werent told about! Pool on the roof top is fairly small with basically no view. Our room was also supposed to have a beach view & all we had was the back of the dirty apartment block behind us - dont believe all what is said on their website. Plus side I suppose was being clean & tidy with all the colours hopefully to brighten up your day
user_name:
Craig G
New Plymouth, Taranaki, New Zealand

review_body: Stayed for two weeks whilst on holiday. AMAZING location (close to shops, food, bus stops). Great vibe - hotel staff are so friendly, so helpful and professional. They chat with you and are hospitable. Venus (Front Desk) was particularly a standout as she was informative, smiles, is welcoming. Free fruit water (I loved the flavours) and coffee in the lobby. Cool chairs and relaxing area for when you want to sit and plan the day. There aren’t too many rooms so the hallways, lobby and lift is never busy or over crowded. I loved that about my stay. Pool is on the roof and slightly small, only 4/5 chairs. But really, I didn’t come in a holiday to sit beside a chlorine pool so that wasn’t an issue to me. In the night you can hear karaoke or something in the next building (wasn’t an issue for us though and wasn’t too loud). Definitely can hear people walking/talking up and down the hall. You can also hear people in the room next to you if they shout or speak loudly but luckily we had great neighbours. Reason I didn’t give a 5:-bed was too soft and pillows too soft that I couldn’t get a decent nights sleep- the white bedsheets (which are changed regularly, so no problems there) were stained in some places- towels smelt like bleach sometimes- smelt a bit like an old hotel (just a tad)

We enjoyed our short stay at the Shoreline. An eclectic boutique hotel perfectly positioned a stones throw from anything you’d need in Waikiki, yet far enough away from the “noise”. The service is excellent and the hotel is value for money.We loved our complimentary snacks & our dip in the pool & the shaved ice happy hour. Thank you Shoreline for the memorable experience.Family of 4.

I was there for a total of 2 nights and stayed in a (2) double bed room. There was plenty of amenities and complimentary snacks upon arrival. We were checked in by Naoki (works the afternoon to night shift) who was absolutely amazing. He provided excellent customer service along with recommendations of things to do in the area. If you plan on staying at this hotel, definitely look for Naoki for help. The room itself was a bit on the smaller size. The location is very idea as Waikiki beach is a couple minutes walk away. There is a Starbucks on the corner and numerous food courts within a 5 minute walk. Valet parking is a bit expensive but street parking is a hit or miss. If you are looking for a place to sleep and shower, this is your spot. If you are looking for some where to stay in the room all day, I wouldn't recommend this.

The hotel was in an excellent location and all the staff were very helpful, it was colourful and pleasing on a weary traveller. The room was pleasantly bright and clean and the generous complementary food items were a lovely gesture.

The hotel was centrally located. Awesome that a ROSS store is across the street and trams and buses behind the building. The hotel has potential to being a nice little hotel. The staff NEEDS training.

Great location and vibe. So vlise to the beach. Food at Hevenly is super super good, must try. Clean rooms and staff were so friendly. We spent an extra night as we loved it so much. Just to note, a great car rental is right behind the hotel called little car rental great people

I recently stayed at this hotel for my husbands 30th bday. Our flight arrived at 6am and even though we were unable to check in, we were able to leave our bags and were able to use bathrooms to freshen up. We also went back during the day to change clothes (coming from Australian winter to Hawaii, long pants were too hot) and they retrieved our bags and allowed us to change in their bathrooms and then stored our bags again. Check in was quick and the hotel was spotless and clean, modern and funky. All staff were beyond friendly and helpful. Our room was clean and the bed and sheets were comfortable. Was a conveninent location not only for access to Waikikis restaurants and shopping but for pick up by tour buses who had a pick up point directly across the road. Would highly recommend the Shoreline to all.

My husband and I want to thank Naoki at the front desk for booking us a honeymoon suite hotel when we were in desperate need to change hotels. Shoreline’s location is perfect for restaurant hunting and a close walk to the beach. Complimentary snacks for the honeymoon suite as well. We really enjoyed our time!

The hotel was in a very good position in Waikiki, minutes to the beach and shops and across the road from Ross Dress for Less. The beds and pillows were a little firm for us, but overall we had a great stay.

We absolutely loved our stay at the Shoreline in Waikiki. Our room was clean, spacious and the service was great. Special mention to Naoki who was super friendly and who went above and beyond to help us with a smooth check in, gave us suggestions for some restaurans and bars to visit and always greeted us with a smile at the lobby. Definitely will stay here on our next visit!

Easy online booking, responsive with a few questions prior to arriving. Such a refreshing lobby and reception. Really tired after an overnight flight from Sydney and absolutely delighted to manage an early checkin as a room was available. Thank you Naoki. Such a lovely start our holiday in Hawaii. Pool area is fun with views. Room has exactly what you need with some fun.

Great location and good hotel, it is close to the beach and the shopping and the rooms are a good space and very clean. Everybody made us feel welcome and were very helpful when arrived after a long flight.

Just perfect place to stay, close to the beach and shopping !!!Rooms are clean and spacious.If you have the chance to talk with Naoki at the front desk you will be in good hands very friendly and helpful, all the staff is friendly by the way.

Nice little budget hotel. Room was clean, Bobby was welcoming. Staff was very nice. The location is perfect, distance from everything we wanted to do. The roof top Pool is Very small and they only had four lounge chairs.We got 20% off of the room rate with our kamaaina discount, no resort fee and half off on the parking charge. I would stay here again.

Great hotel, good location and very friendly and helpful staff. Josh at reception checked us in after a long flight and day and couldn't be more friendly and welcoming. Very good value for money. Very nice room, fridge and coffee and Tea making facilities, WITHOUT the usual US resort fees, that don't give you that anyway. Hotel very colorful and bright. Also 24 hour coffee and fruit for free in the Lobby for extra convenience.

This was recently renovated and the decor is very bright in the public areas. The rooms are much more subdued. There were only steps up to the front door, the outside lift was not working to take large bags up to the front door. The staff were very friendly and service very good. Free wifi, a basket of free snacks in the room and a small refrigerator.It is very close to the main shopping mall in Waikiki and a restaurant next door. Beds were comfortable and everything was clean.

Loved this funky hotel. Everyone on the staff was warm and welcoming, especially Naoki! He gave us some great recommendations while we were there. Loved that you can borrow beach chairs for the day and the hotel is central to everything. Parking can get a bit pricey/difficult to find but that’s probably most of the downtown area. Would definitely stay again!

Not only was reception nice to walk into but the receptionist was extremely helpful. Rooms were great, pretty funky certainly a good change from the rest of the places id stayedi would stay there for sure next time i go back

We enjoyed our stay at the shoreline for a quick 2 night stop over in waikiki. this was the 2nd time we had stayed with Shoreline and they have had an update in design since our last stay. They checked us in early which was great, rooms were comfortable and well equipped. We got a complimentary snack tray with Hawaii food/drink treats in the room, location was accessible to popular Waikiki spots through walking, fresh water, tea and coffee always in the foyer and all facilities like the internet, tv, showers etc were in working order.

My family and I really enjoyed our stay here. We are a local family that have stayed in Waikiki and paid to stay at hotels like the Sheraton and the Hilton, but this hotel caught our eyes online when we were searching for affordable hotels. The Shoreline Hotel exceeded our expectations. The staff was very pleasant, the rooms were very nice and clean (loved the decor and the complimentary snacks!), and the location was right in the middle of Waikiki! It was perfect! We had a very nice staycation here and would definitely return!

We enjoyed one night at this central hotel only a short walk to the beach. We loved the bright, contemporary furnishings and rooftop pool with painted murals on the walls. We were able to leave our bags until check-in and enjoyed the complimentary drinks in the lobby plus generous snacks tray in the room, which made up for a twin room not being available for our 2 teen boys. There was some noise outside being a Friday night in the city centre but it didn't stop us getting to sleep. Great service and style and good value for money, we would come back.

The lobby area looks very neat and everybody here is very friendly. My special thanks goes to Naoki who made check in and check out process very smooth. He also provided helpful information around the area. This hotel also provides complementary snacks in the room, which is good but it would be better if they can instead replenish water bottles every day. I deduct 1 star from 5 because bed and bathroom need upgrade. Hot water wasn’t available for 1 day and took longer time to fix than they promised. Housekeeping forgot cleaning the room for 1 day.

Freshly refurbished hotel, walking distance to all amenities. The rooms are very clean. I had a nice city view from my balcony. Good rooftop pool. Hotel provides guests with complimentary fresh beach chairs and towels on demand. Great coffee and flavoured water available in the lobby 24/7. I strongly recommend.

Great hotel located in the middle of Waikiki. The room was very quiet with good bed and bathroom. Staff I found excellent both when checking in early before 9 am - arranging to store luggage until room available and then when departing at 4.30 am. Only Issue is the steps going up to the hotel when arriving with luggage

Great hotel with a great creative slick color theme... Great location in the heart of Waikiki great rooms with a nice view..clean bathrooms...comfy beds... With an excellent guest services specially from Naoki at the front desk who took care of us from A to Z and told us about so many things to do in the island from tours to places to eat. Very highly recommended to all my friends from Chicago and Sydney this is the place.... Thanks Naoki and shoreline management.

Nestled on Seaside Avenue, the Shoreline Hotel Waikiki provides the comforts of home and the customer service of family in this hip, new hideaway. Beyond its trendy, modern-neon aesthetics, itʻs customer service and accommodations are where it really

Fab location and across from Ross dress for less and Nordstrom Rack. Within walking distance to Waikiki beach and other eateries. Bonus breakfast muesli bars and tea/coffee included in the rate. I would definitely stay back at this hotel. Hotel and rooms have been newly renovated in bright retro colours too.

My significant other and I celebrated our 7 month anniversary in Hawaii. We would like to thank all the hardworking staff members who were, very welcoming and friendly. As soon as we walked into the hotel, the way the hotel was designed were unique and were very pleasing to the eye. This hotel was not like the other hotels that we have been into before, Shoreline Hotel Waikiki was special. The room was clean and spacious, the bed was comfortable, and the bathroom had all the essentials needed, such as shampoo, soap, facial cleanser, q-tips, make-up remover, and more. In addition, the closet was huge as well and the sofa chair was very comfortable. Overall, the different colors of the furniture and the hotel itself caught both of our attention from the very start, which made our vacation more unforgettable. If we were to choose a hotel to stay in the future, we would definitely choose Shoreline Hotel Waikiki again.

My family and I wanted to stay at this hotel for a little staycation for the 4th of July. It was the perfect hotel for my family, we loved the colors and decor of the place. It didn’t look like a regular hotel, it looked fun and inviting. The staff were friendly, they offered many free flavored water and coffee in the lobby, every floor was a different color ( we didn’t stop at each floor, but as other guest got off, we noticed the different colors). The room was amazing, I loved the vibe it gave off and the colors. In the room, they give you a variety of complimentary snacks. I loved the chocolate macadamia nuts and the granola bars. Overall, my family and I loved it, and looked forward to going back to our room after a long day out. The beds were comfortable, the room and hotel were clean. We would definitely stay here again in a heartbeat.

We love this hotel; convenient location minutes away from shops, restaurants and the beach. It’s beautifylly decorated & the adjacent restaurant provides tasty & healthy menu options. Would definitely stay here again!

The Shoreline Hotel Waikiki has amazing friendly staff, superb customer service, the rooms are spacious and clean. The location is excellent — close to the beach, restaurants and shops. Special thanks to Naoki for providing service with alacrity.

Poor service - check in with someone who couldn't be bothered to make eye contact. Room small, bath slippery for showering without a mat, air con poor, decor disastrous! Pictures at time of booking were completely different to the hotel now. Would not willingly stay in neon purple/pink box exuding brothel sophistication without therapy!

We booked this hotel as a stopover in the city before heading to the country. It was great! The hotel and amenities are basic, but the staff and service was per the top. Especially Naoki! He was friendly and helpful and showed concern about our bags that the airline has misplaced during our entire stay. He really added to our experience.

Ok place colours uck uck people at shoreline GR8 very helpful Many thanks to Sunny, Lizzie, Edean, and lovely Venus we do thank you very much for looking after us . I will say again need some work done on pool and the paint work is very BAD the red and blue is sooooo very bad , but thanks again to the lovely people that looked after us Roe and Michael .

Starbucks just around the corner, Dukes Market for food, a bank and 2food courts within 1block. Staff were exceptionally helpful and the new colour scheme is eye popping. Short walk to any type of shopping and the excursion tours stop outside.

Great place to stay. Rooms clean and tidy. Great location. Very close to all the shopping and beach. Staff willling to help. Highly recommend to stay and if we go to Hawaii again will tay here. Had a great time. Would agin highly recommend this hotel.
user_name:
geoffdmcleod
North Myrtle Beach, South Carolina

review_body: We were pleasantly surprised at our stay at Shoreline. Newly redecorated hotel, bright and cheerful colour scheme. Staff were extremely helpful, efficient and friendly. Refreshments bar and breakfast snacks was appreciated. Great value for this location in the centre of Waikiki.

My wife and I passed 6 wonderful nights in this sunny and awsome hotel! It’ s very cleaned, after 27 hours of trip we were soooo tired and fortunately it’s soooo calm and we had very good sleeping!!! At waikiki there are no free parking during the day and for 30$ per day you can use the hotel parking service: it’ s a good choice otherwise you will spend maybe more than that price and without the gentile valet who give you the car back or park it for you. The room is not very big but trust me it has great dimensions for a couple. On the roof, 14th floor, there is also a pool!!!!The hotel is very close to the beach, 10 minutes by feet, and in front of it, the escursion busses stop to pick up the guests. There are a lot, a lot of shops restaurants caffe close to the hotel: you can get all you need in any case, every day, until 11 pm!!!!Hotel is pretty close to the airport about 15-20 minutes but after 8 am there is a lot of traffic due to road work.... There are soft drinks coffe and thee available 24 hours a day and in the morning 7-9 am also muffing and sweets for free. All the staff is very professional, kind and always smily: we often met Edean, T J and Naoki soooooo nice, polite and gentile!!! The manager is very kind professional and available to solve any issue. Do you need any suggestion for your vacation? Just need to go to the front desk and the staff will be available to assist you!! We thank shoreline hotel staff for the fantastic vacation in Waikiki!!!!!!Martina and Andrea

This place is incredibly pretty. Lobby and room are decorated Great! My front desk clerk was Naomi, very Nice and Generous guy! I would highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a good vibe and welcoming staff!

Honestly amazing! And pretty good for price. I was upgraded from a queen room to a king room and it was so good.Staff are lovelyLocation is absolutely insane, 4 minutes walk to the beach, right in the middle of all the shopping and super close to the pink line bus and great restaurants.Also the day tour pickup point is literally across the road. It’s actually the best. Totally reccommend

Our second time staying at the hotel... bought friends back with us to stay because we had a good time the first time, however this time I had expensive makeup that I had not yet even used stolen from our room obviously by the staff and when I asked staff to do something about it all they said was sorry... I will be making sure no one I know stays there....

First tried to overcharge, then gave us a room with a wall to the elevator well, which was not sound proof - rooms and pool etc looked nothing like the pictures when originally booked. Overall poor experience

After a mishap with an Airbnb accommodation that I had originally booked, I found myself trying to find something quick for my daughter and I to stay at 4:00 in the morning, the day of our arrival on the island. TJ, the front desk attendant, was so caring and accommodating to our situation and helped in each and every way he possibly could. He got us into a room as quickly as possible and made sure we were comfortable during our stay. I have never experienced such genuinely warm service from any hotel ever. He helped turn a somewhat worrisome situation for me into a great experience. I highly recommend this hotel for their hospitality and service. Thank you so much TJ and Shoreline Hotel Waikiki! You are the best of the best.

My husband and I loved the vibrant colors used in the Shoreline Hotel. The building itself was a little old, but most of the facilities were well maintained. Those who are sensitive to noise should wear the complimentary ear plugs because the doors, water pipes, and air conditioner could get loud. Personally, I had no problem tuning out those sounds. The best part of this hotel was the location. There were many restaurants and shops that are within walking distance, so we did not need a car or shuttle to go anywhere. Heavenly, which is located right next to the Shoreline Hotel, was one of the best restaurants that I have visited during my stay.

The hotel location was great. Only item I did not like was that the pillows were lumpy and the mattress could be improved for better sleep quality. The walls are thin and you hear everyone coming in and out of their rooms. I think there was also some repair going on in some of the rooms which I could hear earlier during the day.

We regard this hotel as a discovery. It is well priced and conveniently located for shops, restaurants, the Outlet Shuttle, and the beach. All the staff are pleasant and helpful. We love the refurbished foyer area although not so sure about the hot pink hallway on our floor.

This hotel reminded me of Miami. The music when you enter the lobby sets the bar for what to expect. A fun, helpful and friendly staff round everything out. If Naoki is there at the desk, pick his brain for restaurants, sights and things to do. Overall, my experience in Hawaii was great. It was my second business trip there. And it was definitely the best one. I recommending this hotel for our future business trips.

The newly refurbished hotel is close by to everything: directly opposite Ross for cheap shopping; short walk to 'Skybar' for sunset drinks with unbeatable views over Waikiki; 'Coconuts' querkie outdoors dining and live entertainment; one block from the the main street for shopping, eating and just watching. and stroll onto the beach itself. Highly recommend this hotel for your stop in Waikiki. The staff are very helpful.

This hotel was well located on one of the quieter streets in Waikiki with great shopping and lots of restaurants nearby. The main problem was very noisy air conditioning which meant we couldn’t sleep with it on and the surrounding area was too noisy to leave the door open. The pillows were also very uncomfortable.The hotel is being refurbished and the new decor is very pleasant; the lobby area is excellent. The Heavenly Cafe next door is great.

Excellent staff and location . I enjoyed my stay at this hotel . Fresh infused water and coffee all day long . Beach and restaurants at walking distance. specially Josh was very kind and helpful, answering all my questions !

Great hotel location and reasonable price. Room was clean and compact but suited us as we don't spend a lot of time in our room. Easy walk to beach, shopping and restaurants. Staff were very helpful and friendly.

What a pleasant surprise right around the corner from everything you want in Waikiki! A funky vibrant hotel next to the most amazing cafe. Staying alone I felt safe and it was within walking distance to most things and an easy Uber ride to everything else! Staff were all amazing so friendly and helpful. The bed was comfy, the room bright and cheerful and the wifi is epic! Will definitely stay again at this comfortable clean and funky hotel

Loved this little hotel, just a minute from all the high end shops. The staff are really cheerful & helpful and there is an excellent café next door. The hotel has a grab & go breakfast bench with cereal bars, muffins and drinks - warning the coffee would wake the dead it was that strong!

Great hotel with a great location. Came from Canada and stayed there for 7 nights. Staff were very friendly and accommodating. If we needed anything all we had to do was ask. Hotel is in a great location with only a short walk to Waikiki.

The Shoreline was an awesome Hotel and the staff was very friendly and helpful. The offer complimentary coffee/tea and muffins in the mornings. The Hotel is very colorful and stands out and the rooms are well designed. Plus there is a Rooftop Pool!!! Will definitely be back to visit soon!!

Our room was clean, comfortable and spacious. The staff were very welcoming and friendly with no request being too much. The hotel is located about 10 mins walk to Waikiki Beach and less than a minute’s walk to great shops and restaurants. Being so close to the action, it was a little noisy at night but earplugs were provided! It offered good value for money, considering the location. A special shout out to Christopher who’s customer service was exceptional.

Shoreline Hotel Waikiki is a small boutique hotel in a great location, central to every high spot of Waikiki.The staff are welcoming & attentive to any requests.The rooms are comfortable although small, generally clean without added glamour.The lobby area is bright & comfortable & the hotel provides drinking water, free tea & coffee 24/7This is a great hotel if you are happy to be out & about during your holiday, exploring & enjoying the sights of Waikiki

When we were there, they were finishing up their renovation. It is now so bright and cheery. The older pictures that are up do it no justice. Check in was breezy, Naoki was the one who was assisting us. He was awesome, we were given keys within minutes. We had a room on the 8th floor and it came with a balcony. Loved the view and the constant breeze. Loved the idea of a balcony too because it was so nice just to chill there and we were able to put out bathing suits out there to dry. If you do, remember to tie it to the chair. I absolutely loved the bright colors everywhere and it was clean above all. The bed was comfy too. This hotel is really close to the Yokocho and on the side street of the main shopping street. It is also a few blocks from the beach. The week went by way too quickly and before I knew it, we had to check out. Naoki was there to help us again and while we were waiting for our cab, we chatted. He is such a pleasant gentleman and before we left he gave us a box of chocolate! How awesome is that??? Thank you Naoki for making our stay a better one.
user_name:
valny2018
New York City, New York

review_body: This was our second stay at the Shoreline Waikiki within a year. The hotel is under going renovations and we were given a renovated room. The rooms are very spacious with unique decor that we liked very much. It’s got that boutique hotel feel. Location was amazing- 2 minute walk to the shops and restaurants and 5 minutes to the beach. The hotel provides towels and beach chairs which is great. On our first visit, we met Yianni and on this visit we met Lizzie, Venus, Naoki, Josh, and Christopher. A few of the staff members such as Naoki and Josh and Christopher remembered us from our last visit. Such a welcoming staff that provided us with an amazing stay. We are already planning our next trip to Waikiki.

The room was very clean and not to mention the amazing retro vibe . The location was amazing super close to everything . I will def be staying here again . Also the price was super convenient and affordable.

A big group of us from Australia stayed at the Shoreline Hotel for a few days in May 2018. Organising a big group can be difficult especially for the front desk trying to sort out rooms etc. however staff at the hotel made this an easy process for all, were very welcoming and a big shout out to Josh Anguay who went out of his way to make us feel welcome at the hotel, nothing was too much to ask for with Josh. The other staff were also lovely and helpful. This along with the coffee, tea and water refreshments in the lobby 24/7, made us really enjoy our stay. Little things like this leave a lasting impression. The hotel was undergoing a refurbishment of the lobby while we were there but this did not cause any issues for us. The rooms smell like new carpet (since they have all been refurbished) and the hotel /linen/bathrooms were all very clean. Location is fantastic! Thank you for the wonderful hospitality Shoreline, A Hui Hou.

This is the third time my wife and I have stayed at the Shoreline over the past 3 years. It is based in a wonderful location--right in the heart of Waikiki and just a few blocks from the beach. Perfect for couples looking for a low-key hotel with great service. The front desk staff is amazing--especially Naoki. He was incredibly helpful in answering my questions before our most recent stay and attentive throughout our two-week trip. He also went out of his way to welcome us and make sure my wife had a great birthday. The rest of the staff was kind and gracious as well--Venus, Lizzie, Josh, and Christopher.My only real critique was for the housekeeping. While our rooms were serviced and our beds were made every day, I don't think they vacuumed or really cleaned the bathroom during our two-week stay. We also had to ask the front desk for extra toilet paper when it was clearly running low. Of course, the front desk staff was more than accommodating and it didn't put a damper on our stay. I believe they are thinking about an afternoon happy hour and I think that would be a great addition to make this hotel a more fun place to stay.

The front desk staff is always available helpful. The rooms are clean and comfortable. I enjoyed the daily newspapers. The breakfast bars provided quick energy when needed. The infused water was always refreashing when I returned from my outings. The hotel is convenient to shopping and the beach and beach towels are available at the front desk.

Although they were renovating the lobby, we still enjoyed the stay very much. They are located right in the heart of Waikiki and close to many shops (Ross is right across the hotel). We experienced wonderful hospitality from the check in staff and the rooms, while nothing to write home about, was large and comfortable.Highly recommended for the price point and location

Basic, clean and served the purpose. Stay was unexpectedly cut short (in Wednesday, out Friday) however it served the purpose. The semi tenement next door was not so appealing. Adjoining restaurant was awesome.

We visited the Shoreline hotel in May 2018 and really liked the Shoreline. It is in a great location and is about two streets away from the beach. It's close to everything and there is an abundance of food outlets, restaurants and the beach all within close (5 mins) walking distance. A convenience store (ABC Store chain) further up the street and sells pretty much everything you want including alcohol. The hotel foyer has been improved and each of the floors is being updated sequentially to make them very colourful. The foyer offers free muffins and muesli bars every morning and has all day free coffee and tea as well as water that is safe to drink. The room we had was small but clean and comfortable and had a safe to lock your valuables. The pool is at the top of the building and offers a good all round view of the city. The only negative is that the area can be quite noisy at night with trucks and traffic. We were facing Seaside Ave so you may want to go around the other side. The staff are really helpful and organised an express shuttle to the airport (USD $14.00) and takes about 30 minutes.

Centrally located in the "Heart of Waikiki", The Shoreline Hotel is very clean, welcoming, and cozy. The modern aesthetic of the atmosphere is superb/appealing. Room was spotless! Very quiet, overlooking the city. However, it was the friendly staff (Naoki in particular) that made our staycation memorable. Very professional, friendly, and courteous truly makes you feel like Ohana. Naoki, was pleasant and cooperative. His willingness to ensure our stay was enjoyable is beyond exceptional. Mahalo Nui Loa! Hope you enjoyed the Uber Tarts :)Just minutes away from popular restaurants, shops, and beaches. The Shoreline Hotel, Waikiki is very affordable and highly recommended for anyone visiting Oahu, Hawaii. You will not be disappointed!

The Shoreline is in a great location and has lovely friendly staff who are keen to help. I definitely recommend this hotel for anyone wanting to stay in Waikiki. There was a bit of noise coming from the lift, hallway and next-door rooms - that was my only complaint.

I stayed at this hotel for 9 nights (10 days). Right at the reception, their welcome was lovely and they were extremely accommodating, making the check-in easy and comfortable (especially after my 27 hour trip!). Naoki, who was at the front desk almost every evening, made me feel right at home and gave me perfect local advice on where to go and what to see - which I followed to the dot! It felt like a personalised trip and treat everyone like a VIP. I felt like I was coming back to a group of friends every night. So thank you Naoki, and the rest of the team! I hope to be back soon.

Shoreline Hotel is a great affordable hotel in central Waikiki, close to shops and 5 mins from the beach. The decor is very bright and modern. Complimentary muffins and coffee in the mornings was great and the free wifi. Our only disappointed was that our room was on the 2nd floor and looked out on an ugly rundown building next door .

Cute modern boutique hotel. Our stay was during the Memorial Day weekend, yet it seemed very quiet. We had the pool all to ourselves on Saturday morning. The staff is very friendly and helpful - Lizzie at the front desk was very professional, friendly and helpful. We live on Maui and plan to stay here again next trip, close to everything Waikiki has to offer, good rates, clean and has a fun vibe.
courtesy and well mannered staff excellent in every aspect ...maybe breakfast cold be available for a little longer ...Rooms very clean Hotel will be very nice once all the renovations are complete.

Very convenient location and helpful staff. Hotel room and common areas were clean and well kept. Room was quite noisy though, from both the live music outside (part of the location convenience) and inside. Our room wrapped around the lift wells so we could hear the lift every time it went up and down. Also the doors are paper thin so we could hear other rooms doors shut every time someone came and went as well as any conversation in the hallways. I guess that’s why they provide earplugs...

we stayed here for 5 nights and we were so thrilled about how fantastic the location was go absolutely everything / beach, shops, dining, bus stop, abc store, the list continues!The things that really stood out for us was the 24h reception, the lobby’s unlimited free coffee along with other drink options 24h a day, the radius of places within 5 minutes walk of the hotel, the wonderful and helpful staff, how clean and great our rooms were and the super comfy bed!! Thanks for a great stay team!!

You need to be aware that there is an extra daily compulsory charge for amenities not mentioned or included in the daily rate. The beds are not comfortable as you can feel the wire springs in the mattress

We had a wonderful time in Waikiki. The staff at the Shoreline hotel were very accommodating, friendly and went the extra mile to make us feel as welcome as possible. The location was fantastic and for all our tours bar one, we were picked up right across the road at Ross dress for less store. Beach was 2min walk, it was great. The bus system was also great and at the end of our road either way.We were celebrating our wedding anniversary and they gave us some choccies and wine for which we were most grateful for :-)One thing that we weren't too keen on, was where the air conditioner was put in the room. One thing didn't really like was where the airconditioner was situated on the wall. It directly blew straight at us as we lay on the bed and got quite cool when it was blowing straight on us all night. We would definitely recommend the Shoreline Hotel.

This is a very cute hotel. Very neat and super centered in a good location. Right in the middle of Waikiki. Very comfortable overall. Also Sonny the valet guy is very friendly and always helpful! Always with a smile and makes the stay more personal.
user_name:
robny2018
New York City, New York

review_body: My husband and I stayed 2 nights in April 2018 before our cruise. We loved the location of the hotel and the staff were awesome! The price was very reasonable too. We will definitely be staying again in the future. Thanks

Very nice hotel with attentive and helpful personnel. Room is clean and we even had a partial ocean view although it is a city hotel. Central located. The valet parking guys deserve their own five star rating! :)

Sonny was a tremendous help and made arriving and leaving the hotel a snap. The front desk staff was extremely friendly and knowledgeable about local attractions. I would recommend thisHotel to friends and family.

The hotel is very central and within walking distance to a lot of places. The service is impeccable! We dealt with Naoki most of the time during our stay- not only did he give us a brand new renovated room when we arrived early but also gave us great suggestions. When giving directions he was very precise so you wont get confused. Overall it was a great experience and can’t wait to see how the renovation turns out when it’s all done!

Loved this hotel. We stayed in one of the newly renovated rooms. Very clean and modern looking. Good coffee machine. Great location, not right in the middle of the Waikiki madness! Would definitely recommend this place

Hotel is in a great location, two minutes stroll to Kalakua Ave and five minutes to beautiful Waikiki beach. Hotel was undergoing renovations but this didn't bother us at all. Room was ok and size was good. A microwave was provided but would be better if some basic utensils were provided as well. The toilet was small however. What makes this hotel however is its staff. They are extremely hospitable and approachable at all times and this made the stay a pleasant one. They checked us in early and even added a special welcome gesture on the blackboard. That was a nice special touch. Special thanks to Venus who gave us excellent and accurate public transport details.

The location was great, walking distance to tons of entertainment and dining. The staff at the front desk and the valet were very kind and accommodating all around. Hotel is going through a full renovation, can’t wait to see it finished!

Great Location was close to everything beach like 10 min walk.Buses was easy to take really don't need a car you can rent scooters and bikes.If you like to snorkel there a place called Hanauma bay cost a dollar to park and $ 7.50 to get into the park if no parking park down the road in the residential area.There are fire works on the beach every Fri night.Hotel was older they where renovating some floors but never heard any noise workers where very polite.Room was clean no problems at all.

Very nice people. Great location for shopping, restaurants and beach. Good wifi. We had a room on the top floor (14) that faced the street (Seaside). The room was average size and furnished modestly. The bed was comfortable. Balcony had a decent view of mountains and ocean (small slices between buildings). Our issue was noise (not internal to the hotel even though they are doing some renovation on the property). The noise comes from the street (Seaside). Street performers were active until 10pm each night. Those performers used a loud speaker and were very successful in exhorting the crowds to shout in unison. Also, the delivery trucks for local businesses begin their deliveries at no later than 7am, and we heard the

The staff were nice but the hotel looks a lot nicer in pictures then in real life. We ended up changing hotels half way through our stay to one that was better value for money. It wasn’t a bad hotel but I wouldn’t book again.

Try for a room not overlooking the alleyway. The bathroom had mould on the ceiling. The location was terrific, it being in the centre of town.Loved having the room serviced daily. A real bonus to come home to at the end of the day.

We stayed at the Shoreline for a week and we really liked it. Very good location, staff is friendly and helpful. The room was clean and confortable. Special thanks to Lizzie at reception who made us feel right at home!

We stayed at Shoreline for a week.Great location..just a quick stroll to the beach and shops.Freindly and helpful staff..Naoki was really helpful at the reception and made sure that any places or deals we found were our best option!!!!!Room was made up and cleaned well every day.Breakfast at the Heavenly Restaurant was well worth it, very healthy and is extremely popular. Plus you get a 10% discount when staying at Shoreline. Would recommend as a good value, not too fancy place to stay. Kai and Kaye (Australia)

Have never been to Hawaii before . Hotel location was good and grab and go snacks at breakfast time , that’s all . Our room was small , not enough wardrobe space for 6 nights and no drawer space to speak of. Heard every door slam along the corridor, sometimes thought someone was knocking on or coming through our door . Rooms were not cleaned before 3 pm on any day , twice we had to point out that room had not been serviced . After a long day out ( left each morning by just after 9 am and retuned by 2.30 pm at the earliest ) it would be nice to return to a serviced room . Air conditioning not explained , found out day before last when housekeeping left a room corner in the socket. Pool was very disappointing, only a very narrow area around the pool and as it was on roof , it felt rather unsafe . Having looked around Waikiki, we could have found better at a similar price . Lobby will look nice when work is finished .Replies to reviews are all similar, so if we should come back to Waikiki, we would stay somewhere else .

Room was net & clean, views were also good- Beer is also cold overall I enjoyed alot. I would love to come here many times. Hopefully next time I will visit with my partner. Parking & shower was also good.

This hotel is vibrant the new decor is tastefully done. Our room with partial sea view was very spacious, furniture modern and very comfortable,bedside lighting with dimmer switch which I find is a great help,room carpeted which I prefer (I sustained a head injury after slipping on marble floor in Spain many years ago) large TV, Safe,small fridge, ample wardrobe space with wooden coat hangers. Bathroom, bright and cheerful with pristine white towels, toiletries environmentally friendly. The roof top swimming pool does require you to climb a flight of stairs, a local artist painted the stairs and around the pool and what an amazing job he did it was a joy just experiencing that, the pool was very clean and of good size.The hotel staff Naoki, Chris and Sonny were welcoming, friendly and very helpful when checking in Naoki noticed my partner John would be celebrating his 70th birthday and on the day sent a bottle of wine to our room, how thoughtful and a lovely gesture. This Hotel it is in easy walking distance for shops and eateries and Waikiki beach is very close too. I highly recommend this delightful hotel and would stay again.

Very affordable and centrally located for holidays in Waikiki. Renovations are very nice and rooms are comfortable and nicely decorated. Although can be a little bit noisy at night with activity on the street like garbage trucks and people but other than that would stay again

We had to wait till 3pm to access our room. The hotel agreed to hold our luggage till then but then wanted a tip for taking our bags to our room. The air con did not work and when my husband went to reception to ask why he was told to put the room card into the light switch (the lights were already working without the card). When he asked why we had not been told this on check in he was told that the receptionist was new and did not realise. There was coffee in the room but no milk. You got the first cup free then had to pay if you wanted more. Our city view room looked out onto a slum like apartment building which was only a driveway away from our balcony. The bathroom wallpaper was peeling off revealing mildew. The toilet ran water all night. There was no sound proofing of any kind so we heard every sound from the street as well as from every room on our floor. On our first full day in the hotel we returned from an outing only to find our room cards had been deactivated. Not a very pleasant experience at all considering the amount we paid for our room. Not happy!!!

Carpets.....in hot counties it seems more hygenic with marble or parquet flooring!Once renovation finished it will be a superb property and if we are in Honolulu again we will definitely stay...brilliant location.

My partner and I stayed at Shoreline for the first 5 nights of our stay. We had an early arrival and requested an early check in (for a fee) which can’t be guaranteed until you arrive and see what’s available. We were lucky we had a room available from 11am. In the meantime we were offered beach chairs and towels and our bags were taken care of by reception.The first thing we noted on arrival is access to the lobby is via a set of stairs and there isn’t any porters to assist you when you arrive so don’t expect a grand entry.The hotel is in prime location to everything in the heart of Waikiki. Walk less than 100 metres and you’re on the main strip where there’s lots of restaurants and some shopping - if you’re looking for expensive luxury brands that is!The free breakfast mentioned is just some free packaged snacks more so and only available between 7am - 9am in the lobby. The snacks were the same daily, muffins, waffles, chew bars and muesli bars. Definitely appreciated but as snacks. We tried the flavoured waters and didn’t like any of them - these are also the same daily.We ate breakfast at Island Vintage coffee at the Royal Hawaiian centre daily which is a short walk away.The bed was clean upon check in but I wouldn’t say the room overall was and definitely showed signs of needing some repairs especially to the cupboard doors and fridge area. Bathrooms really do need an upgrade! There was only one single chair on the balcony which was all rusted and didn’t look inviting at all. We found that our room was never made up whilst we were out and house keeping was always late late afternoon around 4pm.The pool is tiny with barely any lounge chairs and it really isn’t inviting... we went there once and there was a newspaper at the bottom of the pool that looked like it was there all day so clearly not a maintained area. Highly recommend taking use of the complimentary chairs and towels and heading down to the beach. The chairs though are very worn! Something to keep in mind.The hotel has no security in terms of swipe access to get to levels or pool. Anyone can walk in and get into the lift and go up to any floor and even use the pool! There’s a lot who have mentioned the outside noise in reviews, honestly the noise we found to be all inside the hotel! House keeping staff noisy, lifts noisy and doors noisy. The most disappointing thing for us was one afternoon we asked a lady working at reception to assist us with booking a tour. We had all the information and explained we needed help with calling etc and she was very uncomfortable and visibly nervous doing this and seemed very incompetent. We ended up having to cross the road and get another hotel to assist us with ease.Overall if you’re looking to save a bit of money especially with waikiki’s high accomodation prices and still want to be in a good location, Shoreline would suffice BUT if you’re used to staying at known, well kept hotels... you will be very disappointed here and highly recommend spending the extra to stay elsewhere.

Lovely hotel. Nice atmosphere. Courteous and helpful staff. Excellent location. Free breakfast snacks. Free coffee and water always available. Comfortable rooms and bed. We would thoroughly recommend it.

The Shoreline is located in the center of town just minutes walk from the beach, near outdoor shopping malls and just behind the main shopping road.The hotel is being refurbished to appeal to a younger crowd with beautiful happy colors.The adjoining breakfast place is adorable.Comfortable beds, clean rooms, nice sheets, coffee machine, water and free wi-fi
user_name:
hnaranjo
New York City, New York

review_body: We just needed a place for one night at waikiki. Somewhere clean and not too expensive. The shoreline absolutely met expectations. Staff is nice and extremely friendly. View from the pool rooftop is nice. The restaurant attached right next to the hotel made the tastiest loco moco we've had in Oahu.

Room was hot, ac wouldn’t turn on, tub leaked, wires protruded from carpet, no TV guide, no choice in K cups for coffee, only one chair on balcony so couldn’t sit with the wife, only ice machine on first floor

Overall, Shoreline Hotel Waikiki was a great place to stay. The stay were very friendly on our arrival, and we were able to check in early. The location of Shoreline was awesome, and the room was very nice.

Great location and affordable price. Air conditioning doesn’t work well though and the room had dust buildup on certain surfaces. Linens are clean but had stains. Bathroom clean, but vent was sticking out a bit. I didn’t mind too much since they were in the middle of a renovation and I’m hoping next time it’s better looking.

This isn’t a fancy place, but it is only a block or so from the beach and the price is reasonable. They’re undergoing some remodeling, with what we found to be some odd paint choices, but the room was spacious enough and a place to sleep for a few nights. Breakfast is a grab-and-go muffin or granola bar. There is a Keurig in your room, and your first few pods are included. I can’t bring myself to be enthusiastic about it, but the price and convenient location definitely make it a place to consider.

Staff was wonderful, room was great, location worked very well for us, stayed about 2 weeks with no issues, Will be even better when lobby renovations done. Would stay here again, Love Hawaii and it's people. Mahalo for everything.

Outstanding Staff and rooms.The location is great, close to everything, feels like you are at home.Great beds, you will get the sleep of your life.Newspaper in the lobby each morning to read while enjoying you muffin and coffee.

Excellent hotel right across the road from my favourite shop ROSS IT IS IN SEASIDE AVENUE very close to everything you need the rooms are good everything you need they offer beach chairs and beach towels for the beach and a quick grab a snack table of a morning we are here for 2 weeks the rooms are very clean we have a water view room the staff are very friendly and helpful I have been coming to Hawaii for many years stayed at quite a few hotels yes I would stay here again and a lovely restaurant healthy restaurant next door what more could you wish for

Great location and very clean and comfortable. The price was extremely good value given its proximity to the attractions of Waikiki. The staff were very helpful and a great source of knowledge. One small issue that could have been an issue for some but wasn’t for us was that the TV reception was poor and as a result was unwatchable we did have someone come to try and fix it unsuccessfully and he did say he would swap the TV the next day while we were out which didn’t happen. But that was the only experience that wasn’t positive. The complimentary juice and coffee in the lobby was a nice touch. We would recommend Shoreline without hesitation . If however you are looking for the full blown resort experience with multiple pools room service and onsite restaurants then maybe look elsewhere, and of course be prepared to pay accordingly.

A small hotel who are currently going through a refurb. However this was contained and not noisy so didn’t interrupt our holiday.The lovely welcome at check in, late in the evening was appreciated after a very long day of travelling. Out rooms were clean and the beds very comfortable, out rooms were quiet and the air conditioning good. Every day the towels were replaced and our rooms cleaned. My only recommendation would be to have a safe in all rooms and a shelf is needed in the loo as we had no where to put our toiletries. Everyday we were greeted with a smile and a welcome as we went past reception, it was my husbands birthday and they have us a bottle of wine which was a nice touch. We asked for recommendations and directions and the staff were very knowledgeable. The hotel has accessible rooms which are large and have roll in showers with a seat, you can get into the hotel via a lift at the front which is operated by the staff or via a ramp at the back of the hotel. I was able to access everywhere except the swimming pool due to steps however you are so close to the beach and sea we never used it.

Stayed for one night on a layover. Hotel is in great location but undergoing construction. Lobby was unapologetically unsightly. Room is comfortable and clean. Bathrooms desperately in need of updating.

I selected this hotel from it's reviews, and I could not have selected better. It's a small comfortable hotel, very well situated in the town, not to far from the beach, very friendly staff, more than adequate for our needs. A small pool on the roof if needed. 24 hour coffee, tea in the reception area. there is a quite nice restaurant with the good life ( Vegan also) type of foods.

The Shoreline Hotel is the perfect location for your Hawaii holiday. 5 mins walk to Waikiki beach and 2 mins away from resturants and bars. The hotel is very clean, fresh towels and bedding everyday. The hotel staff are all lovely and friendly.

Our Agent booked us 5 nights at the Shoreline Waikiki at the end of February and it did not disappoint. Great boutique style hotel in very good location and lovely staff. Special mention to Josh and Venus who were so happy to help. Whilst the rooms (we had 721) are not luxurious they are very clean and comfortable with all the promised amenities including good Wifi. The complimentary grab and go muffins and health bars at breakfast were very convenient for early starts and very tasty. Infused waters and 24/7 coffee and tea in Reception also great. Used the roof top pool area on a couple of afternoons after sightseeing. Also borrowed the chairs from reception for the beach which is only a short walk away. For info there are self-service laundry facilities at the Coconut Waikiki, the sister hotel a short walk away, again very helpful reception if you need change for the wash machines. Breakfast wise we did use the Heavenly Restaurant next door which was very nice but also very busy. Most days we used the Dukes Lane Market & Eatery around the corner on Kuhio Avenue which catered for all tastes. Certainly lived up to its good Trip reviews.

This hotel is located within a 10 minute walk to the main shopping street and the Waikiki beach. Good value for the hotel and its location. Currently some rooms are under renovation so be sure to request a recently renovated room. Only valet parking available for $30.

Me and my family spent four nights here. The room is clean, tide and bigger than I expected. It has all those facilities, plus a microwave. The bed and pillows were really comfortable. The location is great, close to everything, while making it a little bit noisy when sleeping. But the hotel prepared earbuds, how nice! Parking onsite costs $30 per day. But you can find a slot just next to the building at the rate of $8 per 10 hours. We didn't have the chance to enjoy the rooftop swimming pool, so no comment. In the morning there is Grab-and-go breakfast. If you are in a hurry, the muffin and energy bar will really help a lot. There are also some refreshments in the lobby, such lemon water, hot tea and coffee. And also thanks Naoki so much for his help since we were late for our check out and he didn't charge us. Hope to stay with you guys next time!

I've stayed here before, so was happy to know the great atmosphere of the hotel has continued. The staff were very welcoming and helpful, and seem to have mastered that "spirit of aloha". The location is convenient to beach, the bus tour pick-up points, and shopping areas. The restaurant just next door is called "Heavenly" for a reason! My room was quiet for sleeping, and had everything you would need while on holiday...for anything else, there's an ABC store down the block!

This was our second stay and we are not disappointed.It is located within walking distance of most attractions in Waikiki. Those that you cannot walk to, just take the bus that arrives and departs just around the corner on Kalia St.Would seriously recommend the Shoreline as it is a nice venue without the high price tag associated with most Wakiki hotels.Free WiFi, free breakfast muffins and snack bars, free tea and coffee.AAA+++

I had 10 days at the Shoreline. I had an excellent time! Lovely staff, especially Naoki and Sonny. Excellent restaurant downstairs called Heavenly. I would highly recommend this hotel. Excellent location on Waikiki as well!

All the staff we saw were extremely friendly and helpful, nothing was too much trouble.The grab and go breakfast was ideal especially when going on trips as these often start early. The availability of drinks all day for free was also much appreciated, tea, coffee water and juices. The rooms were clean and attractive, our bed was a king size. The hotel was very conveniently placed to access the beach, and all the delights of Waikiki.We were very pleased with our stay.

This hotel exceeded my expectations. The staff was extremely friendly and provided so much help while trying to book activities to do. The hotel is extremely chic and modern. The rooms are not big, but its more than enough room to do what needs to be done. In a beautiful place like Hawaii a view would be nice, but they are located in the perfect spot for food, entertainment, and shopping. No big breakfast, but what they provide hots the spot. Book this reasonable hotel in the perfect location...

Shoreline Hotel was located right in Waikiki...a perfect location if you want to be in the thick of it. Only one and a half blocks away from the beach. Very welcoming and friendly staff who were only to happy to help if asked. Loved the grab and go breakfast. One small disappointment was the view from the room but nothing the hotel can do about that!

Stayed here based on trip advisor reviews. Location was great right in the middle of Waikiki. The service was very friendly and the hotel was very neat and tidy. There was some street noise in the rooms purely due to the location. This hotel is a great base for going and exploring or doing tours. There isn’t really anything to do at the hotel - a pool on the roof was quite basic and no bar or anything. They do provide a basic breakfast, packaged for you to take with you. Or there is a cafe next door that you get a discount at, which I didn’t try. Overall, the hotel was great for what we needed, a comfy bed and great base for our trip with friendly staff.

Service provided by your crew was exceptional. Everyone was helpful and courteous. I liked that the room has air conditioning and a balcony. The location was close to the beach, park, zoo and aquarium, so we were able to walk everywhere.

Perfect Waikiki location at an affordable price. Staff were amazing. They were so helpful when we had a sudden power outage. We would definitely recommend this hotel for your Waikiki vacation. Excellent choice.

Clean rooms, excellent location in Waikiki, and great service. I have come several times for business trips. You can take a shuttle from the airport directly to the Hotel. The Hotel is close to ABC convenience stores, shopping malls, several restaurants and boutiques.

The positives: good price (most other hotels in Honolulu seem very expensive), great location (very short walk to Waikiki Beach and to the Tour Buses), free beach towels, snacks set out in the morning (no breakfast but the bars and muffins were great to grab & go) and friendly helpful front desk staff (its a smaller hotel so there isn't the same kind of long line you might experience at the larger chains at their front desks). The negatives: the room was very small (not sure how other Honolulu hotel rooms compare but this was NYC hotel room small; no dresser to unpack a bit while there), poor maid service (3 days the maid didn't come until after 3:00 PM. We'd go to the beach, or go out for the day, and want to come back mid afternoon to grab a shower but couldn't because there had been no maid service and no fresh towels), run down rooms (electric plug in the bathroom didn't work, mold, peeling wall paper, etc.)There is a small pool on the roof which is fine but who spends time in a pool with Waikiki Beach 2 minutes walk away. There is no gym and no business centre to print boarding passes but if you email to the front desk, they can print them off for you. The location is in a very busy, noisy part of Waikiki bit the noise didn't bother us one little bit. There is a Ross Dress for Less across the street and what looks like an all but abandoned building next door. If you are looking for a budget hotel and don't mind a small room with some issues, then this might be an okay choice. I think if we ever go back, I'll spend the extra money and stay at a better hotel.

This is a pleasant hotel just a few blocks back from the beach at Waikiki.The rooms are fine, but why this hotel is a stand out choice is because they offer complimentary tea, coffee etc 24/7 and brownies for breakfast!As a tourist you are so used to everyone trying to take money from you at every opportunity, so it is so refreshing to come to the Shoreline and be offered something for nothing! (and there is an excellent restaurant next door)

Great location. 2 min walk to the beach and Mai Tai at the Royal Hawaiian Hotel at sunset. Very friendly and happy staff. Rooms very clean. Only negative I have is that I could not get the Coffee machine in our room to work.

I stayed here for a week and appreciated the central Waikiki location. Access to everything is so easy, you do not need a car. The hotel is very cute and attractive. Central Waikiki is very loud and busy but my room was well-insulated for sound. I did not hear outdoor noise or noises from other guests. The hotel employees were all very friendly and helpful. Finally, the price is right, which is not easy to find in Waikiki. I reserved my room on the hotel website and avoided the pesky "resort fee" that so many Waikiki hotels charge. The beverage station in the lobby was perfect after hot outdoor activities.

A clean room with a decent-sized, comfortable bed and reliable bathroom fittings. Staff were friendly, courteous and helpful. A useful 'quick' breakfast bar (muffins, fruit and nut bars, coffee and juice) is available from 7-9 am daily in the foyer, and is provided free of charge. This hotel is a good choice for tourists seeking a hotel with a tariff that compares favourably against many other outrageously over-priced hotels in Waikiki. It's just a 5-10 minute stroll to Waikiki beach, and close to all bus and trolley services and good shopping. The pool, which is quite small, is located on the roof, and can only be accessed by climbing stairs from the top floor. Be aware that room service is carried out somewhat later in the day than we are used to in Australia - usually between 3-4 pm, which proved to be inconvenient on a few occasions. Also be aware that due to it's popular and densely-populated location, the noise level surrounding the hotel can be quite considerable at night from nightclubs, street entertainers and frequent police sirens, etc, although it usually quietens down after 11pm-midnight.

We really enjoyed our stay. The staff was helpful, the 'treats' in the lobby is a nice touch. The location is good. The beach is not to far and there are so many stores and restaurants nearby. We did not use the pool at the roofstop but the area is rather small.

A delightful boutique hotel awaits Spent one night on my way to Australia. . The staff at front desk were smart, informative, and helpful. The room was clean and lovely. I felt fully supported by hotel staff in any of my inquiries. I will stay here again on my return trip to mainland.

you should not sell the room like room #628 to your customer. This type of room can hear the disturbing noise made by the elevator. we stayed your hotel for 5 nights. The front desk put us in this type of room in the first place. After 3 times complaining, finally move us to a better room but still can hear the noise. Totally ruined our honey moon !!!!

We stayed here for one night. This is a convenient location to stay at the night before a cruise departure. This hotel is located in the middle of most of the action in Waikiki Beach. Everything is within walking distance. Easy access to the beach, about a 5-minute walk. The employees are friendly, efficient, and quite accommodating. Simple breakfast offered every morning.

This hotel was apparently a much older hotel given a facelift. The oldness shows in places, but overall the facelift was well executed. The location was fantastic, and the staff was helpful, most of all Sonny, who was our valet, he went what I consider above and beyond to help us out. The bed was very comfortable, and the room was well appointed.

Not fancy but clean and good value. Great central location close to shops, services and bus. Helpful and responsive staff. Free coffee, cold drinks and grab n go breakfast in the lobby. Overall clean and comfortable.

Staff very pleasant . Clean . Close to main street . Near restaurants., shopping . Short distance from beach . Close to coffee shops. Complimentry breakfast .Balconies .Valet parking. Swimming on the roof top !!

The staff members were lovely, but we were unimpressed with the pool and amenities offered. Additionally, we reserved a single bed room, and upon arrival were given two doubles, which made the room crowded and cramped with our crib. There was nothing horrible about the place, but it wasn't as nice as I would have anticipated.

Clean overall and conveniently located but not near water and no amenities. Small hotel. Great customer service at desk and parking attendant is quick. Quiet rooms- we were on eleventh floor. thank you.

Access to Main Street is the best.The staff is also very kind.But the night is noisy.The sound of the drain sounds.Easy to hear the sound of the city.The hotel building is old but the cleaning is well kept clean.

Too much climatisation in the levels. People are kind but they’re acting too much like if they were pressured. No security in this hotel everyone can enter in the hotel by the abc store or another enter, they can go to the swimming pool no one is checking. They should tell to the persons who come from the beach not to go directly in the swimming pool. It has a lot of sand. People from the conciergerie found every activity “my favorite one” to make you buy everything they can. They are not enough specific with terms for the activities.
