For example I booked ride dolphins and when I went they told me that I was maybe unable to do it because of my nails. They didn’t tell me about that in the conciergerie. This hotel has a lot of private events which is kind of inconvenient because they blocked spaces in the hotel. The room was good but the shower small! Finally they did’t tell us when we reserved that there will be constructions around the hotel which is unacceptable because we took a partial view and we heard the workers early in the morning and the view was not great.

Location is central Waikiki, that’s why it’s convenient for everything. Also great free wifi connection and speed is good as well. There are flavours water served for free and morning snack such as muffins, nuts bars which is good survise.

Friendly staff always welcoming to guests coming in or going out , Good service, nice to have beverages and snacks available in the lobby at all times of the day for guests. Room was nice and clean ...

We really enjoyed our staycation! Well priced and convenient location. The only very minor complaint we had was that since we were right next to the stairwell, we could hear the door close everytime someone went in or out. Other than that, everything was spectacular!

We stayed for a week at the Shoreline Hotel and the highlight of our stay was dealing with Josh on the front desk most days! He was extremely helpful and so friendly, all the other staff were great also but Josh just seemed to enjoy making sure we were satisfied we were so appreciative that Josh suggested a tour with Hi-5 Tours as we were so impressed with Yianni and Eric - for anyone wanting a small personalized island tour .... don’t go past Hi-5 tours, so much better than the commercialized big bus one size fits all companies The rooms are basic at the Shoreline, clean with a comfy bed although I was disappointed that we didn’t have a jug to make our own cup of tea. Location is great, we would definitely stay again Thanks Shoreline and Josh

Rooms are clean and spacious we had a large outside balcony the outside paintwork was a bit tired but it was still nice to be outside.Standard as expected comfy bed fridge but alas for British travellers no kettle for making tea lucky we brought our own.There is a microwave oven.Tea coffee cold drinks available in the lobby 24 hours .Best thing about this hotel is the friendliness of the desk staff.We arrived midmorning after a night flight and our room as we expected wasn't ready.Venus invited us to get a drink use the bathroom and gave us 2 towels to use on the beach. ROM was ready when we're returned at 2.30.The next day Venus was helpful in printing off bus timetables and was most helpful giving us information on what to do for the day.Nice restaurant next door for breakfast lunch and dinner.Breakfasts look good.10% discount if you show your room key.

Toilet running all night but thanks to the ear plugs it kept it quite. No soap on the first night. Lack of storage space for the BVD's. Complimentry water and coffee. Parking was very limited but the valet service was great.

The staff were wonderful! Great helpers who assisted us with all inquires and questions that we had. The room was great and the cafe next to the hotel called Heavenly was amazing! You even get 10% off if you show your room key. Would stay again anytime!

Stayed here with 2 other couples (my 2nd time here) and was perfect for an overnight. We used the valet parking which solves the parking issue...and it is only a few blocks away from a bunch of restaurants and shops, so we could park and walk. The breakfast in the next door restaurant should be avoided...not very good, and weak coffee...ugh.The hotel is fine though...would stay again...

Spoke to Jordan before we went and apparently because of our pleasant exchange, he upgraded us to a suite. Aloha baby. Right on the strip, close to Marukame Udon, reasonable price, clean room, great stay. There was an outdoor bar down the street that was a little loud but there were complimentary ear plugs waiting for us when we checked in.

The hotel was super cute and had a great lobby. They also served breakfast which was awesome. The staff was super friendly and super helpful when we needed it. I would recommend this place for sure. :)

I am in the industry myself and have worked in Destination and 5 diamond resorts for 25 years...this Hotel was fantastic...situated in the center of everything....clean , comfortable, and FUN!! The decor was Right on....infused water in the lobby ..4 different kinds...cotton candy...essential oils...the GRAB N GO breakfast is wonderful when you are jetting off to tour the island...the rooms were amazing, The front desk staff always engaging when entering and leaving....I can’t say enough about this Hotel...do yourself a favor and book it on your next trip to WAKIKI...you will not be disappointed!!!

We chose this property based primarily on price and value. Everything in Waikiki seemed to be so expensive and this hotel came in as cheap and cheerful. We were not disappointed.The hotel has undergone a mini makeover and the rooms are clean and spacious. We stayed for 5 nights and staff ensured that we had a fridge and microwave for the duration of our stay. All staff were friendly and helpful and the hotel is in an incredibly central location. There is a rooftop pool, but we didn’t use it and there is grab and go breakfast offered in the lobby every morning. Water and coffee is also provided in the lobby 24 hours and there is an organic restaurant next door that offers a discount if you are staying in the hotel.

Good service in this older style hotel. Staff very friendly. Room air conditioners a little noisy. Advertised complimentary breakfast quite limited to food bars, cakes/muffins, and tea/coffee. Conveniently located to beach and busses

Came down from the North Shore for 1 night only and this hotel did the job. I booked it because I got a good price, and really in Waikiki you get what you pay for.Prices are high, and the resort fees a joke, the only resort in Waikiki is the Hilton Hawaiian Village, otherwise the rest are just hotels with pools and I find the sometimes USD38 daily resort fee that hotels charge a joke.So if you book on Shorelines website then there is no resort fee, although they do provide coffee and snacks in the morning which is nice.I booked the lowest level room a city view queen, room was very small and view non-existent but I have no issue with that.Bed was very hard and uncomfortable. I like a firm bed but this was next level, so I didn’t have a greats nights sleep.The bathroom could certainly do with an upgrade, the door was chipped and looked like black mould and rust on the tiles. Actual shower looked newer and this was fine. Can’t help but think if they just did a good proper clean of the tiles they could solve that issue.The location is fantastic (another reason I chose it) yes there is noise, it was very quiet at night but like 5am garbage trucks were noisy, but it’s in a city so can’t blame them for that.Staff I didn’t interact with too much but the ones I did were friendly and polite.All up for 1 night and the price I paid it did the job, but if I was going to Waikiki for a weeks holiday I would not stay here.

We loved our stay! The staff is super helpful and they treat us very well! When we arrived they had a special message for us on the main entrance chalkboard... the hotel is nice and cozy, kind of a boutique hotel, so you will not find the usual Waikiki mess in this hotel! The only negative point in my modest opinion is the pool: it's very small at the top of the building so we didn't like at all! Likely Oahu have many beautiful beaches so you will not miss the pool! The rooms are modern and clean, Just the way we like it! They have same snack in the morning and during all day they have flavored waters as a courtesy (I told you that they are very nice)! Regarding the location it's not on the front row of the beach but it's very close and who has problems walking a little bit between Waikiki stores...

The hotel is only about 200 m from the shops on Kalakaua and close to the beach. The room was a good size , clean and comfortable. The room had a Keurig coffee machine, microwave, mini refrigerator and room safe. There was a small balcony with enough room for a chair. The bathroom had a tub; it was clean with lots of shelf space for toiletries. The roof top pool is quite small, we didn't use it; the beach is nicer. Elevators were frequent. Packaged pastries are provided in the reception area between 7 and 9 am. Coffee and flavored water is available throughout the day. There is a nice, inexpensive musubi "hole in the wall" cafe just a few meters away.

The Shoreline was just what we were hoping for. The hotel was perfect for us and within our price range in Waikiki. Moderately priced by Waikiki standards, attractive and hip decor and convenient location in the center of Waikiki which is a very busy place. Bus stops close by. We heard no noise from neighboring rooms. Rooms were very clean and attractive with comfortable bedding and shower. Small lanai, refrigerator and coffee maker. Friendly staff that gave good suggestions and good restaurant attached. Our three night stay could not have been better.

I stayed comfortable with my children. It is in a good location and it was also nice to have a drink and a snack bar. We were able to use pool in short time during busy travel time, too.Very nice Shoreline Hotel Waikiki~~!!!!! ^^

We chose Shoreline as the pics in their website looks birght and clean with reasonable prices. Rooms however is quite dated and needs new fresh white lick of paint. Furnitures and fittings are quite run down and the bathroom needs a facelift. Saving grace is the comfortable bed, very friendly service and the ammenities like beach towels and beach chairs available for free. Also, the location behind the main strip is excellentOverall if the rooms are renovated this hotel will be an excellent choice for budget conscious travellers. But for now, be aware that those room photos are dated.

I really want to recommend this hotel. I t´s in the heart of Waikiki, the best location, close to the nice restaurants and shops in a very safe área.The hotel was so cozy and people working there were so nice and helpful, trying to make my staying confortable. They were very helpful with my excursions, giving me very good indications. I felt like at home and for sure I will come back. Thank you to Rick, Venus...

The hotel is convenient to the beach, restaurants and shopping. Staff were great and bed very comfy, quieter than expected given location. Bathrooms need updating but great value for the area. Pool area beautiful and great views from the roof

Very convenient location with tons to eat and shop all within walking distance. Vintage island near by is highly recommended. Hotel is clean and staff were friendly. There was a little mix up on the valet parking as we were misinformed nut the manager resolved it with no issue.

The location to the beach and bus stops was excellent. The room was somewhat small the City View wasn't that great. But the rooms and hotel were very clean. Complimentary continental breakfast. The only thing I didn't like is they charge extra for the coffee pods in your room.

Great location.Friendly staff and good practical room.Breakfast was given in lobby....help yourself.Restaurant beside hotel very good.Main attractions within walking distance.Tour around island very good booked at travel tour company beside hotel.Good price.

Hotel was clean, staff was friendly! Recommend for anyone looking to stay close to Waikiki but don’t want to pay $300/night. 200 yards from the beach, easy walking distance for my 7mo pregnant wife! Definitely would return.

This hotel is a quiet convenient smaller establishment with friendly, helpful desk staff. half a block from the main Waikiki Street(Kalakaua Ave). No extra resort charges. Complimentary coffee, cold drinks and grab and go breakfast in the lobby. Close to all buses. Rooms have coffee maker,fridge and microwave.

We stayed back in 2015, so this was our 2nd time at this hotel. We came as a result of the service we initially received, and they came through again!Due to flight issues, we arrived almost 8 hours late to check-in. We spoke to Josh the night before, and he was very accommodating and helpful in ensuring we weren't penalized for the travel delay.Unfortunately, they now charge a resort fee (unless you book directly on their site, whereby the resort fee will be waived). However, there are a number of "little" things to make you feel like you are getting some value.They still offer refreshments in the lobby ALL day (fruit infused juices, arnold palmer), and coffee / tea. There are 2 small bottles of water in your room daily and in the morning, they also provide granola bars, apples, and muffins. Twice a week, they also offer an afternoon treat of cotton candy. Another addition is a nice little aromatherapy bar in the lobby! (see picture). Beach chairs and beach towels are also available to borrow which is a great perk (thank you!). It's all these little touches, along with the staff that still make the Shoreline a consideration.The location is still amazing, but the downside of the central location is the accompanying noise associated with being in the "heart of it all" (the hotel recognizes noise is a factor and supplies you with earplugs).Overall still good value, Although the staff of the hotel have inherited a building that is an older design - smaller rooms, design limitations, they work hard to make your stay a pleasant one.

Great accommodation. Only downside is the noisy people letting their kids run around the damn hallway, but there isnt much the staff can do about that!Would recommend. Nice and clean.Our only other complaint would be that the pillows are a little lumpy but it was fine.

Rooms were terrible, it looked like a time warped holiday inn from the 90s. Bathroom was gross with ripped shower curtain, and black mold everywhere.There is nothing about this hotel that qualifies it as a supposed 4 star hotel. Be aware when booking and only compare it to the older 3 star or 2 star hotels. The photos are deceiving to make it look like a much nicer hotel than it really is.Had to switch rooms the first night due to a broken safe, ripped shower curtain and blood like stains on the carpet. Outside of the pretty lobby the hotel is extremely beat up.Location is central and staff were nice. Giving review 2 stars as that is what this hotel is.

The location is perfect, 10 minutes walk to the Waikiki beach and famous malls. However, the air conditioner is keeping making noise and I hear noises from the street even I am in the 12th floor. And the towels are dirty and we only use our own towels. I didn't sleep well.

The staff is extremely friendly. The rooms need some updating but are clean and have everything needed for a comfortable stay. The bed was comfortable. I enjoyed the juice and coffee always available in the lobby. The location is perfect in Waikiki. There is a wonderful small restaurant next door which is also very good. I recommend this hotel for those on a budget.

Place was clean with friendly staff. Rooms were cozy, clean linen and house cleaning every day. Could use a bit more storage space but overall great value for money and great stay. They provided muffins and food bars for breakfast every morning along with coffee and tea.Loved that they provided coffee, tea, and variety of fruit flavored drink 24 Hrs a day no need to run to the store to quench that midnight thirst.Close to restaurants and international market place. A vegan/vegetarian restaurant joint was 7 min walk or one bus stop away from hotel. Great food. Close to bus system, tour bus pick up was across the road, short walk to Waikiki beach. Make sure when you stay here visit the Japanese restaurant in the shopping plaza adjacent to hotel.

Thank you for a good stay. We enjoyed our time there. Thank you for the upgrade and complimentary wine. All the staff (front desk and valet) were very friendly. The room is nice and clean. I would recommend this place to my family and friends.

This hotel is older and showing it in some places. The rooms are clean and nicely equipped. The staff was Excellent, very friendly and more than willing to help with any questions.Price is very good for Waikiki. Would stay again.

Everyone was exceptionally friendly and professional. The hotel is in the perfect spot in reference to shopping, restaurants, and hidden perfectly away. I loved the Art Deco. The valet guys were always prompt and kind.

I'll admit, i was skimming through all the usual stuff to skim through on hotel websites at the time of booking. That said, the local rate was the most prominent one and was listed as "lakeina" or something. I don't know what that means and just skimmed through. Sounds ignorant, but it was late at night and I just needed a hotel. Didn't need any local id number when booking, thought it was all good. Day of check-in rolls around and I am told that I need to pay an additional $50 USDs: no deal on valet, +$32 on room, and the resort fee is not waived.)Wasn't really happy about this. Other than that, the hotel is decent for a 3 star. Felt the 'locals-only" rate being so prominently displayed and titled under a hawaiian word was not very 'Aloha'....won't be back.

The Shoreline is in a great location to explore Waikiki, being less than a block from the beach. The staff are very accommodating and friendly. The room are modern and comfortable. I highly recommend thus boutique hotel.

central location, friendly staff, view on one side on lower floors is not great ( old residential building) but overall great. Reception very helpful. Beverages always available in foyer. Very good restaurant next door

Very, very helpful staff at front desk...room was very nice, not extravagant, but then again you are not paying for extravagant...location was a block and half from beach and in middle of major shopping, if that is what you came for...but all in all, a very good value, which is not meant disparagingly as in cheap, but as in you get a very good value for the money. Only complaint was alleged breakfast, which was coffee and a few health bars.

Attention to little details and thoughtfulness made this a fabulous stay! Welcome cards, grab and go breakfast, fresh water in the foyer, great wifi, amazing location, super thoughtful and friendly front desk....Loved the spacious rooms, rood top pool was great, can't fault this hotel! The only place I'll consider next time I come here! Quiet, comfortable and clean!

Searched for months for a moderately priced hotel that could provide an early check in because we were on an early flight from Australia. They offer early and late check in/out for $20 each.A welcoming email a few days before left a great impression but on arrival there wasn't a room available.Venus on front desk was okay but her manager was completely rude. He pointed out my card had not been charged for early check in because it was his new policy. Why? Because they know themselves that their early check in cannot be guaranteed. He said so! So a rubbish policy. We checked out and got an oceanfront select room at the Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel for the same price and couldn't be happier.

Outstanding staff, outstanding room, outstanding location. Staff seam to know your needs before you even ask. This is the best place to stay in the city.Great drinks and snacks were a bonus. Never need to shop for a hotel, this is my only choice will be back soon.

Conveniently located in Waikiki, close to shopping, restaurants and beach. Attached restaurant was a great place to grab a nice healthy breakfast (or you could definitely get less healthy if you wanted )...would stay again!

We made reservations long in advance of our November trip, using Trip Advisor to help us decide where to stay.The hotel was very centrally located to the Waikiki main strip and easy to get back to after a day of touring. The rooms were more than adequate and clean, the front desk staff very friendly and ready to offer advice as to restaurants, etc. After our Norwegian cruise we stayed in a different location (also nice), but not as centrally located to shopping or restaurants. WeWould book the Shoreline again if the future takes us back to Honolulu! Paul & Paula (FL). P.S. the flavored waters in the hotel foyer were always a treat to come back to. Breakfast was not much, but we managed to find a McDonalds around the corner to get a hot breakfast every day!

This stay was only for one night as we decided to stay after my husband's unit Christmas party. Room was ok, it was clean and updated but nothing spectacular. They provide ear plugs as the street noise gets very loud. We did forget my husband's electric toothbrush, which we remember right away (we live 20 mins from the hotel by Pearl Harbor side) but they did not even put the effort into looking into it. I am pretty sure someone took it home instead of turning it in. Very disappointing. Shoulda just spent that extra $20 to stay at the Sheraton or Modern.

I looked hard for a reasonably priced place to stay in Waikiki, and found it at Shoreline. The staff were excellent. Great coffee, muffins waffles and energy bars each morning. Rooms were cleaned well, and in a timely manner each day.

The rooms are a little small but when you are so busy exploring the beauty of Hawaii who cares! The hotel is spotless with a beautiful foyer and front desk staff who are always smiling :-)It is central to everything Waikiki has to offer and if you want to go a little further most buses or tour vans pick up across the road or on the adjacent street by the DFS.I really can't speak highly enough of the wonderful time we had while staying here, fresh fruit spiked water available all day in the foyer and even cotton candy once a week!! Ronaldo and the front desk staff are just amazing, they have a wealth of local knowledge and are always keen to see how your day went, we will definitely stay here again and recommend it to anyone wanting to explore Hawaii.

This is a great little boutique hotel. Very clean and comfortable in a central Waikiki location. Solid basic amenities for a 3 star hotel property. Busy, nice little organic restaurant adjacent to the hotel.Some traffic and outside noise, but nothing too bad.Good value for money here. Recommended.

From the minute we checked in until we left we were extremely impressed with the welcoming atmosphere. Great central location to everything. Rooms were perfectly adequate for the two of us and beds were super comfortable. Rooftop pool was small but clean with great ocean views. The breakfast muffins in the morning were a lovely addition. Would definitely stay here again...

It is a great hotel with a nice location (nearby shops, waikiki beach and restaurants), the rooms are clean and big. The peope are friendly and helpfull. Bus stop with a lot of bus lines around the corner.

All in all, a good choice and a positive experience at the Shoreline. Pros: an excellent location, very close to the beach and steps from great restaurants, nightlife options and shopping; friendly, accommodating staff; bright and cheerful decor with a beach vibe; good beds (definitely on the firm side) and pillows. Cons: a small rooftop pool up two flights of stairs with a very small, somewhat shabby deck area - uninviting; tiny (enough room for one small chair) or no balconies off the rooms; a general sense that the transformation from its prior incarnation to a cool boutique hotel is not quite complete, with renovation ongoing (though not disruptive during my stay). Overall, it had enough “pros” to consider staying here again and the location in Waikiki is terrific. If you want a great hotel pool, though, this may not be the best call for you.

Excellent location, near all the shops and restaurant of waikiki. Easy access to local bus routes. Pool is small but nice view on the top floor. Fresh coffee and muffins every morning in the lobby. Personnel very friendly.

The room was quiet and clean and well equipped, and staff was welcoming. They allowed early check in and answered all our questions. Jordan even sent an email before arrival asking if we had any special needs. Well done Shoreline! Waikiki is expensive and this was more than i would have paid for a similar room back home, but such is the going rate at this location.

Very good hotel, the beach was literally just across the road, our room had a great sea view. The only problem with the hotel is that they serve flat beer.Good 'in house' travel information/car hire.Lift system a little bit strange but efficient.

Seemingly recently remodeled hotel in the center of Waikiki. Right across from two parking structures and all the restaurants shops and beach one could want. The staff was helpful and the location is convenient

Excellent location. Very friendly staff. Sadly, the balconies are too small. Two people can not sit down and have a cup of coffee. Need renovation in the near future and building next door giving a bad impression

The hotel was very central(1 block to Waikiki beach) and right in the middle of shopping and a variety of restaurants. We were one block from the main bus station to book scenic and city tours. We found the rooms very clean and the staff were friendly and helpful. We would definitely stay here again. Excellent value for the dollar.

This is our second time staying at the Shoreline as its a great location. Rooms are nice, clean and staff are really accomodating and very friendly. Complimentary breakfast and flavoured waters are a nice touch. I got caught out with the phone bill as I didn't realise ringing mainland USA was so expensive, when I was recovering a lost item from previous days travel. Didn't realise being an international traveller, but no fault of the hotel. Still didn't make it to the pool as we were always on the beach.

The location of Shoreline is perfect for those holidaying without a vehicle. It is one block from Waikiki beach, a 2 min walk to the trolley station on the next street over and right in the hub of shopping, entertainment and restaurants.The staff at shoreline were all helpful and accommodating. There is a grab and go breakfast station each morning from 7am to 9am. Id definitely stay here again.

The location is really good. Right next to Ross and minutes from the beach.Rooms are clean and the hotel staff is super friendly and helpful. They have coffee and really nice flavored water out in the lobby 24-7.Valet parking is expensive at $30, but it's really quick and convenient.

the location is pretty good, approximately 12 mimute drive to the volcano national park. The room is super clean and easy check in. The google GPS can navigate to the front door. If you don't have google map, the nice owner will send you a direction (really easy to find).

So conveniently located, comfortable rooms, and great little restaurant next door for breakfast or a healthy lunch and dinner. You're walking distance from everything and it's just a good deal. They also have flavored waters and complimentary coffee in the lobby day and night.

My wife and I really enjoyed our stay at the shoreline hotel in Waikiki The location was great and Central to downtown Waikiki. Rooms are very nice and the bed was very comfortable. We got several emails from the hotel prior to our arrival and after our arrival making sure that we were well taken care of, which we were.Thank you Shoreline.By the way I would love to see some improvements on the pool deck, a glass rail would give you incredible views from the pool at the top of the hotel and turn the deck into an outstanding hotel feature.
user_name:
Brett T
Big Bear Lake, California

review_body: We changed from one of the expensive popular hotels on the front for the Shoreline because the price was quite good, we were only there three nights and were doing two day trips so felt it was not worth staying at a better hotel with facilities we wouldn't use. On the positive, the staff were nice and friendly, complimentary cold drinks and coffee and muffins and cereal bars in the morning was a bonus. It was also well positioned as we were picked up outside Ross department store right opposite the hotel for our trips. However, we were put on a lower floor which the receptionist said would be quiet, but it wasn't. The view was a building. The room was adequate but dated and didn't feel really clean, maybe because the bathroom and furniture were old. Yet it said refurbished in the description of the hotel. The double glazed window was permanently misty, so was obviously broken, and the little balcony did not look at all appealing. Air conditioning was noisy. Swimming pool did not live up to its photographs. There seemed to be no information folder in the room and it was only as we left we discovered there were towels for the pool in reception. Maybe we had a poor room, and poor position, but I wouldn't rush back there.

Although smaller rooms they were clean and comfortable.So central. 10 mins walk to Waikiki beach. Main street 5 mins away and sooo many shops.Close to trolley stops and of course an ABC store not far away.Across the road pickup stop for many tours.Don't miss the fairy floss between 3 & 4 pm weekdays(lovely bonus) Even though brekkie not included lots of nice snacks available in lobby.Rooftop pool was soooo nice and refreshing.

Excellent centrally located Hotel, very reasonably priced, exceptionally helpful and charming staff at all levels! Throughly recommended! Look forward to staying again when visiting Oahu and Waikiki. Mahalo!

This is my fourth time staying here and it will forever be my favorite place. The price is great, the location is ridiculous(in the BEST WAY), the staff always smiling and willing to help, the lobby is dope also. The room I stayed in was a king with a view of some apartments but I didn’t mind that. The room was exactly what was needed and that bed! My gosh it was sofT( capital T). I really enjoy staying here and for the price, location, staff, rooms, and service provided I plan on staying here whenever I escape Kaneohe haha

I absolutely loved my stay at Shoreline Hotel Waikiki! The room was super clean and location was right in the middle of Waikiki. I was able to walk or Uber everywhere I wanted to go. I'll be staying here again for sure!!

Stayed at this hotel for two nights. Very nice hotel, clean modern rooms, pleasant workers. It is about a 5 minute stroll to the beach in a lovely area. Would recommend it to stay at. Local taxi and bus services to take you to the airport or Pearl Harbor.

This Hotel is Amazing: clean, spacious, modern, cozy and exclusive. The staff is Wonderful! specially Josh (in the front desk) who made sure everyday I had everything I needed and more! The moment I arrived they upgraded my room to a suite on the top floor of the hotel (14th floor) and spoiled me like a Princess! :) I will definitely come back to this Hotel every time I travel to Honolulu and I highly recommend it if you are looking for a 5 star experience! - Ana from Los Angeles

Very well coming friendly helpful staff. Plenty of goodies In the room and lobby. Small roof top pool. Wi-Fi was good, bed was comfortable had lovely view of the city from my room also had ear plugs available in case it get too noisy. Rooms were small but liveable. Location was prefect right in the centre of everything. Walking distance to the beach and shops.

Please make customers aware of the second card to operate the air conditioner. This was not explained to us on our first visit and caused confusion. This was was rectified on our second stay there. The availability of refreshments 24/7 was very good and also the breakfast snacks were well received plus snacks during the day.

Stayed here one night on route to catch the cruise ship. Arrived very late due to late plane arrival. Night staff coped well. Was able to walk down to the beach. Staff organised taxi to the cruise terminal. Room very pleasent. Took breakfast in next door resturant.

From the moment we arrived the staff at the hotel could not have been more helpful and are among the best we have ever come across on all our holidays. This included the first class front desk staff as well as all the other staff we met. The location is perfect as we were just a few minutes form the beach and main street. There was complementary coffee and breakfast muffins as well as various cold juices available. Although our room did not have a great view it was ideal for us.

Great boutique hotel in the heart of waikiki very clean and comfortable! King bed was firm. Complimentary breakfast muffins and coffee were a welcomed perk. The valet was spot on and very fast. Great food nearby and very walkable to the beach and local shopping. Fair price and the staff were fantastic. Also provided chairs and towels for the beach. Roof top pool was appealing and had great views. A good place to stay.

Everything about the experience was top-notch Joshat the front desk was awesome .Sonny in the valet, housekeeping staff.The room was cute and clean. I deffinatly would stay again. Great location can walk everywhere

I had an outstanding say at Shoreline Hotel...From the moment I walked into the hotel to the time I left. When I arrived, I was greeted by Josh...He was beyond welcoming. I was given an immediate upgrade. I felt at home in my room and my view was outstanding...The location is ideal. It was less than a 5 min walk to the beach and I was in a shopper paradise in less than a minute.Josh also referred me to Yianni , who provided an excellent island tour. Hi5tours made my stay even more enjoyable. If ever in Waikiki again, I'll be sure to book my accommodations w/ Shoreline Hotel.

The central location is wonderful if you don't mind walking around town for a bit. If you want to grab an Uber or taxi the road is not busy so packing or unpacking bags out of a vehicle is low pressure. Heck Ross is right across the street so if you're traveling light take two steps and you're through the door. Pick up a few nice things for yourself and enjoy the rest of your trip. There's something about having an affordable clothes store close by to where your staying if you're in a jam. I will definitely be staying here again. The work team was fantastic at giving instructions about how the room is quipped with a key for the A/C unit and various electronics and had excellent eye contact explaining the amenities that are offered. The only thing I did notice was a little bit of mold on the ceiling above the door in the bathroom. I am a reasonable person and I don't consider that to be a deal breaker but any logical person could easily equate that to a bath tub running over on the floor above. Over all the place was spot on and served its purpose for a get away with my friends for a local event going on in Waikiki.

Great location a stones throw from Waikiki Beach and all the best of the stores are within 5 mins walk. The rooms were airy and clean and a good size. The staff were great and very helpful. Would recommend.

We stayed at shoreline during our honeymoon. The hotel was clean and comfortable. The location was great, easy to get around Waikiki. The staff was friendly and helpful. I would defiantly stay here again.

My boyfriend and I wanted to plan a nice getaway for our anniversary and I also wanted to see my best friend who is living on the island. I did a lot of research between AirBnB and hotels. Shoreline kept popping up and the price with the location was really unbeatable for the area. I lived there last year and knew the area well and how expensive it can get being in that part of Waikiki. The day before we flew out, a representative e-mailed me to see if there was anything the hotel could make out stay more enjoyable. I mentioned we were celebrating our anniversary. We live in San Francisco/Berkeley area and honestly couldn't have picked a better weekend to leave with the smoke from the fires being as thick as it was in the area. We were greeted with a very friendly receptionist at the Shoreline. We made it to our room and shortly after received a complimentary bottle of wine. Later (to our delight), we realized we had also received a room upgrade. The room was clean and had air conditioning... all i could want, honestly! There was free water, coffee and tea in the lobby at all times. Free breakfast goodies in the morning. There was even free cotton candy at one point! The rooftop pool was small but nice with a great view. Heavenly is the restaurant attached to the hotel- breakfast was great and my mimosa was delightful. Bottom line, we had an incredibly relaxing and enjoyable stay and will definitely stay here in the future.

This hotel is simple, spacious and clean. It has air conditioning and a balcony with just a short walk to the beach. The restaurant joining the hotel was also one of the best meals in Waikiki, perfect for breakfast!

I have stayed here once before. I was nice. It's not a resort but everything was nice, clean, and well kept. The location is great. Across from a Ross and an ABC convenience store, which was great when I wanted a couple quick things for the beach. It was only 1 to 2 blocks to the beach and popular restaurants. Also only 2 blocks from my favorite bar in Waikiki, Kelly O'Neil's! My room was clean. Bed was comfy. AC was cold. It had a mini fridge, safe, iron, hair dryer and and all the other regular amenities. The balcony was small but offered a view of the mountains and was good for a quick morning weather check. No surprise, beautiful weather. There was a 3 to 5 foot deep pool on the roof which had a partial view of the ocean looking past the Royal Hawaiian hotel. Towels provided. The valet and 24hrs. parking was only $15 (incredibly cheap for Waikiki) because I had a Kama‘aina (local) ID. The staff was very helpful and friendly. I will definitely stay here again. I choose it for the price and it was well worth it!

We stayed at Shoreline Hotel for 5 nights. Every single stuff we encountered were nice, caring and helpful. When my husband needed to print some documents, front desk stuff was right there to help him with what he needed. Everyone just didn't say Aloha, they remembered us and always asked us to see how we were doing. Room was nice and comfy, housekeeping stuff were nice, super quick response when we needed something. Excellent location in Waikiki. Oh, don't let me forget to mention HEAVENLY Waikiki, excellent restaurant with Organic choices! I have nothing but good things to say about this place. Highly recommended. I will definitely stay here again.

Excellent location and value for money, very friendly staff, lovely amenities. Unlike other enormous Waikiki hotels has a very friendly feel. We were allowed a late checkout which was very much appreciated. Great restaurant/café next door.

Allow me to say the bad stuff first because it’s 60% of it for me, but it may not be for somebody else. The rooms in this hotel are VERY VERY SMALL. Small rooms that fit even smaller beds. Queens beds are Full, Kings beds are barely Queens. My friends who were 6’3 feet (him athletic build and 6’0 (her) very thin were not comfortable at all. They stated the beds were “too short” and “too small”. They spent most of there time in the lobby and out of the room. If your are person with let us say a big frame or short and thick one Queen bed (full) will be just enough for one. If you can get pass the tiny house fever this is a good spot. ** see photos Good stuff: It was clean, smelled good, free coffee, flavor water, and cotton candy for the kids. There is a great Restaurant next door with the BEST coffee. Did I mention Organic food served there can’t remember the name. It is a the perfect spot walking distance from beach, malls, and a few good restaurants.

It was my first time visiting Hawaii and this was a pleasant place to stay. The staff was very friendly and after staying at a resort on Maui, the Shoreline was superb. The fact that they had very good, hot coffee in the lobby 24-7 along with granola bars and muffins every morning before we started our day adds so much to the overall stay. The location was perfect as well; a block from all the shops and two blocks from the beach. The city buses are close by as well as Diamond Head mountain.

We had a great stay at Shoreline. Staff were friendly and location was great, an easy walk to everywhere we wanted. Loved the breakfast/snack foods and water in the foyer each morning. Rooftop pool was small and not too inviting but with the beach 5 min walk away we didn't mind.

The rooms were very clean & comfortable, the service fabulous & I loved the cafe next door. The location was perfect for exploring Waikiki.The only downside was the roof top swimming pool was poorly designed ...

We opted for this spot based on some good reviews. We ended up being just a short walk from our friends at the Outrigger Beach. Waikiki is expensive and I am happy for the services and location. The Lana’i holds one chair so... not much to say there, except it a short walk up to the pool that provides a great dip and stunning views. The sound of the vent system is loud but easy to tune out. Josh at the front desk was friendly and helpful. We appreciated the morning snacks, tea, coffee and the infused water each time we came in or out. Some times it takes work to stay hydrated.The bed was very comfy and our room was very quiet. I was a little worried when they left us earplugs but they were not necessary.

Shoreline Hotel Waikiki did not disappoint. The room was clean upon arrival and the employees were very friendly and helpful. The hotel is near stores and just a short walk to Waikiki Beach. The price was awesome for the location! I would definitely stay here again.

Good value and location. Pool area really small, but I guess that's expected in Honolulu. Walking distance to lots of bars and restaurants. Would be nice if there was airport transportation provided by shoreline.

My daughter and I spent a fantastic 7 days at the Shoreline. It was great value for money. The staff were friendly, helpful and accommodating. Our rooms were serviced daily and were well maintained. The roof top pool hosted some nice views of the surrounds.The shoreline provided complimentary breakfast snacks and coffee in the foyer for breakfasts on the go, which were handy for early tour pick ups. With a convenient and popular tour pickup located across the street.We also loved the location. It is centrally located and is a short walk to the Main Street, shopping and restaurants and an easy stroll to Waikiki Beach. We thoroughly enjoyed our work stay and can't wait to come back. Thanks Shoreline

Good location. Not fussy or fancy but good value for money. helpful friendly staff and get up early enough and there's a reasonable choice of take-away breakfast.everything worked and even enough room for one person at a time to stand, petrified, on the balcony!For the money it was well worth it!

We used this hotel as our 'first night' option before taking the island cruise the next day. Really glad we did. It is a pleasant hotel, not flashy but functional. It's upsides were its location, cleanliness and really helpful staff (although they tried to charge us valet parking when we just flown in and had ordered a taxi from them for the next morning!!) I managed to bash my shin on their very sturdy solid wood bedstead which sticks out much further than the mattress, so be careful! It was a good night's sleep but don't expect breakfast as there isn't really any. The streets were very noisey but by around midnight it seemed to be very quiet. Happy to use this again and to recommend it.

Not a flashy hotel but does everything a hotel should do well, the location is just off Kalakaua Avenue, which is the main street through Waikiki with all the shops you should ever want. Forget the hotel pool which is on the roof which is sufficient but why would you want it when Waikiki Beach is a couple of blocks away, about 10 mins walking slowly. The rooms are spacious and very clean. The staff couldn't be friendlier or more helpful. Stayed twice before and after our cruise. They provide towels and chairs for the beach so no need to take your own. Microwave, coffee and fridge in the rooms. Wouldn't hesitate about staying there again.

I really enjoyed my stay at Shoreline!For me one of the reasons for selecting Shoreline was the proximity to the beach and downtown and I was very satisfied with both!I will certainly recommend Shoreline.

This was the second time that I have stayed here. Both times have been exceptional! The staff are extremely friendly and courteous. They go out of their way to do what they can to help you. The room was very nice with a great view of Waikiki. There is a great rooftop pool with a 360 degree view from the ocean to the mountains. I would highly recommend the Shoreline to everyone! Here are some pics of the lobby, 2 of the awesome front desk staffers, and a shot of Waikiki from my balcony.

Very convenient location to restaurants and shopping. Clean rooms and helpful staff. Good value for price. Bedding was excellent along with bath towels. Small continental breakfast and coffee provided.

Just wrapped-up another great 4-night stay at the Shoreline. What a comfortable / super-affordable / centrally located hotel in Waikiki! Its 1/2 a block from all the buzz of Kalakaua Ave without the big-resort price. Had an easy stroll to the Waikiki beach via public access (Shoreline has towels & beach chairs for borrowing). Rooms have a boutique hotel feel supported by a super-friendly staff. Try Heavenly Restaurant right off the lobby - had a great late afternoon meal there. After this business trip, I've concluded Shoreline is my go-to hotel in Waikiki!!

We really enjoyed our stay. The rooms are a bit small, but we had a big balcony (just with one chair, no table). The staff was so friedly and helpful. The valet parking was great and so quick.The little pool on the roof was good- not all of the Waikiki Hotels have one.The best ist, it is almost on Kalakaua Avenue, wich is the main street on the beach of Waikiki. We plan to come back.

I've been looking for a new business hotel in Honolulu and decided to try the Shoreline, mainly because of the proximity to my business appointments. What a great find! The front desk staff was so helpful, assisted with adjusting my reservation and recommended the wonderful Heavenly restaurant adjacent to the hotel. Loved the snacks and drinks in the lobby, my room was clean with a nice spacious bathroom and closet. Right in the heart of the shopping district in Waikiki-close to everything!

Very happy with this hotel, very convenient to. The beach and the buses that get you anywhere for $2.50USD. The staff friendly and helpful. Towels and beach chairs supplied for your day at the beach. The hotel is a little dated but very clean and beds and shower great . We did not book a sea view as we were never in our room only to sleep. There is free tea and coffee always in foyer but the complimentary breakfast is not great . Would definitely stay again and loved Hawaii

I want to give this a higher rating because it was lovely, modern and clean, in a great location and has free snacks and drinks in the lobby! The huge downside is that it was so noisy I barely slept the 2 nights we stayed even after wearing the "complimentary" ear plugs on the bedside (a huge warning sign!!). The balcony window is not double glazed so you can hear every car/garbage truck/party goer going past. Added to that was the lift right beside our door - it squeaks every time someone goes up or down so constantly wakes you up. Apart from this, we enjoyed our stay! Stayed in a standard room with a queen bed which was a decent size.

The hotel was clean and air conditioned. It was close to shops and eateries. A short walk to the beach. Roof-top pool was a plus after a swim. Concierge staff were always polite and helpful. Room had coffee machine and mini fridge allowing us to keep things for our outings. Grab and go breakfast not that great but organic cafe next door had good food and offered a 10% discount for guests. Couldn't have asked for more.

Nice place and many attraction around there. Easy for finding food and club and lovely staffs. Just 5 mins.to see waikiki beach and sleep on the sand and let the spirit down. The best place for family to take kid to stay and also at the reception has the drink 24 hours and also some snacks in the morning.

I investigated quite a few hotels before reserving at Shoreline Waikiki as we only had 1 night to spend in Honolulu. Great choice - centrally located, and good value for the $. We booked direct thru the hotel avoiding the $20 amenities fee and getting an excellent discount for booking in advance. Extremely comfortable room, great pressure/hot water in the shower, coffee/choice of beverages in lobby and outstanding customer service from every employee we interacted with. Highly recommend a stay here.

This place is located super close to everything! 5 mins walk to Waikiki beach and all the shopping. There is a really nice organic cafe located next door called Heavenly - we ate here 3 times during our 4 day stay - there is a line but it moves quickly. They do take away which is super quick so we grabbed takeaway Acai bowls and took them to the beach!Bed is comfortable, very basic amenities included. There is no kettle but there is a coffee pod machine which is complementary for the first night then charged thereafter (like the 2 bottles of water in the mini bar). The bathroom for us wasn't very nice at all - the water wouldn't drain properly in the shower and the bath would fill up with water. Also no one helped us with our luggage when we arrived or left and the automatic door at the entry was not automatic so we had to struggle with trying to push open the door and push our suitcases through. I don't mind carrying my own luggage but when you're evidently struggling to open the door and carry your suitcase up the stairs, a hand would have been nice. If you want something reasonably priced, good location this is great. Bed was comfy and you can get beach towels and chairs from reception which was good.

We have stayed at Shoreline Hotel twice now and have been satisfied both times. Because it's a smaller hotel the service is more personal and friendly than some of the larger hotels in Waikiki. ( we have stayed at a larger hotel previously but prefer Shoreline) Although the rooms and bathroom are a little small they are very clean, comfortable beds and quite adequate in providing a fridge and microwave. The location is excellent and within easy reach to the beach, shops and restaurants. Free services available include beach towels, beach umbrellas, beach chairs, wifi, tea & coffee & cold drinks available in the lobby, daily newspaper and now grab and go breakfast options. Service by the staff is excellent and provide helpful advice and directions, maps and sightseeing. We would definately recommend Shoreline Hotel and would definately stay there agaun next time we are in Waikiki.

I really loved this place. It's right in the heart of Waikiki. We walked everywhere from the hotel. I love that it had a balcony, rooftop pool, free wifi, free muffins in the morning, fridge, microwave. It had everything we would have wanted. It was a great value and had special rate since we live on the big island. I highly recommend this place! Staff are really friendly and accommodating. The beds are super comfy.

On arrival we were met by Josh, who dealt with us efficiently and was very friendly, he gave us an upgrade, which was very kind. A minimal breakfast was provided. The room rate was expensive, but that's Waikiki for you and the rate here compared favourably with similar hotels. The location was excellent for beach, shopping, restaurants and public transport. Overall, our experience was a happy one.

The attitude and service of the staff was very good. Parking was expensive at $30 per day. The provision of breakfast snacks in reception each morning was very good as well as the 24 hour provision of tea/coffee/drinking chocolate/cool drinks free of charge.We booked five nights of the heavenly breakfast coupons for the café next door but cancelled them after the first morning's experience. With the coupon at $15 each, there is a very limited choice of four breakfast plates and we did not fancy them. A waiter was also bad-mannered when after queuing for 20 mins and being taken to our table by one waiter, another waiter accused us of jumping the queue. It appears to be a popular venue but we would recommend eating elsewhere for breakfast. With reference to location, it is very central although our 2nd floor city view consisted of looking into the garage of the hotel next door. Other members of our family managed to get good deals at other hotels located on the beach so our recommendation is to check with people with respect to deals which might be available at the time of your visit.

We stayed at Shoreline hotel for 7 nights and we really enjoyed our stay. Location is very convenient, and all the staff was really nice. The restaurant downstairs is really good and a lot of nice places to eat and shop in the area. We would definitely go back.

Friendly, helpful staff, we received a room upgrade as we were celebrating our wedding anniversary- much appreciated. Rooftop pool is nice to have but could be made more inviting. Overall though great

The location of this hotel is great. Near bus routes, the beach and shops. Great organic restaurant adjoining. Friendly and accommodating staff. Free use of beach umbrellas, towels and chairs for the beach.

We visit Waikiki frequently. For us being on the beach is not a must. Location to the heart of Waikiki with its shopping, dining and entertainment options is key. The Shoreline Waikiki is perfect if this is your goal. For beach / ocean views there are great restaurants and lounges located along the coast. At the Shoreline we en Pinterest a smaller uncluttered property with a warm staff and nice small touches to enhance your experience. We particularly enjoyed the infused water options and Arnold Palmers offered in the lobby. After a hot day of exploring it was a welcome treat.

The hotel is stylish with cool retro decor, great location, reasonably priced, and perfectly clean. There are shops all around. Walking to Waikiki beach is easy and the hotel provides towels. Free refreshments is a plus!

Our lovely daughter had booked us a surprise trip to Hawaii and not knowing where Shoreline Hotel is situated, we were very impressed by the location, like a few minutes away from the main street, various eateries & the most important the famous Waikiki beach. We arrived very early in the morning & were greeted by very friendly staff and surprise we were upgraded to the top floor and accessed to room straight away.The highlight was the Hotel's tour "Hi 5" guided by friendly Ioannis. He was so knowledgeable & fun to be with. And not sure if we are allowed to mention/announce this & hopefully he won't get in trouble, Ioannis is a professional photographer, a bonus; that means he sent us all the beautiful shots by the time we retire to our hotel room. What a service and couldn't do better than that with other tours!We were very impressed all in all. Day and night staff were very helpful and friendly. We would definitely stay there again and recommend to friends and others.

Small boutique hotel. We were upgraded to a part sea view room as we were celebrating an anniversary. It was a nice touch but I wouldn't pay for the view we got. You could just see the sea through some pretty ugly buildings. We were also sent a bottle of red wine to our room which was a nice touch. The pillows were too fat for me as I have a neck injury and when I asked for a thinner one they told me they were all the same size. Everyone has different pillow needs. Perhaps they should all be thin and those that like fat pillows can use two. Had to sleep with earplugs as the air con is very noisy. The fact there were earplugs provided should ring alarm bells :). The hotel was very clean. The staff were very cheerful and helpful. Every morning they had tea, coffee and cake muffins that you could grab and go. Some mornings there was no milk but you are not paying for a breakfast so cant really complain. Sometimes not enough staff behind desk and you can wait a while if you need something. The pool is much smaller than it appears and the hotel could do some work to make it more appealing. Hotel is in fab location and reasonably priced for Waikiki. Would use again.

Booked this place for my parents as a surprise trip to Honolulu. The Shoreline went above and beyond to make my parents 8 day stay a wonderful experience, in particular, the night auditor Yianni, who doubled as a tour guide. I booked my parents on an island tour with Yianni's Hi5 Tours - which was the highlight of my parents trip. He took them around the whole island and showed them some great local spots that they never would have seen had it not been for Yianni and his great local knowledge and warm hospitality. He also took some beautiful photos of my parents which was another added bonus to an already unforgettable day. Couldn't recommend this tour enough! And thank you Shoreline Hotel for your wonderful staff and great hotel. Next time I'm in Waikiki will definitely be staying here and so will my parents! Thank you Yianni and co!

My wife and I stayed here for 6 nights and overall really enjoyed our stay there. The location is just perfect for Waikiki being very close to the beach, shopping, restaurants etc. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful offering fruit infused chilled water and coffee all day and muffins and fruit bars for breakfast. You can also get towels, chairs and umbrellas from reception to take to the beach which is very handy. The rooms are of a decent size and very clean and our room on the 12th floor had glimpses of the ocean. Our only complaints would be that the bed is a bit small and quite hard, the rooftop pool is a bit average and the balcony to our room was extremely small. We thought for the price and location we would recommend this hotel.

I heard about the hotel through a friend at work. Booked it for a week and it was defiantly a good choice. The staff was very polite, and help full with assisting with direction and giving great tips and advice on where to eat and explore
user_name:
edwing38
South Ozone Park, New York

review_body: This hotel was just perfect for our honeymoon. The staff were lovely, the rooms were spacious and very clean.Location is right in the heart of Waikiki Beach.They provided flavoured water drinks in reception all day long and if you got up early enough there were breakfast treats provided free of charge.The restaurant that was next door (10% off if you were staying at the Shoreline) made a fantastic green curry.

Second stay at Shoreline..we were determined to stay here after first time 5 yrs ago..the place is in the best location, central to everything..buses..beach..restaurants and Ross store..staff were awesome..rooms are terrific and coffee and cold drinks in lobby awesome..don't stay anywhere else..we won't and I'm a hard person to please...thank you Shoreline..would recommend to any Aussies going there.

I would definitely stay here again. I was on the 14th floor with a seaview, which i highly recommend. The tiny balcony has one chair and that is all that fits. It was perfect for me since I was traveling solo. My room was next to the elevator,but I hardly heard it. It never bothered me. If you are a sensitive sleeper it may be a problem. The rooftop pool is on the 14th floor and was great: quiet, secluded, and clean. My one complaint is the coffee issue. I consider coffee to be a essential at hotels. The Shoreline has Kuerig coffee makers. They give you pods for the first day, but you have to buy the pods after the first day ($2 per pod)! You may as well buy them from the hotel or bring from home. And I have issues with the waste from these pod coffee makers.

We stayed at Shoreline in August 2017 on our first visit to Waikiki. Amazing location (less than 5 min walk to the beach and lots of shops and restaurants even closer), clean and spacious room, comfy bed, friendly staff, everything you could hope for. We also took the hotel up on their offer of a 'starter' breakfast each morning to get you going (waffles, muesli bars) and borrowed their beach umbrellas and beach towels daily. Only complaints: I don't remember reading anywhere during booking about the $20 daily rate for 'amenities', no shade on the rooftop for the pool and the view from our balcony was of a really run down, dodgy looking set of units. If you can live with those things (which we definitely could!) we'd highly recommend staying here!

Great staff, modern entryway and feel. The restaurant inside was extremely good. The rooms, however, were under expectation based off of the price that was paid. Would recommend the hotel's restaurant but not for staying overnight.

This was our first time to Waikiki so I knew we would be out on the island ALL day long. The Shoreline is Conveniently located in the heart of Waikiki, if you are looking for a good room to utilize for sleeping only, this will do. It is not a fancy Resort with a view, however, if you go to the roof top, there is a decent view of the ocean. I believe a great investment for this hotel would be to put up a clear glass half-wall on the beach side of the roof-top-pool railing, then you could enjoy a nice cup of coffee at the pool with a view. I will also admit, at first glance I was not impressed with the hotel or the room, however, the staff were incredibly nice and helpful. It is VERY close to the shops and nice resorts on the beach.

For the price we paid, it's not a great space. We could've done better. The pros - it's clean enough, aircon was functioning perfectly and the hotel was centrally located.The cons - we were on the 2nd floor and stepping in the room and seeing a pair of ear plugs was not a good sign, at around 430am you'll find out why. You'll hear garbage trucks and other noises very early in the morning. The space is very small for the price. Not quite I imagined it as seen in the photos. We had a balcony, but it's not worth stepping out there. It just felt dirty.If the price was half we paid for, I'd recommend it for a night's stay. But the value just isn't there. Great location though as it's walking distance to the shopping street, restaurants, etc.

Perfect location - close to everything, very clean room, staff were very friendly and went above expectation. Even though we booked room only simple breakfast, coffee and tea served in the morning. Highly recommended! We will definitely stay here again on our next trip.

The staff were brilliant and very helpful esp Jordan. The foyer was vibrant and stocked with drinks and good tunes. Unfortunately the room was a bit disappointing. A little outdated and view wasn't pleasant but you get what you pay for. Mini fridge and safe in room were beneficial

Location, service, clean - overall satisfied.View of hotel is not good. but you'll spend most of time outside.But, I strongly request to chage the hair dryer.It's so old and handle are a little bit sticky.It operates well but not likely to use it.

Lots of positives for this hotel. The renovation is lovely and it is very, very clean and tidy. Comfortable beds and nice linen. Upgrade was available on request, as we had lots of luggage and needed a cot in our room for our 1 year old.The staff go above and beyond, are friendly and knowledgeable about their local area.Simple breakfast and coffee served in the mornings. Fruit infused water available all day. Close to everything- location is fantastic!Good moderate budget hotel.There are some steps at the front, so if you have lots of luggage or a pram (we had both), it's a bit of a pain. Aircon struggled a bit in the heat.Pool area is small - good for a dip, but not really a lounge about all day kind of pool. Luckily the beach is just a few minutes walk away.Close to shopping, restaurants and cafes. Didn't eat at the cafe attached to the hotel, however, the food looked amazing.Would recommend!

Perfectly located in Waikiki and close to everything that you need. Room was clean and great in this perfect boutique hotel. Staff were very helpful and provided a pleasant experience. Many thanks to Yianni from Hi5Hawaii.com for all the excellent tour advice and knowledge on the best sights and tours available. Without this insight we would not have got to enjoy the full Hawaiian experience.

I was in Hawaii for a wedding and booked the Shoreline because it was in my budget and I figured I wouldn't be in the room much anyway. Compared to the other hotels in the area, I had very low expectations but they were completely blown away. All the members of the staff are so attentive and friendly. They knew my name by the 2nd day. The hotel isn't on the beach but about 5 minute walk from anywhere in Waikiki you want to be. Based on the price I was afraid the room wouldn't be clean, but everything in the room from the carpet, bed linens, to the bathroom were spotless each day. I had originally booked 5 days but after the first day I cancelled my "luxury" hotel reservation for twice the price and booked another stay at the Shoreline. All the other guests at the wedding were jealous I had found such an affordable yet comfortable hotel to stay in a central location. My only complaint is that the TV system is a little weird to navigate. I like some white noise while I sleep and I ended up finding 50 channels of infomercials. Would help if they had a TV channel list. The rooftop pool is nothing special and a little small but front desk offers beach towels, chairs, and umbrellas to use at the beach.

I searched and searched for the right hotel and I read review after review and I honestly wanted to stay right on the beach and was disappointed to know that this wasn't an option for us financially. After reading the reviews for Shoreline I had pretty high expectations and was not disappointed one bit. From their prompt email responses to pre welcome weather information, their customer service is on point. Nothing was an issue, Jordan knew who we were when we arrived and how many rooms were in my name. Zhi was also extremely good at his jobThe pool is perfect size for a swim (when the beach is too busy) and laze....it gets sun all day long. The room was perfect, the aircon worked a treat. The cute balcony looked out to the ocean. They offered me a place to safely park my bike, they had a generous breakfast selection in the lobby, tea and coffee as well as beautifully flavoured waters all day round. Free candy floss in the afternoon as well. The location was perfect. I would highly recommend the Shoreline hotel to anyone. I don't think I'll say anywhere else in Waikiki now. Thanks guys for the best little holiday I've had in years.

Staff is always attentive and friendly. The hotel makes up for the lack of a view by being in the a great location in Waikiki - quick walk to the beach, shopping, dining and city transportation. Room is comfortable and quiet, great to relax and rest up for the next days' activities. This was the second time I stayed here, was able to check in earlier and out later so I was able to enjoy more of the amenities and explore.

Wow, what a fabulous hotel! I made a last minute change to stay here for 6 nights at the end of July and it was the best decision I could have made! The room was great with lots of room and a balcony, the pool on the roof was fab, and I usually got it all to myself! The staff were really helpful and friendly, couldn't ask for a better vacation!It was my first vacation by myself and they made me feel very at ease and welcome. The breakfast and refreshment bar is a really nice touch also. Highly recommend The Shoreline and will definitely be back!

Our stay at Shoreline was perfect from start to finish. :) Definitely a boutique hotel, the personalized service and attention to detail rivals anything we've experienced from much pricier hotels. Check in was quick and easy, the complimentary upgrade was an awesome bonus as was the chocolate treats and welcome note in our room! Location is ideal and within walking distance of tons of restaurants, shops, even the Waikiki Shell.We can not recommend Shoreline enough. Thank you to Jordan and the rest of the staff for surpassing expectations!

Fantastic boutique hotel! Perfectly located. 4 minute walk to beach, across the road from Royal Hawaiian shopping centre, food court and the famous Mai Tai beach bar. Hotel staff are very friendly and helpful. Public transport easily accessible to Ala Moana shopping centre and to Outlet Centre. 24 hour tea, coffee and flavoured waters in lobby and grab and go breakfast muffins and bars. Highly recommend and very cheap. Just Fantastic, very happy!!!

I was very pleased to be only a blocl from the best of Waikiki.The hotel facilities are handy and the reception looks very good.The staff does its best to be helpful. I had to negotiate and insist to leave my car after a 2 and a half hours drive in the parking for guests, as it is small and there was no more room.The rooms and beds are comfortable. Coffee in the rooms available and muffins and snacks on top of coffee, tea and fruted water in the reception to take away

The Shoreline Hotel is ideally situated, a short walk to Waikiki beach and the various upmarket shops and bars of the 5-star resort hotels.We stayed in a Junior Suite and found this to be a good size and well appointed. The hotel has been renovated from its 60s/70s origins to meet current expectations.There are nice extras such as the packaged waffles and muffins in the foyer for breakfast, and the afternoon cotton candy (be there at 3pm to see the desk staff mixing up their skills, making the cotton candy!).

This hotel location was ideal for our stay, great access to Waikiki beach, bars, restaurants and local transport (bus to hanauma bay or maunalua bay). Prior to arriving in Waikiki we really impressed with the attentiveness of the customer service, receiving a text asking if we were celebrating anything or if there was anything they could do to 'make our stay extra special'- we were in Hawaii on honeymoon so replied with this info (I had also mentioned this on the original booking). However when we arrived, this wasn't acknowledged-and even after we mentioned this nothing was done to 'go above and beyond' as they had insinuated in their messages. There is a blackboard near the lift which had welcome messages daily for other guests and congratulations for other honeymooners.I wouldn't usually complain about something so small, but found it slightly disappointing after they had reached out to us to specifically ask about any special occasion.This being said, the hotel is well presented and there is free coffee, juice etc in the lobby daily. Also the restaurant next door 'Heavenly' was lovely. Just missed out on 4 stars from us, overall it served its purpose for our stay location wise.

First time visiting Hawaii and booked the Shoreline Hotel, I can't fault it at all position is awesome 2-7 min walk to everything you need from restaurants, shops, bars, beach etc... Stayed on the fourth floor, rooms are very clean and bed was so comfortable. Grab and go breakfast is great with muffins, bars, coffee, tea to go. Small issue with tv which was fixed in less than five minutes.Excellent staff always willing to help, with directions things to see made my first trip to Hawaii very easy and enjoyable. Big shout out to Yianni, who was very helpful with his knowledge around the island.Already planning my next trip and booking The Shoreline again.. Keep up the good work guys!!!

I stayed in Shoreline hotel for 2days, the room was perfect, just as expected. The hotel is very central as well, close to shopping malls, beach and eating places. The highlight for me was the people at the service desk (most especially Yianni). Very excellent service and he gave me a lot of tips on what to do while on the Island (circle Island tour), good places to eat. The tour was one of the best things i did while there.

Excellent location but very small rooms. Perhaps i am biased since I had just flown in from a resort in Maui. The bathroom tile contained some mold so i just tried to ignore it so I could keep my sanity. But the rest of the bathroom was clean along with the room even though i could see dark spots on the carpet.

Enjoyed everything about this hotel except the AC was not cold enough for my liking regardless of the thermostat being set at the coldest setting. Even after being away for hours the room was cool, but not cold and I truly enjoy a frigid room when I sleep. That aside, the location is right in the middle of Waikiki and just about everything is within a 15 minute walking distance either way. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. THIS IS NOT A RESORT, but the rooms are clean and adequate. You're in Hawaii, so you should be out exploring and beaching it anyway. Either way, we'll be back.

This is a great position right in the heart of Waikiki and good value for money. Costs around $40 to the airport in a taxi and is on the bus line. An easy 20 minute walk to Ala moana and only a block back from the beach. Great shower in the bathroom and having a fridge and microwave in the room meant you could buy some cheaper items from the local shops and not have to go to restaurants. Front desk staff helpful as was the bellhop. Nice to have drinks in the lobby. Would be nice to have a ramp up to front door rather than stairs but only 10 or so of them but they seem insurmountable when off a long flight with a heavy bag! Recommend this hotel and would stay again.

When we arrived we were delighted to see we had been upgraded. Fantactic suite on the 13th. with sea view!!We really enjoyed our stay from the first to the last minute.Everything was perfect and the personnel really friendly and helpfulThank you!

To be honest I chose this hotel mostly because of the great price and was pleasantly surprised by this wonderful boutique hotel! The rooms looked recently renovated and contemporary and were nicely appointed with a comfy bed and linens. The staff was very attentive and offered some great amenities. We were personally contacted by the concierge via email prior to our stay. My husband replied and mentioned we were celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary. As a result, we not only received a free upgrade to a lovely corner room on the top floor overlooking the city with views of the mountains and the water, but also a complementary bottle of wine complete with wineglasses in our room upon arrival. This hotel was a quick block walk to the beach and centrally located. Our pearl harbor tour (with Polynesian Adventure Tours which we recommend as well) picked us up and returned us right across the street. The Shoreline also offered free use of beach chairs, towels, etc. We wish we could have stayed here longer before hopping to the next island. Since we are not big breakfast eaters, we really appreciated the grab and go breakfast bars, muffins, etc. as well as the wonderfully infused water all day long. Finally we opted for the Diamond Head Luau due to its proximity. It was great to be able to walk to it and not spend an hour or so on a bus in traffic getting to and from the other luaus, most of which are some distance from Waikiki. Diamond Head was about a mile away and a very easy walk along the beautiful waterfront park. We had planned to take a cab back but ended up walking since it was such a nice walk and felt perfectly safe as many people were out and about and stores and restaurants were open along the way, which was very well lit. Try the restaurant next door (actually you can enter it through door from the hotel's lobby. The food was great and they were more than happy to box us up to go lunches to eat at the airport before our flight. While I believe the hotel does offer transportation from the hotel to the airport we opted to take a lyft or uber. This hotel is one of the very few in Waikiki that does not charge the ridiculous nightly resort fee, but still includes the same amenities.

The service was great. I was not happy with the size of the room, but I think that since they accommodated us when the hotel was full, they put us in a small room. However, if this was the case, they should not have charged us the full price. Aside from that, this was a really great place.

Very nice clean and tidy with very helpful staff!I am a big fan of the different waters in the lobby area especially the cucumber water.Great touch and keep up the good work.Great location very central.Much love from Ireland!

The hotel's location is in the centre of Waikiki - easy walking distance from the beach, shops and transport. The staff were friendly and most helpful at all times.Infused water, coffee and tea were available in the Lobby and muffins, health bars, etc. were there at breakfast time. Our room had a coffee machine, microwave, refrigerator and safe. The décor is pleasant and subdued. We enjoyed the extras in our package which included a dinner/sunset cruise, Sea Life Park and the Waikele outlets shops.

Hotel is nice. Location is great. Staff is helpful. Room was clean. The only negative was the valet does not have much parking so it was full had to park in the adjacent parking structure. Otherwise hotel is pretty nice and the Heavenly restaurant was good too.

We stayed 4 nights here before our cruise and 1 extra night at the end of our trip. Firstly we arrived early in the morning and thought that we had organised for early check in at a slightly higher fee, no such luck and no sympathy from Jenni? on front desk either. Eventually we managed to deposit our bags at least and were able to head off to orientate ourselves. Great location, Ross and ABC stores opposite and the beach and numerous restaurants just a short walk away. Finally we got in to our room, exceptional service from Jordan, great room, clean and comfortable, well equipped with hairdryer, toiletries, fridge etc and good wi fi however the mattress didn't quite fit the wooden bed base...watch out for your knee on the corners. Comfy bed and nice and clean however. Next day we went for directions on how to get the bus and Jenni pointed us completely in the wrong direction, fortunately we had a phone and the bus stops have good details. Then our friends arrived and also didn't get early check in and needless to say they didn't get it either. Then there was the issue with the room being far too small and inappropriate from what they had booked, Jordan to the rescue again, an upgrade, wine and happy people all round. I have to say that all the gentlemen we dealt with at reception were a pleasure to deal with. we did also stay 1 other night at another hotel in the same price range and it was clearly budget, would stay here again happily.

So short and sweet,mold in the bathroom,dirty,one of rails on balcony was broken on my 11 flor and we had 15 months baby playing on it.I satayd in different old hotels in Waikiki area,like non existing Miramar,Ohana East etc but my good what dump this place was.So save yourself and get different hotel
