Our city room on the 10th floor was nice, clean and had everything you would expect for a small hotel. The view was ordinary but we were not staying for views. We were only in the room to sleep as we were constantly on the go. Excellent location for walking to the shops, meals, beach and transport options. The bed was comfortable however the pillows were small and not great quality. The air conditioner was noisy but bearable. All staff encountered were professional, friendly and helpful. We would stay again.

The Shoreline tries to bill itself as a “design hotel” on its website. But after staying there for 2 nights, I can say that label is quite a stretch. The rooms and hallways are very rough around the edges. This is not the place if you're a slightly more discerning individual about the details. Some sites give this hotel 4 stars. But that's being overly generous IMHO. My room and bathroom was very basic. The AC unit was very noisy when it ran, making it hard to sleep. There was no hair dryer in the bathroom. And the pillows were just thin and terrible.I do want to give a special shout out to Matthew at front desk, who provided great service upon check in.

near by, mushibi food and Waikiki was goodbut air condition sound so huge it was hard, to good sleepAnd parking area so hard it was good. hotel but not so good resort.if you want love to people , fix to air conditionAnd search to good. parking system

This hotel simply has it all - great modern rooms, balconies on all floors, roof top pool, 24hr checkin, WIFI & the super awesome bonus of a complimentary drinks station. Super awesome on those busy hot days!!Lovely & clean always, no issues with anything!Great walking distance to everything, shops, restaurants, bars & the beach.Even better that there is a ross store directly opposite so this was a great highlight!Was a great place to stay and i would totally go back! Highly recomend

The hotel has improved it's breakfast bar to include muffins and museli bars. The complimentary candy floss in the afternoons is simply delightful. Rooms clean and comfortable. Centrally located in Waikiki. Exceptional customer service by all staff makes it a pleasure to stay here. Thank you!

Perfect location in Waikiki for shops, trolley lines, and the beach! Wonderful service by all staff, very polite and helpful. Cosy room, enough for 2 people to stay. Restaurant next door is convenient. Small Recycling tubs would be nice in the room to ensure not all paper and plastic waste goes into one bin, and to ensure Hawaii stays beautiful for as long as possible!

I really loved this hotel. Really convenient location. Great reception service. Free grab and go breakfast early morning. Coffee, tea and flavoured water available all day. Trail mix during lunch and cotton candy late afternoon. Really clean hotel and Heavenly Cafe is attached for really good food. Fridge, coffee maker and microwave. Only downside is amount of street noise- building work and air con units over the street.Also deliveries, reversing vehicles and busses leaving their engines running whilst waiting.

The hotel is close to shopping centers and Waikiki beach. The hotel provides free inn-room WIFI and toiletries. The room was small, but clean. The lobby offers grab and go breakfast from 7 to 9 am, and iced water all day. Many nice restaurants are nearby, like Heavenly Island Lifestyle and Crackin' Kitchen.

while the staff is helpful and friendly, we were dissatisfied about the room we were allocated. the room was rather small which isn't an issue in such but we didn't even had a small desk to work with my laptop or just write.in addition, the bathroom really needed to be renovated.

Very pleasant stay in a spacious room on the top floor, overlooking Waikiki.We had a friendly welcome by manager Jordan who even took time to call us in the room to check if everything was okay. Also the guy from valet parking was very friendly.The lobby offers granola bars and muffins in the morning, cotton candy in the afternoon and all day a variety of flavoured water, which is a very nice touch.You get a 10% discount in the adjoining Heavenly Island Lifestyle cafe. We had breakfast here twice, also very nice.

We stayed here for four nights and received excellent service throughout our stay. We arrived at 8AM, feeling very jet lagged following our flight from Australia. Check in staff were very understanding and assisted us with getting into our room before official check-in time. We could not have been more appreciative of them doing this for us. The room was small but contained everything we needed to make our stay comfortable. The hotel is located a short walk from the main shopping area in Waikiki and is close by to many restaurants. The hotel had a refreshment area in the lobby which provided small breakfast foods of a morning and tea/coffee and iced water throughout the rest of the day. We could never walk past without grabbing a cup of their infused waters. If we ever return to Waikiki, this would be the place we would choose to stay.Thank you!

This boutique retro cool style hotel was perfect for our needs - a clean but modern place to base ourselves, while we enjoyed the sights and shopping of Waikiki and Honolulu. Great central location! Walk to almost everything!! Things we loved - the breakfast muffins and waffles & juices which you can help yourself to each morning before 9am; the cute messages on the blackboard outside the lift lobby; the great job the cleaners did every day - thank you! Things that weren't so great : the noisy air con!! Couldn't keep it on at night so it got very stuffy in our room. (Too noisy outside to open the slider to the deck, and the air outside was too warm anyway!)This hotel is great for couples of all ages, not great for families or those wanting a resort-style stay. Would highly recommend! Thank you.

The property needs to be updated. I was shocked when I arrived and tried to change rooms but was told each room was the same. Instructions on the phone to call reception were marked incorrectly on the list. My coffee machine did not work. The carpet was very smelly and felt we in areas.

Our third stay at Shorelines because of it's great location, clean rooms serviced daily, friendly staff and now the added bonus of muffins etc for breakfast, soft drinks avail all day, fairy floss, mix trial nuts and newspaper.Really is a great value hotel. Can't wait to go back again!!

I cannot believe the luck I had stumbling upon this hotel. It is an absolute gem that I will most definitely be staying at on my next trip to Hawaii. The location is in a perfect, central location. The rooms are neat, comfortable and serve their purpose. Please appreciate the location of the hotel and the neighborhood when it comes to the views; you're not right next to the beach but why are you in Hawaii to look at something from your hotel room, right? The hotel has a charm about it that makes it feel like a home away from home. The breakfast to go was great for the couple of early mornings we had during the stay. I can't remember anytime that we passed the free infused water without grabbing some. It's a great way to hydrate after being in the Hawaiian sun. What makes this hotel such a gem however is their staff. I have never experienced such courteous and experienced staff at a hotel. Five star service. Matt was the guest agent we had the most to do with and I cannot commend him enough on his performance. He knew our schedule better than we did and was always keen to know how our day was. All in all, this hotel is not to be missed. It is the most cost effective, 5 star service hotel in all of Waikiki!

we stayed at hilton waikoloa before staying at shoreline in honolulu. I must say the service i recieved from shoreline was way better than hilton, no jokes. It seems they genuinly care for their guests to return back to them.their property was in an excellent location, staff for super friendly and very easy to approach to and the rooms were very clean and tidy. was there only for one night but wished we can stay there for longer time.will surely consider this hotel when we visit back.

Great location to stay on Waikiki Beach if you're ok with not being right on the beach or if you're ok with a little less beach view. It's right in the middle of great shopping and it's only a short walk to the beach. It's within walking distance of so many awesome places. It would take a long time to get bored here!

Spent nine nights in city view room on the 12th floor...nice and quiet. A centrally located Hotel. Desk staff very friendly and helpful. As a frequent visitor to Hawaii I would not hesitate to stay here again

ホテルにはほぼ寝るだけなのでそんなに重視せず安いホテルを…と探していましたが、安さのわりに綺麗&親切でロケーションはどのホテルよりも良い！といったくらいの大満足でした。おそらく次回ハワイに遊びに来た時もここで過ごしたいと思います。thank you for all staff members!! We spend really good time in Hawaii because of yours.

Ok it's not on the beach, and yes the aircon is noisy, and yes the pillows are a bit lumpy. But ..... for the price this hotel ticks all the boxes.Staff are fantastic, there are free muffins for breakfast, free beach towels/umbrellas/ chairs. Difficult to fault - recommended.

Near the beach and lot of restaurants! Bus station is around the corner. Helpful and friendly stuff, free beachtowels, coffee and water on the room. Restaurant heavenly at the other door we highly recomend.

Great location to main street, shops and beach. Offer of value added with free drinks coffee at reception is great when returning to the hotel Also offering free muffins and health bars in the morning is a great initiative.

Good location, very good service. Location is top just a few meters from the beach away and also not far away from bars and clubs. The rooms are very clean and you have a great view to the ocean if you're lucky!

The rooms where clean and very modern. I like how the lobby served different infused water, tea & coffee for hotel guest. View was ok from our room. Love the healthy breakfast menu from Heavenly Cafe located downstairs. Parking is limited and only offer valet. Definitely would book again!

Shoreline Hotel is older- but- it's position is great long as you don't want beach front- rooms are well kept and have everything one needs- very clean and housekeeping excellent- infused waters and 'treats, at reception are wonderful- exceptionally well priced- Heavenly next door for food are greatAnd lastly - the staff are amazing!Congratulations to management and staff for showing the bigger and more expensive hotels how its done

We loved our stay at Shoreline. Unfortunately we only had one night, but the front line staff were accommodating and the location perfect! Easy walk to the beach and some awesome shopping and restaurants (Dukes is about 800mt away).Free tea / coffee & assortment of naturally flavoured waters in the foyer were a nice touch!

We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights at the end of May / beginning of June 2017, and found it to be excellent in all respects regarding the services it offered. Staff were very courteous, professional and very helpful. The downside of this hotel is that it does not offer any areas for relaxing in other than a small rooftop swimming pool. If you will be spending the day out and about this is the hotel for you. It is very close to the beach, shops and restaurants at Waikiki

Absolutely incredible in all aspects. Perfect location, amazing staff and well priced. Will definitely be staying in this hotel again when I book my next holiday to Oahu and will be recommending this hotel to everyone.

Karla June 17, 2017Verified review8.8“The most pleasantly suprising property ever!”CleanlinessFacilitiesComfortStaffLocationValue for moneyOlder property, but while not "luxe", went out its way to be welcoming and thoughtful. Three flavor-infused ice cold waters (berry-lime, cucumber-lemon, Arnold Palmer) available in the lobby 24/7, along with coffee and tea. Muffins and granola bars in the morning, trail mix and dried fruit in the afternoon, cotton candy from 3-4 pm. Restaurant offers locally sourced organic dishes. In-room coffee-maker is K-cup, fridge and microwave in room. Flat-screen TV. Steps from the best shopping and dining in Waikiki, 10 min walk to Waikiki beach.That I did not find this property sooner!

the location is perfect. very convenient for shopping & eating.everyday provided free drink and snacks at lobby is also nice.good shower & comfortable bed.highly recommend for every type of travellers.

Thank you for an enjoyable stay. Great location easy to walk everywhere. Reception staff always friendly and helpful. I liked that they give you beach towels and it was an easy walk to the beach. Check in and out was smooth and quick. Breakfast snacks in the lobby was a surprise and a nice extra touch. Upgraded to a room with balcony and ocean glimpse. The room was very spacious, clean, quiet and comfortable. The only thing to have improved the room would have been free Coffee pods replaced for all of the stay. But that was a small detail and I enjoyed my stay. I would definitely stay again and have recommended the hotel to others.

Great location. Close to the beach,shops and restaurants. Rooms excellent and very clean. The breakfast snack area on ground floor was a nice touch.Staff very friendly and helpful. Matt on the front desk was the best! Will definitely return.

This is a perfectly adequate hotel for the price. It is right in the centre of Waikiki, 7min walk to the beach, two minutes to shopping and food, tour buses pick up outside the door. The iced water drinks in the lobby are good, towels Supplied for the beach, staff helpful. The beds are comfortable and showers hot but it is a basic room which is very dated. The corridors are in serious need of a repainted and the rooftop pool is bare and basic. However, if you want convenience at a good price this is fine.'k

This was our second stay at Shoreline. We are impressed with the service we received from the staff, especially Matt. He was great and even remembered me by name and when we were to be checking out. The hotel provides beach towels, chairs and floats at no cost. They provide snacks and infused water and coffee/tea in the lobby complimentary. The location is fantastic and you get great value for your money.

Awesome little spot to stay just a block away from the middle of Waikiki. Rooms are nice, but on the small side. However when you're in Hawaii why would you want to spend so much time in the room. Would definitely recommend this spot.

Really enjoyed our stay at the Shoreline. It's not a flash hotel - the views are NOT great, and the balconies are tiny. But it's in a fantastic location, right in the centre of Waikiki, the staff are all great, the rooms are clean and a decent size for two people who are really only using them to sleep and shower.The hotel offers a very basic free help-yourself breakfast in the lobby, fairy floss every afternoon and iced water and tea/coffee all day.

Our second stay and we wouldn't stay anywhere else. Centrally located at Waikiki, close to shops, bars, restaurants and the beach. We had an excellent room although a little noisy at night because of proximity to the elevator shaft.

Excellent Hotel, very friendly staff and good service. The rooms where perfect and the location is amazing and only a few blocks from waikiki beachShopping and dining just a few minutes of walk. Loved the beach chairs!!!

The Shoreline hotel is a cute boutique style hotel with all the comfort of any big hotel brand.But they go beyond expectations. Friendly front desk staff, neat small rooms, great hygiene and a fantastic interior design. The hotel breathes happiness.They serve free coffee and infusion water all day and have free cotton candy in the afternoon. In the morning they offer free cereal bars and muffins. It's those little things combined with the great atmosphere that makes this hotel the right one.I have to look hard to find something the hotel needs to work on. Maybe the bathrooms in the room are a little boring and cheap-looking compared to the rest of the room. But they are clean and adequate.Avoid the big hotel chains and choose for this hotel at a three-minute walk from the beach.Do go for breakfast in the cozy restaurant next door!!! You get discount as a hotel guest and the food is great!!

The location is great in the heart of Waikiki. Just a a few minutes walk to the sunny beach, restaurants and shopping centers. The room is small but clean and quiet with excellent WiFi speed. Value for money.

great facility , close to everything we required , rooms were excellent , would recommend . The staff were very help full supply information about tours and suggesting tour operators . Made our stay very enjoyable.

Good location : not on the main road but not far from the beach. Nice & pleasant staff member. Complimentary Grab & Go breakfast very convenient when leaving early. Very good compromized price/quality & service.

A great value hotel in a central location- only a block or so back from the beach and close to all the shopping and restaurants that you need. The rooftop pool is a bit minimal but still handy on a hot day to have a quick swim. The hotel staff were all really friendly and helpful.

Close to Resterants and beaches. Little treats in the lobby every morning and between 3 and 4 in the afternoon! Drinks also available. Wifi is great! Comfy rooms. Staff are lovely. Try the revolving Resterant and Dukes for meals! Worth every cent

Hotel exceeded expectations except for the checkin experience was ordinary young lady was quite evasive unhelpful to the point of being rude. She seem to spend more time on the mobile phone then bothering with guests. All other staff were exceptional. Room was clean well serviced and comfortable it was great having real glasses and crockery most North American have those plastic and paper cups.There was abundant of muffin and breakfast bars in the morning coffee and refreshments all day in the lobby. I would defiantly return next in Hawaii avoiding the young woman at reception.location perfect.

The location was perfect! Just a street back from the main strip which was nice on busy Waikiki. Little extras such as flavoured complimentary water, coffee, and tea in the lobby was a bonus. The room was a good size and clean. Daniel on the front desk was always friendly, helpful and happy to help... The other staff however barely acknowledged you, one female staff member was not great at all and never even smiled!The organic cafe 'Heavenly' next door was delicious AND we were surprised to find a car hire right alongside the hotel called ACE Little Hawaii Rent-a-Car (which you get 20% off as a hotel guest by the way). They too were such good people and will get their own seperate great review.We didn't use the pool, as the beach was so close, but it was acceptable. Just small.All in all we were very happy with this hotel choice.

Shoreline hotel is one of the smaller hotels in Waikiki. It's a block away from the beach but easy to reach by foot. Hotel provides free beach towels. We had a standard room and that was alright for us. All a bit dated but very clean and pricewise good. In the lobby you'll find 3 glas cylinders of differently favoured water for your refreshment throughout the day. That is a very nice feature. There are free muffins and muesli bars as well but only early in the morning. The guests seem mainly Asian people. Adjacent is the restaurant "Heavenly" which offers great food throughout the day and you'll get a 10% discount when you show your room key.Overall we loved our stay, the only negative thing was a very unfriendly greeting at arrival and whenever we saw her from Yenny at the front desk. She didn't even bother looking at us, no please no thanks and barley answering questions. Very rude. Other staff was great.

We had the worst welcome ive ever had at a hotel. Her name was yenny. No welcome. No smile. I actually stopped to question myself if i actually wanted to stay as it was not a good start. We checked in and the whole 11 nights there she was the same grumpy looking person. So many great reviews on staff i read prior to booking but none of them came close

Great location close to beach & shops & restaurants (the restaurant next door is delicious). Very helpful staff. The room was smaller than I anticipated, but was still lovely. Had to pay for parking, which I didn't know before arriving. Overall good experience.

The Shoreline Hotel was great! The staff were all super helpful, the bed was super comfy, the shower had great water pressure! The location is only minutes away from Waikiki beach which is super handy. There are heaps of places to eat only a few minutes walk away, none better than Heavenly which is downstairs. Eat at this place, it's great!I cannot recommend the Shoreline Hotel enough!

Great place to stay with a friendly staff and close to pretty much anything you could want to see or do. The restaurant, Heavenly, is so amazing. Overall, a hotel that anyone traveling to Waikiki should consider.

Very friendly welcome at resection and up to our 5th floor room , just what we need , clean and spacious with balcony view over downtown . Dump our bags and a 5 min walk to Waikiki beach . Quiet at night so good night sleep . The on site restaurant good for late afternoon beers and snacks , check for happy hour . We very much enjoyed our 4 night stay here . Thanks .

So happy I chose to stay at the Shoreline! Have visited Waikiki four times now and this hotel definitely offers the best value stay. Great location close to everything (food, shops, beach). I kindly received a free upgrade on arrival and even though my room faced the street, it was very quiet. The room was well maintained, clean and modern. I was next door to the elevator but didn't hear it once. Complimentary daily tea, coffee, breakfast muffins and fruit-infused water are on offer, as well as beach towels and chairs. Wi-Fi was excellent. The rooftop pool is small but so quiet you can usually get it to yourself (and the beach is just across the road anyway). The hotel has no dining options, but Heavenly Cafe next door is popular and has some healthy options on offer. Would happily stay again!

Shoreline Hotel is great hotel and walking distance to beach. Close promoxity to shops like ABC, Ross, Nordstrom Rack, H&M, Macy's Sephora, Apple to name a few. The room was good size the only dissapointment was tiny balcony and small bathroom. Balcony should be bigger to sit down and relax after a long day out. The grab and go breakfast is good with breakfast bars, muffins, tea, coffee and flavoured water. Dried fruit for guests around lunctime in lobby was very delicious and great idea. Cheesecake Factory less than 10 minute walk has delicious food, cheesecake and cocktails same with Duke's Waikiki again less than 10 minutes walk. Both my favourite places when in Honolulu. Was not aware beach chairs and umbrellas were available for beach and surprised no staff member offered this when we asked for beach towels. Lobby is nice and wifi was good, had no problem during our stay. Staff very friendly and welcoming at any time of day and night and offered some great tips. Starbucks also closeby for coffee or snack. Overall pleasant hotel and would definately stay again. Location is important and Shoreline Hotel Waikiki definately in prime location.

It appear that the hotel is partially renovated. Me and my family stayed on the 6th floor and the bathrooms were old and needed updates. There were parts of the bathroom that were dirty. service was ok.

Shoreline hotel is Very Very clean, their were no bugs, the staff were awesome, best location which is one block from the beach and close to all the shops!!!! We will definitely be staying at this hotel again.

The room was quite small, but clean. The service was great and loved the flavored water. It was in a good location able to walk to everything. I'm not sure we'd be back again unless the prices were much higher elsewhere.

From the time of our arrival we were made welcome and the staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel is central for shopping.. The bar & restaurant attached to the hotel is great value and excellent food

The hotel is near Waikiki beach. Breakfast is not included, but they have maffines, cereal bars and drinks on the ground floor in the morning. There is a swimming pool on the roof. It opens after 8am. The view is good.

We stayed at Shoreline Hotel Waikiki on the way back from Maui. Being the first time to visit Honolulu and given the limited time we had, we wanted to be in an area where we were close to shopping malls and restaurants for easy access. We couldn't have chosen a better hotel. In the middle of the top malls and several restaurants we only had to walk to get all our shopping done. Right beside the Shoreline Hotel is Heavenly Cafe which served excellent meals with ingredients sourced from local purveyors. It's also right across an ABC and a Ross for less for value shopping. The lobby serves flavored water, coffee and tea. A day before we arrived we got a warm welcome email from Manager Jordan Cesneros which is always a nice touch from a hotel. All in all, the Shoreline is highly recommended. Good value, great location and friendly staff. We will stay here again should we come back to Honolulu.

Friendly receptionists, good drink service, perfect location!It's center of Waikiki area, so nice to enjoy shopping :-)I will come back when I stay Honolulu again.But sound of carting vehicles??? Is so loudly in the morning around 7am was bad.

My wife and I had really memorable stay at Shoreline Hotel Waikiki during our honeymoon.I never ask for upgrade when traveling for pleasure, however, as it was our honeymoon I have requested for any special upgrade if possible. When we arrived at the hotel, the front desk staff welcomed us for our honeymoon and even provided us the room upgrade including so kind letter with special wine and chocolate. We really experienced the luxury of shoreline hotel and certainly made it a more incredible stay.Even more every morning the hotel provided us muffin, coffee and snack and we could have drink including coffee and water anytime in the lobby.Also, the accessibility of the location! It was really perfect! The most popular Musubi Café – Iysame was just right next to hotel (We had delicious musubi every morning) and Ross was just across from hotel (As we had so much shopping, we bought carrier at 12am). And only 5 minute walk to the Waikiki beach and many shopping store near!We even stayed at Maui Sheraton; however Shoreline room condition was much better! As this hotel was newly renovated, all facilities were neat and clean.It seems like I am advertising this hotel, however, my wife and I have discussed that we would definitely recommend this hotel to our parents who will traveling Hawaii this year for their 30th Wedding anniversary!Visitors who cannot make up your mind with the hotel, I certainly recommend Shoreline Hotel Waikiki.

The overall property is well-kept and is conveniently located in Waikiki. It is not on the water but an easy 5-10 min walk. Staff is friendly and knowledgable. Grab and go breakfast provided in the mornings and coffee and infused water available all day in the lobby. The attached restaurant (Heavenly) was great with a unique and modern menu. Our room(s) were fine but our original room was right next to the elevator which makes a banging sound (like someone knocking on your door) so we asked to be moved. The next room was better but the elevator banging can still be heard. I suggest getting a room at least a room or two away from the elevator. The provide beach towels and umbrellas (and other items) if you ask at the lobby.

Our stay at Shoreline capped our 9 day visit in Hawaii. Great location and the shops are just walking distances from the hotel. The rooms are very clean and service staff are really professional. Heavenly restaurant below offered good tasty meals at very affordable prices.

As you have read by the other travellers this hotel is close to all without killing the budget. It is not a luxury hotel just basic with everything you need.The rooms are clean and comfortable.Noise level is low, the foyer is well presented with fresh water infused with fruit which is a welcome after the heat.At breakfast time there are a few things out to take if your on the run for tours but there is a café associated with the hotel.A special shout out to Matt in reception who is an amazing ambassador to this hotel as he does everything in his power to make your stay great..........thanking you Matt.I would stay again if visiting Waikiki again

great location! near by Ross , Nordstrom rack and Crackin Kitchen and so on.. there is some drinks and coffee on the lobby the room was clean and neat. but water in bathtub does not drain properly..However you should choose this hotel cuz location location location!

and breakfast treats. COffee and tea available 24/7. Fairy floss on offer in the afternoon. Restaurant attached provides a healthy menu of well priced quality food. An excellent holiday venue. We enjoyed the opportunity to engage with fellow travellers in the foyer lounge area.

Located in the heart of Waikiki, easy to go anywhere. But It is not noisy there.When you return to the hotel, hospitality with delicious drinks.(some fresh water, coffee and tea)The rooms are also clean and comfortable.

와이키키 해변이보이는 위치 오션뷰는 좋습니다!시내랑 거리도 멀지않습니다!대체적으로 만족하고 친절합니다가능하면 렌트카를 추천합니다 호텔에서 푹 쉴생각으로 렌트를 안했었는데 생각보다 필요합니다.Waikiki Beach Location The ocean view is great!The streets are not far from the city!I am generally satisfied and kind.I would recommend rent-a-car if possible.

We always come back to the Shoreline! Wouldn't stay anywhere else! They always remember my stay and very accommodating when we ask for a certain room. Great location and always have snacks and drinks!

The hotel was very central and just less than a minutes walk to the main busy street with all the restaurants and malls. On arrival we were given a complimentary upgrade to a junior suite which was on one of the top floors and had a partial ocean view. The room was lovely and bright and had quality modern furnishings. Although the other floors had small balconies and our room didn't, we didn't not find this a problem and were happy for the extra space. We loved that you could choose from a selection of hot and cold drinks in the foyer and an added bonus was spun sugar between 3-4pm!!! We found the staff very pleasant and helpful. Overall a great stay and highly recommended.

Shoreline is the best hotel we have stayed at in Waikiki! We got married in Oahu in May and organised a group rate for all our guests through the Shoreline. Not only did they give us a great rate, but the rooms were clean and very reasonably sized, and the staff went above and beyond for our entire stay there! Special mentions to Zhi, Ivan and Matt at the front desk who were so great to see everyday and so helpful to us and all our guests! The attached restaurant, Heavenly, is also great - a long line up out there for breakfast each day, we ate there at least 5 or 6 times. Location of the hotel is excellent, walking distance to everything you could possibly need. Complimentary snacks and 3 different types of water are provided in the lobby, what felt like all hours of the day, as well as hot tea and coffee! The staff were super considerate, and generous and organised made this the best stay we could have had in Waikiki for our wedding! Thanks again Zhi!!

My family and I just came back from our trip to Hawaii, and I must say that this hotel has everything you need for your stay in Waikiki. The location is perfect, as it is near the International Marketplace, and other great shops. Everything is walking distance.. and the beach is not too far as well. The hotel itself is very stylish and modern, and the staff are all very welcoming. They go above and beyond with customer service, ensuring that they meet all the needs of their guests. My kids loved the room, especially since the beds were not too high (I have a 7 yr old and 1 yr old). The whole property is clean, and the restaurant next door, Heavenly, serves the best acai bowl and eggs benedict. Def a must to try. Special thanks to the staff of Shoreline for making our trip a memorable one!

The location is perfect,near Dfs galleria. Our room condition was okay,felt comfortable. But the thing is The hotel lobby staff was unkind. They never smiled us from we check-in.And the room was cleaned everyday but never refilled our capsules for coffee and amenities(cotton/Q-tip) during 5days.

We very much enjoyed our overnight stay at the Shoreline. Great staff, great room, great location. The service staff was very efficient and helpful and the location second to none... great vibe, excellent restaurants in the immediate area. We'll be back!

Very pleased again... love the location and the ease to get in and out of Waikiki so conveniently. First stay wasn't so good but I'm really glad I had this a 2nd try. Will definitely be back. Rooms are always so s clean.

We had everything we needed in a hotel room: great service, friendly personnel and close to everything. A short walk to Waikiki Beach and shopping. Great job Shoreline Anything we requested was ours on just a few minutes. The rooms were very clean. I would stay there again in a moment.

What a wonderful hotel. My husband and I stayed 9 nights and we loved it. Room was clean, comfy bed and free Wi-Fi! The location of the hotel is fantastic, right in the middle of all the action, short walk to the beach. Staff are friendly and helpful. The morning muffins and snacks that are available to guests for free was a great treat. We really enjoyed our time spent at the hotel, the rooms are small but your in Hawaii you don't spend much time in the room. We enjoyed seeing the daily messages on the blackboard in the foyer every day! Lovely hotel, hopefully we can come back soon!

There is a lot to like at Shoreline. The staff really seemed to go above and beyond. Free snacks, drinks and breakfast in the lobby made us feel we were getting five-star generosity at three star prices and the location made it an ideal base for our time in Waikiki. The styling of the hotel is also impressive; to upgrade a design the interiors for an older building to look that good is something that even the famous five major chains appear to have struggled with.

This hotel is in an awesome location. The rooms are good, but smallish so better for couples or individuals who are out everyday. Daily cleaning wasn't anything outstanding. Bed was comfy and bathroom was fine. Aircon was awesome and we slept very well.

This hotel was fabulous. Set in a fantastic location a couple of streets away from the beach. A street away from the most amazing shops too. Staff were very friendly and the room was immaculate. Would definitely stay there again

I can't say enough about how great our stay was at the Shoreline. Small touches like the cotton candy station, complimentary cool beverages /snacks /coffee, chalk board were evidence of their aim to please. The rooms were clean, spacious and modern. But the highlight of our stay das the staff. Mahalo to Matt, Zhi, Ivan and the rest of the staff at the shoreline for your kindness, flexibility and helpfulness! Looking forward to staying with you again

This is the most adorable little hotel, and I cannot recommend it highly enough! I was concerned that it would be small and I was also concerned about the location. It is small, but not uncomfortably so. It neat as a pin and very friendly. If you are looking for an oceanfront resort, this is not the hotel for you. It is very centrally located, so you can easily access the beach, restaurants, and shopping. For what it lacks in size, it makes up for in amenities. Beach chairs and towels are available for the short walk to the beach. The pool upstairs is cute and not crowded. The staff is so friendly and helpful! They gave me some excellent recommendations for restaurants and were super helpful any time I needed anything. I love the little breakfast bar and snacks. From a price point, it blows all of the other hotels out of the water. I've stayed in the bigger resorts, and this place is my favorite. I can't wait to come back.

Amazing property. Excellent staff. Always will be staying at shoreline for the stays in town for business and pleasure. All the staff remembered my. And and we're excellent and professional in every way

Front desk staff especially Matt, Yenny and Zyi have been very friendly and helpful. Right in Waikiki and near the beach. Room is slightly smaller but location makes up for out. Close to shopping and restaurants.

We arrived early morning, they were so welcoming on our arrival and they stored our bags for us whilst we waited for the room. As we were staying for nearly 2 weeks they put us on a higher level floor. The room was really nice, very clean and had a large fridge. The hotel offer a take away breakfast and also beach chairs and parasols to take to the beach. The hotel is just off the main road to the beach but is only a 5 minute walk to the seafront - it is nice not to be in the busiest area. We really couldn't fault our stay here. It is good value for money definitely.

After having considered a number of nearby properties, we chose Shoreline for a couple of reasons... price and previous reviews and traveler photos. And we were not disappointed.About a week before our arrival, Jordan (senior guest experience manager) contacted us by email to make us feel welcome before we even arrived. A very nice personal touch.Upon our arrival, we had a complimentary bottle of sparkling and a very friendly and personal welcome note in our room. Just a perfect way to start a 2 week holiday after a 10 hour flight from Australia.Check in process was a breeze thanks to Daniel who not only was very friendly, but has always assisted us with any questions we had during our stay.Rooms are quote nicely appointed, reasonable size, with a balcony. Our room was level 7 facing the street with one side view being of the mountains (very beautiful).Hotel is located literally 2 minute walk to the famous Waikiki beach... we made use of hotel supplied beach umbrellas, chairs and towels and most def enjoyed the pristine beach and surroundings.Special mention must go to Matt. He must be one of the best reception staff I have ever come across in my travels. Always friendly, attentive and very quick to assist any way he can.Although this was our first visit to Honolulu and we have not had experience with any other properties there, I cannot recommend this hotel any higher. They are just ideal in every sense of the word. Unless you are absolutely looking for the Ritz Carlton experience with beach front access, then this place is for you.we will def be back here when we decide to visit again.

In my opinion it was great value for money, if you want to spend hundreds of dollars per night (and can afford too) then do it, for us this was clean, great location and value so we could afford to do other things, let's face it you need a shower and a bed - both where good, is stay here again if prices stayed reasonable in the future :)

My partner and I travelled to Honolulu from New Zealand and stayed two weeks at Shoreline Waikiki.Great area in Waikiki so central to shops and restaurants, awesome restaurant next door called Heavenly where you get 10% off- which is amazing.Service was outstanding! We checked in at 2am and our room was beautiful, clean and we had a personal note from the hotel manager with some chocolates.Reception staff were sooo easy to deal with and really friendly.Highly highly recommend staying here and will be definitely staying here next time!

Great value, and close to everything. Would recommend this place. There is a nice breakfast place next door with healthy options. The department store opposite came in handy. Plenty of food options. Good wifi facilities - essential these days.

Location is very central . Near beach near food near shops. Room is clean bed is comfy. Staff are very friendly and helpful . Very good that there is always cold flavoured water in the lobby . Car parking is pricey $30 per day

Although we've already reserved in January, we became an ugly and tiny room. Your receptionist managed thst problem asap and thus we could moved in a better room, which was convenient for us. Thus we were thankful to Yenny, but as an important person at the frontdesk she should show a smile and a warm welcome instead her frozen mask all the time. The aircondition should be reniewed!

Very friendly staff. Extremely good value and perfect location. Rooms are good, bathrooms a little dated but clean. Nice touches are the coffee and snacks in the lobby at all times (really useful in the morning) and the beach towel service - great!

The hotel is in a fantastic location and the room rates are great too. The rates offer complimentary breakfast snacks and drinks. The rooms are clean. Staff are very helpful and friendly too. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Honolulu and will stay back at this hotel when we return.

Great location in the heart of Waikiki, bit off the main road which gives you quiet environment. Accessibility to sightseeing places is just awesome! Regret to say that I was quite disappointed with a tired room, totally different from what I saw on the hotel website. Some hotel staffs offered us warm hospitality but some were not. I'll choose any other hotels in the same area when I come back next time.

I loved the location on Seaside between Kushiro and Kalakaua and how close it was to walk anywhere in Waikiki. I would definitely stay here again. The hotel staff were super friendly and helpful!The muffins, breakfast bars, trail mix, cotton candy, free daily paper and 24-hour coffee, tea and fruit-infused water beverages added a very special touch to my stay!

Wow! what a little gem in a mad city!! We changed from a large hotel on the beach front after reading the Shoreline reviews, and we are so glad that we did. Simple and very contemporary hotel but value for money, it was one of the best hotels we stayed in during our three week holiday. When we arrived we had a warm greeting by Matt. After initially be given a room next to elevator we asked to move. Without any problem at all we were given a top floor room with two balconies and a fabulous view. Room was a great size and bed huge and so comfortable.The booking was on a room only basis but there was coffee making facilities, fridge and microwave in our room. When we arrived the reception was complete with tea, coffee, juice, dried and fresh fruit and nuts all for visitors. A really nice touch. We were even more surprised on our first morning that there was muffins, cereal bars, waffles, tea , coffee and more all laid out for residents to help themselves. This set us up perfectly for the morning. When you return in the afternoon, we were greeted by staff making candy floss in reception. what a lovely gesture. We also enjoyed the rooftop pool. we used it several times and every time we were the only one there. It is fairly small but perfect to chill and relax.Thank you Shoreline for being a perfect retreat. Loved Oahu but Waikiki Beach was a little on the busy side for our liking and your hotel was just what we needed. Would very highly recommend to all visitors.

It's a nicely updated, modern hotel that's clean and centrally located. Only negative comment is that depending on your room location, you may overlook an apartment eye-sore. However the staff is friendly, they have snacks to enjoy as you're passing through and it's an easy walk to food, shopping, and the beach.

Very happy to have stayed at Shoreline Hotel! Loved the close access to beach. Room provided all we like to have in the way of amenities. Staff at desk was excellent. No problems or complaints of any kind. Would recommend to friends and would stay again when in Honolulu.

Everything was really good. The only thing we good wish more for was a bigger balcony with a nicer view. We had a view of a not so nice old bildning. The restaurant beside is great! The staff was nice and really nice to get beverages in the lobby every day.

What a Welcome! It started with contact from Jordan in the Customer Experience Team before we even arrived advising they were looking forward to us staying and enquiring if we had any special reason for the trip, yes a big birthday. Our check at Reception was speedy and efficient, thank you Yenny, even though we'd arrived quite early off our flight from Aus. Within an hour of arrival there was a complimentary bottle of wine to help our birthday celebrations, Thanks Team. Nice clean well presented room on level 14 at the front of the hotel with a view down Seaside to the Royal Hawaiian Center and out to Waikiki Beach. Wife appreciated that we were just across from a Ross Dress for Less! Really comfy bed and good coffee selection. Lobby was well stocked with refreshments, Water/Coffee/Tea and Nut/Fruit Mix not to mention the essential oil aroma bar. Thanks Team Shoreline!

Moderate priced hotel, which is well located and an easy walk to many places around Waikiki. It offers great facilities and generous sized rooms. Exceptional staff and happy service made our stay most enjoyable.

We stayed here twice during our stay in Hawaii (in between island trips) and it was excellent. Shoreline goes out of their way to ensure you gave a pleasant stay. They may not be the flashiest hotel but they sure make up for it in service.Their lobby staff are so friendly - especially Matt who works in the morning. The rooms are always clean and stocked everyday.The room and beds aren't huge, but we didn't need anything else.They offer free beach chairs, umbrellas and towels for you to take down to the beach (saves you have to buy your own or spend truck loads on hiring them). There is always three different ice cold drinks for you to choose from when you get back to the hotel and at 4pm they have free candy floss! I've never seen a hotel offer candy floss before!We would come back to Shoreline and recommend it to others.

We were made to feel very welcome by the hotel staff. The room was very comfortable and clean. The hotel is in a good location, just off the main Street so quiet butless than 5 minutes from the shops and beach.

This is our third stay here & can't imagine staying anywhere else. Matt & Zhi are so very friendly & helpful with any questions you may have. The 24 hour coffee & flavored water as well as other snacks in the lobby are so nice. Rooms are nice & clean as well as nice sized for Waikiki & the beds are very comfy!"Thanks Shoreline" for another fabulous visit. We hope to return soon!A hui hou!Ken & Judy Fleischer

My husband and myself stayed at the Shoreline April 2017. It was in a superb location 5 minutes from Waikiki Beach and close to all reasonably priced eating places as well as the better Restaurants and Shops.The Staff were so friendly and helpful and the accommodation very clean and well maintained. I loved the all day refreshments in the recepton area so great when you return to Hotel after a busy day. This hotel will always be very high on our list to recommend to others.Thanks to all the Staff at the Shoreline.Hilary and Geoff

Thank you so much to Matt and thewonderful team at Shoreline Waikiki. We are a young family and we had such a memorable and comfortable stay at your hip and happening Hotel. It has been a little over a week since we got back and the hotel has left a lasting impression. We stayed for 10 nights and arrived super early, our room was not ready but Matt was kind enough to check us into a room to get our sleep with our 2.5 year old. Being our fourth visit to Waikiki and having experienced the likes of luxurious hotels on the beach, Shoreline was just as good, if not better! The beach is less than a 5 minute walk away. Literally 10 steps from Ross, ABC convenience store and all transportation for tours or trolley rides. Great and generous coffee varieties in our room (including French), bountiful options of luxurious pillows to get a good night sleep. Well-cleaned and well-attended room. We felt like no request was out of the question from band aids to scales to universal adaptors-staff are very attentive, friendly and helpful. Leave your beach towels at home as the Hotel offers you a supply at front desk (no charge). Free and HQ wi-fi. All hours of the night and day you have a refreshing supply of detox water and fun fruit flavoured drinks, hot tea and coffee which were great when we were on the go, cute surprises of fairy floss and trail mixes made an appearance on my stay too. All the little things count and the Shoreline goes above and beyond expectations. I will definitely recommend and be a repeat visitor of your humble hotel on my travels to Waikiki. Thanks again Shoreline! Sibel

Was a pleasant stay at this hotel and the service received was excellent especially from Matt & Jordan! Would definitely return to this hotel :) great location as it is in the centre of Waikiki so easy to get to where you need to go!

The service was professional and friendly. The staff were able to assist with anything and were great to have a chat to. Rooms are serviceable. Loved the complimentary juices and snacks in the foyer each morning to start the day!

We stayed at the Shoreline in Honolulu for 3 nights before heading out on a cruise. The staff was extremely helpful and accommodating. The location of this hotel was centrally located in a very nice shopping and dining area.

Lovely staff , great central location. Can get towl , chair and umbrella from front desk for the beach which is a 5min walk .muffins and cereal bar provided daily as well as all day flavoured water and tea and coffee

I love everything about the hotel, everyone is so nice especially the valet guys, Zhi, and Jordan. This is our 5th time staying at this hotel and will be coming back here next year again. Thank you for making our stay so welcoming and special.

The staff at the Shoreline look at every detail in making sure your stay is great. From the cotton candy happy hour for kids to the great coffee and friendly staff, you can tell the staff really cares. One great example was one night our AC stopped working. I called the front desk and Jerome was sent up to fix it. He had to replace a whole part in the ac and instead of making us move to another room fixed it as quickly as he could and the family slept great. Thanks Shorline and Jerome.

Upon initial arrival, we were a bit disappointed. We didn't really know where to park, because we didn't know it was valet only. We managed to pull up and ask someone on the street if self-parking was available. They said it was valet only, so we proceeded up the ramp to valet parking. The valet attendant immediately welcomed us and took our bags. He directed us to the front desk where we were warmly greeted and checked in. We were told to go ahead and head up to our room and our bags would be sent up. As soon as we got to our room, our bags were already right behind us. Great service! Upon initial inspection of the room, we agreed that it was a tad small and the walkout balcony was also smaller than we would have liked. Also, there weren't any dressers to put our clothes in, but there was a closet to hang clothes. We were dismayed, but said we were just going to go with the flow and make the best of our vacation. (By the way, the room was immaculately clean and neat!) As our week progressed, we quickly realized that not only were we right at the heart of everything: shops, restaurants, stores, etc., the hotel staff was amazing! I highly recommend Shoreline Hotel Waikiki and will definitely stay there again next time! One more note: JORDAN CESNEROS, Senior Guest Experience Manager, emailed me before our trip and asked if there was anything he could do to make our stay more enjoyable. I told him it was my wife's birthday on the 22nd and that morning, they wrote a personalized Happy Birthday note on the hotel lobby chalkboard! Can you say brownie points for me???? Thanks again, Shoreline Hotel, for a wonderful stay!

This hotel had a great combination of location and affordability. It was roughly a 5 minute walk to get to the beach and was very close to several shopping centers. The staff was always incredibly friendly and pleasant to deal with.The resort fee presumably covered the beach towels, chairs, and umbrellas on loan, flavored drinks / coffee / tea in the lobby, cotton candy between 3 and 4 pm, and Granola Bars / Muffins in the morning. We grabbed some of the latter for the road on early mornings when we were going out hiking and it really helped us save some $ and time!The room was sufficiently nice with relatively quiet air conditioning and a small baclony. The bathroom could probably use a little updating, but it was totally acceptable for the price. Otherwise the room was nice, but nothing that will blow you away. The pool was nothing remarkable either but who cares when you're that close to such a nice beach. If I were planning the trip again knowing what I know now, I'd definitely be up for staying here again.

Great hotel, good price. We loved the restaurant next door; healthy, local and decent happy hour prices. Hotel staff were excellent. Good coffee, snacks, infused water in the lobby. The cotton candy was cool. Great place.

Very close to the beach, great location to good food and establishments. Hotel staff was awesome. Free rental of beach towels, umbrella and chairs. Would go back to this hotel for sure. Had a great time!

The Shoreline offers everything you need for a vacation in Waikiki at realistic rates and without the inflated hidden resort fees charged by some of the bigger resort villages. OK it is not right on the beach but it is two blocks (2 minutes) walk from the beach and very central for the shops and restaurants. Why pay for a sea view when you are going to be out during the day and asleep at night!Rooms are a good size and well maintained. The hotel does not have a restaurant but has a deal with the adjacent restaurant (Heavenly) where hotel guests can get 10% discount. We used it for breakfast a couple of times and it was excellent. Towels were changed daily (without asking) and bed linen every three days.Despite previous comments about noise we didn't have a problem but would recommend probably trying for a room on one of the upper floors. All rooms have air conditioning and have a coffee maker, fridge and microwave. Complementary tea, coffee and iced water were available 24 hours a day in the reception lobby. All staff were exceptionally polite, courteous and helpful and would try and assist guests in any way they could.I would have absolutely no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone visiting Waikiki, whether for business or pleasure.

This hotel is only a few streets away from Waikiki Beach yet it's no where near as expensive as the others. It's all you need if you're out all day. Extra friendly staff who are always polite and willing to help. Jordan made us feel welcomed. Champagne on arrival as a surprise, booked us restaurants, etc. The hotel will loan you beach chairs, umbrellas and beach towels free of charge. There is a small rooftop pool with beach views but I don't think any rooms have beach views (that we could tell). For what you pay, we felt this was excellent value. It's not the Ritz, but we really enjoyed it. We spent the money we saved on accomodation on other activities.

rooms quite small and noisybalcony is a jokefire alarm went off from just opening the windows and having a showerTV channels limited selectionfast free internet, nice coffee and drinks at reception 24/7valet parking quickvery friendly staffcentral location

Kind of ended up in this hotel at the last minute. Didn't have a chance to do any research on it but we lucked out. The staff was exceptional. Rooms were very clean. The walk to the beach is a few blocks but as long as you don't have small kids it's easily doable. All in all a nice place to stay in a nice location. And if you like shopping at Ross or ABC stores they're only 100 feet away.

Rude staff, our room is next to the elevator and we can hear the sound of it going up and down as well at the conversations in the elevator. The hotel next door looks like a crack house and the duty manager couldn't care less that we were dissatisfied. Went to the pool for a swim and found used cotton tips around the pool along with floating bandaids in the pool. Babies swimming without nappies. Went to report everything we discovered and nobody at the desk would acknowledge us. This would be a 2 star hotel in Australia and even that's being generous. Have arranged to check out first thing in the morning.

This hotel was recommended by our travel agent for two nights before our Round Island Cruise - what a great location. The rooms were clean and good size. Snacks and drinks were available in the reception area, which included muffins and snack bars - sometimes just enough to get your day started. Across the road from Ross for Less and a short stroll to the main street - full of restaurants, bars and shops. All at your finger tips - will go there again.

Loved the Shoreline - rooms kinds retro-style, ours was bright orange mainly! 2 blocks from Waikiki and one block from the main shopping street in Honolulu. Lots of restaurants and bars close by. We used the roof top pool also - small but good enough for a couple of hours relaxation. Staff were very helpful and polite

Staff are very attentive before, during and your trip - they are genuinely interested in your well being and enjoyment. The facilities have a class 60s/70s vibe, but it feels to have been recently renovated. Hotel is right in the middle of Waikiki, walking distance to all of Waikiki's attractions, no need for a car to enjoy the area.

The Shoreline was recommended to us by friends and we found it to be an easy option. If you're not fussed about being on the beach then this is a great find. Centrally located across the road from a Ross store and on the street behind where all the tour buses pick up and drop off every day it really was an option that worked for us. Rooms and bathrooms were clean and comfortable. The place is practical and functional though not a place to relax in your room as they are quite small and most have limited or no views. It worked perfectly for us though as we were out all day and most of every night so really only used it for functional reasons.

Awesome experience during that I stayed in this hotel.Clean, comfortable, and enjoyed compliment beverages and snacks.Breakfast was not generally offered, but just right next door there was a great bento shop.

We stayed at this hotel for 5 days. That was enjoyable even though the bed was smaller than we expected. Every customer can drink decafe, coffee, herbal tea freely 24 hours on the 1st floor. Also, you can get cotton candy from 14-15. The location is very convenient to go to somewhere, especially duty free shops, restaurants, cafes.

This hotel is great if you want to dodge the prices of the hotels on Kalakaua whilst sharing the same great location.The staff were great as I arrived at 7am and checkout was 3pm. I asked to leave my bag but the receptionist offered me a room instead. He tried to find me the best room too, he explained the differences and suggested me to pick the one with the microwave and mini fridge. There was also a free beverage bar in the lobby which I enjoyed.The lobby was beautifully done and had a relaxing vibe.The room was a decent size and everything was very clean. It came with two free water bottles in the fridge. Free wifi in the room and lobby was a HUGE bonus. Room service was good, particularly with replenishing the little bottles of shampoo etc.The only negative was that the bathroom was aged however it was still clean. you could only tell from between the floor tiles and inside the vent which was dusty.

The location is great. Short walk from the beach and main street. Hotel is small but clean, modern and quiet. Would stay there again. Although the rooftop pool is small it is a very nice place to relax and there is hardly anyone there :)

We only stayed here one night, but we had an excellent experience. The manager of the hotel (Daniel?) was on top of everything. He made a real difference in our stay. The location was convenient and the price was good. Our room was clean and efficient. I would not bother with the breakfast add-on with the restaurant next door. We would stay here again on our next visit to Honolulu.
user_name:
chase174
New York City, New York

review_body: Hotel in a strategic location when you want to tour around the island and when you want to get to the beach quickly;). Helpful and friendly staff. In the morning and afternoon light snacks available like muffins, wafels and breakfast bars.

Stayed 3 nights Great staff helping with luggage clean rooms hotel is handy to shopping. Our family of 6 adults stayed good experience all the way around. Took advantage of the valet parking. Flavored water and coffee in the lobby muffins and snack bars for breakfast in room Keurig!

The position is great. Our daughter and her family stayed on the beach and it was much noisier there than where at the Shoreline.Easy 5 minute walk to be in the thick of things. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Staff were amazing and always happy to help. Snack breakfast was a bonus. What a great experience

First trip as a couple, exellent overall stay. The view and balcony could be better but thats pretty much the same for all the hotels on waikiki exept for the much more expensive ones along the beach.The location is hard to beat in my opinion, everything you need within 5 minutes.We had a problem with the room one night but it was solved quickly and got a very nice room upgrade so that little problem turned into a good memory and funny story to tell.The refreshment always ready in the reception is very pleasant. The small restaurant "The Heavenly" attached to the hotel has very good and healthy food, those benedict eggs!!

I will recommend this hotel to all my family and friends. My only constructive. Moment would be that the bathroom needed a bit of an update - otherwise all else was fantastic. I had fresh towels every day and my room was cleaned every day.Thank you for making my vacation easy.

We spent 11 nights at the Shoreline Hotel and we made the right choice. The staff are very friendly and we thought our personal welcome was really nice of them. The rooms are equipped with TV, fridge and coffee maker. The rooftop pool is small but peaceful if you want a change from the beach and you have views of the sea and the famous pink palace from the roof. We would definitely stay here again on our next visit to Hawaii.

Staff was very helpful and welcoming. Place was "comfortably" sized. More than two people would be a squeeze. Could depend on the room arrangement. Rooms were clean, bed was comfortable. Bathroom was clean. They even provide complimentary beverages and snacks in the lobby! Overall very satisfied with my stay and would recommend to any and all of my friends!

The cleanliness of this hotel was ok.. the rooms could use some updating! The location was great and the value is very good for Waikiki. The rooms are small but having a balcony is nice and the city views are good. The staff are friendly and I would stay here again!

Fantastic location, very clean and friendly and amazing cafe called Heavenly next door, which give 10% off when you stay at Shoreline.Highly recommend this venue and we stayed there twice in our time in Waikiki. Great car company around the corner too called ACE car rentals.

Excellent service. Great, handy location - 5 minute stroll to Waikiki Beach; less than 1 minute walk to bus stops on Kuhio Ave that take you to Ala Moana Shopping Centre, Diamond Head, Pearl Harbour, Chinatown, Downtown and much more; across the road is Ross Dress for Less & around the corner from Nordstrom Rack. Very clean rooms & foyer. Roof top pool. Reasonably priced for Waikiki. 24 hour Reception desk. Free refreshments in the foyer eg cotton candy, trail mix, coffee/tea, cold drinks. Personalised sign in the foyer to greet guests celebrating birthdays, honeymoon, anniversary. Enjoyed our stay.

I would recommend this place to anyone. Close to great shopping and eating places. Staff very helpful and friendly. Beach is only a 5 minute walk away and rooftop swimming pool has great views of the city.

This hotel is terrific. The staff are all friendly and helpful. The rooftop pool is good for people who can't walk long distances. The refreshments available in the lobby were delicious and appreciated after being out in the heat. The rooms are clean and well maintained. It was right in the middle of everything. The longest distance walking anywhere interesting from the hotel was 30 minutes. I had a wonderful stay there, would go again and highly recommend it to everyone. There is also a "Heavenly" restaurant attached to it. The food was wonderful.

I will certainly consider staying at Shoreline when I return to Waikiki. It was centrally located to shopping and transportation. I truly enjoyed my birthday celebration..... I will recommend to friends and family.

This was a great choice for a short stay in a prime location. Not on the beach but a short walk away and excellent shops, restaurants and other services within five minutes and without that big "resort" feel like so many of the hotels there.

This is a 5 to 10 minute walk to the beach. Central to the shops and amazing restaurants. Opposite my favourite shop Ross!!! Amazing staff and complimentary ice tea 24/7. Very reasonable pricing and you don't have to pay the beachfront tax. Perfect location for a shopper!!!!!

Stayed with Shoreline from the 12th of Feb to the 19th of Feb 2017. What a heavenly place! Price was reasonable, location is amazing and service is exceptional! Rooms were cleaned adequately, daily. Complementary iced water, iced tea and coffee were a delight for the heat filled Hawaiian days. I will definitely be staying at the Shoreline time and time again. Thank you to all who worked during my time in Hawaii, you made is a truly wonderful holiday! <3

Brilliant! This is my second time we stayed at this hotel. The service is exceptional. Location is perfect and the rooms are tidy. Brilliant service from Matt and Daniel. If you are looking for a great location, tidy place and value for money, you should definitely stay at this hotel.

I really, really enjoyed my stay here! The staff was incredibly friendly and knowledgable and the location couldn't have been any better. I will definitely come back here again the next time I visit Hawaii.

Great hotel!!! I would love to stay there again!!! Central location- Short walk to everything. Roof top pool as well. This was a fantastic hotel with no hotel fees too. Friendly Staff and free fairy floss from 3-4pm daily!!! how could you beat that!!!

Close to shopping, restaurants, fine hotels, but four blocks from the shoreline. Even so, central Waikiki is nothing to complain about. The small city-view room on the 6th floor was nothing special, but who stays in their room in Hawaii? The bed was only fair with a too-warm duvet. Whatever happened to sheets and blankets? The AC was terribly noisy and not sensitive to temperature changes of several degrees. The mandatory resort fee and valet parking boosted the price by 28 percent, but the service was very good. OK for a couple days.

Stayed for 2 nights and overall we enjoyed our stay. Great location close to the beach. Rooms clean and comfortable but be warned that the rooms are not quite as sleek as the pictures imply (some aspects quite dated). Staff friendly and helpful except for the Korean girl (Yenny?) on reception as I felt her service was lukewarm. Cold drinks in reception brilliant. Overall would recommend this hotel.

Pleased with the value for money equation. Easy walk to Kalakaua Ave and then to Waikiki beachfront. Rooms are in reasonable condition and serviced everyday. Had breakfast in the cafe next to hotel and got 10% discount showing hotel card. Car parking available at $30/day. Does have a separate resort fee, which was not included in room rate when booked on Booking.com. Responsive service from the staff on the desk. Affordable & clean accomodation with good location. Would stay there again.

While staying in Waikiki, I stayed at 2 hotels, Shoreline was definitely the standout of the 2. Close to all amenities and friendly staff. No too crowded, free tea & coffee and free local calls so it was easy to confirm transportation

Clean place with convenient location ; pleasant, friendly and helpful staff .All conveniences close by including various forms of transportation.Rooms have excellent sleep quality . It was a great stay .

This hotel is a smaller hotel centrally located on the Waikiki strip. It is very accessible to all the shopping and all the nice hotels. We stayed on the 14th floor which is the topmost. The swimming pool is just above us. Nice simple room with comfy bed and pillows. I wonder why they called it shoreline... It is near the beach but not on the shoreline. You have to cross the street and walk a little bit to reach the shore.Reception is average.

The Shoreline, is a great place to stay, it's location is very convenient to access everything Waikiki has to offer. Pick up for all tours is across the road, the beach is at the end of the street and you can walk to most place as the Shorline is centrally located. The rooms were clean and well maintained and the pool on the roof was sensational for a dip and bake all day long. The staff were friendly and went out of their way to make our stay an enjoyable one.I would recommend The Shoreline to anyone wants to be centrally located in Waikiki.

The name and advertising pictures for this hotel are deceptive. Shoreline is nowhere near the beach. It is a land locked hotel with Nil views to speak of. Our greatest disappointment was no in hotel restaurant so no opportunity to have room service for any meals or to have breakfast in bed. The hotel room itself was tiny and so was the bathroom. Definately in need of a major renovation. This hotel room was how things were in the early 1980"s. Shower in the bath wallpaper peeling due to steam build up as there was no exhaust fan. The male lobby staff were great as was housekeeping. No kettle or toaster in the room. tiny balcony overlooking a carpark and near to the rubbish disposal. Found out later that we could have booked a great beachside room with access to room service for not much more. Disappointed. The nearest restaurant served a very niche menu. Organic is great but this menu was too way out there for most people.

My husband and I stayed at the Shoreline for 3 nights, we enjoyed our stay here. The rooms were clean and our King Size bed was extremely comfortable. The coffee, Arnold Palmer Iced tea and flavoured water in the lobby were greatly appreciated. Although it would've been nice to have a larger pool it was ok, the beach was very close by. Great,central location. Would definitely come back.

Location is better than other famous hotels. Service is not badRoom condition is not good as you expectWhen i stayed the hotel, my room's air conditioner has some problem that i was not able to stop workong.

Beach within walking distance. Room was cleaned after mid day each day, fresh towels provided daily. Hotel provided daily refreshments in the foyer. Very clean roof top pool.. great restaurant at the hotel.

The accommodation and service was perfect! Much more than you would expect for the amount t you pay! The quirks or the fruit tea and coffee station at reception was a great idea. Fairy floss was also served every afternoonwhoch I thought was cute !

We stayed here for 2 weeks on our honeymoon. It was a very centrally located hotel. Very clean and the service from Matt at the front desk was always great. I found the hotel to be very expensive but Oahu in general is a very expensive. We really enjoyed our stay here and would stay here again if we returned. My only suggestion would be to do something with the pool upstairs. If you would some nice sun lounges there that are not broken and renovate this area a little bit this would add to the experience. Other than this it was wonderful!

there are good point that is very near the shopping centers and waikiki beach. Room was clean and good. all staffs was very kind.but valet parking was little expensive.(almost hotels near that hotel was too)

I have stayed at the Shoreline multiple times and would stay again. I have always received good service and the rooms are clean. I love the Arnold Palmer iced tea! My flights home usually leave late at night and they kindly will keep my bags secure and let me wait until I go to the airport.

Me and my boyfriend stayed at shoreline for 3 nights, we had rented a car and used their valet parking service, the staff are always friendly and prompt, we never had to wait too long for our car. There are coffee and tea in the lobby available 24/7, beach towels available at the front desk. Room is a bit small but big enough to open up 2 25" luggages. Would recommend if looking for a hotel in Waikiki that doesn't cost a lot and doesn't require to have a beach view.
user_location: New York, New York, United States
user_name:
Annie S
New York, New York, United States

review_body: 'My wife and I totally agree with the positive things that have been said about the Shoreline. We would certainly recommend it to anyone looking for a clean, convenient, comfortable and reasonably-priced stay in Waikiki. Kudos also to the personable and very helpful Matt at the front desk! He was genuinely interested in making sure we had a room we liked, giving us tips on where to go and places to eat. We found that the other staff people to be helpful and friendly as well.Some of the places located close by that we really liked included: Marukame Udon (delicious udon made on the premises, inexpensive. Don't worry about the line. It moves!); Island Vintage Shave Ice (go for the specialty shave ice, its well worth the price! We had to go back the next day for more); Dukes Canoe Club for mai tais and entertainment on the beach; Arnold's for mai tais ajnd entertainment; Rainbow Drive-In (take #2 bus; bus stop is half a block away on Kuhio. Food is very good and possibly the best value on the island). A half mile past the Rainbow Drive-In is Leonard's Bakery with their hot and savory malasadas (Leonard's is probably the gold standard in Oahu for malasadas (a donut brought to Hawaii by Portuguese laborers in the 1870s).

Great location, clean room and friendly staff. Pool was a little small, but not an issue and would not keep me from coming back. Complimentary coffee, water and Arnold Palmer iced tea was well appreciated. My wife and I will definitely be back again.

Had a really great time at the Shoreline - two visits on the same trip (was over on the Big Island in between).The staff were most helpful with directions, tips, getting me into the room as soon as they could, and upgrades to higher level and larger rooms because I was there for a few days.Location was excellent - right in the middle of Waikiki - short walk to anywhere I wanted to go.Would stay again.

Matt was the best! My airbnb turned out to be an absolute nightmare, so I started calling different hotels fir a last minute booking. Matt was great and told me I could check in directly without having to wait till 3pm, which was great as it was 9am in the Morning. I arrived at the hotel and immediately felt super comfortable, the lobby is huge and very modern. The offer free coffee, tee and flavoured water all day, loved it. Matt did everything to make me forget my horrible stay at that airbnb which I'll never forget, thank you! The enclosed restaurant Heavenly is great and you get 10% discount as hotel guest. The Shoreline is centrally located between the beach and the canal which made it easy to enjoy my Morning run but also be close enough to the Beach fir the afternoon. Everything us in walking distance and even with that central location it was very quiet in my room which btw was super clean and spacious enough for one to two people. Thanks again Shoreline for making my stay in Waikiki a great experience and big shout out to Matt!!

We stayed at the hotel for one week and could have stayed longer. Modern decor and very clean. Excellent, friendly staff that will accommodate anything you need. Location is wonderful. Close to restaurants, shopping and beach. Nearby transportation too. Has a lot of services like free beverage bar in lobby as well as fresh cotton candy daily. They also provide free beach chairs, towels and umbrellas during your stay here. Front desk staff was very informative and helpful. We were very impressed with this hotel and can't wait for our return trip back to Hawaii.Thanks Shoreline for helping to make our stay in Hawaii just perfect!!! Sincerely, The Cassara's

Great location by the shops and beach! This made it easy to skip transportation. If a car or vehicle is needed, the hotel is right next to little Hawaii rentals and we got a discount! Overall very friendly and helpful staff! The rooms were nicely decorated and very clean. I would come back for a third visit!

Shoreline Hotel is At the heart of Waikiki and is very near the beach. The room was very clean, equipped with ironing board (important if you come here for a conference and have crumpled shirts and dresses), coffee machine and a microwave oven. The bed was comfortable, the bathroom was clean and spacious.

No hotel airport shuttle, which was a little disappointing, outside shuttle service average $12 per person.Location was close to shopping, dining, and beach.First impression of hotel lobby atmosphere was clean and pleasant.Guestroom was not what I was expected but it did the job, no microwave to warm up leftovers.Unfortunately I never made it up to the rooftop swimming pool

Fabulous location, nice rooms and lovely staff. However, our room was right next to the elevator which was ridiculously loud at night when we were trying to sleep. Also, a small complaint, but the pillows were awful. Everything was wonderful

Great location, exceptionally clean and tidy hotel with professional and friendly staff who went out of their way to please. The complimentary coffee in the lobby was great! The room was spotless and spacious. It was nice to have a desk and extra chair with footrest in the room.
user_name:
Aitken M
West Coast Region, New Zealand

review_body: Arrived before midday and got to check-in early. Had a room on the 13th floor facing the nicer building with a queen bed. Room was comfortable with a decent sized bathroom and a separate [wardrobe] room which you could store your bag, hang clothes and shopping. The room was quiet and clean. It may need an interior refresh but how much time would you spend in your room when you are in Honolulu?Beverages in the lobby all day so if you need a coffee, tea, or water you could help yourself.But the most important thing was the location! It was one block to the beach and if you are heading to A la Moana Centre, the bus will get you there in ten minutes tops. Really handy for getting to the beach, back for a change and out to dinner.
