Location of the hotel is just great, in the centre of shopping/activities district, however, not on the main street, what makes it cozy and more quiet. Enjoyed complementary tea/coffee/water at lobby. Good food can be found in Heavenly restaurant on the ground floor.

The room was small overlooking a run down building next door however clean.The airconditioning would not turn offf. Location was good . Central to the strip and buses. The rooms all have free wifi. Reception staff were very helpful.

Location is tops for this hotel! Within short walking distance to everything you could possibly want to do. Quiet, clean rooms. Valet parking ramp access was the only thing that left a little to be desired.

The staff were very pleasant and helpful when we had contact with them.Be careful which room you get, one side (even number rooms) looks onto a low end apartment block and a pub one street across can cause noise issues towards midnight.That said the hotel is at a great location and most of the tour buses pick up on Seaside (at the hotel) or one street up (Royal Hawaiian Ave) so if you are looking to go on some tours the hotel would be perfect. The restaurant attached to the hotel has good food and is usually very busy at breakfast.Room was big enough with all the usual amenities. Wifi comes as part of the package but there is a resort fee of $15.07 per day which wasn't clear to us at the time of booking.All in all we were very pleased with the hotel, on the UK star rating system this is a very good 3 star hotel and the staff are excellent.

We recently stayed at this hotel for four nights. It was our first time staying at the Shoreline (we have visited Waikiki four times previously but usually stay at another beach front hotel). We decided to save some money and try a cheaper hotel. As we arrived in the lobby we were pleasantly surprised by the modern decor. Reception staff were friendly and offered to store our bags as we arrived 7 hours before check in. We we got to our room it was clean, modern and had everything we needed and expected from the room description on the website. Hotel is located 1 and 1/2 blocks back from the beach, shops, restaurants etc. We would highly recommend this hotel to others and would definitely stay here again.

Ideal accommodation for our short stay (5 nights). Centrally located and very helpful and informative staff. Adjoining Heavenly restaurant great for breakfast. Great that beach towels and chairs provided. Free coffee in the foyer also a bonus.

Our stay at Shoreline Waikiki (March 2017) was really great. Our room was ample size for two of us, we had a great city view from our balcony, the bed was very comfortable and it had secure storage of valuables. The AC vent was a bit nosy, even when turned off, but by the end of the day we were always tired and did not notice or mind the noise. We had a coffee machine and fridge with complimentary coffee and water which was nice, no amenities for boiling water or cooking, so be prepared to eat out for most, if not all, meals.Our room was made up daily and we never felt intruded upon by the staff. They were very accommodating of our requests and always friendly towards the guests.The pool was not a great highlight, we recommend taking the 5 minute stroll down to the stunning Waikiki beach for your swims instead!In my opinion this hotel is more ideal for couples, with the balconies getting quite high and the distance to the beach. It was absolutely fine with us and we did not mind the walk at all!

My gf and I recently spent a week in Honolulu.As this was our 2nd trip to Honolulu we were looking for a comfortable hotel with a good location at an affordable price. The Shoreline Hotel Waikiki met all of these requirements and we were glad to have stayed therLocation/price: you can't beat it. While not being on the beach the Shoreline Hotel is still very well located in Waikiki with affordable prices. If having a view on the water doesn't matter then you should consider staying here. From hotel everything is within minutes walking, from shops, cafes, restaurants, the beach and buses.Staff: everyone at the the Shoreline was very friendly and helpful. It started even a few days before our arrival when we received an email from Jordan (guest experience manager) to greet us and ask if there is anything we needed for our stay. I responded in saying that we were coming to Honolulu to celebrate my bf's birthday and Jordan made recommendations for dinner. It was great to have these recommendations and we ended up going to one of these and enjoyed it a lot.On my bf's birthday the staff had left a card in our room as well as written a message on the board in the lobby :) this was a very nice gesture!Hotel: we found the hotel to be very comfortable, nice bed, quiet and clean. In the lobby you can help yourself with coffee, tea and cucumber water for free at any time of the day.We really enjoyed our trip to Honolulu and the Shoreline Hotel was definitely a contributor to it. If we ever come back we would gladly stay again here and recommend it to anyone going to Hawaii.

I really believe this hotel is the best place to stay at in Waikiki. It's clean, central, has all we needed and those special little touches like the cold water, iced tea, fairy floss, chalk board notices, (eg. my husband's 50th birthday message), friendly and helpful staff, were noted and truly appreciated. It's great value! Honestly, stay there and you will see. Tina and Joe

Shoreline Hotel was a great choice. Staff who checked us in were friendly and helpful, location was excellent, the little extras like coffee, water ect in the lobby was very welcome. The only negative was our room smelt very mouldy, as if the carpet had been wet ??? Decor was clean and modern and all in all a very pleasant stay.

The hotel is fairly nice, has valet parking for 30 bucks a day, which i s, i guess, reasonable, staff is friendly, quick and neat. Our room was always perfectly cleaned by Carlo. I have two gripes though. First, the room safe could not be opened on the day of our departure, however the staff reacted swiftly, so no problem. Secondly, we were charged some 16 dollars a day so called amenity fee. When I asked for explanation Jenny the receptionist, I was told that was for coffee and WiFi. When confronted with a complementary WiFi and coffee cards, she stammered something about these being complementary within the 15.71 dollar fee. At that point I wanted my money back. She finally presented a booking (made by my travel agency) that satisfactorily explained it as some Hawaian hotel fee or tax. Maybe the hotel should train their receptionists little better in order not to give lame explanations. Otherwise the hotel is close to Waikiki beach and reasonably priced.

The Shoreline Hotel is such a gem within Waikiki! I absolutely loved our stay! This boutique is so adorable with such chic modern furniture in the lobby. There is complimentary infused water, coffee, tea, an essentials oil bar, and they give you free towels to borrow for the beach. It's not a beach front property, but the beach is very close, a short walk, and its within steps of many restaurants and shopping centers. Its located right next to Waikiki Shopping Plaza, which has a cute Japanese eatery, also right across from Royal Hawaiian Center, which has lots of different shops and eateries as well. Its in the heart of Waikiki, so its surrounded by pretty much everything! The bed was comfortable and the room was cute. Everything was clean and well done. The front desk service was really nice and helpful. The front desk guy gave me some recommendations on food places he liked -- but ask me for mine! :D There is a pool, but I would recommend just going to the beach since its so close by. I didn't find the room to be too small as some of the reviews had mentioned, but honestly when you are in the heart of everything, we spent so much time walking everywhere around Waikiki and enjoying the beach. This is a very cute and comfortable hotel to come back to after a day of exploring at a great price point. Location is perfect here, rooms are comfortable, cute hotel overall! I would highly recommend and I would also come back to stay for my next visit :)
user_name:
eatwellexploreoften
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We were here for our honeymoon! We were upgraded to a junior suite and had beautiful flowers choccies and champagne waiting for us on arrival! What a great touch! Jordan was absolutely fantastic in the lead up to our stay. Will definitely stay again

Hotel was clean but the room was smaller than I prefer. Also there was no fitness center. The Staff was great including front desk and valet parking staff. Would recommend this hotel if the room size and lack of a fitness center are not important to you.

Hotel was very clean, staff were very friendly. Tea,coffee available all day in lobby as well as apples & most days they made fairy floss. Location was central right across from Ross Dress for Less. Checked us in early after a long flight was a blessing!!

We will give a big 10 to the hotel for cleanliness, client care, location and price.We appreciate very much the fact that the hotel accepted the first day cancellation without penalty.We had our flight cancelled because of a storm in BC.

We booked this place for our honeymoon before we left Australia as it was one of the cheaper options, when we arrived we were blown away by how beautiful the place was and how friendly the dude at the desk was, there was nothing he couldn't do to help and made our trip that much better, I believe his name was Matt, he made the start of our honeymoon awesome

This hotel is value for money. Great location, staff are very friendly and very helpful. Rooms are a bit small but neat and tidy and cleaned every day. Downstairs they have coffee, iced tea and every afternoon they make cotton candy. I would definitely stay here again.

Enjoyed using beach towels and chairs hotel provided and being able to walk to beach. I like the decor used in the hotel. Check in staff was very friendly and helpful. I have scent allergies and upon entering the room I almost had to back out due to room deodorizer and/or scented cleaner they use...never smelled that scent before...way too strong! Smell dissipated by day 2. Hopefully they will discontinue using that product.

Centrally located in Waikiki and located a block from the beach. I enjoyed the Kona coffee and refreshments. Roof top pool, safe, mini refrigerator and beach towels provided. Only thing missing was a gym, but other than that, I really enjoyed and I would return.

Spur of the moment decision to spend our last couple of days on Oahu in Waikiki. Booked last minute on the day of arrival. Called direct and was able to get a better rate than online. Our room was quite small, but clean. Easy to walk to Waikiki Beach and numerous restaurants and stores. Front desk staff were very friendly and accommodating, and stored our luggage for us as our flight was late at night on the day of check-out.

My wife choose this hotel on line and thank goodness she did . After a island hopping 14hr flight we finally arrived at 4am in Honolulu , no problem they had our room ready . Comfortably appointed with a great bed and all the normal appointments . The staff are a real credit to this hotel with nothing being a problem and always bright and cheerful . Great location with the main road a short walk away and close to all public transport , some great restaurants close by as well . The chilled cucumber water in the foyer was great after hours of wandering around Waikiki .

the staff are what makes a difference at this hotel . They are great before you arrive with an email welcome and once we arrived the service didn't end . Everyone is helpful and happy and being a smaller hotel you don't feel like a number . The location is great and the rooms have everything we needed . We will def come back . Free cotton candy everyday is a way to make the guests smile :)

We had difficulty finding the parking for this hotel and the traffic in the area was terrible. It was only by chance that we actually found where to park. Our room was clean and included a coffee maker but like other hotels they have the meaningless "Resort Fee" which frankly doesn't cover anything. The rooftop pool was difficult to locate and it was too windy to actually swim there. Only really used this place to sleep as we were visiting family in the area.

We appreciated being upgraded to a larger room on 13th floor and were greeted with a handwritten note thanking us for being return guests. Who does that ? A business that is trying harder. The small things matter. Cotton candy in the afternoon in lobby. Fun concept. Heavenly restaurant is the best ! Thank you. Your business and " what you have done with the place" has won our hearts. ♡ thank you !
user_name:
Mary M
Los Angeles, California, Usa

review_body: The shoreline is a well located hotel in the middle of everything in Waikiki. The hotel itself is renovated, but 3 stars at best.As most people say, "we need somewhere clean and airconditioned and comfortable for the night".The beds are only double size and not very comfortable for the 8 nights we were there.The staff were very good, eager to please and very obliging.( If the bed was a queen and more comfortable, I'd rate the place 3 stars easily).This is the first time we have stayed in Waikiki so can't compare value for money to other hotels, however we would recommend it.

Enjoyable stay at Shoreline , facilities good ,service good and quiet central location .A staff member Yianni who was also working on Aloha tour was very helpful and friendly.Free beach chair were a great idea to take n short walk to Waikiki beach.Tour bus drop off across the road and lots of eating places nearby.

The room was 118 but they charged hidden fees and it turned out to be 160.They forced us to pay 15 usd for "amenities" we did not use like rooftop pool.The guys at the front desk were not nice the ventilation in the room was dirty and the toilet looks old. Not recommended

Shoreline hotel is situated in the perfect quiet location only 10 mins walk to main shopping and waikiki beach. Room size is decent, tea and coffee complimentary in lobby which is nice. Staffs are helpful and pleasant. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Nice little hotel close to the main sites in Waikiki. Room was comfortable and good size. No view from room except run down adjustment building adjacent but not a big deal. View is at the beach which is short walk Fridge and microwave in room handy for snacks or saving few bucks on food. Bathroom okay but shower was so-so. Low on pressure and a wall mounted shower head. Good lighting and basic amenities. Did bang my head couple times on shelf weirdly placed just above sink when brushing teeth and washing face.Staff were great. Very helpful on a number of occasions. Top marks there.In addition to couple small things above the relatively high cost of parking was a bit of a drag. $30 a day seemed excessive. Traveller tip: if you book directly with the hotel they waive the "resort" fees (already the dumbest concept amongst Hawaii hotels).All-in-all a comfortable stay. Nicely located with other conveniences nearby (Ross across the street open until 1AM and new Nordstrom Rack around the corner, 24hr McD for post-party nomnoms). Would be on my list to consider highly for another stay in Waikiki.

We needed a hotel for two nights as we had arrived from Japan and then moving into a timeshare resort that had been booked. This hotel was excellent, the staff on the desk were very friendly and helpful and the location was great. There was a restaurant next door which was ok. We enjoyed our very short stay very much.

Our stay at the Shoreline was great. The hotel is very clean and situated in a good location close to lots of shopping and restaurants. The hotel was very affordable. The restaurant adjacent to the hotel was great.

Awesome hotel, clean, friendly staff and convenient location. Can't wait to come back and it's very affordable for those who do not want to spend a fortune. I highly recommend it here as I was staying in a different hotel initially for the first 2 days of my stay and I changed to here immediately

Dirty rooms, not friendly stuff. They forgot about the surprise that my bf was organising for my birthday and asked them to do. They didnt appologise and didnt fix it. Rooms are very old and tiny. Would never recomend this hotel

Excellent staff, very helpful giving direction or is you needed a lock cut off your luggage, great location. The only negative was the sliding door to the balcony was not tight. So it let in a lot of outside noise. But I did not complain to the staff about it.

Excellent location! Rooms were very modern, well furnished, reasonably priced, and comfortable. Bathroom has a bidet. Don't see that often. We were impressed from the moment we checked in until well after we checked out. Our bags were held for us for the remainder of the day since we didn't fly out til late evening. Highly recommend this hotel.

Great location and value for money. The pool was a little small but good for what u paid for. Everything is nearby. The staff were great. Loved having the cooled water and ice tea as well as hot tea and cofffee at anytime available in the foyer.

The location of this hotel is great. A 2 minute walk to the main shopping district & Waikiki Beach. The rooms are decent (didn't care about the old building view), the staff are very friendly and the cafe next door is fantastic. The roof top pool is a bit of a miss. It's clean, good for a dip, but you wouldn't hang around up there. Saying that, you're in Hawaii...... go to the beach

The hotel is in a good location, it is close to shops the beach and transport. I could walk too so many of the shop, restaurants and bars. Getting to places further away from the hotel is made easy using either the public bus system, taxies or shuttle's. One of the best feature of the bus system was that they announce each stop so for someone like me it made things easy to get off at the right stop.

This is a very nice middle class hotel. You can't expect any luxury. But the rooms are clean and the bed are very comfortable. The location is great, you are very quick at the beach and in the surrounding mall areclose. The staff is very attentive and incredibly friendly and helpful. For them 5 stars !

We stayed here during a week's stay in Hawaii. It was room only but there were many places to eat nearby and a superb place nearby for shopping. Waikiki beach was only a short distance away, a man made beach. There was a little kiosk near the hotel where you could book trips at a reduced rate.

The Hotel is ideally located, clean with friendly, helpful staff. It does however fall short of 4 stars. We were 'upgraded' to a higher floor which was very nice but there was no fridge in the room which meant we were unable to purchase anything that may have needed to be kept cold. Neither was there a kettle. My husband likes to have a cup of tea with fresh milk and I like to have a yoghurt when we wake up in the morning. It didn't help that we noticed other rooms with a fridge and microwave. Our friends were upgraded to a Junior Suite which had all amentities. There was a coffee machine in the room but after the first complimentary coffee pods, it was necessary to purchase them from the front desk which I found outrageous for a '4 star' hotel. There were urns with flavoured water and coffee in the foyer but it is inconvenient to have to go downstairs to get these. Tea is made with boiling water not warm water from an urn. Candy floss was offered every afternoon but I thought this more a gimmick than a plus. Also the pool area is not conducive to spending time. It's a pool and nothing more. This may sound nitpicking but it is often the small details that make a hotel great.

This hotel was more reasonably priced than others in the locality. I was surprised to find how central it was for accessing shops, restaurants, the beach and tour buses. My room was very comfortable and extremely well equipped.

Nice hotel with great room and friendly staff. Good location close to Waikiki beach and lots of restaurant.The room was clean and the cleaning staff makes a good work. In lobby they have coffee and tea. They also have water. They have also a pool at the top.

location was good, close by to shopping and the beach. My main complaint would be that there were no place to store your clothes. No drawers at all. Other than hanging your clothes in the closet you had to keep things in your suitcases. There also was no vent in the bathroom. The view is of another hotel. The help was very nice as was the checking in. One or two nights would be fine But not for 7 nights.

The hotel location is amazing. It's one street back from beach front so you don't have to go far to be on the beach. There is a great cafe attached to the hotel with amazing breakfast. Everything is within a few minutes walk. The hotel itself is very clean and nice.

It was disturbing to have a fire alarm , yet alone a false alarm at that time of the night . They did not apologize for the inconvenience of our stay and did not let us know anything going on. The balcony is small and had water dripping from the floor above ac. Room was descent but not for the price

This hotel is 5 minute walk to everything. Very clean, comfy beds, great water pressure in shower, free fast wifi. Best part about this hotel are the staff. Friendly, helpful & very accomodating. A big Mahalo to Matthew, Ivan & Ina for your wonderful service & for making our holiday so enjoyable. See you next time.

Enjoyed our stay at the Shoreline Hotel. It is very conveniently situated with access to beach and shops within minutes. Rooms are clean and beds are very comfortable. Iced tea and water available all day in the foyer as well as tea/coffee,newspapers and fruit. Beach towels also available at reception. The staff could not be more friendly, helpful or corteous. I would have no hesitation recommending this hotel and would stay there again

Myself and my wife stayed at the Shoreline for 5 nights in late January. We have previously stayed right on the beach but wanted somewhere more reasonably priced for our short break. We were on the early flight from OZ and had requested early check-in. When we arrived there were no rooms available so we left our bags and went for a walk. The staff on check-in were very friendly and that continued through-out our stay.We returned a few hours later and were provided a room on the 8th floor. The room was clean with comfy bed, mini fridge and mircrowave. Overall the facilities exceeded my expectations and the WiFi speed were very good.Our view faced the dreaded building that others have complained about, but lets face it, the hotel can't control the neighbours and apart from sleeping in the room, we had't gone there for the view. The location was ideal, right on the door step of "Ross" and just around the corner from the upgraded international market and a Nordstrom-rack, a few blocks to the beach and plenty of good restaurants and bars to try near by (the hotel supply great beach towels)The hotel itself does not have its own bar so if you are in a group, there isn't really a place to meet apart from reception. When we go in a group, we normally meet in the hotel bar before venturing out.I'd read reviews about noise from the street and have to say that on one night a car alarm was going off nearby which woke us but apart from that there was no issues at all.We did use the roof top pool on one occasion, not the most salubrious but did the job.Suffice to say, when I go back to Waikiki with just my wife, we will stay here again.

Waikiki hotel rates are ridiculously high, but this hotel offered a good accomodation for a (relatively) good price. Rooms were sufficient in size, very clean and the staff was friendly. Distance to the beach was about a 10-minute walk, which is fine.

It is a beautiful boutique hotel , for the decent price it's wonderful location is amazing ! It's not very big it suits couples rather then anyone with kids, it has a small pool upstairs but the beach is only 2mins away,Would defiantly be back !!

Room was spacious, bed comfortable, shower worked well, & free wifi also worked well. Could control air conditioning which was useful. Also had small balcony which meant fresh air in the room which I prefer. Free bathroom toiletries were excellent. Appreciated free bottles of water in the bedroom and also free refreshments in the reception area - cool drinks, coffee & fresh fruit. Great location in central Waikiki - only 2 minutes walk to lots of local buses and only 5 minutes walk to the beach. Surrounded by all the main shops. Only disappointments - 1/ there is no baggage storage on site and you have to pay a minimum of $20 to store luggage off site - not helpful if you have a very late flight or want to visit one of the other islands for a few days and leave a bag in storage. 2/ there is no breakfast service in the hotel, although the health food cafe next door does a nice breakfast and hotel patrons get a 10% discount.

Front desk staff not able to deal with customers appropriately. NEED further training. When faced with a challenge that was easily solvable with good / basic customer service during check in - a card not going through for authorisation for 'incidentals' following total and complete payment in full for the room. Instead of allowing the 'customer' to go up to their room to find the appropriate card in their luggage after stressful travelling. The front desk staff refused to allow the 'customer' to have the keys to their room without a card or a $200 cash deposit - despite the room already being paid for in full. They held the 'customer' hostage in the lobby untill a card could be found or a large cash deposit paid - even asking them to unpack their luggage in the lobby to find said card, before they were allowed access to their room. Claiming this was 'policy'. This was hostile, unecessary and showed a huge lack of understanding of the customer experience. Favoring unquestioned 'policy' over keeping the customer feeling happy, positive and their situation understood - when such an easy resolution was within their grasp. No customer recovery was attempted and the 'customer' decided to walk out without checking in. Such a blatant failure to deal with a few very common customer challenges. This hotel will certainly be regularly loosing people to the newly opened Hyatt Centric opposite who excell in customer experience and facilities.

Arrived tired and stressed , with a pre paid reservation. Hotel would not allow me to check in as my credit card was packed in a bag.Both front desk agents were clueless.They would not allow me to check in without a 200 USD cash deposit.Hotel does not have a bar or anything, so they couldn't justly the charge.I was not prepared to unpack in reception , so they agreed to refund me the charge i had just paid.5 minutes later, they called me to say they refunded it onto the wrong card.Terrible

Free beverage is so niceand the location is good because there is in middle of waikiki and close by Mcdonals.The best thing is that this hotel located near by T-galleria & ROSS. so we can find out Trolley stop so fast.

we stayed at Shorline for a week. Such a great location in the heart of everything. Close to buses and walking distance to most places in the area. The staff were very friendly and very helpful, always greeting us with a happy smile. The rooms lovely and clean, modern and serviced well daily. Loved the infused cucumber water, iced tea as well as hot tea and coffee you could access any time downstairs in the lobby, a wonderful idea! Definitely recommend Shorline a great place to stay while in Waikiki.

such a great location, very impressed with Ross across the road and a abc store on within a block of either side of hotel. Also 1 block away from trolley starting point. the hotel is kinda boutique but i loved it!

Very close to main shopping and beaches. Very competent and informative staff. Rooms OK, bed comfortable , modern facilities. Quite a lot of street noise, which was not a surprise, our room on floor 12 was next door to the lifts which were quite noisy when operating, try to avoid this.
user_name:
Michael G
Auckland Central, New Zealand

review_body: Old room, not valuable for price. Pictures make room look big, but is actually really small. Shower/bathtub drain blocked. Good location. Balcony goes onto an old rooftop, dirty and smelly. Wouldn't go back again. Parking too expensive at 30 usd.

Just like you guys, I shop for hotels for great rates but wonder if the price would be the deciding factor. This is my "GO TO" hotel on Waikiki since I already know what to expect. I just got back from a 5 night stay there. That makes my 6 stays there altogether and not been disappointed yet. I wish I can stay here every time I'm in Honolulu but the rates are not always in my favor.The following reasons I like this hotel:Boutique feel- It's upscale enough but not pretentious.Location is close to the best stores and restaurants in Waikiki and to the beach, not on the heavy pedestrian street.Refreshing beverages in the lobby, free fruit if you get there early.Rooms are clean, nicely decorated with above average linensBeds are comfortable and always get nice sleep.Staff are always friendly and helpfulA few things I wish they can add to their amenities: Beach chairs and beach matsThere's a small pool on the rooftop which I never used since I prefer to soak up the sun on the beach.

We recently discovered this gem of a hotel. It is in a great location in the heart of Waikiki. Close to shopping,beach,restaurants. Has nice amenities,roof top pool and restaurant.Feels like an upscale modern hotel,but is very reasonably priced. Will stay again for sure ,our next time in Waikiki!

I stayed here for 5 nights in January and it was the perfect location to enjoy Honolulu. It's only about a minute walk from the beach and it is surrounded by shopping, restaurants and activities. The front desk staff were very nice and friendly. The room was very clean. They provide a keurig in the room with 4 complimentary k cups and tea, but they also provide complimentary coffee and tea in the lobby. After coming in from a warm day at the beach there's fresh pineapple iced tea and cucumber lemon water. It was very delicious and refreshing after being in the hot sun. I've never seen this at other hotels so this was a very sweet touch to show that they care. The lobby also has essential oils for sale. My friend tried the sleepy time oil and it really worked. Even though we were in a 5 hour time difference she had no problem falling asleep thanks to the oils. They also have ukulele lessons and a list of other fun activities provided on site. It is also between multiple bus routes so getting around is not an issue. Great hotel! I would definitely recommend this hotel.

The hotel is so close to all major areas, it is great for the budget minded traveller. The staff are so kind and accommodating. The rooms are small but updated ; the balconies really are not useful especially when you have a city view of the back alley... other than that no real concerns.

The location is perfect. You are in the middle of every thing but not caught up in the crush of tourists. Close to beach, shopping and restaurants. The rooms are modern, nicely appointed and comfortable. The hotel has an adjacent restaurant that has great food and drinks.

I have stayed in this hotel which was sold to me as a 3.5 star facility by priceline, this is my true and honest review of this hotel. This is a very low quality poorly maintained hotel with Mold in the lobby and the guest rooms. I've pictures to prove it.1. Very filthy, poorly maintained, smelly, dirty and moldy floor, lobby with broken furniture and unkempt reception2. Dirt and mold in the main hotel lobby (see attached Pictures of mold in main lobby)3. low quality, broken and unmaintained Lobby furniture (see attached Pictures of broken lobby furniture)4. Smelly hallways, guest rooms and washrooms5. Mold in guest washrooms (see attached Pictures of washroom mold). My daughter was sick the whole time we were in the room.6. dirty walls and rust all over the washroom (see attached Pictures of washroom rust)7. Very small dingy rooms, with no space to keep luggage8. Very low quality guest room furniture with sharp pointy corners, me and family got injured many times during our stay.9. Dirty linen and washroom towels. The towels are so dirty that they are no longer white. They are more like dirty yellow (see attached Pictures of washroom towels and linen)10. Very bad housekeeping, even after the rooms were cleaned, the linen, towels and beds were not made properly. (see attached Pictures of bedroom after housekeeping complete)11. Ultra-low quality washroom things like old worn out soap dish and other washroom toiletries (see picture of Soap Dish and other washroom accessories)12. Dirty and smelly Shower curtain13. Mold and filth on washroom tiles and groves, which has not been cleaned or years.14. Old worn-out, dirty wall paper in guest rooms/washrooms, See picture of dirty wall paper and switches.15. Dirty and unkempt outdoor pool. After checking it, we decided, no way we were going to get into that pool.16. No workout room/gym17. 2 free coffee pods and then a $2 charge for Coffee machine PODS in roomIf you are booking this hotel as a 3.5 Star hotel, you'll be terribly disappointed.

Close to all amenities and comfortable. Friendly staff. Plenty of eating places close by including the Heavenly organic restaurant next door. Easy for transport and beaches. Slightly tired. Good value though.

We saw the great reviews and location and decided to give it a try - glad we did, we'd definitely stay here if we come back to Waikiki. We were just in town one night, but the service and location were great. Easy walk to the beach and great shopping and restaurants very nearby. Clean, comfortable room.

Good access to DFS, Royal Hawaiian Shopping Center, other shops. Little dark at night. Heavenly cafe is good to have on the 1st floor.Easy to catch Pink trolly.Cozy & simple hotel.Baggage & call taxi service is very quick.

The Shoreline is located in a great area close to the beach, shopping and transport. Staff are always friendly and helpful. The attached cafe/restaurant serves lovely modern and bespoke healthy food. The hotel has a nice contemporary look and feel. The rooftop pool whilst small and basic is clean and provides great views of Waikiki.

Stayed here for 7 nights for a little R and R. Great location being very close to shops and restaurants. The beach was close, about a 5 minute walk or so. The room was clean and all of the staff were excellent. Always smiling with a warm greeting. The location was very central and getting around was easy. Had breakfast at the Heavenly. Eggs Benny with Kahlua Pork was great! Will definitely stay again!

Hotel is in a great location and very clean,It could use a little TLC but it's minor.Only a 2min walk to the beach and shops are all with in a short walk as well.Staff are very friendly. Would definitely recommend for the price.

Stay was very comfy and of good value. 5 mins walk to Waikiki beach and 2 mins to main shopping plazas. No hotel restaurant however the Heavenly just below is pretty decent in comparison to everything else nearby.

This was our first stay at a hotel off the water, which could be easily $100 more for the mid-level room. It was a great surprise to ourselves to find this accommodation perfect. Great value with its location, cleanliness, impeccable and friendly service, and much much more! We stayed in a partial ocean view corner room. Even though our room was next to the elevators, we could not hear any noise at all. This will be definitely a strong candidate for us to stay in the future.

Not much else to ask for at the Shoreline. The hotel was complete and left us wanting little else. The location is great, the room was clean and we designed. We would book here again when we come back to Waikiki.

First time in Hawaii, this place was competitively priced and centrally located. Everything worked out nicely, even the couple of glitches were handled well. It's not a big hotel, so you can easily get to know the staff after a couple of days. The biggest negative was some cleanliness and maintenance issues. The place is due for a remodel of the rooms, they're a bit on the musky and dingy end of the spectrum, cleanish but not spotless.

We stay 6 nights in the shorleine Hotel the Bed and the room was clean and great,the location is near by the wakiki Beach and Stores its all around the Hotel.Good Food and Cocktails in the Hotel Resturant

The room was nice. And the bed and lines actually really fantastic - so smooth and perfect to sleep. Also liked that there was a working desk.However, there are some downsides:- A/C is not the most quiet one (had one with "silent" mode for sleeping at another one which worked perfectly)- There was a garbage car every day peeping for at least 15 minutes. And although we stayed on the 9th floor and I had earplugs in, I woke up several nights since the truck was hearable.- No gym (or expensive voucher for gym nearby for $15/day - we found an alternative for $25/week)- Valet parking pretty expensive ($30/night)

Everyone was very helpful. It started at booking and just continued on. When we arrived the baggage handler came out and picked up our 13 bags and delivered them to our rooms. The staff had answers for all of our questions and kept us lined out.

Beatiful place to visit and great accomodation at the Shoreline Hotel. Close to main shopping area with lots of good eating choices. Also close to fantastic sections of beach. Availability of the pool at the hotel meant even on days when the beach wasn't great you could still swim.

The location was very good. The staff were excellent ant attentive. The women who clean the room did good job but when men-cleaner clean we noticed that they don not pay much attention to replenish soap etc. The staff at the front desk are excellent . Overall we were pleased with the service.
user_name:
gametchub
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We only stayed for one night after returning from a cruise, the service was great, they offered free coffee ice tea, and cucumber water, it is close to Kalakalua Ave....It is a small hotel, but celan.
user_name:
Mayra F
North Arlington, New Jersey

review_body: We chose this hotel because it wasn't as expensive as the hotels on the beach and it had everything we required - a clean room, a comfortable bed, friendly staff, a fridge and a microwave for our leftovers and most importantly, it was central and VERY CONVENIENT. Afterall, we wouldn't be hanging out at the hotel and watching Honolulu from our hotel window but experiencing it outside. Our room didn't have any ocean view. Our room faced the city and the balcony was so small with railings we were too scared to go outside due to the height. We kept the curtains closed most of the time. The pool in the photos did not look great and we did not visit the pool but if we wanted to swim we'd be go to the beach! The first 2 water bottles and coffee pods in the room are free and subsequent refills will be charged. We did not use the coffee pods. There were complimentary coffee, tea in the foyer but we mainly only drank the iced pineapple and cucumber tea. Heavenly restaurant was adjoined to the hotel and was great for healthy fresh breakfasts - loco moco was amazing! (We found a 10% discount coupon in one of the magazines) Ross Dress for Less is directly opposite the hotel closing at 1am most nights, ABC Store also across the road, The Waikiki Trolley main pickup is directly behind the hotel at DFS Galleria where all lines passed, $5 Trolley to Waikele Outlets at DFS Galleria, the hotel is 2 min walking distance to the beach. There's no mini bar or in house dining but that did not bother us and we tried a lot of the TA restaurants and cafes. On the first day, we arrived around 7am and the hotel stored our bags while we went to explore Honolulu. Checkout was around 5.30am and was a breeze (under 1 minute). Would return to this hotel again.

We spent four nights at this hotel on our first trip to Hawaii and were so pleased with it. At the center of activity in Waikiki but a fraction of the cost of other big label surrounding hotels. Rooms were clean, comfortable, and staff were very welcoming and helpful at all hours of the day and night. We had planned a few tours out and about so didn't want to pay extra for resort services we wouldn't use, this hotel was perfect for our schedule. Coffee was supplied in our room and fresh water and fresh delicious iced tea available 24 hours in the lobby. Free wifi too and excellent air conditioning if you want it. The adjacent restaurant Heavenly Island Lifestyle also had delicious fresh affordable meals all day and most of the night. Can't think of one negative thing, highly recommend it, will stay there again on our next visit.

We decided to stay at this hotel also for 2nd time during our visit at Honolulu, were satisfied again... really good location, basically right at the center of Waikiki, nice room & staff for reasonable price... would come back again!

The location of this hotel is excellent for Waikiki beach attractions. The room was spacious and clean. Bathroom small but adequate. Towel service average, but beach towels provided. There is an adjacent excellent health food restaurant. We also rented a car from an agency just around the corner from the hotel.

I wife and I were travelling with a group to Waikiki and found out two week stay at the Shoreline to be very pleasant. The staff was always willing to help, from recommending local attractions and restaurants, helping us find services, or just having a friendly chat at the front desk. They were also very sympathetic to our needs. After mentioning that our neighbour about was very noisy the night before, the manager offered to upgrade our room to one of the upper floors with a partial ocean view. Most hotels wouldn't go that far. We didn't take them up on the offer, but they insisted the offer would stand until the end of our stay if we so desired. The room was modestly decorated with all the amenities we are accustomed to: refrigerator, microwave, iron and board, and a safe. We found the king size bed and pillows to be extremely comfortable; the best we've had at a hotel in many years. All in all, we had a wonderful stay at the Shoreline Hotel. We would a return in a heartbeat!

We spent 5 days in the hotel and were very satisfied with the location of the hotel - close to shops, restaurants, few minutes from the Waikiki beach. Friendly staff, nice rooms, comfortable beds, 24/7 fresh coffe, water, ice tea at the lobby. We will certainly come back.

I arrived at this hotel at 8am off a flight from Sydney and expected to be told I would have to wait till 3pm to check in. I was greeted by a lovely reseptionist Ilana she told me my room was ready and I was given a room on 11th floor with a view out towards the sea and the famous Royal Hawian hotel which were less than 2 blocks away.The room was small but clean and had all that I neededIlana at the front desk was helpful through out my stayThere was a young man that tried to help with a bus to the outlets stores . I asked about the direct bus that I knew ran from the strip but instead he booked me on a van that picked me up and took over an hour to get there and did not drop me with in the shopping centre and gave me no direction , Other wise this is a great place to stay in Waikiki close to the strip and beachThe pool is not much but you don't need it when so close to the beachThere is a restaurant called Heavenly attached. There is no bar .

The rooms are lovely and clean. Staff go out of their way to help. Thank you to the lovely young man who rang around looking for shoes for my son, calling the taxi and making sure we had enough time to get back for our tour. We WILL be staying here next time we come back and telling our kiwi friends and family to do the same

The property is excellently located. The staff is friendly and helpful and promptly looked after any concerns we had. Room was spacious and comfortable.A Keurig machine in the room was supplied with 3 coffees and 1 tea, only one of the coffees was a regular type. Any further coffees you had to purchase at $2 per serving. Way too expensive. Alleviated by the fact they served free coffee in the lobby at all hours. The rooftop pool is small, temperature cold and it was 30 stairs steps above the elevator reach, making it a problem for people with mobility issues. The room only had one chair and we had to bring in the chair on the patio to provide seating for two..

Great location to the hive of activity. Bus stops close by. Hotel staff were very friendly and kind, and the rooms were clean. Bed comfortable. Great to be able to have hot and cold drinks from the lobby free.

Fantastic location, close to Trolley bus stop, walking distance to Waikiki beach, restaurants and it's opposite to Ross which opens until 1am! The room is nice and cosy, staff is very helpful and friendly.

the room was clean and modern. the staff were great and always there we you need them. even though it was not on the beach it is very close. the location is awesome it is in the middle of fun area, you can walk to everywhere you need to go. I recommend this hotel to everyone i know considering its location and price.

Clean and modern Hotel, stunning views from balcony and the rooftop pool. Matthew from reception is extremely kind and helpful! The location is close to shopping amenities and Waikiki beach. Highly recommended!

While this isn't on the beach it is very close and close to shopping as well. Clean and modern perfect for our stay. The staff was always friendly and answered any questions we had. Everything you could need was within walking distance of the hotel.

Great location, clean rooms, friendly staff. would definitely stay there again. Look forward to coming back next year. Matthew at reception in particular went out of his way to make our stay enjoyable

Visited in December staying here for 4 nights. Good location as just over 5 minutes walk to the beach, near a variety of shops and near bus stops. Room was clean the only problem was the noise from the street as our room was facing the road. Free WiFi was of a decent speed. Bathroom had a shower room so toilet and shower was open plan. This was a bit problematic as the shower was near the toilet and the water we think everywhere. Room was clean and staff were helpful.

The surrounding area was noisy. Restaurant below was loud late into the night. Maybe a room in the upper floors will help with the street noise. Don't drink the bottled water. They charge you for it. $15 for 2 small bottles.

We were very satisfied with our stay at the Shoreline. We liked being close to the beach, restaurants and shopping but still in a smaller and quieter hotel. We had two rooms and they were both very comfortable and clean. They even upgraded us to a junior suite which was a nice bonus. Staff were friendly and helpful.

We loved this hotel. The rooms were furnished and equipped with modern furniture and equipment. The bathroom was spacious the bed was comfortable. The coffee supply was continuous. The staff was friendly and courteous and the location was superb.

Conveniently located a block back from the beach and in the middle of everything in Waikiki. The staff were always pleasant and helpful. Free coffee and cold water always available in the lobby is a nice idea. There is a roof top pool but it's not somewhere you'd want to hang out with very noisy industrial air conditioners going right beside it. Maybe if you're desperate for a cool dip without going to the beach which was extremely crowded at this time of year. There's a reasonably priced restaurant next door attached to the hotel. The rooms were quite well appointed with a coffee machine, hair dryer and lots of power points. Housekeeping staff very amenable. The only thing wrong with the cheaper rooms are the views. There is a horrendous looking building next door which I had to look at for a week. It would help if these rooms had white sheer curtains you could keep over the sliding door to filter the horrible view and let the light in. As it was I kept the heavy curtain drawn and I was in a very dark room. There is also a lot of urban noise nearby, rubbish trucks, air conditioners etc. Not a peaceful environment.

Hotel is close to everything. However, room was very small with no table or chair. We stayed on 6th floor, but it was noisy at night. Limited view from room, because it was blocked by buildings nearby. The rate was expensive given the hotel/room quality. But it's holiday season.

Hotel was dated but we'll kept. All the people there were nice and friendly. Location was ideal, everything you could want was within a 5 min walk. Only complaint would be rooftop pool was something out of a 1970's Kung fu movie

The location of this hotel is great. Right in the centre with a 5 in walk to Waikiki beach. Nice rooms with comfy beds.The restaurant was pricy but value for money.The pool on the roof top is not worth a visit.The view from the room wasn't great-

small hotel with some charm. They have upgraded this old Honolulu staple hotel to charming little find with a fabulous location. If you do not care about the view it is delightful. The upgrades are quite nice and there is only so much you can do with the space, i.e., bathroom etc but they did a great job with the bedding etc.
user_name:
Barbara R
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: So happy with this hotel perfect room cleaned everyday very nice restaurant and bar very cheap all the staff were fantastic helped us with our pearl harbour tour with directions and a map of were to go perfect location central and this is were we will stay when we come again Huge thank you to all staff on making our first visit so amazing Thank you

The bed was very comfortable, room was clean (every day), location in between restaurants and stores. Closeby the beach! It took us just 20 minutes to go to the biggest outdoormall of the world and just 30 minutes to go to Honolulu downtown.

I picked Shoreline because it both good reviews and reasonable prices; my wife was worried that it couldn't be as good as it sounds -- a few hours after we checked in she said,"You made the perfect choice; now I can stop worrying."The room was not large (but definitely not too small) but had a balcony and was beautifully appointed. Everything worked well and seemed to be of the highest quality.And, no, I'm not related to the owner; I'm a retired lawyer living in Toronto (Canada) thousands of miles away.

Great location, excellent service. Service was spot on, especially Sonny. All the staff were very friendly at all hours of the night. I would definitely recommend it. Only complaint was parking. Had to pay an extra $30 for Valet parking. overall great experience

This place was quite dumpy compared to what I had expected for an almost 4 star hotel. When I looked out my balcony window there were homeless people congregating the the alley way with graffiti everywhere. I decided to venture out to the rooftop pool., what a mistake that was. There was absolutely no way I was getting in the water with the light hanging the was it was. Very dangerous to say the least I would never stay here or recommend this place to any of my friends.

A great spot, a little quieter but still close to the hustle and bustle. Friendly, quick check in. Great beach opposite where you can lay your towel in peace and complimentary beach towels and chairs. Some rooms look to Diamond Head

First and foremost, we chose this hotel because it offers early check in at 10:00 am (instead of 3 pm) for only $20! This was perfect as our flight from Australia arrived at 6:30 am and our cruise arrived back at 9 am so we stayed there two nights before the cruise and one night after. The male staff at the front desk were awesome - I wish I had gotten names because they were so nice and helpful. We asked for a room away from noise and were allocated 1130 which was near the lift but we never heard it. We even got a little glimpse of the ocean. We felt the room was a good size and slept very well. The AC was a bit loud but with air plugs we didn't have a problem. There are lounges in the lobby if you have to wait and also lovely containers of ice tea and flavoured water as well as coffee. And the location is perfect. It's directly across from a Ross store and about a two minute walk to the main street with all the big hotels, shops, restaurants and of course eventually the beach! Going down the laneway after turning left out of the building takes you to the Galleria where the trolleys are located downstairs and go just about everywhere for a fraction of the tour prices. We'd definitely go back there!

I sometimes dread staying in Waikiki because of the congestion, crowdeds, and difficulty with traffic and parking. But, Shoreline has the most friendly staff, clean lobby, fresh tea and minted water, coffee, etc. upon arrival that the noise of Waikiki just goes away. The staff calls my boyfriend by his first name and is always ready to get our car, or tend to our every need without every having to wait in a line. The smallest things make the biggest difference. The fact that it is a small hotel makes for getting around so easy and it feels so comfortable and homey. I appreciate quality over quantity and this place has it. We literally parked our car with valet and never went back to it until check out. When we needed a snack, we went downstairs and easily walked across the street to an ABC store. Likewise, some of the finest restaurants are walking distance and we took advantage of that. I told my bf, I totally love this hotel! And I never say that.

We arrived early, tired from an overnight flight. The front desk worked to get us into our room early. They were so helpful. I loved the lobby, it is so tastefully done and the restaurant next door had the best healthy food. It is a great location, we walked everywhere and just loved it all. They put great care into style and were decorating for the holidays. It was so sophisticated and stylish. I loved the fresh coffee, iced tea and water in the lobby, along with apples.

Hotel was excellent, great location, good value for money, rooms were clean and well appointed. Staff were friendly and helpful. Would recommend and will definitely be returning in the future. Many thanks to all the staff.

I had a blocked booking for our 35 guests and we stayed for 1 week. Shoreline was like a home for all of us. Their lobby became our living room. Staff is very friendly and valet parking is very convenient.

I really enjoyed staying at Shoreline. Its location was great and accessible to waikiki downtown. Staffs were very kind and willing to answer any kind of question I had concerning the hotel, restaurant recommendation and etc. It was a great hotel :) Thank you!

The staff was very friendly and helpful and then add in the bonus of "Heavenly" restaurant downstairs and you can't go wrong! Watch out for the parking charges as they can be more than your car is costing you!

Shoreline is in a side road just off the main shopping street. This is an ideal location for all you need to do in Waikiki. The hotel staff are extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel is modern in style and the rooms are spacious with good design and have a balcony as well. Ask for we view and you do get a view between the high rise flats/shops. The bathroom is modern and has a low bath with a shower over it. Beds are very comfortable and are of a good size. Coffee and tea making is limited to the dreaded coffee pod machine - all hotels seem to have the same Keurig make machine. You can get boiling water by setting it off without s pod! As in all US hotels you will probably get creamed so get some milk if you want this in your tea or coffee!! In the reception area there is large seating area and 24 hour coffee pots. The 'bar' is a bar called 'Heavenly' - great name for a bar!! It is attached to the hotel and caters from the street so can get very busy for breakfasts!In essence - great hotel, great value and great staff!! Highly recommend!!

We really loved the location, very central, close to beach, Ross is literally few feet away. The reception area is clean, love the ambience and interior. There's also free pineapple tea, and ice cold cucumber water, hot water, coffee (decaf and not). You can ask for free beach towel at reception. Housekeeping is great, staff are very helpful. Our room is OK size, not too big, not too small. The bed is super comfy!!! Toilet is good size and has good lighting. The room has microwave, coffee machine and TV and aircon. It's not a super flash room and we didn't have a nice view but that's fine if you will be in and out of hotel. I would book here if we visit Hawaii again!
user_name:
Maryanne D
North Shore, Auckland, New Zealand

review_body: Room was clean and neat. Our room was city view but it doesn't matter for us cause we pretty much stayed at hotel for sleeping (almost went outside). Room condition and value was good compared to price. Shoreline's Valet parking ($30 per night) was very convenient service. We'll definitely stay at Shoreline when we visit Oahu in the future.

I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. I had 2 separate stays over 8 days and both times I found the staff helpful and accomodating, the hotel and my room pristine and the location excellent. On my first visit I had just arrived after a long flight from Australia and it was 2 hours before check in. When I told the staff how exhausted I was they immediately found me a room. When I returned it was even earlier- 11am- and I had been upgraded to a junior suite on the top floor, essentially the hotel's best room. I was given no reason for the upgrade but it was a nice and totally unexpected gesture.I cannot find fault with my stay and at roughly a 5-minute walk to the beach, it is very well located.A genuinely enjoyable stay.

We stayed at this hotel for 5 days coming back from the States. Normally we would choose a grander place but were short on cash and this hotel was reasonably priced. I was very surprised. The room was large, the bed very comfortable and we even had a view of Waikiki looking across the Royal Hawaiian. The staff were great, so helpful, nothing seemed to be too much trouble and there was a really nice vibe in the hotel. The restaurant was terrific and there was often a queue ! It was situated in the heart of the shopping area and close to everything. We would definitely stay there again !!!

Room is small but clean......our room is city view but the room is across apartment building...not a good view...will request next time with different view though good location......pleasant and helpful staffs.

We stayed here while holidaying with family in Hawaii and felt very welcomed.The rooms were very comfortable and above all both front desk and hotel staff extremely helpful.I left behind my expensive prescription glasses and must admit that Matthew from front desk went out of the way to communicate with me and ensure that they were kept safely till I could arrange to get them across. Over all a very amazing experience.Will definitely give this hotel 5 out of 5.

Location was perfect, right on the main street. Really pleased with the customer service from Aaron and the team at reception as they made us feel really welcome. Hotel was value for money in comparison to some of the other hotels in that same area.

The highlight of this hotel has to be the staff who were all without exception incredibly helpful during my stay. They were always ready to help with the strangest query.I was upgraded to a king size room which was a perfect size for my 6 night stay. Rooms are done up and maintained nicely - even though it is an older hotel. The only downside for me was the noisy airconditioning system - I would bring earplugs next time.The restaurant - Heavenly next door was a real bonus. Great food

The desk staff was very kind and helpful. I got there way too early before check in time. I was only expecting to store my luggages and head out but they offered me a room right away without charging any fee.Clean room, comfy bed. Very close the trolley stop and shopping. Would definitely stay there again!

Nice hotel. Every thing is near by, the beach and the shopping. The staffs are very helpful and friendly. The room is a little bit small but we don't stay in the room much therefore it didn't matter to us much.

We stayed here on our honeymoon/babymoon recently and on first impressions I was slightly disappointed. The hotel is rather old fashioned and tired by European standards. The room itself was very spacious. We did notice that a lot of hotels in Hawaii are quite dated.. The staff were a hit and miss, some very nice others didn't seem too bothered. We asked a couple of days in advance about the possibility of having a late check out on departure day, they firstly said it wasn't possible because they were full but then changed to saying if we paid half day rate we could keep the room. Was a bit miffed about this as we have been all over the world and this has never been a problem.Location is great within Waikiki. Restaurant next door is great for breakfast and a acai bowl

My husband and I stayed here one night prior to leaving for a cruise on the Pride of America. The location in Waikiki is convenient to restaurants, shopping, transit and the beach (a short walk away). The room was clean and comfortable. The desk staff were very helpful and accommodating. There is a good restaurant connected to the hotel which serves fresh, organic locally sourced food and is great for breakfast. We were able to store our bags after checkout so we could do some touring before having the desk call a taxi for a ride to the pier.

We recently spent 6 nights at the Shoreline Hotel and it was a great way to complete our US holiday. The room was spacious and clean and very quiet. The location is fantastic, very close to the action and the famous Waikiki beach front. The staff were very helpful and friendly, we couldn't have asked for more.

These guys really do go out of their way to make your experience personal and special. I work in travel and I chose this hotel after much research and comparisons. Not only is this a great location, it is a great price and on top of that the hotel is fresh and funky and our room was amazing! Thanks guys, I'll be recommending you to my clients

We stayed one night prior and one night after a cruise and throughly enjoyed the experience. This is our first stay since this hotel has been remodeled under new ownership and it exceeded our expectations. I casually mentioned to Aaron and his colleagues that it was our 27year anniversary and we returned to our room and found a bottle of wine, box of chocolates and a handwritten card. Amazingly thoughtful surprise! Rooms great, tea, coffee, water in lobby. Newspapers even on Sunday. Wonderful, helpful staff. Attached " heavenly" restaurant delicious healthy food. Recommend use their taxi service. Driver Hung Chau is the best. This hotel: great value. Great location. Thank you. ( one constructive note: bathtubs slippery. Recommend optional mat)
user_name:
Mary M
Los Angeles, California, Usa

review_body: A bit of a rocky start, we called ahead of time, saying our flight would get in at 7am and if we could have an early check in. They said no problem. When we turned up, they said we couldn't check in until 1pm despite the conversation we had. They kindly held our bags for us whilst we went on to explore Waikiki (which we would have done anyway if we had checked in). Apart from that, we really enjoyed our stay, and the staff were really friendly and nice. Gave us tips on great places to go, and asked us every day what we were up to.Great location, and some really awesome places to eat/bars close by. Is a short and lovely walk to the beach. We would defiantly stay again.

The Shoreline is absolutely perfect for the price / location but most of all the restaurant attached called Heavenly. Exactly that. All farm sourced locally but the line can get crazy on the weekends.Hotel is very clean and refreshing. In the middle of all the action. FantasticGreat wifi too (as I'm using it now)King Britt

If you want to stay at a hotel in the heart of Waikiki, within easy walks of the beach, restaurants, coffee shops etc., then Shoreline Waikiki comes highly recommended. If you want fantastic friendly and helpful staff, who went out of their way to be the best they can, then Shoreline Waikiki is your place. thank you Aaron, Ivan, Ina, Matthew and Zhi, and all the other staff who make this place great.

Made the most of our trip while on Oahu. We live on the Big Island. Shoreline had great Aloha and we much enjoyed ourselves. Staff was very helpful and attentive. The 24 hour coffee, tea and water was great in the lobby.

The staff were lovely and friendly, accommodation walking distance to beach and short walk to bus/trolley stop. Room was lovely and bed comfortable. Would definitely stay again. The only downside was there was no guest laundry, but that was only a short walk too.

We stayed here briefly this summer and all I gotta say is get up and get to that buffet!!! The view from the restaurant as well as the fresh pleasant tasting food will woo you here. Huge hotel.. beautiful beach .

This hotel's great amenities and location in Waikiki gives you access to most activities in Honolulu. The beach, restaurants and shopping are just a short walk away.The staff, Sonny and Ina, were truly friendly and helpful in providing whatever we needed during our stay.

This was a wonderful hotel only steps away from the main street hustle and bustle. Lobby has free Cucumber water and tea out all the time, also newspaper and fresh fruit. A nice little touch. The rooms are very nicely decorated and the bed was perfect. Ask for an Ocean View. Roof top pool with a beautiful view.

The shoreline hotel provided incredible accomodation. The location was so amazing compared to other hotels we were considering - we were central to everything. The staff showed great hospitality and were very helpful.

Great boutique hotel in a great location 5 minutes walk to the beach and local restaraunts and bars.Rooms are more than adequate with a comfy bed and all the facilities you need Free wifi in the room and reception.All the staff were approachable and very helpful Free coffee and tea in reception is a nice touch ,the hotel does not have restararaunt but there is one next door that was good for breakfast.It was our 25th wedding anniversary while we at the hotel and our daughter arranged flowers and wine to our room and she said the hotel were really helpful in arranging this

When we arrived I was concerned at the state of what could be best described as a Chinese tenement building next door which we could see from check in. Despite having emailed them that we were there for our wedding anniversary we were put in room 728, with a stunning view of the tenement building. How any one could consider that a suitable thing next to a hotel I don't know. The room was far from its boutique label, self applied I think, and we asked to be moved to the other side of the building which was a bit better. The room was quite ordinary and although it came with a safe, fridge and an iron the hot drink maker came with four drinks for a weeks stay, if you wanted anymore they were $2 plus tax each or you could go down to the lobby and pour yourself a hot or cold drink. The balcony was pointless, it only had one chair and wasn't big enough for two. The towels were a bit thin and small and not enough hangers.On the plus side the staff were nice and helpful, it is well located, clean with a reasonable bed and has valet parking at $30 a night. Would not recommend it but passable if you don't have a sea facing room.

Shoreline ended up being the perfect choice for me as a central base in Waikiki for an overnight before an international flight. It's close to the beach, restaurants, bars, and shops. Staff are friendly and accommodating. I thought this hotel was really good value for money, had a good feel to it, and I would definitely stay there again if I was to return to Waikiki.

Perfect location.I imagined "city view" something else than looking out on a dirty courtyard with local appartments.The room was very clean.Very easy, because the hotel is located in the center of town. Restaurants, shops,.... Are all in walking ddistance.

Excellent staff and cool boutique atmosphere that can't be found elsewhere in Waikiki at a fair price. Room was small but nicely designed and was exceptionally clean, which was all that we could ask for. Be sure to check out the restaurant they share a building with for sone great grub!

You have Very Courteous and kind staff. The Filipino staff truly enhance the hospitality rating of your hotel. They are accommodating and helpful. They made us feel at home. God bless you all for a good choice of staff
user_name:
Thomas J
New York City, New York

review_body: We've stayed in lots of different places in Waikiki over the last ten years or so, but we've found the Shoreline Hotel to be easily one of the best. The staff are extremely pleasant and helpful (Matt on reception knows the answer to everything and nothing is a problem!). The room wasn't huge but we didn't come to Waikiki to stay in the room. But it's plenty big enough, very clean and tidy, loads of storage space, good shower, good aircon. The views aren't necessarily the best (two of our party looked out on the back of the apartments next door while we looked out on the road and the Ross store opposite) but the hotel is in a great location - a few minutes walk from the beach, the shops, the restaurants. There's an ABC store opposite for all those little things you forgot to pack. And the restaurant/cafe attached to the hotel, Heavenly, lives up to its name - some of the best breakfasts we've had. The omelettes for breakfast are particularly awesome, made with all local ingredients. Again, the staff here are excellent. In terms of value, we found the hotel to be excellent, compared to what you pay to be in a hotel a few metres up the road. All in all, a great place to stay and we'll be back.

I just recently stayed at this hotel for a couple of nights to celebrate me boyfriends birthday and I was very disappointed. I chose this hotel because I've stayed at boutique hotels in Waikiki in the past and have never been disappointed. This time however was different, our room was VERY VERY VERY small, there wasn't a refrigerator or microwave, the water pressure SUCKED, the toilet kept refusing to flush, the AC had this weird loud humming noise, the bedsheets had blood stains on them, and the pool was CLOSED. I will never stay here again. No thanks.

This hotel is not the fanciest in Waikiki, however if you are looking for value it can't be beat. Front desk staff were friendly and most accommodating. Lobby area was small but neatly kept, room was efficient and clean. Rooftop pool, a little disappointing but ok. Booked room directly with the hotel and avoided paying the annoying resort fee.

This is our 6th time to Honolulu since getting married here in 2013. We have been back 1-2 times year. This is our 5th stay at this hotel. Why? It's because of the great service we receive from the staff at Shoreline. There are many hotels to choose from but we choose to always come back to Shoreline. Staff from the front desk to the staff that tends the parkade are all amazing. We have been here so many times that we now have great relationships with some of the staff. Our recent visit the staff recognized our arrival and had a welcome back signage with our names on the daily board in the hotel. What a welcoming and special experience! Upon our arrival in our hotel room they even left us some treats, champagne and a beautiful welcome back card. What a beautiful touch! There is fresh coffee served daily and you are always greeted by the staff with a good morning! If you don't care for all the glitz and glamour, you don't require all the amenities of a resort then Shoreline is a place for you. There is a restaurant next door called Heavenly and the food is Heavenly! You get 10% off your bill at Heavenly if you show them your Shoreline room key. Shout out to Matt, JD, Ivan and Paul for making our experience the best always! Looking forward to our next visit!

Hotel nice, location good, shame we had to wait so long to get into our room on arrival. We waited 8.5 hrs to get into room and then it was the wrong room, the second room had an awful view and third room was what we booked in the first place

it was excellent trip for us. but we felt uncomfortable because room clean was poor. begin of our trip for 2days bed cover was dirty. you guys didnt change it for 2 days, maybe if we didnt complain ir not gonna change until end of our stay. anyway we complained to staff in reception about room clean and he solve it.

Shoreline experience at wonderful Waikiki beach in beautiful Honolulu. Convenient location as well as excellent service, clean rooms and several amenities. All conducive to creating a calm and relaxing trip.

이용기간: 2016.8.14-2016.8.17와이키키에 14일정도 머물면서 있었던 마지막 호텔입니다. 오기전에 Hilton Hawaiian, Ilikai Hotel&luxury suites, Waikiki Resort Hotel 등을 이용했는데, 개인적으로 가장 맘에 드는 호텔.+리조트타입 호텔은 너무 붐벼서 시끄럽거나 객실의 청결성이 떨어지는 반면, Shoreline은 guest들이 조용한 편이고 객실이 굉장히 깨끗이 관리되어 있음. +와이키키 중심에 있다보니 street noise가 있긴하나, 다른 호텔에 비교해 조용하고 쾌적한 환경에서 휴식을 취할 수 있었음. +Waikiki의 대부분 호텔들이 Unit A/C거나 노후한 Central A/C라 객실이 시원하지 않거나 A/C의 소리가 너무커 수면에 방해를 받은 적이 있는데, 여기는 A/C만은 waikiki 호텔 중 가장 조용하고 시원한듯 :). +Walking distance안에 다양한 음식점도 있어 불편함없이 끼니를 해결할 수 있음. +일찍 도착하더라고 방이 있으면 early check-in을 해줌. 프론트 직원들은 매우 친절함.+무료 커피와 음료수가 1층에 비치되어 있음.+본인은 tripadvisor을 통해서 예약을 했음.+실외 풀장이 작긴 하나, 이용하는 사람이 없어 맘 편하게 이용할 수 있었음.**3년전에 와이키키에 와서 이용했을 때 좋은 인상을 받아, 이번에 또 이용하게 되었는데 굉장히 만족했고, 다음에 또 이용할 예정임.

Stayed 12 nights in a Partial Ocean View King room. Frequent visitor to Hawaii and decided to try this hotel based on recommendations. Room was quite acceptable but not overly large. Ocean views were very limited. Hotel dos not serve breakfast. One small complaint - the in-room coffee making facilities do not include a jug/kettle for those who do not happen to like coffee pods. We bought a $8 kettle from Walmart to meet our needs. Staff were friendly and efficient. We even noticed one hotel rarity - a quality control officer checking corridors and rooms for cleanliness and any damage. Hotel was very well located to shopping, beach and bus transport.

Second time staying at the shoreline, Lovely place, lovely staff. There was a particularly lovely girl on reception, Impeccably groomed, very warm, kind and had class! Fantastic location right in the heart of Waikiki. Our room and a huge balcony and sea views. Everything right on your doorstep. Beautiful clean rooms, lovely comfy beds and linens.We had some dripping water from the bathroom above ours (they left a tap running). One call to reception and it was all sorted out. Love the complimentary iced tea, iced cucumber water, tea and coffee in the lobby. Would defiantly stay there again and again.

This was a lovely hotel and with a great staff. Clean, boutique style. We stayed for five nights and were able to book the last night free on the website. Had a very nice stay at the Shoreline Boutique Hotel.

... in central Waikiki. A Short walk to the main shopping area and beach.No restaurant in the hotel but a good variety of eating places in the vicinity. Coffee making facilities in the room, tea and coffee in the lobby along with ice water. Staff efficient and friendly.Room was of a reasonable size. Bed comfortable.Good free wifi in the room.Understand there is a pool but we did not use it.

Very comfortable hotel centrally located in Waikiki. Staff were very polite and helpful. Room was basic but well presented, clean and serviced daily. Coffee making facility in room. Ice tea & water in foyer was refreshing. If you are considering a smaller hotel but in close promimity to beach, shopping centre and restaurants then Shoreline hotel is a very good option.

Great little hotel central to everything. Especially love the valet parking ($30/night) for the convenience and the free tea, coffee and cold drinks in the lobby. Close to the Royal Hawaiian and short walk to beach. Macys 5 minutes away. Shopping centre next door has Gloria Jeans.There is a funky cafe/restaurant attached.

Love this hotel! Stated there for 6 nights and everything was just great.The location is perfect, 1 minute walk from the main street and 2 min from the beach!ABC store right in front of the hotel.Staff is great and very friendly.

Everyone was very nice and welcoming. Hotel is Just a block from the Waikiki strip and short walk to the beach where my boyfriend learned to surf. Love the modern island decor. I would recommend others to stay here.

The staff were friendly, the beds were comfy and the location is great.(1 block to the beach)The bathroom had mold under the sink and when I brought it to the attention after the manager, he barely acknowledged my complaint. I wish I took pics but I didn't think I had to.

Pleasant staff and good location! I e mailed and spoke to a receptionist who made a note that our trip was for our anniversary! The first room given was small and overlooked some horrendous what can only be described as filthy tenement which was covered in rubbish. When I complained I was moved but on first arrival there was no other rooms higher than floor 7 room 728! Bed linen lovely! Towels were worn and shabby! You only got 4 coffees to last you a week! Once gone it would cost you $2 plus tax for each extra coffee pot for the machine! One chair in a balcony no bigger than a shower and you took pot luck with the view! Our wedding anniversary wasn't even acknowledge by the staff as opposed to other guests who had their names and congratulations written on the daily chalk board! Would we stay here again NO. This is not a boutique hotel to say the least! Over rated and definitely overpriced for what you get! You are also charged €30 per night for the privilege of parking your car in their car park! That seemed excessive! Take my advice and research your hotel before you travel thoroughly! I thought I did but not as good as I should have! It is not a 5 star hotel but more like a 3 star! You have been warned!

The rooms are very small and the water pressure in the shower on our floor(14) was very low. Also the room did not have a refrigerator or a microwave... Would have liked to have a boutique hotel offer a simple breakfast to the clients especially when on a vacation.

Great service and nice shower. Nice valet service. Excellent breakfast place semi-attached. Small room with poor view. Thanks for the refrigerator - a life-saver. A work out room woul have been ideal.
