Great location. Good value for money. Clean Rooms. Easy walk to shops and Waikii beach. Plenty of eating places close by. Access to the Hop on hop off trolleys nearby which give great coverage of the Waikiki area.

This was the 1st time we stayed at the Shoreline. It was very close to the beach, shopping & restaurants. The staff couldn't have been better...excellent, very helpful. It is a block from the beach which was great. The rooms were a good size & clean, just make sure you have a room high up & not on the beach side of the Hotel as staff gather outside next to the lower rooms & talk around midnight!

Stayed here for one night before we went to main accommodation, room was nice and tidy, clean. staff were very friendly and Ross store right across the road open till 1am!! Everything in walking distance we loved staying here it wasn't overly flash but was comfortable we enjoyed it... Would stay again.

The Shoreline staff came to our rescue when the hotel we had reserved had cancelled our reservation as they had overbooked. They let us check in early so we could leave our bags in our room. We were able to enjoy our stay. The rooms are a little small but are very clean with little balconies. The hotel is right across the street from the beach. The staff here are amazing. The cucumber water is very refreshing after a hot day. The hotel is across from an ABC store where you can buy snacks. Parking is thirty dollars a night but everyone charges the same. There is a small cafe attached which has some nice tapas dishes. All in all it is a nice place because of the staff and location.

The hospitality was great very friendly staffThe rooms were cleaned daily they even came back without asking once we had left the room. The towels and linen could do with a bit more cleaning. The air conditioning in the Lobby needed to be fixed it was very hot. Great value for money though and would go back

Lovely modern looking hotel in the heart of Waikiki! Room was fresh & clean, although small. Liked the rooftop pool and the room safe. ABC store across the road for incidentals and an organic produce restaurant right next door. Handy to the trolleys and many shops and restaurants. Walk to Waikiki beach in minutes. Loved it!

The Shoreline Hotel in Waikiki is really good bet: location, location and location, AND clean, friendly staff, and good amenities. I am definitely going to visit again. And, they have a hip restaurant just next door.

Very pleased with service especially the customer service officers behind reception, Lauren was the best, location perfect, rooms average but overall good value for money. Would stay again & recommend to friends x

Shoreline hotel was well located. The hotel was near the beach. The front desk, valet, and cleaning staff were fantastic. Shoreline hotel is a great value and should be a hotel to consider for anyone looking for a great stay in downtown Honolulu.

This hotel is just a few minutes away from everything, beach, shopping, fine dining, casual dining, fast but delicious food, rides to Waikele outlet and luaus. Rooms are clean and spacious. Love the refreshment station in the lobby, such a nice touch. Ice cold Plantation ice tea on a hot summer day, just like they read my mind.Their staff is the best I have encountered in Waikiki, acknowledging every guest and making sure we are enjoying our stay.

Good location for a "base camp " to explore Oahu. We enjoy the rooms, the wifi, the drinks( hot & cold) all day long, the swimming pool on the roof top. Beach towels are available. Lot of restaurants and stores few steps away.

the staff at the front desk are very nice, polite and answered to all our questions. our room was cozy and even being close to the elevators we didn't get bothered by the noise. ideal location for shopping and restaurants, and the beach is just 5 min away. overall we spent a lovely time at the shoreline before our cruise!

From the moment we arrived till we checked out, the staff were friendly and willing to assist. The hotel itself is in a perfect location with both the main street and beach about 5 mins walk away. The room was comfortable and we especially enjoyed the beverages in the main lobby. Will definitely be back to stay when we are there next.

My wife and I found an offer on booking.com and so we booked a room for 5 days in this hotel.The location is perfect, 5 minutes walking from waikiki beach.The hotel in my opinion is not good, we payd 750$ for four nights and they never changed us towels and blankets.Also the price( was an offert) is anyway too much for the quality of this hotel.

Excellent hotel and sercice. Was a little noisy but that's Waikiki in general I think. Service was exceptional and all staff very friendly and welcoming. Bed was incredibly comfortable and good sized rooms. Would stay again.

I have stayed at this hotel about 4-5 times when I come to Hawaii but this time was the worst. I arrived here on a Thursday and the front desk clerk was very welcoming and friendly. When I got to my room it was very different then the last 4 rooms I stayed at. Smaller; loud, can't open my curtains cause the hotel guest next door can see me. I asked to switch rooms and they said they were completely full. I stuck it out since I wouldn't be in the room half the time anyway. But disappointed for sure. All the other times I've been here I was great hence the reason I always book here.

I love the shoreline.. its in the center of shopping , restaurants and night bars.. for those who gave it bad reviews, it sounds like either u are to fat for the rooms.. to privilege , or just a dumb gay dude with no morals.. and its not the ghetto. its a CITY,,but defiantly I like that their is NO KIDS!!!

The Shoreline is a good tourist class hotel. Location is absolutely in the middle of everything - so perfect if you want to explore Waikiki. The staff are friendly and helpful. Try out the cafe to the left of the entrance which serves organic breakfasts with local specialities! Room was clean yet a little small for a family of four...but housekeeping were friendly and charming. We really enjoyed our stay.

From the moment we walked in we felt welcome. The front desk staff could not be any more informative and friendly. The rooms are nice and beds comfortable. We had a small balcony but not a view of the water. The pool is very small with 4 lounge chairs and a few other chairs but we wanted to be at the ocean anyways, yet we did swim a few times but more than 6 people is crowded. The rooms are clean and have a refrigerator, microwave, and Keurig. The lobby has coffee, tea, and infused water and tea. The location to everything is perfect. Easy walk to the shops, restaurant and the beach. The staff really go out of their way to be helpful!!

My rating is based mainly on the customer service. The rooms are nice but small, but the exceptional service we received was second to none. They really care about their guests and they make sure you are completely happy with their services.

This hotel is located very close to the beach and shopping and restaurants. It does not have a view and the rooftop pool is strictly for swimming and not lounging. However, as a base for sleeping it is just fine plus the cafe on the ground floor as handy. Good value for money.

The rooms could use some updating however staff was amazing and always so helpful. Could not have asked for a better location. Right in the middle of everything we wanted to do and a quick walk to the beach.

Well situated for one night. Walk to beach and main streets. Plenty of restaurants all around. Parking. Will store bags for you...for a fee. Small rooms but with all amenities. Could do with black out curtains.

Staying at the Shoreline Hotel meant that we were central to the beaches, restaurants, shopping and bus stops. There was no need for a car as we could walk to everything. The hotel was immaculate, modern and the staff were friendly and helpful. The Shoreline has also produced a map including all the attractions and how to access them via TheBus - most helpful.

Website show 4 start, but actually like 2 start hotel. Tell them for our anniversary but sent us to very dark room and looks so dirty, also near by left noise all the time~ many many nagtive feedback~ highly not not recommend for everyone~

I booked a room for three nights shorthand before getting to Honolulu. The rooms are modern, equipped with a very good bed and a fridge. I was also lucky to get a quiet room what was very good after the long journey to Honolulu from Europe.Still, you are in the heart of Honolulu and the beaches are just a short walk from the hotel. Furthermore, there are some bars and restaurants nearby the hotel.I very much appreciated the fact that there is free coffee (excellent!) in the room as well as refreshments and fruit are provided in the lobby.The very warm welcome by the front desk staff needs to be mentioned as well.

The hotel's located close to the beach and Waikiki plaza shopping center and also alot of restaurants nearby, clean rooms and exceptional staff! Will definately stay here again! Great place to stay in Waikiki!

Travelling to get places you have never been to is a challenge when you are looking to book accommodation. Rarely do the images match the reality once you arrive.The reviews for shoreline are spot on. Great value, clean and convenient hotel at realistic prices. The building itself looks like it is older but has undergone a renovation at some stage. We are staying (we have 5 nights to go, have been here for four) in a king city view room. Whilst not huge, there is more than enough room for our ten night stay. The air con is cold, the flat screen led tv is large and the bed is comfortable. Free wifi to boot! (And fast, but we live in Australia so anything is fast.)The standout for this hotel however is the service. Elsewhere in Waikiki we have been disappointed with the lack of service. (Eating out, tours etc). Sure it's a tourist area, but if this is your one big holiday per year you want to be treated as such. Shoreline staff are excellent. From the desk staff to the room staff, all are friendly, courteous and obliging. Whatever the management are doing at shoreline, the should keep doing it. Next time we come to Hawaii, I wouldn't even bother with researching. I'd just book the shoreline hotel.

I liked this hotel. Very central in Waikiki nice cozy rooms to stay in. The only problem we had was the Parking. The staff were very courteous. Not a major hotel so wasn't busy or crawling with people. If you like the feeling of being private and don't like crowds and to be in a peaceful place than this is the hotel for you. They were great!

Great location close to shops, restaurants and Waikiki Beach and great customer service. Stayed on 14th floor and found room Very clean and quiet. Loved the infused iced water and complimentary coffee in lobby.

No breakfast facility. Staff were ok but we had to ask for information rather than it being offered. We booked two rooms as a family but they weren't next door to each other which would have been better.

The hotel is in a great location, and while the rooms are simple, the price is very affordable. The staff is extremely helpful, and they can give you good tips concerning navigating the city and its attractions.

.Very good overall. Parking was a bit challenging with the valet. Rates were a little on the higher side for the property location. Property location was reasonably central to Kalakaua and Kuhio and Waikiki.

We were supposed to get a queen or king bed and a sofa bed. But they didn't have that so my kids had to sleep on the floor for two nights. All three picture on the internet are deceiving. Because the rooms looks big but there all tiny no space at all. The valet is very poor, both nights there were no parking for us and they reserved parking for a group, making us feel like we weren't important enough to have that lady parking stall. There was mildew on our shower curtain. And we never got told about a amenity fee at check-in, then at check out they wanted to charge us thirty something dollars. Which I didn't because that would have made me really move hotels because we were mistreated from the beginning with no beds for our kids.

I went to this hotel due to the Hotel Tonight app, and loved the service and location. However, I learned that the rooms on floors 13 and 11 do not have refrigerators, which basically ruined the dinning portion of my trip because I had no way to store leftovers (or heat them). If I had known this ahead of time I would have been able to plan accordingly, but this was rather disappointing as I couldn't buy fresh fruit and have it for breakfast. I hope that in the future that this hotel would be clearer about it's amenities or at least standardize them across all rooms.Pros: Good complimentary service (beach towels, drinks, local attractions list), very clean room, excellent costumer service, rooftop pool, and extremely convenient location.Cons: No refrigerators or microwaves on certain floors.

Staff was very friendly eager to do whatever they could do to make your stay enjoyble. Love the mint water and the pineapple tea that was always in the lobby. short walk to the beach and a nice Tiki Club downstairs around the corner.

Perfect location and awesome staff. Close to everything you need and especially the beach. In a good area for walking . The staff were very helpful and nice. Cute restaurant on site had a great happy hour.

This was our first time in Hawaii and the Shoreline Hotel was central to everything. A lot of the tour buses were also located just outside the hotel also. The staff were very polite & helpful & always had a smile. The rooms were awesome if you were out all day & the pool on the roof was very refreshing after a day out in Waikiki. Make sure you check out Heavenly Cafe next door but book early as it is always busy & you won't regret it

We had a great short stay at this hotel... we were pleasantly surprised on the location!! Easy to get to all places from here... The hotel itself was a bit dated by when judged by what other hotels charge, definitely great value for money! I would stay again...

We chose this hotel due to budget constraints. We weren't looking for fancy-just clean, cost-conscious digs near the main strip of Waikiki. It was a wonderful choice for us. The room was clean with quick wifi and a comfy bed. The location couldn't have been better for the cost compared to other hotels--you don't get an ocean view, but we were never in the room other than to sleep. Shoreline fit the bill for our quick 48 hours in town.

After reading the reviews both good and bad I came with a level of expectation and after receiving our room (528) and finding that it's next to an elevator it thought 'damn-here we go' and was expecting no sleep for our stay there. But to my surprise I couldn't hear the elevator at all, and the aircon was super cold (I guess some people don't know how to adjust the thermostat). The day we landed there was a tropical storm that night with torrential rain that wouldn't stop. Of course we didn't bring our brolly (who brings an umbrella on a tropical holiday?). That's when we asked the reception if we could borrow one, in which Matt from the desk went to go and get his personal one from his car for us to borrow. Over all, location was pretty good next to the main shopping strip, the rooms were good for us as we spent a lot of our time outside exploring the island and shopping. The condition of the room was acceptable given the price and there was no surcharge for wifi or any thing like that for us (maybe read the fine print when you book) . And the staff was really helpful with organising and changing taxis for transfers and showing us bus routes.The only thing I can fault is the room view. But if I wanted a view and wanted to spend all my time in Hawaii in a hotel room then I would have stayed closer to the beach.

Had 8 nights at this centrally located hotel in Waikiki. Staff super friendly and helpful. Room attendants kind and efficient. Nicely furnished rooms. I am happy to return. Excellent value for money. Loved the free coffee/drinking fountains much needed after a long flight.

Staff was beyond helpful, rooms were perfectly sized and clean. Only downsize was the 5 valet parking spots, we had to park at a garage at the end of the alley for $24 a day. Other than that absolutely loved the hotel

Wonderful place to stay ,good price & extremely clean rooms,all Hotel staff where pleasant & very helpful, within walking distance to beach,buses,etc . Highly recommend. Restaurant , Heavenly next door ,wonderful food & staff.

It was a perfect option for a night before we flew home.Heavenly the cafe is wonderfulLocation is ideal.Pool on the roof is a bit scary if you don't like heights.Air con in room was old an noisy but overal a berry good hotel with courteous staff.

The hotel is conveniently located in Waikiki within walking distance to the many shopping centers, restaurants, and beach. Our room was clean and comfortable. The valet parking attendants Ivan and Paul always started our day with a smile and cheerful greeting before delivering our car. They went beyond their required duties to make certain that we had a great time in Hawaii. We asked where we could get good local food and they would leave post-it notes with restaurant names on the dashboard of our car and they gave us good directions to get to our destinations. Everyone was great!

The accommodation was adequate and the restaurant attached to the hotel was good. We only hired a car on a daily basis as parking costs at the hotel were high. There was a delay with booking in which should not have happened.

Within walking distance of everything. Easy shuttles to Pearl Harbor, airport etc.. Beach, shopping, restaurants all close. Only negative is it is busy city street so hear trucks early morning. Otherwise great! And friendly staff

Absolutely fantastic place to stay, Staff very helpful and obliging, nothing was a problem to them, very close to shops, eateries and buses, should of been staying there our whole visit to Waikiki, room was very clean, thank you Shoreline for looking after us

If you don't want to pay the fancy prices for the beach front resort hotels in Waikiki but still want quality accommodation then this place would suit you.It is situated half a block back (1 minute walk) from Kalakua Av in the heart of Waikiki.I would class it as a 4 star hotel, with everything you would expect from a 4 star hotel including great staff.There are partial views of the ocean from the rooms that front the street.There is parking on site at an extra cost.There are plenty of restaurants and convenience stores within a 5 minute walk.Bus stops are within a 2 minute walk.We stayed here 10 days and would have no hesitation staying again.

We stayed here for a short time in 2015, loved it so much when we decided to return, we wanted to stay here again. This time we were on the 7th floor, next to the lift. This didn't bother us at all, the noise if any was minimal, and didn't keep us awake at all. The room was large and clean. The staff here are welcoming and very helpful. The location of the hotel is awesome, close to the beach, shopping and all the eating places. When we come back we will be staying here again. Thanks Shoreline for another great stay. Deb

Good clean hotel in good locationOnly issue was clearing credit card hold after checkout. Took several weeks to clear. Close to shops and restaurants and beach. Several steps from ground to entry and no help with lots of luggageNeed a porter out front

Stayed at the hotel for 3 nights. The room was nice, clean and comfortable. The stuff was very helpful and friendly. The location is great!! There is a pool on the roof, small, fits to those who don't want to go to the beach...

Excellent hotel for the price, great location. Room was small but sufficient. Parking around the hotel is expensive, so be prepared to pay for it. It is within walking distance to all major Waikiki attractions.

Very friendly staff. Very helpful. Hotel in a very central position. Close to beach, shops and restaurants. I am very happy we booked Shoreline as the room was as nice and even bigger than other more expensive hotels. Great value for money.

Loved this hotel! Note: first night will be debited prior to checking-in, will have credit card freeze and resort fees staff here are extremely helpful and friendly. They have delicious infused water and iced tea complimentary in hotel lobby + coffee as well. There is a cute black board near the elevators where the staff write local tips, word of the day, temperature and other messages - nice touch! The hotel itself is very nice from the outside and the rooms are very clean; we really enjoyed staying here – it was very convenient to the main strip of Waikiki and bus stops very close by. The rooftop pool is great too, water is a bit warm – loved relaxing here. Wifi is relatively fast as well! Highly highly highly recommend this hotel!

The last time we stayed at shoreline in Oct 2015 left us with a bad taste in our mouth. The service, cleanliness & other problems we encountered with hotel. This time was a lot better but nowhere near the quality that we have experienced in the past stays with shoreline

I would definitely recommend this hotel. It was in an excellent location, close to all the shops, restaurants, bars, beach and buses. The bed was really comfortable and the room had everything we needed. One thing to be aware of is that there is a $15US charge a day for 'servicing'. This is for the use of beach towels, bottled water in fridge and WiFi. It is compulsory. I wasn't too happy to only discover this charge once at the hotel, as I thought it should have been advertised.

Really enjoyed staying at Shoreline. Rooms were simple but clean and beds were comfortable. I like the fact they had ice tea and coffee bar at reception which you could enjoy at your leisure. The rooftop pool is also really nice and well maintained. This hotel is very well located in the centre of Waikiki shopping area which makes it so easy to get around. Would definitely recommend to people on a budget as it is not fancy like some of the big resorts but very pleasant and we really enjoyed our time there :)

I stayed at the Shoreline Hotel during June 2016 & stayed at the hotel for five nights. The hotel itself & my room were nice but were a little outdated. My room did feature a small balcony but unfortunately it didn’t face towards the beach. The hotel is in a great spot, only a minute walk from the shops & approximately a five minute walk to the beach. Overall the hotel is average but good value for money.

Nice hotel great position Close to beach. Walking distance.Friendly staff.Fresh tea and coffee,water iced tea available in foyer.Restaurant on hotel was good.Nice little balcony. Tip ask for a higher level as we were on 6 no view.You can see beach from pool level.Shame they don't do much in pool area.

Very congenial and helpful staff. Small, but clean room. Location is outstanding - very central and easy walking to everything in Waikiki! Partial view of mountains, Diamond Head and beaches. Reasonably priced valet available, but allow a few extra minutes because parking not on-site. Lovely and comfortable balcony. A bit of construction around though.

Conveniently & centrally located to all facilities & the beach. Tour pick-up point just in front of hotel. Staff friendly, helpful & obliging. Considering it is in Waikiki, good value. 24 hour coffee & tea, as well as water & syrup drink, great. Apples in the morning.

The good:- Great location near everything- Very cute retro decor- Comfy bed- Nice staff- Room had safe, fridge, microwave, etc.--everything you need- Price was reasonable for Waikiki - I appreciated that they asked whether I needed any help getting my luggage to my room. I imagine most people can manage wheeling a suitcase into an elevator and would rather do it themselves than make awkward conversation with a bellboy who expects a tip for providing an unwanted service. Bit of a pet peeve about staying in hotels. So that was great.The bad:- Some signage was a bit unclear--for example, I assumed the two small bottles of water in the fridge were free, but there was no sign to indicate that. (They were, as it turned out.) - The little pods for the coffee maker were replenished the second day, and I wasn't sure whether those were free or charged (they turned out to be free too, FYI). - Loud construction site nearby, but luckily my room was facing the other side.

We recently stayed at the Shoreline Hotel for two nights. The location of this accommodation cannot be beat. It is close to everything. Unfortunately the location was all that impressed us. Firstly the accommodation had decided to impose a $15 a night 'resort' fee which began in July. I always book with booking.com so that I know the total price before booking but there was no information about this. Also in the weeks leading up to our stay the Shoreline didn't contact us to let us know about the fee. They just said we've implement this today and you have to pay. The fee is for wifi, towels, tea, coffee and a 200ml water per guest. All of which I am used to being included for free. My next complaint is that I asked for a quiet room if possible as I am in my third trimester of pregnancy. They put us in a room next to the elevator that could be heard all night. I should of a asked to be moved once we arrived but I thought I might not be able to hear it. I was wrong!! On top of the noise of the elevator the outside noise IS SO LOUD!!! This may just be Honolulu but we really struggled to sleep. Lastly the air con was hopeless. It didn't let out any cold air. We only had a short stay and we had to leave at 4am to fly home so weren't able to make management aware of our disappointments. I suggest if booking this hotel, pack earplugs, make sure the air con works and check what fees you will have to pay on arrival.

Great choice! Shoreline is not a luxurious hotel, but we had everything we needed. The location is perfect, just few minutes from Waikiki Beach, there are many shops and restaurants around.The room was large enough and very clean, room service was done every day. Beds were very comfortable, there was a free and fast Wifi. I loved complimentary coffee and water at the lobby. There is a small pool on the roof, but who would use it if you have Waikiki just few steps away :-)Hotel staff was very nice and helpful, they were so kind and did order a taxi even though we chose a different taxi company so that they got no provision. We were offered complimentary bottle of wine as we were on honeymoon!I would appreciate if breakfast would be offered at the hotel.

Good if you want basic accom and you plan on only sleeping in the room when you come home from a night on the town. Very convenient but you wouldn't want to spend too much time there - it was just a bed for the night to recharge before heading back out!

Great location. Great value (important when travelling on a weak NZ dollar!). Staff were all super friendly and helpful. Room was a good size. But was on a low level looking out to the shabby building next door, so felt the need to keep the curtains closed all the day - a real shame not to enjoy the sunshine. They can't do much about the neighbouring building, but net curtains in the room would be good, so you can have some privacy while enjoying some sunlight. If you can get a room on a higher floor, I'd recommend it (I've stayed on higher floors on my previous stays). Still, I'll definitely be back.

This hotel is in a great location, close to absolutely everything. The staff were friendly and helpful and I was very pleased to be given a room some 6 hours earlier than the usual check-in time. My room on the 12th floor was spacious but badly in need of renovation, starting with the carpet which was less than spotless. Good shower and generous supplies of shampoo etc. Room cleaning left a lot to be desired. Small fridge, microwave, coffee machine supplied.Very noisy at night, especially Friday and Sat. nights. Strangely, there was only one chair on the tiny balcony."Heavenly" the adjoining bar/cafe/restaurant was excellent; mainly organic, reasonable prices and serving sizes which were not ginormous.

This was our favourite place to stay of the three hotels we stayed at in Waikiki. It was so close to the beach but set back from the busy main street. Clean, tidy and comfortable - great value for money.

If you are looking for a cheap stay in a nice little hotel, and one that is in an excellent location, then this could be the place for you. Our room was of modest size, in keeping with the cost, but was very tidy, well maintained, and had everything you could want. The shower was excellent.To round the whole stay out very nicely, the staff were excellent at check in and check out, and very helpful throughout our stay.

One my best trips so far. This hotel has got excellent location and it is literally in the middle of everything you need. I had my room on the 13th floor with a great view. The room had everything I needed and more, wifi speed was great, reception staff were very helpful, highly recommended :)

Loved the front desk staff and the location of this hotel. Room was clean and comfortable. Pool was small but did the trick. Little japanese spot downstairs has excellent poke bowls and bentos. Awesome shopping, dining, and beaches very close. Great room for the price! Mahalo!

Well situated for shops and beach. Discovered a path next to the cheesecake factory short cut to the beach. Great staff. A set of drawers in the room would have been helpful when staying for more than a few days. During the day it was noisy when sitting on the balcony due to construction work opposite.

This was our second time to Waikiki, first time we stayed at the coconut Waikiki which was lovely. This time we stayed a little bit closer at the Shoreline Hotel. Hotel was very clean and friendly service. Everyone was very helpful and polite. I found the shoreline hotel nice and quiet at the night which was perfect as the coconut was right near the main road so very noisy at night. Would be great if in the future they had a separate area like the coconut has with a activity advisor, e.g tour recommendations, where to go etc. Bed was very comfortable and felt right at home. More ventilation in the bathroom would be great and maybe even a wet sink & cutlery near the fridge would be very handy. All in all we had a great time and wouldn't hesitate to recommend anyone visiting Waikiki. Thank you for a beautiful stay shoreline and I'm sure we will be back in the future.

Would highly recommend staying here. Our flight got in at 7am and we were unable to check in until 3pm ( a little annoying ), however the staff kindly looked after our luggage as we went and had a snooze under the palm trees on the beach. They ended up having a room ready for us by 12pm which was hugely appreciated! The staff are extremely helpful and friendly. Matt, in particular has been great with us, giving us tips on things to do and see.The rooms are exactly what you need. Very comfortable bed and great working air conditioning. Not very modern, but the hotel is not what we came to Hawaii for. AMAZING location!! heaps of shops and restaurants close by and just a five minute walk to the beach. The bus stop is just around the corner which we used a lot to go exploring around the island.Would definitely stay here again :)

We love this place. Great service thanks Val, Matt and team. Ticks all the boxes for these kiwi travellers. Close to everything. Smallish rooms but who cares verve here to shop, eat and swim. Fabulous cafe 'heavenly' attached. No big resort hotels for us. This is s home away from home.

It was my first time staying here and would probably go back again. The ambiance was good and comfortable, very clean, and the staff was friendly. The view wasn't the greatest but that was ok for the price. the restaurant on the ground floor was fun also.
user_name:
mai a
New York City, New York

review_body: The location is great, walking distance to beach, shopping, restaurants, etc but they do need to put some money into upkeep of rooms. Pictures did not match reality. The front staff and valet were always very helpful and nice.

I loved staying at the Shoreline hotel. The rooms were comfortable and well styled, and were very clean. The art in the corridors and blackboard in the lobby were nice touches too. I really enjoyed having refreshing drinks in the lobby upon returning to the hotel, and the staff were friendly and helpful.The neighboring café Heavenly was also great and so convenient!I would definitely stay at the Shoreline again.

Stayed at Shoreline for 7 nights in June 2016 - this was our second time staying, and we were not disappointed yet again. The location is PERFECT! Across from the beach, and 10 metres from the main strip so not noisy. The staff are lovely and helpful, and the room is big enough for the amount of time we stayed there. Cannot fault Shoreline and it will continue to be our hotel of choice in Waikiki

This hotel has comfortable beds, a small amount of storage but very helpful staff. Our travel agent did this for us. After the resort where we stayed on Big Island, this felt a bit basic but actually was staffed with helpful people and in just off the main drag. A bit of a walk to the seaside but not impossible. The rooftop pool is small and not somewhere you'd stay the day but it did cool us down one day. Get a hire car and go to turtle beach! We also snorkelled on a "tour" of Hanauma Bay - the tour part was simple a return van trip to a drop off point about 100 metres from the queue to get in the park. We wanted to stay longer. It was heaving, being a public holiday. Pearl harbour was excellent- we appreciated being on a tour between the sites. Now we know, we would probably hire a car for the 3 days and done it ourselves. Hindsight is a wonderful thing! The cafe next door which is linked with the hotel, we think, was always busy which suggests that it was good but the queue was too long for us so we went once to a cafe/ diner on the cross street away from the sea. The water in coolers in reception was very welcome. There's a small outlet store opposite which was useful when we needed a new carry on bag.

Good general location for shops, restaurants and surfing. The Staff are great - very helpful. I was disappointed with our room at first because we had paid a higher rate but 5 days into the holiday they moved us to a much better room on the 13th floor, all rooms are clean and the bed is great.

I think good generally , Staff was very kind. Location is good. Free WiFi is good. password changed every day. but so noisy because of construction work. and air conditioner was so dirty. I think it should be removed dust.

Extremely clean, perfect location and very friendly and helpful staff. Would stay there again. No issues in helping with orgainising tours and shuttle buses. Reminded me of a boutique hotel, and lovely cafe

Central to what we wanted to see and easy to get around on foot. Great beach, some good walks along the canal. Easy reach of car hire, good local transport options taking you anywhere on the island at very little cost. Plenty of places to eat and shop for whatever one wants.

This hotel was clean and in a central location. Rooms are of an average standard. If the price is right and you are wanting to stay central in Wakiki, this hotel would be suitable. Happy holiday planning!

This accommodation is ideally placed , with walking distance to Waikiki beach and the downtown shops. The access to Thebus is excellent with this service being exceptional. It is a bit sad that the block of units next door is so very drab and unkempt which is awful if you open the curtains!

roon clean, but service equiments are not enough. It would be better if some staffs would speek Chinese. This hotel should supply the guests with enough parking area and reasonalble parking prices. Otherwise, it should point the guests the correct and free parking position.

Just around the corner from the main strip with friendly staff. The room was tidy with all the basics. We got in early and the staff did everything they could to have our room ready hours before check-in time.

I recently returned from a four night stay at the Shoreline and it was exactly what I needed! The rooms aren't fancy but are cutely decorated and have everything you need including free wifi, a refrigerator, microwave and Keurig coffee machine. They also have free coffee, tea and water in the lobby. They provide you with a few free Keurig K-cups but additional cups are $2 each, so bring some from home. Besides the friendly staff, the best part of this hotel was the location. Step out the front door and you're in the middle of everything that's going on in Waikiki. There's a great Ross across the street where you can buy anything you forgot to pack, a fantastic nail place called Nail Zone next door if you need a mani/pedi, an ABC store basically across the street, and a great Musubi/Rice Bowl spot next door for some cheap eats. Also nearby is the Royal Hawaiian Center where you can't miss out on the Island Latte and Taro Bagel sandwich at Island Vintage Coffee. There's also a food court at the Center if you don't want to spend a lot on a meal. There's a nice looking restaurant connected to the Shoreline, but I never got a chance to try it out. Beach access is maybe a five minute walk away (you can cut through the Outrigger or look for the walkway with surfboards) and free beach towels are provided by the hotel. There was bit of construction noise from next door but I was hardly in my room at all, and slept with the A/C on and balcony door shut so it didn't bother me. There's so much construction going on in Waikiki I think it would be hard to avoid most anywhere. It's just a noisy city! There's also a bus stop less than a block away that will take you practically anywhere on the island. Overall a great stay!

I am a local resident and my boyfriend and I had to stay in Waikiki for a convention. All the nearby hotels were super expensive, and Shoreline Hotel had the best kamaaina rate for the weekend. Everything was excellent for the price. The front desk service was especially awesome. The room was clean and the bed was super comfortable. There was also a refreshing iced tea in the lobby. I would definitely stay here again.

Good for an overnight stay, flight stopover. Handy to shops, eating and short walk to the beach. Taxi from the airport. Taxi to Maneoa falls prior to,flight out. No onsite eating or restaurant. Dukes down the road was very good. Free use of beach towel for swim.

We were treated very well by the friendly staff.Room was clean and tidy. The only setback was that there was not enough room for all our luggage and we could not leave some suitcases there while we were on a cruise,Good wi fi connection. Happy to use this hotel again if I revisit Hawaii

If I could give the Shoreline Hotel and its staff 10 stars, I would!!! Absolutely LOVED this hotel, the staff, the amenities, the location - EVERYTHING was top notch!! The rooms were beautiful and modern. The lobby was great - with coffee and tea all day and night. The staff were winderful with everything - helping with hiring a car, getting around. The staff even surprised my husband and i with chanpagne in our room for our Birthdays!Even the cafe next door was really nice. I had thr french toast with tropical fruit.The loaction is awesome! All the shops are within a minute walking distance, the DFS galleria is around the corner block. We used the trolleys at the DFS Galleria to get to and from Ala Moana Shopping Centre. Will definately be back! Thank you Shoreline!!

Absolutely loved our stay the the Shoreline Waikiki for our honeymoon! We were given an early check in after a long flight which we were so greatful for and the room was lovely. The room was cleaned every day and the cleaners were really friendly. Staff were very helpful and welcoming and would highly recommend staying here :) Mahalo Shoreline for you lovely stay x

having a really great stay. staff at the lobby are very impressive polite and helpful. the food at the restaurant is great. the room is clean and cozy. great location walking distance to waikiki beach and surrounded by many restaurant highly recommend

We have just stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and for the price of the hotel we cannot fault it. The rooms are very clean and modern, the reception staff are incredibly friendly but best of all is the location! Close enough to be able to walk to the beach, shops, restaurants. Would definitely recommend this hotel for its location. We enjoyed it!

Me and my husband was on honeymoon and stayed 8 nights at your hotel recently. We are so happy and satisfied with everything. The location is so ideal and walking distant to the beach, shopping center and restaurants. The room is small with attached balcony but it was ok with us since we spend most of the time outside. The receptionists especially Alex and Ivan are pretty friendly and helpful and they also provide local information around the area. Roof top pool is small but we did take some good photos especially the royal hawaiian hotel. The best of this hotel is they provide the cold and nice lemon, cucumber and mints drinks apart from coffee and tea at the lobby all day and night. Heavenly cafe is always pack next door so we did not have a chance to try it apart from a late night drink. I would certainly recommend this hotel to my friends and would ike to stay there when visit next. Thank you so much for the wonderful staffs and we really enjoyed our stay in your hotel.

Our first time at Shoreline and it was a delight. Room was modern, clean and very comfortable. Pool area could do with an upgrade ie deckchairs and needs some shade seeing it is on the roof. Otherwise a wonderful hotel in the best location. Friendly and polite staff. Thanks for a wonderful time.

This hotel has an excellent location as it is very close to the beach,restaurants and shopping centres. The room had everything I needed and wifi connection was excellent. The housekeeping might be improved however reception staff is very helpful. They have provided everything I asked for. Many thanks for the great stay :) highly recommended!

It was our anniversary and the people there made us feel very welcomed. The exceptional staff greeted our names everytime with a smile. There is no doubt that when we come back to Waikiki, Shoreline will be our number 1 choice to stay.

We stayed at the Shoreline for about 12 days in total, it was a great hotel and our room attendant Margz was lovely and very friendly all of the time. Our stay was great and the front desk staff very helpful. When we realised we needed to add on another night to our stay, even though the hotel was sold out, they could recommend other hotels for us to stay at. The room was really clean and it is in a great central location of Waikiki, the only issue with that is that of a morning the street traffic and works can be a little loud. However, overall it was a great experience and we would stay at the Shoreline again for the price, location and service.

i spend 2 week at the shoreline hotel and love itso well located on waikiki, room are nice and the bed is very comfortablestaff is great ,you can have your breakfast at the restaurant next door heavenly deliciousfresh water ,coffee and tea available in the lobby .front officer staff are very efficient ,will definitly comeback

Have been staying at the Shoreline for 5 years or so, everytime I come to Oahu on Business or Pleasure. The staff makes my stay by being so helpful and responsive. Always greet me by name and do whatever they can to make my stay pleasant. Great location only 2 blocks from the beach and the Royal Hawaiian shopping center with many nice restaurants. Starbucks across the street and a good restaurant called Heavenly downstairs

Stayed here for 2 weeks with my partner and loved every day , the staff were lovely every time we seen them and called for all of our transfers and helped with whatever we needed. Would defiantly go back and stay there it is in the perfect spot , close to everything and a lot of tour buses pick up and drop off right across the road at ROSS. Five stars

Great location so close to the bus and trolley pick up. Close to the beach. Clean!! The staff were so helpful.We lost track of days and went out for the morning and came back at 2pm to ask for a late check out the following day when we thought we checked out... we were suppose to be out that morning and people were waiting on our room (SORRY GUYS) and the desk staff were so calm about it and we just asked to book another room for that night. We shot upstairs and packed our things at light speed and everything was sorted when we got back down. We werent made to feel bad at all they were so understanding. Recomend this hotel.

Arrived at 8.00am after long flight from Sydney and check in time not until 3.00pm.Receptionist gave me a room straight away to my relief.Rooms are good for the price and beach 5 mins away Close to all the shops and restaurants. And Waikiki Trolley stop nearby.

the Hotel is really nice great lobby nice little restaurant next to it The pool on the roof is where you wanna hang out the views are amazing the room are small but really comfy and clean the location is amazing close to everything

I would recommend people to book this hotel. The amenities are good and perfect for a stay. My only one criticism is that the air conditioning in the room is a bit noisy. However the hotel is clean and staff are friendly and helpful. You may not have spectacular views. My room had views of an old, old office centre. But that's honestly secondary as Waikiki beach is only minutes away. The main shopping strip is amazing. So the hotel is in an excellent location.

Just stayed for a week at the Shoreline like I do every year at this time and like always, it was a great experience! Alex was wonderful from the time I made a reservation and remembered I always come back and gave me a great deal! Shoreline is my go to when I am in Waikiki! The whole staff was great! Thanks again Alex!

We stayed for a week at the end of our cruise from Sydney to Honolulu and were reasonably happy. Upon arrival our room wasn't ready, but we expected that as we were early. Staff stored our luggage for us. When we got into our room we were disappointed at the lack of storage and the fridge not working. I informed staff and 24 hours later nothing had happened so we told them again. This time it was fixed but stopped working again a few days later, but given we were going home shortly after we chose not to mention it. Overall, it's a good budget hotel if you are only using your room for sleeping.

Really enjoyed our stay at Shorline and even tried to extend it by two days but unfortunately they were fully booked. Staff were very helpful and friendly. Our room was very quite and comfortable. Will difinitely stay there again.
user_name:
Margaret L
Auckland Central, New Zealand

review_body: On arrival at the hotel things did not bode well. There is a flight of ten to twelve steps to the front door, unfortunately the luggage/wheelchair lift was out of order and remained so for the duration of our stay. I am not as young as I used to be and luckily our cases weren't overly heavy. There is a note attached to the lift apologising for the inconvenience.The room we were allocated was on level three overlooking the street. It was noisy first thing in the mornings due to deliveries etc on the street. Opening the curtains made us feel that we were in a goldfish bowl and everyone on the street could see into the room. Had we been staying longer than three nights we would have requested a room change.Tip: On arrival request a room on a higher floor and away from the street.

Stayed with a friend for a little over two weeks. Great affordable accommodation, close by to everything you will need being in Waikiki. What I remember the most is the friendly and helpful staff, they are there and willing to help with anything you need. The staff always had a smile and positive energy whilst helping. Rooms are average but for the price you get them for you cant go wrong. Has a rooftop pool which is small but offers great views. Pretty good if you want to chill after a long day at the beach and shopping.Overall pretty satisfied and would recommend to friends and family.

When I tried to book the package tour, I looked up different hotels. Finally I booked with Shoreline because I like its reasonable rate and white colour building. It's definitely not the best hotel near Waikiki but with this price, it's good enough!! All you expected you can get from shoreline. Walkable distance to beach, many shopping malls, and good food court close by. And Turned out I met the nice staffs ever in my travel experience !!! Thanks!!

If you're looking for somewhere that enable you to just relax that's comfortable and has those small home comforts, without paying top dollar, then this is where you should certainly book.The staff here are great, really friendly and very helpful! The cafe next door, Heavenly, is amazing and there's always a long line of locals and visitors waiting for breakfast, lunch, dinner or drinks, so get in early!Shoreline is certainly well within walking distance to Waikiki beach, The Royal, Hard Rock, Bill's Sydney, shopping, food and so much more.If you're looking for a place that is just somewhere to sleep after a huge day out, then Shoreline is the perfect place to book!

We were pleasantly surprised with the hotel its in a good spot not far from Waikiki beach also bus and tour buses are outside the hotel.its within easy walk of shopping and food outlets.the staff are terrific and will do all they can to make your stay enjoyable. Our room was really nice,so we would definitely stay there again

We chose this hotel because of it's central location.The staff are excellent and very helpful and the lobby has coffee, tea and cool drinks which is great coming in from the heat.We were fortunate that we were upgraded to a king room which we were grateful for as the other rooms from the glimpse we saw appeared quite small. The only drawback with the room is the air-conditioning vent blows straight onto the bed and when the door is open the street noise just flows straight in.The location is very central but there is quite a lot of noise from the street.The rooms are very clean and there is a great organic cafe next door.

After the luxury of our condo in Maui coming to a regular hotel was a bit of a letdown but in all honesty if you don't need a ocean view or anything to look at the shoreline is perfectly located one block from beach we walked through the Sheraton or Royal Hawaiian onto the beachfront .Upon arrival check in quick no worries room clean bright airy very small balcony with no views only next building aircon perfect hot showers towels changed daily Loved the fresh iced tea and water in lobby along with yea and coffee and ice machine all free of charge you are directly across the road from ABC for all your needs and top of street H&M Macy's Victoria secret and Sephora what more could a girl want Only downfall is the pillows invest in one at Macy's

The hotel is pretty central in Waikiki, a short walk to the beach and close to all the overpriced souvenir shops and whatnot. Friendly and courteous staff, complementary water (cucumber-infused fancy style!), iced tea, and coffee in the lobby. The room was decent/clean, good running hot water in the shower, nothing super luxurious. Granted, if you're in Honolulu on vacation then lounging around all day in the hotel room typically isn't plan A.... if you're looking for a moderately-priced place to stay in central Waikiki then I would recommend the Shoreline Hotel! 3 thumbs up!

The hotel is in a great location for everything you could need. The staff are all friendly and very helpful. The room was a good size and the shower was fabulous after a sweaty day. The complimentary drinks in reception are a very welcome and refreshing extra. There is a smell resturant next door and an ABC store across the road so food is no problem. The only down side was the lack of view as my room was opposite another block building so had no view.

This is my go-to hotel in Honolulu due to the bright clean design and easy access to good healthy food just next door. The location is very close to the beach and shops like Sephora. Definitely recommend for people who like contemporary design in hotels.

The hotel is off the main road but very close to the shops,restaurants and the beachRooms are clean and well serviced.Recommend them for travelers looking for very good rooms at a reasonable price Opposite where most of the tourist buses pick up and drop off so very easy to go on trips Michael

Overall this was a great experience. I will be looking to stay at the Shoreline on my next visit. The rooms are clean, tidy and modern. Good wifi. Great location within easy walking distance of the beach, shopping and restaurants. Highly recommended

We stayed for two nights in Shoreline Waikiki. Our room was a queen size. On a small side, but comfortable. The air conditioning was a bit of a trouble, as it was blasting cold air or nothing. We are returning for another 7 nights soon after touring Kauai. Another review will follow.

In the middle of Waikiki fashion street and just 5 minutes walk from beautiful Waikiki Beach.You will have the choice for the best restaurants and bars a block away.We've been very lucky to get the Jr. suite at the 13th floor, spacious, clean and tidy.A small fridge, microwave and coffee maker are also available in the room.Alex at the front desk very helpful and always willing to find the best solution during your stay.

at first we weren't impressed - but after one day this changed after finding how centrally located this hotel is. Room was perfectly adequate for our 4 day stay. Didn't get use the pool because we were on the go every day.

The staff here was very friendly and made sure you had a nice stay. The hotel itself is at a great location--right above the mall and close to several shops and restaurants, so you don't have to worry about parking. The hotel is clean and well maintained. Overall we had a great experience and would definitely stay there again!

Fantastic location - walking distance to all major resorts, restaurants and shops. Would definitely recommend to friends and family to stay here when visiting Waikiki. Staff were friendly and helpful, and service was great. Will definitely come and stay here again soon!

Me and my boyfriend stayed here for one week and we loved it. The best location, just a minute from the beach and right beside Kalakaua street. The rooms were clean and really comfortable. Very helpful staff at the reception and the cleaning ladies were so cute. Would definatly stay here again! ++++ was the little fridge in the room and the microwave (we made a loooot of popcorn)

The staff were excellent! That being said that is the only good thing about this hotel! The hotel and our room were not the same as what appears on website photos! The first room we were given was so musty and the carpet was so filthy I would not even put my bags in the room! Went to desk to change rooms and were given another room, the same but maybe one stain less on carpet! SO GROSS!Arriving at 10:30 pm we had little option but to stay! Not much sleep! The balcony???? i wouldn't even try to stand on and the "lovely" view next door was an eye sore to say the least! Not a great way to start our holiday and my "60" Birthday!Also the price that we paid for this hotel was outrageous, given the poor condition it is in and the rooms that smell, stained carpet etc! Would never tell anyone to stay here!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Perfect location, right in the centre of Waikiki. Room are pretty average but your in Hawaii your not there to stay in the hotel rooms!!! Front desk was very helpful and extremely friendly would defiantly stay here again.

My family stayed here for four nights. We had three separate rooms booked, which were all arranged on one floor for us.The hotel is very clean and the location is excellent. I enjoyed being in the centre of Waikiki but without too many other hotels, tourist buses etc. crowding our street. The pool is decent, but not the reason you would stay here... it's all about the location and superb service. Would definitely stay again.

Stayed here April 28, 2016 to May 6, 2016 and I must say, the customer service and Aloha Spirit from the staff is OUTSTANDING! Everyone made us feel welcome and before long, they seemed to already know us. The rooms are spacious and clean. The one issue we had with our room (625) was the shower head pipe was a little off so it sprays towards the wall. LOL. be aware, storage isn't great, but we came prepared with a hanging closet unit so we had no problems. The valet guys George and Sonny were so awesome and completely helpful and welcoming! They are the best! The front desk staff and housekeeping we all so great and so friendly! Reserve your parking space at the beginning because parking is limited but you can take the car out whenever you need to.The hotel location is so nice! It is about a block from Kalakaua and also a block from Kuhio. It feels super safe at night and if you need anything, everything is within arms reach!You HAVE to eat at the attached restaurant Heavenly! The açaí bowl is amazing! The shrimp ravioli is GREAT! The fish taco is really good but a bit spicy and it is open until midnight.I would stay here in a heartbeat!

Awsome service, everything was taking care of, all the employee was nice and greetful, I would stay in this hotel again, up stairs pool had a nice view of the city and a great place to lounge and chill

Great location, reception had very helpful staff. Only suggestion is to have tea/coffee facilities in the room on a daily basis, instead of reception. Valet parking a little pricey but required. Thank you

My wife and I stayed there for 10 nights and it was absolutely wonderful. The location is one of the best in Waikiki, the room was fully equipped, clean and the bed was really comfortable. Very recommended!!!
user_name:
ohmana
New York City, New York

review_body: great place to stay , very close to heart of Waikiki ,great base to start many adventures, modern décor and fresh , if you are looking for somewhere to base your holiday and want a good hotel ( not a resort) this is the place for you

the location is perfect. When we arrived @10:00am we have to wait for the room till 3pm so we just leave our luggage in when for walk in come back the time...over all it was good.in look forward for the next holiday.

my husband and I stayed here for 3 nights. They offered valet parking at $30 a day, which we thought was ok after evaluating the options of parking elsewhere. The hotel was nice and clean. The roof top pool was perfect for cooling off. The rooms are pretty small, they look bigger online in the photos. But they meet all the requirements. The staff are friendly enough. They have an inbuilt cafe/restaurant this place I would give 5 stars to, the food is so fresh and healthy and a welcome after some of the bad quality restaurants along the main strip. All in all the Shoreline hotel is adequate for a few nights stay. If you were staying any longer I would suggest getting out of the main strip and staying somewhere relaxing.
user_name:
Amy Morgan B
Auckland Central, New Zealand

review_body: Nice clean big room with bath, shower and balcony. Good views. Easy walking access to coffee places, restaurants, beach and all the fun stuff that waikiki has to offer. Tea, coffee and internet included. Room had a fridge, microwave and safe. Roof top pool area was limited, but still it is a roof top pool. Whats not to like.
We arrived this hotel at our honeymoon and enjoyed the location and the service of the staff, the rooms are very clean.The hotel is in near evetything, shoping, beaches, bus stations and restraunts..

This was my first trip to Hawaii and it didn't disappoint. When I chose this Hotel, I had read many reviews (which were mostly positive), but still was unsure as I had never been to Hawaii. From the moment I arrived, everyone there was extremely courteous and helpful. In many ways they went above and beyond, often times doing the little things that they don't have to do. For a smaller Hotel, it's in great shape. You are within walking distance from most of Waikiki, as it's only a little over a block from Waikiki Beach! They have NO resort fees, which is very unusual for Waikiki. They do have a charge (like most hotels in Waikiki) for parking (valet only). But I was conveniently billed at the end of my stay. The decor of the room was different, and something I liked. Now the room was fairly small, as was the balcony. But I didn't mind that at all. Although most of their rooms have mini-fridges, if you want one, it's best to ask them (like I did), to help ensure you get a room with one. There is also a rooftop pool, with a great view of the area, and a partial ocean view! Overall, I highly recommend The Shoreline. The Hotel, the people, and the overall experience, can't be topped....especially for the price!!

Great Boutique Hotel in a great area - across from Ross Dress for Less, around the corner from H & M, Apple Store, bus stops and designer stores. Only a short walk to beach. Rooms are very nice and hotel has a pool on the roof.

Very clean , friendly staff, close to everything , quiet and the most comfortable beds and pillows. Not the best of views but not in the room a lot , too much to do . Close to shopping and restaurants, cafes. If you go check out EggsnthingsBest eggs benedict. Wouldn't hesitate going back to Shoreline

What a great hotel. I was concerned when the bus pulled up as there are stairs out front but the concierge was there to bring our bags in. We were met at the desk by Mathew who is a credit to the propertyThe hotel isn't new but great on Hawaiian standards for the price. All the staff are helpful and the location is perfect. 1 block from the beach but just around the corner from the main drag of Waikiki. Very clean and well presented with coffee and ice tea and cold water at reception free of charge. Next door is a great little cafeNot much of a view but who wants to be indoors in Waikiki.

Shoreline is perfect if your going to be out and about in Waikiki there is no point paying for the expensive hotels on the beach, shoreline is short walk to everything (beach, shopping, restaurants, bars, buses) the rooms are a good size with nice bathroom and balcony, the rooftop pool is cool and the beds are comfy! Staff is lovely and helpful too

Shoreline was very practical. Close to everything we needed.Great room for if you plan to spend little time in a motel, which was out plan.The only thing I would have liked as an improvement, would be a retractable clothes line over the bath. So we could hand wash our swimwear and dry out. Or a clothes airer and pegs to put on the balcony. The staff were friendly.The facility was very clean. Complimentary drinks were good.Sheets on the bed did not fit properly.Over all, I was happy.Thanks Shoreline.

I love staying in smaller boutique hotels. Shoreline is fun and kind of retro with decor. Clean rooms and friendly staff. The restaurant attached, Heavenly, is just that. Good atmosphere. Great food. This was a very good experience. Would stay here again.

The Shoreline hotel is in a perfect location within Waikiki Beach. Everything is within walking distance e.g. the beach, shops, restaurants. Hotel staff are very helpful and pleasant. The hotel was recently renovated, so the rooms are quite clean and comfortable. There are in-room safes, Keurig coffee makers, plus all the normal amenities you would expect with any hotel these days. The free Wi-Fi is also pretty strong.If you have a car, you can park across the street at a reduced rate (24 USD per day, which is good for the area). Shuttles for the airport or for various tour companies pick up right in front of the hotel.While the hotel does not have room service, it does not really need it as it is connected to a place called Heavenly, which is one of the best restaurants in the city.There is a rooftop pool which is nice, but relatively small. It could be better maintained, but it is a decent feature.The only real downside for this hotel is that if you are on the south-facing side, you'll be looking right at a building that appears to be condemned. This means that you probably won't be sitting on your balcony too often, but it's not really a hardship (especially on the higher floors). I'd suggest asking for a north-facing room, which if on a high enough floor, may give you a bit of a view of the canal.I would happily stay at the Shoreline on future trips.

Love this hotel, though its a bit dated its clean and no unusual smell. Very accessible to transportation, shops and restaurants. My husband and myself come and stay here yearly or whenever we are in Honolulu.

Great location for a short stay. Would be helpful to have some local tourist information available in the lobby especially bus timetables and where to go to find reasonable places to eat. Was very central to most places once we found our way around.

My husband and I stayed here for one night during our trip to Oahu. I was a little nervous about the size of the rooms because I had read on some of the review that they were a little small. We were pleasantly surprised when we got there. The entire hotel has been recently updated. It's a 3 minute walk to the beach and it's right off of the main strip - GREAT location. The staff were so helpful and friendly. I would definitely recommend staying here. I also found that it was one of the lest expensive hotels for the location. We will definitely be back again!

We booked this particular hotel based on the idea that we wouldn't be in our room much, so we didn't need a lot of luxury.When we arrived we were informed that we had booked a room with two double beds. We showed our receipt, stating that we had paid for a room with a queen bed. We waited in the lobby, while they 'found us a room'.We were also told, when booking, that the hotel has a laundry. It does not!The room was clean. The bathroom was clean. The pool was clean. The hotel overall, was clean.As I said, the hotel was adequate for our needs.

The Shoreline has a very good location in the center of Waikiki, very close to shopping and resturants and an easy walk to the beach. I'm somewhat walking impaired and could easily get everywhere I wanted to. The only problem I had with getting up the front steps into the hotel, but it was manageable.My room was small but very clean and comfortable. Great bed. Small balcony but fun to sit out and watch the people walking by below. Lots of traffic in the street so could be noisy esp on the weekend.

I was there recuperating from a surgery, wanted a quiet comfortable room, and that is EXACTLY what we got. Staff was great, friendly and caring. Nice location just off Kalakaua. Clean room, nice flat screen, with lots of channels. Bath was large and had some storage too.

We stayed at this hotel because we enjoy boutique hotels with modern design. It delivers and is very clean. We didn't expect such a nice staff that goes out of their way for you. Our electric outlet wasn't working in the bathroom so they completely replaced it while we were at dinner....instantly! They offer coffee, water and tea in the lobby 24/7, bring more towels if needed and just go out of their way for you. The hotel is quiet and located in the heart of Waikiki...close to beach and shopping. Excellent location for dining, night life and fun!! And the cafe next door, called Heavenly, is delicious! Get the green curry! :)

The hotel is in a great location being only a 5-10 minute walk to shops, beach, restaurants, zoo and aquarium. Pick up locations for DFO shopping and tours were right out the front of the hotel. My favourite shop of the entire trip was Ross which is straight across the road from the hotel. The roof top pool is lovely and clean with great views. Rooms are always kept clean by the cleaner each day and there are always fresh beverages in the lobby. Fantastic hotel would recommend 10/10

Love the staff and location. Room are nice but on the small side with no work space. Nearby construction noise an issue and it starts pre-dawn. Front desk friendly and efficient, and Susan in reservations is very helplful.

We stayed for 5 nights on our honeymoon and was extremely impressed, we booked it before we left australia because it was cheap but it was a fantastic place to stay, Matthew at the front desk couldn't do enough to help, I recommend it to anyone coming to Waikiki

This hotel is located in a great place, very close to the beach and the best shops. The rooms were well appointed, comfortable and nicely furnished, with a balcony and lovely bathroom. everything was spotlessly clean. The hotel has a rooftop pool but no restaurant. However it was very close to a wide range of restaurants, cafes and take always so this was not a problem. Tea and coffee were always available in the lobby. the staff were always friendly and helpful. wHite this is not a luxury hotel with a wide range of facilities it was idea for anyone who likes to be comfortable but at a reasonable pric.

We thought the Service at Reception was very good, and really liked the Free ice cold drinks, Hot coffee and tea's and bowl of fruit which were available every day to any of the guests, in the Reception area. This made up for not having tea/cooking facilities in our rooms. The small pool on the roof was great especially after spending all day walking/travelling around in heat. Unfortunately we had to ask about everything, information was not forthcoming. We feel that a Guest Booklet in each room would have helped, saving us time & waits in Reception. Service to our room was very slow and staff seemed frantically busy. It was not uncommon for our room to be cleaned at 4 pm in the late afternoon, - just as we came in to put our feet up after being out all day.

The Shoreline is a great choice if you are visiting Honolulu for holiday or a short stay while you are in Oahu. The rooms are clean, beds are comfortable and the staff are very friendly. All local transport services pickup for transport to and from the hotel and the location is 5 minutes walk to all major shopping and restaurants in Waikiki. I booked on Expedia fora great rate.

An amazing stay, close to the heart of Waikiki and beaches , restaurants and shopping , and the front desk staff were amazing , always there to help with any questions that needed to be answered , especially Mathew !

Stayed at the Shoreline Hotel and found Staff very helpful and rooms neat and tidy. Would recommend this lovely place to stay while in Oahu. Will definitely be going back.As it was our wedding anniversary the staff presented us on arrival with a lovely bottle of bubbly in an ice bucket, and card. Lovely thought.

We loved this hotel the staff were amazing nothing was a problem connecting my wifi ,confirming my airport transfers ,organising shuttles , they were just so helpful ! We will definitely be returning there

We loved our stay here. It was a great location our only problem was being charged $100 US for towel damage as there were some marks which seems a bit ridiculous as atowel does not cost that much and the marks easily come out.

Right in The heart of Waikiki, very close proximity to shops/food/bus/beach.. Silent and clean. There is complimentary coffee/tea/mint water/ice tea/fruit. Internet is strong even on the 12th floor. Beach towels available. Polite and helpful reception. A coat of paint in the rooms would make it actually a five star almost but it did not disturb my holiday. The hotel is actually a large pick up point for all travel agencies so if you book a local trip, you cannot miss it.

What a great hotel, pretty central to all amenities and pickup for tours. Staff very friendly and helpful. Nice and quiet did not get to use pool on rooftop as beach was 1 street away. I would recommend this hotel to friends and family.

The Heavenly restaurant next door was ultra-hip with genuinely friendly, happy staff. We were recommended a show at nearby Blue Note Jazz Club. Terrific show and venue we wouldn't have known about otherwise.

There are alot of nice things about this hotel. It is very convenient and the hotel staff was very pleasant and accommodating. I liked the infused water in the lobby. You won't have any fantastic views if you get a city view room, however it is a very easy walk to the beach. I would recommend renting a scooter which was the funnest way to take a tour of the city and surrounding area. Nice stay!

I stayed here for seven nights and would find it very hard to find fault. There was a complementary bottle of wine in the room on arrival as I had mentioned it was a special anniversary. No coffee facility in room but always available in reception. Excellent restaurant attached for breakfast, really centrally located, clean, helpful staff. Superb for the money. Would go back in a heart beat.

Good hotel to sray for one or two nights. Very close to all shops and restaurants. We would again stay there even if the price is farely high for what you get (nice bed, shower, and small balcony to the back of the hotel). We booked an upgrade but were not sure what we would have get without this upgrade.

the front desk was always friendly and helpful the room was clean. location was good there was always fresh water and cold tea downs stairs and coffee that was for free.all the staff were very friendly and kind Waikiki beach was only a 5min walk if that

Stayed here one night. Shopping and restaurants close by. Friendly staff. Expect city noise. Good for travelers. Room didn't have a view but didn't expect it from this price. Waikiki like any other prime destination is expensive.

Me and my friends stayed for five nights in two double room. It was pretty decent simple hotel, and the staff was great. From our check in, during our stay to check out, everything was excellent! Front desk people was very helful, helped us book our tour, transportation to the airport, offer beach towel and the greeted us with warm Aloha! We glad we chose shoreline among expensive beach front hotel. This place is very accessible to beach, shops and restaurants. We barely stay in our room, but everytime we go back our room was clean, amenity replenished and towel replaced.. will definitely recommend this place to friend and relatives.

When I first got to the hotel I wasn't impressed and getting my room didn't provide much relief. But oh well I tried to save money by using a "pay now see what you get website." This is a boutique hotel better than a economy hotel but not quite a Embassy, Westin, or Marriott. The rooms are small but the staff is very attentive. The hot water was warm at best, but the bed is comfortable and its their version of a "Heavenly Bed". The building beside the hotel looks like a slum lords building you see in a karate movie. The hotel caters more to the Asian travelers who appreciate space and tranquility, not us US southerners who think we should have half an acre room for $50 a night. The hotel is one block away from all the worlds leading retailers like Cartier, H&M, Harry Winston plus it's right across the street from a Ross discounter; go figure. There is no room service but plenty of dining options all around the hotel. The beach is one block away and amongst those staying at the major hotels. I'd stay here again only because I know what to expect; a somewhat trendy hotel only to rest your head in Waikiki.

This hotel is only 3 blocks from the beach which makes it a little cheaper. It was clean, staff was friendly and we walked everywhere in Waikiki beach from it. I highly recommend saving your money for the Poke and Mai Tais instead of splurging on a hotel right on the beach.

Hotel ok, being refurbished, lobby nice but no where to park to take your bags in. My poor husband had to drag 3 suitcases up the front stairs as staff member said the lift was broken, advised we were parked across the road as there was no where to park...actually we could have gone round the back to drop off bags but was not told. Room was clean but could not open curtains as no sheer curtain and everyone can look in. The room, lift well and lobby were clean, the 2 guys were very nice but the girl we encountered who checked me in was not that great. Also reception is not,always manned so no one ever picked up the phone when we called downstairs, we always had to walk down to talk to someone.

My fiance and I stayed here for 4 days and loved everything about this hotel. Staff were friendly and helpful,the hotel was a modern feel with funky furniture and decor. The rooms were spacious and clean. Location was perfect with a organic brekky bar next door!!!! Don't make the same mistake as us and leave going there until the last day, eat there on your first, you won't be disappointed. Would stay again.

Excellent service and great location in Waikiki is to be found at Shoreline. Room size is on the smaller size but adequate for two people. Very close to most activities in Waikiki and restaurants and shopping malls are plentiful for availability and budget. Shuttle service available when requested. Double glaze windows make sleep inevitable.

The room is a little small but it was perfect for our stay because we just back to the hotel to take a shower and go to sleep. You have a coffee machine in the room. The location is excellent, walking distance to everything.

Room was more than adequate for one person, pool was amazing, central to everything. Clean facility. Walking distance to everything, beach and restaurant across the street. Also a great weekend getaway

We had 5 nights at Shoreline Hotel, it was in a very convenient location, 2 min walk to Waikiki Beach, shops & restaurants. Staff at the hotel were very helpful & friendly, has regular tidy up & change of towels/linen during stay, room & bathroom neat & clean & tidy. Internet was fast & efficient. Pool on roof top was OK size & refreshing to get in after walking around. Our room was small. We had accumulated luggage during our 3 week USA holiday & were fortunate we could store luggage in large walk-in wardrobe area. A/C was a bit annoying on the wall as it blew cold air directly onto bed. It was thermostat controlled, when a/c off room heated up & too noisy outside to have sliding door open. Price for hotel suited when booked but we would probably ask for larger room next time we go back. Otherwise all ok for the price. Loved Honolulu & Waikiki

Over all, good first impression of the facility ... service, location, convenience, quality, beverages avail in lobby was nice.Didn't get to experience .... restaurant, pool, terrace, exercise room ?, sauna ?

We recently stayed here for 5 nights. We found the rooms adequate but very dated. The wardrobe door fell off on trying to open it! In general we found the hotel to be clean and comfortable.
