It lacked any information on Waikiki or the hotel's facilities. We found the swimming pool by accident and found the advertised photos to be quite misleading. The down side was on our last day, I had arranged with the concierge to check out at 1pm instead of 12 noon. From 11:45am we were told a number of times by cleaning and reception staff that we needed to be out by 12 which left us feeling harassed. The location is quite good if you don't mind a bit of a walk however next time we would pay more and stay somewhere a little more central

We just returned from a 7 night stay at the Shoreline. We had a group of 10. The first 4 stayed for 2 nights and the 6 of us who stayed on for the week. Just loved the position, the staff, the added touch of having water and iced tea in the lobby along with a coffee and tea facilities. It was close to everything. A short walk to the beach, right across the road from Ross, right in the centre of everything. Matt and all the front desk staff were always ready to assist. Rooms were adequate, clean, beds very comfortable. I was on the 14th floor - had a great view of the ocean. I would definitely stay at the Shoreline again.

I have been to Hawaii many times staying at various levels and locations and Shoreline exceeded my expectations. Yes the room was not a huge suite but was more than adequate for my 9 night stay. Beautiful comfortable bed and being on the 13th floor (yes there is a USA hotel with a 13th floor :) ) I had no street noise. The location is central to restaurants and shopping and about a 10 minute walk (max) to the beach. The Shoreline had everything I needed and I have already recommended to friends who are going to Hawaii in December '16. Thank you for a lovely stay I will be back!

I love our stay at The Shoreline. I went with a friend who travels to Hawaii every year. She had not heard of this hotel before but she put her faith in me and I booked it as the reviews looked great. We arrived early in the morning and out room wasn't quite ready, no problem! They held our bags for us and offered us refreshments and we spent the day shopping. On our return about 9pm that evening our room was ready and they even upgraded us to a bedroom with 2 separate King beds which was perfect for us. All staff were very accomodating and the room was fresh and had everything you needed. The location of the hotel is fantastic, right in the middle of where you need to be and I will definitely be returning. Take my advice, don't spend thousands on the beachfront hotels when you can pay half the price for this little gem. Thank you Shoreline.

We stayed in this hotel twice during a 6 week trip to Hawaii; both times we were impressed by the friendliness of the staff. It is also in an excellent location just two blocks from Waikiki beach and all the fancy shops, yet was quiet at night. Both rooms we stayed in were spacious & clean, especially considering the price (book through the hotel website for a good deal!). Thoroughly recommended!

The hotel was conveniently located. Close to the beach, shopping, & dining. The rooms were clean but a little dated. Not much of a view out our sliding glass door/ balcony (facing the beach). We saw a dilapidated apartment high rise next door. So, we kept our curtains closed. Not what I wanted to do in Hawaii. The staff made up for the negatives I listed.

the hotel is not perfect it's a little bit old. with that said i found super nice staff always ready and very kind. bed was comfortable room was clean and you're literally one block from everything. it's your bargain in Honolulu because you won't spend much time in the room. i didn't use it but it was nice to have a microwave in the room.

nice and clean hotel, loved the lime water in the lobby, refreshing. i arrived at 8.30 in the morning after travelling from cairns but couldnt get in my room till just before 3. would've been nice to be able to get in earlier. i emailed with my arrival time hoping i might be able to get in but no luck. staff weren't particularly helpful in that respect. so it was an uncomfortable day walking round feeling tired and unclean. no view but already knew that, to get a view in hawaii have to pay good money. comfortable bed. overall very good.

As I heard,room was good and staffs were kind. When I lied on the bed,I found a hair. That must not be from a head!!! And I do not know why my room was just next to the elevator so we could not get sleep. Also I thought I could get breakfast service but one of your staff said that shoreline does not have it. But if I show my room key to heavenly,I could get 10percent discount.After i came back from alamoana,there were 4 breakfast coupons in our room . We would check out next day!!!Which meams we got the breakfast coupons one day late. We were very happy in Hawaii but not happy in Shoreline.

This hotel is good for people who will be venturing off on the island and need a bed to sleep in. This is no Hilton. Good location, walking distance to everything. I wouldn't pay more than 150$ a night. Matt is awesome but wouldn't stay again. Pictures shown are very edited...

The staff are really nice. They keep the room clean everyday during our visit, but there is no sound proof. I could even hear someone open the door next to us. The location is very convenient. Generally, it was not a bad stay.

The hotel is well situated between the two main roads in Waikiki. Its close to buses, taxis, shops and restaurants. An easy 10 minute walking distance to most things. The Hotel itself is older but well suited to the budget conscious or brief traveler to Waikiki. Tea. coffee, water and computers, and newspapers are available. I used a couple of free towels and the small pool on the roof. The pool is a great way to cool and deck chairs are available but the pool and the surrounding area can get easily crowded due to its small size. The room size, facilities and bed are all adequate. Cleaning was not always meticulous as I did notice hairs left in the bath and basin. I did have problems with the card "key" which did not allow me to get into my room. It flashed a red button on the door lock and I had to get the receptionist to "reset" the key. An easy fix problem though. The other main problem was the intermittent air conditioning. The air conditioning only works with the card entered into the wall slot. However my card was in the slot but it still showed on the air conditioning system as "unoccupied". So I called reception to get a repair guy to come and look at it. He did come to the room quickly and adjusted/reset the settings. My mum had a similar issue when we first arrived. I think the whole air conditioning system is out dated and needs upgrading as most people would rely on it to keep their rooms cool during hot days.

I stayed at the Shoreline Hotel Waikiki during the last 2 nights of a 6 night stay in Waikiki. I wished I had stayed here the entire time! The first thing I noticed was how nice the staff was. Everyone I came in contact with during my stay, from the front desk staff, to the valet attendant, to the cleaning staff, was very friendly. We had a nice queen bed room with a spacious bathroom. No complaints there. Short of actually being on the beach, the location was perfect - only about a 5 minute walk to the beach, and close to lots of shopping and restaurants. I stayed at a hoteI right in front of the beach during the first 4 nights of my stay, and while the view was nice, this hotel was just so much better in every other way. I hope to stay here again during my next visit to Oahu!

I stayed here for 5 nights this past week - amazing location just a block from Waikiki's main avenue, shopping and the beach and across the street from tour bus pick ups. City bus stops are right around the corner. Room on the 7th floor was large, clean and bright with a small balcony, microwave and fridge. Free coffee, tea, cold drinks and fruit in the lobby at all times. A bit of street noise starting with delivery trucks around 6 AM each morning. I can't say enough about the staff - housekeeping staff was friendly and helpful and the front desk staff were all amazing. They were friendly and helpful and knew me by name. A special shout out to Alex for touring advice, directions and general information but everyone's customer service was exemplary. Thank you for a great stay!

Our stay was great, rooms wasn't ocean view but the rooms are well maintained and clean. Friendly staff. Hotel provied beach towel, complimentary coffee!! Very accessible to beach, shopping mall and restaurants.

I have stayed at many hotels in Honolulu for the last 7 years and I can say that this is one of the best exceeding our expectations. Shoreline Hotel has one of the best positions on Waikiki with easy access to the beach and centrally located within walking distance to popular restaurants and shops. What I like best in my stay with Shoreline is the service that we experienced from their staff. From the moment of arriving all of the staff who served us were friendly, welcoming and professional anticipating your every need. I'd like to commend their front desk supervisor Ina Yzarri for her best assistance during our entire stay. In any chance I'll get to go back in Honolulu, I won't think twice of staying in Shorline Hotel.

First time coming to Hawaii, stayed in this amazing boutique hotel in the heart of Waikiki and its near everything! Friendly staff and very accommodating it made our trip so memorable The room is small but everything I need is there with like Kuerig cups, microwave and refigerator. I will really stay here again in our next visit!

I recently decided to stay at the Shoreline Hotel Waikiki, as I was on a short business trip. I love how everything was in walking distance. Alex had great customer service and was very helpful. He is really knowledgable, as he answered many of my questions. I will definitely stay here again and recommend this hotel. Thank you.

Im writing this review at 3am while i try to settle my baby who has woken up constantly throughout the night, this latest time by a staff member cleaning the outside entrance to the hotel with some machine. I'm trying to call reception to ask tjem to stop but there is no answer. Seriously???? It's 3am. PLEASE STOP.To the staff member using the machine and/or management: i would highly encourage you to spend a night in room 230 and have someone clean downstairs with that machine in the middle of the night so you can see what it's like.To everyone reading this: request a room on the highest level possible. I chose this hotel for the central location but it's back-fired on me as i try and sleep white waikiki parties on. the higher you are the further you will be from street and cleaning noises which have kept me up all night.

Our stay at the shoreline Waikiki was amazing! The hotel is in an excellent location, staff are friendly and the rooms were very clean. I really loved the black board outside of the lift that has daily updates on the surf and has a new Haiwaiin word to learn each day! I also thought the iced tea and cucumber water was a great touch!

We stayed here for 4 days from March 8-11 and the hotel is clean, with good sized rooms, comfortable beds, but the best of all is the staff. They're very courteous with detailed attention to guests and sma details. Will stay here again this week. Will recommend this to my friends.

The hotel was well placed near Waikiki beach and shopsThe breakfast close to the hotel is very good with good smoothies The bedroom was good and comfortable with a small terrasse and there is also a swimming pool on the roof top

I am giving this four stars purely for the piece - $180 Aussie dollars for a one night stopoff after the airport. It's definitely not a four star hotel, but it's clean, comfy, convenient and all of the staff have been above and beyond friendly and helpful.The rooms are small, but look recently refurbished; perfect for a one night stay. The bathroom is massive, and nice quality products. The bed is a very small queen size - I would have said double.The only faults I have are the sliding door to the tiny terrace not locking or even shutting property - the non-stop banging in the wind nearly drove me insane. Other than that, the terrace/balcony is very small, no chairs to sit out and enjoy the views. Would I stay again?For a stopover on the way to a hotel, probably. For a couple of night stay, I would like a bigger balcony to relax on but can't fault anything else.Excellent value for money.

Aloha!Interesting hotel to stay, friendly staff. When you enter the lobby very inviting to the guest with the pineapple ice tea and cucumber water for free! The amenities in the room with fridge, microwave and kuerig cups very useful. I will surely stay here again for my next visit! Mahalo

We booked this Hotel as it was less expensive than those on the main drag. It is located on a not so busy street between two major streets and just 5 minute walk to beach area so nice quiet location.Dress for Less and Markets are across the road if you need to shop for bargains.Hotel itself is older but has been freshly renovated inside and rooms are superbly clean.There are about 8 to 10 steps to walk up from street to enter hotel so have to carry bags.Staff at front desk were most helpful and courteous. There is iced tea and lemon water along with tea and coffee all day in foyer.Plenty of eating options close by but no restaurant at hotel itself.Outdoor pool on top as well.

This is the 2nd time we have stayed in this hotel, it is clean and so convenient, not to mention a great price. We stayed 2 nights on the way to visit other Hawaiian Islands and 3 night on the way home. The first 2 nights the room was a little old but the last visit we were in what looked like a brand new room. Staff are very friendly and helpful and the hotel is close to the beach and all the shops.

This was our 2nd stay at the Shoreline and I would definitely stay there again. The hotel is clean and tidy and central to everything you need in Waikiki. Best shopping spot is just across the street. The staff are more than fantastic!! The guys on reception are so helpful and friendly. I would highly recommend this hotel.
user_name:
Jamie B
Auckland Central, New Zealand

review_body: This hotel was good friendly staff and valet parking local guy George was awesome hope we can have more cool local braddahs working for our hotels but it was nice and relaxing no noise and close to the strip and beach and restaurants and shops it's Sunday check out time and back to work thanks shoreline hotel

The Shoreline Hotel is a clean, modern, affordable hotel in a great location. Its a short walk to the beach, shops and lots of good places to eat.We weren't looking for ocean views or resort pools, we wanted somewhere clean and comfortable to rest our head each night, Shoreline provides this.With an in room safe, good air conditioning, full sized shower with lots of hot water and a very comfortable queen size bed.The front desk staff were great! Friendly, polite and happy to offer information. For example, we wanted a sim card, not only did they show us the closest shop available, they even called the store to check if they were still there. Also our flight home was cancelled, twice! Shoreline were happy to accomodate us 2 extra nights on short notice.Heavenly Cafe downstairs was fantastic as well.Would definitely recommend.Thank you Shoreline

This newly renovated Hotel is in a great location in Waikiki, right between two major streets so nothing is too far to walk to. It is directly opposite a Starbucks for free wifi and decent coffee and also right accross from Ross's Dress for Less (open till 11pm!)The Lobby has fresh drinks for you daily and free towels to take down to the beach. But don't forget the Rooftop pool. It's small but a nice quiet place to get away and cool off.Our room was big with lots of light available and the bed was comfy and much needed after big days out and about.There were only a couple of things we were unhappy with, we paid extra for a balcony and room with a partial view but the balcony was tiny and could barely fit two people on it. The neighbours were also smokers so we couldn't open the door ever. We had also requested a king bed, but despite checking in early and the hotel not being fully booked we were refused. Small things, but still would have have been great if they were different.

Terrific hotel in downtown Honolulu. All of the staff were very helpful, courteous. Well appointed rooms, clean and comfortable. It actually looked like the pictures on line! Very close to the beach and within walking distance of many other amenities and attractions in the area. Terrific restaurant next door called Heavenly. Superb job, Shoreline! Hope I get to come back again soon!

We recently spent a week at Shoreline Waikiki. Overall a great experience! The rooms were spacious and the location was wonderful. We could walk to the beach, shops and restaurants. The staff was accommodating and professional.

My husband and I stayed at the Shoreline for four nights and really enjoyed it.The hotel has a modern and hip vibe to it and is literally right in the middle of Waikiki's shopping, restaurants and beach. There is construction going on across the street from the hotel but that didn't really bother us much because it started and ended each day while we were out. The hotel staff was really a fun bunch of people. They were always happy and friendly and gave us some good insights on where to go on the north coast. You can also borrow towels from them to bring with you to the beach.This is a smaller hotel so there are only two elevators but you never had to wait long. The pool on the top of the hotel was pretty small but the view of waikiki is pretty good. We didn't want to spend our time at the hotel pool though, wed rather go to the beaches. The restaurant attached to the hotel was the best breakfast place we ate the whole trip!We really enjoyed the hotel and will stay here again the next time we come back!

I stayed here for six nights in late July 2015. The best thing that can be said about this hotel is its central location with shopping, restaurants, and Waikiki beach easily accessible within walking distance.Other than that, this property doesn't have much going for it. The so called pool at the top of the roof is a joke: it's tiny, there are only a couple of sun chairs, and it's surrounded by noisy air vents making it very unpleasant to be up there. My room was small with very limited storage space. When I wanted to make use of the guest vouchers giving me a discount at a 24 hour Fitness gym a couple of blocks away, I was told they were out of vouchers. Instead, much to my embarrassement, I had to ask the gym to give me the discount without the voucher (which they did, reluctantly). Worst of all was the inconsistent level of customer service. Some front desk staff were just so nonchalant, slow, and unwilling to assist me, a first time Hawaii visitor, with directions and suggestions, that I eventually had to put my foot down and file a complaint. Really unpleasant and unnecessary; had their staff shown more professionalism and courtesy this situation could have been avoided. A bottle of wine was later sent to my room along with an apologetic note (see attached photo). While I appreciate the gesture it didn't alter my view of this hotel nor did it resolve the issues I had in planning excursions etc on the island.In summary: a hotel with a good location but with no restaurant of its own, no proper swimming pool, no fitness room, no proper concierge service, small guest rooms, and uneven customer service. Would I stay here again if I were to return to Honolulu? No. The Shoreline is not cheap, and I expected more and better.

Perfect location right around the corner from the Waikiki action. Stayed 5 nights with most of the time off exploring Oahu so only needed a basic clean convenient place to stay and this fit the bill. Rates were ok (AUD low so it was not going to be a good deal anywhere). Short 10min walk to Waikiki beach with shops to see along the way. 5 min walk to bus stop on Kuhio Ave for the day where we did not have a car. Close to convenience stores, eateries, very close to cheesecake factory, across the road from a Ross store which was open until very late- made for lots of things to do and easy drop off back at hotel.I would recommend Shoreline for those after a balance of shops & beach/ or off most of the time exploring other parts of the island. This end of the beach is closer to the main shops & eateries, market across the road, and offers more to do and see in the evenings. If we had stayed around the center of the strip, it would be quite a long walk every day back and forth to the action.  Room is smallish but tidy and clean and the view was overlooking a back street and another apartment hotel which was acceptable and about what you can expect for non -beachside hotels in Waikiki. There is a coffee maker in room plus a mini fridge which was sufficient to keep a few sushi rolls cool overnight. Did not bother to visit pool.The attached Heavenly Lifestyle Cafe was highly rated in reviews so we ate there twice- dinner & breakfast. Nice atmosphere and delicious food but a bit overpriced.Will definitely stay again!

We booked this hotel because the hotel we regularly stayed at was unavailable. We stayed 5 days. It was confusing to see where the lobby was until we realized the entryway was in an alley and the words "Lobby Check In" were on a small 8x12 sign. The valet was very courteous and assured us about our car. Our room was not ready as it was only 2 o'clock but we had only a 10 minutes wait in the lobby. The staff is nice, efficient, and welcoming. In the lobby, hey have iced cucumber infused water and pineapple infused water as well as coffee and tea for all the guests. Really nice. The room was clean. It's not the fanciest place, but it has all the basics you'll need. The best thing about this hotel is the convenience of shops, restaurants, the beach only five minutes away. The Heavenly Restaurant is a must, espceially for breakfast, I think this will be our regular place to stay from now on. 4 stars instead of 5 because of the forced valet parking (30/day) and confusing entrance into checking in.

Pretty average hotel for the price I paid however when you're working with the NZ dollar, it was always going to be a struggle. Great location for shops and eateries. Interior is tired looking but rooms clean. Staff very friendly. Pool area is very sparse with only 2 sun loungers to lie on. Having your own balcony was a bonus.

Arrived 9am. They were able to check us in to one of our groups rooms until the other room became available. Stayed for 3 nights. Great friendly staff. Excellent lobby area with good wifi and water. Roof top pool was cool. Quick walk to Waikiki beach. Good eateries close by. Would definitely stay again.

We spent two nights here and arrived in the night after 2 am. The receptionist was so friendly, he even offered us something to eat. The rooms are small but the bed is comfortable, the bathroom clean and well equipped.And everything you need is in walking distance. Also breakfast at Heavenly Coffee is highly recommended. Worth every penny!

This hotel compared to some around it was not comparably big but I would classify it as Boutique and beautiful. It met all our needs and was extremely well presented from the lobby through to the rooms. We stopped here on our way home to Australia from the mainland. This is not my first time in Hawaii and this hotel is by far the best stay for comfort and definitely for a great location. less than a block to the main street and opposite great shopping at Ross. Staff were always helpful and friendly. the facilities available to the guests in the lobby were excellent from coffee to fresh juices and water. Only downside was stair access only - a bit of a struggle with your luggage. Management may want to consider a ramp for street access.

We stayed at the Shoreline for 6 nights in January. The hotel was in a great location and the hotel made our stay a fantastic one.We were visiting for our honeymoon and my husband was 40 whilst we were there also. Check in was a breeze and our room was ready when we arrived at just before 3pm. The hotel also had a bottle of champagne sent up to our room which was a great start to the vacation. Our room (1428) was clean and tidy and had a good seaview, would recommend this room if you do want a view. For two of us the room was a good size. Towels were changed daily, bed was made every day and the sheets were changed after 3 nights. There was a coffee machine in the room and an ice machine down in the lobby if you need to chill anything. The hotel is one block from the beach and there are plenty of restaurants and bars in the local area. We visited the top of Waikiki which was great food and excellent place for a drink to watch the sunset. Would also recommend island vintage coffee as a great alternative to Starbucks. We had a rental car whilst we were visiting and on a couple of nights there was no spaces left in the valet parking but no fear, you can park in the public parking across the street for $24 (you need to show your room key to get that rate) All in all a fantastic visit and we would definitely recommend to friends and family. Look forward to visiting again. Mahalo!

This is a good value for money option when staying overnight in Waikiki. Location is excellent, rooms are small but clean and staff is friendly. We already stayed here 2 years ago and think it’s solid.

This hotel is greatly overrated on most reviews 8/10 is no where accurate. The rooms are small & balconies small,so double rooms have 1 chair inside & 1 chair outside,basically there is no room. bathrooms small, basically. Small is the best word to use. We were on the 12th floor view to ocean blocked by city concrete. location ok & staff friendly.Stayed 2 nights that's was enough. sorry a very Overrated hotel. View from the balcony below not inspiring..Wayne @ Lennox

Posting this review sitting out on the lanai at this nice hotel. Stayed 4 nights. At check-in was given a choice of what room I wanted out of 4. I recommend picking a room that is not facing the Seaside Commercial Center (it's kind of not pretty looking). My wife and I had a private swim on the rooftop pool. This hotel has great walkability to everywhere on Waikiki. Front desk staff great. Look, would I tell a couple looking to book their honeymoon to stay here, no, they would be better off to book at the $400+ resorts for a once in a lifetime type occasion. But if you're just looking for great accommodations at a great price (we used an opaque site) then yes, this hotel hits everything. Clean, safe, and location.

We picked this hotel because of location which is in the centre of Waikiki, not in the strip but very near to the main attraction. The room is clean and the staff are very friendly. We had an initial issues with our card as we thought however the staff admitted that it turned out their system had just been upgraded and at last my card did work. No breakfast facility however they have a small shop next door that provide light breakfast or in 2 minutes you could go to small cafe that sold Japanese nigiri or a local Hawaiian restaurant that serve their famous Loco Moco. This is not a big hotel so we don't need to queue when check in or out.

We booked this hotel for nine nights after reading reviews and on recommendations of others. We were very disappointed.The rooms were meant to be renovated but were very small and the bathroom was tiny with no ventilation whatsoever .When we tried to check in on arrival after a nine hour flight we were told check in was at 3pm so we spent the next six hours walking the streets of Waikiki. Surely in a hotel of this size there must be some rooms that are available before 3pm.Upon our return to the hotel we asked again if there was an available room and were given the same response. Finally when I asked again we were escorted to a room and told our keys wouldn't be available for this room until 3pm which seemed strange as we already had access to the room.While the staff were relatively friendly none of them went out of the way to be helpful or accommodating.On one of the days after a long day at the beach we returned to our room at 3.30 pm to shower only to find our room hadn't been serviced and we had to leave again in order for it to be serviced.

Pros: Free Coffee and Tea in the lobby 24/7, valet parking, free wifi, 5 mins from Waikiki beach, friendly staff, clean roomsCons: Housekeeping knocked on my door at 7am each morning, pool is a bit small, restaurant wasn't too great. Found a roach in my room and contacted the receptionist. The bellman arrived and quickly removed it from our room. He apologized and sent us some chocolates and a cute note. Thank you!

Our family stayed here for 5 nights. Lobby has refreshing Cucumber mint water & Pineapple ice tea. Check in was quick and easy. Alex and Matt were just wonderful. They recommended some great restaurants and activities to do. Room size was a bit small for a family. This didn't bother us because we were out most of the day. Valet service was $30 a day. (highly recommended in Waikiki) We will be back on our next trip!
user_name:
Cathy L
New York City, New York

review_body: We went with a group of friends, and my husband in April 2014.It was a great hotel as it was clean, quiet and close to everything. Nothing much at the hotel other than to rest your head, but overall a good hotel.We paid extra to get a view, don't bother... You are too far away to see anything and you don't use your balcony anyway at this hotel.

We had a wonderful stay at the Shoreline. The rooms were modern, clean and air conditioned. The staff were amazing a special thank you to Alex and Zhu for your helpful and friendly service. We definitely recommend this hotel and we will be returning.

Very clean hotel, Air conditioning in rooms only. Convenient, walk across street to shopping! Attached restaurant right out of lobby. We booked a total of three rooms for an all family cruise. Arrived one day early and stayed one night at Shoreline. Very reasonable compared to other surrounding hotels. Downtown, lots of shopping within few blocks.

I stayed at the shoreline about a month ago, as a mini staycation for my family. Entering into the facility the Staff members were friendly and polite. Upon seeing the room I realized that we needed two beds instead of one. I called down to the front desk and spoke with PT. Pt was apologetic and eager to help. PT was extremely sweet and a pleasure to speak with. In no time at all He was able to move us from a one bed to a two bed room.Overall; from the lobby, the rooms, restaurant, and service; I would highly recommend this place to friends and family. Thank you shoreline for the great service and making our staycation fun and relaxing.

We were very pleased with our 4-day stay at the Shoreline. Waikiki beach is only 1 1/2 blocks away, the main luxury shopping street is even closer. Our king-size bed was very comfy and the room was not as small as I expected in this high-tourist area. Nice decor and a small, health-conscious cafe is next door. Especially nice was the Nespresso machine in room (small charge for refills after the first 4). Be aware that valet parking is another $30 a night. We would have been better off renting a car by the day for the two times we went out rather than rent one at the airport. There is plenty to do and see without one! There is a small balcony and a rooftop pool, although we did not use the latter.

I booked this hotel because of the closeness to the beach and while it was a perfectly good stay I feel it may have been a litle overpriced as I had stayed at hotels one block back for 2/3 the price with no marked difference in amenity and a 2 minute extra walk to the beach. The pool is tiny and access is via a pretty ugly staircase on top of the building. Staff are pleasant, howver I reported that the TV was not working and the promised maintenance person never arived, neither was I given any feedback. Did not impact on my stay, but am not sure that the next guest would feel the same.

Booked a room at the Shoreline Hotel because my flight was delayed. The staff were friendly and always smiling. Hotel was centrally located and only 5 mins from the famous waikiki beach. Thank you again. Room 1227.

This hotel was great! My partner and I were in transient from our 7 day cruise around the other islands. The staff were very professional and friendly, housekeeping was nice (I wasn't in the room enough to interact) but when I got back the room was clean! I like the little cards with the housekeepers names on it! Overall I was happy and would love to come back to this hotel. And to those complaints about the view. For me we were on the 4th floor but it didn't bother us we wanted to explore Hawaii! And the staff make up for it :) thank you!

Stayed here for five nights in December 2015 and the location is amazing. Right across from the main shopping and entertainment precinct of Waikiki and only a five minute walk to the beach. The front desk staff are very friendly and the rooms are okay. Asked for two seperate beds and received one double bed and a fold out couch which was disappointing. Also got woken up every morning by housekeeping banging on the door for upwards of ten minutes, and then slamming the door repeatedly on the lock chain. This was the most negative point of our stay. Complimentary beverages in the lobby and good quality wifi are both positives. Location is the most stand out positive though.

A smaller style Hotel / Apartment complex on Seaside Avenue just a five minute walk from Waikiki Beach. Perfect location (in the middle) of the hub, beach, shopping, restaurant in Waikiki. Pick up for almost all our booked tours were just across the street. Hotel rooms are very small (usual for Waikiki) with basic amenities. Free Wi-Fi works very well in the room and hotel. Place is clean and staff (service) is good.

My husband & I visit Hawaii almost once a year. We've stayed at several different hotels and we were very happy with our stay at Shoreline. The location was very convenient- close to the beach and delicious eateries. Easy check-in/check-out, nice staff, clean room. We would definitely stay here again!

My friend and I stayed for a week in October, our room was lovely, on the top floor so we did have a partial view of the ocean. The room was very nice, clean and spacious. The location is ok, its just off the main street and the beach is only a 10 min walk away. The swimming pool on the roof is not worth a visit!! There are definitely better hotels but for the price this is more than fineWe also found the Wifi worked fine in our room, which was a good thing as I had read reviews on this not being great but I can confirm we had no issues with this at all.

We had a fantastic time at Shoreline. The rooms are as described, nothing lavish but all you need for a few nights in the middle of Waikiki - walking distance to everything.Staff were also incredibly helpful organising shuttles and tours if desired.

I've been staying here since my first trip in 2013, and have loved the location, hotel and the service so it pains me to write this review, but if you stay here please lock up your valuables in the safe. Not even reception area is safe to hold items as they told me my souvenirs that they were holding for me had gone missing.Over the course of a week I had some expensive headphones for the plane, some jewellery, and other personal effects go missing from the room. At first I thought my wife had accidentally packed some of these items as she packed up to see some of the other islands for a bit but unfortunately after checking with her I've concluded that the items were taken from the room by housekeeping.The hotel advised there was nothing they could do and even the police just wanted to file a "lost property report". The hotel will not take responsibility for anything that isn't in the safe so if you want to stay here be careful.Not even the front desk is safe to leave items, I had some souvenirs being held at reception for me and they also went missing. Very disappointed as I want to return to Waikiki and need a new favourite place to stay.

I booked through my travel agent and first looked at pictures, comments etc. the good: price (I guess), the neighborhood (convenient, less crowded, easy to get anywhere) and a new restaurant next door, really good but spendy...the 'bad': friendly staff but not knowledgeable of much past the bus system. Kuerig machine in rooms w 4 pods, each additional is $2 bucks! The pool! On 14th floor, have to climb slippery stairs last flight and a half. so small no room for anyone to sit! Gross! Such a disappointment! Rooms, small and poorly appointed. No storage, badly in need of an upgrade, and not terribly clean! One day the elevators were down in the morning and we walked down 10 flights! Would not return....

I booked this hotel for one night as I had a flight from Australia before heading to mainland USA. I originally should've landed at this hotel around 7pm, however I missed my flight, and therefore ended up arriving at the hotel around 8am the next morning. I informed the hotel via text, and asked if there was anyway I could stay in the room until around 3pm. I didn't receive a positive response, but decided to check-in at the hotel anyway. Unfortunately they couldn't let me stay in the room past midday, which I found quite poor service, when taking into consideration this room cost me £90. I didn't explore much of the hotel as I just crashed for three hours. It seemed nice though, with the decor. Room facilities included a mini-fridge, coffee machine and free toiletries which were great. Also a balcony was included with this room. I found internet to be of reasonable speed.On my departure, I slipped outside the hotel, with my suitcase. If it had just been mopped, then no wet floor sign was to be seen. Didn't receive a very positive service from this hotel, but would stop here again if I was in the area of Waikiki.

We only stayed here 2 nights as it was at the end of our 2 week holiday. We opted for a partial sea view which was on a higher floor and you could 'just' see the sea. Each room has a small balcony which is nice and the rooms are of adequate size. As with most hotels in Waikiki this is an old hotel freshened up and to the credit of the owners, they did a pretty good job with the canvas they were given. It is clean, comfortable, free WIFI, fresh water and coffee in the lobby and staff friendly. It is in a side street just off the main drag so it is a little quieter than on the main road, but you still get noise from surrounds but it tends to stop at about 10pm. There is a pool on the roof which has limited hours (0800-7pm +/-) and there is cafe right next door - we didn't go there.Please note, if you are mobility restricted, older or physically challenged, there are only stairs to access the hotel. There is a disabled lift, but not sure if it works. Check 1st. It is only about 10 steps, but if you are carrying bags it can be tricky.If back in Waikiki, we would most likely stay here again.

The location of this hotel is good but their service is terrible. The cleaning people even forgot to lock the door after they cleaned the room. Also, the air conditioning system is so noisy and you can't hear anything with that system on, and the room is so small which barely holds two people.

This hotel is located in Waikiki perfectly!Right by the Royal Hawaiian center, two blocks from the beach, and close to amazing restaurants! Our room contain a fridge and a microwave, which was helpful.We had lunch once at the rooftop pool.. The pool is small and nothing much going on there...Service is amazing. The front desk were able to provide us with helpful information and beach towels. They have coffee, tea, pineapple iced tea, cucumber mint water and apples at the lobby as well.Restaurants near by: marukame udon, surf N tacos, siam place (thai), kimukatsu, cheesecake factory, musubi & bento iyasume, steak shack, crackin kitchen, eggs n things, etc. The food pantry is also close by!Bus 2, 22, 23 are very close! The hotel room needs more shelves in my opinion but that's because I like to unpack my suitcase. Our room was facing a loud restaurant/bar... We were in room 726. I would definitely stay here again!!!!!

Good clean hotel. Free cool water ( mint and cucumber) in the lobby and coffee and tea. Within a 5 minute walk to shopping district. I shared a room with a family member and there was definitely enough room.Hotel provides beach towels upon request. Staff polite and courteous.Negatives: No shelving in wardrobe only hanging space. No ramp only stairs when carrying luggage into hotel. Would definitely stay again
user_name:
Heidi S
Perth, Western Australia, Australia

review_body: After searching for countless hotels for the first part of our honeymoon we stumbled across Shoreline Waikiki. We ended up booking as the pricing was pretty competitive and it was near the beach.The staff were really friendly, the room was clean and had all we needed although quite small. However, as it was a city hotel this wasn't a bad thing at all.There is no on-site restaurant or bar but they have one of the best cafes next door. All in a great stay and wouldn't change a lot. Happy customers.

I stayed in this hotel for 6 nights recently. It is an interesting hotel with good location. It is not a beach hotel, but can reach the beach after a few minutes walking. The front desk staffs are friendly and helpful. My room was in 12th floor with no good view other than adjacent buildings. It is small and carpets are old. There is a small fridge in the room, hidden inside the table drawers. Good points:1. The front desk staff are friendly2. Free coffee is available in the lobby3. A restaurant adjacent to the hotel (never used it so I do not know the quality)A few bad points to note,1. Room is very small, may be difficult for a couple. Not recommended for a family2. The room carpet is not cleaned recently and I request the hotel to vacuum it every day.3. Bed sheets are not changed daily. 4. The cleaning service comes at irregular timing during the day and they do not knock on the door either. If you miss their visit, then need to call the front desk to request it.5. The bathroom floor is clean, but very stuffy and smelly due to lack of windows or exhaust.6. The bath tub was never cleaned and I could see the stains.7. The most irritating stuff was the coffee machine. It is a nespresso machine and need to purchase the coffee capsule ($2 each) from the front desk to use it. I wonder what a tea loving guest can do with this machine. It would have been great if the hotel provide at least one or two complementary capsules every day for the guests to use it. Since they advertise the presence of coffee machine in the room, I felt very disappointed on this. I would like the hotel to provide a normal coffee machine with one or two complementary coffee & tea packets. if the guest want to use more, they can purchase the additional items.So the hotel can be improved greatly by paying attention to these issues.

Hotel was awesome!Big pros:-greatest location, 3min walk from Waikiki beach where all the action is happening and right next to street where all restaurants and shopping stores are located! -very modern and clean place, my husband and I travel a lot, but this hotel exceeded our typical marriot experience!-free sweet tea and cucumber waters+hot coffee and tea available in the lobby 24/7really made the difference!One con:parking is limited to 7 or 10 spaces, so be ready to park in the garage across the street.the good thing hotel helps you with it, so u pay less for parking there than any tourist

I prefer to stay at Joy de Vivre hotels whenever possible, so when my husband & I decided to stay in Honolulu for a night before going on to Maui, the Shoreline Hotel Waikiki was an easy choice. PT, the friendly & knowledgeable front desk manager, checked us in with no issues. He and every staff member we encountered was courteous & professional. Our room was a good size, and the bed was comfy. Everything was clean and well kept. There's a Keurig coffee maker, a mini-fridge and a microwave. The lobby has cool MCM touches, but still feels authentic to Hawaii. It is not a fancy hotel, but it is super nice, and we hope to stay there again. Mahalo to the Shoreline ohana for an excellent time!

Very comfortable, facilities good and staff friendly. The location was great being central to all. My wife would have liked the bed to be a little softer! You get what you pay for and we found it adequate in every way. Would stay here again.

During out three days stay, they totally "forgot" to clean our room. Not a nice surprise to get tired back from tour and find the room totally undone. After requesting the cleanup and towels, somebody came in few minutes to make the room up. Finally when we got "clean" towels, one was totally stained and disgusting .Stupid sign in room telling "here is your first cups of coffee, if you need more come downstairs to buy more". I found it insulting for visitors that stay several nights.

Not on the beach but not priced like on the beach. Easy 2 block walk to the beach and centrally located on Waikiki. In my opinion it is not worth the extra cost to be next to the ocean. We would stay here again.

Very good pricing via Hotel.com. Very convenient Waikiki location. Clean. Restaurant. Refreshments in lobby. Parking is valet via an unmarked driveway in side alley. Found it after driving around the block only once. No frills, nothing fancy but it worked with nice touches noted.

The staff were friendly and helpful, the rooms were clean, the beds were good and the location was very central and not too far from the beach. I dislike the bath/shower in one but that is personal preference. Overall this hotel was great for the price and if you are not staying on the beach this place is ideal.

I stayed for 5 nights. I thought my room was spacious, clean and well equipped.Good location for everything in Waikiki.Staff very helpful.Great breakfast next door at Heavenly.Roof top pool could do with a little tlc, fix the water fountain, get wifi up there. Good value hotel, would stay again.

This was a great hotel for the price in super expensive Waikiki. We were only there 2 nights and experienced no issues. We never got a chance to visit the rooftop pool. The view out of our room was not great, but I didn't spend all day in the room either, so that was not an issue. It's walking distance from the beach and a lot of shopping. The room was very clean and the shower was excellent. The bed wasn't the most comfortable at first, but I actually slept pretty well here. I definitely recommend for a great deal and location!

I'm a big Joie de Vivre Hotel fan and always try to book this brand where ever I travel. Unfortunately, this destination is seriously in need of help. The carpets are soiled, torn and stained. The bathroom was not clean and everything seems old and rusted or in need of repair. I'm sure Chip Conley would never allow such poorly maintained elements to be found at one of his properties, but like so many corporate buy outs, this once highly styled brand has been diminished and the result is sad.I did not even realize there was a restaurant at the property until the 3rd day, no mention at check-in, no menus. Windows were filthy. The non-skid surface on the bathtub floor was grey and soiled, so much for my bubble bath. I know it is humid in Hawaii but everything seemed to be sticky to the touch. As a former B&B operator I am very disappointed.

Rooms very comfortable & clean, maid visited everyday. Staff very friendly & helpful. Good location for shops, near enough to beach & handy for local bus & tour departures Will stay here on my next visit
user_name:
Chris S
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: Great priceSuper locationThe big bonus was the staff. They are so pleasant and go the extra mile. I would go back. Safe and so well located. all tours start across the street yet my room was quiet and attractive.Favotite breakfast around the corner at the bar.Mahola, Shoreline StaffJudy

This hotel is situated in a perfect location in Waikiki it's right near the shops and restaurants and it is only a short walking distance to the beach. I would highly recommend this hotel and it's also great value! The staff are really friendly and helpful. The rooms are nice and clean.

We experienced two different rooms. A city view queen size on 2nd floor, which was rather a fulll size bed and a view on a garage, And, a city view king size on 12th floor, with a real city view. The room types should be described more precise to avoid disappointments. However, the staff was very friendly, nice rooms, although not too big. Small, but cosy pool on the roof. Complimentary coffee, ice tea and water in the lobby... Excellent restaurant and café for breakfast next door.

We decided to stay at the Shoreline because of the great reviews it has received on Tripadvisor but we were a little disappointed. Yes it is a good location, clean and comfortable but our room was very small. We had a corner room on the 11th floor and we had nowhere to even put down our bags. There was no bench space what so ever. Also the balcony is very small with only 1 chair. If , like us, you enjoy sitting outside then I would look for a place with a bigger balcony. If we go to Waikiki again we would also stay somewhere that had a better pool. The pool is very tiny and located on the roof surroundd by concrete walls.

Spacious comfortable and clean roomVery helpful and friendly staffIn walking distance of Waikiki Beach, shops, restaurants etc.Very relaxed armosphere, safe environmentFree WiFi in the room good quality

Pluses: yummy water in the lobby, quick and efficient valet service, location close to shopping and the beach, great service, comfortable bed, partial Oceanview and city views from the rooftop pool, and the biggest plus...next-door to the fantastic Heavenly restaurant.Cons: The rooms are very small with no dressers and no refrigerator.Overall, good value for the area and would definitely consider staying here again on a future visit.

The TripAdvisor reviews we read before we traveled were overall very accurate. The rooms are updated and very nice. The hotel is older and nothing to look at from the outside. The wifi signal was strong and allowed us to plan our days out. Shopping is very convenient. Beach access is only a few blocks away.There were many comments about having to pay for valet parking. At least we knew going in and $30 / day is the going rate. The valet is fairly inconvenient and a tight drive up a narrow ramp. More often than not the valet was not at his post and we had to leave our keys at the front desk with the car at the top of the ramp. The valets were always friendly and accommodating.The best find was the Heavenly restaurant next door. It is excellent for every meal.

Loved this boutique hotel. With resorts you pay a daily resort fee on top of your bill but not boutique hotels. Freindly, helpful staff, free wifi, great housekeeping, good shops very close, transport close, loved this place!

We stayed one night in Shoreline. Staff is friendly, room is clean and quite, price is very reasonable on Waikiki and the location could not be better.After a long flight, we had a good sleep. The carpet is thick, the door insulate well and even the flash toilet is quite.Ress and Duke market is cross street. The big shopping centers are around the corner, including Royal Hawaii, Waikiki Trade Center, Macy, DFS... The beach is 5min walking away. Of course Sheraton' location is even better, which is right on beach. But you pay for what you get, plus the stupid resort fee.One last tip, we parked on Seaside Commercial Center. Open parking garage, right beside the hotel. $6 per night and $12 for day time, much cheaper than $30 valet parking.

Good price for the location - room was a little small (we had the queen city view). Friendly staff, Alex was very nice and helpful! We got there at 8.00am and were already able to check in to our room. Lobby was a nice place to chill, with free coffee/tea. Microwave was good but I would prefer if there was a kettle in room as I don't drink tap water, there was a coffee maker but only the first cup was for free, other hotels I've been to had free nespressos every day. Overall it was a great stay, comfy bed and pillows.

I really appreciated the text messages for earlier check-in and their focus on customer care. The hotel isn't fancy, but good enough. The location is great, close to waikiki beach and the downtown area. There's also a bus stop nearby.

We have been to this hotel probably about 3 times but this time our room was very small so a little disappointed. Luckily we are not there too much so it was ok. Rooms were cleaned late in the afternoon usually after 3pm so if we were out during the day it was a little unlucky that you couldn't rest until your room was cleaned because you would be woken. Rooms were clean bed was comfortable and staff were friendly. I think when you want them to book you a shuttle and you have a coupon that is cheap it was suggested that the shuttle company was unreliable so recommended who they used which was a bit more expensive. The water for the tea and pre made coffee was not hot enough in the foyer so I would always check first and if not hot enough the staff are able to get hot water for you out the back from a room which wasn't a problem for them. The hotel is situated in a side street which is quieter but close to everything. To catch a trolley was easy you just walk down the laneway next to the hotel and you are at the DFS where they start from so you would get a seat .

An excellent retreat from the busy Waikiki right in the heart of the action, Shoreline Hotel kept a high standard for the price paid. A special treat is the small but cosy rooftop swimming pool which we had all to ourselves to watch the sunset.The room is not large but enough for a couple and their large suitcases and on top of that, well-equipped with coffee maker, security locker, microwave, fridge and a small balcony.Reception staff did an OK job but our favorite was the valet.The next-door café is badly organized but do offer everything from acai bowles to cocktails.

The only complaint is to get into the hotel with heavy luggages. Once you entered the lobby, you will love the hotel. The front desk personnel were very kind and courteous. She helped me to figure out where to park since we would only stay till 4:00 a.m. to catch the flight back to Boston.

We found the reception personnel to be very friendly and helpful when we asked to change rooms as we were next to the elevator shaft. The location is perfect, right in the centre of Waikiki and the rooms were modern, comfortable and clean. I read a few reviews on here about how they were on their honeymoon and they didn't get their names on the blackboard at the elevator. We were on our honeymoon and we didn't either, but if you need that to make your honeymoon good, you're not off to a great start of your marriage. I'd highly recommend staying at this hotel. Complimentary fresh fruit every day is a nice touch.

Spent 21 nights here in October. Arrived late in the evening and given our room number with the keys and off we toddled. although the room was a non smoking room, the previous encumbent had obviously had been having a few crafty cigarettes. There was also an air blower in use but not of much use as the room still smelled of the stale smoke.Off to reception I popped,spoke to a young chap and asked if it was possible to change rooms. There were only 2 spare left. My husband and I checked the rooms and selected one of them.Absolutely no problems at all to change. After a very long journey to get there it was just the start we needed.The hotel is ideally situated, close for walking almost everywhere and as for the beds, the most comfortable we have ever slept on. The staff are helpful, courteous and always with a smile. If I had to mention a couple of small niggles. There was not a lot of storage for the two of us. But on the positive side, next time we just need to bring less! The timing of the room cleaning was a bit of a lottery, sometimes early, often late and on a couple of occasions, not at all, but that was because we were in the room when the cleaner called and we thought they would come back later on.All in all a lovely hotel.

I always stay at the Shoreline Waikiki when visiting Oahu, at least 3 or 4 times a year. The staff is part of what makes the Shoreline so comfortable...always helpful and friendly! the hotel is convenient - just 2 blocks to the Royal Hawaiian Shopping Center and the beach. Everything from the ABC store to Starbucks just across the street. If you appreciate a place that is much less of a hassle than a big resort, the Shoreline is the place for you!

The Shoreline is one of two properties in Waikiki part of the JDV chain (the other is the Coconut). The hotel is situated across the street from a Ross Dress for Less and next door to the south a rundown apartment building (if you have a room on the oceanside south side), make sure room is above the 6 th floor so you aren't facing the apartment building. Valet parking is $30 or self park across street for $24. If you arrive at night and move the car in the am, you can sometimes find meter parking. The staff, like at their Coconut hotel is what sets the hotel apart from the other inner Waikiki hotels in this price range. I was concerned about possible street noise by my room location and desk called me after I got to my room to confirm I was ok with it. My room was a smallish corner room on the street side with a VERY small balcony but I could see some water to the south down the street and a bit of Diamondhead to the east. Being on the 12th floor street side, I could hear some traffic below but the sliding glass door was heavy and blocked noise pretty well. You should check the room thermostat when you get in as my room seems pretty warm. The rooms and sizes are not all the same so ask (desk has a schematic of dimensions/layout) for what you are looking for. The rooms are older but have a safe, mini fridge with a couple of free waters, microwave and keurig coffee maker. Free WiFi and beach towels and no resort fee. I didn't go up to the roof pool or fitness area. The lobby had free newspaper and coffee in the morning and flavored water and iced tea throughout the day. The restaurant attached to the hotel to the north (Lifestyle) is the place for breakfast and attracts a number of non-guests. For my purposes of not needing a bunch of amenities (like a robe or turn-down services, etc) or wanting a resort or oceanfront, the Shoreline is a good value.

The room was nicely decorated and clean. The position is great. There is a tiny balcony but I was too afraid of height to go on it.Valet parking (30$) was full. Public self parking (24$) is available on the other side of the street. Cheaper but the elevator was under construction, so if you have luggage, you should leave it at the hotel before going to the parking.Breakfast is not available. Overall, I'd say a good value for Waikiki (I paid 130$+taxes per double per night)

My partner and I arrived and booked into Room 1425 which was a smaller room and large bathroom but as it did not have a fridge in this room we asked to be transferred and moved to Room 626 it was a great size room... Very clean and had a fridge and microwave as well. Aircon was really good which is important...also free wifi which worked really well never had a problem with it.... Staff were extremely helpful and friendly... It is pretty much centred in Waikiki walking distance to everything you need which was really helpful... The only negative is there is no view or was no view in either of our rooms which wasn't a big deal for us but maybe for others... I would stay here again

I stayed here for one night due to some flight delays. This is a very clean and simple hotel, right in the heart of Waikiki. The room I stayed in was modest and the size of a studio. There was a small bar fridge and microwave which was very handy. There was nothing fancy about the hotel but it had everything I needed. The best feature of this hotel is the location - it is so close to the main street in Waikiki, very close to all the shops and restaurants. There is also an ABC convenient store on the same street (across the road) which is also very handy.If you want to save some money by staying at a modest but clean hotel with great location, then I highly recommend this hotel. Don't pay to stay at a fancy hotel, which you are likely to only spend time sleeping in.

This was a great place only steps away from designer's shopping in Waikiki. The staff was friendly and accommodating, there was iced tea, lemon water and a big bowl of apples for guests in the lobby and a wonderful busy little restaurant right out the front door. Perfectly located in Waikiki close to everything and a great base especially if you don't have a car, and yet a couple of minutes from the craziness of tourists. I would definitely reserve this great alternative to the high priced properties on the beach and saddened I didn't have more time here.

my partner and I were there 2 months ago. we got engaged and had the holiday of a lifetime. SHORELINE HOTEL staff were by far the most amazing ive encountered in my travels .there is not enough words to say how awesome these guys were: Zhi, P.T, Paul, Ivan, Hatt, Sonny, Alex , they were all absolutely wonderful. a huge shout out to Karin who went out of her way to make sure that or holiday was amazing.. she outdid herself if anybody wants to know how to do customer service go and see these guys.

Close to restaurants and shops. Book King City Room, bigger room than Queen City view that our friends booked. The swimming pool is good but needs umbrellas as it can get very hot with no shade. Front reception staff are very helpful.

For people who are happy to put up with noisy air con - air con noise in all rooms the same I was told - in exchange for being in a great location , 2 short blocks from the water and big hotels . I met other sleepless visitors affected by noisy air con and construction noise outside their hotels in this area. Shoreline's outside noise is from heavy air con all around on old buildings and garbage trucks early a.m. Not a temp construction noise problem. Good spot . 3 star hotel . No thin curtains behind 'drapes' so ugly buildings from one side of building can mean dark rooms with blinds drawn to avoid the eyesores.The staff 's attitude is that if you don't like the noise, the hotel 'is not a good fit for you.' You may ask for a quiet room but they will not acknowledge in advance that they really cannot offer one as they do not have any quiet air con . They advertise Lanais with breeze wafting in ( see 'gohawaii' website). No one does much more than hang their bathers out in such a noisy place as the balconies( Lanais) there!The decor is mostly updated, beds comfortable, furniture fine but lack of sleep quality made me fly home early. Stay at your own risk. If you are a light sleeper, don't stay there.

This was my third time staying here. I love the proximity to the beach, shops and restaurants. The little cafe next door, Heavenly, was not there the last time I stayed here, and it is a little gem. The breakfast is so good I ate there three times during my stay. The staff at the Shoreline is super friendly and helpful. Very accommodating. I will definitely stay here again.

After taking some time to decide on where to stay in this busy tourist mecca with all of the hotels available, we were not disappointed. Great value for money. Clean and comfy and a great location. We will be back and will happily stay at The Shoreline again. Loved the cold drinks on tap in the foyer, a definite bonus in hot and steamy Waikiki.

The staff was very helpful and friendly, our room was very clean and well furnished, location was close to many restaurants and just a short walk to the beach. Hot and cold beverages were always available in the lobby, not usual for all hotels. We would definitely stay here again.

Great location for shopping and beach access. Very busy area. The staff was very helpful, the facility is clean and comfortable. Flavored water and sweet iced tea were by the front desk, good restaurant attached to hotel. There are lots of dining opportunities nearby, from McDonald's to very fine dining. We were very satisfied with the Shoreline Hotel.

Fantastic location with the minimal requirements needed for a enjoyable holiday in Waikiki. Best value for money. Don't expect service and views of the Hilton, but do expect affordable hotel stay in the heart of the city.

Service was great, friendly and efficient. We liked the hot and cold beverages on offer in the foyer. Room and bathroom were clean and a decent size. Location was great - pretty central. The bed was hard and bit a uncomfortable - ok for overnight but I wouldn't stay there for a longer period.

Great place, very very clean. Really good restaurant in the building and great places around. Extremely hospitable staff and location, location, location. If the valet is full they will help you find a really reasonable place nearby.

We stayed here 2 nights during our Hawaii holiday. First we had reservations at another large chainhotel, but then i found this hotel with a better rate and better location just off kalakaua avenue. So just footsteps away from the busy Waikiki beach. The Valet was the first encounter with the staff of this hotel. That encounter could have been better! Not so very friendly!But the frontdesk made that all beter and we were welcomed very friendly. Checkin was quick and efficient. The roomwas not big, but it was nice, bright, fresh and above all clean! The decor is a bit 1930's, but all new furniture and looks very fresh. From the small balcony we had a great view on the mountains. The room was very quiet so we slept well. Internet was really fast and very stabile. So it is possible! It seemed that every room had its own wifi acces point with fast acces. At first it didn't work, but after some action of the frontdesk we managed to login. Defenitely compliments about that!On our first morning around 7 o'clock the fire alarm went off. No problem offcourse, just follow the instructions and go outside. But outside there was no one to pick us up or inform us on what was going on. When we went in we heard that it was a false alarm. Also no problem, but the communication on that could have been better! Because it was allready warm and humid we wanted to shower, because we were sweaty. But there was no water coming out of the tap or shower. So called the frontdesk and apparently they knew there was no water because of a leak. Als no information from the frontdesk. So all in all its a good hotel in a great location for good value, but when something isn't going exactly right the communication could be improved. I would defenitely come back to this hotel.

I spent September 20-26 working in Hawaii. I wanted an affordable place that was close to the beach. Overall it was a good experience and I would stay there again on my own, I think the room is too small for more than one person.Pros- great manager, PT- loved him! Made sure I had very quiet room and always was there to help!Loved water, ice tea, and coffee.Always got help from bell / valet.Great location! Felt safe in area too and not too far from beach.A/c worked well, but had to turn off at night. Very loud!Fridge and microwave great to have for breakfast. Both decent size.Great price for what hotel is!Cons- Restaurant, Heavenly....Expensive and nothing great! Miss Cha- Cha- Cha that was there a few years back.Kurig machine didn't work and I told front desk and it was never fixed.Maids did a so so job cleaning my room. They left ironing board up for 2 days and had to put note to have them put away.Garbage cans too small in room, need to be larger.Overall a good experience for working, clean and reasonably cheap. Wouldn't recommend for a special or romantic trip. Spend a little more and get something closer to beach.I will be back next year to work.Thanks PT for making my stay so great!!

Ok for overnight or business stop but not suitable for beach holiday (10 minute walk). Pool on roof is small and suffers from noise from air conditioning units situated alongside. Small seating area by front desk but no decent lounge in which to relax. Room adequate but not large and double beds were small. We moved to Hilton Hawaiin Village after 2 nights for remainder of our 6 night stay.

Stayed here for 3 nights during our Hawaiian holiday. Although not ocean front it is just a short walk to the beach. It is extremely well located for the shops and restaurants and also for catching the 42 bus for Pearl Harbor (although the receptionist tried to talk us into taking the more expected shuttle but we caught the bus and found it an easy journey).Our room was clean, comfy and I wouldn't say it was particularly small as some reviewers have commented.There is free tea/coffee and iced water 24/7 in the lobby. Wifi is free and they also provide beach towels.A good mid range hotel.

A very good hotel Good locationFriendly staffClean roomsFree WiFiI recommend the hotel location close to lots of tourist placesstaff are happy to help with any problems not that we had anyThe cold refreshments in the lobby was great

Stayed here from 9/22 - 9/27. Upon checking in, the room was found to be very small and hot. You have to leave your room key in a slot in the wall for the air to work. However, after a long period of time, our room did not seem to cool down. Maintenance was called and responded within about 15 mins. Very courteous. He replaced a part and left. Although the fan power was not that great, it eventually did cool down. I would have liked it cooler though. The room was equipped with a Keurig coffee maker and a small refrigerator. They supply you with 2 regular coffees, a tea and decaf coffee. The first 2 are free, then you must pay $2 for any additional Keurig coffee pods. We stopped and got a 10 pack at the ABC store for about $1 a cup. There is also free coffee in the lobby at all times. Free WiFi, and it seemed to work pretty good, no glitches. After a shower on the first night, we experienced a slow drain in the tub and stood in water. Again, maintenance responded quickly and fixed the problem. The bed was comfortable, housekeeping did a wonderful job. The view is not good with the building next door. Ocean view is a thin slice between larger buildings. Although we did go see the pool, we did not utilize it. The bathtub could use a re glazing as they are old and yellowed - a noticeable contrast to the white walls. I am not sure of the nightly rate we had as we booked air and hotel together at a bulk rate. Place is convenient walking distance to everything in Waikiki. Even with the negatives, I would still stay here again. I would just stay in the larger room (which I have stayed in before as it used to be owned by United Airlines). Can't beat the location. Staff is friendly, free coffee in lobby, free wi-fi. Who spends a lot of time in their room in Hawaii anyway?

The hotel is located down a side street just a short walk from Kalakaua Ave where all the action is. There are some steps up into the hotel from the street so it may not suit people with mobility problems. The reception are of the hotel is very nice and the staff were welcoming. In the lobby is both a cold drink station (mint & cucumber was yum) and well as free tea & coffee. Personally I found the free tea & coffee to be very frustrating. Why offer something but not ensure it is available? Whenever I went to get a coffee it was all out. Once I went to get a tea instead but there was no hot water!The rooms are on the small side but functional. Has to be the smallest lanai (balcony) I have ever seen. They have a coffee maker in the room with some free pods (and you have to pay after that). I tried one and the taste out of the machine was disgusting. It wasn't the coffee but the taste of stale water and crud. They should clean the machines.The bathroom was OK but a bit dated. Cleanliness standards were not high with visible marks (perhaps soap) on the pictures in the bathroom. Bathroom products were not refilled/replaced during my 4 night stay.The hotel pool is a tiny thing up on the roof surrounded by ducts. Not a pleasant space.

What a great place .... lovely people from get go who couldn't do enough for you and were very knowledgeable. Free coffee, free cold drinks, free ice, free towels for the beach, free cold water in the room, free Wi Fi excellent healthy adjoining Café. All things that 5 star Hotels more often than not charge for! Room serviced daily- decent size room - even a bath! Excellent location, quiet and 5 minutes walk to the beach. Chose this Hotel due to previous good experience of this chain in San Francisco and came away not disappointed!!

Staff is very helpful, and consistently very accommodating.Rooms are small but actually set up well with all the basics, wifi works well.Location of hotel is just a block off main drag in Waikiki and makes walking to all Lewers restaurants convenient. Restaurant on lobby level is very good, not related to hotel but makes late dining easy.Great value in Waikiki!

Shoreline is a good hotel overall. Nothing fancy but it is clean and very centrally located. Good value! Also there is complimentary coffee and ice tea in the lobby which is such a nice touch. They provided us a crib for our son and also their tours have good prices.

This hotel is very well situated. You will be a the beach in less than fice minutes. Beach towels are colimentary. Valet parking is available (USD 30), across the street is also a public parking where you get a discount as a Shoreline guest. During the night it was a little noisy, but overall ok. Their restaurant/breakfast place (Heavenly) was indeed heavenly. The staff were super nice and helpful. WiFi is complimentary and fast enough.

My wife's extensive research paid off very well for us with the choice of this wonderful hotel. It was just us. Not too fancy but had everything and more that we needed. Nice touches such as free iced tea or hot tea and coffee in the foyer was much appreciated on our return from shopping etc. Great location for pickup for many tour operators etc - opposite Ross (everyone seems to know that place). Very friendly, helpful and efficient staff made our stay very pleasant. The view from the rooftop pool is good. Highly recommended - we'd probably stay there next time.

Centrally located with friendly staff. Alex was helpful in providing information and directions and even change for the bus. Good value for money and cleaning staff do a great job. The fire alarm going off inside the room was somewhat LOUD but better to be safe than sorry.

The closest parking garage was being renovated, so we opted for valet parking at $30/day. Let me tell you, it is worth every penny! They were very quick and friendly. I can not praise the staff at this hotel enough! EVERYONE went out of their way greet us and meet our every need. It is also within walking distance of many restaurants and Waikiki beach. Our only complaints with this hotel was the the view and our A/C. Our view was of a run down building and the room never reached the cooler temperatures we prefer to sleep in. Overall, we loved our stay here and would recommend it to anyone!

Easy to get everywhere by walking or buses, helpful staff. Pool small and a bit hard to find but good view from the rooftop. Restaurant seemed popular though we didn't try it. Water in the foyer a nice touch.

Room are ok - loud A/C if you are very light sleeper. Renovation completed not great based on bathroom tile work. The staff is why I gave this hotel 3-stars - Matthew in particular is very, very helpful. Fire alarm went off on Wednesday at 7ish - I left my room on the upper floor got down to the ground floor and saw people heading back to their rooms. I headed back to mine - no communication by Front desk on "Safe to Return" I got to my room and called down - asked if I was safe as I heard no audio saying it was safe. The person laughed and said "Safe to return - the audio broke so could not overhead communicate this message - if this had been a real fire it would have been very serious. More Fire Safety Training would go along way plus regular checks to make sure audio, etc., works!

One of the ways to tell how truely good something is is when something is wrong. The TV did not work and within a few hours they had compleatly replaced it and reprogrammed the new one. Very good hotel and staff. Great for shopping and the beach. We would recommend the local cafe on the corner for breakfast

Shoreline was a great clean and modern looking hotel. It was minutes walk from the main shopping area, restaurants, and Waikiki beach. Staff were friendly and happy to help. The rooftop pool was clean and great way to end the day before hitting the town.

stayed on level 5. Reluctant to open the curtains (in fact we didn't) faced a block of very run-down and scruffy flats. We booked this trip some time ago and was disappointed that this was the side of the building allocated to us. Would not stay there again.

This hotel pleasantly surprised me, and it was very good for the value. The staff was great, they have refreshments in the lobby, the room was very clean. Hotel is in a great location, few minute walk to beach and by all the best shopping. I would definitely consider staying at another Joie de Vivre Hotel after staying there. Only hangup was the pool on rooftop, very very small and not pretty, but after all you do have the beach right by you. All in all, I would stay again.

This is the second year I have stayed at Shoreline, and I highly recommend it. It is much better value than most decent hotels in Waikiki. It is very central - right across the road from Ross Dress for Less, a block away from the main shopping and food street and only 5mins from the beautiful beach. The only downside is the pool - but given the beach is so close, that isn't a big deal. I love the complimentary cold drinks available in the foyer. I highly recommend Shoreline.

I stayed at the Shoreline for over a month and felt at home on the last day as much as on the first day. The hotel staff (..of note, Ivan, Matthew, Zhi, JD, Alex & Alex) were very attentive, informative, & showed exceptional professionalism, courtesy, & friendliness throughout my stay, which presented a home-like atmosphere…they rocked! The hotel is in a great location allowing for an easy walk to just about anywhere around downtown Waikiki. The Wifi was about average but they upgraded just before I left. My room was clean, comfortable, and updated. I can only speak to a single occupancy room, which was small but enough for me. Overall, I felt at home and the staff understands that details matter. I would definitely recommend!
