I really liked this hotel, it's comfortable, clean, and has a great location: steps from the beach, bars, shopping, and even the bus station. The restaurant next door is amazing. Rooms are clean and comfy. Simple design, looks modern. I would get rid of carpets, but other than that, all good. I liked it so much that I went back.
user_name:
AdrianaER100
New York City, New York

review_body: I have just returned home from my 5 night stay at the Shoreline, and I can happily say that it was an excellent experience on all fronts. The staff are friendly, professional, and knowledgeable and willing to go above and beyond to make your stay an enjoyable one. The rooms are spacious and modern with clean and comfortable facilities, great beds and pristine linens. The location is as perfect as you could ask for - far enough back from the main shopping strip that it's not too loud, but only a walk of a few minutes to the beach and all shops and amenities. The hotel helped to arrange for a hire car, and gave great advice on where to go, eat, and shop. Though there is no room service on in-house restaurant, Heavenly is accessible by a connecting door from the lobby, open long hours, and serves delicious local and organic modern Hawaiian/Western food at reasonable prices. Mahalo to everyone at the Shoreline Hotel Waikiki for making my stay in Oahu a thoroughly enjoyable one.

We had a great time in this hotel.... Friendly staff and the room is clean... I told them about my husbands birthday and they wrote it to the board with the greetings and my husband was so amaze to that and i took a picture of him.... Thank you for the staff for doing that. They are so approachable...this hotel was close to everything and you will enjoy walking..... I recommend this hotel!!!!

Located one block from the beach but easy access to everything. Excellent staff who are always smiling and eager to assist with any info you require. Not a large crowded hotel, but quiet and great for its location.

Staff was very friendly and we got a nice upgrade, but we had to go to two other rooms before they finally got us settled into a third room. They gave us a comp bottle of wine which we appreciated. Room was very nice and clean with some decent ocean view. Unfortunately, the new Sky Club had blaring lame music until 2-3 am and kept us up all night. Not the hotel's fault at all but they said they had received numerous calls. Why they didn't call the police when the city noise ordinance was plainly disregarded is beyond me.

I loved the fact that the hotel was so close to restaurants,shops and market. Staff very helpful in arranging shuttle buses to Factory Outlet shopping mall and airport. Room and bed were comfortable everything was lovely and clean. I was disappointed that the door to the balcony wouldn't open for me to sit outside. Would definitely stay there again and recommend it to my traveling friends.

Whilst very clean the rooms are very small. Only 1 bedside lamp & table, 1 indoor chair & 1 outdoor chair on the tiny balcony which overlooked ugly buildings. Good location close to shops & restaurants. The pool was very small & too noisy to sit for very long. Advertised in house safe but our room didn't have one.

My wife and I just stayed two nights at the Shoreline Waikiki on our way to Australia. We needed to catch up on our sleep and just kick back after a whirlwind time getting ready to get ready for our big trip to Australia.What a pleasant surprise when we walked into the Lobby of this Joie de Vivre Hotel! We were warmly greeted by the staff who tried to help us with our every desire -- from giving us excellent directions to Duke's on the beach (a 4-minute walk), to giving me half of their remaining post-it notes pad on our last day.Our room was clean and well appointed. There is a small roof-top pool (which we looked at but did not use), and spectacular views from the rooftop of the iconic Royal Hawaiian hotel complex.Ross Dress-for-Less is across the street, the International Market (think crafts fair) across the street through a small alley. Every conceivable way to spend money (shopping) is within a 10-minute (maximum) walk.We achieved an excellent rate (per the front desk) by booking EARLY. (We booked 10 months in advance -- a strategy that works with many airlines as well).This is NOT a luxury hotel, but if you want to be treated as good or better than a customer of a luxury establishment, enjoy LOCATION-LOCATION-LOCATION, and feel right-at-home, I highly recommend the Shoreline Hotel Waikiki!! My rating: A solid 4 stars.

From Palalie and his colleagues at the front desk, to the cleanliness and modern style of the room, this last minute choice will remain a permanent choice whenever I visit Waikiki in the future. The location of the hotel is ideal and the room amenities, as well as the lobby amenities and the friendliness and professionalism of the staff, makes this special hotel a one-of-a-kind place to stay.

We enjoyed our stay at the Shoreline and will be recommending it to others. We stayed for four nights and then another two when we returned from visiting Maui and the Big Island. Both rooms were very clean and both times we were on the 14th floor, so we didn't have any problems with street noise. The hotel is in a great location, just a short walk to the beach, restaurants and shopping. Obviously we would have loved to stay at one of the bigger resorts on the beachfront but we were on a budget and got a great rate, and we weren't disappointed at all. All of the reception staff were extremely helpful (in particular PT who recommended amazing places to eat) and we loved the pineapple iced tea in the lobby.

My husband and I stayed here for 1 night when we first arrived on Oahu. It's close to the airport, close to lots of shops and restaurants and close to the beach. The hotel has a nice lobby and friendly staff. There's a small pool on the hotel rooftop. We had room 727 (it was nice and quiet) with a queen sized bed. The bed was pretty good, we had a decent night's sleep. The room was pretty small. It fit a double bed and a desk plus tv. It was showing wear and tear. The bathroom was basic, but good, with a small tub and plenty of room. The Shoreline is a three star hotel at best. It was relatively inexpensive compared to the bigger hotels around. That said, we paid over 150 dollars a night. That's quite a lot, as far as I'm concerned. I travel all over the world, and usually you get a great choice of hotels for that amount of money. Not on Hawaii though, I have come to find out...

The hotel is located in a very good position, in the heart of Waikiki.The staff is very polite and available to help the customers for all kind of necessities.Unfortunately the rooms are too small for the the price you pay.

The hotel is beautiful and in a good location. A family member had a medical emergency while at the hotel. The staff were very professional and responded in a caring and timely manner. A special thanks to Matt at reception and the Manager, Daniel.

Given the cost and location the hotel exceeded expectations. The rooms didn't blow me away and there were some negatives but for the price it really is pretty fantastic.First the negative. Parking is expensive. There is a self parking garage across the street for $24/day or valet for $30/day. The garage is VERY tight and only takes cash. The rooftop pool is quite small and views of the beach/ocean are quite limited by larger buildings all around. The room cleaning wasn't perfect on all days with the trash can not being emptied one day and a damp towel being left on my night table. Wifi connection was free but kept dropping out. Lobby connection was much more solid. Pretty minor stuff actually. The positive. Rooms were spacious and clean. The location while not on the beach is right in the heart of Honolulu, plenty to do at anytime. Waikiki beach is a 5-10 min walk and the hotel will provide beach towels if you need them. There is coffee, pineapple tea, and cucumber water in the lobby. All of the staff was friendly and helpful.A hotel that won't blow you away with luxury and amenities but won't blow up your wallet either without making you feel dirty for being cheap. A quality hotel at a reasonable price in a wonderful location.

There are really only 3 small but annoying drawbacks to this hotel. 1. The aircon is noisy all the time.2. The wifi is patchy and slow3. The pool is not worth considering.Apart from that it's a great location and staff are exceptional. Handy location to Waikiki and all bus routes. $4.50 will get your every where local bus wise as the main bus route is 1 block back. The outlet bus stops across the road! The rooms are tight and the hotel has had a superficial but adequate makeover.There is a very trendy restaurant next door called Heavenly, with organic menu, which we found a little overpriced. Better to get provisions from ABC shop. Lots of kale added and $6 U.S for cappuccino - not worth it - a nice morning walk will get you a diner breakfast for 1/2 the price.Highly recommended.

Best pillows! Yes that's important to some. The hotel staff helped us after a bad experience at another hotel. The hotel is not beach front but is only one block and a short walk to the swimming beach at Waikiki. Swimming pool is very small on the roof top and there are no restaurants as a part of the hotel but I can recommend the restaurant attached to the side (I'll rate this seperately). Why would you choose this hotel, staff can't help enough, nice size rooms, very clean, comfortable beds, good toiletries. Excellent pricing. You can hear the bar close by at times but not enough to keep you awake.

I think about that this hotel has the best location in waikiki.Anywhere you can go easy attractions(shopping, beach etc) in waikiki. Room condition is clean as well as Staff is very kind. I'll be coming back to Oahu that i hope to stay here again.

Me and my husband stayed at this place for 3 nights during our honeymoon. We booked a room with partial ocean view, but you don't really see much of the ocean. So if u want a place with ocean view u should not live here. Overall, the room was ok, clean, and the staff was nice. They got water and coffee in the lobby. Location was really good, a nice restaurant, heavenly just next door. Close to a lot of stores and restaurants as well. About 10 min walk to Waikiki beach. But u don't really get what u are paying for, nothing special and no concierge service or tours. A little too expensive so we moved after 3 nights to ala moana hotel, which I think was more valueable.

If you are looking for a very affordable, very clean, updated hotel in the heart of Waikiki, you found it. Beautiful pool on the roof, as well. You do not really have a view of the beach, but you are two blocks from it. The restaurant associated to it called Heavenly is also very good for breakfast. I don't care for the bustle of Waikiki, but this hotel makes all of that go away once you are inside. Highly recommend it.

Lovely room a bit in smaller side.small verandah. Comfy pillow bed. Block out curtains and really quite despite its central location we were on 13 floor.i would say great place for a short stay due to size of room. Would def go back.plus opposite Ross store and sephora and many more round corner

Loved the hotel. Lovely and clean rooms well presented. Staff very helpful and friendly. Will definitely recommend to family and friends. Close to main street and beach. Cool drinks and tea / coffee in the lobby. I want to go back soon.

We were looking for a hotel that was near the beach, not too expensive, yet clean and nice. Tall order! The Shoreline was perfect in all of it! At first, we were a little concerned with the room we were given (4th floor), literally sharing a wall with the elevator. We thought it would be loud. It wasn't -at all, and I am a light sleeper. We got a great price, about a 2 minute walk to the beach (really!), very clean, and nice in every way. Being a little on the conservationist side, we didn't want our sheets changed every day and we don't mind using a towel more than once. So, we put the "Do Not Disturb" sign out. When we returned, there was a call left for us stating they noticed the sign was out and if we needed towels or anything to simply call the lobby and they would bring it up. Every staff member was wonderful. There was no view, but why would you need one? You're in Hawaii! You should be outside. We highly recommend this hotel.

People say that the rooms are small in Shoreline Hotel which I disagree. The room is well equipped within a reasonable space providing you with everything you need - large enough closet, iron, hair dryer, a safe, refrigerator (even with a small freezer and two bottles of complimentary water), microwave, a desk with a chair, one-person sofa, full-person-sized mirror and a good-sized queen bed for a couple. The room was clean with nice bed sheets that me and my bf just loved. The air-conditioning system was always controllable. Always gave us more than enough towels (you need a lot of towels in Waikiki :-D) aside from the beach towels that you can get from the check in desk. Coffee, tea and water was always ready in the lobby. The room cleaning service was perfect everyday. It's in the center of everything in Waikiki although a slight walking is needed to get to the beach but with the reasonable rate in Waikiki where the living cost is crazy, I would definitely stay here again! (Oh forgot to mention the good wifi although this is only few hotel that doesn't charge resort fee.)

Overall I liked this hotel. The location is great and perfect to get to the beach and to get around Waikiki. The staff are really friendly and gave some good recommendations. I also loved the fruity water always available in the lobby. WiFi is also great in your actual rooms. I did find the rooms to be quite small & the pool on the roof is a bit of a joke. I was looking forward to having a relaxing afternoon for a rest but found the pool to be quite small and not very appealing or relaxing. There was only 2 loungers and no parasols so that meant no shade and if any other residents came up as well, I felt I couldn't read my book or lie down for too long. I understand that the pool probably can't be much bigger but a bit a money spent on the décor and furnishings would probably be appreciated. In the end we went next door to the holiday inn and used their facilities. The heavenly cafe attached to the side of the hotel is ace, does amazing breakfasts and is a must visit!

I was staying for a couple of days in Waikiki and wanted a room that was a bit more affordable than the high prices charged on the main beach strip, but still good quality. The Shoreline proved to be a great choice. Although it's on a side street set back from the main resort area, it's only a very short walk to the Royal Hawaiian Center and the beach, and a bus stop if you want to go further afield (or simply catch the bus to the airport). The hotel itself feels modern and boutique-y, and my room was very clean and comfortable. I even had a small balcony which didn't have much of a view but was nice for sitting out with my morning coffee. Noise levels are minimal and the air con was good meaning I got a great night's sleep. The free WiFi worked very well. Free iced water and pineapple iced tea in the lobby was lovely when coming in after a hot Hawaiian day!All in all the Shoreline is an excellent choice if you're looking for somewhere affordable but comfortable in Waikiki. I'll definitely be looking to stay here again if I make it back to Honolulu (a long trip from the UK but so worth it, what a beautiful place).

First, to be fair, the hotel is nice, the staff is nice, the location is nice. Why the low rating? In Hawaii, the hotel is for sleeping, shower, and change clothes. Then you go out for fun in the sun. Unfortunately, every morning (not some mornings, every morning) loud deliveries 3:30 AM - 4:00 AM and again 5:30 AM - 6:00 AM. Crashing lift gates and a loud beeping forklift delivering who-knows-what to the businesses around it. At first we thought the window was open, but no, it was just loud. I sleep moderately, but my wife sleeps like a rock and we were both awakened. Hard to get back to sleep, then it starts again. Given that sleep is important, and was miserable, I have to give an otherwise good hotel a low rating. I am sorry to do it. Were it not for this, I would stay again. If I have any complaint about the staff, they completely failed to take this complaint seriously.

After a very dull and bland hotel experience our first night in Waikiki, we were very warmly welcomed to the shoreline hotel for our second night.The front desk staff is really exceptional, i have never experienced such an efficient yet friendly and elaborate welcome to a hotel. Throughout our stay the staff was very forthcoming and helpful in arranging stuff or answering questions. The location was perfect. Rooms were very clean and modern, the bathroom was simple but clean and spacious. Rooms were quiet - even though we were right in front of the elevator we never heared a sound from the corridor. Bed was very comfortable and there was a nice view from the room. The rooftop pool, allthough small, was a welcome addition to the hotel. All in all very good value for money!

The hotel is very nice, well designed. When you come in you find a nice lobby with a lounge, coffee and water. The rooms are also quite spacious and offers you all the basic amenities. The location is very good. You just speak out of the hotel and have the shopping area, as well as many bars and restaurants around you. The only downside was that after checking out there is no possibility of freshening up in the hotel. There is no accessible shower, which I found very unusual for a 4 Star Hotel that has a pool and is basically on the beach.

My wife and I have stayed here twice and our stay each time was wonderful. The staff are welcoming and warm and the peach ice tea in the lobby is very refreshing after a long day at the beach. The location is great as it is right in the middle of Waikiki, just a short walk to the beach, shops and restaurants that Waikiki have to offer. If you are looking for a great deal I would recommend you stay at The Shoreline.

Had a lovely stay at the Shoreline, the room was nice and spacious, super comfy bed. The free refreshments in the lobby was a nice touch (loved the ice tea). The roof top pool was small but our group really enjoyed spending our afternoons up there, would be nice if it stayed open a little longer, closed at 7. Heavenly cafe in the lobby had some of the yummiest organic beer and sandwiches Ive ever had in Waikiki. Location couldn't be better, only a few minutes walk to everything worth seeing.

This was our first hotel out of 5 that we stayed in on honeymoon and it was fantastic! Check in was seamless, the room was a decent size and very clean. The location was great - a few minutes from the main sea front, plenty of shops and restaurants nearby and on a bus route! The staff were brilliant - my suitcase had been damaged by the airline so they pointed me in the right direction to buy another one for a good price, great information given about the bus routes and a very friendly service on check out! I would happily stay here again and can't recommend it highly enough! Thanks very much!!! Oh and as a side note? Check out dukes for dinner - brilliant x

On a recent visit to Hawaii I searched TripAdvisor for a reasonable hotel and came up with Shoreline Hotel Waikiki. Although filling many of my criteria it did fall down in one area. The Good. The front desk staff were excellent. Always friendly and helpful. Location was very good close to everything really (just across street from where the International Markets were and a block and a half from the beach. You want the beach you pay for it, this was more than close enough. Most things you want to be near are just walking distance away. 24/24 Coffee and choice of two cold beverages in the foyer.The property is neat and clean.The Bad. The room size was very small. The bathroom was fine but the main room was just too small. Admittedly we were at the end of a 4 week vacation and had two large bags but there was no room to open them. We ended up with one against a wall and the other right in the middle of the room, which meant you had to navigate around it. The 'City View' was the building across the street, but I guess you don't come to Honolulu to look out you hotel window, but it is nice to see some pleasant sight. Strangely the wardrobe storage was adequate. The WiFi was a little ordinary and I could not log onto my room and had to go through a room downstairs.In summary if your looking for a good reasonably priced hotel in a good location this one fits the bill, just be warned don't expect to have too much room to spare.If you stay here make sure you visit 'Ross', which is right across the road.

We have had our visitors stay here, they were quite impressed and the location is well positioned to the beach, restaurants and shopping. Everything can be in walking distance when staying in Waikiki. Though we haven't stayed, would recommend, as we were living in Honolulu. Great value.

I had a business trip in the middle of tourist season and I needed to stay near Waikiki. Traveling for the government meant I had to stay in a facility that accepted the government rate. Most properties were twice what I was able to pay. This one came up and I booked it. WOW! was I surprised. In the middle of Waikiki, Clean comfortable room. Super friendly staff. I will book again if I am in town and I will highly recommend to my friends as a place to stay for business or pleasure.

ROOM: Room wasn't too spacious but had all the amenities you could need. Comfy bed and decent bathroom.We heard from the other guests that the pool on the top floor wasn't great, but who needs the hotel pool when the beach is just a few mins walk away?LOCATION:No complaints at all. Right around the corner from the main shopping strip and a short walk away from Waikiki Beach. SERVICE:Mona at the front desk went above and beyond for us during our stay at the Shoreline. She helped with restaurant recommendations & sights to check out.We had family and friends who came during our stay and she was amazingly helpful when assisting with their check-ins as well. She was helpful in every way and really made our stay at the Shoreline a fantastic one.We stayed at a 5 star hotel for our honeymoon a month later and the lack of customer service made us wish we were back at the Shoreline.

We found Shoreline on a short notice planning and wasn't sure of what to expect upon arrival. Our flight arrived earlier than scheduled so we couldn't check in, but Zhi offered to hold our luggages while we get our rental car. When we returned, he upgraded our room from a Queen to a King size bed which we thought was excellent customer service. Zhi went the Extra Mile and highly commend him for his expertise, caring for his guests. Location-5minutes to Waikiki Beach, surrounded by restaurants and stores, lots of activities at night on Kalakaua.We would stay here again if we return to Honolulu.Room-room size was quite small, but having a comfy bed offsets that, room is clean. Only complain is the room service, they clean real late so when we return from an outing all day, the bed is not made and no clean towels.Beverages-always a refreshing treat to have the ice tea, lemon/cucumber water always in the lobby.

Great wee hotel. Room on the 12th floor great. Spacious and well equipped - and very clean.Reception staff very helpful and efficient.Tea/ coffee/ flavoured water available in reception constantly. Beach towels available daily at no charge. Restaurant and bar area lovely. Location great for beach. Small pool on top floor, nice to end the afternoon with a dip!Only negatives : our room was beside the lifts which could be a bit noisy and the balcony with the partial view didn't have a great view when you looked down and the smell of food cooking was overpowering. However you don't come to Waikikii to sit on your balcony!Would definitely recommend.
user_name:
Margaret K
County Antrim, United Kingdom

review_body: My husband and I stayed at the Shoreline Hotel for one night en route to Maui. The hotel was clean, quiet, comfortable, and a quick 5 minute walk to the beach, which was perfect. There are tons of high end stores nearby, as well as eateries of all kinds. My only complaint, and why I didn't give it 5 stars is that the front desk clerk told us to be in the lobby by 8:45 to catch an airport shuttle, but then he never signed us up for it, so we ended up having to get a cab. We didn't miss our flight, but it was certainly nervewracking!

Great location, very clean hotel, perfect service. Would recommend this place 100%. The room was small but it's good for two people only. Complimentary coffee, tea and refreshing drinks for guests. Can't wait to go back again :)

WE had booked two King Rooms with Partial Ocean View, with special requests for a foldup bed for an adult in Room1 and for a child in Room2.The booking was confirmed in May by Booking.Com.Upon arrival we were advised that the Hotel does not have extra beds and further that there was only one 'partial ocean room' available. The other room with a City view contained two small double beds in which three adults were to sleep.The hotel guide book in the room, page 3, clearly stated portable beds are available on request.We brought this to the attention of the reception staff and asked for alternative rooms. The manager, Jerome, had left, but reception suggested we find an alternative hotel! The other option offered was a single room at $US299 plus taxes!!!. He said he would email the manager to see if a rate could be negotiated.We were never communicated by Jerome during the two nights we stayed with three people in a room made for two.We do not recommend this hotel because of False advertising;complete lack of concern by the manager; and the hotel accepting the Booking.Com booking knowing that three beds would not be available.A complete disaster.

Clean, crisp, modern, and fresh are all words to describe this hotel. We had excellent service by housekeeping, car valet, and front desk. This property is so close to the beach and right in the middle of Waikiki. We spent much of our time on other parts of the island, but it was so nice to come home in the evenings to a fresh, clean room. It is a great value for your stay in Hawaii. I am very picky about cleanliness and this hotel did not disappoint. This is a great hotel for you if you need a home base for exploring Oahu.

Great location. No resort fee. Free and excellent Wi FI in room.Free and excellent refreshments in lobby (tea and pineapple wáter was amazing !!)Great safe, microwave and TV in room.Closet very, very, very, very, very small.Great option for solo travelers and couples.

What a great recommendation from our travel agent. Just one block from the beach. Stayed there twice now, once in a huge room and once in a cramped room. Nice pool on the top floor. Good views of the city and hills, limited ocean views. Really friendly staff, well located just two minutes from the beach. Nice little personal touches in reception. Opposite Ross department store and right near great little restaurant, Seaside Bar and Grill.

We loved our stay at the Shoreline! Definitely a gorgeous boutique hotel with everything you need within walking distance. A bit on the pricier side for the room size, but it was very clean and modern. The lobby always had ice cold water and pineapple iced tea. The restaurant below had an amazing breakfast/ brunch connected to it - Heavenly.. check it out! But watch out... the lines can get crazy (it's a small place).My ONE negative criticism? The WiFi was unfortunately VERY slow... but then again, maybe that was a good thing to be disconnected on vacation.

Stayed here for 3 nights, we were hardly at the hotel however I found their staff unhelpful and not very friendly. I was trying to use their computers and was having trouble with it, nobody came and looked at the computer to assist me until I asked again for assistance. In the end I ended up using a different computer and my husband was more helpful. Their housekeeping is later in the day, so we would come back to the room and it had not been replaced with new towels or sheets. However for the price you pay, the location is fantastic. Close to everything in Waikiki. The views are very disappointing, I would guess that would be the same for every room in the hotel. They were constructing a car park next door and the noise was keeping us awake during the night. I wouldn't stay here again however good for those wanting to be centrally located and those on a budget.

A nice room and hotel a block or two back from the beach. Staff were friendly and helpful. Only down side was the incredibly noisy air conditioning and the bathroom floor. Why anyone would grout tiles so badly that all the dirt and marks stay in the crevaces I don't know, but it doesn't look pretty. All up the hotel was okay for the price.

I have just had an enjoyable 6 nights at the Shoreline Hotel. Great location, just off the main thoroughfares of Waikiki. Nicely fitted room with everything you need for a few nights. As pointed out in the room you are in the middle of a busy city so the noises nearby can be expected in advance. I would stay here again

I really enjoy boutique hotels, but I didn't quite enjoy my stay here. It was definitely decent overall -- the bed was comfortable and the room size was fine for two people. However, it certainly did not meet my expectations after my research on TripAdvisor and other sites, including the hotel's. The building itself seemed to be very old and it showed from the moment we walked into the lobby to our room and bathroom.The building/lobby -- Hawaii is very warm in the summer and I was expecting to walk into the hotel and immediately feel pretty good. I get it, a lot of hotels in tropical places have an open-air concept, but the lobby was stifling and the valet parking area/entry into the lobby from the parking side smelled terrible for the 3 days we stayed. The folks at the lobby were decently kind, but no one went above and beyond.. the lady behind the front desk hardly broke a smile -ever-, and due to the heat, the entire lobby area seemed rundown. I didn't try the hotel restaurant because it was so hot and it was open air. I didn't enjoy sweating while checking in and getting settled. The room -- In general, the room is fine. The bed was very comfortable, so that was wonderful. We slept very well both nights. However, the room was very plain, raggedy... not at all like the photos. The bathroom slept strongly like chlorine or some cleaning chemical, and it was just old. In order to save energy, the rooms do not have AC on when in between guests, so we walked into a warm, stifling room. Once we turned on the AC, however, it was fine and pleasant. We had a regular room, no special view, just other buildings' rooftops and parking areas.The pool -- We visited the pool one day and were a little shocked. It was a tiny pool with one chair... that was it. There was nothing done to make the area pleasant, nowhere to put your belongings... The small pool is enclosed in a small 'rooftop' that has high walls around the pool so you see only the walls if you choose to go inside the pool. We left after getting over the shock.Parking -- Valet parking is available, which we used, and the valet staff were kind and efficient, prompt.Wifi -- Good!I won't stay here again unless there was no other option. Overall, it is fine, but might as well splurge on nicer hotels if you come all the way to Hawaii. We needed a quick stay and we know the local area well, so we didn't need a nicer hotel, but I would be a little irritated if I had come all the way there for a dream Hawaii vacation to stay in an old place like this.

A nice hotel with modern rooms... maybe a bit small.Swimming pool on the roof is a bit noisy due to AC generators.The staff is kind, helpful and trying to accommodate requests.They don't have restaurant even for breakfast but there is one just next to the hotel and plenty of them around.Only drawback was the housekeeping... The lady didn't came before 3 PM. Just a tip: become a member of the "Joie de vivre" and you will get a present!

Good hotel. Small but adequate rooms. Views not super great with a lot of city like stuff around. Location is great! Everything within walking distance. Zhi at the front desk was good. Tried to gelp us keep same toom for 2 reservations but wasnt able to. Upgraded us to help keep us happy. He did his job! Would definitely come back if i ever get the chance.

Every one in a while, a hotel will exceed your expectations--meaning deliver more than you expect for its price and category. That's the way I feel about the Shoreline. Waikiki is expensive--hotel prices can rival New York--so keep that in mind; I am comparing the Shoreline's price points to others in that range in Waikiki. Here's what I loved--rooms and the airy lobby have extra style for that boutique feeling; there is a small fridge and microwave in the room, and real mugs and glasses--none of that paper stuff that just feels cheap. The location is excellent--and you will save money by not being on the beach. The beach however is one block away, and you are right off a main street that has tons of restaurants and shopping. The hotel is also right next to a very decent restaurant connected to it for breakfasts and the like. My hotel room was higher up, so noise was not a problem at all--the view was not great, but on some sides of the hotel you will be looking at Diamond Head in the distance. Staff was friendly and available. Keep in mind this is not a resort--it's a hotel that gives you want you want (free decent wifi, free coffee and tea in the lobby, valet service, and perhaps removes the things you don't like an in-hotel spa or gym). One piece of advice, I was there alone, so the room sizes which can be on the small side, were very adequate. If you are a couple or family, pay the extra money for a larger sized room.

Lovely hotel, friendly staff, very keen to help and accommodate requests. We were in a double room and although they did not have twin rooms first night they moved us no problem when rooms available on next night. Very clean, good quality fittings etc. , free drinks available in lobby which is nice touch. Nice location , easy walk to beach through shopping/mall area and Sheraton. Liked drinks at Rumfire which was recommended by reception. No parking was available at hotel so had to use multi storey opposite which wasn't great and not cheap but think that is par for the course in Waikiki - some lifts at car park were out of use with construction works so check which floor is best to use before you go in. No hotel dining or eating facilities but there is a bar/restaurant attached called 'Heavenly,' however this did not live up to is name for us. Staff out front who were seating customers were rude and unwelcoming, slow service and very lukewarm breakfast which we sent back and had to wait over twenty minutes to be replaced and it was still not hot - real shame because the menu looked good and quality of food seemed high. After that the staff didn't even look at us and did not acknowledge us as we said goodbye.Streets outside hotel have a big mix of people especially at night so just be aware if you are wandering. Market in alley opposite hotel was quite high pressure sales with prices dropping 70% odd as they kept trying to get a sale - beware!!Chinese style diner on corner to left as you leave hotel was very good value for breakfast - food good - not smartest place but worked well for us.Also recommend Hans Hedemann Surf school - they picked up from hotel and we had a fantastic time surfing on Waikiki beach - and it was well away from the madness of the central beach - do it - its great !!

So much about Shoreline is great. Location, furnishings, staff, reasonable value for money. I would recommend it generally BUT I did have an unfortunate experience with the way my toilet backing up was handled. It took 2 hours to fix and the bathroom wasn't cleaned properly after, so it took me to chase up with reception until it was eventually attended to. It wasn't the end of world but a better response was expected,especially when it comes to sewage and hygiene. The room needed a good dust as well. This wouldn't stop me staying here again or wouldn't mean I would hesitate recommending Shoreline or the chain more generally as it was just an unfortunate incident.

We recently stayed here and we found it to be an excellent hotel in a great location, the room we had was very nice with a very comfortable bed, we had free wifi, there was complimentary iced tea, coffee and papers in the lobby, there is also a very nice little organic cafe/restaurant down stairs, all the staff were very helpful, friendly and polite, we would definitely stay here again.

This was our first trip to Hawaii. We didn't arrive until after 1am, and reception were waiting for us, and check in was smooth. Our room was clean and very comfortable, we loved how comfortable the bed was. Our room was on the 3rd floor and we didn't have any issues with hearing the garbage trucks as some others have mentioned. This hotel is within walking distance to the beach, shopping and restaurants. Staff are always helpful and gave us some great eating tips. This is not a resort, and doesn't advertise that it is, so don't stay here if that's what your expecting. However if you want a clean, happy, reasonably priced place to stay in a good location this is it. Thank you to all the staff, we will be staying with you on our next trip.Deb

My sister and I stayed at the Shoreline Hotel for 6 days and it was in a really great location near shops that we constantly visited like H&M, Footlocker, Forever 21, Ross etc and LOTS of good food places like The Cheesecake Factory, Cheese Burger, Rock Island Cafe, Hardrock Cafe and the Heavenly Island Lifestyle Cafe attached to the hotel downstairs. The staff were really kind and helped us with the millions of questions we had! Awesome time and would definitely stay again! Also super close walk to the beach too!

Location is perfect, down the road from the Royal Hawaiian, Waikiki Beach and plenty of shops. It also has the best cafe for breakfast 'Heavenly' located within the building. Most tour buses stop outside across the road at Ross Dress For Less which is ideal when touring. Unfortunately the room is not sound proof so rubbish trucks and buses reversing from 5am in the morning would wake us up each day. We had no wi-fi in our room for 3 nights, we mentioned this on day one but was told it was probably our phones so we wasted a lot of time trying to work out what was wrong with our phones. We could sometimes pick up other rooms wi-fi, in the end it was the modem in the room that wasn't working. The staff at reception didn't always write things down when we mentioned the problems we had so they usually forgot to pass these on to Maintenance, the wi-fi took longer than it should to be fixed. We also mentioned the bathroom door was squeaky and needed an oil but this was never fixed. Air conditioning is an on-going problem I find with most hotels but the location of ours was 30cm above the bed (against the wall) so was a bit noisy. Ideally sound proofing the room and moving the air conditioner away from the bed would make my rating 5 stars but I would stay here again.

We had a good time on this place. Good location , close to the main area of Oahu. Very close to Waikiki beache and plenty of restaurants and bars around it. The only thing is that for the same price or a little money more we could have a much better choice. The hotel should offer a little breakfast to compensate it.
user_name:
Renato Santos C
Rio de Janeiro, RJ

review_body: Shoreline was not only a great location in Waikiki, but the staff were fantastic. Stella at reception was amazing and gave great restaurant advice which was spot on. Rooms as well as the entire hotel was clean with nice decore Defibitely stay again.

Hotel staff were very helpful and responded quickly when our luggage was misplaced and our room's WIFI went down. The location of the hotel is great and is so close to everything you possibly need in Waikiki. The only downside was that the room was quite small. We only stayed one night (our last before we flew home) so it wasn't too much of an issue, but there is no way my husband, our toddler and I could have survived in that room for more than two nights! So cramped!

I stayed 2 nights at the Shoreline in June and enjoyed my stay. The room was clean and the staff were great. Zhi was very helpful and always smiling! Spoke to Mona whose name I knew before checking-in from prior comments on TripAdvisor. She's lovely! The hotel is conveniently located to the main shopping strip and a short walk to the beach. The shuttle pickup point to Waikele is a 2 minute walk. Ross -across the street - is great for bargains. Just wish a ramp from the street could be built to help with lugging bags up to the lobby. Apart from that, it's 2 thumbs up for a good-value short-stay hotel. Looking forward to my next stay in a week, on my way back home.

Centrally located, clean well maintained rooms. Great value for money, Waikiki beach only 2 mins walk away. Comfortable beds, with nice sheets and good towels. Hotel supplies beach towels free to use and also wifi access. Coffee machine in the room but you have to buy the pods from the reception for $2 per pod.

For our honeymoon my partner and I had already visited San Francisco and Maui so weren't looking for anything overly exciting in Waikiki as we'd be out most of the day. Shoreline was recommended to us for it's honeymoon touches. We'd seen online that it was a welcoming hotel for couple. Everything was fine on arrival and staff were friendly. The hotel reception takes a $100 deposit from you, even though there is no restaurant, breakfast, bar or mini bar. The room was clean but the small wardrobe was poorly fitted as the doors were too big for the space (resulting in a sore hand trying to close it). The lightswitch in the bathroom didn't switch off and the Air Conditioning was extremely noisey. I didn't see the point in the balcony either. We decided after visiting Pearl Harbour we'd go to the roof for the swimming pool, now this isn't a small hotel but apparently 2 loungers should accommodate over 100 people. Needless to say we didn't use the swimming pool. We had told the reception staff it's our honeymoon (not to get freebies but the hotel is known for putting small gifts in the room and congratulating you on the daily updated blackboard downstairs). Every morning we came down a new honeymoon couple had their names highlighted and celebrated. Not entirely sure what we did to not get the same treatment but id say other than great location Shoreline is not worth it.

Pros:Location is great. Beach, shops, restaurants, and public transport is need one - everything is in short walking distance. 'Heavenly' cafe which is located next door provides very good breakfast for reasonable price. And hotel gives you 10% discount for 'Heavenly' on demand. Try it - you will like this place. It's nicely organized, cute and staff is friendly. Reception staff is helpful and friendly. Very nice people. You can leave your luggage in the hotel before checking and after check out (free of charge). And you can use all hotel facilities after check out while you're waiting for your flight. They have nice and cozy lobby where you can wait for your room to be ready before you check in (or after you check out). Ice tea and coffee are provided for free.Room service is good. They do their job.Cons:Pool is small and is located on really hot roof where there is no shade.View is not suberb as well. If you want to see the ocean, go to the roof. I can compare with another hotel located next to the beach - for the same room price view was much-much better. There is some strange smell in the room when you turn on conditioner - looks like filter should be cleaned.

Shoreline is a great place to stay if you want to be near the heart of Waikiki as it is just a block off Kalakaua Ave and a couple blocks to the sand. Very relaxed vibe. Attentive service. Could not get enough of the complimentary pineapple iced tea.It is an older property with smallish rooms and is well kept. The view from the roof next to the pool is great. I would have spent more time by the pool if there was a bit more shade.

My husband and I spent 10 amazing nights at the Shoreline and are so glad we chose this hotel.The staff were so friendly and helpful with all queries we had. It was our first time to Hawaii and the location was perfect. Close to the beach, shops, transport and restaurants. The roof top pool was a god send for the days you wanted a quick dip to cool off after a hard days shopping and the Ross Store (one of my fave shopping spots) is literally straight across the road. The only downside we found was that there wasn't a little table and chairs for the times you wanted to eat in and relax. Other then that we are returning in May for a wedding with our children in tow and guess where we Wil be staying? Yip - you guessed it. Shoreline Hotel :)

Our family stayed at the trendy Shoreline in June. The hotel was a great location, just down from the main road Kalakua Avenue (shopping heaven) and minutes from the beach. Short walk to Lewers Street with restaurants galore (try Yard House), Sushi shop down the road (small place but great sushi!), ABC and Ross discount store just across the road. The rooms were clean, spacious and had everything we needed! Free water in fridge, coffee machine, Cable TV. Small balcony. Shower head in bathroom was the best I've come across. Beach towels available at reception. Wifi worked ok, did drop out quite a bit but did it's job. The Pineapple Iced Tea and Cucumber Mint water in the lobby was a welcome treat daily after exploring the Island. The cafe next door is the BOMB! I actually can't explain how good it was to eat some wholesome HEALTHY food at HEAVENLY cafe - try the Acai Bowls, Pittaya Bowls, Loco Moco, Eggs Benedict and Pho soup - really amazing. The smoothies were great too. (This cafe actually saved me from going insane with all the unhealthy American food on offer around the place!!) I would definitely recommend the Shoreline to anyone, and I would definitely stay again. Value for money. I actually don't have anything negative to say about this place!

Pre-flight accommodation before returning home. Central location with walking distance to Waikiki beach and main shopping centres.Small hotel but comes with all the basic amenities and facilities with some nice touches e.g. cold drinks, coffee in the foyer, friendly staff. Small hotel means room is right next to lift - so quick in and out. on the other hand, noises from the outside can be heard.Downside of hotel is that while it is refurbished, it's not well done, could see wallpaper peeling and not cut to the right size, mould in our bathroom ceiling. Also, if you have a lot of luggage, be prepared to hike 12 steps up before you get to the entrance of hotel as there is no ramp or lift.

We recently stayed 10 nights at the shoreline in a city view room. It was very comfortable the rooms are lovely modern clean and a very decent size for the two of us. The rooftop pool is fantastic if you have been out for the day and don't want to venture to the beach. We are so glad we decided to stay there. The location is perfect close to all the shops beach restaurants bars public transport. We honestly couldn't have been in a better location. If I had to be fussy and pick something the only thing I would say is there wasn't a little chairs and table on our balcony but maybe in the others rooms there might be. Just would have been night to sit out in the mornings.

We checked in and were given double room on 14th floor. Excellent view but no house safe and not very large. The staff were very helpful when we asked about no safe and changed us to a larger room (no view- but we were not in the room all day) with more space and a small safe. The room had double bed a small balcony (nice) WiFi, microwave and en-suite bathroom plus coffee tea making facilities. The room was cleaned daily. The location was very central and across the road was a very popular discount dept store. The staff were extremely helpful, knowledgeable with restaurants, places to go and tried to assist wherever possible. They were happy to assist help make bookings. The reception area also had free decaf and regular coffee and tea throughout the day and evening and provided beach towels for guests.

We were a party of 3 and had 2 rooms which we were happy with. Not a nice view from our deck but hey, we were only there to sleep. Who goes on holiday to stay in their room anyway?? Hotel staff were excellent and so was the location. Would definitely return!
user_name:
Jamie B
Auckland Central, New Zealand

review_body: We enjoyed 3 nights as part of our vacation. Shoreline was we'll situated - close to the beach, restaurants and shopping. Staff were friendly and very helpful with all enquiries and assisted with bookings for car rental and shuttles the hotel was comfortable with tidy decor in rooms. WiFi was a little bit intermittent but acceptable. We would stay again and would recommend as a good value option in a good location.

Stayed here in a suite for 5 nights on the top floor. Our room was very clean and nicely appointed and bright. Our housekeeper did a thorough job everyday. Stella at the Front Desk and the rest of her coworkers were wonderful. Greeted us by name and very friendly. Also the entire staff we encountered were very knowledgeable with places to go, restaurants and things to see. The attached restaurant, Heavenly, was also excellent. Unique healthy organic menu items and quick friendly service. We ate there three times we loved it so much. Alex our server was great and we appreciated the discount coupon the front desk gave us to use in the restaurantThe location, friendly staff, and value is great at the Shoreline. Mahalo!!
user_name:
JoeyD1966
New York City, New York

review_body: I stayed in Shoreline with my friend for 5 nights in total. We required a quite room with double beds but none of these were satisfied. The room was on level 4 and very noisy. We guess it must be just above the restaurant inside the hotel building so we smell a lot of cooking in our room. So we had to close our windows to block the smell and noises. However, the air-conditioner went extremely cold if we did so. Anyway, we struggled to get a balance between close/open window. The bed was king-size and they kindly provided us two blankets. The overall service was good and I would recommend those with a tight budget to stay there.

It's only a couple of blocks from the beach, sandwiched between the two main Waikiki streets. It's clean, efficient, and has astonishingly good front-desk service. Rooms are modern and average sized, with balconies. The pool on the top floor is a little small, but does the job. Free coffee and (when we were there) iced tea or cucumber water at reception too - there is no other catering but it doesn't pretend there is. Free wifi and good free boarding pass printing too. Just a minute's walk to bars, restaurants, buses to the rest of the island. I would return.

Shoreline Hotel Waikiki was really nice. The staff was very nice and friendly. The room was perfect for me and my guest. We came from a wedding and I forgot to pack make-up wipes, I went into the restroom and there was make-up wipes there. It was pretty awesome and a lifesaver. Everything was in walking distances from the hotel. Shoreline Hotel Waikiki is literally in the heart of Waikiki. I would recommend the Shoreline Waikiki to anyone who needs a getaway, this hotel is the place to go. Definitely going back.

A very clean, centrally located hotel - one block from the beach and close to world class restaurants and shopping. Special thanks to Mona, Stella, Zhi, Karen, Taro - all at the front desk - professional, super nice & friendly. Also special thanks to Alex, Ivan, Sonny, Paul and Melvin - for helping me out with my car every day and lending an ear every day. Excellent restaurant by the lobby called Heavenly, organic menu - every healthy and tasty. Good value hotel for sure.

Plenty has been written about the location, so I'll just confirm, it's centrally located in Waikiki (close to shopping and restaurants) but not to the beach. Our flight arrived very late evening and we had booked a King with a City View. We were checked into a very dark room on the 2nd floor with no balcony. Given that we were staying 4 days here, we really wanted to change rooms and called the front desk but were told there was no other room available, although we asked if we could move in the morning, we were given a very non-committal answer. Given we had just had a very long flight, we just decided to accept our fate but were not happy. The next morning, we were up early and spoke to Mona at the front desk. She was AMAZING! Unlike the service we received the night prior, she immediately started looking for an alternate room for us. She asked us regarding our plans for the day, and did her utmost to offer us an alternate room before we began our day's activities. She provided us with a few options and we were moved about 1 hour after speaking with her (the previous guests had just checked out and Housekeeping was starting on the room). We were moved to a Partial Ocean View (upgrade) with a Queen bed (small downgrade). Despite the new room only having a queen size bed, it was on a much higher floor (ie brighter!) with a tiny balcony. Location IS great but had it not been for Mona's warm hospitality and service, and the move to the new room, I can say that I would NOT have recommended this hotel. The room we stayed in made all the difference! FYI: the room itself comes with 2 small water bottles (upon initial check-in only). Amenities in the room include a small fridge and microwave. Free wifi. Lobby always has chilled water and pineapple iced tea, coffee / hot water, apples (usually), newspapers and a business centre. The hotel can arrange for an airport shuttle (cost ~$13 per person) on a smaller shuttle = generally fewer stops. The pool is tiny and although it is on the rooftop - only has 4 sun loungers so these were often taken. My recommendation to management would be to also include some chairs (I do recognize it is a small surface area so there is not a lot of terrace room). Traveller tip: make sure you upgrade your room to one that is on a higher floor (so you don't need to see the nasty building next door) and get more of that Hawaiian sunshine you've come for!

I stayed here for 3 nights and I couldn't fault it. I arrived early and my room wasn't ready so I asked to be pointed in the direction of a good bar whilst I waited and it was a good recommend. The location was perfect-being on my own and with no car I needed to be near to everything. The staff were lovely-I think I remember Karin being the one who helped me first and then I think it was Mona who checked me in but they were all really nice and friendly. My room had a view of the building I think has been mentioned on here as an eyesore but I was fascinated by it. I invented little stories about what the rooms were used for (well I am holidaying alone-got to do something to keep me amused!). There is a lift just to the left of the entrance and if you press the button someone will come out and help you with your bags. And the Heavenly restaurant which is attached but not part of was a tad expensive but well worth it-I ate there 3 times during my stay. The pool on the roof is very small but there was only ever max of about 3 people up there when I went. Once it was just me! All in all a good clean friendly hotel.

I stayed 4 nights at the Shoreline Hotel Waikiki, it was a smaller property than others in Waikiki but that's what made it perfect. As a solo traveler the room had everything i needed, though the room may have been small for a couple. Hotel was very clean, staff were extremely helpful and the location was perfect, with everything on your doorstep.

Stayed 4th - 9 th June Good stay at shoreline with nice clean modern room ,a little on the smallish size ,but location is the bonus with this hotel.decent bathroom ,aircon on the tad noisey on or off !! Room has a small balcony to step out onto balcony to view the town.This hotel is not a huge hotel,very compact boutique style ,it's did the job ,but only let down was the size of the pool to relax by instead of going to the beach on most days !! Beach less than 10 mins walk to beach ,via Sheraton hotel .....free towels for the beach .Staff were nice an welcoming an assist with all your needs ! Free wifi worked well though out the hotel .... free tea/ coffee an ice tea stand available in foyer on a daily basis ....Location is the bonus of shoreline ,2 mins walk to main st dining options available very near by.designer shopping at your leisure ...There's a Ross store an ABC store ,right across the road from hotel .....$10 carparking over the road for a 10 hour Limits or valet parking is $30 with the hotel ....There's a dining option attached to this hotel ,but not part of the hotel ,we didn't dine there ,but was always full.....Housekeeping of our room was never completed until, 3.30pm ,at times we would be back at hotel by lunchtime an room not clean yet ,apprently they clean the rooms first ,that new guests are arriving on the day ! So maybe hire more staff as it was an in connivence to leave the room so that can clean in late afternoon ...Rooftop pool was a sad sight to see,with 2 deck chairs only ! but there's no room for a big pool .... A must visit is the top of wakiki ,right next door to H & M at end of the street ,dine there or just go for the view an drinks at happy hour ...view is great !! Enterprise car hire is across the road ,down the street 7 mins walk ,we hire a car there for the day an just return it back at night time to save on parking fees at hotel ...they give you a voucher for $28 flat rate back to airport ,for not taking the car to airport ....We walk to al Mona centre ,30 min walk or get the trolley for $2.50 each way !! Taxi to this hotel was $38.50 for two person plus tip ! Tour desk ,right across the road an money changer is at DFS ,5 mins walk away for all you're currency enquiry ....Overall a good stay at shoreline .....Thanks Elisa. Australia

I stayed 6 night, clean, value for money. very helpful staff, my room was ready early , as I was 3 hour before check in they were great , cold and hot drinks in lobby , plus heavenly cafe next door. 100 mt main street . Loved it there. Will stay there again .

We had a fantastic stay at the Shoreline hotel! If you are not into the big resorts, and more into the smaller more individualized boutique like hotels, then this is a great option for you. Reasonably priced, clean, and less than a 5 minute wall to shops, dining and the beach. The hotel provides beach towels that you can check out and return at the end of the day. The attached restaurant Heavenly is delicious (a little pricey but well worth it for breakfast our brunch). For a more reasonable priced meal, try Marukame Udon right around the corner it is sooo good! Don't let the long lines outside discourage you...it moves fast and the food is good and cheap.The staff at the Shoreline were always very friendly and helpful I can't remember all their names but I do remember Zhi to go above and beyond. Waikiki is expensive but the Shoreline is a good option for those who don't like to spend too much on accommodation and save it for the fun stuff!! There is a bit of an eye sore building right next door (which will hopefully be gone soon according to staff), other than that the surrounding area is nice.

Stayed one night, booked the queen but had been upgraded to the king. Sort of boutique hotel, all good quality and very clean. Bed was very comfortable. Modern feel and comfortable too. Location is a block from the action, such as it is there. Front desk staff were friendly and engaging, particularly Mona (I think) from New Jersey who went out of her way to welcome me and provide recommendations. There are a lot of choices around and this is a good one.
user_name:
GingerMatti1
New York City, New York

review_body: My husband and I had a fantastic stay at the Shoreline. This hotel is great value for money - it is right in the middle of all the action and has everything you need. The beach and shopping malls are just around the corner, you would not need to hire a car to see waikiki from this hotel. All the staff were lovely, particularly Mona who checked us in and was very helpful with any questions we had during our stay. All the thoughtful details like the complimentary iced tea in the foyer make this hotel feel special! I will stay here next time I'm in Waikiki and we have already recommended the Shoreline to our friends and family.

First time to Hawaii. The staff were excellent very friendly and helpful with anything we needed. Rooms are a little small and dated but were clean. Beds were comfortable. We stayed on the 12th floor and heard no street noise ( which can be very noisey). Excellent location just off the Main Street. Close to beach, transportation and restaurants. Would definitely stay here again, thanks Shoreline for making our stay enjoyable and having great staff. Keep up the excellent work!!!!

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Shoreline and would most certainly stay again. The hotel is close to Waikiki beach, shopping and restaurants. The staff were always helpful and more than happy to help and offer assistance when needed. The availability to grab some fresh beach towels for the beach/pool and then an iced tea and a apple (at no charge) on your way out before starting the day was an added bonus. The rooms themselves were clean, modern and light with good air conditioning, a bath with shower and comfortable bedding. We would definitely recommend this hotel!

The hotel room was nothing like the pictures. We had a "partial-ocean view" room and could not see it at all. When we called room service to request something they did not send it up for another three hours (and two phone calls later). Valet parking is good to have but can take a little while. The place is decent and clean, the staff is friendly and the location is ideal if you want to be in the heart of tourist-ville. Otherwise, I would not recommend this place too highly.

Stayed here one night on our recent trip. There is no ramp to the doors so its a bit of struggle getting suitcases up from street level. Room was clean however sliding cupboard door did not operate smoothly and the air conditioning unit was too close to one of the beds from our point of view. Nevertheless these were minor issues and overall its not a bad place to stay. We were on level 5 and there was no street noise. The hotel is only a very short walk from Kalakaua Ave which is the main street in Waikiki and Waikiki beach. The staff were very friendly & helpful. I would stay here again.

Very good central Waikiki staff pleasant , good for all events entertainment shopping And dining . suggest you don't travel rush hour .Attached Heavenly restaurant excellent Breakfast menu to die for and healthy.
user_name:
woogli19
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: Had a room on 13th level. The room was spacious, clean and well decorated. Had a big balcony with a great view. The staff were very friendly and so easy to talk to. Would definitely stay there again. Only downside is, you have to walk up a flight of stairs dragging your luggage to get to the entrance. The hotel is located right opposite Ross's and around the corner from Duty Free Shops and Macy's.

The location is excellent. The pineapple iced tea and cucumber, lemon & mint iced water in the lobby was always appreciated after being out exploring the city. The staff are were friendly and helpful. Our room was small and 'tired'. I had to kill a roach when we first arrived but fortunately it was the only one! This hotel is ideal for people travelling on a budget, wanting to explore the city that won't be spending lots of down time in their room. The free wifi was a deciding factor in our choice.

I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights and I was really happy I selected this hotel. I have been wanting to stay here everytime I come to Honolulu. Everything is beautifully updated and the location is perfect. I highly recommend this hotel and would stay here again. I was in the top floor and had an amazing view of the city.

Wonderful location in the midst of Waikiki with lots of shops, restaurants and bus stops nearby. Room is small but sufficient. It has obviously been revamped (presumably since the conversion from Seaside Hotel) but remnants remain. Staff was very pleasant and helpful. If you do not require an ocean view, I would recommend it. We found the restaurant attached to the hotel not as tasty as other reviews had indicated....perhaps we ordered the wrong items. The small parking lot right next to the hotel (but unrelated to) charged only $6 for 10 hours where other lots in the area easily cost $15 to $30 overnight.

My husband and I had a wonderful time at the shoreline. This hotel is VERY clean, wonderful hospitality. We were acknowledged on their daily board and received an anniversary shout out. They provided us with complimentary wine and chocolates for our special day. They accomidated our request for a upper level view. The ladies at the front desk were such a wonderful help. They definitely helped my husband and I navigate through the island. We will definitely return to this hotel when ever we return. There's a lot of nice hotels but it's either too expensive or doesn't look nice. The pink trolley was really helpful. The shoreline is a great location and is in the center of everything. The hotel doesn't have a restaurant but has the restaurant "Heavenly" is attached next door. Boy there food is great! So convenient, fresh and taste better than a lot of the food in the area. I recommend the shoreline if you decide to visit Waikiki. Just as shown in the picture. The right amount of space with balcony. Just as shown in the pics posted.

The hotel located near the heart of waikiki but still was quite. Nice hotel for sleeping. Not more than that. The staff was polite but didnt help much. The room was good, not very big. Good value for money.

My partner and I had the pleasure of staying here for a few nights while in Waikiki and found it to be a great hotel. The room was spacious, comfortable and situated very near the main shopping strip and beach.The room was a tad dated but this is not something that I feel impacted the enjoyment of our stay at all. The staff were very welcoming and helpful, particularly when we needed help getting to Pearl Harbor the following morning.As a whole I would definitely recommend the Shoreline to anyone needing a decent, well priced hotel in Waikiki.

Good priced hotel, a few minutes walk from the beach, clean, and most importantly quiet. No dining room, but a cafe next door and lots of other places to eat breakfast. Provides juice and fruit in the foyer.

My wife and I have stayed here twice! We had to come back a second time to Waikiki and chose to stay here again because our first stay was just great! Rooms were clean and the hotel was just in a perfect location! 5 minutes from the beach, a minute from kalakaua ave and restaurants all around! Not to mention your in front of Ross so we were able to shop and drop off what we bought instantly! Very convenient for shoppers! I highly recommended this hotel if you are just in Hawaii to shop and do activities. If you are just gonna relax and stay in your room all the time, the rooms are small so I wouldn't tell those who plan this to stay here. But other than that, we love this place!

Overall, this is a decent budget hotel for this area. I stayed here over Christmas in 2014. The positive, the rooms are a decent size, there is a restaurant connected to the hotel, there is a pool on-site, and you are walking distance to multiple restaurants and sites in the area. I had no problem finding my way to the beach, to find food, or go shopping. The negatives, the hotel has a shady policy (maybe only during holiday season) that they will upcharge you at check-in for double beds. It would be one thing if this policy is noted in writing somewhere, but it is not. Even though my travel agent listed a request for a 2 bed room, I was told there would be an additional fee per night for the room. I am well aware that bedding requests are not guaranteed, however if they have the room that was requested at the time of booking available on site they are supposed to give it to and definitely not try to charge you for it. The desk attendant flat out told me that they do this because they can get extra money out of people during the high season. I was very upset by this, luckily my travel agent covered the additional cost but they should not have had to. Aside from this when I finally got into my room it was not as clean as it should have been and they had to come and change the sheets. This is a budget hotel, so I was not expecting the Ritz. If it had not been for the unscrupulous extortion of extra money and the dirty sheets I would not have had anything bad to say about the resort. Overall, I had a decent stay but I would not recommend this place to anyone because you don't know what you're going to get at check in.

The Shoreline Hotel met our expectations as a part of the Joy of Living group. It was centrally located in a nice area of Waikiki. Being on a half and half one-way road was a little confusing, but easily maneuverable. Easy walking distance to Dukes. Just make sure you go to the right location. There are two sites. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. Complimentary iced beverage choice 24-7 in lobby. Rooms were nice and beds comfortable. Great place for the price.

The Front Desk staff here is amazing, they made me feel so welcomed and special. They asked me daily how my trip was going and gave me great suggestions on where to go, a special thank you to Mona who was our go to girl for anything we needed. The room was perfect for what we needed, clean and comfy! The location of the hotel was so close to restaurants and bars as well as walking distance to the beach. I would come back here any time it was truly perfect. Thanks again Mona and everyone else on the Shoreline team!

We stayed 5 nights , great location excellent staff, nothing was a bother .Complimentary WiFi ,paper and coffee and tea + cold drinks 24/7.Rooms are clean and tidy not large but every thing you need , small fridge and a safe .Also a lot of pick ups for tours are from directly over the road out side the Ross store.

Excellent value for money, very well located for Waikiki Beach, restaurants and shops.Perfect for someone wishing to do organised Tours, as they seem to all pickup opposite the Hotel.Nice clean rooms, and Heavenly Cafe which is adjacent to the Hotel reception has good food.Friendly and helpful staff.Photo shows view from roof of Hotel.

I think they was rude to us when we first got there. There was no DVD player so only could watch tv. That sucked. and they Wi-Fi suck too.. for the cost of staying there was too expensive. I dont think I will stay there again.

This hotel is in a great location in the heart of Waikiki (just a few minutes from the ocean). The room was always clean and the staff always nice and helpful. Valet parking available. Great hotel! We were very happy about this hotel.

My daughter and I chose this hotel as we were staying in Waikiki for five nights before heading to Turtle Bay Resort so we were willing to forego a sea front hotel in Waikiki. We wanted something quiet, clean, with efficient service, comfortable, located centrally and reasonable cost. Shoreline delivered on every one of our requirements. We booked a two double bed room and asked for a quiet room. Our room was not an ocean view room and was on the non seaward side of the hotel and it was quiet. Efficient aircon, comfortable beds, good wifi, clean and refurbished - carpet, paint, framed prints, furniture. Microwave and fridge. Coffee maker. Small balcony. Lobby area bright, airy, and modern while still being personal and comfortable. Desk staff polite, helpful and pleasant. Next door to Heavenly Restaurant which has fresh and organic food but is not cheap but decent food in Waikiki costs, especially with the AUD at the moment. Great service and food! Shoreline had efficient check in and check out and billing. Only cons for me were there is no ramp to wheel suitcases in and out of hotel, stairs only. But I'm sure the staff would organise help if requested. On one day our room wasn't serviced but towels etc promptly delivered when I asked. Front desk staff booked our taxi for our departure date and it all went seamlessly. Always ready with recommendations for shopping, dining etc. great location on Seaside Avenue which is smack bang in the middle of Waikiki just two minutes walk to the main esplanade.

Price to park the car was ridiculous and we were not aware of the charge when booking. Location within walking distance to the beach and shopping. Found a great restaurant to eat at right on the ocean with fabulous views.

Stayed this past weekend for our anniversary. The hotel is lovely. Staff was great and even gave us a card and chocolates since it was a special occasion. Parking was valet only for $28 which is pretty standard for Waikiki so that didn't bother me at all. and the attendant was super friendly. The room was really nice. The bed was AMZING with tons of pillows and made it super difficult to want to get out of bed! I loved that there were black out curtains since most hotels I've stayed at have not mastered keeping the room dark in the early morning hours. Room was very clean and tidy and had every amenity that we could have needed. Overall, just a really great stay and we would definitely go back!

My husband and I stayed at the Shoreline for six nights at the beginning of May 2015 as part of our belated honeymoon. We arrived early but our room was ready so we were checked in straight away. The rooms are nice and had everything you need in them (safe, fridge, microwave, coffee making facilities); the bed was extremely comfortable and the curtains kept the light out in the early hours of the morning. The staff at reception were so helpful, always a welcoming hello when you arrived back into the hotel. Stella in particular was great - we were given fresh flower leis on Lei Day and just her advice on where to watch the fireworks on a Friday night and where the quieter part on the beach is was greatly appreciated.I wouldn't say this was a luxury boutique hotel, or maybe I just have a different opinion of what a boutique hotel is. But if you're looking for somewhere that is clean, tidy and in a fantastic location (literally 2mins from the main road and less than 5mins from the beach) then this is the hotel for you. And as it said on the chalk board one morning, you haven't come to Hawaii to stay in your hotel room!

This was a wonderfully relaxing stay, peaceful, excellent sleep, wonderful bedding, yet right in the heart of Waikiki just a very short stroll to the beach. The ambience of the foyer, space, light, calm, restful was added to by the delicious free iced waters (cucumber, lemon, mint) and iced tea. The rooms were smart with fine decor, well-equipped for self-catering, while the free in-room coffee and tea were much appreciated. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Best value I have found.

A beautiful contemporary hotel right in middle of Waikiki, only 5 minute walk to beach, ask for your complimentary beach towel, 24 hr tea coffee and flavored water in lobby, very friendly helpful staff held our bags in check in and check out for hours with NO charge, clean beautiful rooms with lovely furnishings and the softest pillows ive ever had has a bar fridge too, Starbucks across road and ladies Dont miss a trip to ross essentials BARGAINS GALORE, right in centre, Macys and H&M around corner. .Brilliant Hotel will book and stay again for certain. .

I am so happy I picked this hotel.The room was cute and comfortable. I took too many naps but that bed was wonderfully soft. I had everything I needed: a coffee maker, microwave, fridge, clock radio, safe, iron, ironing board and of course a hair dryer. The front desk was sooo helpful. Stella set me up with a cheap place to book tours. You are literally minutes away from the beach and everything else. As a single traveler I felt safe there day or night. I can't mention enough times how helpful everyone at the front desk was. They set up a shuttle for me to go to the Swap Meet and let me say deals, deals, deals. They called a taxi that was there in minutes so I could be on time to my luau. There was always coffee and drinks in the lobby. All I can say is stay here!!!! Price, location and friendly staff they have it all.

Excellent location in the heart of it. Seconds away from food, shops, bars and the beach. Stayed for 3 nights as part of our honeymoon. Stella the receptionist was very friendly and helpful and upgraded our room as we were on honeymoon. Would recommend. Love the cucumber & mint water in reception!

We stay at different hotels all the time in Hawaii. We have stayed in 5 star to 3 star.This one is very good. Stella on the front desk was the best I have every seen and the hotel should make sure they keep her.First we had a queen bed but the room was a bit small for us for 6 nights. If you are only here for a day or two it would be fine. Rooms are very clean.We then got moved to a king room thanks to Stella. Room again was very clean. Nice size room for a longer stay. There is a little bar under the hotel and restaurant which again is nice and clean.You can walk to everything from here. It's in a great spot.Only down side I found was you have to bring your cases up stairs to get into the hotel. No ramp but that's the only down side I found.Nice ice cold drinks each time you come back. Good internet .10/10

If you want to be at the heart of things at a reasonable cost this hotel is a good option. The staff and young and amiable and everything is a footstep away. This being said it is also in the heart of the city. The lights are bright and this is no relaxing seaside vacation in paradise but I am not sure that goes for any part of Waikiki.

I arrived at the hotel early in the morning after disembarking from the Carnival Legend. The desk clerk was very accommodating to my needs and ensured I was able to move into a room immediately. I found that the hotel was a very short walk to all the famous places. The room was clean and the bed comfortable. A room safe was available. Very important for international travellers as we want to lock up passports and other valuables. For Australian visitors we need a kettle to boil water and tea bags.
