Tea has to be made with boiling water not hot water. The only down side was the morning I departed. Showering at 4am. The noise from the plumbing was very loud. Hope I didn't disturb other guests. Check out was simple and courteous.

This is a great hotel!!!! The rooms are great, the location is fantastic and the staff is out of this world!!!! Thank you Stella and Mona you were the best!!! Helpfull, nice and you made our stay unforgettable!!!! If anyone is thinking of booking a hotel in Hawaii this is the hotel you should book!!!!

Great location, quiet, great wi fi, yummy pineapple ice tea, amazingly helpful staff, clean and modern.If you need a no fuss place to stay with friendly smiles check out the shoreline plus very reasonably priced, just check through all their discount codes on their website for the best deal.Definitely will stay again

We had an enjoyable stay at Shoreline Waikiki. The staff and valet service were most hospitable and the free drinks in the lobby area are a nice touch. Although this is a small and older building tucked away in the City, the location is great and the decor is hip and chic. Would definitely recommend staying here on a future visit.

Just spent 8 nights here & it was wonderful. Front desk staff awesome ( special kudos to Stella, Mona, & Jerome ). Genuinely friendly, courteous, & helpful.We received a complimentary bottle of wine for being return customers. We stayed on the 11th floor. Room was very quiet. We never heard anything from other rooms. AC made our room very comfortable ( daytime & nighttime ).Sometimes our room didn't get serviced until late afternoon, but we knew we weren't the only customers they were taking care of.The location is perfect as well as the price! Right in the center of town. Also close to bus stops & shuttles.Love the 24 hour coffee & cold cucumber water & pineapple ice tea.If we get back to Waikiki we will definitely stay here again.

We stayed at the Shoreline Waikiki for 7 nights last month in a City View King room. We chose it because it had a good location and a reasonable rate. The staff was very accommodating and I love that the hotel had free coffee available in the lobby 24 hours a day and provided beach towels.I agree with other reviewers that it would be nice if the hotel provided more storage for clothes. Our room had one deep but small drawer in each nightstand and three tiny desk-sized drawers in the desk. The room also had a nice sized closet, but only a handful of hangers. When 2 people are staying for a week, this really isn't enough for clothing storage. It was hard to stay organized and tidy.If you're a light sleeper, you may want to bring ear plugs. Even though we were on the 10th floor and kept the sliding door closed at night, the street below was quite noisy starting at about 5 in the morning. The street seems to be a loading/unloading zone for tour vans and also an access road for garbage trucks, so there was a ton of beeping noises echoing from trucks backing up. Also, be careful on the steps leading up to the hotel. It's really slippery when it rains! I slipped and have a huge bruise on my arm from my fall.

We choose this hotel for a one night stay prior to boarding a cruise ship. The hotel is situated in a good location to walk anywhere in the Waikiki area. The entrance to the lobby required that we carry our suitcases up about 14 steps from the front street. It is an older property that is reasonably clean and adequate for a one night stay but we would not choose it to stay for longer. The advantage it may have is the price point at 250.00 night Canadian at the low end of the scale for Waikiki properties.

On the island for our honeymoon, we made a poor choice of an AirBnb. We found Shoreline just down the street, and they were having a great honeymooners special. We were anxious to vacate the old lodging, and they even let us check in early. Some chocolates welcomed us with sweet note. Our room was clean, nice, and modern. The location is fantastic; just a few minutes walk from the beach and just about anywhere else you want to be. We never took a cab. The restaurant downstairs was great too. The only downside was our view wasn't ideal, but all of the above more than made up for it. Salvaged our trip!

After coming off cruise ship early, room was not available until mid afternoon. We were given a room on 8th floor opposite elevator so heard people coming and going all night.Room was very small with not a lot of room with two large suitcases. A/Con outlet in wall was annoying when it operated over nite. The bathroom was dated with strange setup of hot/cold water for the shower. The front desk staff were very helpful and answered any questions. The good thing going for hotel is location.

This hotel offers everything you need for a seaside stay without the huge crowds at the other hotels. A 2 minute walk to the hotel strip, it's location was top notch and the staff so friendly and helpful.

I think this hotel is typical of what I've seen Joe de Vivre do. The come in and remodel old, smaller hotels and tag them as "designer boutique." This one was remodeled but not quite all the way - the bathroom, for instance, was showing some wear and tear. And I don't know if it was just me, but my room was super small. It fit a double bed and that was about it. It had a desk, but you had to take the lamp off it to see the TV - that's how small it was. I suffered through four nights there. There's also a tiny pool on the hotel rooftop. Frankly, I was a little afraid of climbing the stairs to get up there and didn't find the trip worth it once I saw it. Now the positives:Price. It was relatively inexpensive compared to the bigger hotels that may cost twice as much just blocks away. Location. It's right in the heart of Waikiki - steps to shops, restaurants, etc. Bear in mind, staying here you will feel like you're staying in the middle of a big city, which you are. You won't feel like you're on a quiet island or in a relaxing Hawaiian resort. You will however be little more than a block from the beach. Service. The kids working the front desk were superb. They really were like tour directors. They took the time to explain how to get places, gave recommendations, and were generally helpful. Would I stay here again? I don't know. Maybe if I were just stopping over on the way to another island. But if you're on a budget and want to be in the heart of everything, this is probably a good option for you. Probably.

Great value for money, staff were all helpful and engaging, room was well appointed, very quiet, bed was comfortable and bathroom clean and well stocked, would definitely stay here again. Heavenly restaurant next door served great organic breakfasts.

I really liked this hotel! For a mid-range hotel in Waikiki, it's modern, clean, and the location is great. A really quick walk to the beach, and plenty of shopping and restaurants nearby. I arrived early in the morning well before check in time, and they were able to offer me early check in, which i really appreciated. The room is big, clean, nicely furnished, and I was lucky enough to have a partial ocean view, and a view of the pink Royal Hawaiian hotel which is really pretty! My favorite part however, was the restaurant attached to the hotel- Heavenly Cafe. Absolutely EVERY meal I had from there was amazing (and I ate there A LOT!) I only stayed two nights but I wish I had stayed here longer! I have stayed at a few locations in Waikiki and this is by far my favorite.

We stayed here for 2 nights before our cruise. It's a nice small economical hotel in a great location. The staff at the front desk are friendly and very helpful. Our room was equipped with a nespresso machine, mini fridge and microwave which was great although you could get coffee, tea, water and ice tea in the lobby. I would recommend it.

We flew here from Maui took about 20 mins. We were staying here for a week. On first sight , lots of stairs leading to reception ! There is a small lift outside but you need to go to reception to use it, so we dragged our three heavy cases up the stairs. Our room wasn't ready on arrival at about 1:30 pm so the staff stored our luggage and we went for a walk around. This hotel is in a great location just 5/10 walk to Waikiki beach, also right in the shopping area , I've never seen so many designer shops in one area! This island is very busy and crowded. Went back to hotel , given room on 14th floor. The room was small, the bed was small and uncomfortable, it has a mattress on a wooden base, every time you get in and out of bed you bang your legs! I lost count of the amount of times we walked into the wooden frame. There is free wifi in all areas, free tea and coffee and iced water , apples in the lobby, tea and coffee making facilities in the room, but you have to pay for it after your first free cup! There is a walk in closet,with a safe and a high shelf for clothes etc, which I couldn't reach! There are no draws for your things other than a small shallow one on the desk and in the one bedside table. There was a balcony but it was small and scarey! It's very windy at night so make sure. You don't leave towels out they will blow away! The small swimming pool was also on this floor there are only four sun beds so first come first served! There is a small restaurant at the side of the hotel but we didn't eat there. I think this hotel has a great location and is ok for a few nights, it didn't really suit us. The room cleaning can be anytime between 8:30-5:00pm which in my opinion is too late in the afternoon .

I booked this hotel based on Conde Naste Travellers March 2015 review and I was not impressed. It has a good location away from the frenzy of the big hotels but the air-conditioning is so loud you simply cannot sleep! We switched the air-conditioning off only to realise our room (suite on the 12th floor with large balcony) was right next to the lift shaft!! Desperately needing to get some sleep I went down to front desk at 6.45am and the lovely staff member said "oh yes that's a noisy room!!" We were relocated to another room at the back of the hotel on the 10th floor. The air conditioning is old and sits right next to your head ...so I just gave up. I had two more nights to endure. Maybe the free coffee and iced water would help!! I must commend the front staff..Taro and Mona were very kind and helpful but when my room was not cleaned at 4.30pm after being out all day, I kind of lost all "joie de vivre" for this place...pity because it's called a "Joie de Vivre" hotel. It's not nice to be critical but in my opinion it all starts with a good nights sleep.
user_name:
Kimvdv
Cape Town Central, South Africa

review_body: I stayed at this hotel on the 16th April - 22nd April 2015. The Hotel itself is in a great location and the staff are very good, BUT (always a but) the rooms are very small and the one we had number 1426 was smaller than our bedroom at home. You had no room for a table, had one chair, a very small balcony, plus you had the noise of the lift going up and down 24/7.The bed was close to the wall and it was very hard to get out of if you had the wall side to sleep. The base of the bed is very dangerous as it sticks out and you keep hitting it with you shin.

We stayed in a City View King for 4 nights and got a cheaper advance rate online. The room was small but comfortable, clean and well appointed. Great location and staff were friendly and helpful. We were able to check-in early after 19hrs in transit which we were very pleased with! Good value for a basic hotel.

Stayed for three nights after a cruise. Always difficult checking in after a cruise, as you leave by around 9am and can't get into rooms often until mid afternoon. This was no exception. The room was fine, the staff very helpful, the lounge etc good. Just two small issues. As others have said the air conditioning is a bit noisy. Our room backed on to the lifts. There are only two and they are even noisier. Very good WiFi.Very close to but not on Waikiki beach. Also near main shaping area.

first of all,customer has to carry the suitcase to the front after long hours of flight and shuttle bus from the airport. not the elevator,"STAIRS". needs to change somehow.room towels color weren't the same white, they should stop using old one. if they are keep charging room over $155 per night.opened the one suitcase made room full and no space.location is great. but the room, I would say $75 quality.anyway never go back there.

This is a good value choice for Waikiki. We stayed for five nights and had a good stay.The hotel is centrally located one block back from Waikiki BeachThe check in process was excellent, and we received a complimentary upgrade to a sea view room. The sea view was only if you craned your neck, but the gesture was sweet.The room was clean and the bed was more than comfortable. The bathroom was small, but well equipped. The shower was more than powerful enough.The housekeeping was a touch light for me, but it didnt ruin our stay.The wifi isn't very good, but a Starbucks is over the road.I'd stay here again, and I think for a budget conscious traveller this is a good choice.

We really enjoy our stay for honeymoon in Shoreline Hotel Waikiki for one week! We got a fabulous room in the upper floor and cute blessing card from the hotel! It is really a amazing gift for us! We appreciate your service and blessing!

Can't complain much about the location of this hotel. It's right at downtown waikiki. Just steps away from all the shops and restaurants as well as to waikiki beach. I'm not sure how old this hotel is, but it kinda looked aged once you got inside. I had to move rooms because there were ants in the first room they put me into. But location wise, this is a good price for its location.

i loved this place it is in the heart of everything.. there is honestly one thing I will say is that the air conditioning in the rooms do make a lil bit to much of noise. but other then that the staff there is amazing no doubt.. I am already looking for a great date to stay again next year this time with our children. most certainly a place to be with your loved ones.

Stayed one night before picking up our cruise ship. Check in was fast and friendly and we were given a room on the top floor. Lovely clean room with comfortable bed and balcony which had a partial view of the sea. The hotel is right in the middle of the action and as such comes with city noise - did not interfere with our sleep and I am a light sleeper.All staff were extremely friendly and helpful - the complimentary juice in the lobby was very welcome and we ate in the adjacent cafe for breakfast which was tasty and freshly prepared.A few suggestions - more seats around the pool area and some umbrellas as the sun was very hot.

where the place is located, i can say that the price is good. it's steps to shops and restaurants. if you're visiting to enjoy the beach, then pay more to be close to one. this is my 4th or 5th visit in oahu and this time was just a stop for us to visit a friend who lives on the island. parking is $28/night so rented only for a couple of days i needed them. staff were very helpful and pleasant..there is free beverage (coffee/tea/iced tea) on the lobby available all day long. no free coffee refill in room - purchase some or go to the lobby if you want coffee. the room is small, not american standard. the hotel is a good location but there is an old and hideous building right next to is and this is my view from the room where i was. had the window closed throughout my stay so i do not see this depressing scene while trying to enjoy honolulu. i was here for 5 nights but used the 3 full days driving outside of waikiki/honolulu to do a lot of sightseeing. it's a good place to crash...if you're into shopping, it's good place to stay as you are right behind the shopping area. also a short walk to 2 main streets for access to public buses with routes for sightseeing as well as airport.

I checked in the hotel on Sunday after I participated in the half marathon over the weekend. The hotel was clean , great decor and everyone there was helpful. Jerome was the first to help me. I was there to check in but i was really early. He held my luggage for me until check in time was close by. Jerome recommend a few restaurants to try and they were very on point and let's just say I went there more then once while I was there. Sonny helped with my bags.After checking in the rooms were great and nice and cozy. After taking a quick nap headed downstairs spoke with Taro and recommend some evening activities and they were great. Recommended the Diamond Head hike in the morning.Location was a couple blocks away from the main busy street if Waikiki.The tea and pineapple juice was amazing in the lobby. Overall I would stay here again my next trip out.

Perfect Location right near the beach,restaurants, shopping and public transport. Most friendly and helpful staff at the front desk who gave great advice on where to go and how to get around. LOVED the design of the hotel was always bright and colourful and welcoming. Our room was the perfect size, had a side view of other buildings but didn't matter as we were only a walk away from the beach we didn't need a view of it from our room. The wifi connected perfectly every time in the hotel and next door café. Our FAVOURITE part of this hotel was the beautiful organic café "Heavenly' that is connected. Amazing food and service, we could have eaten the kale salad and acai bowls every day!

Street access not great for managing your own bags and my so called upgraded room as in a crummy location in the hotel. They told me it was larger than other rooms but wasn't ever given an option - like higher room with view and quieter but smaller (I was only staying one night) vs bigger room and nothing else good about it. How is that service?

The biggest plus of this hotel was the staff and location. It is located a couple of blocks from the beach and a minute from shops, restaurants and bars. We arrived at 10am and as our room was not ready we were offered space to freshen up and towels to use the roof top pool. We opted to use the pool, which was small but adequate with four sun beds. The pool was also clean and the roof top relaxing.Our room was nicely decorated and a reasonable size with a balcony. There was a safe and coffee machine. In the lobby there is coffee/ tea and juice which you can help yourself too. We would recommend the hotel.

The hotel is conveniently located to the beach. It is about a 5 minute walk. The staff are great. Always helpful and friendly. The room is very pleasant. The restaurant is an added bonus. It serves organic and local foods. We ate there several times and enjoyed the good and relaxed environment. Overall the hotel is very good value for the price.

The hotel is located in the heart of Waikiki, close to the beach, numerous great restaurants and the shopping street. The stuff was very friends and helpful and they offered nice refereshments at the lobby. However, we had a room with a queensize bed (even though we had requested to have two doubles if possible as we were travelling as friends) and it was tiny, hardly any space for our luggages. Such a room is ideal for one person, but even for a couple it is two small.

Overall, I would definitely recommend this place to other people! My best friend and I stayed at the hotel for 4 nights this past march (2015). The rooms were newly renovated, other than the bathroom, which was still very functional! The rooms are small, but comfortable. The staff were SUPER friendly, and always helped out even when it wasn't necessary!The location is also PRIME! You are located in the heart of Waikiki, so everything is walking distance. Its less than a 5 min walk to the beach, and you are surrounded by all the premium shopping on the island. Honestly, for a cheaper hotel, right off the main strip, you cannot go wrong! I would definitely stay there again!

Great location - very close to the Waikiki beach, shopping strip etc. ABC store is across the road.Room Size - Not the largest factoring in luggage spaceBed Size & Comfort - Ok at best!Wi-Fi - Good speed.But it's the staff that makes this simple hotel tick in my opinion. Super friendly and always willing to help. Will not hesitate to go back. Highly recommended, value for money!

Stayed for 6 nights and I found the place to be great. It was central to all major activities and obviously the beach was within walking distance. The rooftop pool although small was relaxing and quiet. The only negative thing I would say is that the rooms were'nt cleaned at a reasonable time. But overall the staff were bright and bubbly and I so enjoyed the free refreshments in the foyer.

Stayed for 4 nights and my stay was very pleasant. The price for the type of room is very much worth it. The staff from check in to check out was fantastic. Karin called my room after I checked in to make sure everything was alright and if I needed anything else. The room itself is nicely decorated and comfortable. Love that they give complimentary water, a Keurig machine, microwave, fridge and most of all the cotton balls and swab. The bed is very comfortable with plenty of great pillows. The location is also fantastic, it's in the middle of everything, minutes to the beach, shopping and great restaurants. I only took off one star because I wish the pool was open later.

By far the WORST HOTEL IV EVER STAYED IN!!!! Me and a friend stayed here in September of 2014 . The toilets overflowed every single time it was flushed . The first time, we called someone up to fix it . Then it second time we had to call him again. By the end of it, this hotel charged our credit card and said IT WAS OUR FAULT THE TOILETS OVERFLOWED??? Clearly, they were broken before we got there!!! We were already back home in Australia by the time the credit card was charged so there wasnt much we could do about it -.- ALSO the balcony door kept getting jammed so we had to call someone up just open the damn thing! Next , we paid for a 2 bedroom hotel .. When we arrived we were given a small room with 1 bed!!!! I told reception this isnt what we paid for but they were booked out and were not able to helpUs . ONLY POSITIVE is the location! Other than that, I WOULDNT RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL TO ANYONE!!!!! If i could give it a ZERO I WOULD!!!

junior suite...had 2 balconies but only 1 chair. We begged and pleaded and got another chair from the lunch room. They looked at us like we had asked for the moon. What's the point in having a balcony with 2 people in the room and 1 chair? Our stay was 7 days...junior suite..no dresser. What? Lived out of suitcase for 7 days. Last day...no wake up call. Front desk apologized and offered us a candy bar. We read all the great reviews and thought we were all set. Think about it...no dresser. When we inquired the front desk shrugged and told us all the rooms were different. I guess I thought a junior suite would be a little better. Never have I stayed in a place where I couldn't unpack for a week.The location was perfect.Oh...the pool that everyone complains about having no plants or anything tropical...that's the same...ie they must not read the reviews...or they just ignore them.

I recently spent 2 nights before and 1 night after an Hawaiian Cruise at the hotel. The location was great for everything I wanted to do in Honolulu. The room was clean and comfortable. Staff members were friendly, helpful, and knowledgeable. Their willingness to store our luggage and give us a place to change into our bathing suits before our room was ready allowed us to enjoy every minute of our stay.

Our stay at the hotel was excellent. The staff were professional and helpful, the place was immaculately clean and well presented, and the wifi was complementary and fast.The rooftop pool was a little disappointing, but considering the amount of space available up there, I'm not going to rate them down for it.
Great location, friendly service. Clean room and bathroom area.Valet parking optional , I would probably choose self parking next time as the parking lot is directly across the street and is cheaper.

I recently stayed at this cute little hotel and have absolutely no regrets - I loved it! First of all, the location was brilliant, being between two main streets Kuhio (shops + restaurants) and Kalakaua (beach, more shops and restaurants, zoo etc). The staff were all incredibly friendly and helpful - shout out to Stella in particular, who gave me some awesome tips! But seriously everyone was lovely.The room I stayed in was quite reasonably sized, the bed was amazingly soft and comfortable. I also enjoyed things such as the iron + board in your room because so many hotels don't have these anymore and I like ironing my own clothes.Free wifi!There's an adjoining cafe called Heavenly which has healthy and delicious food, although somewhat pricey.I really liked the fact that they had complimentary had iced tea, cucumber and mint water, hot tea and coffee available in the lobby at all times.To top this off they have free beach towel rental which was great.Overall, I am very impressed with this hotel - would definitely stay again!

We got an excellent price during Spring break and we stayed at this property for 2 weeks. The staff are very friendly and helpful, this was very noticeable and appreciated.Excellent complimentary coffee in the lobby, and I mean excellent! Also included are pineapple iced-tea and another flavored water. This is on top of the apples and newspapers available every day in the same area.The hotel provides free fresh towels for the beach or whatever, right in the lobby. This helps a lot!Hotel doors lock after 11pm and can be accessed with a room key (nice security feature)There is a nice little restaurant attached to the hotel, but you are only a few hundred feet away from Kalakaua ave and Kuhio ave.This includes McDonald's, Starbucks, multiple ABC stores etc etc and a Ross store that is open until 1am every day right across the streetThe rooms are not very large but more than plenty for our family of four. We had a queen bed and brought our own queen blow-up for the kids which the hotel had no issues with (not many rooms have 2 beds at this hotel). This saved us a ton of money.There is a K-cup coffee maker in the room (bring some from home) and a small fridge.AC was quiet and worked well. Elevators were fast and quiet, even though our room was next to them.Rooftop pool was simple, with decent views ( we never used it, why bother with Waikiki beach there?)Parking is $28 a night, but all hotels in Waikiki charge a lot to park. I parked for free every night along the Ala Wai canal, but you have to hunt for a spot and be prepared to walk back some distance (your choice)Everything was clean and we had no issues, will stay here again.ps, Thanks Stella at the front desk, you are very helpful and friendly!

Wow!! What a pleasant surprise!!This European styled hotel in the heart of Waikiki!! It is newly renovated, clean, comfortable rooms & furnishings, and a great value!!Two blocks from the beach, in the middle of the shopping district. You can also count on friendly service!What more would you want?! The only thing it doesn't have is a waterfront view!Enjoy!!

Spent 3 nights here. Comfortable, convenient, and affordable with helpful/responsive staff. Nice cucumber water in lobby. Attached restaurant has GREAT and healthy breakfasts. Loved their smoothies, and very nice bartender. Only downsides were: the garbage trucks emptying dumpsters in the wee hours, and setting off car alarms and the staff arranged a shuttle for us to get to Pearl Harbor, but it didn't show up on time and followup said they'd be at least another hour, which we didn't have. Ended up taking the bus, which was way cheaper and more dependable -- takes a while but if you plan for it... Suggestions to hotel: 1. Big closet but would've preferred some drawers or shelves for the types of clothes I bring to HI. 2. people have wet swimsuits and snorkel gear in HI, put those clothesline things in the bathtubs.

We really enjoyed our stay at the shoreline hotel. All the staff were very friendly, we always got greeted with a good morning or welcome back which is small yet sweet. One of the ladies of the front desk gave us some good recommendations for dinner and showed us how to get there by a map. It is conveniently located, just a short walk to the beach, trolleys and cafes etc. The rooms are quite modern and comfortable. Free wifi and free beach towels are also available to use from the front desk which is handy! Overall we really enjoyed our stay!

I really enjoyed my stay at the Shoreline in Waikiki. Travelling solo, I'm always looking for somewhere central and safe - the hotel is only a block from the beach and right in the centre of Waikiki, yet my room was so lovely and quiet. I got upgraded to a king room so I had a huge, comfy bed to sleep in. The staff at the front desk were so helpful and friendly, particularly Stella. They always had cucumber water, coffee, tea and iced pineapple tea in the lobby which was a nice touch. The room was so reasonably priced compared to the hotels right on the beach. I won't hesitate to stay here again if I get back to Waikiki!

The hotel is conveniently located in the centre of town. Overall good value. Comfortable king bed. Unfortunately the Shoreline is looking worse for wear - but then it seams many of Waikiki's hotels are looking old. No restaurant in the hotel but next door is a good cafe that makes tasty and well presented food.

I was looking for an inexpensive hotel in the centre of Waikiki, and the Shoreline hit the mark. It's nothing special, but the location is excellent, close to everything, and the hotel has most things you could need.

Just came back from this hotel , wounderful staff very helpful, the rooms were clean modern had everything you needed, not far from restarants. public transport just around the corner, lovely restraint next door called heavenly, we had lovely breakfast there every day you get a 10% discount coupon off hotel reception when you arrive to use when ever you want, but we kept going because the breakfasts were so healthy. One block from the beach, theres a ross store across the road to hotel, the only gripe I have was the maid service to clean the rooms they were not cleaning room until 4pm and it was inconvenient when we where out most of the day and would come back to relax and the maid would turn up to make the bed and clean rubbish and bathrooms. but apart from that everything was great.

Everything was great from the first contact with them to checkout. Front desk staff VERY helpful and friendly. beautiful trendy hotel in the big city. good central location: only a couple blocks from the beach and close walk to many restaurants and shopping. I can't imagine you could get much of an ocean view here but its not a far walk AND it was half the price of some of the hotels adjacent to Waikiki beach. The room was small (we had a queen room, city view). view was a back ally, but we did have a balcony. The bed was very comfortable. Bathroom and room was very clean and updated. Loved the organic restaurant attached to the hotel. Loved the pineapple ice tea and mint cucumber water and coffee offered in the lobby. front desk staff arranged shuttle for us to go to Pearl Harbor and gave us helpful hints and a map for the downtown Waikiki area. The attention to the little details in this hotel made the stay that much better.

My best friend and I stayed at the Shoreline Hotel Waikiki to celebrate our birthdays, and from the minute we walked in we were treated as very special guests. Stella checked us in and became a much needed source of info for us throughout the entire trip. She was so helpful and even sent us personalized birthday cards and champagne on our arrival. Stella is the best! Seriously have never had better customer service at a hotel, all staff included. The room was adorable, super clean (and this is coming from a super neat freak), and perfect for the trip. The location was amazing, just a short few minute walk to the beach, but also tucked away on a quiet street. The tea, water, and coffee in the lobby was wonderful after coming in from a day at the beach and or when leaving for the day. Checkout was so easy and the hotel arranged our shuttle to the airport so we didn't have to do a thing. Our stay couldn't have been better!

Travelled to Waikiki for the first time and stayed in Shoreline Hotel. Central location, very helpful, informed and welcoming staff. Free tea, coffee, iced teas, newspapers and often fruit available in the lobby. Beach towels were also available for guests. Small but clean pool on rooftop. Rooms were clean and well equipped with a handy fridge for keeping drinks cool. Many thanks, a good stay!

I stayed on waikiki many times in many hotels include (halekulani hotel,Hilton,sheraton and others ) this time since my husband was joining me on Kauai I decided to give this hotel a try since I was by myself for four days and didn't feel like I need to spend $$$$ I was very skeptical and scared choosing this hotel at first but this hotel exceeded my expectation, everything was clean and bed was very comfortable!!!! Do not choose this hotel and than complain that you don't have ocean view !!!! U should know what your are choosing at the fist place !! And yes there is a notice on the morning but it's normal city leaving.If you don't want a notice stay on north shore of the island or close to diamond head. This hotel is located one block from the waikiki strip and if if you need to know it's right next to "on top of the roof restaurant " across is vintage island coffee shop so yes you are in the middle of everything and beach is just less than 5 min away.Big Thanks to all the reception stuff you guys are awesome thank you for constantly putting smilies on people faces.I will return to you every time I'm on waikiki !!!! The heavenly restaurant next door has an awesome organic breakfast,lunch and dinner.
user_name:
Olimpiusek1
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Shoreline Hotel was fantastic for our stay. It's location is excellent, clean rooms (on the smaller side which was fine for us) that were serviced daily. Coffee/tea and cold freshments available in the lobby. Check in and out was fast and efficient. Staff were so helpful. One lady in particular who checked us in was really nice but I don't remember seeing her name on uniform, sorry! We thoroughly enjoyed our holiday in waikiki and in my opinion you really can't go wrong choosing this hotel. I'm glad I booked this hotel thanks to other reviews. When staying here you must also go to Heavenly, the restaurant next door, it's the best!

Small rooms, but cheap! Very small roof-top swimming pool area, housekeeping spotty. Excellent location right in the heart of Waikiki, very overpriced on-site hotel car parking! Free coffee / tea and cucumber / ice-tea water in the lobby all day long. Friendly staff, free beach towels. Overall for the price (we paid under $95USD per night) it is great choice for a week in Waikiki.

After travelling to Hawaii for our 4th time we stayed at the Shoreline and were very impressed! We stayed here for a week after getting a great deal on Priceline and were very happy. The staff were so helpful, friendly and always had a smile on their faces. The room was always very clean and the location is perfect in Waikiki. We would definitely recommend Shoreline to others!

Thank you Shoreline on Seaside Ave. The location, the cheerful service, the very clean and relatively spacious room (by Honolulu standards) impressed me. Excellent location just couple blocks above the beach - yet up a little side street nicely tucked away from the heaviest flow of tourist traffic and street sellers. The one thing I'd add is a great hot tub. :-)

This was my first trip to Hawaii, so everything was new and I had a lot of questions. The people were typically very helpful and friendly, and the cleaning staff were spot on. Any questions I had were answered quickly, and if they didn't have the answer, they went online to find it for me.One of the better aspects of the hotel is the location - right across a one-way street from the Waikiki Trade Center. That might not seem relevent, until you realize that almost all of the tour buses park there. So, if you're going to Germaine's Luau, or the Polynesian Centre, or Pearl Harbor, you can just hang in your room or the lobby until the bus drives up - no standing on the curb waiting for a bus. There is also a city bus stop just around the corner, so that was handy.The only downside to the hotel was two-fold: one, no in-room movies, (which can be a problem when the weather isn't nice for being outdoors; and, two, parking is $27 a day. The movies thing isn't terrible if you have a device that can stream (free wi-fi, of course), but the parking is prohibitive, since most car rentals start at $40-$50 per day already. Get ready to utilize those tour buses and transit!Overall, it was a great place to stay, and the price is very competitive with other hotels in the area. I actually went to look at other hotels that I had seen online, and the minor savings I may have realized by staying in lower-cost hotels were not worth what the condition of those hotels was.

On first impressions the hotel has a boutique feel and the foyer area was neat and clean with free coffee/tea and cool drinks dispensers. Our first night (Friday) was a bit of a nightmare as we had a room overlooking the street and the noise from the yelling of the passing revelers continued until around 5am when the garbage trucks started up with their banging and reversing beeps. The next morning I requested a room away from the street and was given one towards the rear of the property. The noise situation in no way reflects on the hotel itself but the way that the staff handled it does. They were sympathetic and gave us another room and followed up as to whether the new room was OK.The rooms themselves were a bit on the small side but were very clean and had a "nice" feel and a comfy bed. We received small complementary bottles of water on the first day but not on consequent days which I found a little odd.The location is great and there are a number of bars/restaurants and shopping in the surrounding blocks and is only a short walk to the beach.The reception staff were all relatively young but obviously very competent which I found refreshing and fit with the overall feel of the hotel.I would stay here again if I returned to Waikiki.

As a part of my job almost my entire life is being spent in hotel rooms. Shoreline front dest is absolutely one of the most lovely one! Similing, helping lovely ladies and great gentlemen, we thank you all.Fantastic locatio, comfy beds and nice price ratio is to be mentioned too. Waikiki is a crowded and noisy location. So, we had our share of it in our room but that is not a sphesific problem to the Shoreline Hotel.We would definitely come back.

What can I say , they were great from the start we arrive to the end . The guys at the front desk and the other staff was amazing and helpful ... The rooms are great and clean they were always on top with the room cleaning . the location is amazing right in the middle of everything . This hotel is the place of choice to stay at if you want to have an enjoyable time in Waikiki ..next time I am there i will stay there ..Thanks for everything you made a good holiday for us

After arriving on an early flight from Sydney it would have been much appreciated if there had been a hospitality room room available or the offer of an early check-in. When booking with Shoreline I'd requested an early room if available but when I raised this with the reception staff she wasn't, unfortunately, very helpful on the matter. I was met with a shrug of the shoulders and a "we can just see if one comes free" response. Not a good first impression. Despite leaving a contact number to be sent a SMS if a room became available before the 3pm check-in she didn't bother contacting me. By chance we returned to the hotel around 1pm and spoke with a different member of reception (who was also extremely helpful in advising us of what was available in the area) to find that rooms were free. Hurrah! Our room was a city view on the 3rd floor. Despite a very bleak outlook (keep the curtains closed) the room was very well presented and kudos to the domestic staff on the cleanliness of the place. The beds are so comfortable and rooms are an adequate size for what we paid. The free water was a bonus but it may have been a nice touch to have this replenished daily. Check-out was smooth and straight forward although it would have been nice to be met with a smile. We returned to Shoreline after 3 nights on the north shore and on this occasion there were no problems with checking-in (albeit we arrived at 6pm). We'd also been given rooms on the 12th floor which was a bonus as there was a big difference in noise level (nice and quiet) and the queen size bed was bliss. Early morning check-out was a pain as there was only one staff member rostered on and we had a cab waiting for a good 10 minutes despite getting to reception desk earlier. I'd definitely recommend this place for friends travelling together but just a few tips: - earlier check-in time or at least the availability of a hospitality room - staff were generally helpful but a tip: smiling never hurt anyone - replenish the water daily and the water jug/coffee maker had a terrible taste to it - more staff available for checking-outGreat location though and high standards of cleanliness.

It is a boutique hotel with small rooms, with rooms in front of the elevator on each floors. We had to change room the next day, because the one assigned was in front of the elevator. The 1st room had a desk with chair, but no microwave. The 2nd room had the microwave but not the chair since it did not have sufficient room for it. The rooms were clean. The employees were very helpful. The location is convenient, close to restaurants, shops, and the beach. At the same time, it was quiet.

Clean and spacious rooms (for a hotel in Waikiki), friendly and helpful staff. Only complaint would be lack of availability of early check-in or late check-out, but rooms were fully booked so was to be expected. Small but complimentary bottles of water and microwaves in room were handy.

This is a smaller boutique hotel in a wonderful location. Our room (on the second floor) had no view at all bit was nonetheless comfortable and we'll appointed. The staff was friendly and knowledgeable. We had a great stay. Highly recommended for the budget savvy traveler.

I have just returned from my first stay at the Shoreline and can not speak more highly of this hotel.Not only is it great value for money but from my first step into the hotel the level of service was fantastic.If you are looking for a hotel thats close to the heart of Waikiki beach than this is the hotel for you.

It is a boutique hotel so rooms are small but well appointed. Keurig coffee maker, microwave, refrigerator and wifi were unanticipated but welcomed. Bathroom was very clean and well llghted, bed was comfortable and employees were cheerful and attentive. Located in the center of Waikiki, it was very convenient, in fact, it may be one of the best off beach locations available. Beach is a very short walk away. Coffee, hot & cold tea, flavored water and newspapers in lobby was most welcomed. We only stayed one night as a birthday adventure but I would stay again.

Overall this is a decent hotel if you get a great price. It is in a great location and the staff is nice. I would definitely recommend the largest room option. The Queen Cityview room is a little small in my opinion.

I come to Honolulu at least three times a year for the past 10 years for business. This by far was the best value. Mona at the front desk is outstanding as well as the entire staff. This is a very service oriented Hotel which I look forward to coming back to.

The hotel location is perfect, very convenient to reach stores, beach, food, rental, and room is wonderful. We really appreciate the great service tht we had over the stay, def will be back again!!!!!!

We stayed at the Shoreline in Feb 2015 for 6 nights in their City View Queen suite, left for a 6 night cruise around the islands returning for one night stay in their Partial Ocean View King suite (attached photo's-king room). I have found the Shoreline be in an excellent location, close walking distance from the beach, round the corner from the restaurant district, in the heart of the shopping district as well as an ideal spot for public transport. The Queen suite was small, which may be difficult if you travel with a lot of luggage, however if was not a problem for us. This suite contained all amenities we needed including a fridge, iron, hairdryer, free wifi, free beach towel rental etc, however when we were upgraded to the king suite on our return, we found this room did not contain a fridge. Their is no tea & coffee in the rooms, however this is available, along with iced tea in the reception area. This location can be noisy at night, however ceases when you close the sliding glass balcony door. The staff were excellent, attended to all needs immediately. After much research, I found the Shoreline to be the best value for money in a great location, I was not disappointed. This hotel is a real treasure and recommend it to all travelers and can't wait to holiday there again soon.

centrally located about 50metres back from the strip. Friendly and efficient staff. Good size rooms with comfortable bed and good pillows. Hot and cold drinks free in the lobby. Free wifi. Recommended

My husband and I had never been to Waikiki before so had no idea about locations of hotels - so glad we found Shoreline! Clean, tidy, great base for our week. If you want to shop and go to beach than this is the place! Ross dress for less across the road, H&M on the corner, easy walk to Waikiki beach (we cut through the Sheraton every day as we had friends staying there paying over double per night what we paid!) and close to restaurants etc in Lewers Street. Staff are polite. Will definitely stay there again when we come back!! Rooms aren't huge and pool is not lavish but we just wanted the option of having a dip so it suited us.

I was very nervous booking as this was not a hotel recommended by our travel agent but rather what I found doing research on trip advisor. Myself and my husband spent 8 nights here as part of our honeymoon. The location is perfect and so central. Just one block off the beach and just around the corner of the main drag, couldn't ask for a better location. The rooms were very clean and more the sufficient to enjoy a fabulous holidayWe had spent 4 nights in Maui before staying at the Shoreline in Waikiki I will admit it's definitely a shock coming from the Hyatt Maui to the shoreline, however in saying this we decided to splurge on accommodation in Maui as that part of our trip was more about relaxation and we didn't really leave the resort. If the big resort pools etc is what you are after then the Shoreline is not for you but you need to way up if that is what you are after in a holiday. I knew when we were in Waikiki we had planned to be out and about most days so were rarely at the resort during the day, the money we saved by staying at the Shoreline compared to the beach front resorts could be spent on other pleasures! And once again we were more then satisfied with our choose to stay here.

I have stayed here twice and this hotel is probably the best deal in Waikiki. It's in a good location, close to dining and the beach. Staff is very courteous and makes the stay stress free. I will stay here again on my next visit to Honolulu.

This is such a great little gem of a hotel. As a solo traveller I loved it. Very centrally located in Waikiki. Loved the quiet of the rooftop pool after spending the day at the beach. Room was cute and had a fridge and microwave. My room was only on the second floor, so there was some street noise, but nothing to loud. The view from the room was the back of a building across the lane, but didn't go to Hawaii for the hotel room view! It's less than five minutes to walk to the beach, and the view from the roof is amazing! I booked it through a third party site and got an amazing nightly rate.

My wife and I stayed from feb. 13 thru feb 20, 2015. we were on the 8th floor. hotel was clean. our towels were missing one day but were brought to us promptly. would be nice to have more coffee in the room, instead of having to go to the Lobby for it. this was a family vacation for ourselves, my brothers family and my parents. if we were to come back to Oahu I would consider this Hotel again

Firstly, let me start by saying what a great location this hotel is in... one block back from the beachfront strip and close to everything. I had requested an early check in before travelling to Hawaii and when we arrived at the Shoreline, my request wasn't even acknowledged until I asked about it. It was of course denied so we set off for the day and came back at check in. On check in, we were surprised to learn that we couldn't pay cash at check in (as previously told we could) and the total amount would be pre-authorised on my credit card and we could pay at the end of our stay. I was incredibly upset about learning of this credit card authorisation as we were not aware and had all our holiday money in cash, not on my card. When trying to sort this out with Zhi, another front desk staff named Jerome decided to add his two cents on this situation, reducing me to tears and bullying me over the front desk. "THIS IS OUR HOTEL POLICY" he borderline yelled at me - to which I replied, please stop talking off to the side of me you are making me feel very uncomfortable. His response - "I am not to the side of you, I am right in front of your face. I'm sorry but is this how you make your guests feel welcome? It immediately set a negative tone of this hotel for our stay and I do not appreciate been made to feel like this. It is poor customer service and Jerome shouldn't be speaking to guests like this. I was incredibly upset. We finished our check in process and made our way to our room. Be warned, the photos are a little misleading but the room was satisfactory and was clean and comfortable. One thing I will mention, every afternoon when we came back to our room, big bags of rubbish and old linen from the room attendants cleaning other rooms, was constantly left outside our door - not very nice to come back to every day and started to smell! I sent an email to the hotel manager, explaining my unhappiness at the check in process and was very touched by his kind apology - thank you for the wine and chocolates they were greatly appreciated. Not the worst hotel I'm sure, but lots of room for improvement in todays competitive market.

This hotel is close to the beach and in the middle of the action. The price compared to the other hotels was better making this the pick. We had three in our family on this trip. They only had a queen bed room left so we took it. The bed was tiny a little less then a queen and we managed to have all three in the bed each night. The room was smaller the a cruise ship room. Very little. Guess the room doesnt really matter as you are out exploring the outdoors. They also did have a little balcony which was nice. The place is clean and the beds as comfortable as can be given our situation. They had a restaurant attached which we did not try as within walking distance was so many choices. Given the price I would stay here again.

My husband and I recently came back from an 8 night stay at the Shoreline. I was slightly skeptical about the hotel just because it was much smaller than what we're used to. I'm so glad we took the chance and booked this hotel. It is located right in the heart of Waikiki. The hotel is clean and the staff is extremely friendly. We booked the queen room which was on the smaller size but we didn't care because we were only in the room to shower and sleep. Each room has a fridge, microwave & Keurig machine which was a nice bonus. The lobby always had fresh water, pineapple iced tea, hot tea & coffee. The front desk staff was the best! - Mona (Jersey!!), Taro, Alex & Zhi were always chatting with us and giving us suggestions on where to eat, drink and swim (there are some great beaches on the north shore). We've stayed at larger hotels in Waikiki but we preferred this hotel. It was nice to have the staff remember where we were from and other small details about us. They made us feel at home which we loved.As for the area - Waikiki beach is only a 5 minute walk and the hotel provides beach towels. All the restaurants and bars are within walking distance as well. Heavenly is a great restaurant for breakfast right next to the hotel - it is a must try! Duke's (in the Outrigger) has a great breakfast buffet. Yard House (on Lewers street) is a great sports bar - over 100 beers on tap. Doraku (in Royal Hawaiian center) is great for sushi. Rum Fire (in the Sheraton hotel) is great for drinks. They have live music and a DJ depending on the night.We absolutely loved our stay at the Shoreline and can't wait to go back!!

The staff were hospitable. They saw to my comfort as much as possible. I enjoyed the pool on the rooftop which is small but good for a refreshing dip and laps. I don't shop but there are convenience stores ABC and Starbucks a block away and the hotel is around the corner from duty free. What attracted me is that it is only a couple of blocks to the beach though hotels line the beach and access is relatively. limited but it is nice for a stroll. There are many dining choices. For the budget minded it is possible to take public busses to most tourist spots. I was very happy to save money by staying here. Clean cheerful bright.

Smaller hotel didn't scare us from having a great time and enjoying our stay. Everything was very well done without the flash, glitz, and stuffy atmosphere. I would recommend this hotel over anything that sits right on the water in Waikiki. Walking distance to everything ever needed and at the right price hard to beat. Enjoy your stay!

We liked it here because it was within a 5 minute stroll to swish shops, restaurants and the beach, but as it wasn't right in the more expensive part of Waikiki it was a lower cost. The rooms were nothing special, quite smallish, but clean. Staff in reception were helpful. No restaurant but that was fine as we were happy to use as a base, and have our meals out.

The hotel is right in the heart of the Waikiki beach area. The room was small, but had everything you needed. The front desk staff was knowledgeable and pleasant. The WiFi was pretty fast. The elevator was super fast. There were hot and cold refreshments at the lobby every day. I requested for a higher floor if it was available, but I should have asked what kind of view and if the electrical room was next door. So, this time around there was zero view and bit of clanging every once in awhile. The doors need a bit more sound proofing. It was a small nuisance on our vacation.

We had a great and enjoyable stay at the Shoreline! Really loved the centrality of the location - so close to everything: Waikiki, shopping malls, shops, transport- so easy to get to everything!!! Plus, the room was so clean and the bed was one of the most comfortable I've ever slept on!! Very fluffy pillows too! They were very accommodating as I had asked for a room away from the elevators, and they happily gave me one at the end of the hallway - which had a balcony and was very quiet. I've been having insomnia lately, and it was a while that I have slept like a baby in the bed! Great they have a microwave and fridge in the room! Good modern hotel with Free and good wifi in the lobby and room and free newspaper, coffee, tea, apples, cucumber art and pineapple ice tea in lobby! What more can I say? Only con was the size of the room- it was abit small- but can't complain: everything else made up for it tremendously! Also highly recommend the Japanese cafeteria restaurant Madame Udon nearby on Kuhio Ave. Usually long lines which go by quickly. Delicious and very cheap! They hand make the udon themselves!

I guess I should start with the good...the staff was friendly and helpful. The location is perfect..short walk to the beach, shopping and restaurants no need for a car here! The price was reasonable for the area and the hotel has free wifi. Enjoyed seeing Moses daily when we did have to use our car :)Now the bad...I asked for one of the nicer rooms as it was our 25th...not too sure if it was, the view was of old apartment building full of garbage and the noise of trucks every morning waking us at 4:30 am. The housekeeping was not the best...long story short I had some tea droplets on the bathroom floor and for five days it stayed there so looks like washing the floor does not happen daily. Most days the room was not cleaned until 3:30 or 4 pm. I actually wrote "dust me" in dust on the headboard...it is probably still there. One day we went to get beach towels at 8am and they were out...not too sure how you can run out at 8am. We asked for an hour later check out and was told we would be charged half a day...for an hour! Crazy!So...it had it good points...but the bad ones are right there...would I recommend it...not too sure...but probably because of the staff and location and price I would?

We stayed here from the 14th Feb to the 24th Feb 2015 .Before leaving for Honolulu , my husband had emailed the hotel explaining that we would be arriving on our 22nd wedding anniversary and if possible could they provide a room with a semi-nice view as a surprise to me. A reply was received stating that his request was passed on . On arrival at the hotel after a very long flight there was no acknowledgement whatsoever , hubby was disappointed but let it go. Our view was of a dilapidated old building with Ross's dept. store to the left . We were given a room right next to the lifts, which were very noisy . We stayed here for 10 days .. For 3 of those days our room was not cleaned . Returning from busy days touring and shopping I found this to be a disgrace. More than once we had cleaners knocking on our door at 4 in the afternoon asking to clean our room when we had just returned from a busy day and were just relaxing or having a nap . Husband had to keep going down to lobby to advise staff our room had not been cleaned. Once he went to ask for fresh towels and we were told "oh I think we're out of towels" ... Hang on folks it gets better.... On returning from a day out and about we arrived and found our room door open , yes that's right open .. Hubby made his way back down to the lobby to advise them of this " oh we're sorry" ... I think if it was another guest all hell would have broken loose down at that lobby , but hubby is quite level headed and handled it very calmly. it seemed like you had to work hard just to get your room serviced at this hotel . It was all a bit odd. We have just returned home , and I don't like leaving negative reviews . We are regular visitors to Hawaii and absolutely adore it. The hotel was clean and well presented but our personal experience was not up to scratch , it certainly lacked in areas . For next year's trip we will be looking to stay elsewhere. They've lost us as return customers and we unfortunately cannot recommend them to our friends and family who will also be holidaying in Hawaii.

Just wonderful. Forget any negative reviews. Stylish decor, quiet--Seaside Avenue is peaceful. We didn't need a 'wow' view. Actually our view on both the 8th and 6th were fine sunny, city views. We upgraded to a larger room-- at $30 plus tax per night--because the '31' line was too small (as in 831). We love the corner room next door as in 830 or 630 where we are now. Because I made two separate reservations at this hotel (was unsure where we wanted to be), I got an upgrade on the second for free because I joined their Loyalty program and we saved plus $100 including taxes for our final 3 nights.Stay here, enjoy it and spend lots less than other hotels AND free Wifi plus free coupons for casual restaurant next door. We like our 630 room. Only disappointment was the tub size roof pool--forget laps but kids will love it!
user_name:
louise w
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We stayed here for 6 nights in February and overall were pleased with our choice. We are not 'resort' people, so didn't want to pay mega dollars to stay on the beach. The Shoreline has a very convenient location, being right in the middle of things for shopping, restaurants, tours etc, and is anyway only a short walk to the beach. Our room was comfortable and attractive, great bed, most of the amenities we look for on holiday. The lobby was stylish and offered somewhere to sit if you don't want to go straight back to your room after a day out exploring. And Heavenly, the restaurant attached to the hotel was funky and cute and had lovely food that offered a healthier alternative to most of the offerings in the area. We had a corner room on the third floor, and my advice to anyone staying this low down would be not to sleep with the window open. We did on the first night and were awoken by a lot of street noise, garbage trucks etc. On subsequent nights we kept the window shut and didn't have this problem at all. My only complaint would be that although we booked months prior, and specifically asked for a higher room (both at time of booking and on arrival), the hotel didn't seem at all interested in trying to accommodate this. So we were slightly disappointed to be put on a low floor, with no balcony, and as others have noted, a very drab street view. However, this didn't spoil our overall experience, and I would recommend this hotel for those who want a good location and a comfortable sleep at a reasonable price.

This hotel was an easy choice - great location - only minutes walk away from Waikiki Beach and the main street, as well as great value for money.We stayed here for a week over October/November. The check in process was easy. We were allowed to check in early to our room with no penalty for being early - which was lovely. (We caught H.A. from SYD so by the time we actually arrived at the hotel it would have been nearly 12.30pm) The main entry to the hotel is quite bright and refreshing. You are greeted by bright coloured lounges; two fresh drinks on tap (of the fruit kind) plus tea or coffee; two computers; printer; ATM. We had a city view room - which had a view of a run down building next door (but at the end of the day, we didn't actually spend that much time in the room to mind!) We had a small balcony which we used to dry our clothes and get a bit of fresh air from time to time. The room itself - the bed and tv set up was nice, the room was a decent size for us to have our suitcases unpacked and not feel like sardines in a can. The room had a semi - modern feel to it. (Also fantastic - the rooms had fridges; microwaves; air conditioning) One thing I need to mention is - Free Wifi - that was a huge plus for us!The bathroom, however, was a bit dated. The decor was peeling in spots, a few chipped tiles etc.The bathroom was our only problem (staying here). On two separate occasions the toilet became unflushable and we had to get it repaired. Only a minor inconvenience, as it was done whilst we were out and about. The rooftop pool - was quite nice. Not once did I see anyone else come up to use it - it is quite peaceful compared to the likes of Waikiki Beach. The staff, were amazing. Every time we had a question - they were full of suggestions and extremely helpful.

We loved our stay! Impressed with cleanliness and style. Super friendly including reception and bell boy & cleaning staff. Consistent complimentary wifi throughout building plus two desktops in the lobby available for free with printers. Also free exotic drinks on tap in lounge, we had cucumber mint lemon water. Informative welcome board as you exit lift on ground floor to provide guests info about the day ( weather, surf report, local events etc). Small rooftop pool open 8am-7pm.Good location two streets off the main strip so quiet in mornings.Very convenient! Will definitely stay again! Highly recommend A+

We had really mixed feelings about this hotel.Pros:- very affordable- friendly and helpful staff, especially Mona; always greeted us with a smile and asked about our day; gave very helpful recommendations and suggestions- clean rooms with nice amenities (refrigerator, microwave, coffeemaker, safe)- coffee, cucumber water and pineapple ice tea provided in lobby- location, if you want to be in the midst of the hustle and bustle of Waikiki and near shoppingCons:- location, if you don't like crowds and shopping is not a priority; there are some inexpensive alternatives on the Diamond Head end of Waikiki near the beach and park - small rooms with limited drawer space- unappealing view from rooms, especially those facing a dilapidated apartment building, and loud outside noises- badly stained carpet, especially in hallways- very unattractive entrance from valet parking into lobby does not make a good first impressionIf you are looking for an inexpensive hotel near the action, this one might work for you.

You have free tea or cucumber mint water in the lobby, all day everyday! Free internet and comfortable rooms (for two). You have a fridge, coffee machine, and free internet. The bathrooms are a bit small but most rooms have a balcony so you can sit and relax. They are small as well but the building itself is small so I won't complain much. The location is EXCELLENT for shopping and eating. You can head in one direction to Kuhio for loud bars, drinks and great restaurants. You can head the other way into Waikiki Beach for sunbathing and swimming!Some staff were kinda "blah" but still helpful nonetheless.The Jewel of the Nile was HEAVENLY, the Japanese restaurant downstairs. WOW! Great quality and delicious food. Definitely go for breakfast while there!

The Location have a very good Position to Waikiki Beach !! We have a lot of fun there! Very nice is also You have all the Time Very good coffee and cool Drinks in the Lobby! Free Parking when You have Rentel car You get by the Zoo!

My husband and I stayed from the 9th to the 17th of Feb 2015. Daughter and her husband arrived a few days earlier and left the same time.We all loved our stay, the staff, very helpful and friendly. Our rooms... good size,large comfy bed,pillows great, 5 on our bed. Good size fridge, microwave etc. The cleaning staff did a great job, also very friendly. My eldest daughter,husband and children stayed the same duration as us but in the Hilton Regency. Comparing the rooms,we got the better deal. If we ever have the chance to come again, we will be booking to stay at Shoreline Hotel again.

Had the perfect stay in this wonderful hotel in waikiki... Everyone in the staff was very friendly... especially Mona and Karen at the FD who were very helpful and made my birthday stay even more fun... will surely come back to stay at Shoreline Hotel...

This was a good hotel. Room was clean and tidy, and decent size. Front desk staff were very welcoming and always helpful offering advice on where to go and booking shuttles. They offered a free upgrade and had a room on a high level. Location is central to everything, including bus stops, restaurants and shops. Walls seemed a bit thin, we could hear every detail from tv in room next door, but I suspect he was blasting the sound more than necessary. Overall a well priced, clean hotel which is in a perfect spot in Waikiki.

The rooms are smaller but perfect for the two of us. The rooms were kept perfectly and the bed was comfortable. I like the fridge and microwave, made things easy. Also, front desk staff was knowledgable and friendly. Always willing to help and always someone there to help. If I return, I will definitely stay here again!

We wanted to start our first-time Hawaiian expereince from Honolulu and of course there's no better place for that than Waikiki (yes, it sometimes seemed too crowdy but it has everything here, besides, you always can have a getaway). As it's the most popular place to stay in Honolulu, the prices are surely higher. Shoreline Hotel surprised me with its very reasonable price (indeed!) in relation to its wonderful location. Kalakaua Ave and Kuhio Ave, two principal streets, with all the possible shops, bars and restaurants you ever need (some of them have ocean view) are literally around the corner. Famous Waikiki beach in 5 minutes walk, the next one (plus 2 minutes) is less crowded Kuhio Beach. If you don't have a car, the bus stops are also right here: 10-15 min ride to Ala Moana, 20 min to the Downtown with its fascinating sights and nice places to eat, 15 min to Diamond Head. Other magnicifent Oahu sights are also reachable directly from here but it's gonna take some time. The location is the thing we really loved.Overall hotel's condition was OK. We liked the hotel's interior decor, it's nice and modern. They even have this nice blackboard with daily surf conditions, Oahu events, things to eat, etc. But the room wasn't so bran-new. Some renovations are needed, it's not critical, just some minor things you would notice. I would also prefer to have some shelves in a wardrobe. Anyway, you're not here to sit in a room. So, we weren't dissapointed. What else.. medium-sized room, rather clean, nice bathroom (also may need to be a little bit renovated), very good WiFi signal. A balcony is a very nice thing. I suppose, most or even all? rooms have balconies. We had the Downtown view. If you're lucky, some of rooms must have the ocean view (just an assumtion based on the building layout).Another nice touch. They provide you with beach towels free-of-charge. Be sure to ask about it in the morning. Once, they ran out of it when we asked for it in the afternoon. What drew my attention is that I'd found out about beach towels thing from some brochures in the room not from the staff (of course, it's not obligatory but would've showed client treat).So, the staff and hospitality in general. I am rather satisfied than not, but it could be better. Just a couple of examples. The first one.They kindly agreed to receive a delivery for us (I had a broken wrist and was waiting to get a special cover for my cast). But it was me who inquired about its status all the time. They told me they would tell me once it's arrived but I had to ask myself. Of course, it's also not obligatory but, once again, would be very nice as the hotel tries to show oneself as client-oriented. The second one. Mustn't be the case for most of the people, but we had mostly cash for our trip due to this crazy ruble rate (you never know how the bank will convert it to dollar the next day). The hotel requires a deposit for incidental charges and for the hotel stay. A gentleman, who checked us in, in the late night hour (24 hours desk is definitely a plus), allowed us to pay in cash for the room and also to provide a cash deposit (though in amount exceeding a card deposit). We were told that it was exceptional and some staff members, possibly, wouldn't checked us in. Yes, it's a very particular and uncommon situation that wouldn't be an issue for 99.9% guests but it would be helpful to clearly describe all the conditions in a reminder email they send.In conclusion, a slight misunderstanding with staff or a room probably lacking of renovation couldn't outshine the beautiful location, the reasonable price and Hawaiian relaxing atmosphere. Next time I'm in Oahu, I would probably go for this place.

We booked the Shoreline for our week in Hawaii because I thought the photos looked like it was a modern but still affordable hotel so we could spend more money on shopping but not go without that fresh feel, boy was I mistaken.The location is the only great thing about this place oh and the free pineapple iced tea, I would definitely not stay here again and would rather choose an outdated décor hotel with better customer service that is higher reviewed than this place for sure. We should have booked the VIVE HOTEL with free breakfast instead.Bad things: The reception is the worst we have ever experienced. The two Asian looking guys are unfriendly and standoffish. They expected a tip after we flew 10hrs and waited almost 5hrs to get into our room. When people would walk past they did not greet or say hello ever, they would just look away and act busy, not the charm you expect from a front reception. In my opinion this is CRUCIAL to a stay, they were not overly helpful, did not provide bus maps or anything unless we probed. It was like we had to force information out of them. We felt apprehensive every time we walked through lobby area as there was certainly no 'Joie de Vivre' whatsoever. We kept saying wouldn't it be great if we had helpful, friendly and outgoing people at reception. There was one girl at the last day who was a breath of fresh air though and was what you would expect. The other guys are severely bringing down the hotel morale and should be replaced if they expect people to have a good experience.The room gets really stuffy, you need aircon on almost all the time, the rooms are small and dingey not like the pictures and they are not well laid out, aircon is loud & blows on you at night.The bathroom toilet flooded once, they did not apologise and just said housekeeping will take a look. It was fixed but didn't seem to work properly. The shower hot water isn't hot either, you wait 5 mins for lukewarm water to come through. LADIES the lighting in the bathroom is one of those seedy fluorescent lights you see in office buildings, I literally looked like a goblin the whole time under this lighting and that was actually really off-putting, unforgiving and totally inappropriate for a hotel bathroom. Fresh sheets were questionable. We had a problem with our hire car booking and had to use the room phone at midday, housekeeping staff were pushy and knocked 4 times in a half hour period to get us out, even though it states its available till 5pm?! We explained what was happening but then reception even called us to ask when we were leaving. This was very rude. The last day our bathmat was missing so had to stand on handtowel. My advice - If you want to maximise your time in paradise stay in a hotel with great front desk service as its paramount to knowing where to go what to do and how to get around but also just makes you feel great while you're there! Try the Vive Hotel or Coconut Waikiki, anything right near this location will be great. Included breakfast would help speed things up.Warning - Don't stay here until its renovated and re-staffed.

First time in/on Hawaii, we have noticed during plenty of vacations that people gets more and more friendly the further west you go, Hawaii, the islands are as far west you can go in US and our statement was 100% fullfilled.The long trip from Sweden to Hawaii (18h) was well worth every minute on our two week of happy vacation.Shoreline hotel was a really good experience, ALL personal was 100% friendly and always easy to communicate, they did eveything to please us, even a surpricing birthdaygift. If possible we would love to reurn to Hawaii and Shoreline hotel located close to the beach, close to shopping, restaurants and public transportation.:0)ALOHA and best regards from Jeanette & Olle

To be honest, I wasn't initially impressed with the Shoreline Hotel or with Waikiki in this general area. It took me about 10 minutes circling around the block to figure out where to park (the answer was you drive up a ramp that says "Valet Parking" while you check in. I highly recommend paying for the parking if you have a car and plan to use it to tour the island). I was, however, very impressed right off the bat with the friendly staff. The desk managers were both very knowledgable, courteous and professional. The valet parking attendant doubled as the bellmanand he too was pleasant and helpful, as was his relief on the following day. The desk staff and bellman began to turn around my negative first impression. When I got to the room, I found it small but efficient and very clean. The general location in Waikiki, of which I was a little dubious at the start, proved to be in the middle of everything and quite convenient. A two minute walk around the block provided access to dozens of little shopping stalls with competitively priced merchandise that ranged from Hawaiian skirts and shirts, to all manner of jewelry, quilts, carved goods and signs. There was a wide variety of department stores within a two block walk, an Apple Store and a four story mall with an excellent food court on level 2. At night, the street corners transformed into stages for a variety of musicians, dancers and magicians, some of which were excellent. I especially enjoyed four street dancers who performed with flawless synchronization and individual spot performances of incredible speed and agility. One fellow whirled around on all fours, all in time to the music, and sprang into a one handed hand-stand, from which he bounced, on that one hand, at least half a dozen times. I've never seen anything to equal it. They were very talented. So in summary, the Shoreline is a great value, very neat and clean, with a five-star staff and comfortable accommodations in a central location, near to everything. We would go back if in the area again and will recommend it to our friends.

We booked Shoreline for the first two nights of our trip to Hawaii (two separate rooms, one for my parents and one for my hubby and me). Let's go through a few main points.Good things Shoreline has got going for it:1. Great location: From the airport you can take bus 19 or 20 straight to the stop that's 2 min walk from Shoreline. And it's very very easy to find. It is quite centrally located in Waikiki although on on the beach, which is protected by a concrete line of hotels and resorts. But you can easily walk onto the main strip with all the shops within a min. It's got a restaurant pretty much on premise and the famous rice ball shop next door. So you will never go hungry :)2. Reasonable rates: we got this deal through booking.com at a "genius" price and compare to the majority of Waikiki lodging options, it offered a rather reasonable rate. So if you are only using your hotel for crashing at night and plan to spend very little time in it, this is a good choice. Otherwise you wouldn't be very comfortable for the following reasons, which are also the Bad and unfortunate aspects about this place:1. Condition: I'd have to say this is one of the more run-down places I've seen in a while, even comparing to many pensions and hostels in less advanced parts of the world. I assure you that it's not what the professional photos look like. The carpet is very old and it just has that "given up" look to it. The bathroom tiles, although mopped, are permanently stained with dirt and grime. There are water leakage marks behind the toilet and etc. However everything is functional. 2. AC: I definitely caught a cold here in this hotel as the AC vent is directly facing our bed. It looks like a ceiling vent but on the wall, the direction of airflow cannot be changed.
