The only thing you can do is turning it off. Due to the humid condition of the room, even at a very high temperature setting, the air gave me a chill. But if you turn it off completely, it will get so stuffy and uncomfortable in the room.3. Noise: The hotel is in the middle of a commercial block so expect a lot of noise, even through the night. The view is abysmal, just other buildings all around it. But if you go up to the top deck where the pool is, you can see a sliver of the sea.4. Our horrible misfortune (I'm sure this is not a normal occurrence, but do consider the quality of service): long story short, on our second night the door lock of my parent's room gave up and this took us 4 trips up and down to the main desk to figure out. After about 30 mins, my parents were offered a temp room to sleep, note that they are without any essentials, and we were flying to Molokai the next day. The room is on a different floor and looked like a staff lounge. Later I asked for toiletries, which we had to fetch ourselves, only they were available as the front desk claimed. So that caused us more time getting stuff from our room and sending them to my parents. By then it was 11:30 pm. Then we get a call from the front desk asking if my parents can go back to their original room as the locksmith who is off site and came in an hour after being called for could not fix the lock and once he's gone, the door would not work again... The front desk took the liberty to wake my parents first without success before calling us to go and get my parents. At this point I just lost it. We found out that the locksmith actually went and knocked on their door after they didn't answer the phone and demanded that they move back. Being exhausted, they didn't. After all, we all got no sleep because basically the lack of facility maintenance became our burden and the locksmith's convenience was placed over that of 4 guests. We are not fussy travelers, we try to make do with what we have and not tolerates a lot of small imperfections. But this was just so sad! We probably spent more than an hour explaining this to the front desk the next morning. In the end, the manager waived the fee for one room for the second night. In my opinion, they didn't deserve anything for the 2nd night because none of the 4 of us got any sleep, plus dealing with the unpleasant and frustrating situation that's not our responsibility at all. Isn't rest and sleep the reasons for our staying in hotels?I try to stay objective in my reviews, otherwise the poor customer service alone would warrant a zero rating. But I understand that this is an uncommon situation and it wouldn't happen to all of the guests staying there. So this is as an indication of the general quality of this establishment.

Nice hotel on a cetral location. beach is just a block away. Walking distance to shops, malls and public transport. Room we stayed in was average but good enough for the price. Friendly and helpful staff. They had 2 types of iced tea in the lobby for their guests.

This is a perfectly nice hotel. The rooms are comfortable, the location nice, the restaurant—the Heavenly—on the bottom floor is delicious. But you get what you pay for. Though not cheap, there’s a reason it’s one half the cost of the Waikiki Beach resorts—it’s not luxurious and it’s about five blocks from the beach. Some minor complaints—the AC was inconsistent, first too hot, then too cold—and there were very loud trucks on the street every morning about 530 or 6 am. The people at the desk were very friendly, but sometimes their information seemed questionable. Overall, a nice enough hotel and if you want to be in Waikiki, but can’t afford the resorts or are there for business not beach, this is the place for you. One note: when they say “partial ocean view” for some rooms, the view is very partial--you can see the ocean a few blocks a way, behind and to the side of the big apartment building next door!

My first solo holiday, but second time to Honolulu, I had a great stay at the Shoreline Hotel, arrived a little after 7am to hotel, couldn't check in straight away but that was ok, I was able to get changed and freshen up. I left my bags in their care and headed off for some breakfast, returned a little while later and was able to get into my room, it was very nice, clean bathroom, comfy bed with six,yes,six! pillows that if I had enough room in my bag I would have taken them home! Very friendly staff that acknowledged me each time I came and went, would highly recommend this hotel to family and friends and would definitely stay here again, great location close to shops and restaurants, the bus and trolleys. Thank you Shoreline Hotel for a great holiday

Fair/good location in second row behind the Waikiki Strip. Rooms clean yet a little bit old. No breakfast available. Parking was not free of charge (25$/day including vallet parking as only type of parking). Staff was very friendly. Free internet available. Overall we were sattisfied as we wanted a price-value stay for this trip and Waikiki top hotels were just unaffordable. Hawaii is fabulous and incredibly beautiful, an absolute must visit.

Stayed here for a week. Unit is nice and clean and in great location but cheaper than beachfront and it was. Initially in room beside lift with partial ocean view, but it was noisy and we moved to normal cheaper room. Partial ocean view was not worth it, since it was only very partial and most view was to ugly unit block next door. Normal view was nicer we thought. Front desk staff were very pleasant, and free cucumber/lemon water, iced tea, tea/coffees in foyer was great. Wifi was very good I thought, though I didnt try streaming video or anything data hungry. Shower was great I thought - not super water flow like some upmarket hotels Ive stayed in, but nice even spread of water - thumbs up. The air-con was very off and on, so it seemed cool and then warm, and hence we changed to colder temp so that it never got warm - not ideal but worked for us.

Located on Seaside, one block from the beach, the Shoreline has no real views to speak of. Having said that, you will not find a better run "boutique" hotel on Waikiki, nor one that is so affordable. Rooms are small (which is common here) but you'll get a full bath, a comfortable mattress, a quiet surrounding, a caring, attentive staff, and a digitally temperature control that does its job silently. My room had a fridge and microwave, a gorgeous TV, and even a tiny balcony upon which to enjoy first or last light of the day. I would definitely go back as the experience was excellent and beyond common from start to finish...as one cannot find a better option near the water.

I enjoyed 2 nights here and then looked for a bit more savings. I actually went to 3 other hotels in the 100-150 range and looked at their rooms. Nasty. Old, outdated, musty, mildewed... I also looked at a Hostel very nearby, which was a bargain at $35/night for a bunk bed in a shared room with 3 other folks... but I'm a (credit)-card carrying middle-aged man, and I wanted some privacy and a place to nap. I've stayed in plenty of Hostels and I can get in the funky, chatty, ratty traveler groove, but this trip I didn't feel particularly social. So I went back to the Shoreline for 3 more nights.Rooms are CLEAN, design/remodel choices are smart if modest. Rooms are small-- I don't care about that. Staff was super nice, free coffee and iced tea was appreciated. Hotel is in the middle of tourist district, which is not my main thrill but there I was, Warm in Hawaii for $119 a night plus tax.First room, on 6th floor, was a tad shinier and newer than second room I rented on 5th floor. I suppose it had seen less traffic.There's a simple but clean and effective pool on the roof. Beach is a 5 minute walk. No complaints at all. Heartily recommended.

I was very happy with the service and hospitality at Shoreline Hotel. There's isn't anything I can say in the negative. My family of 4 stayed in the suite with King bed with pull out bed for the kids. It was enough room for us. They also had queen beds available and these options were important to us because so many hotels have double beds instead of queen.

I was beyond pleased staying here. The location is in the center of waikiki but still off the main strip so quiet. The room although smaller was clean, simple and beautiful. Pineapple ice tea and cucumber mint water are in the lobby. The people are kind and gracious. Love love this place.

We were there for a week or so it was planned. We had to leave as a result of a health issue. They were very concerned for my well being and cancelled the final 4 days without any question and made us feel like there was a genuine concern for us.

Daniel Floren was the best front desk man he looked after my partner and I and I. He was very accommodating with all of our requests. Keep up the great work Daniel - Shoreline is lucky to have you!! I have been to Hawaii 3 times now and can honestly say I would stay at Shoreline again on my next trip. The staff had great contacts to book tours and car hire and helped with after hours maintenance also.

We just got back from a week at the Shoreline in Honolulu. This small, boutique-like hotel was a real find for us, thanks to Travel Zoo, a website where we got a rate of $109 per night, plus tax. There were no tacked on fees, i.e., "resort fee" that many of the hotels in Waikiki have. We had a clean, comfortable room with all the necessary amenities. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Cucumber-lime ice water, pineapple ice tea, and coffee were always available in the lobby, along with a bowl of crispy apples. We appreciated having the daily paper, as well as the business center when it came time to print our boarding passes for our flight home. We thoroughly enjoyed the restaurant, Heavenly, that is part of the complex. The food is organic, locally sourced and delicious. We also got a 10% discount as guests of the Shoreline. We really wanted to give the hotel five stars, but as good as the restaurant was, having our room located directly above it made for a noisy night. I'm sure if we had been higher up or on the opposite side of the hotel, this would not have been a problem.

Great location a very short block away from the main strip! It was great! We stayed 2 nights. The roof top pool is nothing spectacular; just a small old pool with a few lounge chairs. The room has no other mirror besides the mirror in the bathroom. There's a microwave, so that's a plus! Valet is $28/night (a bit pricey). WIFI in-room is free. Mini fridge is a good size. Small flatscreen TV... more like the size of a computer monitor... We had a view of the alley, which can get quite loud during garbage day :( Overall, great experience with this boutique/hipster hotel. Friendly staff. Clean rooms. No complaints here!

We only stayed one night, did not use its beach towels, but felt the location would be great - near the beach, eateries and shopping. We had a clean and comfortable room, with a microwave oven and mini refrigerator, WiFi was free. The lobby is spacious, have many seats for guests to relax. There are free coffee and teas and computer/printer for free printing of boarding passes. We especially like their professional, helpful, and friendly staff.

Just returned from six nights at the Shoreline and it was delightful! It was adorable and comfortable. It was well appointed and VERY CLEAN!! The staff was always helpful and friendly. We had a room on the 14th floor and for the most part it was very quiet. You do hear the garbage trucks in the wee hours but I'm not sure there is any getting around that when you're in such an urban setting. The refreshing cold tea and cucumber water in lobby hit the spot when coming in from a day of activities. In the room there was a keurig with two complimentary pods; but you can hit the store and buy more. There wasn't a dresser to unpack for my 6 nite stay but all in all very cormfortable.My only recommendation to the hotel would be to add a few more chairs around the pool. It is a tight area but I think chairs and a little table would be fine as I'm not sure too many recliners would fit. This is a good value and the location can't be beat. Two blocks from the beach and two blocks from the canal if you want to get in a power walk or a run. The Udon Noodle is just a block away- so wonderful and such a good value. We took the city bus to Pearl Harbor- it took about an hour each way but can you beat the $2.50 fare each way; I don't think so! I would definitey stay here again.

Perfect location, just behind the big resorts but half the price - 2 mins to shops & beach with H&M on your doorstep! Not 'luxury' but really clean and comfy, we don't spend much time in the hotel/room on holidays so was perfect for us.

Checked in with no problems and staff was friendly and helpful.Room was simple and good enough for a cheaper end hotel stay. The bathroom was small and our light-switch was broken, same with the sliding door to the balcony. This was irritating because you use the switches a fair amount, but not a huge deal breaker problem. If you want clean towels and new sheets everyday you have to put a note on the bed and towels in the bathtub.Complimentary beach towels were handy and the wifi connection was good.Overall, not bad. I've stayed in better hotels in Waikiki though (courtyard by Marriott).

The big hotels have much more to offer with multiple pools and multiple restaurants and big staff. This hotel has few employees but it is comfortable, relaxed, clean and better placed. easy walk to beach, close to shops and restaurants. has a roof top pool if you don't want the sand one day

Stayed in a room with a King bed for 5 nights in November 2014. Was on the 4th floor, facing a side street (Waikulo Way), nothing interesting to see, can be quite loud with trucks but we didn't mind it since we're used to noise outside our window. If you're sensitive & wake up easily to noise, as for a room higher up. Room was very clean, enough room for 2 people, decor was modern, and you have everything you need. Lobby was nice, especially with the drinks on your way in/out. Staff was always friendly and helpful with anything we needed. We got beach towels everyday, they kept our luggage for us for a few hours after checking-out/until we headed to the airport, and they even let us borrow a scale to weigh our bags. We did use the valet parking here for 1 night with our rental car which cost $25, but parking is pretty much around that price around Waikiki. The best part about this hotel was the LOCATION. We loved that it was central, 5 minutes from the beach, and right off of the main strip. There are so many food options closeby, and easy to hop on/off transportation. Would definitely stay here again.

I have been to Waikiki 4 times now, but this was the first time staying at the Shoreline Hotel. I can't believe I waited so long to book this place because it's been the best hotel I've been to yet! I arrived from Sydney really early in the morning, and I was lucky enough that there was a room already available to check into. The room was a great size for my friend and I, and the bed was one of the most comfortable ever - 5 pillows EACH! The room amenities were perfect; clean and well maintained. I was happy to see a balcony, because it's rare to have them nowadays. We didn't have "ocean" views or anything, which we didn't mind at all as we came to Hawaii to enjoy the outdoors, not to stay in our rooms. In saying that though, we did have one day where we lounged in bed all. day. long... watched TV, ordered room service and made the most of their free in-room WiFi connection.Another plus was having the restaurant 'Heavenly' right next door. It's an absolutely amazing restaurant specialising in organic, healthy meals and drinks. I loved their shakes and every meal on their menu was tasty and refreshing. All members of the Shoreline staff were very polite and accommodating. Daniel and Jerome in particular were genuine and nice from the get-go and helped with any queries we had in a professional and prompt manner. They made us feel very welcome and at home, greeting us warmly by our first names. From the personal greetings, to the daily noticeboard, to hand-written letters from housekeeping.. it is clear the team do all they can to make your stay at the Shoreline as welcoming and pleasant as possible. Thanks Daniel, Jerome, and the rest of the team at the Shoreline for making our stay so memorable and enjoyable. We will be sure to recommend the hotel to all our friends and family!

Best place to stay and enjoy your vacation. centrally located at the waikiki beach and surrounded by shops and restaurants. Surely try their restaurant - "Heavenly". great services, pleasant & caring people all ard the hotel. highly recommend this hotel.

The rooms are okay but not very modern looking! The room we were staying was very noisy because its so close to the main street where all the traffic is. We had a terrible view which was facing an old garbage looking building. There was a coffee machine in room but there was a $2.00 charge on the coffee, however there was a free coffee and tea in the lobby! Our overall experience was alright and I would say its an average hotel. The great thing is the location which is very close to Waikiki beach shoppings and Restaurants. I would highly recommend the Restaurant in the lobby which we got a 10% discount coupon. The food is very fresh and tasty.

We stayed at Shoreline Hotel Waikiki while other family members stayed at two other hotels. Overall it was pleasant stay. Ask front desk staff for tips on where to go, as they can help you where to go without trying to sell you package or something. They are friendly and willing to spend time with you. They also can help you with late check-out if room is available. If not late check-out, they can hold the luggage for you, so that you can check-out and go around town to enjoy the last day and maximize the trip. The front desk staff is also willing to help arrange shuttle service or taxi (you pay for the service, as none of the hotels in Waikiki seem to have free shuttle - but still nice that they can arrange it)

This hotel is fantastic value for money and the location is great! Short walk away from the beach, many good restaurants and shops. Initially we were put in a room on the second floor which was ok but then got offered to move to a room on the 7th floor which was much better and very grateful for that. There is a great restaurant next door called Heavenly and from reading other reviews apparently you can get 10% off if you stay at Shoreline, wish we were told about this as we ate there a couple of times. Other than that Zhi at the front desk was very helpful and offered wonderful advice and was always friendly. Wifi worked well in the rooms and was free woo. Would definitely stay here again if I visit Waikiki again

What an amazing little boutique hotel!! We found this little gem on Trip Advisor of course so decided to try it out from all the great reviews we heard so much about. We were going to stay in a big beaut hotel but decided on something a little smaller and less busy, well we were glad we chose this place absolute central and conveniently located and off the main road, just walk out on the street, Starbucks across the road in the Trade Centre, Abc shop also across the road. Just of the main Rd Kalakaua Ave and the beach only a couple blocks away.The hotel itself was amazing as so too the staff, free ice tea, coffee and iced water also they had a bowl of fruit out so you just helped yourself, but our room was the best part, well worth the money for a bit of leg room and luxury, can't comment on the noise from the other rooms cause we were right on the top floor so didn't really hear much, but if i was coming back i'd definitely stay here again!!

Got upgraded to junior suites and it was awesome! Rooms are very clean, building is easy to find and very near waikiki beach, restaurants and shops. Friendly and very helpful receptionist. Wifi is slow at the lobby at first but eventually picked up especially when we came up to the room. Overall, good value for money.

This hotel was in such a brilliant location in Waikiki and a short walk to the restaurants/shops & beach.Located next door is a great eating place for breakfast and hotel had good WiFi too.Room was quite small but were weren't in there for long as out sight seeing. If you just want a place to sleep & drop your bags off then this is the place. Balcony, TV, fridge, coffee machine in a clean & comfortable room. We stayed for 2 nights here including New Years Eve but it wasn't noisy only celebrations going on outside. There is a pool on the roof.

This was my second consecutive year staying at the Shoreline Hotel. We loved it that much! I called Front desk and spoke to rep named Zee prior to our arrival. We have a 6 month old baby boy so a crib and a larger room was necessary. He listed our requests on the reservation so that when we arrived, there wouldn't be any problems. Zee was awesome, friendly and professional. Needless to say that, everything went perfectly and our stay couldn't be any more enjoyable. Again, great value for location. Thx Shoreline!

First, let me say that the lication is great. Short walk to shopping, beach, and restaurants. I have two big complaints. First, the rooms we were given were terrible, low floors, small, view of alley and parking lot. "Each room has a balcony"; well, ours was more like a small, dirty ledge with one plastic chair. Not a boutique experience. Next, a boutique hotel is all about service. It was hit or miss. Many of the staff were friendly enough, but the main answer to any question was "no". I had family arriving after a long flight and wanted to check them in so they could refresh themselves, say noon or one. The answer was "check in is at 3pm". Then I asked if our room could be made up so they could rest there until theirs became available. "Can't promise anything" was the answer to that one (almost at noon).We were then going to Maui for 4 days, returning to the Shoreline after. I asked if we could store 1 bag until our return, just as I was about to head, in a rush, to the airport. It was items that weren't needed and wanted the added delay and cost of checking a bag and lugging it around. The answer was a lecture on their not wanting to accept liability and their limited storage space. I was offered a cash option to pay an unknown third party a $20 fee plus $5/day to come pick up, store and return the bag. I was stunned, having stored bags many times before, but stressed, with no options, and running out of time, I paid (of course leaving a bag with no receipt, with an unknown third party, no liability there, right?). After we returned, I limited our stay and moved to an excellent hotel that I will review separately. Finally, this might sound petty, but the beds weren 't all that comfortable (too soft), the tv was small and hard to see, the toiletries were 'mix and match' different brands, and the soap was old (dry, almost sandpapery on your skin -noticable and unpleasant). A bit of foolish penny-pinching going on here. In conclusion, a boutique hotel needs more than some hipster furniture in the lobby and some pineapple tea. It needs a service mentality and more helpful staff. Giving someone crappy rooms when they book multiple rooms for multiple stays is a bad idea. Sadly, Waikiki is pretty much like many tourist areas, where its about grabbing as much cash as possible, and don't worry about repeat business (and I have stayed at a number of JDV hotels and had better experiences).

I enjoyed my 3 night stay here. Got a deal on Travelzoo. Some small perks was free coffee, tea . Pineapple ice tea & lemon in lobby. Free beach towels to borrow & 10% discount to restaurant next door. Q-tips & makeup remover swabs was nice. Our balcony faced a parking lot so nothing to see but great place to hang your wet bathing suit to dry overnight. Beds were comfortable had lots of soft pillows. I liked the Koehler shower too lol. Good sized flat screen tv unlike Aqua wave Waikiki hotel. No annoying resort fee. Pool small on rooftop but didn't have time to go because beach was a 5 min. walk away. Parking lot was full when I arrived but they sent us to one right across st which was $4 cheaper per night anyway. Came out to $24 with unlimited in/out access. Girl at front desk from NJ was super friendly & made checking out a breeze. Thumbs up to her!

had just a little issue when we arrived as the room was short a bed called front desk told them the issue went down picked up room key with right amount of beds no extra charges .. room was super clean and staff were awesome

We enjoyed our stay at the Shoreline. This was our first visit to O'ahu and the hotel staff were all very helpful. We especially appreciated Karin and Zhi at the front desk for their warm welcome when we checked in and each time we returned from sightseeing. The also offered helpful restaurant, shopping and excursion recommendations. An added treat were the iced teas available in the lobby from morning through evening. The room was very clean and comfortable. The "partial ocean view" was uninspiring but the rooftop pool offered a nice view of the sunset over the ocean. Recommend going with the "city view" because we didn't end up spending much time in our room during the day and the beach was a block away.We would stay here again on a return visit to O'ahu.

We stayed at the Shoreline Waikiki for one night on our stay in Oahu. We got the Queen city view room with the last minute special, which was a great deal! The staff was helpful and friendly, the room clean and modern. The location was the best part, just a short walk to the beach, and surrounded by much pricier resorts. Valet parking is expensive and there is a shortage of overnight options in the area, but it sounds like this is typical for Waikiki. The valet service itself was exceptional. Would definitely stay here on a return trip to Honolulu!

I really enjoyed this place. The room was very affordable, clean, comfortable and and in a desirable location.I arrived to the hotel at 8AM and asked to check in. They managed to get me a room right away which was great. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful with all of my needs.The only complaint I had was the price parking. I self parked and it was $24/night.Slightly pricey since the hotel I stayed at during my last visit only charges around $18/night and is in the same area.Overall I enjoyed this place. I would stay here again.

This was my first stay at the Shoreline, but it will certainily not be the last! The front desk people were efficient,professional and friendly. Each request was received well and fulfilled. It is so nice to be able to relate to such people. The room I had was a city view and that is what I got - a view of other high rises,f acing wesst; but the wonderful part of it all was one did not feel trapped in. There was space and that space contained a silence which was perfect. No traffic noises fro the street - just perfect to sleep soundly. The room was simple and modern contributing again to a relaxing atmosphere. While housekeeping kept the room clean, they really need some training so that all are on the same page and service is consistent. Good restaurants are nearby - expensive and moderate and even cheap. The beach is only a five minute wak away. And prices so far are reasoanble and much less than those on the strip. You really will enjoy a stay here. I did.

I thought we would come to regret reserving a hotel not on Waikiki beach. I am glad to write that I do not regret my decision. This hotel is where you want to be. In the heart of Waikiki, walking distance to everything inluding Waikiki beach. Near the bus that will lead you to many of the sights people come to Oahu for... Also to the right of the hotel is Heavenly Island Lifestyle Restaurant which I just gave a rave review about because the food is real good. They have a nice refreshing pineapple iced tea which is so good after coming from touring or shopping. Good modern hotel, for a goid price.

The front desk and valet staff were friendly and helpful. Though very small, the rooms were clean and comfortable. It's great for tourists who want to walk to the beach, shops and restaurants and the staff is very knowledgeable about the Waikiki area. if you want a bigger room with less parking charges, there are others in the area that might be better. All in all, it was a nice place to stay.

Very nice and updated hotel, great location and perfect service. We are very satisfied by our choice of this hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Nice room that had everything we needed and you could always get complementary beverages as coffee and water in the lobby.

In between flights, I needed accommodation in Honolulu for one night's stay, this hotel was chosen for its location - within walking distance to the beach, restaurants and malls.Check-in was quick and easy, the lobby area was bright and nicely designed, it was particularly welcoming with strong air conditioning to combat the sweltering heat and humidity outside, the area also has comfortable sofas, a computer station, drink station and fresh fruits for guests. The room was bright and presentable. It has a firm-ish king size bed with decent beddings, 4 pillows, bedside lamps and tables, TV, iPod dock, free WiFi, a small dressing table, a stool, bar fridge, tea/coffee facilities, 2 small bottles of water, small balcony overlooking the next building, ample luggage rack, a wardrobe with 2 bath robes and some hangers, a safe, brightly lit bathroom that comes with a hairdryer and good toiletries.The room was relatively clean and sleep was comfortable.The bathroom can get stuffy after showering and towels don't dry as a result, housekeeping should also tone down their use of chlorine for the place smell like a swimming pool.Although there is a swimming pool on the hotel's roof, I was disappointed to learn that there is no facilities for a quick shower/change before catching a long haul flight in the evening (there is no facilities at Honolulu airport either except for military personnels and their families). Staff were generally not pleasant except for one, who was patient enough to recommend her favourite place for lunch.I will not stay here again.Tip for quick bite: there is a great little hole-in-a-wall place in the next door building that sell take-away bento (lunch) boxes, it's good food for a good price!

We chose this hotel because of its location, and the previous reviews. We are so happy with our choice. The location is brilliant - so close to everything you need in Waikiki. The hotel has recently been renovated and is very clean and inviting. The rooms are relatively small but comfortable. The staff were very friendly and happy to help with any need. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel.

We did a lot of research before booking here and were glad we did for our stay in Honolulu, brief though it was. The room was clean and modern. The bed was comfortable and there were no issues of bedbugs to be found in my research. The staff was friendly and very accommodating. It was walking distance to the beach, and to the shopping center down the street which was great for a bite to eat after 11 hours on a plane. I'd definitely consider it if I were planning to go back to Honolulu.

Rooms and hallways are dated & smelly. Carpet was stained & smelly, both in my room and in the hallway. As soon as you entered the hallway, there was like a sewerage smell. It was horrible. The carpet in the hallway, lifts and rooms needs to be replaced. They ran out of regular milk in lobby for tea and coffees - they only had vanilla milk (I think it was vanilla) which tasted horrible. They should never run out of a staple product like regular milk.

I did lots of research before booking our room for this trip. This little hotel met my criteria of being; reasonablly priced, clean, modern, close to the beach, and friendly. This staff is top notch!! Everyday there is a cute informational billboard that tells you the weather, how big the waves are, a local word and food to learn and try, and local events. Fresh fruit, coffee, tea, and water daily. It isn't a huge hotel but that's why we really liked it. It was off the busier and louder Wakiki streets. Our room had a microwave and fridge which allowed us the opportunity to buy food and save some money from eating out so much.

We stayed from 12/27-1/3...What an amazing expierence...Mona from the Front Desk called us on our second day to checkon us and ensure we were happy with our room WOW...Jerome was very helpful in providing us ideas on how to spend our New Year's Eve...Alex and Kristi were also amazing....The hotel is very close to the beach, which where we spent most of our time...I would recommend everyone who is going to Ohau to stay here...great value, amazing staff, close to the beach....clean room....No disappointments....

We stayed at this Hotel in Dec. to go see the Christmas Lights in Honolulu. They are attentive and very polite to all Guest. Rooms were very nice and comfortable to be in. Close to Ross which made shopping easy for my wife. We both enjoyed our stay here and well come back again.

The only positive thing I can say is that the hotel was fairly clean and the location was amazing. We had two rooms, we paid for one King bed, and a second room with two double beds. My husband and I had a room with one double bed (not the King we paid for) it was the smallest room I've ever been in, the rooms in Paris were larger. One of us had to stand by the door so the other person could get around the bed to use the restroom. It was so small it had only one night stand. Pictures on their website show a room with a king bed and it is an average size room. Not as advertised. It looks like they tried to update the room a bit, but nasty water stains on the popcorn ceiling dated the place. The whole week we were at the hotel we never received clean towels until we called the front desk. Housekeeping would take our dirty towels each morning but never replace new towels, we called the front desk each afternoon when we came back from the beach asking for towels. We never had our sheets changed in the 8 days we were at the hotel. My kids sheets were so dirty with black spots all over them from not being changed. Thanks to our horrible experience with this hotel, I doubt I would ever take my family back to Honolulu ever again.

The location is really good. it is a good place to get around. the staff are very nice. free wifi is a complimentary. Only thing not that good is the room is a little small. But the room is really clean and comfortable.

Turned out to be the best hotel we stayed at during our 2 week vacation. The price is great value for Hawaii, especially in Waikiki. The hotel itself is sleek and modern looking, outside and in. The front desk staff are great; the receptionist lent us her beach umbrella when we asked where we could buy one. There is cucumber water, iced tea and coffee in the lobby everyday for guests. The location is fantastic, just one block down from the main street and the beach. Just walk straight down the street and through the Sheraton hotel to get to there. Lots of restaurants and shops in the area. Right next door is a great restaurant/cafe called Heveanly which we ate breakfast at a few times. We will stay here again next time we are in Honolulu. Outstanding value!

This hotel deserves all the good reviews! The location is absolutely perfect, close to the beach and all kinds of restaurants. The staff is very friendly and the pineapple tea in the lobby is delicious!

I was pretty shocked at the low room rate I paid, given the hotel's prime location and clean, modern rooms (note - I travelled in October and paid off-season prices). Beach access is right across the street through the Sheraton hotel lobby. Lots of coffee shops and good restaurants nearby to suit all budgets.Rooms are quiet, with free wifi that was pretty speedy. Hotel offers free beach/pool towels. The only downside was the rickety-looking balconies (small with wire handrails) and cramped rooftop pool that might give you vertigo.
user_name:
Holly B
Birmingham, England, United Kingdom

review_body: Stayed here during the Diamondhead Classic Basketball Tournament. This hotel was two short blocks from the Main Street in Waikiki; also only two blocks from the beach. Close to shopping and restaurants. The staff is friendly and helpful; for example, they looked up which bus I should take to go view the Celebration of Lights. They always asked us who won the game when we returned from the arena. Very nice lobby area. Always have water and pineapple tea ready for guests. Our room was not huge, but a comfortable size for two people; then again, who hangs out I. Their room a lot when in beautiful Wakiki! I'd highly recommend this hotel for the reasonable price, location, and excellent customer service!

Just got back from a great week in Waikiki staying at the Shoreline Hotel. We had booked the hotel through Priceline Express Deals, so were not totally sure what the accommodations would be like. Let me say that we were very happily satisfied. The hotel is a smaller one about a block from the main road. Our room was clean, comfortable, and quiet. The staff was very friendly and extremely helpful at fulfilling our requests (extra towels, taxis, etc). The location is conveniently in walking distance of most Waikiki attractions (other hotels, restaurants, shopping). About the only complaint we had for our week stay there was that my son said the pull-out sofa bed was a bit lumpy. We would definitely stay there again and feel we got an exceptional value. As an added note, my wife left her camera case in the lobby when we checked out. By the time we had returned home, there was already a phone message from the hotel staff about it and we have arranged getting it shipped home---now that is great customer service!!

Pros:First off, the hotel is at one of the best locations - close to the beach, the shopping area, and many awesome restaurants. Our favorite is Heavenly, the best breakfast/brunch place in Waikiki, and it is just in the same building with the Shoreline hotel. Also, one minute walking gives you the Blue Marlin, the great restaurants on Kuhio, and many others! The lobby of Shoreline has a very modern design. The front desk staffs are very friendly, warm and helpful. It provides pineapple iced tea, cucumber mint water, hot water, and coffee 24/7-- all for free! We also got a lot of information about the island from them (Thanks, Mona!). There are also desktop computers available for use (first ~0.5 hour is free). Our room is a standard queen-bed room, which is minimal but very cozy. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom is very spacious and clean. Having TV is great, I didn't miss the Christmas games. Oh, free Wi-Fi is available at our room and lobby. For the rate, I would definitely recommend Shoreline Hotel to anyone who would like to stay at the Waikiki area and does not plan to spend too much time in the hotel. Again, I recommend Heavenly which is just 10-second walk away but has great breakfast/brunch selections. Cons:Our room is next to the elevator (just one wall apart), so the noise was annoying at first. Since it was the peak season, it was hard to change to another room for that night. I got a pair of earplugs from the front desk for free, and could not hear any noise at all. They offered to change our room from the second night but we didn't want the hustle. If you are not super sensitive like me, you should be fine. The swimming pool is not impressive (small and no view), but it is better than nothing.

I was somewhat wary of this hotel choice from the reviews here indicating that the property was dated and in need of upgrades. In fact, I found this to be a fantastic hotel, which is more modern than any of the other big-box beach-side resorts in Waikiki. Everything was clean and well appointed, and the free wifi, lobby water and coffee were nice touches. The lanai is tiny - to the point where I was afraid I'd drop something accidentally by bumping into the railing, etc so I didn't take advantage of that, though the views areThere is no on-property dining, but that is not an issue given the many fantastic dining options around town anyway. Generally I found this to be a well-located, reasonably priced, and well-done hotel and would definitely stay again.

We stayed one night at the Shoreline before leaving Honolulu on a cruise. This hotel is clean, modern, and a great value. It is about a 5 minute walk to Waikiki but is located in the middle of great shopping and dining locations. The rooms were comfortable and well-kept. The staff was attentive and very helpful. You won't get all the luxury of a beachfront resort but you also won't have to pay the resort fees. Take note: This location is surrounded by other buildings so there is little to no view from the rooms.

I stayed here for one night in early December, as I had an early flight from Honolulu.The room wasn't quite ready when I arrived, although I did arrive before the scheduled check in time. The front desk staff made me feel welcome and offered to store my luggage so that I could explore the local area. I chose to wait, so they provided me with ccomplementary coffee and/or cold drinks while I did so.Once the room was ready, I was very pleased with the size and high standard of presentation. The bathroom was spotlessly clean and the complementary shower gel & shampoo was not only good quality, it was very welcome, since it saved me having to unpack my bag. The aircon was a little fierce for my liking, but it adjusted easily enough and the temperature was soon more comfortable. The bed was quite large and very comfortable; the linen was of an unexpectedly high quality.There was free wifi, a large TV, fridge, coffee-maker (although a charge applied for further supplies, if needed) and an in-room safe. This particular room did have a balcony, though not much of a view. However the fairly pronounced slope towards the edge made me rather nervous about spending much time out there!My only small gripe would be that the alarm clock didn't work and, had I not also set the alarm on my mobile phone, I would probably overslept and had a rushed journey to the airport.All-in-all, in the unlikely event that I returned to Waikiki (I disliked the place intently) I would have no hesitation in staying at the Shoreline again.

I stayed here the week of Thanksgiving because of great reviews on the site I booked on. It lived up to expectations. Apparently, this was a United Airlines-owned property for their layovers and since it's been managed by Joie de Vivre, it's becoming well known. From the entry in the lobby you feel the friendly spirit of the staff. They literally help with everything. Alex took my map and highlighted places that I should check out and was spot-on! Kristie was so nice and fun at the front desk, too. The room was fine, bed comfortable and only a short walk to the beach. I didn't think I would use it, but the Ross store across the street was convenient too. They have a little restaurant attached that's part of the local food scene...check it out, it was TERRIFIC! All in all, I would stay here again...ask for a high floor with partial view, I got a corner room and was very happy!

A basic, but well maintained, well positioned hotel. Not a place to spend a whole vacation, but great for a visit to Waikiki. Staff was helpful and friendly and the room was clean and attractive with a retro Hawaii feel. I would stay there again.

Beautiful boutique hotel smack dab in the heart of Waikiki. The front desk service was accommodating and friendly, the rooms were modern, clean and comfy with balconies. Also, a couple of small things that make a big difference to me - 1) quality bed and bedding and 2) a functioning radio/stereo. Many hotels cut corners on these small details, but I think they show attention to detail and the customer experience, and they nailed it all.

My husband and I just returned home after staying here for 7 nights. We stayed in a king size room which was nice and spacious, clean and the bed was very comfortable. We also had a small fridge and microwave. We stayed on the 6th floor which was pretty quiet. The reception staff are very warm and welcoming, and there is free tea/coffee/chilled water/pineapple iced tea in the lobby 24/7. The housekeeping staff are also very friendly, always saying 'Aloha' when you cross their paths. The location is FANTASTIC, with the Royal Hawaiian Shopping Centre at the end of the street and restaurants/cafes all within a few minutes walking distance. The new cafe that has opened up next door called 'Heavenly Cafe' is a good spot for breakfast. Try the pulled pork with eggs.......TO DIE FOR!!! Thanks to all the staff at The Shoreline for a wonderful stay.......made my birthday very memorable.

Firstly, before I booked the Shoreline Hotel, I had to research what hotels suited and met my requirements as follows: 1) in room fridge and microwave 2) 2-3 mins walking distance to beach and main shops 3) 24 hr desk for our late arrival 4) Internet. After extensive research, the Shoreline had met all these requirements all within our budget, and so we booked and we were not disappointed. Shoreline is faultless in everyway. The staff are attentive and polite, and the hotel is small enough to provide personalized service such as lobby coffees and deliciously tasting pineapple ice tea (free). I stayed with the Shoreline for 6 nights, and as I left I knew I was going to miss this place. The room come supplied with basically everything you need. A hair dryer, a very comfortable bed, a desk, arm chair, soaps and toiletries, information about the hotel and area, and a lot more. The air conditioning worked very well and was effectively fast! I loved the lanai facing the commercial building opposite - it added character. Unfortunately I did not have time to use the pool. But thank you for providing it. The Christmas tree looked spectacular also. Thanks for providing beach towels on request. There are so many other great things I have to say about this place, like the cleanliness and modern furniture. The place is true value for money. If you are looking for absolute beach front with water slides and extra services then your looking at tripleing the price Shoreline has. For something a stone throw away from the beach which is immaculate, Shoreline is the definite winner. I cried when I left, because this holiday took years to save up for and you really made it special for me.Thank you. December 2nd- December 9th. Mr Law.

found this wonderful place on kayak hotels. called a few days prior to our arrival and the front desk was very sweet. the hotel was beautiful. spacious lobby with cafe. they have flavored water in the lobby which was great because it was HOT! HOT! outside. Free WIFI!!went up to our room it was clean and had a balcony (not a good view) but it did not matter since we were literally minutes away from the beach. With lots of stores near by incase you forget anything or wanna pick up gifts to take back home.Staff was super helpful about directions and what would be the best thing to check out and places to eat. local eats that is. they asked us what was the purpose of our trip..my husband told them we were celebrating our 3 year anniversary. and when we came down stairs it was written on their board wishing us a happy anniversary which i thought was so sweet.  bed was cozy pillows were wonderfulbathroom is a bit small not much space to put your toiletry bags and has no vent so it gets really foggy :(overall it was great. happy we picked this place. If we ever come back to waikiki..will probably stay there again.

Staff was extremely helpful and resourceful.Mona was especially great and accomodating and made my stay wonderful.The location is convenient and just a few minutes away from beach and mall.Thanks for a great experience!!

This is a perfect hotel for short stays on a budget in a central area, with clean rooms great amenities and very helpful staff.Ross is across the street so if you forget anything its very easy topickup some extra clothes. The restaurant has a wonderful local-ishmenu from Japanese company that also does Aloha table.The christmas tree was great for taking pictures.

great place to stay . Not a tall hotel and not much view , but Hey who wants a view when your right in the middle of Waikiki ..The staff were great the front desk was great free paper and 24 hour refreshment in the lobby.

It's waikiki, how much time do you really spend in your room or in the hotel for that matter. Some of the friendliest staff around and Heavenly, the attached restaurant, is a great place to eat well prepared and presented meals at very reasonable cost.

I stayed at the Shoreline Waikiki for a week and loved it. There are cold beverages in the lobby 24/7, as well as tea and coffee and the local paper. The hotel is central to everything. Rooms are clean, quiet (not on a busy road road) and spacious. The bed was comfy, lots of pillows and luxurious. The bathroom was roomy and clean, newly updated i think. We had a microwave and a fridge - handy for leftovers. There is a restaurant on site Heavenly Island, we tried breakfast and lunch there, both were great. There is a Ross store across from the hotel, we bought extra luggage there, also great for clothes, bags, shoes etc. Rooms are equipped with complimentary fast WIFI. Staff were always friendly and courteous. I'll definitely be staying there again.

This hotel is central to everything! We loved staying here. The rooms are very quiet and quite spacious. The beds are extremely comfortable and the bathrooms have been updated and are modern with all amenities. The inclusion of a microwave is also a bonus as we were able to heat up our leftovers in our room. The pool is on the roof and lacks inspiration. It is clean but not very exciting. Great views from there though! I would definitely stay here again and recommend it. Just a suggestion to staff - please answer enquiries from guests in front of you rather than taking calls and making them a priority. I had to wait while the desk attendant took two calls.

Excellent location and customer service. Nothing was too difficult for the staff at the Shoreline, in particular, Alex and Monalyn were lovely and very helpful. We enjoyed our stay so much that we booked our final 3 nights at Shoreline after returning to Oahu from Maui. The rooms are a bit dated and the pool is nothing special, however they are clean and comfortable. Ask for a room with a queen bed as the room with the 2 x doubles was even more dated and the beds were a bit short. There's complimentary ice tea and cucumber water in the lobby, free wifi in the room and lobby, and a lovely restaurant/bar next door called Heavenly which serves clean, healthy food including acai bowls, ahi poke etc. You couldn't get a better location for your stay in Waikiki unless you prefer to stay directly on the beach.

I have stayed at more than a dozen hotels in Waikiki over the past 5 years. This hotel wins my vote hands down. The customer service is impeccable from the front desk staff to the valets. You just couldn't ask for more. A bulletin board that you see when you step off the elevator in the lobby gives you up-to-date information on weather, surf, eats, and even a Hawaiian word of the day! The front desk staff are knowledgeable about the area as well as restaurants. And the valets take very good care of your car and are expedient and efficient. Coffee, water, and ice tea are available 24/7 in the lobby as are newspapers, apples, and a little business center. The rooms are spacious with refrigerators, microwaves, coffee makers, and safes; and wifi is available free in the rooms. And the rooms are fairly quiet considering it's a noisy area. Parking is expensive and only valet, but not out of line for Waikiki. The only downfall I found is in locating the valet the first time. It's hidden off the alley behind the hotel.

Very welcoming staff, great location, comfortable bed and pillows, coffee free downstairs plus nice cold drinks, coffee maker in room, microwave in room, over all great place to stay and not far away from the beach.

1.Parking is a terrible situation, yes a discount but not via your room charge with a.separate garage company that is.poor.2.linen and cleaning service provider needs fixing, having an unplanned lack of.service for guests with no.perk for.guests get.real..3. Improve signage and way finding in the hotel like that you have a pool, no.sign in elevator.even.4.room service is needed with a mini charge bar.5 . forget valet parking if you have no signs and no parking lot...again get real.

Found this hotel on Trip Advisor and took a chance...very glad I did. The location is excellent, the staff is top notch, and the room is quite nice at a reasonable rate. We used the valet parking for our rental car and that's the way to go! Great shopping right outside the front door, and great food options as well. Would stay here again in a heartbeat! Do you self a favor and look no further...

Nice hotel in downtown Waikiki - Honolulu. Spacious rooms. Large bathroom. Two minute walk to the legendary Waikiki Beach. Great shopping and dining in the vicinity. Hotel only offers valet parking for 28$; cheaper parking nearby available. No

The room and hotel was very quiet and relaxing and a very enjoyable place to relax and enjoy in Waikiki. Very clean and a very hospitable place to stay. Easy for pick up for day tours and in walking distances to every shop you can think of, Restuarants and of course the beach.

My daughter and I went to Waikiki for a mini vacation and the Shoreline was perfectly located for exploring all it had to offer, from the beaches to the restaurants and bars and the shopping. The staff was very helpful, friendly and accommodating and we were extremely pleased with the cleanliness and comfort of our room. A great value!

Very friendly, helpful, and accommodating staff. The room was clean and well maintained, and the in room WiFi worked very well, always with full bars in signal strength. I visited Waikiki for a conference in November and this place was perfect for me. Due to its proximity to Kuhio Ave, it is well connected to public transportation, and there are several stores and restaurants nearby. I made ample use of the refrigerator in the room, which also had a microwave and a Keurig coffeemaker. The latter however came with only 2 capsules of complementary coffee, additional capsules were for purchase, which didn't seem to make much sense, because the lobby always offered complementary coffee and tea. Another plus was the provision of a beach towel, that the friendly staff handed me at the front desk after an exhausting day at work, so I could enjoy a few laps in the water at nearby Waikiki beach.All in all I was very satisfied with my stay there, and will likely pick this place again at the next opportunity.

Could not be happier with our choice to stay at this boutique hotel! Located right in the center of Waikiki, the location itself was well worth the entire cost of the week (which was not much at all!) Beach to the south, high-end shopping to the east and west, and the asian markets and restaurants to the north. Couldn't be better!Hotel service was great, recommending places to go, as well as holding our bags, assisting us with an odd-houred valet. Free wifi and pineapple tea was an added bonus.Tip: Try Heavenly cafe located adjacent to the hotel- food is amazing!

My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights starting on Nov 15th, on our way to a longer stay on Maui. We just wanted to get a taste of Waikiki for a few days and this boutique hotel served our purposes very well. The staff was very friendly and accommodating, allowing us to change the room to a higher floor after the first night, since the initial room was facing a parking lot. When we packed to move to the new room, I managed to forget my phone charger in the former room and, again, the staff proved to be very professional and found it and gave it to me promptly.We appreciated best the location, right in the heart of it all, even if it is not right on the beach, but a 5 minute walk away, just around the corner from Kalakaua Ave which has the big name shops, if you are into shopping (the Armani Exchange store on the corner was a constant temptation), the raved about Island Vintage Coffee, but also, on Seaside Ave, the newcomer well reviewed restaurants Heavenly and Blue Marlin.The rooftop pool is worth a visit close to sunset time, it has a nice view of the Royal Hawaiian resort and glimpses of the ocean.I would stay at this hotel again for sure.

Great service, comfortable beds, everything was perfect.The room was clean, the air conditioner is quit and cool. The pool is small but clean and quiet, great for relaxing and reading a book.Valet parking was swift and painless. Great bento shop right next door, and the restaurant next dooris truly excellent. Thank you!

The staff in general is very attentive, accommodating and helpful. For some reason, our room reservation got bumped out and we didn't get the original room we booked. Instead, front desk gave us a larger room...though there were two beds --- odd since it was a couples trip. We didn't mind, and the room wasn't too bad, but the bathroom was really small, and there isn't a fan for steam from the shower. Staff was very attentive every time we were on our way out to the beach and needed beach towels. One day, I needed a knife to cut open some fruit I had gotten at a farmer's market and a gentleman went out of his way to find a butter knife for me (mahalo!).Overall, loved the staff and location since we were close to the shopping area and the beach. Thanks for the great stay!

We were a bit apprehensive about booking this hotel we had not heard of previously. However, the online reviews were good, location looked ok, so we took the plunge.We were very pleasantly surprised with what we found. Location is great, less than a block to Kalakaua and then to the beach. Staff are fantastic all around. They are unfailingly pleasant, helpful and upbeat. Some are quite young, but obviously well trained and committed.Rooms are small, but very clean and quite well appointed - basically, just like the pictures you see online. So if you are looking for solid Waikiki accommodation at a reasonable price, this should be on your list!

I received a good service in Shoreline hotel. The room is as clean as new. The staff is very nice as family. The shampoo and hair conditioner is very is great. And there is one thing I want to share. I parked my car the first night here, they refund me the parking fee in the next day when I find a cheaper parking lot near the hotel next day. Then they phoned me that my car will be towed away if I parked illegally, which made me very touched. Overall, execellent service , reasonable price.I will recommend it.
user_name:
朔 杨
Boston, Massachusetts, United States

review_body: The hotel is located in the center of all Wakiki !!! Short walk to all shopping, restaurants and other actions..... the price very reasonable........the room was clean, newly remodeled with a huge batroom. The staff very friendly and ready to help you with anything !! Thank You !!!
user_name:
Raphael N
San Carlos, Sonora, Mexico

review_body: I visited Honolulu for my birthday vacation and Shoreline exceeded my expectations during my stay. Check-in went smoothly and front desk staff and housekeeping provided exceptional service. Shoreline even provided me complimentary wine and a birthday card upon my arrival, which was very sweet and welcoming on their end! The rooms are small and this hotel does has limited amenities in comparison to other major chain properties near by, but the overall location, in-room free wi-fi, small microfridge, microwave, and the room balcony are a major plus! I stayed on the 7th floor facing the Marine Surf property. It did get noisy at times, but it didn't bother me during my stay. I recommend this property for both long and short stays and definitely for solo and couple travelers. I will definitely book with Shoreline again in the future! Thanks!

Clean and very well located in Waikiki hotel, great and friendly staff, who was always accommodating and ready to provide suggestions and assistance. Highly recommend if you are looking for a reasonably priced option in Waikiki!

The Shoreline Hotel in Waikiki was a great place for a business traveler as it provided easy access to the local bus routes 2 & 13 which took me downtown to my office for business and allowed me access to the beach and good Waikiki restaurants in the evening. The room was confortable and roomy,

We had a really great stay at your hotel last week, the staff was amazing offered us tips, andadvice on what to do and where to go. The pinapple ice tea is amazing and the rooms have anice balcony to relax on. Fast wifi, right next to the shopping central area.

Good hotel, not too expensive, book the junior suite.drinks all day long in the lobby, fresh water, coffee, ice tea.Excellent service, valet parking, center of Waikiki where all restaurants are situated.shopping near by.

This little jewel is located in the heart of waikiki just a short stroll from the beachthey offer beach towels, at the front desk, and theres a lovely pool on the roof to relaxand work on my tan. Staff is knowledgeable, friendly, efficient, and courteous. Coffee, Tea, Pinapple Iced Tea(my favorite) in the lobby.Will come again!
user_name:
Jenson F
New York City, New York

review_body: There are couple of issue with this hotel:1. I stayed in room when housekeeper cleaned the room. She washed the cups in toilet and she did not use soap.2. They charge Parking fee for $28 per day and it takes so long to find valet person to bring your car.3. I requested the bell man to bring my bags to my room and I had to call three time and finally they brought it after ONE hour4. I requested the late check out and they did accept it but in the morning the management refuse to honor because they have customer who need the rooms earlier!! 5. Very poor service at front desk with limited knowledge about city. 6. Very unconformable bed.7. You have to request every day to change your sheet. If you don't ask they will change it every 5 DAYS!!!8. Coffee was cold all day long

Me and my boyfriend just loved this hotel! Everything about it was just wonderful. Close to Waikiki beach, close to the shops and close to restaurants. The only downside to this hotel is that it was very noisy around 5am due to deliveries to the shops and restaurants close by. Also, we could not open the balcony door as we would always get a strong garlic smell coming from a restaurant nearby. I would like to take the time to thank the staff at the hotel who were all extremely friendly and helpful! One gentleman in particular who had longish dark hair was lovely he would always be polite and friendly when we left/came back to the room giving us a little wave. I would be sure to stay at this hotel again if I was ever to come back. Thankyou so much Shoreline!

A small hotel, convenient to everything in Waikiki. Clean rooms, nice decor, wonderful staff, especially Taro, Karen, Alex, Ivan, Jinny and others whose names I forget (sorry). Neat views and good breakfasts at Heavenly, the attached restaurant.

Stayed here with my wife over Halloween weekend.Staff excellent and friendly.Had a room on 10th floor so views of beach and town.Room was spacious with good size bed and a wet room (no bath though) and I do love my bath.Did,nt eat in hotel so cannot comment on that,.Hotel ideal for beach as only a five minute walk away,and also the main drag

Stayed here for 3 nights, the staff was really friendly and helpful and the location is perfect for beach access, shopping, dining, and night life.The rooms are just right, and at a great value, I will be back soon!thank you!

Alright, here comes the classic "feedback sandwich". Pros: LocationBasics (clean, comfortable, safe). Free wifiCons:Underwhelming rooftop pool. Basically a square pit in the room with two deck chairs and a water fountain. One day my room wasn't cleaned - at all. Another day I left my room and the staff in the hallway asked if I "needed new towels or would I be ok?". I'm fine with reusing my towels many times during my stay, but I didnt expect him to ask when I had left my room and walked to the other end of the hall. Couldn't call down to the front desk. They didnt answer. Each time I walked by, a single staff person would be trying to handle a group of 5+ from 7:00 am - 3:00 pm. When my room was cleaned, I received a different assortment of toiletries. One day I got a makeup wipe. The rest of the days, none. One day I got extra conditioner. Another day extra shampoo. My room had no closet space to store my luggage.My lanai had no view and no chair. While there was nothing wrong, per se, with my stay, I wasn't entirely satisfied with the experience offered. I was hoping for something a bit more than the typical hotel thing. Something with a bit of flair or personal touches.

Stayed at Shoreline 9-14 Nov booked queen city view room which was ok as I traveled on my own but would definitely be a squeeze for more than one person. I would recommend and would stay againPros:• great location just off main strip of waikiki• Ross directly across from hotel - great for luggage for all your Hawaiian shopping• safe for solo traveller's• room clean and tidy• air con - great• free reliable wifi• helpful staff with good recommendations• close to public transport (Kuhio Ave a short stroll from hotel)• 20 min walk to Ala Moana Centre ($10-$13 cab back with shopping)• Island Express Shuttles used for transport to Waikele Outlet shopping definitely recommend this• Food Pantry (for supermarket supplies) 5 min walk down from hotel on Kuhio Ave• for the ladies - Sephora next door and check out neo plaza smaller beauty/cosmetics place -cute and OPI only $6.99 good range Cons: (if I was being picky)• my room didn't have tags (do not disturb etc) to hang on door handle• a couple of times it looked like top covers on bed had just been pulled up and pillows placed but bottom sheet hadn't been straightened out• no room service but lots of places to eat - the hole in the wall sushi? next door was great for a smaller meal or snackAll in all happy with my stay and would return.

It's a very nice hotel.good location,friendly staffs,reasonable price.The double room is not big,but very clean.Internet access is very fast.I have recommened this hotel to all my friends.Definetly will com back again.

We stayed four (4) nights from 9-13 Nov, 2014 and booked a larger than standard room which was fortunate as the rooms are not big. The staff are all friendly, the location very good. Throw in the free coffee & fruit in the reception area every day it's good value for money. One minor point perhaps the carpets need a change but overall a good choice and will stay again.

We booked through travelzoo, so we got a good deal. Shoreline Hotel is a great boutique hotel in the middle of Waikiki. Centrally located to restaurants, shopping, beach, and transportation. It's a Clean, quaint, not large, or luxurious and no amenities. The staff are all very nice and helpful.

I took a chance with a deal that I got on Travelzoo and boy am I glad I did! The shoreline hotel is chic, modern and clean. You're still close to all the action without having to deal with all of the traffic and walking tourists off of the main strip in Waikiki. The Sheraton is directly across the street and you can access their resort and beach from there. There was also a really great spam masubi hole in the wall joint right outside of the hotel front door for breakfast or a quick snack on the way to the beach. The hotel staff were extremely helpful in pointing us to popular local spots around the island. I will definitely be returning to Waikiki and will book a room at the Shoreline Hotel again.

As all other reviews state, the location is good if you are into shopping and being very close to Waikiki Beach. Room was clean but very small. I don't know whether all rooms are that small at this hotel. Valet parking is almost a must because there are few other options around with the same flexibility. Staff was very helpful with making suggestions of places to see on the island.

We stayed here as part of a flight deal and it was pretty good. The room was clean and we had no issues. We were out most if the time doing tours so weren't fussed in needing to stay somewhere upmarket. This place is located in the middle of it all and all our tours picked us up at the front. Staff were friendly, I'd stay here again.

very nice accomodations. nice staff, nice rooms and great location to everything in walking distance. room was clean and the bed was very comfy, nice decor and city view room was spot on. very friendly staff helped with dining suggestions.

We chose this hotel based on reviews and were not disappointed. The location was great, close to everything- beach, shops, restaurants so we were able to walk everywhere.The room was very clean and though we did not spend much time in it it was always lovely to come back to. It was great having the fridge and microwave too. Best of all was the complimentary cool drinks in the foyer which were always fresh and plentiful. The staff were friendly and knowledgeable too. We were not bothered by the lift noise that many people mentioned even though we were across the hall from the lift. Seaside Avenue is only one way and a little quieter than some of the other main roads but we slept with the balcony door open for fresh air (hate air conditioning) and it was mainly the garbage trucks we heard in the early hours that was noisy.The only problem was there were no set of drawers to unpack clothing into but adequate hanging space and bedside drawer and used my suitcase for storage.Only went up to the rooftop pool the day before we left to check it out and the view was great.The restaurant next door "Heavenly" had great food and service.Would definitely stay here again as the price was reasonable compared to the beachfront hotels but only a block away. Thanks.

One block from the beach, good rates, nice staff, and a fabulous breakfast restaurant attached to the lobby. I like the JDV hotels, they all have a good feel to them. Will stay here again -- there's loads of stuff to explore near the hotel, not just the beach.

We stayed here for five nights, the hotel is in a great location just off the main strip, 10 mins walk to wakiki beach, shops and resturants. Our room was small but very clean quiet considering we were in the city. The bed was really comfortable and we had a great nights sleep. A nice touch was the free coffee and cold drinks in reception. The staff were really friendly and recommended resturants to try. Would of give 5 stars but deducted 1 for room size, however everything else about the hotel and the staff was perfect.

This was our first stop on our honeymoon and after 24 hours travelling we arrived shattered but excited. We were told our room had been upgraded because we were on honeymoon. It was a lovely big room with (just) a sea view and the most comfortable bed ever! Nice toiletries in the bathroom too! Oh and a fridge and microwave plus a coffee machine. The hotel is located just off the main street in Waikiki where there are (expensive!) shops (think Louis Vuitton) but there's also an H&M on the corner of the street. There are also loads of restaurants but because it's the main area it's not cheap to eat out here. Instead go the other direction out of the hotel and you'll find some better value options. The Seaside Bar & Grill up the road doesn't look much but does fantastic breakfasts. From the hotel it's only a short walk to Waikiki beach (which isn't really all that!) and you can easily catch buses to Pearl Harbor, downtown Honolulu and Diamond Head from a bus stop literally 2 minutes away. There is free coffee and fruit water in the lobby all the time, as well as a bowl of apples each morning. There is also pineapple iced tea during the day which is lovely and refreshing when you've been out all day. Really could not fault this hotel. We'd definitely stay there again if we ever returned to Oahu. The only negative is that the rooftop pool is quite small and the area around it isn't really in keeping with the rest of the hotel. But you've got Waikiki beach on the doorstep so that's not exactly an issue!! Oh and you can get beack towels from reception too.The staff are all really friendly and helpful and the hotel just has a really great relaxed and friendly vibe. Much better than all the monster hotels like Marriott etc. Yeah they front the beach and have gardens and huge pools but who goes all the way to Hawaii to spend all their time in the hotel anyway! The best beach is Ala Moana beach.

I visited Hawaii for my 50th birthday and stayed at the Shoreline. I was greeted warmly and made to feel welcome from the moment that I arrived until I left! My room was cozy and I had an awesome view. Consider yourself lucky if you have the pleasure of meeting Mona! She is so friendly and sweet. She greeted me with a smile whenever I saw her. The entire staff was very accommodating. As far as location, the hotel sits in the heart of Waikiki. There are restaurants, upscale shopping, souvenir shopping and the beach, all in walking distance! Overall, I would grade my experience at the Shoreline an A+! I plan on visiting again next year and will surely stay at this hotel!

After arriving we were unhappy with our room( tiny and right near the air conditioning duc 's for the whole hotel) not to mention the room smelt. So after speaking to the reception staff ,we were relocated to a bigger room and No smell. Thankyou... Room was very clean and 4nights were easy and comfortable. Great location, so close to every thing. Staff very helpful and rang us a cab after our pre paid shuttle bus from Diamond Head shuttle FAILED to turn up . After two calls to the shuttle service we were told the shuttle had a flat tyre , and they had ordered a cab for us. The CAB never arrived. Staff from shoreline rang a cab and it was there in less than 5mins. Thankyou shoreline staff for looking out for us ,in a very stressful situation .

Shoreline is a good location in Waikiki just a short walk to the beach & very close to all the shops and restaurants. We booked a king bed through Orbitz (ebookers) however we were given a queen bed as they said our king bed was a request which is wasn't as we had paid extra for this type after some discussion they agreed to "upgrade" us to a king room after a 30min wait. Room was very clean with all amenities. Housekeeping didn't come at all so had to find someone to replenish towels. Air con was incredibly load and you could also hear noise from the road. We have stayed in other shoreline hotels and this did not match the standards at all they have have to remodel certain parts but improvement is needed. Pool is adequate on roof top but you have to walk up a flight of dingy stairwell which could be much improved. Good for price and location. We only stayed 2 nights to acclimatise ourselves after flying from the UK.

We stayed for a week and found the shoreline to be a very comfortable and convenient place to stay in Honolulu. The staff were very helpful and accommodating and really contributed positively to our holiday experience. The rooms had been recently updated and we found them clean and pleasant. While we were there they were having the window coverings upgraded on our floor, the scheduling was a little mixed up and ours weren't done on the day scheduled. They were scheduled and done a couple of days later. This was probably a contractor issue but it was still an unexpected disruption in an otherwise pleasant stay.There was also some confusion with our airport transportation. We were in the lobby at the time were told to be there and found the airport van had just left! He came back and got us after a while but it was a bit of a shock because the desk clerk thought we had caught it! We still recommend the Shoreline and the helpful staff.

Stayed at this hotel for 10 nights on a trip to Oahu. I knew that I would only be using it as a base to explore the island as I had rented a car for the 10 days. I booked hotel for my boyfriend and I as it was fairly cheap in comparison to most hotels in Waikiki. The photos of the lobby on the net are true to form - it is a nice lobby with free drinks (coffee, tea, flavoured water, peach iced tea, etc). The photos of the rooms are a bit misleading - the rooms themselves are a bit tired and dated, but they are clean. Will list the pros and cons:Pros:-price for location - really in the heart of Wakikik, great location for wandering to shops, restaurants and the BEACH!-easy check in process -balcony in most rooms (I believe)-clean -most staff are happy and helpful-free beach towels each daycons:-valet is usually full. this means you have to park across the street at the Waikiki Trade Centre parking lot. It's not that far, but you have to get a ticket each day from the valet to park across the street. The process is a bit cumbersome for a vacation. I would suggest that they just give you a ticket for the whole week if you desire it (nobody wants to deal with this daily on their vacation)-computer in lobby is free wifi, but it requires you to enter a credit card number - sorry this is a bit sketchy, so bring your own device and use the free wifi in the rooms.-one of the main desk people is a bit useless. I asked them about local attractions - I mean local MAIN attractions and they had no useful information to impart. I turned to trip advisor instead- you people save me all the time :) -bathrooms and rooms are a bit dated. The tiles in the bathroom look old and a bit grimy (not dirty grimy, just old and used). They could use an update.-rooms are a bit tight - try and pack light!Overall if you are looking for a crash pad in the city centre, this will defiantly serve your purpose. I would stay again for the price/location.Some other area tips: there is a Ross across the street that is open till 1am (I went one night after my boyfriend went to bed and snuck in some purchases ;), there is a starbucks and a jamba juice across the street in the Waikik Trade Centre concourse - super easy for something in the morning. The restaurant in the hotel - Heavenly, has 'heavenly' eggs benny - highly recommended and they serve it all day in case you want a light dinner. The restaurant next door - Blue Marlin - has tasty food, the black ink risotto, garlic shrimp and crab cakes were all delicious and the service was good all for a reasonable price. Enjoy!

The recently remodeled hotel was a pleasant surprise. The location is very convenient, just between Kuhio and Kalakaua - so it's only 2 blocks to the beach (without the beachfront prices). The only real negative is that the valet parking is expensive and inconvenient.
user_name:
EvilDrew
Washington DC, District of Columbia
