review_body: Its a nice place in the heart of waikiki the hotel is nice and clean and the rooms were reasonable size and the staff very friendly. Shopping is all around this hotel and the beach is a 5 minuite walk with towels available for the beach from receiption.

Essentially, the 3.5* rating is pretty accurate. The staff is very nice, and extremely helpful, but the rooms are quite basic. Free WIFI is a plus, as are the pineapple iced tea and iced lemon water in the lobby. The location is excellent, very close to all the major shopping and many restaurants.

Staff and ambiance are excellent, as is the central Waikiki location if you don't need to be on the beach. Rooms are small. I've stayed twice and it will be my first choice next time I go. Staff attitude is supurb and one get's the feeling that it's genuine.

We stayed at the Shoreline Hotel for 5 days and found it very handy to everything from shops to eateries to the beach and transport. Not a large room but always clean and comfortable with reasonable facilities. The foyer always had cool drink available which was home made and tasted fine. Quite refreshing. Staff were mostly helpful. Rooftop pool was OK. All up I would stay there again as I feel it is very good value for money.

This is a great little boutique hotel with an excellent Waikiki location. All of the staff are friendly, attentive and very helpful. Stayed in a lovely, very quiet room and in three nights never heard any noise from adjoining rooms. Would book again and highly recommend. Thank you!

Wasn't sure about this hotel when I first arrived, but after a night or 2 once I got my bearings in my opinion it's extremely well located. Right in between the 2 main roads of Waikiki 5 mins walk to Kalakaua/Waikiki Beach/shopping shopping shopping one way, 1-10mins to great food, stores, coffee or anything else on Kuhio the other. Great little restaurant attached, highly encourage Coco cove(3 min walk, left onto Kalakaua)for all general store items, souvenirs etc. As much as I'd love to stay right in waikiki beach, I couldn't beat this place for value & location. Rooms are a bit dated but clean (& cleaned daily), great shower, kinda small but it's just to sleep & shower in. No jug or toaster was my only let down. Otherwise fantastic & will be back to stay again.

I strongly recommend this hotel !!!•friendly staff member •stable wifi connection •the best location •clean room •free drink at the lobby I really love to stay this hotel again when I'm back to Hawaii !!!! Thank you for the wonderful stay :)

Great location if you plan to travel around by public bus or walk to places around Waikiki. Plenty of food options nearby (acceptable food). Very friendly and helpful staff. Large room with plenty of space for 2.was directly adjacent to elevator shaft but didn't find this to be a problem. No view - faced another block of apartments, however we were rarely in our room except after dinner so not a problem.

I stayed for 9 nights recently. I enjoyed everything about the hotel. Location, the room, the staff. Easy 2 minute walk to Waikiki Beach at half the cost of staying right on the beach. I will be back for sure!

My husband and I recently stayed 7 nights at the Shoreline and were very pleased. The lobby and rooms were very clean and the staff friendly and helpful. We had a queen room that had a small refrigerator, microwave and a Kuerig coffee maker. The room was quite small and when we return will get a slightly larger room. Valet parking was not available when we arrived but we were able to use the parking garage across the street at a rate less than the valet parking for the first few days. The pool on the roof is small but very clean and was great for a quick dip. The view from the roof is fantastic! The steps to the roof were steep and there were no steps in the pool, only a ladder. This would not be suitable for folks with a disability or small children. But who really needs a pool when Waikiki beach is but a couple blocks away?

Stayed for 8 nights. Hotel is boutique and has a nicer feel than a lot of the more dated classics around Waikiki. Location is fantastic. It is close to everything. The beach is a 200m walk. Ross is across the road, H&M on the corner, Victoria Secrets and all the good shops, supermarkets and public transport links are not far away so I think it's hard to find a better location for hotels not on the beachfront! Cheesecake Factory aka Food heaven is pretty much 100m away - location is hard to beat! Check in and check out was smooth, although we had to wait right till 3pm to check in which was a little annoying.. They held our luggage and we could borrow beach towels and use wifi (which is good) etc was cool... The complementary refreshments at reception everyday are a nice touch as is the blackboard next to the elevators with gigs, Island and weather info, cuisine recommendations etc.. We were on the 9th floor. The pictures on the website look very fresh and bright, however, we were a little underwhelmed with how dark he room was. It had, however, a very, very, very comfortable bed and all the features required for a good stay. One gripe I do have is with the Keurig coffee machine in the room. The first coffees were free but after that it was like $2 a pop. I've never liked when hotels do these types of things as they should be replenished every day for free as guests pay per night and for those staying more than one night are not anymore rewarded than someone who stays only one. The water pressure of the shower was pretty weak and our housekeeper (Hong) I think her name was, although she tidied very well came late afternoon most days which after spending the morning out was a bit of a downer returning to a unserviced or currently being serviced room. If you plan on hiring a convertible or jeep wrangler etc there are plenty of rental place near by.. I'd search on Hawaii discount rental cars which had way better rates than the car websites themselves. Parking at the hotel is expensive but no more than other hotels in the area. My advice - hire a car for one day only and save the rip off Waikiki valet fees.. You can see the island in one day. No fitness centre. Rooftop pool is nice and has great views of Waikiki. Although there were a few niggly things, we enjoyed our stay. I would recommend this Hotel. We paid roughly $220 a night and I thought it was overall a nice stay.

Stayed at this hotel for a week, it's not a five star hotel but the room was clean and the location can't get any better for the price we paid. It is in close proximity to the beach and shops. It is also close to the duty free gallery which about less than 5 min walk from where we took waikiki trolley to different places almost everyday. Staff were friendly and the refreshing beverages in the lobby is a plus.The only downside for us is that the room was right next to the elevators. So we pretty much heard the elevators going up and down the floors all the time. We didn't bother switching the room because we were out all day and by the time we got back we were too exhausted and fell asleep regardless of the noise.

Stay here for 2 nights in Oct. - stopped in HNL on our way to Maui - specifically to see Pearl Harbor. Easy 2 minute walk to Waikiki Beach at half the cost of staying right on the beach. Hotel was clean with average sized rooms and staff was friendly and it's location was very central.

We stayed in this hotel for 15 nights, using the Priceline express deals for Waikiki City (three stars) for $95 a night.We arrived at 11am and despite check-in not available till 3pm the front desk clerk (Monalyn) found a room available for us right away. She said it was on a higher level, so this might have meant we were slightly upgraded, I can’t be sure. Either way this was hugely appreciated after the long journey! Throughout our stay Monalyn was really friendly (as were the other staff), and always said hi or chatted to us when we passed through the lobby.Free cucumber and mint infused water, and pineapple iced tea was available in the lobby daily. I found the best option was to mix the two. There was also hot tea and coffee available. It’s these small touches that really make a place I think. The room was spacious, clean and had everything we needed (i think it might have been a partial ocean view queen):• Safe• Ironing board and iron• Microwave• Fridge• Wi-fi• Iphone mini-stereo dock• Plenty of hanging closet space (although not many coat hangers)• Coffee maker (but I think the coffee sachets cost money).From our room we got a glimpse of the ocean between two high-rises, which was nice, and were opposite an apartment building (which took some remembering to close the curtains when we got dressed). Location is great! • Lot of restaurants and shops within walking distance• 5-7mins walk to the beach• 5mins walk to food pantry (closest supermarket)• Lots of bus stops around to take you to Pearl Harbour, Diamond and a host of other locations. Note: Given we’re in the centre of Waikiki you can hear the traffic below with or without the door closed, but I didn’t find it to be a major problem when sleeping. Good eats in the area:• For a cheap and tasty meal visit Da Big Kahuna burger 2 mins away• For a healthier meal visit Hide Tide Poke, next door to the hotel.• If you’re looking for musubi or bento box options next door to the hotel (on the other side) is a small place that only accepts cash. I only had a spam musubi from there on my last day but a lot of locals frequented the place. • To save money we bought a lot of microwaveable items and raw foods from the Food Pantry, which is about a 5 minute walk away – this really made for a cheaper stay.• Coco Cove (2mins walk onto Kalakaua) had some great desserts and some decided sushi and salad options if you’re looking for something quick and easy.The only problem with our stay was my allergies. Throughout the stay they settled down (but didn’t go away) as I got more used the environment. I’m not sure what this was due to as the room didn’t smell nor did it appear dirty. I have never had this from any other hotel I’ve stayed at in Waikiki. I mentioned it to the front desk who said they would tell the cleaners to do an extra clean but it didn’t appear to make a difference. My fiancée did not have any problems, so I might just be more sensitive than others.I know they have a pool but we never saw it (too busy elsewhere).

Room was a tiny bit smaller than others I had in Hawaii, but I was travelling alone and it was definitely fine for my needs and I liked it. Staff were really nice at the front desk. The pool was really cute (OK so Sheraton pool had the sunset views but who wants that many people to swim with!) and had a cool view. Rarely any people up there as they don't advertise it very much, which was fine by me! The only complaint I had is that they closed the pool for an ENTIRE 24 hours, my last day, for cleaning. I understand pools need cleaning and that's cool, but closing it for a whole day on a Saturday seems like bad timing. It's a roof top pool so surely they could have done it at night to minimise impact. I know it's a not a huge deal but on my last day I really just wanted to chill out and use the hotel facilities. Who knows, someone could have 'soiled' the pool in which case that's fine I understand! I liked this place a lot for convenience, cleanliness and the staff. Would stay here again if they had a good deal, but even though for Waikiki it's 'good' value, they could do a little more for $170/$180 a night. Very little info given at check in for example, and I had read online that breakfast was to be included from September 2014 but heard nothing about it when I checked in so assumed it wasn't. Definitely a good experience but room for a little improvement. Can't beat this place for location to restaurants and shopping. I was also pleasantly surprised at how quiet it was considering the location. I was on the 5th floor and only heard noise when the buses started rolling in at 8am- but I was up by then anyway. The balcony was suffice but only really for drying swim wear. Wasn't really ambient enough to have a drink :)One last thing, the airconditioning system was a little odd. Even when I turned it off, it was never really off, it would come on randomly in the middle of the night..

Stayed 4 nights at this hotel. I am very pleased with friendly staffs. The room is kind of small compared to others I have stayed in the area previously. There is not much of a view of anything from my room. But, it is clean and comfortable after all. I recommend this hotel for solo and couples. It may not be a good choice for family. I wish the doors of the rooms do not close so hard and so loud. Basically, you can hear any door close on your floor.

We used a travel agent to book our 3 week US holiday, but I selected this hotel personally after reading the reviews on Tripadvisor.We stayed for 5 nights August/September (over Labor weekend as it turned out).The best thing about the hotel is it's really handy location, with the beach and Waikiki attractions all a short walk away. The Ross shop across the road was also very convenient when we needed to buy an extra suitcase for our trip home!We were able to walk to Ala Moana as well as Diamond Head Crater from the hotel, only taking the buses a few times to go further afield (to Waikele Outlets and airport - and to get back from Diamond Head trek!).I chose this hotel because it also had a pool, although I didn't have high expectations for it..so was not too disappointed, and did actually hop into once. It is very basic and kind of odd, climbing up stairs onto the rooftop. Good views of the Royal Hawaiian though!The staff were friendly, and we loved the water/cool drinks in the lobby. The restaurant next door was being renovated while we were there, although did look to be reopening on one of the evenings as there was small party there.We stayed on the 8th floor, and found the room to be quiet although the air conditioning was quite loud. Our room wifi didn't work, so I picked another room number and was able to use that!Probably the biggest disappointment was that we had a small room with two double beds. This trip was to celebrate our 20th wedding anniversary, so it was not very romantic! We didn't want to cause any bother so did not ask to be changed, we felt quite lucky to have a balcony and be on a higher floor. But it was a bit of a downer after 3 weeks in the USA with huge beds in the 3 other hotels we stayed in. It was also difficult to find anywhere for all the suitcases since the two beds took up most of the floor space. And they are fixed to the wall board, so you can't push them together in case you are wondering.It did live up to my expectations in other ways too, we really didn't want to stay in one of the big resorts and like to do our own thing, so it was a good base for this, no bellhops or airs and graces, just polite service with a smile.We would stay here again, but probably as a family rather than a romantic getaway.

Views not so much, good hotel for price. Employees where great. One odd thing was at check in made great point of $100 dep. for damage to room ..... When I got to my room first thing I noticed was minor damage to the room ... (421) ... They said was remodeled .. In reality was refreshed... Please do not get me wrong ... For the price ... Clean, safe, close to beach, super employees, everything I need when traveling.

The room was clean and most of the staff were friendly. But 2 (really small) double beds is not acceptable for a honeymoon. There is also no tour desk, so the only form of information for directions or activities is a few black and white pamphlets and a map which you must ask staff for. Also, the toilet backed up twice and there was no thought in staff to call a plumber. Really wouldn't recommend this place.

Took my wife for the 1st time to Oahu and decided to stay in Waikiki to be close to all the action. This place was perfectly situated for us. We don't require a hotel right on the beach and don't mind walking a few minutes to reach the beach. Several bars and places to eat very close by. The room & hotel were very clean and staff very nice. Parking was a little pricey being from Vegas used to free valet parking everywhere but nice knowing the rental was always secured.

We stayed here for 4 nights on a quick trip for a wedding and this really did meet our needs well. The room was not super large (king bed however) but comfortable with a very small balcony that helped make it feel more roomy. The bathroom was small but again adequate for a few days. Most important thing was the room and bathroom were clean! We were fortunate enough to get a microwave and refrigerator in our room ( this was important to us) on the 8th floor. I was concerned that it would be noisy on a lower floor but it was not. We appreciated the complimentary papers , apples and tea/water they provided each day. Valet was a nuisance (we self park usually) and expensive but offset by a great room rate and we never had to wait more than a few minutes for the car. We didn't use the pool - its on top of the building but it is tiny and ok for a quick dip or sun bathing convenient if you don't like the beach. Honestly if we had more time this would have been a problem for me since I like sun bathing and relaxing at a nice pool. This property does not have a fitness center - they will happily point in the right direction to find one but this is very unclear. They did not offer any kind of discount for this either...your pretty much on your own. Lots of places to walk and run. Hotel is also a couple blocks from beach but not reasonable walk.

Wonderful, friendly staff... we definitely felt the aloha spirit from the moment we confirmed our reservation over the phone through our entire visit. Comfortable, clean and relaxing rooms.... we reserved a queen room but the bed was larger than your average queen and the room was perfect size for 2. The fridge, microwave, balcony, brand new furnishings, light airy colors and design made us feel very special and right at home. Our next visit to Waikiki will definitely include a stay at The Shoreline. ps... use of valet (additional $28 a day) is definitely worth it. don't try and find all day parking in this area.

We stayed here in early September. It was our first time to Honolulu and we really enjoyed our 3 days at this boutique hotel. Unlike most of the enormous hotels around Waikiki, the Shoreline suited us as we don't care for the larger and more often impersonal hotels. Our room was on the 3rd floor overlooking the entrance to the hotel. It was quiet, had all the amenities you need ie. fridge, coffee making machine and good quality bathroom products. The hotel décor was light and trendy and all very clean. We particularly enjoyed the complimentary iced drinks always available in the foyer. The staff were always very efficient, accommodating and friendly. All in all, a great boutique hotel for a few days shopping. Shoreline is right near the main shopping district and only a short walk to Waikiki Beach. Would not hesitate in staying here again.

Visiting Hawaii on our first trip, I was disappointed with the hotel. I had booked through my travel agent, with the request for a 2 bedroom room for my son and I. We discovered we were only given a room with 1 bed. I was abit upset when I was spoken to rudely when I requested a room with 2 beds. I was informed that I would have to pay for the upgrade, even though it was what I had organized in the first place. Then being informed that they were booked out and I would have to stay in the room I was given. Then I requested a roll bed for my son.. These are not available in this hotel. And they offered me sheets and extra blanket, but my son would have to sleep on the floor. We ended up buying a inflatable bed from a shopping center. The hotel has a old musky smell to it. And the roof pool was very basic. The only plus about this hotel was that bed was comfortable. And it is close to the shops, beach, restaurants in the area.

My daughter and I spent a week at the Shoreline during our first trip to Hawaii. The location of the hotel is great: only a two minute walk to the beach and less to many stores and restaurants in the busy Waikiki area. Close proximity to stops for The Bus, Hawaii's fantastic public transport, is another bonus. Whilst our room was quite small, we weren't fussed as we were basically only in it to sleep or shower. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was stocked with good quality toiletries which were replenished every day. As others have noted, views from the hotel aren't great but we were aware of this when we booked and who cares when a short walk gets you to the beautiful beach anyway! My daughter enjoyed the iced tea and iced mint and cucumber water which was freely available in the lobby everyday and we also utilised the free daily newspaper which was also available. We found the staff very helpful and always courteous and friendly. This hotel is NOT a resort: if you want luxurious lobbies and lush pool areas there are many available in Waikiki but NOT at the very reasonable price we paid. I would certainly recommend this hotel to people like us who wanted an economically priced hotel, with clean and comfortable facilities in a very central location.

Lower cost central hotel on Waikiki beach. Friendly staff happy to help you. The hotel has pluses and minuses which may help you decide when booking:- Rooms and bathrooms are small and only a queen bed in standard room. We were on the 10th floor, it had a partial sea view although we only paid for a 'city view' and to be honest you don't stay here for the views as the other tower blocks each side of the hotel aren't great to look at as other reviews suggest. Less pigeon poop viewable on the higher floors it seems... - The reception area is contemporary and clean and while the rest of the hotel is clean it is aging - carpets on the hall ways are going thin and could do with a renovation along with those in the bedrooms. - We were here for 3 nights just to visit Oahu before going onto Maui for a proper beach rest. The Hyatt in Maui at a 4 star made me question whether the Shoreline is even a 3 star...- Pool on roof is very small and ok for a dip as only 6 loungers - you certainly wouldn't want to spend the day up there listening to the hum of the air con and kitchen extractor!+ Free coffee and tea and water in reception 2 computers which allow you to print boarding cards for free is a nice touch. There is also free wifi in the rooms- Cleaner came at 830 one morning rather early for holiday resort, they also undertook routine maintenance on the water system at 915 so my shower went out!+ Reception give you beach towels if you ask+ Close to main strip of the beach and shopping centre also a Starbucks and McDonalds up road, island coffee down road across the Main Street+ Udon noodle bar up the road is well worth the wait as the queue moves fast - see my other review. - My only issue is as it isn't on the beach if you want a lounger you have to pay a heavy price $45-60 to rent 2 beds and an umbrella per day! Check prices of the beach hotels or those with bigger pools as if you are staying more than a few days it may work out cheaper if you can avoid he rental cost of using the beach. NB the beach is public so no hotel has free beds but many have bigger pools and some are on the beach.

Recently stayed at the Shoreline for 7 days. This hotel is well located close to all the shops and restaurants of Waikiki. Well priced compared to the higher priced beach front properties, it provides great value. With a modern design, the hotel has a well presented foyer and rooms. Complimentary hot and cool drinks are available all day, along with newspapers and fresh fruit. The highlight for me was the friendly, relaxed and helpful staff. Everyday they were helpful and had lots of ideas for good local restaurants, bars and activities. When I left and arrived at the airport to return to Sydney, I left a bag in the taxi. With only an hour till my flight the hotel front desk staff member contacted the taxi they had booked for me and arranged for the bag to be found and then sent to me at check in. Thank you so much, I really appreciate this.I highly recommend you consider this hotel for your stay, while it doesn't have beach views, it has so much style and great service, you won't be disappointed.

The Shoreline is a fairly new hotel in an old building. I love the concept of taking older hotels and making them hip, trendy, and cool. They did a great job on the Shoreline and it feels like you are in South Beach Miami versus Waikiki (not a bad thing!). I was only at the hotel for about 12 hours before catching a flight so I don't have a very thorough review but I did enjoy my short time here.Check in was very pleasant and the young woman working the front desk was personable, cool, and fun to talk to. I had parked my car in the incredibly tiny valet area and no one came out. Come to find out that there were no spots left and I would have to park across the street at a pay garage. The nice valet guy backed my car out (it is scary!) for me and I went about my way across the street. It actually worked out very nicely as it was $15 to park as I was out by 6am the next day. Hotel valet is limited and $28 a night.Being a Joy of Life member has its perks as they sent a free bottle of wine to the room! A very nice touch. The room itself was small (queen bed) but for the price it was a good deal in Waikiki. It was very hip and trendy and the furnishings were quite nice. The bed was "ok" and comfortable enough. The bathroom was fine although the towels were terrible. They were think, scratchy, and left pieces in my hair. Please get some new towels! There are patios on each room and I was somehow lucky enough to get a HUGE patio on the 13th floor. I didn't get too much of a chance to use it but it was a nice touch. internet is free and they have a pool on the roof but I did not see it. This is a cool place to stay in an otherwise uncool tourist paradise. I don't like Waikiki very much but I did enjoy my short time at the Shoreline!

We stayed here for 6 nights during our last trip to Oahu. I definitely have mixed feelings about this place.The location is great, we were super close to Royal Hawaiian Center and Island Vintage Coffee, and it was super convenient for walking the strip (although now that International Marketplace is closed, Waikiki is really not the same). We had a Partial Ocean View King room, and stayed in a corner room on the 13th floor. I'm still used to the taboo against 13th floors in hotel rooms, so that was a little scary (ha). Immediately when we got to the room I looked for the microwave and fridge, which was a necessity to me when I was looking for a hotel. Apparently not all of the rooms in this hotel have them (which to me is ridiculous, why don't you just put them in all the rooms?) and I was told to just hang out in the room for a bit until they figured out a solution. That was a pain, since the last thing we wanted to do was sit around in the hotel room (especially since we wanted to EAT). After waiting for a while and getting antsy cuz we wanted to leave, I followed up on the micro situation and was told they didn't have any other rooms in the category I booked, and if I needed to store something perishable I would be able to use the staff fridge. That's super inconvenient, if I was still a nursing mom and had to store breastmilk, the last thing I'd want to do is trek down to the lobby to store my milk. Thank goodness my son is older now and it wasn't a requirement, but it was definitely an inconvenience, and will surely factor into the decision for a hotel during our next stay.My husband felt like our room was probably converted from a storage room. He didn't like the fact that the bed faced the door. Also, one of our two sliding doors' locks were broken and we had to wait for maintenance to come fix it before I was comfortable enough to leave. We also had a huge patio, but only one chair. The hotel should definitely look into making better use of that huge space. Most of the other rooms have really small lanais that would only fit one chair so it makes sense. But for the two rooms (that I could see) on my floor that have the huge lanais, put more stuff out there so the space can actually be put to use. Stupid thing that I do is check out other rooms when housekeeping is cleaning them. The room across the hall from us had a microwave. Stupid gripe maybe, but since I was specifically wanting a room with one, I was annoyed. Also, the bed wasn't facing the door. If we had gotten that room I would have been happier, but it probably didn't have our partial ocean view.The building directly next door to Shoreline was gross. When standing at the edge of our lanai, and looking over, you see an old decrepit building with bird poop everywhere. We didn't use our lanai much due to lack of furniture and the gross building.There was also construction going on, and the little alley leading to valet parking would be partially blocked a lot. This caused several occasions where super duper car maneuvering was required. It was pretty annoying, but I'm sure it's nothing the hotel can control.Our AC also wasn't working the first day. I had to have front desk folks come in at 11:30 pm to fix it. While my son was sleeping and sweating. Another annoyance.One of the valet guys also rarely ever smiled. Pineapple iced tea in the lobby was great though :).Overall, it was an OK stay. Location was the number one best thing. There aren't any dresser drawers to unpack your stuff, so we were literally living out of suitcases. And having to shove suitcases out of the way when I was done digging clothes out of them. I probably won't stay here again when there are so many other options in Waikiki with all of the things my family needs.

We selected this hotel based on others' reviews and we were not disappointed. It was a clean, nicely renovated hotel with friendly, helpful staff . Many amenities are free (WI-FI, use of computer and printer downstairs, etc.) The refreshing water and ice tea and fruit basket were welcoming. We did not have a car and most everything was in walking distance. We took a city bus to Diamond Head. The front desk was so helpful in arranging us transportation to Pearl Harbor and the airport at reasonable rates. The day and evening valets were most helpful. They suggested good places to eat at reasonable rates, but we found some on our own, too. We had a wonderful stay at a reasonable price. We looked out of our window at hotel that rented for over $400 per night. Beautiful, but not in our budget.

We recently spent 4 nights at the shoreline Hotel in Honolulu, though it was a basic hotel compared to previous stays but it was all nice and pleasant, the room somewhat small but clean and comfortable with a little balcony as a bonus, beds were spacious and comfy, same with the bathroom, very basic but clean, staff members were very courtious and always eager to help especially at the reception and the valet, value wise in Hawaiian standards was good, however if you were to compare with mainland standards, you would be surprised especially with no breakfast included.over all I would be more than happy to revisit Hawaii and stay there again.One little tip for the Hotel administration, your 11th floor could use a new carpet, I am sure it will make a huge difference.

Just spent a week visiting family stationed at Kaneohe Bay, and I did not want a typical Waikiki resort hotel. I did not plan to use a rental car, & I did not want a spectacular view of Waikiki, as I planned on being out & about most of the time. I was given a 9th floor room with a view of a rundown building next door, but that was the only downside of the stay. I was out all day, & most evenings, so the view was not my priority. Note: If you are a light sleeper, get a higher floor. This is a city, and yes, if you leave the lanai door open, you will hear a city at night, replete with the evil truck beepers.The room was quite clean, and details like baseboards & doorjambs also showed evidence of frequent cleaning. Bath amenities were by Lather, and I had enough good quality towels. A thoughtful touch was a makeup remover packet. However, I did indulge in buying skincare from Nature Republic, a Korean cosmetics retail store in the Hyatt Regency, so I will not rate the hotel's products. I found the staff surprisingly pleasant, everyone at least acknowledged me in hallways or common areas with a smile or a hello, usually both. Front desk staff was informative, and did not act in an overbearing manner at all. The lobby area was nicely decorated, and had a funky retro vibe that I liked, and the whole hotel seemed rather refreshing after the many typical 'Hawaiian' suites I've stayed in before. The cucumber mint H2O & Plantation pineapple iced tea in the lobby were again a thoughtful touch, and a gentle reminder to hydrate yourself in a tropical environment. Heavenly was a small breakfast & lunch place next door, and the food was nicely health oriented & close by. however, it was rather pricey at $15 per entrée. I found an inexpensive local diner called Seaside a block away and had basic breakfast for $4.95 to $7.95. I was really pleased with the location, I could walk or trolley/da bus/cab to just about anywhere on the strip easily. Royal Hawaiian shopping was at the end of the block, and behind that, the Pink Palace & Sheraton Waikiki, then the beach.However, be adventurous, and look around the mauka side of the Waikiki strip on Kuhio & around Alawai canal. I found Thai Massage at Aisawan for half the price of the spas, I ate Korean BBQ at Hawaii 678 ( oh, pretty Kpop boys serve you, girls!) , Japanese Udon at Marukame, drank $5 maitais at Arnold's, $2 draft beer at the Tiki Bar ( Marriott?), and made an absolute pig of myself chowing plate lunch at the Rainbow Diner for $9.50. There was also a Keurig, a microwave & small refrigerator in the room, which I used for breakfast food and late night snacks. Food Pantry is on Kuhio, 2 blocks East of Seaside ave. Yes, food is pricey compared to mainland, but again, step out of the box & try some local stuff. Why pay $6.95 to a restaurant for a papaya 1/2 with yogurt & granola, when you can just as easily buy the same and eat at least twice? I might mention here that there are several places that are geared to Japanese tourists in the immediate area, but don't be afraid - try them. and most folks were quite interested in talking to me at the local Japanese bars, provided I behaved with good manners and said a few words in Japanese 1st. To sum up, I would certainly stay here again, and I do recommend it, if you know Waikiki already, as I do. No, I am a native at all, I Just have travelled in the islands a lot. These guys have the aloha spirit.

Great location to explore Waikiki. A lot shopping and excellent places to eat. The room was extremely clean and the staff was friendly and helpful. The beach was just across the street and the price was awesome.

This was actually partly business, and partly a family trip. The company my husband was working for booked us at Shoreline. Apparently, a couple of people on the crew weren't too happy with the hotel, so we ended up getting moved later in our stay to the Hilton Waikiki Beach. However, we would have been perfectly happy staying at Shoreline! Hilton Waikiki Beach says, "No resort fees!" Well, there may not be resort fees, but there are fees for everything else, including internet. But guess what? You get free internet at Shoreline! Shoreline is probably at least $100-$200 less than the Hilton. The rooms are much smaller at Shoreline and I do wish the bathroom was bigger (bathroom at Hilton was pretty incredible), but the air conditioner at Shoreline worked fantastic and so did the little fridge! (We had to have someone override a setting on our AC at the Hilton because no matter what we did, it wouldn't get cool enough, and we also had them bring in an old fridge because, for some reason, they replaced their "old" ones with updated ones that barely keep anything cool - we weren't even sure it was working at all!) The guy who brought the fridge in and changed the AC at the Hilton was super nice, but you would think for the price you pay to stay there, that stuff would work great! Plus, he even said when he brought a different fridge to us that the new ones they have don't keep your drinks cold (what's the point, then?). I want anything I put in there to be cold. It's a fridge for crying out loud!Here's a comparison of the 2 hotels:SHORELINE HILTON WAIKIKI BEACHFree Internet Charge for internet useBeds are SUPER COMFY (and we're very picky!) Beds were satisfactoryAir Conditioner ROCKS!!! AC doesn't work wellLittle Fridge works great!!! Ask for different fridge-ones in rooms don't work!Microwave No microwave2 free Keurig coffees only in room Free single serve coffee each day in roomFree coffee anytime in lobby Nothing free in lobby anywhereFree Cucumber Mint water in lobby everyday! NopeFree Pineapple Iced Tea in lobby everyday! NopeSometimes had free pink lemonade in lobby NeverViews not so great Great view from our roomGood TV channels (Scenic Hawaii) Didn't have Scenic Hawaii channel my son wantedVery nice staff Very nice staffSuper small balcony with 1 chair Bigger balcony with small table/2 chairsCould have used more drawers with 3 of us More drawer space for clothes and stuffArea surrounding hotel looked cleaner Area surrounding hotel not as cleanRoyal Hawaiian Center/Food Court rt. down st. Shorter walk to beach Great new restaurant next door (Heavenly)Very close to Island Vintage Shave Ice (the best!)Bottom Line: If I'm spending my own money, I'm going back to Shoreline!!! Alex, who works at the lobby desk was SO NICE!!! And so was Paul, the valet. Everyone else was VERY nice too, but I'm sorry that I don't know anyone else's name.

I booked this hotel going off the back of other reviews and I'm so glad I did. Lovely, modern hotel in a great location. Close to all the shops and just a 5-10 minute stroll down to Waikiki Beach. Staff were lovely too - we'd pre-booked a Pearl Harbor tour and got ourselves confused with pick up points and timings but the hotel reception called the company and sorted it all out for us, no problem. We had a late flight on the day of checkout so we were allowed to leave our suitcases in their luggage room, we came back to find my partner had left a pair of shoes in our room (!!) and they were bagged up on our suitcases along with a little note :-) A nice touch in the rooms were magnets with snippets of Hawaiian on them and a 'Hawaiian word of the day' on the chalkboard in the hotel lobby every morning. Overall a great experience, I would definitely stay here again!

The hotel was a good base, comfortable, and with a lower price than many other hotels in the same area. However, like most Hawaiian hotels it was not cheap! I would stay here again if passing through Oahu. The only issue I had is that they charged my credit card 100USD more than the quoted price. When I questioned them (by phone after having left) they replied that this was a security deposit and was being refunded. Fair enough but they should have mentioned this beforehand.

The location was fantastic, close to the beach, shops and restaurants. The room was clean and beds were comfortable, my only issue was the shower curtain started to smell after a few days but other then this I was quite happy with the rooms. The staff were very friendly and helpful. This hotel was great for the price, location and service so I would definitely stay here again.

I recently stayed at the Shoreline, Sept 4-7, 2014. I had a wonderful experience. I knew nothing about the hotel other than reviews and the hotel website. When I arrived I was very happy to find exactly what I was expecting. Hotel was centrally located to everything on Waikaki. Hotel was clean and inviting as advertised. Room was small, which was expected, but well laid out and appointed. Even though it was small it was not to small for the two of us. Bathroom was clean and provided good supplies, but was the one part of the hotel/room that showed some wear and age around the edges. Though nothing bad. My room also had a small mini fridge which was appreciated. House keeping service was wonderful and friendly. Not pushy like some hotels where they try to make you leave your room when "they" are ready to clean. Brenda was nice and said ok, I will come back later, please take your time.Hotel staff was very nice and accommodating. I arrive early since I took the red eye from Fairbanks, AK. It was about 10 am when I arrived and Monalyn at the front desk was gracious and kind to find a room that was ready for us, even though we were very early. Once we got settled in our room Mona also called quickly to check up to make sure we had everything we needed. Mona was exceptionally nice and helpful the whole time we were there. She is def. 5 stars! The bell staff was also good about letting us check our baggage on our last day, as our flight was not until 10pm and were helpful in assisting us with transportation back to the airport.I will stay here again if my travels take me back to Waikaki. For the price and location this hotel could not be beat. For reference I booked by stay through Priceline.

Booked Shoreline hotel 3rd party, based on reviews - turned out to be a mistake.Arrived late 8/25/14, around 10:00 pm and was told there was no parking - valet was full. Sent to nearby public lot. Oh well, we did arrive late (and tired, from east coast U.S.,). Next morning had plumbing issue - toilet about to overflow. Called front desk but no answer. Went downstairs. Told help would be right there. 3 hours later, maintenance arrived. Oh well, Island time...Used lobby toilet short term.Location wasn't too bad, although room view was a run down, dilapidated, abandoned hotel that looks about ready for demolition. Didn't pay for 'view', but still.......Next morning went out to find a snorkel beach and came back to find our spare room key had been taken/removed from our room. Called front desk but no answer. Went downstairs (again).Spoke to Manager on site (Jerome) about room key disappearing and concern for security our personal items. Was informed by Jerome that taking key from room is hotel policy if room key was left in wall as an energy savings. I asked why key wasn't simply left on table or near phone. He then showed me a handful of keys that had been removed from other rooms in the same fashion for the same reason. I was still concerned as have never had such a thing done before. Was told that this is 'policy' and if I didn't like it I could leave hotel.Tried to check out, as Jerome recommended, but was told that now the 3rd party booking agent would have final say in reimbursement (or not). Decided to leave anyway....with 3 nights paid in advance hanging in the balance.Tried to contact General Manager, Alvida Surpia-Jones but she never returned multiple calls....Finally left and Checked in at Marriott 0.5 mile away -what a blessing.

Recently stayed 4 nights at the Shoreline with a family group of 5 adults in 3 rooms. Our room (730) was quite spacious and very clean. The location is great, just 1 block off the Avenue, opposite Ross for Less store, with easy walk to all the restaurants & shops & Ala Moana bus. Desk staff very helpful. The beds are extremely comfortable. Would recommend requesting a higher floor as the garbage trucks are quite noisy round 5am. Our daughter & s-i-l were on 2nd floor & were woken up every morning.

We stayed for three nights here and were glad we chose a hotel that is at a very convenient location. The main shopping center is just within a minute walk away and the beach within five minutes. There are several ABC Stores nearby, and the trolly stop at Galleria is very close by. Although the hotel itself is a bit outdated, the room facilities have been updated and maintained very well. The room although small is very clean. The sound proof window completely keeps the noise out. The price is reasonable, so we will definitely choose this hotel again next time.

The Shoreline is a very comfortable small hotel. The rooms are small, the pool is small and its not on the beach. But its clean, and convenient to the beach and shopping. The staff is friendly and helpful. If you want value in its price range, I would highly recommend it. If you want grandeur, you should try somewhere else. We will stay here again.

I stayed a little over a week, for my first time in Waikiki. Everyone on staff, from the desk concierges, housekeeping and maintenance act to make it a relaxed, hassle free experience. I appreciated the offer to print my boarding passes for free, and borrowing towels to take to the beach. When I managed to lock myself out of the room safe, there was a maintenance director there right away to reset it.The room was comfortable, clean and well-supplied. It was was on the top floor (14th) on Seaside Ave. side, but it was quiet, even being close to the elevator, as well as next to the access for the rooftop pool. The hotel is very convenient, almost right between Kalakaua Ave, (beach and Royal Hawaiian Center) and Kuhio Ave. I would definitely stay here again!

Wonderful Hotel. Very clean, nice bathroom and friendly staff. Nice location close both to beach, shopping, bars and restaurants! The Shoreline, Honolulu and Waikiki is a wonderful place to stay if you want to have a really good time!

We stayed in the hotel for 3 nights whilst in Oahu. From the outset I have to say the location is exceptional. 5/10 mins walk to Waikiki Beach, restaurants and bars on the doorstop and shops close by. Many tours stop off anfd pick up opposite the hotel too which is a big plus for getting out and about to see all the sights.The hotel itself is relatively small (compared to most in Waikiki!) which works to its advantage! The staff are amazing and couldn't do enough to help you, adding to the personal touch of the hotel. We originally were put into a room next to the lift which, being a light sleeper at the best of times, was horrendously noisy. I explained my discomfort to the reception staff and immediately they put us in another room - smaller but away from the lifts. As a result I had 3 great nights sleep despite being in the centre of the Waikiki area! Such is the dedication from the staff to ensuring your comfort. In the hotel itself I particularly liked the free amenities such as Wi-fi, the in room coffee machine and cold lemonade and tea/coffee downstairs in the lobby. As a side note, it's definitely worth visiting the Seaside Bar and Grill cafe for Breakfast (just around the corner) - does amazing waffles and pancakes at really good prices! If we ever visit Oahu again then we'll definitely consider staying at the hotel again.

We stayed here for five nights as part of a larger Hawaii honeymoon. The location is excellent, being on a quiet side road off Kalakaua Ave (the main road) with its shops, bars and restaurants, and about a 5-miunte walk from the beach. The hotel is quite small, meaning that you get the personal touch from the very friendly and helpful staff. We were surprised and pleased to find a welcome gift in the room for our honeymoon – a bottle of rum and mai tai mixer. The rooms are on the small side (although I believe this is common to all Waikiki hotels – much like New York), but reasonably well appointed and we had a superb balcony overlooking the street. Considering how busy Waikiki is, we had no issues with street noise. The WiFi is free and reliable. Coffee and free lemonade in lobby and free beach towels are a nice touch.Although we appreciate that Waikiki is an expensive place to park, we thought that $28 per night is somewhat steep. Despite this, we had a great stay and if we are ever to travel the 7,200 miles to Waikiki again, then we will consider staying here. Mahalo.

My partner and I stayed here whilst visiting Oahu, and loved it. The staff were simply wonderful, and couldn't do enough to help us with anything and everything.It's a few minutes walk to the central Waikiki area, where there are restaurants/shops etc., and the popular "Roberts" tours/excursions picked up from right outside the hotel (very convenient!)The hotel itself has free WiFi, a small but nice swimming pool on the roof, and they provided beach towels and drinks.Definitely recommended!

My husband and I stayed here last night. Hotel was clean enough but our toilet overflowed and hotel staff while pleasant were not prompt I'm fixing the problem. The issue was temporarily resolved but then again this morning it again. I informed the front desk again of the problem and the attendant did not seem concerned or apologetic. The complimentary coffee dispenser was completely empty and again no urgency to correct it. The price was right and the room was clean but if you want service don't go to this hotel.

I stayed at the Shoreline the last time I was in Hawaii and will be staying there again when I return in November. The staff were extremely welcoming and friendly without being overbearing and the rooms were clean and well maintained. I travel a lot for work and have stayed in many many hotels, this one has the most comfortable bed and pillows of all of them.It's a short stroll to the shops, beach and restaurants. Definitely one of my favourite places to stay.

just back from 5 nites at this hotel , rooms were a little small but good valvue for what we paid . Location is the best feature as you are only a block from the action . Loved the free cold drinks in th efoyer . Restaurant wasnt open but should be this week . Would stay here again

Our family enjoyed a terrific Waikiki vacation here in early August. The staff is wonderful, the location is fabulous, the rooms are in very good shape, and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We had a junior suite on the 13th floor (one floor below the rooftop pool). The room was on the north (city view) side and was very quiet. As others have noted, the view of the tired, old residential tower on the north side of the building is not ideal. Be aware that some of the junior view suites do not have balconies. We originally were in a junior suite on the 12th floor that had a six-inch ledges outside the two sliding glass doors. The oft-complained about Waikiki traffic noise heard at other hotels was non-existent in our room.The room worked for our family of four (2 kids on the sleeper sofa), but the updated rooms are locked into an old hotel room layout. The bathroom is quite small. The room itself has a walk-in closet (great for putting baggage out of the way and hanging clothes), but there is no drawer space for clothing--if you're the kind of family that likes to unpack.The pool on the 14th floor is small, but perfectly serviceable for an evening or sunset dip.As for location, you're not on Waikiki beach, but it is an easy 5-minute walk. Early morning and late evening strolls along Waikiki are terrific. If you're the type that likes to shop, you're in the heart of the upscale shopping district, plus a block from Duke's Lane and its myriad vendors selling jewelry, crafts, and clothing in outdoor stalls.Enjoy the complimentary coffee, iced cucumber water, tea, and pink lemonade in the lobby.

We stayed here last week during the threat of Hurricane Istelle.The staff were excellent,several were staying in house as there was potential for them not to be able to travel to work in the storm.Location great,wifi excellent,drinks in reception always welcome! Special mention to Alex and Ally who were around the last day as we hoped to get our connection out to Maui ...they helped with checking flights etc and Alex checked the weather updates several times for me.Love the personal touches in this hotel...I would highly recommend.We hired a paddleboard from Blue Planet Surf in Ward street...they dropped off and delivered and the staff at the hotel were very accomodating about this ..
user_name:
Natalee S
Auckland, Auckland, New Zealand

review_body: Good hotel in a good location. Great wifi. Pleasant staff. We had a room that adjoined the lifts and although the noise during the night was not bad, it did get somewhat annoying from around 6-7am. Pool area needs shade and more furniture is needed.

Awesome location if you are looking to be nearby everything in Waikiki. Staffs were courteous, warm and helpful. Located just off the main Shopping strip , short 10 mins walk to the beach and nice boutique feel to the hotel. Coffee and free lemonade in lobby is a nice touch. I found myself looking forward to the pink lemonade whenever I re-entered or exited the hotel. Free wifi with good connectivity was def a big plus. All kinds of restaurants and convenience nearby. Marukame Udon is a must try. Rooms were clean and contemporary although a bit small. A microwave and fridge is provided in each room. I didn't get a good view with my room but I'm sure that was just my luck with the hotel being almost at full capacity and its impossible to provide every guest with a view from the room. Bathrooms were clean and updated. The restaurant attached to the hotel is still under construction but with all that's around you, I'm not sure if that even matters at all.The hotel does all the little things that matter the right way and it adds up in the end. All in all, a very comfortable stay and I would consider staying here again in future returns. Mahalo!

Small, intimate hotel, very clean. The staff is friendly and helpful. The location of the hotel is idea, just a few blocks from the beach and the restaurants, and right across the street from the hundreds of vendors in "Duke's Lane".
user_name:
DaniloD73
Carol Stream, Illinois, United States

review_body: It was our first time in Hawaii. We stayed at this hotel for 7 nights. It is very close to Waikiki beach, shops and restaurants. Room was clean with free Wifi. staff are friendly and helpful. I would recommend it to anyone.

Wife and I in mid 20s visiting Oahu for 4 nights had a great stay at Shoreline. Free wi-fi from rooms, free hiring of beach towels that we took to the beach, free cool drinks from lobby, free to online check-in to plane and print off boarding pass from the lobby, good AC, easy walk to waikiki, saw a family happily using the rooftop pool on level 14. Chose a "city-view" room which had a tiny balcony (didn't use) and overlooked a run down apartment complex, from our room could hear people in hallway but not people in other rooms or people on the street (we were 8 levels up). We would recommend this hotel.

We only stayed at this hotel for 3 nights but it was the best choice. Staff were always super friendly and helpful. Room was really spacious and the bed was really comfortable, definitely struggled getting up in the morning. The location is perfect, only a short walk to waikiki beach and close to bus stops. Loved the free tea, coffee and lemonade in the lobby.It would be my first choice when I return to Waikiki.

Pleasant, mellow hotel with friendly staff. On fairly quiet street off main Waikiki strip, but close enough to beach and all restaurants, shops. Only 10 min walk to beach. Staff helpful, especially Ally, who really answered all questions and requests. Love the assorted hot and cold drinks always available in the lobby. Free wifi too! Would recommend to anyone.

The Shoreline is in an unbeatable position & really offers value for money. We stayed here for two weeks & really can't say enough about how great this hotel is. It's in an position if you want to be right in the heart of Waikiki. I travelled with three teenage girls so being close to all the fantastic shops was a real bonus for us. So was the free & speedy WiFi! The front desk staff were friendly & helpful at all times. The complementary basket of apples, newspapers, tea,coffee & ice cold drinks available in the foyer was another nice touch.We made daily use of the (small but clean) hotel pool & enjoyed the views over Honolulu. Some umbrellas around the pool area would be a welcome addition as it gets pretty hot up there! Overall, we had a wonderful two weeks staying at the Shoreline & look forward to coming again next year!

I attended a conference in Waikiki and was able to compare my experience with that of many colleagues and friends. The Shoreline Hotel was by far the most comfortable and friendly hotel in the price range and you would have to fork out at least 3 times as much to get anything comparable in terms of service and quality elsewhere in Waikiki. It begins with the wonderful lobby with cool complimentary refreshments and coffee and very comfortable sofas. Many of my friends come to meet me there were envious of the relaxed ambiance of the place as their hotels tended to be a lot less cozy. The room was very comfortable with a small balcony from where you can catch a glimpse of the sea and the hills, and a good desk where I was able to get some work done. Finally, what topped it all for me was the friendly front desk staff who provided beach towels every morning for my quick dip in the sea (3 minutes walk to the beach) before the conference started. There was one small drawback in that the air conditioning in the room is directed straight at the bed and I would have preferred having indirect cooling as I am not used to air conditioning. I told the front desk on my last day and they promised to look for solutions for future guests with the same problem, such as keeping mobile screens that could be put in front of the air conditioning when a guest requested it. I also forgot some personal items in my room that were kindly mailed home to me by the hotel's lost and found department.

We stayed here for 13 days we arrived in at 11.30pm and we very lucky enough to get a room on the top floor but once we got inside our room we noticed no fridge inside which we definitely needed staying this long so the guy on the front desk changed us no worries but the only other room left was on the 2nd floor which I wasn't that happy about cause I heard this hotel was noisy at nights. The guy on the front desk said if it was too noisy he could change our room to another one in a few days when another room opened up. He was so friendly and apologetic about the whole situation which was great after arriving on a long flight. Once inside our room 228 we realized there was far more space than in the one of level 14, rooms ending in 28 are by the elevates so they are much bigger which you want staying 13 nights! We didn't hear any noise while staying here we slept like babies the bed was so comfy! The view was of seaside ave which the hotel is on but the only time we went out on the balcony was to hang our togs cause your on holiday and hardly in your room so it didn't matter what we looked at. The room was serviced daily and was very clean.I would recommend a roomBy the elevates as the rooms are almost double the size!The location was amazing a minute walk to the beach, dukes, Cheesecake Factory, Maccas and most tours pick you up from outside Ross Ross store which is right opposite! Bus stop to Ala Moana shopping mall is 30 seconds walk I would definitely be returning here the location was great, staff were friendly and room was big and clean. Request a fridge if your staying more than a few days!

This is a small boutique hotel located a few blocks off Kalakaua, the main drag in Waikiki. It's about a 7-10 minute walk to the beach through the Royal Hawaiian Shopping center. This is not a resort hotel, and you won't be choosing between an ocean or a garden view room. Don't let this deter you - you're unlikely to be spending much time in your room anyway - for heaven's sakes, if you're staying here you're in Hawai'i!! I chose this hotel because the reviews said the beds were comfortable and I was in town on business. The beds ARE comfortable. The rooms are small, rather dark, and there is not much special about the property. The hotel is clean and the prices tend to be very competitive for this area of Waikiki. There is a pool on the roof that one of the guests I saw joked was a "communal bathtub." But, again, it's Hawaii - you should be at the beach if you want to swim. :)The people at the front desk are very helpful and friendly. I stayed a total of 5 nights and would stay here again. The property is close to everything - bus lines (very easy to get around Honolulu on the buses), wonderful restaurants, world class shopping (including the Ross Dress For Less right across the street)j, and the beach. The front desk staff can hook you up for much of what you'll need in terms of activities, short term car rentals, etc. I do have a number of tips for those considering this hotel. First, if you're a coffee drinker know that there is always coffee in the lobby. There are Keurig's in the room, but after check in they will charge you $2.00 per pod. So, either plan on walking down to the lobby or bring some pods along. Second, be very wary of rooms ending in 28. They are larger than the others, but share an entire wall with the elevators. If you're a light sleeper you're not going to want to listen to the elevator workings when you're in the room. Third, there is often a bowl of apples in the lobby, but no restaurant currently on the property. But, check out the amazing closet sized Bento and Misubi place next door - it's amazing.

From checking in to checking out everything was perfect. Great staff and only a block from the Waikiki strip! I love the fact that this hotel was close to all the major stores and shopping. The only complaint I have is that it is not stroller friendly. The hotel should really consider building a ramp, in the front of the hotel, for strollers and luggages. Other than that, my family really enjoyed our stay.

The hotel is good value for money. It is located right in the heart of the Waikiki beach district and handy to most bars/eating places. Rooms are very basic but come with a fridge and microwave. The bed was very comfortable but the a/c isnt very good. Had it on the coldest setting but at night it didnt cool the room at all. The wifi in the lobby is good but in the rooms it takes long to connect and not very strong. The coffee and cool drinks in the lobby are a nice touch. We were on our honeymoon and didnt expect much but even after mentioning it in our booking no mention was made of it during our stay. Staff are okay, not very friendly and did not go out of their way to offer any assistance. Dont think we will return to stay there by choice.

Family of 5 celebrating my 50th birthday. Hotel staff are very helpful. 10+ rating for the cleaners. Our rooms were crisp and clean daily. The double beds are sooo comfortable. Access to shopping and restaurants. Refreshing drinks daily. Planning on returning next year.

The Shoreline Hotel is a smaller hotel but it is convenient to everything and clean. The staff was accommodating and friendly. The hotel is a very short walk to beach access for Waikiki Beach.The only reason I would not give this hotel an excellent rating is because there is no place to obtain food on site and the parking is valet parking only for an additional $28.00 per night. I think most of the hotels charge for parking but it would be a plus if they were a little cheaper. I did inquire at some other hotels and found some charged as low as $15.00 per night for guests. There is coffee in the lobby but they only provide coffee in your room for the first night. If you want coffee for any other nights there is a $2.00 charge per cup.

Lovely staff. Nice roof top pool. Fantastic location within minutes of from main street. Lovely touch with fresh drinks, tea and coffee and apples each day + daily newspaper. Shopping available across the road. ABC store not much further away for all daily needs - cheap sandwiches for an easy lunch, drinks, small goods - toothpaste, soap etc. Thoroughly recommend.

- Front desk was extremely helpful and friendly.- Valet parking was never a hassle, always fast.- Always had refreshing water and iced tea in the front lobby and usually had apples as well.- Awesome location, within walking distance to everything you need.- The only slightly negative comment is that the room was on the small side, but we've definitely seen smaller!

Stepping off the beach strip drops the price of hotels in Waikiki dramatically. But it doesn't have to drop the level of standard in your hotel! The Shoreline is a quality hotel at a mid-level price.Rooftop pool, clean and neat in the rooms and the common areas.Check in/out were a breeze; the staff professional, friendly and polite.The only two "drawbacks" might be the incredibly small and awkward parking lot (don't use it, just pull up to the curb along the front of the hotel) and the lack of a view (at least lower floors have a very ugly building next door as the view.)However, the hotel, as mentioned in other reviews, is in an easy walk to the beach, restaurants, and shopping (Ross is directly across the street!)Terrific place to stay!

The shoreline hotel is a boutique type, modern looking and conveniently located hotel. The surrounding might not impress you with Ross store on one side and a weird building on the other side, but that didn't really bother us because the inside was great and you can't choose a better location. The staff was always very welcoming, helped us find dinner options, transportation suggestions and other general questions. The hotel's location is great. 1 block behind the main Kalakaua Ave, which is where all the restaurants, shopping and way to Waikiki beach is. It was also very good for public transportation, both on Kalakaua Ave and Kuhio Ave, on both ends of the island. We used the Bus system a lot and it was worth it because the roads can be packed with cars and finding parking (and paying for it) can be time and money consuming. We only needed the rental car for 2 days that we spent driving to the far east and north part of Oahu.Back to the Shoreline hotel- the room was always clean and we even received a call that asks us if we would like cleaning anyway in one of the days that we had the "do not disturb sign" left on our door. The bed and pillows were one of the most comfortable I had, and I have to note that I suffer from back condition and travel a lot so...We didn't notice any of the construction around, although it was written in a note that waited for us in the room. We came back around 6-7 p.m. every day and I guess they were already done (3rd floor).I know that I'm not the usual leisure traveler to Hawaii, but I really don't see any point paying for those big resort style hotels when I'm out all day and all I need is a good bed and clean shower, and I definitely found that in Shoreline hotel!

Great staff great hotel! Couldn't recommend it highly enough! Perfect location away from the noise and yet close enough to all the main areas! The staff at the front desk couldn't have been friendlier and all the small touches like the coffee and tea and punk lemonade were awesome!

Just a 1 night stay here but it was such a prime spot and modern/clean hotel I would definitely be returning to!It had all the necessities for a comfortable stay at such a reasonable price that impressed our trio family. Microwave and free wifi were an added bonus. Their roof top pool is small and probably wouldn't leave an impression as other grand places may, but it's sufficient, without a doubt.Yep, we will be booking here again for any future visits to Honolulu!

Stayed here for an overnighter. Good location, short walk to the beach and all restaurants, shops etc. Staff were great. Check-in from 3pm was a bummer after getting in at 8am from a red eye but they kept our luggage until we could get our room. Sleep quality was the main issue here - the noise from door slamming shut from 7am was pretty bad and meant no sleep in!

This was the 5th vacation to Honolulu for my wife and I. Each time at a different hotel. All in Waikiki. Shoreline was the most centrally located hotel of the 5. Even though we like to walk, it was nice having everything so close. We were there for 8 days for our 42 second anniversary.Our room was small but we didn't much room when sleeping. The south view from our window was of a very run down building. We quickly solved that by not looking out the window anymore. Bed was very comfortable. Fresh fruit and different kinds of beverage were in the lobby most of the day.Wifi in the lobby was free for the first 20 minutes each day. You must give a credit card number first before using it. There is a timer on the screen, letting you know how long you have been on-line. It cost $4.95 for each additional 20 minutes. Each page you print is 29 cents added to your credit card. ($1 minimum)Every time we travel to Honolulu, we buy the Entertainment Book in advance. We received many of our meals for free or half off. You can print additional coupons on-line using the computer center at the hotel. We left the book with our son and daughter-in-law when we returned home. They live in Honolulu. You can always give it to the staff at Shoreline. They were great and VERY friendly.Another way to cut cost is to join the birthday clubs at different restaurants. They always give you something free for joining. We just list the local restaurant as our favorite location.Shoreline could be the first hotel we return to. The next time, I will have treats for the 2 friendly cats who hang around to parking area.Thank you for a wonderful vacation experience..Steve

stayed at the shoreline for two weeks while i was in hawaii on a business trip (yeah, tough life). the shoreline was within the per diem limits and was in a good location. obviously not right on the beach, but it was a close enough walk. the hotel is a block away from island vintage coffee, which offers great coffee (unfortunately, the free coffee in the hotel lobby isn't too tasty. but if you just want the caffeine boost, whatevs). as for the rooms, they are clean, but dont have that "new" feeling, despite the relatively recent renovation. the bathroom in particular had an "old" feeling, and it didn't help that the tub would not drain well and that the water pressure was a little weak. valet parking (the only parking option) was convenient when it was available - for the first 3 nights, i had to park in the public garage across the street because the hotel didn't have spaces. the hotel provides a discount for the public garage, but for just a couple dollars more, the valet parking is easier. my one major gripe - the balcony is tiny, and the "partial ocean view" means a teeny tiny sliver of blue above and between two buildings. it's not worth the extra money for that "view." all in all, the hotel is good enough for a stay, especially at the price point.

Despite reading some bad reviews we found this hotel to be perfect for our needs! Very helpful staff who helped us book a rental car and printed us directions on where to pick it up etc.Clean rooms and an easy walk to the beach and all the shops! Would stay here again for sure.

My partner and I stayed here from 10th - 23rd June 2014. I picked this hotel because it had the best ratings (in my opinion) on Trip Advisor and was also a great price and looked a lot more modern than similarly priced hotels in Waikiki. I was definitely not disappointed! The location is amazing, literally right in the middle of Waikiki, really close to bus stops to take you anywhere, and about a 6 minute walk to the beach.I made sure to choose a partial ocean view room, as previous reviewers recommended and I'm glad I did! I could see the ocean, although obstucted by the Royal Hawaiian hotel and other buildings, but really, I wasn't fussed (and I rarely spent time on the balcony anyway). The room itself was small but I was aware of that and totally fine with it. We had a massive TV with heaps of channels (I love that Scenic Hawaii one! Much to the disappointment of my partner when I watched it all the time haha!) and OMG thank goodness for the free wifi! It was a massive life saver, especially since I planned and booked all our activities on my iPad! We also used the rooftop pool a few times - it was nice when there weren't any people up there.The front desk staff are all really nice and helpful! I'm especially grateful that they allowed us to check in at 10am (our room was ready) as I was suffering jetlag and felt like a zombie and just wanted to sleep! Thumbs up! Also the 3 different iced tea drinks in the lobby always made my day after coming in from the heat! As well as the free coffee, that was always handy in the morning!I really can't fault this hotel at all. I really would have liked to see the restaurant that was being renovated downstairs, but I guess I'll check it out next time! I would absolutely stay here again if I returned to Waikiki!

I love this hotel. I stay there every time I go to Honolulu. Located a street back from the beach and within a minute from the major shopping precinct, the shoreline is a great place to stay. It's affordable and the rooms are always clean and well presented. The rooms are a decent size and the bed is comfortable. The bathroom is presentable and modern. Free wifi is available at the shoreline also.The cost is another bonus of booking at the shoreline. It is very affordable. It does not have a gym, but they offer you free vouchers to go to a near by gym. The same staff are there every year we go. They embody the Hawaiian spirt! Always have a smile and nothing is to much. The lobby is clean and well presented offering complimentary coffee and tea. I whole heartedly recommend this hotel.

This is a cute little hotel in the heart of Waikiki, just moments from the shops and beach. The rooms are pretty average, which is to say comfy beds, typical modern hotel decor, and a clean modern bathroom. We had a room on the back of the hotel at 5th floor and there were no views as such, but it was quiet given the hotels downtown location.There are lots of nice little touches that make this a step above similar chain hotels: free iced tea in the lobby, a black board in the lobby with information for the day (weather, sunset etc) and a small pool on the rooftop. But best of all are the staff, who were all super friendly and dealt with all of our requests quickly and efficiently.

I thoroughly researched and planned for months when picking this hotel. We chose it over a condo because of the reviews which raved about the comfy beds, great showers, courteous staff and cleanliness of the hotel. They're all wrong. My request for a room not facing Seaside Ave. wasn't honored but it was quiet enough, even being on the fifth floor. Most of the renovations were being done in the daytime which didn't disturb our sleep. Unfortunately, it was all downhill after check in. The bathroom wasn't very clean when we arrived to our room. There was a light ring in the tub and a few hairs on the bathroom door. The toilet had some black stuff under the rim Housekeeping came up with a dry towel. He wiped the toilet, then the tub (with the same towel) and said it was 'just stains.' The next day, we got to the room at 3pm and our room still hadn't been cleaned. We were told they had until 5 so we sat on the balcony while they cleaned. Cleaning consists of a light spray of the bathroom, making the bed, changing the towels and emptying the trash. They don't vacuum the sand from the carpet or thoroughly sweep the bathroom. They also don't change the sheets (we marked the inside of the sheet with a pen just as a joke). The cleaning staff also smokes on the balcony. We found an empty pack of cigarettes and butts on there our second day. The customer service was almost as abysmal as the cleaning. When they didn't clean our tub at all one day, the manager Jerome asked 'What do you want me to do about it?' I asked him to send someone to clean it. He didn't until I made a second phone call hours later. He said it was 'mis-communication.' Another day they took our towels and didn't leave any washcloths. The front desk clerk Kristy sent someone up quickly but was very dismissive like I was bothering her. The best thing about this hotel is the location but if you have Gucci and Prada money, you wouldn't stay here. The balcony is large but you may be greeted by a whiff of smoke from the guest next door. As you know, there are no dressers or tables and chairs. There are a few drawers though and our King city view room was larger than I thought. The bed is right next to the bathroom and there's no vent in there. The valet guys were nice as was Aly at the front desk. The lemon water was a welcome touch but I'd rather be greeted with a smile instead of being treated like a burden. We honestly dreaded coming to the room everyday. I would not recommend.

I could not have been more delighted with my stay at Shoreline. The reception staff were very welcoming, the room was clean, comfortable and very quiet. The balcony was small but enough to sit on and take in the sounds and sights of Waikiki (although Waikiki is so easy to walk around). The hotel is ideally situated, just a short stroll to the beach (passing lots of shops along the way). It is also close to restaurants and convenience stories. Better still, the Ross store opposite the hotel was open to 1:00am. The staff were very knowledgeable and their suggestion of Duke's restaurant on Waikiki beach turned out to be a highlight. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel to solo travellers or couples.

We really enjoyed our stay here. Friendly staff, clean, and close to everything you want to see. The receptionist remembered me mentioning that it was our one year wedding anniversary and the very next day she had it on the announcement board to congratulate us. The kind of stuff that people remember. If we visit Waikiki again we will definitely book here.

It's times like this that I'd like there to be another rating option on Trip Advisor - something in between average and very good. This was good. The rooms are large enough and quite comfortable, although the attention to detail when they're cleaned leaves a bit to be desired. A quick walk from the beach and in the heart of the main shopping strip, it's a great location and even on a Saturday night it's quiet enough to sleep outside. The hotel offers free beach towels for you to take to and from the surf which is a nice touch. There's plenty of water pressure in the shower and the wi-fi works well. The only downside is the pool area which looks, frankly, very sad. It wouldn't take much to make it look much more pleasant and inviting. Good value for money

Had a great stay here. The staff were super friendly and helpful. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. Although this hotel is not on the beach (and therefore lacks a view) it is centrally located with the beach and MANY restaurants in walking distance (the hotel even offered us an umbrella when it was raining out). Great value and great service.

HONEST & UNBELIEVABLE customer service! Great value & great location! Forget the FourSeasons or Hilton! The staffs were so amazing and super friendly. Here is my story, I left money in the safe and completely forgot about it until i boarded my cruise, i called the hotel and told them that i forgot my money in the safe.
