I thought the money would've be gone but whomever cleaned my room was honest enough to return it to front desk. The staffs at the front desk told me they would mail the money back home. I had my doubts but i actually got my money back!!! So i thank Shoreline for being so honest and professional! I would 110% stay at Shoreline again!

Decided to stay our last night of a second trip in a different hotel. Was greatly disappointed. The Shoreline has a boutique feeling and staff makes you feel welcome and appreciated. Def did not find this at the Aston Waikiki. While the location is better (and on the water), The Shoreline is only a step away from a nicer part of Waikiki Beach.

This is a boutique hotel and I found the ambiance of hotel to be very pleasing. Our stay was in May of 2014. This was our 2nd trip back to Waikiki our first visit was for 2 nights in November 2013. We stayed at the Outrigger Reef on the Beach. I really was impressed with this property everything from the cleanliness and appearance of common areas and Lobby, to the Staff's knowledge of hotel and facilities in addition to their knowledge of surrounding area. I found the rooms to be on the smaller side but the overall condition of guest room and furnishings more than made up for it. My wife was impressed with the cleanliness of both the room and the bathroom. I found the room to have proper functioning room technologies (television, entertainment, telephone and WIFI). The best part was the comfortable bed. I did not get a chance to use the fitness center so I cannot comment on the facility. For the price you cannot beat this hotel. So what are the cons? The only thing I wish this hotel had was a restaurant and bar. Having said that there were plenty of places to go within walking distance. The beach is close by and my wife enjoyed her stay here. I would recommend this property to family and friends.

We stayed here for two nights in June. We chose this place based on our past positive experiences with his hotel chain and it's convenient location.The check-in was smooth. Loved how the lobby always had the 24hr beverage stations as well as apples and newspapers. Shout out to Tyson from Dana Pointe at the front desk who was not only friendly and knowledgeable, but was breaking a sweat from multitasking whenever we saw him.The room we got was a standard. So definitely not much room to move about, but still very modern and hip. I really like how the have energy saver air conditioner using your hotel key. The toiletries are of good quality as usual and you get a real hair dryer to use.Note there is no gym here. There is a pool on the rooftop, but we did not use since the beach was close by.The hotel is very central to all the shopping. No need really to rent a car if you aren't planning to venture far from Waikiki beach. Just steps away from the hotel is a small japanese cafe/convenience store Masubi Cafe. Good food and super affordable. Would recommend checking it out if you're for a quick bite.

We stayed here for four nights and could not fault anything about this property. Staff were very helpful and friendly any time we approached the front desk. Rooms were clean and comfortable and very quiet. Daily newspaper, internet and free beverages were just the added extras that made our stay even more enjoyable. You get the impression that the staff are very interested in their jobs and the daily updates on the notice board were great to read. The location of this motel is fabulous. Walking distance to the beach (towels supplied daily at the front desk) and all the main restaurants and shops in Waikiki. We would certainly consider staying at the Shoreline again and were very impressed with this property.

we stayed here for 4 nights in november and we enjoyed ourselves. Easy valet parking and the staff were friendly and helpful. the bummer was that the restaurant wasnt open but im sure it is by now. our room was modern and clean and very comfortable. some people complain about the street noise but we didnt hear any.Great location and a great price.

If you are not looking for a resort hotel, but looking for a hotel in a great central location, with nice, clean rooms and efficient service, look no further than the Shoreline. We had seven nights here in May 2014 and really enjoyed staying there. It is a cute little hotel, modernized and very comfortable. The bed and pillows were great and I am very fussy! We had a view of the disgusting building next door, and a tiny peep of the sea! Honestly, given the quality of the hotel, the cost, and the little time we spent in our room, it was not a big deal. Why would you pay for a resort hotel and view when it appears you can use the facilities of the pools on the beach anyway during the day. If we ever return to Waikiki, we will be staying at the Shoreline again.

A very nice place to begin our Hawaiian vacation. We did not have a car and the location proved to be just fine. We were able to walk to the beach, to a number of excellent restaurants, and was accessible to trolleys or buses. The room was clean and well appointed. There was a great chalkboard welcoming newlyweds and teaching us non-Hawaiians some Hawaiian terminology - a nice homey touch. The front desk staff was great; very pleasant and very knowledgeable. A great first choice of hotel for our trip ...

My husband and I stayed here for five nights in April - May 2014. I was really impressed by the location of the hotel for the price, it was a really short walk to Waikiki beach and the main shopping/dining area. The decor in the room and lobby is nice and it feels really clean and modern. I think it is stretching it to call the view we had a 'city view' as it is more a view of the apartment next door but it didn't really bother us due to the view from the beach a short walk away. I really enjoyed the quirky touches in the hotel, like the pineapple ice-tea, flavoured water and pink lemonade available in the lobby and the chalkboard with facts and information about the area. The staff were all really friendly and had some good recommendations on places to visit.

We got a great deal on this hotel for 3 nights and I'm glad we stayed there vs our backup plan which was closer to Diamond Head. The front desk staff was friendly and approachable (especially Ali), though some seemed to know the area better than others. The furnishings and decor were contemporary although the drawer/storage space was limited and the room certainly is small. This didn't bother us too much as we were only there for 3 nights before heading to the BI so we just kept everything in the suitcases in the closet.The only cons were: no view to speak of; our room faced an adjacent apartment building, the laughably small balcony with one scrubby plastic chair, and the limited valet parking which forced us to park across the street every day.The location was right in the midst of the shopping area with lots of moderately priced restaurants nearby and a short walk to the beach. Excellent value!

Did a staycation here and the hotel is a pleasant surprise. It's double glass doors kept a lot of street noise out. It's actually a short block and half down an alley from the beach. Centrally located from shopping dining etc. The room fixtures look new, bath fixtures are modern. There is one warning for your shin, the bed frame extends beyond the mattress, so be careful not to kick it while walking in the dark. I enjoy it's shower a lot because the curtain frame is circular which keeps the curtain away from your body. Over all it's an excellent hotel.

I would say this hotel is average. Our room was VERY small! So small that it was difficult to find a spot to put our luggage and eventually resorted to storing one of our bags in the closet and had to keep the door open for it to fit. Good price and close to the beach. I think we could have found better for the price however.

stayed in the hotel from 29 April for 14 days with my daughter and grandaughter for 14 days and was extremely pleased with the choice. We stayed on the 14th floor in a junior suite - big enough for 3 females!!! even had a walk in wardrobe. arrived early and could not book in until 3pm but they held our baggage and gave us towels so that we could go to the pool or beach until our room was ready. after a walk along the beach we then went to the pool on the roof and although small was big enough. Hardly anyone there and we went every day, even I had a swim which was unusual. the hotel is so close to everything and was always spotlessly clean. Free wifi saved us a fortune as we used viper for contact to Australia. Free tea and coffee and also cool drinks were free (in the foyer) which was real good after coming in from the heat. Right opposite is a store called Ross, some really good deals for clothes. Staff at front desk were always friendly and helpful. Cannot fault this hotel and would definately stay there again.

We spent 7 nights at Shoreline and were pleasantly surprised by our stay. The hotel and room were clean and modern with more than enough room for us with our travel and plenty of shopping bags! The location is off the main "strip" but only by a few shops, and it was nice to be away from the traffic and hustle. The hotel was close to the main bus stops to all the popular island destinations plus fantastic food options and of course right across the road from Ross for Less! (a must for anyone looking for great value shopping!). We requested a higher floor as it was our anniversary and the hotel obliged by putting us on the 10th floor and even surprised us on our first night with a complimentary bottle of wine! The front desk staff were exceptional, providing us numerous maps and hints and tips to get around the island, including organising our early morning check in (after our flight landed well before check in time) and arranging our taxi on departure. Only negative is delivery trucks on the street can be noisy early in the morning, but not controllable by the hotel and suspect noise would be worse on the "strip" and in a hotel with a lot more guests on each floor ( we didn't hear our neighbours at all - which was nice).If you are looking for fantastic value, modern clean rooms, great location and friendly staff - this is your place! Thanks Shoreline!

You cannot beat the Shoreline. Just a few walkable minutes away from beautiful Waikiki beach, and shopping and restaurants of all kinds. The price for this location and quality is unbelievable. A smaller, older building that has been nicely updated to a modern gem. Everything in our room was in perfect working order and very clean. (Nice and quite, too!) Very helpful and friendly staff. On the negative side, rooms are small, views not great, tiny balconies, and no restaurant on the premises (at least not during our stay) -- and parking is expensive (valet only), but that's no different from anywhere else in Waikiki. But none of that would stop me from staying here again and recommending the Shoreline to my friends!

I stayed 2 nights following a business meeting to look around the island. the reception referred me to a good budget booking agent to book some tours which was helpful. The location was convenient especially being alone i felt safe wandering to the shops down the road at night. I liked the complementary drinks in the lobby, the cucumber and mint water was delicious! My room looked over the road, no view unfortunately but quite comfortable. The only negative was that the staff in the lobby were not very friendly, especially the porter, who looked very miserable, but overall the stay was good. i would recommend this hotel and would stay again.

I spent nine nights in this hotel and enjoyed the stay there. My trip was partially business and partially pleasure. There's supposed to be an attached restaurant on the north side of the hotel, but it was closed for renovations. The desk staff and maintenance crew were attentive. The room I had was a little on the small side, but I wasn't looking for large. Wireless internet was very helpful and the television was adequate (I'm not much of a television watcher). Beds are very comfortable and the bathrooms are well maintained. Hotel lobby is a bit dated (it smacks of 1964), but even then the staff are attentive to its cleanliness.

Stayed here in August 2013 and was very pleasantly surprised with this place. First off, it's in a great location, close to the beach and shopping without being on the beach. The staff is very polite and helpful. The decor was clean and chic-- i liked the color palette. Small rooms, but clean and updated. Loved that there was a rooftop pool (albeit small) that was empty 95% of the time. I think I lucked out because our room on the 13th floor had a HUGE balcony that had a partial ocean view.On my last 2 trips to Oahu, I've stayed at turtle bay and royal hawaiian so i've been a little spoiled! While Shoreline isn't the RH, you aren't paying RH prices, but you are still getting a great waikiki experience on a budget. And although I say it's budget friendly, you aren't getting a nasty budget-friendly hotel! Would come back for sure if I can't splurge on RH (which is still my fav)!

Our experience at this hotel was average overall. The entrance to the hotel was up concrete stairs to an unwelcoming landing that needed a good sweep. There was a person smoking at the front door. The front desk staff were also just average. The room was worn, had two double beds and was not overly tidy. The bathroom was tiny, as was the lanai. It faced the city and the street and was extremely noisy. We have stayed in Honolulu before and always enjoy it, but this hotel was an unimpressive start to our holiday.

I was very pleasantly surprised by this hotel. I arrived late due to a delayed flight.... I was probably the last guest to check in that day about midnight, and the hotel clerk met me at the door and was expecting me! The check in and welcome could not have been better. The lobby has been freshly done with some beautiful lighting and decor, as have the rooms. I was happy and impressed by the quality of the bed and the size of the room. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a prime location but traveling on a tight budget. It's located right next to the best hotels but for a fraction of the price. The hotel staff were immensely friendly and helpful.... a real change from the giant neighboring hotels whose staff are always overwhelmed by crowds of people. The only cons to this hotel are the limited views... mine looked into an adjacent apartment building, and the lack of an on-site restaurant. If you want a nice affordable place this is a great option.

We stayed at the Shoreline for 3 nights and it was fantastic! Location was good. Susan Makio and her staff were friendly and welcoming. The lobby has complementary coffee, tea, fruits and an assortment of cold drinks. I would stay there again and definitely recommend to friends.Close walking distance to the beach and the Cheesecake Factory. :-)

I recently stayed at this hotel after reading rave reviews from previous travellers. Everything said was spot on. The location was fantastic! Two min walk to trolley depot from which to travel to other destinations, from bus stops and best of all, my fave find (Marukame Udon). I loved everything about this hotel and it was perfect for my needs. I will definitely stay at Shoreline in the future. The hotel restaurant is currently being renovated but there are a few breakfast places close by (e.g. Seaside Bar & Grill, IHop, McDonalds) if you need an early start.Note this place is not for those who are accustomed to five star hotels.

We visited this hotel and stayed in room 1022 for more than a week. It was wonderful!!!Beautifully hotel with clean rooms. Housekeeping was included every day :)A short distance to the main street with all the designer stores. Very close walking distance to the beach. The hotel had even a pool on the roof. Fruit, coffee, tea & water drinks included at the lobby. Free Wifi was included, you could also use the computer at the lobby free of charge in 20 minutes. The hotel had a great staff who were helpful, kind and provided a good service with everything you ask =) We loved this hotel and will definitely visit it again. Very good price for a great hotelGreetings from Sweden :)

We stayed at the Shoreline for 4 nights on our first trip to Honolulu. It was a convenient location with friendly staff. We loved the complimentary tea, coffee, apples and ice cold drinks available in the lobby, especially after a long day out and about. We booked the Partial Ocean View Room which was a reasonably sized room but it overlooked a car park. You had to step out onto the balcony to see a glimmer of water to the right. The rooms were nicely renovated with a microwave, bar fridge and coffee machine. The room and lobby wifi was very handy and the only thing that we would add is a coin-op washing machine and clothes dryer. We would definately stay here again on our next visit.

Kia Ora (Greetings) from Aotearoa New Zealand. We spent our last 2 nights in Hawaii at The Shoreline, and unseasoned travellers as we are, found this a perfect place. On arrival the porter Sonny was helpful and friendly caring well with our luggage. Unfortunately the little outside lift for people with disabilities was not working. However the steps to the hotel were wide and shallow with sturdy handrails so I was able to get up with minimal difficulty and I could use my walking frame from there.  On arrival at the reception the two lovely ladies there made us very welcome and seeing I had a mobility issue changed our room to a disability unit. We had close relatives also staying and the ladies advised us which room they were in - not far from us on the 13th floor. These ladies were on the desk both evenings and were helpful and interested in our activities also providing directions and helpful hints for our sightseeing. The room was spacious and well set out, the bathroom had a 'wet floor' shower with a folding seat attached to the wall, rails where needed and everything was spotlessly clean. The little balcony had beautiful views of the sea and the city and we enjoyed sitting out there just looking at the ever changing scenery. There was a slight ridge (over which I had to step very carefully)where the sliding doors led out to the balcony and only 1 chair, but my walking frame had a seat on it was no problem. Our wakeup call the next morning was on time and courteous. The room was quiet and the air conditioning unit appreciated. The other couple also commented on the spotless state of their room, and although they didn't have a sea view enjoyed their city skyline. The foyer was spacious and welcoming. We did not use the fitness centre or swimming pool, so cannot comment on that. Being a plain tea drinker I did miss my tea bags thought there were plenty of herbal teas available in the foyer. The hotel was close to all manner of restaurants, and shops from high fashion to convenience stores with a bustling night life. We would highly recommend this hotel for the traveller looking for a good price, clean rooms and friendly staff. We are just 'ordinary Kiwis (New Zealanders) living on a limited budget and as we said in our title, this was the perfect place to end our holiday of a lifetime

This hotel was perfect - clean, well-appointed, and well-maintained, with a friendly staff and awesome location. What a fabulous deal for the price! It is right in the middle of everything, walking distance to anywhere you wanted to go to shop or eat. The lobby had infused water, tea, and lemonade, which was a nice touch. We never went to the beach while we were staying there, but I know the hotel offered complimentary beach bags. I would definitely recommend this hotel - it was just awesome.

I stayed five nights in room 622 at the Shoreline Hotel Waikiki (April 17 to 22, 2014), one of two Joie de Vivre Hotel brand properties in Hawaii. Last year, also over the Easter Holidays, I stayed at the other Joie de Vivre Hotel in Hawaii – Coconut Waikiki Hotel – and I have no hesitation in saying that while they are both well priced for Waikiki, the Shoreline Hotel Waikiki is the better of the two properties.I booked a “City View Queen” at the amazing price of $98 per night (plus tax). Upon my arrival, I was informed that I had been upgraded to a “City View King” at no extra cost. Although small, room 622 was clean and the King size mattress was firm but very comfortable. Bed linens and towels were adequate, the small bar fridge was a welcome appliance, and electrical plug ins were plentiful. The small flat screen television did not provide high definition programing (almost hard to believe in today’s world of inexpensive large screen, high definition televisions), but the free internet more than made up for the lack of proper television. The room does have a safe, ironing board, iron and hair blow dryer. Spoiler Alert: the Shoreline Hotel Waikiki is not a “high end property”, but it is well situated and provides everything one needs for a budget Waikiki experience. There is a very small rooftop pool, there are three community computers available for patrons to use in the lobby area, and the lobby itself is fairly small, simple, and underutilized. You can walk easily to everything in Waikiki, and you’re just a five minute walk to the famous Waikiki and Kuhio beaches. Restaurants, coffee shops (there is a Starbucks across the street), ABC convenience stores, banks, major transit lines, and retail therapy are all just a few steps away.On a scale of 1 to 10, where 1 is terrible and 10 is excellent, I rank the Shoreline Hotel Waikiki as a solid 8 and I highly recommend it. There is nothing wrong with spending $500 per night for a beach front hotel experience if that’s your thing. It’s just that most of us like the extra coin in our bank accounts, and the two Joie de Vivre Hotels in Hawaii go a long way towards preserving one’s bank account.

Location is great (close to shopping, beaches, little restaurants and markets); staff is friendly; rooms are really clean. Only thing is rooms also are very tiny (but well organized, with a microwave, fridge and desk) and atmosphere impersonal. Overall, we liked it !

I would say it's a good bargain compared to price. We stayed a partial ocean view room and had a concrete view of ocean and the Waikiki landmark "The Royal Hawaiian". The room is quiet, clean and has free WiFi. It's a easy walk to the beach and shopping. We strolled along the beach and had a drink at Moana Surfrider a Westin Resort. A wide range restaurant choice around the corner: the Cheesecake Factory, California Pizza Kitchen, and Japanese restaurants.

This hotel is not only at the centeral shopping area, but also provide everything all that perfect cosy. It is the first choice hotel I've ever experienced, friendly staffs, clean room, refigerator, even the microwave. That made me just feel like my home, everything I saw is absolutely clean and new. When it comes to the beach, my wife and me just walked 5 mins to get the beautiful Waikiki beach, and looked around the shopping streets along the way! Before going to the beach, you even can ask the counter staff for the fresh towels, and get them to go. The valet DUSTIN was so friendly to introduce everything we wanna know in the hotel. He exactly help us all that much! The hotel absolutely made my honey all that sweet!

Overall a really good choice if you want Waikiki but don't want to pay a lot and appreciate good design and service. The rooms were very clean, good sized and quiet (we were on the 12th floor). Staff were friendly and helpful. Not sure what I would do differently as it really seemed to provide a lot for the price relative to what else is out there.

My wife and I had previously stayed at a Joie De Vivre Hotel in Huntington Beach, California and had been blown away by the customer service there so we decided we would try our luck with the same hotel company in Waikiki. I have to say that was a great decision. From the moment we arrived a the hotel we were greeted very attentively by all the friendly staff. Love the personal touch when they wrote our names on the chalk board on the day we arrived.We were traveling for the first time with our young infant so we had a number of requests at the time we were booking a room. We had heard about the noise levels if we were on lower floors so requested higher floor, trying to avoid noise from down below. We also needed a microwave and fridge for our baby food prep. Person we spoke to on the phone was very accommodating and we got everything we had asked for. We ended on the 10th floor facing the beach. Unfortunately at that level, we were really facing a car park. At the end of the day it was fine, because it was hard enough to find the right room with all the unique requests we had. We also had no problem with any noise since we were higher and facing away from the main roads. This was key to ensuring our baby slept through the night and she did!Rooms were quite clean and really met our expectations. Location really is great and central to just about everything. Wasn't too hard to make a B-line to our hotel room in case of any baby emergency or just needing a pit stop.Overall we really enjoyed the stay as we were there for 11 days. While the hotel has been renovated and has that boutique feel to it, the staff really made all the difference. They would ask you about your day and just have friendly conversations and even provide helpful advice and tips. Everyone was just so accommodating and willing to help out. I just wanted to specifically thank Christy, Sonny, Tyson, Alex, and Dustin for all their efforts in creating a wonderful vacation experience for us. It obviously left an impression on us.With such great care and attention to the customer experience it's really going to be difficult for me not to return to this hotel the next time I have a chance to go to Waikiki!

I would recommend this place as an excellent value when staying in the area. Easy walking distance to everything. Excellent customer service and very cool and not crowded roof top pool. Only flaw we could find was two some type of bug we saw twice. But it is Hawaii bugs are hard to totally get rid of. New and updated rooms also.

The Shoreline was an excellent choice. I have been to Waikiki a few times now and usually stay 'on the beach' so it was a little bit of a risk to stay further away in a new hotel that I had not been in before. Fortune favours the brave. This was a great hotel. The staff were very friendly day and night and always made you feel welcome and kept you informed of what was happening in Waikiki that day. The rooms were clean, bright, very comfortable and far more stylish than I have experienced elsewhere. US hotels are usually daggy and lack contemporary style. This hotel made you feel that you were in Hawaii the whole time without it becoming a themed hotel. Would I stay here again? Definitely so. The location is great for going out to dinner and shopping (Which you do a lot of) and is only a short stroll to Waikiki beach. I went twice a day with my surfboard and it was never any hassle at all.

We found the Shoreline very pleasant and staff are extremely friendly and willing to help anyway they are able. We were upgraded during our stay which made our trip very special. Very central to Waikiki attractions and restaurants. Rooms were great and clean. Will stay again if we go back.

The location is excellent -- close to all amenities, shopping, restaurents, good bus services, and within walking distance to the beach. A new H&M clothing store is just around the corner, as is the Royal Hawaiian Centre and Dukes Marketplace.The hotel price is reasonable, and staff is friendly and helpful. Dustin the bellboy was very willing to give information on how to get to places and Tyson at the admin desk phoned up after we were settled in to see if everything was to our satisfaction.The room is clean and adequate and bed is good. There is free WiFi in the room (I love this feature) a microwave, and coffee maker. The lobby is welcoming with Keurig coffee and refreshing water for guests 24 hours.We spent two nights there, in transit from Australia back to Canada. From Airport to hotel and return to airport, we got a shuttle service called Speedy Shuttle and paid $53 dollars total for the two of us. The shutlle will come to the hotel to pick you up at the arranged time.All told we were bery happy with our stay at the Shoreline.

The hotel is located right in the heart of Waikiki area, so that's its main advantage. Rooms are actually nice and cozy and the staff is really helpful. And one thing I really liked is that even though they don't have a fitness center, they have $5 passes for a great gym in front of the beach.Now to the main downside......rooms do not have blackout curtains! That means that at 6 am you already have sunlight coming into the room.......maybe they fixed that already though.Other than that, it's a good affordable option in Waikiki area, and the fact that offers free WiFi adds another point to the overall stay.

For our trip to Hawaii, we hoped to find a place that was conveniently located, reasonably priced, comfortable, clean and safe. With the Shoreline, we had all of those features. The hotel staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. They were able to answer all of our questions about booking excursions, using local buses, attractions and restaurants. They greeted us with pleasant smiles at any time of day and were unfailingly courteous.The room was not particularly large, but we had enough room to unpack for our 9 night stay. The closet was large and we were able to get additional hangers. The bathroom was very modern, clean and bright. The refrigerator and microwave were convenient. We brought back leftovers from meals out and had them for lunch several times. The real coffee mugs were a nice way to start our mornings.The hotel location was ideal for us. Many excursions and tours picked up right across the street from the hotel--very nice indeed for early morning starts. The beach was an easy 5 min. walk. We were just off the main shopping area and numerous restaurants were within a few minutes stroll.The view from our room was not exciting, but the balcony was very handy for hanging wet swimsuits and clothes. We did not need to hang beach towels because the hotel provided free use and laundering of those. The street was quiet at night and that is important to us.The Shoreline is reasonable priced in comparison to most of Waikiki. We preferred to spend our vacations dollars on excursions and experiences instead of an overpriced room. We would definitely return to the Shoreline if we return to Waikiki.

This hotel is right in the heart of Waikiki and only a few minutes walk all the TA favourite restaurants. They provide beach towels to take to Waikiki and have some complimentary drinks in the lobby, including coffee. The wi-fi is also complimentary. It's not beachfront but that's why it's cheaper than other resorts, but the location is very handy.Although our room was very small we were happy with it, the only issue was a lot of noise could be heard from other guests going about their business which wasn't ideal.Would stay again.

This is a clean and modern hotel with very pleasant staff in a great central location. Waikiki has expensive accommodation, so this hotel was reasonable value for a nice modern hotel centrally located. A few minutes walk to the beach, shopping and eateries, this is a great choice of hotel in Waikiki.

My wife and I stayed here for three nights at the end of March. For the low rate we paid, we were extremely pleased with the overall experience. This is a very clean, recently remodeled establishment. The room was small, but included free water, coffee, wifi, and toiletries with plenty of towels. We received fresh towels every day (even though we didn't actually put our used ones on the floor), and the a/c was quiet. Having to use the room card to activate the a/c was a little awkward, but I understand why they do it (no need to run the a/c when there's no one in the room). The hotel has a vibe that adds to the whole vacation experience; the employees were friendly and helpful. Dustin, in particular, helped us with all sorts of tips about the beach and surrounding area. The location is fantastic, about two blocks from the main entrance to the Royal Hawaiian Center, which itself is very close to the beach. Obviously, it's not the Halekulani. There's no restaurant, and if not having a completely unobstructed view of the ocean bothers you, then perhaps it won't be your cup of tea. However, if you want to keep your costs down, sleep in a clean room with friendly service in a great location, then the Shoreline is an excellent choice.

I really like this hotel! The hotel was very clean. The service was great and the people that worked there were so friendly and always willing to help. It was in a really good location, within walking distance to many restaurants and shopping. Would definitely recommend.

Great small sized hotel with modern services and perfect location to waikiki beach and shopping. Affordable and friendly staff. Highly recommended for people who don't want to go over the top, but want the services. Rooms are small, but accommodating.

Mahalo to every single person who works at Shoreline hotel! We just spent 9 nights at Shoreline and it was great. When we arrived on March 18, front desk manager sent a bottle of wine to our room as a gift for our upcoming wedding on the Island. I don’t remember his name but it was around 7 pm 03/18 – thank you so much to him! Honestly, every one at the front desk was friendly and helpful. Thank you for providing me with a sewing kit. When we left yesterday 03/27 Dustin Bellraz helped us with storing our language and later taking it to our taxi. Thank you so much! The hotel itself was just like on the pictures. It feels new, fresh and modern. It was great to have coffee/ tea/ infused water and iced tea at the lobby all day long. In addition, it was nice to have fresh apples almost every morning. Thank you for that. Our room was 1029. It was smaller than I expected, but now I think that the size was just right. Its cozy and you shouldn’t spend your day at the hotel, in Hawaii you must be outdoors! Big thanks to housekeeping team our room was always made on time and it was spotless. I also wanted to say that I really liked that even though the hotel is big, it never felt overcrowded. Overall, we had very good time in Hawaii and had a wedding of my dream. When we’ll be back we will be definitely considering staying at Shoreline Hotel. I would definitely recommend everyone staying there. Mahalo!

Me, my wife and our friends, we spent one week at Shoreline Waikiki. We have booked three rooms (11th,12th and 13th floor). All rooms were King Rooms, they looked pretty much the same and had similar views. Despite good rating I give, I can't really think of any strong and obvious pros of this hotel besides it's value. We liked a bed which was very comfortable, location and a big TV - thats it. Shoreline Waikiki is a typical medium class US hotel and you just shouldn't expect too much of those. We had a quite clean and spacy room but our balcony was a total mess - a load of dirty concrete with water puddles after rain and a view reminding Hongkong. Advertised partial ocean view is an exaggeration as one can see only a little bit of water between buildings. There are sliding glass doors between the room and the balcony. Unfortunately locks on both were rusty and one didn't even work properly. Considering how close our balcony was to others we decided not to leave valuables inside the room. Bathroom was small and needed renovating not to mention stuck drain in the sink. But one thing I remember the most was air conditioning - complete disaster. The unit was placed exactly next to the bed. After switching on we felt like inside a freezer as cold air blew directly into us. Moreover the temperature was regulated by a long very cold and loud air bursts. They lasted for 10-20 minutes and paused for another 10-20mins. The only way to sleep was to open the sliding door and hope that noone will enter. We had to bare city noise of course having balcony opened. It was not that bad but we don't know how it would have been if we chose a room on lower floor. Shoreline doesn't have any restaurant or bar. It also does not have a parking but one can have his car parked at a parking lot across the street (20$ a day plus valet). Location is rather OK. Waikiki can be reached within 5 minutes by foot. If you drive to Shoreline for the first time get a good look on the map. There is a lot of one way streets and it is easy to get lost. I think this hotel deserves good rating because it has considerably good location compared to the price.

Spent 5 nights at the Shoreline.The room was modern looking, clean and big enough for 2. The staff were welcoming and friendly. Two baggage stands for our suitcases was thoughtful.It's barely 5mins walk to Waikiki beach and right in the center of the busy area (restaurants, shops, etc). The complementary beach towels, water and coffee are a nice touch.Parking is pricey at $25/day but found somewhere else at $15/day about 10-15mins walk away.Worth the savings I think.Overall, I'd stay there again.

We stayed here for 2 nights and the best part is the awesome location right in the middle of all the shopping, beach access and restaurants. It is right across from Sheraton but much much cheaper. The rooms are small-ish but well maintained and comfortable. Parking is pricey at 27 bucks a night but worth it because it's hard to find street parking in Waikiki.

I had a very pleasant stay at this hotel recently. The staff are friendly and helpful, the rooms are clean and the location is fantastic with many surrounding shops and restaurants. I would definitely recommend staying here. I'll be staying here again!

This hotel is smack dab in all of the shopping, and eating you could want. Very clean and rooms have good a/c. Definitely recommend. Parking is pricey, $25 a day staff is very helpful. Loved it. Gentleman staff in lobby carried my bags down the stairs when I needed help. Thanks!

This hotel which appears to be recently re-done in mid century modern style, is clean and attractively located just a few blocks from the beach. The bathroom is small but efficiently designed with a GOOD shower. The double bed is comfortable and the room is equipped with black out curtains. Each room has free WIFI. There is no food service available at the hotel but there are many restaurants nearby. Free coffee, tea and ice water is available in the lobby. There is no gym but the hotel will sell you a day pass to a local gym located a few blocks away. If you don't spend a lot of time in your room and you probably won't if you are visiting Hawaii...this hotel is a very affordable option. Taxi from the airport to the hotel will run you about 40 dollars.

Stayed at the Shoreline from March 1 - 8th in a Junior Suite Partial Ocean View room on the 13th floor. Overall experience was excellent. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful everyday. The size of the junior suites was more than adequate. Yes the 13th floor suites do not have lanais except for the end king view rooms that have the only huge lanais on the property. The 13th floor has a 'Juliette' style balcony that was more than adequate for us - being somewhat acrophobic the thought of spending massive amounts of time on a slab of concrete jutting out from the building is not my idea of vacation time. As for the negative comments in other reviews, all I can say is that this was not our experience. If you want a room with a view of something other than another building (which is the norm in Waikiki) then book (and obviously pay for) a room on the higher floors. Our suite was well designed, had a fridge, coffee maker, etc and excellent Wi-Fi. The bathroom was large - and did not have the toilet in the shower. The products supplied by the hotel were very nice.The only negative I might point out is that the rooms do not have any sort of dressers in which to put your clothes. However, the closets are huge. In the suite there were 2 full double closets which had shelving units inside that provided more than adequate space. There was a lack of sufficient hangers in the room but one quick call to the front desk immediately solved that problem. So, overall it was an excellent vacation. If you are looking for a relaxing, low key hotel in a great location I would recommend staying here. I will be returning as soon as possible. Mahalo to the staff.

I can’t say I had a bad experience at Shoreline hotel, so the overall rating isn’t that off, but as someone who spends time actually reading reviews, I don’t know where all the specific compliments came from. The room is tiny (Chicago size) and the A/C is noisy, as pointed out by a few other reviewers. Now, for the original comments: The parking fare wasn’t a surprise, but everybody mentioned they relied on a 3rd party parking across the street. During my whole time there (6 nights) I could always find a spot on the limited parking space they have on site. Such “luck” didn’t prevent the daily charge of US$26,00. I got a 4th floor room facing the front of the hotel only to find out the Ross store is a meeting point for several tours (information confirmed by a staff member) and precisely at 5 A.M you start hearing those annoying 80’s games sound effects of buses reversing to park. I’ve tried twice to get moved to a higher floor but in spite of the apparent not fully booked situation (the on- site parking availability is a big indication of such) I was never granted with a floor upgrade. Honestly, I wouldn’t (won’t) personally recommend this hotel.

We recently stayed here for a week. We booked through their website and got us a Partial Ocean View King ADA room which says on the email we received in confirmation:"includes a... balcony/lanai, refrigerator, microwave..."When we got to our room on the 14th floor, we noticed that there was no microwave or fridge. The balcony was only for one person to stand on (why bother having one?) so I went down to the reception to ask if there was another room available that would actually match what we booked. I even brought our print out. There were 2 people at reception and there were both confused at the simple request. The unhelpful lady goes, "Is this something you think you would require?". Um, excuse me... I require what I paid for. It's like asking someone who booked into a resort if they require a pool. I was gobsmacked and said yes. She said no rooms were available until about 4 days into our trip. By then what's the point? I told her that she should tell management to change the description of the ADA rooms in their website and take off the fridge/microwave description and she just looked at me with a blank look on her face clearly just having failed Customer Service 101. The room we had was average sized. The king bed was very comfortable which is a plus and so are the pillows. The bathrooms are poorly designed (read: cheap) so that the shower is in the same area as the toilet. I believe another reviewer also commented about this being a poor design and I agree. Everything got wet basically. I sleep with earplugs on so the noise didn't bother me but if you're light-sensitive then please bring an eye mask. With all the lights off in the room, it was still bright. Again, poor design. The bed was facing the door directly and there were large gaps in the bottom and side of the door so the orange flourescent lighting from the hallway seeps into the room casting an orange glow all night. The airconditioning is also very loud. The pool was again another poor design (I'm just thinking the designers/management are lazy overall). It was just a rectangle of water in a rooftop with 4 plastic chairs. No umbrellas or anything to make it usable for anyone. Why bother?Some pros:- location is brilliant. Only a couple of minutes from Waikiki Beach.- the bed is comfortable- we found the free coffee/water helpful some days- there was one guy in reception that was particularly helpful (male with glasses on, morning shift always)Apart from these pros, there were too many cons especially the afternoon reception staff and their attitudes. Would I stay here again? No way. There are many more great hotels nearby just for a little bit of an increase on the price.

Thrilled to have found the Shoreline. Very much appreciated the front desk and their immediate response to our initial displeasure with the view of a garage roof. (Many thanks, especially, to Pete, for his patience.) Once settled in to our room, we were pleased all around. The rooms are well-appointed, as are the bathrooms. Our deck was great for watching the Waikiki scene. Nice lobby and extremely helpful staff. Note: Lower floor rooms get noisy at night from the street life. ** Upper floor rooms (1327, 1328, 1427 or 1428) are quieter. ** The hotel is only a block away from Waikiki Beach and great shopping. (Check out Dukes Marketplace on Kuhio Avenue for well-priced take-home gifts. Found some beautiful bead and shell necklaces that were well-priced.) Highly recommend and can't wait to go back.

I hadn't been to Waikiki for many years and we were on a bit of a budget as always - wanting a pleasant place without paying a fortune. After a lot of Trip Advisor research, I decided to book the Shoreline Waikiki.....it was the best choice I could have made.This is a delightful boutique hotel just a short walk from just about everything. I'm guessing it has been renovated in the last few years and is now stylish and modern. The room was a good size with everything you would expect - no musty smell that you get in so many of the other older properties. The staff were extremely polite and helpful - and good advise on restaurants, buses etc. Nothing was too much trouble.We loved the iced water, really good coffee and green tea available 24/7 ini the lobby.There is a samll rooftop pool - nothing flash but good for a quick dip and a fabulous view to the Royal Hawaiian and the ocean.All the local buses and trams stopped just a few metres away.Having looked everywhere for clothing and accessories at a great price we realised we had a Ross's Outlet store literally next to the hotel - and open to 11pm! We did some credit card damage in there!Would definitely stay again and would highly recommend to anyone else heading to Waikiki and not wanting to stay in one of the massive resorts.

I just stayed there for four days w/my wife during a vacation. Loved the location. It is a five minute walk from the beach. And the staff was super friendly. The room was a bit small but the price was great and totally worth it.

My Husband and I spent two weeks here for my special Birthday-we were so glad we picked this Hotel.It was such a great location close to everything and yet nice and quiet, as just off main road down a quiet street. The staff were all very friendly and gave us lots of advice about getting around the Island and good restaurants. Coffee making machine in the room and a small fridge.The bed was very big and so comfortable we slept really well.Would have no doubts about staying there again or recommending to any-one.

Boutique hotel near high end fashion stores and a 10 minute walk to beach. Room was small but compact and big enough for two. Big asset was the fact it was quiet on the 5th floor! Asked for a room away from street and it was really well soundproofed. Mini fridge and coffee maker in room and towels provided for beach if you asked at the front desk. Only thing the hotel lacked was a breakfast area. We ate our own in our room,but it was a small space in which to eat. No table at all....all in all a very good hotel and reasonably priced.

I stayed at the hotel while in town for a conference. I had requested a room on a higher floor as suggested in previous posts and I got a room on the 9th floor. The room was large enough, I was on my own. The first day there was a plumbing issue but I reported it and it was fixed right away. The staff I encountered were very friendly and professional but not uptight. I didn't need to have the room cleaned every day because I didn't spend a whole lot of time in it, I would just have a few towels replaced. The lanai is very small with one plastic chair, I went out now and then to check the status of the rain. It rained hard nearly every day I was there. I spent a few hours at the pool one day, it is small and I was the only one there. My stay for the most part was good, I was quite disappointed when I asked about staying an extra night and the rate was much higher than what I'd paid and I didn't feel the front desk was interested in working something out. The additional night was not planned and I ended up finding another hotel for the night. The parking price is too high. there is one super nice valet attendant, he was very friendly and courteous. I chose this hotel after researching and reading the ratings on trip advisor. I don't think I would rate this hotel as high as a five.

This is a very nice hotel. They were very helpful letting us know where to get a good meal, and giving us maps on how to get to different restaurants and attractions. When we asked for towels to take to the beach they even gave us little backpacks to carry them in.The rooms weren't the biggest, but they were plenty good for us.Front desk was very helpful.

Compared to the fancy Hyatts, Sheratons, etc in the area, this hotel will not wow you with its basic looks & facilities. I think it's biggest plus is the location - even though it is not ON Waikiki Beach.We encountered the biggest negative of our stay when the airport shuttle dropped us curbside. To our dismay, there was no ramp to tow our wheeled bags to the lobby - we had to carry them up a flight of (low) steps. Not fun after a long & tiring flight.Check-in was uneventful & we were allowed to get into our room early. We got our info for free wifi log-in & really appreciated the elevators to our 5th floor. The view was horrible (the backside of some business building) & we didn't really use the single chair on the small balcony. But I was curious about the pool on the 14th floor ...Again, not much of a view except for the tops of other hotels & other buildings around us. In the distance, maybe a hazy glimpse of the ocean. It was a very basic pool for getting wet, not much space for much else.Our room had a very comfortable bed, a mini-fridge, microwave & coffee-maker. We liked that there was a desk-chair and an arm-chair for two of us to sit on besides the bed. The shower was good & strong, but based on the lack of lather, I suspect the water was "hard" (normal for Hawaii?). Quite noise-proof too.Thankfully the hotel had a very detailed map of the surrounding area - restaurants, shopping, hotels, etc. Also details on riding the various public buses/trolleys & how to get to the nearby beach.Across the street, one of the ubiquitous ABC Stores (39 in Waikiki alone) where we shopped for 100% Kona coffee macadamia chocolates & souvenirs. Then we discovered Duke's Marketplace one street over, parallel to ours - a bargainer's joy for haggling over jewelry, handicrafts, etc from the numerous stalls & merchants.Kuhio Avenue is at one end of our Seaside Avenue and it is the cheaper, but no less exciting street than the high-end Kalakaua Avenue. Most buses run both ways on Kuhio so tourists can pretty much go anywhere.Next door to the hotel: an ATM and Starbucks (and another across the street). Opposite direction of Kuhio, cross Kalakaua Avenue, are the hotels that we walked through to get to the beach.As I said, great location - once you get your bearings. Unless you plan on staring at or living on the beach, there really is no need to pay the premium bucks to stay in those hotels. If there was a good price, I wouldn't mind staying here again. We got all our breakfast items at the ABC store & ate in our room everyday, using the microwave.

Stayed here during the Spam Jam event April 2013 - Location is very convenient (only a few blocks from Waikiki beach and right by the shopping area). The people working the front desk are all friendly and attentive. We weren't satisfied with the layout of our first room (view facing the parking lot) and asked to be changed. The front desk changed our room without hesitation to a higher floor with a balcony facing the front of the hotel. The rooms are recently renovated giving it a fresh decor and vibe. The bathroom was a bit depressing though with dim lighting and a very basic look to it (comparable to a motel 6 bathroom). Lobby was very modern with high ceiling, pleasant to come back to after a long day of excursions. There is parking available at this hotel.
user_name:
J M
New York City, New York

review_body: This hotel is in a great location, very central. Lovely and clean, with good linen in the rooms, great rooftop pool, and a very nice touch of freshly brewed coffee, and also ice cool water. Pleasant helpful frontline staff. Would recommend this to fellow Travellers

Based upon several 4 star reviews, I chose to stay at the Shoreline, which is very conveniently located in the heart of the Waikiki shopping district and within walking distance to virtually everything you would want to see on foot......But, despite the great photos and curb appeal, the room was extremely small ( I have had cruise ship cabins bigger than this), and the pool which is on the 20th floor ( last two flights are steps ), offers no shade or umbrella's whatsoever, so we could not use without getting badly burned. The only place to put a second suitcase was on the desk, except that it was loaded with a coffee pot, microwave and condiment tray. The hotel does not offer any food or beverages, and when you arrive you are greeted by 12 steps by which you must haul your luggage up just to get into the building. Location aside, I could have stayed at a real 4 star hotel for what I paid to stay here, and had the amenities that go with it. One Note: When we arrived and found no way to get our luggage up the 12 steps I went into the front desk to inquire if I was in the right place. The desk clerk (Peter) said, well; "most of the cab drivers know to drop you off at the rear service alley where we have a ramp." I am sorry, but I am not in the habit of being dropped off at the rear service alley of so called 4 star hotels. I think if you are single this might work for you, but otherwise, I would suggest another place with more room and more amenities. By the way, this hotel does have a handicap lift out front, which looks like a trash compactor, is unmarked except for a small faded sign that says ring bell for service. If you are handicapped, you may check in, but unless they have special rooms for you that are larger, you will never get around the bed or into the bathroom, and I doubt the balcony would hold a wheelchair.

Location is everything for me. Shoreline Hotel is situated on Seaside Avenue equidistant to Kalakaua Avenue and Kuhio Avenue and directly opposite Ross Dress for Less.Arrived early and was able to check in prior to 3.00pm thanks to the lovely Reception staff. Gorgeous lobby area with freshly brewed coffee and iced water available all day/night and daily newspaper.My queen room was on the 9th floor with a city view facing Lauula Street and overlooking the Marine Surf Condos. Although the room was on the small side, it was perfectly adequate and clean. Comfy bed, lots of pillows and extra bedding in the wardrobe. The balcony was tiny with only one chair, however the view of the city lights at night was really pretty. Room was equipped with TV, ironing board, safe, microwave, coffee maker and in the bathroom hairdryer, shampoo, conditioner and body lotion. One issue with the bathroom though ..... remember to keep the door closed as the escaping steam caused the fire alarm to go off!The chalk board in the lobby is a fantastic idea, giving infomation on weather, surf conditions, "Hawaiian word of the day" (loved that) and nightly entertainment. Was lucky enough to go see Mike Love (Beach Boys) at the Mai Tai Bar and would not have known if not on the chalk boardComing back to the hotel after a day out was like coming home. Only a minute's walk from the bus stop on Kuhio Avenue past the ABC shop where you can pick up a snack to enjoy with a coffee and plan the next day.Highly recommend Shoreline Hotel for a convenient place to stay in Waikiki.

We stayed here as a pre-cruise destination to help us with the change in time zones. After a good deal of research we chose the Shoreline and glad we did. We picked a room with a partial ocean view and after a long travel day it was most welcomed. The rates were very reasonble for Waikiki with a location close to everything. The room and entire hotel were very clean with a touch of elegance. The staff was very friendly and most helpful. We would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to stay in Waikiki without breaking your bank account.

We had a lovely time while staying at the Shoreline. It was easy access to fine dining and shopping. The beach was only footsteps away and the weather was fantastic. We definitely would stay at this luxurious hotel the next time we are in Waikiki.
user_name:
Angela U
Rocky Mount, North Carolina

review_body: went here durung a three day weekend with my gf. she loved it. nice place and location close to everything. Room had a fantasic veiw, and the staff was extremly helpful and courteous. can't wait to come back, highly recommend this hotel.

Location of the hotel was great.The Staff were all incredibly nice and helpful and willing to answer all of my questions. Our room was adequate for what we paid--$225 a night but there were definitely some maintenance items that need to be addressed.Thanks.

My boyfriend and I stayed there for 4 nights and it was just a perfect vacation. I cannot say enough great things about this hotel. Check-in was smooth and their service was up to par. The hotel staff definitely had the hospitality spirit as they were all professional, courteous, and displayed their "aloha". The concierge was very helpful in planning our day activities. Our room was clean and very modern. The beach is just a few minutes away from the Shoreline. Thank you Shoreline Hotel for making our vacation the best ever! We will definitely be returning to this hotel!!

Really impressed with the value for money aspect of this hotel!Sure it's a refurbished building a couple of streets back from the beach, but it's stylish, close to everything and has that 5star boutique feel about it!The room we had was large, furnished in a trendy classic fashion and included all the usual things you need for a week or so break!Impressed by the wifi (both the free service and the connection speed), the friendly staff, and the overall deal!(Sure the pools not a draw card, but it does have one, and after all who goes to Hawaii to swim in a pool when the beaut beaches are only a 5 or so minute stroll away?)We are already booking our next stay here!Thanks to the staff, service and accommodation provisions, really had a blast and can't wait to come back!!!

Although, we did not stay here, a friend of mine and myself recently found ourselves in a bit of precdicament and the wonderful staff at the Shoreline kindly helped us out. We were flying out of Honolulu around 2330 but we had to check out of our condo by 12 and they had no luggage storage. The Shoreline was a building over and they kindly let us store our luggage for the day at no charge. It made our last day in Waikiki more enjoyable not having to tow our luggage around and knowing it was safe. Next year I will definitely consider this hotel with it's lovely atmosphere, great location and super friendly staff.

We had two rooms for three days, the free coffee, cold water and news papers daily were a nice touched. Staff extremely helpful and personal as oppose to large hotels. Rooms are modern and clean. We enjoyed our stay! Thanks

My wife and I had an excellent stay at the Shoreline Hotel. Having read the Trip Advisor reviews before we went, it met our expectations. It is very reasonably priced, and the location in the center of Waikiki, along with the big name hotels. The room was clean. The bed was excellent. The shower was powerful and hot. Daily servicing of the room was just right. The desk staff was young, attentive, knowledgeable, and very nice. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for the things that I just described. I would stay at the Shoreline again.Hotel is just a few blocks from Waikiki beach. The hotel provides free beach towels for you to use. The hotel is just a block from the Royal Hawaiian Center, which is a major shopping and restaurant center. The Royal Hawaiian hotel puts on a free, top-notch Hawaiian music and dance show at the Center five nights a week at 6PM. I believe that each of these free shows is of higher quality than any show you could pay to see on the Island. The Shoreline is only two blocks from Lewers St and one block from Kalikaua Ave, which are major shopping streets. There is also a McDonalds less than a block away. It is easy to get from the Shoreline Hotel to the highways that take you to every part of the island. Recommend you use a GPS for guiding your driving. Trip Advisor reviews of the Shoreline do include a number of reviews which indicate issues exist. Some were due to unrealistic expectations. However, when you go to a restaurant or a hotel, you get a feel for how the hotel management views and implements their role. Same is true for the Shoreline. I noticed a few things that I wondered about, so I asked one of the desk staff who owns the hotel? The answer was surprising, and explanatory. It was: "The owners of this hotel are anonymous. It is managed by the Joie de Vivre company." I believe that this explains many of the negative reviews. I politely suggested an improvement to a desk clerk, who politely responded "That is above my pay grade." In my nine days at the hotel, I never saw anyone who looked like a manager. The parking situation for the hotel is a problem. It has limited parking spaces. You have to check with the hotel every day to see if they have space for your car. If not, you park across the street, where you pay daily, ONLY IN CASH and no bills larger than a $20. Management should settle which option you will use before you arrive, and if you park across the street, you should be able to pay the hotel, who then pays the other parking garage.Once I asked the desk clerk to change a $100 bill for some $20 bills so I could pay the garage. They didn't have enough twenties to change the $100 bill. I was really surprised by this.Another small but easily fixable problem is that the soap dish by the sink in our room was a simple flat bottomed plastic box with no drain holes or raised bars to keep the soap above the water which drains off a used bar of soap. Thus the bar of soap was always a bit soft. I believe that the issues that I have listed here are easily fixable. I have written them here, not as complaints, but as suggestions for improvement. I would recommend the hotel to others, and would stay there again, even if the small issues were not removed or ameliorated.

With so many hotels in the area, this hotel definitely will keep me coming back due to their friendly staff and clean atmosphere. The location is very central to Waikiki. P.s-I liked the keurig coffee in the lobby ;)

Very clean but petite hotel room, all amenities were excellent including shower and bed. Not much storage space, but has safe, microwave, and frig. Our maid service could have used a little work as we were regularly shorted a towel or washcloth, do not believe maid spoke good English, but a call to front desk always resulted in prompt service. A/C was not working first day but was attended to by management the next day. Keurig coffee machine and ice water in lobby is a nice touch. Comfortable lobby, wireless internet in rooms.

Excellent hotel! I needed a place to stay in Waikiki for a couple of nights, and I’m glad I chose Shoreline. At this price point in Waikiki, one would expect a standard room with standard service. However, Shoreline far exceeded my expectations. The vintage modern design of the lobby was warm and welcoming. It gave off a hip/cool vibe that sets itself apart from the other (mostly outdated) hotels in the area. The guest room was just the right size, and had all the amenities I needed. Above everything, though, was the staff’s extraordinary level of customer service. They knocked it out of the park. Everyone seemed genuine, and went out their way to make sure that I had a pleasant stay. I will definitely be back!

My wife and I visited Oahu from a neighboring island for a mini-vacation. The Shoreline turned out to be the perfect choice for us! Its location in Waikiki ensured that it was within walking distances of beaches, shopping and restaurants. However, since its off the main strip, it is a lot quieter and cheaper too - a win-win! The standout of this hotel though, was the incredibly professional and helpful staff. They recommended some great restaurants and places to check out, that definitely made our vacation more memorable. We'll be sure to stay here again when we return to Oahu.

Everything about this hotel is excellent. Location, staff, service, rooms and amenities. I have stayed at many hotels in Honolulu for business and leisure and so far this hotel exceeds all expectations. The pool on the rooftop is perfect, its like your own personal pool for relaxation, away from the crowd. I definitely will be staying at this hotel again and again.

My girlfriends decided to plan a vacation after my divorce to celebrate. I was hesitant at first but they were able to convince me to go. Since we were on a budget, they found a great deal at the Shoreline Hotel. I've been to Waikiki many times before and never heard of it. I assumed it was cheap and the service would be horrible but I can say that I was wrong!!The staff was very accommodating to every request that was placed, considering 9 females were on the trip. My friends can be a bit demanding, however, the staff was able to answer our every request with professionalism and a smile! The location of the hotel was convenient as the beach was easily accessed since we planned to utilize our time tanning and relaxing.You can't match the room rates with the amount of satisfaction we received on our trip! Thank you, Shoreline Hotel for the best divorce experience ever!

staff was very helpful, friendly and generous. didnt treat us like customers. gave off a very warm vibe and were there to assist in any way we requested. They were not pushy like a lot of places can be in touristy areas. The hotel itself is very clean and beautiful. I have stayed at a few other places in waikiki and this one by far takes the cake. Definitely recommend giving this place a shot!

Location and a quickie analysis of TA reviews led us to the Shoreline. It is located two blocks back from the Royal Hawaiian- centrally located for the beach, restaurants and shopping. And it was rated #10 in Honolulu at price around $200 for a 'partial ocean view king'. TA rated hotels #1-9 ahead of it ranged in price from $250 to nearly $1000. We felt it was worth a try for 3 days, and we did have a good stay, thank you.The house has a number of features beyond location providing, at least for Waikiki, a reasonable value: medium sized room and bath, complementary internet ( thank you), daily newspaper (in the lobby) and a large flat screen TV with many channels. Everything was very clean and well maintained. Our 13th floor room had a 'partial ocean view' overlooking the Royal Hawaiian and had a huge deck ( a table would have been nice along with the two provided chairs.) The linens, towels and amenities were about normal for this level of house. It had a small refrigerator- would have been nice to have a microwave and coffee service ( complementary coffee in the lobby). The bed was comfortable and the room was pleasantly, if sparsely decorated and furnished.This tendency toward a stark look and feel, minimalist if you will, defines this house. We rated the service as average, although it was actually very good- there just was not much of it. The folks at the front desk and the housekeeping staff is about it- and they did well. Ice is only on the first floor of a 14 story building; coffee and newspapers are complementary but you have to come to the lobby. The exterior and interior colors are so muted as to be nearly monochromatic with just some occasional bright pieces of art. The tiny roof top pool and deck can be a nice escape from the Waikiki circus, but they are just barely big enough to actually exist.You can do better than the Shoreline for a lot more money and you can surely do far worse, but we can recommend this hotel with some small reservations.

Ideally placed for exploring Honolulu and close to the beach. Desk staff were helpful with restaurants, this was undone by one of the day managers who was unhelpful when we had a problem. Rooms are ok, balcony looked out onto the next door building so we didn't use it.

We stayed at the Shoreline Hotel Waikiki last week.The positives: The front desk staff were great; positive, friendly and helpful.The lobby is very nice ... very boutiquey.The rooms are modern and clean with nice amenities.The room: The first room we were assigned was a handicapped room. The toilet was in the shower! I complained ( the clerk said "is that problematic for you?" ... yes, it was!) and was given a different room on the 9th floor. It was tiny and it had no view (an understatement - it overlooked a semi-abandoned apartment building, the street and several rooftops). It was very noisy. Lots of activity in the apt. building next door and the trucks and buses on Seaside beeped all night long.The negatives: A lot of street noise.For the most part the rooms are very small with unattractive tiny balconies.The pool is a joke - unattractive, cold and dirty.The worst thing:We almost got mugged in front of the hotel at 10:30 PM. Followed very closely and harassed by a young street kid ... I fear something terrible might have happened in another 10-20 feet if we had continued down Seaside Ave any further.Conclusions and advice: Don't expect too much.You can do much better in Waikiki. We got a really good Orbitz price on our room and it still wasn't worth the amount we paid. Ask for a very high floor room (non-handicapped accessible). Expect to be disturbed by street noises.Be careful and be wary of your surroundings at night on the side streets.

This was my first visit to Hawaii and my budget didn't quite stretch to one of the luxurious hotels on the beach front. but this didn't matter as i felt i didn't miss out on anything and saved a fortune. The one thing I will say about this hotel the location is amazing with only a 5min walk to the beach and everything else on your door step. The only bad point I will make is the pool area is very small but this doesn't matter as the beach is so close and Im sure you don't visit Hawaii to stay by the pool all day. All in all a very good stay and would definitely recommend.

Stayed here for nine nights all up. 8 nights then another one night after traveling to Maui for 6 days. The Shoreline is in a great location, in the middle of great restaurants and shopping is only a small block away. The rooms are quite small, and although traveling with my son we were allocated a room with just one king sized bed. The staff on the front desk were unable to move us to a more suitable room, but organized for a roll away bed to be bought to the room - which made a small room even smaller, but being in Honolulu we wern't there to sit in our room for long periods of time - we were out and about. Went up to check out the pool, but it was tiny, and no shade. We didn't stay there for long. Free coffee and tea was provided in the lobby, as well as free wifi in the room and in the lobby. Staff were attentive and friendly. They were happy to organise taxis etc. For the one last night we stayed there we were allocated a room with two beds, located on the side above the lane way and opposite a 2 or 3 story car park. The lights seemed to be on in the carpark all night which lit up our room making it hard to sleep. The first room was on the other side facing the blue building, which was preferable. The noise of slamming doors was an issue, all night long, it seemed. We left very early on a couple of days to go on tours, and although I tried to cLose the door quietly it was not possible.The room and bathroom was clean, air con worked well. Nothing too much to complain about at all.

Small boutique hotel between the two main drags in Waikiki. It's about a 4 to 5 minute walk to Waikiki beach, rooms have ac (even though this is a hotel, condos in Hawaii do not always have ac, we were thrilled to have a cool room after seventeen days traveling other islands and staying in places without ac). We were in a quiet, clean room, our bed was very comfortable. We had trouble getting to the hotel because the city had closed off the main road for a street party. The front desk staff was patient and kind to help guide me in a different way(my GPS was not cooperating ) when we arrived they were so nice to us they upgraded our room and made us feel very welcomed after a frustrating drive in. The parking attendant was waiting on us when we arrived and he quickly helped us get our luggage out and to our room, great service everywhere!) You want be disappointed, great price for the area. You can walk to great restaurants and shopping in minutes. If you want to drive to Pearl Harbor and to the north shore, you will need a car.

We had read mostly good things about this hotel, but some very bad ones.We had a bad experience and would not stay here again.We had booked through Expedia, which seemed to make our reservation inaccessible to Alex, the desk clerk. He had rooms, but would not assign us to one. We waited in their tiny lobby for two hours until a manager came, who assigned us a room. He would not look us in the eyes; he was obviously ashamed of their performance.The room was a queen instead of the king which we had reserved, but we were beyond caring by then. The room was well equipped, with everything we expected, but after the bad introduction, we were glad to take the plane to Maui and get on with the rest of our visit to Hawaii.

All though rooms are small, they are up to date and have a great view from the roof. Did I mention a roof top pool? The best part of staying there is the AMAZING staff. So friendly, accommodating and had great advice to give. By day 10 they were more like friends than staff members.

We were exceptionally pleased with our stay here. In fact, it was much nicer than I had expected. It's central location in Waikiki is great. Lots of shopping a is stones throw away. Our room and our bed were very comfortable. The front desk staff were very helpful.

I would give this hotel a 3.5 rating for a few reasons: Small rooms, photos in website can be deceiving, and I heard that quite a bit from other customers while we were there. Location is fair, walking distance to main attractions in Waikiki. Customer service was good, attentive, but nothing over the normal for a tourist-oriented place like Waikiki. I don't know, I guess I was expecting more from this place based on the pics, and other reviews I had seen, and let it be clear I'm not a picky person at all.

This could have been a problem. Our travel agent booked us in a standard room. We checked in to discover that we were put in a small room with a double bed. I asked for a room change, and luckily got one a half hour later. We were given a nice room, a king bed, a mini fridge, a microwave, a big closet, a good enough bathroom. Whew! The hotel provides beach towels, and is steps away from a reasonable coffee shop for breakfast. Near the beach, lots of shopping, and all the action, the room is quiet.
user_name:
CamilleNYCDiva
New York City, New York

review_body: I stayed here for about 10 days, my partner almost 3 weeks, and got to say it was pretty enjoyable. Rates we paid were a little high a) because it was Christmas/New Year and b) because we booked pretty late. Admittedly, once past NYE, the rate dropped significantly and made it much more reasonable. Hotel is only a couple of blocks from Waikiki, so terrific location - that is, you are close enough to walk down, but also not right in the centre of it! For those looking for a great pool with bar atmosphere, this is not your place. The pool is on the roof, very small and only about 7 lounge chairs with NO bar. For those who want to go to the beach and frequent the bars on the beach (i.e. us!) this is a great place to stay. All of the staff were extremely helpful and were kind enough to let us stay for an extreme late check out seeing as one of our flights only left at midnight (admittedly the hotel wasn't full by this stage, but they still didn't have to to this). Rooms were average size, but clean. Showers were great - good pressure and nice and hot! As always, if you plan to rent a car, parking charge is $26/night. This is definitely a great alternative if you want to be close to the action, not necessarily in it, and don't want to pay extortionate nightly rates… Truth is, you're in Hawaii, so likely not spending that much in the room to warrant the extortionate rates. So Shoreline is a great choice!

I visited Waikiki for a week over the New Year period and we were really glad we picked Shoreline to stay in.The staff were very friendly and happy to help us with any questions we had and they had plenty of recommendations on where to go around the island. A bit cheaper than staying on the beach, but being only a street back it was not much different than being in one of those that is on the shore. We walked through the main strip a lot during our tiem, easilty able to experience some of the bars in those on the beach, withotu having to pay extra.The room was a good size (I think we were staying in a king) and it was serviced well every day. We didn't have an ocean view, but that only matters if you're sitting in your room all day, and not heading to the beach.Wi-fi was fast, and this made it easy for us to book tours during the week and find out more info about the place when we needed.The hotel organised our shuttle back to the airport with ease.If I was going back to Waikiki, I would definitely consider staying here again.

We stayed at this hotel based on trip advisor reviews, my 6th trip to Honolulu. Since we were only staying two nights we decided we didn't need to pay the premium to stay on the beach. The location is good (for not being on the beach), certainly in the middle of the Waikiki strip action. The furnishings and room were clean and modern but they clearly decided not to update the bathrooms, felt like a motel 6 style and space. The re-model felt more cosmetic than anything. The rooftop pool wasn't much bigger than the equivalent of a few bathtubs, hard to imagine anyone would spend any time up there. We were on the 2nd floor with a view of a sketchy parkade for $250/night.
