The rooms at The Shoreline are modern, clean, stylish, very comfortable bed/bedding, you get a decent sized hd flat screen tv (which I didn't turn on once) a balcony, modern bathroom, Free internet, free coffee and water 24/7, the staff are very friendly and helpful, there's no crafty extra resort fees when checking out. The Location is very handy, It was a couple of blocks from the beach, a few minutes walk to all the restaurants and bars in Waikiki. If I'm ever lucky enough to go to Honolulu again and need a hotel I would stay here for sure (providing it was still such good value.)

Very nice basic hotel with comfortable beds and plush towels. We stayed one night before a cruise on the top floor facing the ocean and two nights after returning from the cruise on the 8th floor facing the canal side ("view" was of another building). Both rooms were quiet. I would stay here again. There is a pool on the roof which we did not use. We did take advantage of the beach towels when we went to the Ala Moana City park. There is a Mexican restaurant attached to the hotel, we did not try that either. Instead we ate at the street vendors at the International Market one block north.

My wife and I had three wonderful nights at the Shoreline Hotel. If you choose not to stay on the beach, this is where you want to be! 5 min. to the beach, 1 min. to the main shopping street, and the staff is super friendly. The hotel has recently been renovated and the rooms are great. Kinda '70s look but in a really cool and retro way. Definitely positive! We even got a hand written post card and a small bottle of champagne when we arrived (when I booked I told them to find a great room since it was our honeymoon :-) I would definitely recommend this hotel, and I'm going to stay there the next time I'm in Waikiki!

Just got back from my stay here and was impressed the moment our driver made a turn on Kalakaua ave. The Hotel looks fresh and it's so close to everything..shops, restaurants and the beach. All the staff are friendly and attentive. Special mention to Sally, making me feel I have known her for a long time. She's making sure we're enjoying our stay and even gave us a gift we didn't expect.As for the rooms, they have limited rooms with 2 double beds which may not accommodate a lot of family members needing to share rooms. Room size maybe small for american standards but it suits me comfortably. It's clean and the bed and pillows just have the right firmness. Water, coffee and tea are available in the lobby plus free Wifi accesss(also in every room).This is my first time I stayed here and haven't found anything to complain regarding its location, service, rates and amenities. I have been staying every year at the other top 10 Hotel of Honolulu but I think it's time for me to move my "Home away from Home" here for less price, friendly and comparable services. Thank you, Shoreline.I'll see you again next year or maybe even sooner.I'm looking forward to my next stay.

Have been to Hawaii many times in the past years. I have stayed at a dozen of hotels all along the beach and paid the premium price. However this hotel was great, awesome position, clean renovated rooms and very helpful staff. For the price your paying you really are the winner. Would definitely stay here again.

I stayed for a three night stopover in September . The Hotel was in a great location and was above expectations for the price. Free Wi Fi which is a must these days.Very clean and well serviced rooms.Air con not that efficient.Not a great view to the tired building next door but this is no fault of the hotel (maybe they should buy the site ? )Wasn't flying out until 11pm at night and they stored my luggage which was great.Would be great if there was a room avail for late checkout with a shower. Overall very friendly and would stay here again.

Myself and my young daughter stayed in a standard double room at Shoreline, during August for 10 days. I have to say I was pleasantly surprised with our stay as it surpassed all expectations!! Everything was perfect from the extremely comfy beds and pillows, to the friendly staff, free Wii Fi and clean modern room!! Free tea coffee and ice water as well as free beach towels are provided in the lobby. Having a balcony was a real bonus for me even though we had a street view! Quiet location, off the main road. Convenient and close walking proximity to all restaurants, bars, shopping and bus stop to Ala Moana Mall. Beach is approximately 6 minute walk. Rooftop pool is nice, except closes at 6pm :( Manager Frank, was delightful and very accommodating after a mishap with a failed wake up call from reception (on the day of my birthday) which in turn led to a missed expensive swimming with dolphins tour! Manager Frank arranged a bottle of wine, cake, card a personal birthday message on the blackboard in the lobby and even called the tour company to obtain a full refund of our tour :-) Our overall opinion of this wonderful hotel is great value for money, deserves a 4 star rating, definitely a place to highly recommend!! Would stay again in a heartbeat. Special thank you to Frank, for an enjoyable stay in Waikiki. We look forward to staying with you again in the future!!

this hotel is in a perfect location............staff very friendly and helpful...... room was very clean and modern.........would recommend any time.....coffee available 24/7 in lobby......free WiFi in room with excellent reception.

My trip to Honolulu almost went bad when I got bumped from my flight. This would have left me in Honolulu for an extended stay on a week when it was very difficult to get a hotel room or flight. The manager of the hotel, Almida, made special arrangements to make sure I had a room at a very reasonable rate in a hotel with a terrific location and very comfy accommodations. I am in debt to her and the staff for answering the call in my hour of need. A beautiful place to stay.Rick Southern

Very good location close to all the good food and stores. The hotel staff very professional and friendly. I would stay there again. The rooms were small but large enough for just sleeping. Vault service excellent. Very clean hotel.

Staff was so welcoming and helpful. Just a short block walk to the beach. If you can't afford to stay right on the beach, this is PERFECT. Nice room, great staff. Right in the middle of everything! Great trip!

We came upon this hotel by chance. We arrived in the city later in the evening, without reservations. (We tried at a sister hotel and they called the Shoreline for us as they were booked up). We arrived to a fantastic staff who were so friendly and inviting. Check-in was quick and we were in our room in no time.We only stayed one night here as we were staying in a condo on the leeward side of the island for most of our trip. We wished that we had returned for our final night in Oahu, as we did not like the one we ended up in. It was farther away and the walls were very thin. At the Shoreline, however, it was very quiet and very little noise from the hallway, too.Our room was fairly large. The bathroom was recently redone and quite modern in details. Our bed was very comfy and we especially enjoyed our little balcony off our room. We noticed many people had their beach items drying on the balcony which is perfect and makes it feel less like a "regular" city and more like a tropical destination. :)In the morning, we took a stroll down to Waikiki. It was only a couple of blocks and easy walk. We found that this hotel was close to it all. The pool is on the roof. You get a great view of the city from here. Although the pool is small, it is very clean and refreshing after a hot walk around Honolulu.This is a wonderful hotel and is part of a great chain of hotels. I would highly recommend this place, whether for a night or for a week.

If you don't have the budget to pay for a beachfront property in Waikiki, this is a great option for you, especially if you plan on being out and about most of your trip. Great Location at a great price! Extremely friendly and helpful staff!I would definitely stay there again.

I chose Shoreline based on previous guests' reviews and now that I am a previous guest, I am here to tell you that you will not regret staying at this contemporary, well-located hotel in the heart of Waikiki. It is located within walking distance to the beach, shops, the famous International Market Place, and close to excellent food places, including ChaChaCha .... a Mexican restaurant located in Shoreline. But what impressed my husband and I the most was the excellent service we received from beginning of our stay to the very end of our stay. The staff always greeted you with a smile and went out of their way to make sure you received top notch service. "Mahalo nui loa and aloha" to our friends at Shoreline!

The shoreline hotel is fantastic. We would definatly recommend the hotel to everyone we know because it is great value, nicely decorated, clean, and a great location! Its is right in the middle of the best parts of the kalakaua Avenue and the staff can help you out with great tours and anything you need help with, deffinantly a 5 out of 5

We stayed at the Shoreline for 6 nights in August 2013. Our room was nicely furnished, very clean and the staff were extremely friendly and helpful throughout our stay. We will stay at the Shoreline again. Again, the staff was helpful in giving us suggestions to beaches to visit away from the crowds and for related activities. The parking is tight and you do pay for parking but that was a good trade for their service and genuine caring attitude. The location is fantastic, right around the corner from shops, restaurants and the beach.

The Shoreline is a really pleasant hotel.It's not waterfront; but it's so near as not to matter and it's probably half the price because of it.The locations ace, right in the middle of Waikiki. The rooms are smallish but very well-appointed and clean. Every room (at least on our side of the hotel) has a balcony and a view across the area.The staff were friendly and helpful. I really don't think you could find a better hotel for the price (& I did my homework on that before booking in).Personally I think the hotel should cut its ties with the adjoining groundfloor restaurant (Cha cha cha) however. It's downmarket compared to the hotel (and Waikiki generally) and I watched a number of hotel users go in and quickly leave. p.s The roof top pool's nothing to write home about (8 x 3 metres at a guess). Why anyone would want to use it with Waikiki beach only about 100 metres away is anyone's guess.

My partner and I stayed here for a little over a week and had a wonderful stay. After spending 2 weeks in a really quiet , remote and large cottage in Kauai we were concerned that this part of the holiday may not be as comfortable or enjoyable but we were wrong. This place was great in its own way. The first thing we noticed was the awesome lobby. It is really trendy and fresh and made a great first impression. Next the staff... So professional! No pretension - just quiet, polite and friendly people - all of them. They checked us in early after we arrived on an early flight from Kauai, which was not expected but appreciated. The room was small but nice, white, spotlessly clean and comfortable. It had a large flat screen TV, not a tiny little one. The bathroom was large, white, modern and also spotless. The bed was super comfy. The hotel has a rooftop pool which was bigger than I expected and also spotlessly clean. Someone else mentioned it could be updated but I liked it as is. I don't think it needs to be any fancier. In the lobby there is complimentary tea, coffee and water, along with an ice machine. There was also a couple of computers with free internet but the wifi in the rooms was super quick so we didn't use them. There was also complimentary newspapers available. This was our third visit to Waikiki and other hotels we have stayed at in the past have been noisy with both street noise and noise from other guests doors . We didn't hear much noise at all from the street, none of those pesky garbage trucks, and rarely heard other guests doors even though the hotel was full. Yes the air conditioner was a little loud at times, but we just turned it off and enjoyed the trade breezes. This hotel is in a great location close to everything. We walked everywhere including Ala Moana, Ward Centre, beaches, Diamond Head, but there is a bus stop close by to get you around if you are not a walker. In all, this place felt like a home away from home and I would definately stay here again. It is not luxurious, just clean and comfortable with a great, relaxed, down to earth vibe :0)

We are so glad we stayed at this hotel. We chose it based on Tripadvisor reviews and were not disappointed. This was our first visit to Honolulu and we would return to the Shoreline if we are lucky enough to visit again. The location was fantastic, right around the corner from all the shops and restaurants and Waikiki Beach. The staff were very friendly and always helpful. The room, though not large, was spotless, the bed comfortable and the bathroom well appointed. The air con was really effective tho a bit noisey.There was iced water in the lobby area every day which was much appreciated and free wifi. We felt so at home and were really impressed by this hotel and the lovely people who work there. Thanks for the wonderful memories. Christine Kelly Perth Australia

The Shorelne was recommended by our travel agent as a good budget hotel and she was right. Great little hotel, modern, very clean and very friendly helpful staff. So close to the beach, shops and heaps of restaurants, what more do you want. We will definitely be going back to Hawaii next year and will be staying there again. Havel also recommending to our 2 sons who plan to take their partners there next year. Excellent value for money!

I did not know where to begin but just say thanks so much for the wonderful time that me and my whole family were there at the shore line hotel .We feel like we are at home ,my aunt told me that this is the first time she slept so good and it has been a long time (because she has just recovered from a throat cancer . So thanks everybody that you all have been wonderful . Thanks K

Originally I was torn between staying somewhere that was reasonably priced and boutiquey or spending more (close to double) and staying at one of the resort hotels. So glad we ended up choosing this hotel. In Hawaii you don't spend much time in your room as you are always at the beach or doing things. Also, the resort pools, which are generally nicer than the shoreline one, are so packed you would never go in there! The beach is where you want to spend all your time anyway. And while the hotel didn't have a gym, they had a deal with a great gym down the road for $10 that overlooks waikiki beach! Much better than any resort gym! The location was very convenient in the central part of waikiki and walking distance to everything. The rooms had been recently renovated and felt very modern and clean. There is a fairly large airconditioning vent in the room which can be a little noisy, but it was actually one of the things I really liked about the room as they had decorated it with hawaiin sayings which was a nice quirk. Staff were great too, always friendly and helpful!Enjoyed staying there so much that we ended up rebooking at shoreline after we returned from the north shore. Would stay there again!

A great value hotel, The staff were extremely helpful and friendly and the rooms were lovely and clean and more than adequate.The champagne and chocolates delivered to our room on our wedding anniversary was a lovely touch and very much appreciated.Location is superb and I could not recommend this hotel more highly .

I loved this location which was perfect for our friends trip that included visiting a lot of tourist spots and also nightlife. I recommend this hotel if you are on a budget and just want to enjoy Waikiki. This place is incredibly close to the beach, tons of shopping, and a large selection of local and commercial restaurants.With a little bit more investment into the retro theme of the lobby, I could see this place taking off as a hipster destination equivalent to some places in Palm Springs. It would be great to see the owners transform the roof top pool area into a scenic hangout spot. If you're looking for more luxury and romance, I recommend looking elsewhere in Waikiki.

We spent two nights at the Shoreline on our way back to Australia after a week on Maui. We chose this hotel after discovering the Joi de Vivre chain in San Francisco (Hotel Rex). What really appeals to us about these hotels is that they seem to have taken over older hotels and given each its own distinctive ambience. So you won't find the standard 4 or 5 star monochrome larger chain experience here - but what you will find is an attractive room with excellent toiletries - a room which you will probably remember long after the trip because it wasn't like all the rest. The staff were outstanding - and the complimentary tea, coffee and lemon water in the lobby an added bonus - though to an Australian, we would have liked to see liquid long life milk rather than powder.

This hotel was nothing fancy but it was clean and newly renovated. The decor was really funky and tasteful. The room was quite small but we didn't spend much time in it anyway. Bonus: the bed was really comfortable and we got free beach towels everyday. The restaurant next door was really tasty and had nice staff.

This older hotel has been revamped but not enough. The staff are very helpful and friendly and the location is perfect for all the attractions of Waikiki. The price for a room is fair but the layout is a bit strange. The room balconies look scary similar to walking the pirates plank. No one told us about the rooftop pool which is very nice and private.It is kept very clean and is a convenient base to see everything.The Hotel has a few shortcomings.Overall a bit of a mixed bag.

My husband and I stayed during early August 2013. We have been holidaying in Honolulu each year for the last 20 years and have tried many different locations. The 'Shoreline' is situated between Kuhio and Kalakaua which means excellent access to the best shopping that Waikiki can offer. Our room was clean, comfortable and compact. The cost was as expected for August. The top rating that we give it is for the top service that was given from those who work there. Nothing was too much trouble, everyone had time to stop and explain whenever we had a question and even after we had paid our bill in the morning, they were still demonstrating their kindness at 8 pm while we waited to leave for a late night flight.

My wife and I stayed at this hotel from the 4th to the 10th of this month and enjoyed everyday of our vacation the hotel is centrally located in the heart of Waikiki making it extremely easy to love around without renting a car. The rooms were extremely clean and comfortable had no complaints at all and I must recognize Romell, Tyson and the busboy Dustin they were extremely helpful for the duration of the trip letting me know where to go and what buses to take truly appreciate the assistance and Romell addressing me as Mr. Forbes everytime we passed by although I didn't want it I appreciated it.I am sure I will return to Oahu and there would be no other hotel to stay at other than the Shoreline.Keep up the good work guys.

Stayed there July 30-August 4, 2013. Everything was excellent. Room was small but fine. Everything was clean and up-to-date. Fantastic balcony and view of Waikiki. Staff were terrific, even when TS Flossie disrupted our travel plans. Price was unbeatable, as was the location.

My wife and I stayed at the Shoreline Hotel for a week to celebrate out 10th anniversary. It was within walking distance of great shopping, restaurants and nightlife plus was only about a 10 minute walk from the heart of the Waikiki beach. The staff was unbelievably helpful and friendly. We were always greated with a smile when we came back from our excursions. The room was spacious enough for our week long stay and I don't recall when I have slept on a bed as comfortable. I am usually quite critical of hotels being in the hotel business for over 20 years, but this hotel sure did it right. I have no complaints.

Excellent staff and hotel! Traveled to Hawaii for the first time for a family reunion and it was a very memorable vacation. Our room was very nice and we look forward to returning to Hawaii. The food was fantastic! Waikiki beach was beautiful!

I stayed at this hotel for 8 nights and was very happy overall with the room, service and especially the location. Location: The location was perfect for me, only a block away from Waikiki beach, a 3 to 4 minute walk to the International Market (via taking the back streets, it takes me right to the foodcourt). Most tours pick you up and drop you off across the road from the hotel. Shopping is right in your front door step (practically).. the pink trolley line only about a 2 minute walk from there. Overall, everything is within easy walking distance. Another thing is I felt safe in this hotel and also, walking around on my own at 11pm at night in this area which is important for a female solo traveller.Room: Despite the room being on the small side - the room was very clean and the same with the bathroom.. Cleanliness is important to me and Shoreline definitely delivered that. It is sooo nice to check in to a really nice clean room! The bed was comfortable and loved the ambience and overall decor of this boutique hotel. I was on the 11th floor so quite high up - for that reason - I didn't hear any street noise.. and hardly heard a peep from the other rooms. bonus! The only tiny downside is the air conditioner is right there and got quite loud.. lucky, I didn't really need it as I often had my balcony door open to let the breeze in at night.Service: Overall, I was very satisfied with the service. There was a wrong billing when I used the printer in the lobby but I was refunded promptly. Also, housekeeping at one stage kept forgetting to replace the dirty coffee cup - it sat there for a couple of days until I left a note to request for a new clean cup. Attention to detail would have been good. But overall, as mentioned this hotel is clean :-) The hotel reception, were very helpful - I enquired about public transportation (the receptionist gave me directions to where to go and also told me where the little side streets to take shortcuts to get to the International Market quicker. Another big plus is the free WIFI of up to 5 devices.. Really appreciated this as other hotels will probably charge you an arm and a leg or resort fees. As this was my first time in Hawaii, staying at this hotel played a big part of my enjoyable holiday in Hawaii! Thanks Shoreline :-)

I stayed at the Shoreline for 9 nights. The room was a decent size for two adults, and the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was clean and although small was not cramped. The hotel is located extremely close to the beach and to Kalakaua ave- it is hard to imagine a better location without spending a fortune. The staff were very friendly however not all of them were entirely helpful. The Shoreline is excellent value for money.

Excellent value as a base. Centrally located. The only downside was the lighting by the bed was too dim for those of us who like to read in bed and I have advised the hotel of this.Otherwise very comfortable and clean.

I booked my first night through the Hotel Tonight app not knowing what to expect and was pleasantly surprised by this stylish hotel. It was very comfortable, had environmentally friendly features, and was a great location. Staff was helpful and I liked the bulletin board with events and weather updates. I decided to stay an additional night, booking at the normal rate, which is pretty decent for the area. I didn't use the pool because of the weather but the location is convention to the beach, buses, and shopping.
user_name:
Angela H
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I love the Shoreline Hotel. We stayed awhile back when it was being renovated, and it was so great we booked with them again this trip. Its so beautiful now on the inside, and the staff are great! We will be coming back and forth to Honolulu for the next year, and we plan on booking with them every time for sure!

This was my first time to Honolulu. I'm on a budget and was looking for a hotel that was clean and within walking distance of shops and restaurants. Most of the budget hotels did not have great reviews. But, when I saw the reviews for Shoreline Hotel and the reasonably priced rooms and the fact that it was recently renovated I knew it would be a good choice.The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. The room was clean. The beds were very comfortable and the bathroom was up to date and spacious. We didn't rent a car and it was easy to walk to the beach and shops. I would return to this hotel and highly recommend it.

I stayed at the Shoreline just for one night when passing through Honolulu. Location was great - easy walk to the beach and shopping only a few hundred metres away. 100 metres to Kuhio from where you can catch city buses to many destinations including the Ala Moana Shopping Centre.I usually stay at expensive hotel right on the beach but this was an excellent budget friendly choice. The room was small but had everything you need. One curious thing was there was a microwave but no cutlery, plates or anything you could use to cook with or eat off! The bed was extra comfy, pillows were excellent.Bathroom was fine although a minor cleaning issue existed from the previous guest which I reported to the front desk. Amenities like safe in the room. The aircon was in a very big ugly panel facing the bed but an attempt had been made to partially cover it with posters/stickers. The aircon was effective and not too noisy.Staff were efficient and very friendlyThanks for a pleasant stay

i stayed there for three nights. best hotel bathroom i have ever seen. nice closet nice safe. porch on 14th floor. nice.close to beach and right next to the hot night clubs; they are far enough away so you dont hear noise.restruant had the biggest plates of food. could not finish two meals.

We loved our stay at Shoreline Hotel. This hotel has the friendliest staff that we have ever encountered on our vacations. We were very happy with our room. It was very clean and comfortable. The rooms are well lit. The room was small but very comfortable for a couple. The bathroom was very clean and bright.The pool was a little weird. It is on the roof top and to access it, you have to go to the top floor and walk up another few sets of stairs to get to the roof and walk another set of stairs to access the pool. I'm not a huge fan of heights so I wasn't too eager to spend time up there. We also spent all of our time swimming in the ocean so I wasn't disappointed at all.When we arrived there was no room in the valet parking and we were told that we would have to park in the parking garage across the street, but we were also advised to call the front desk in the morning to check and see if there are any openings. It took two days, but we did get the valet parking and it was worth it. The valet staff was super friendly and fast. We were a little worried about the location of the hotel since it sat close to a few sketchy areas off Kuhio, but we were surprised at how quiet it was. It is a straight shot down the road to the Royal Hawaiian Shopping Center and not too much further to the beach. You are also just behind the Waikiki Shopping Center with a few fun little shops inside.When arriving to the hotel, we weren't sure what to expect. What a wonderful surprise finding this great boutique hotel in Waikiki. This is definitely a hotel we plan on staying in again and one we would suggest any couple, wanting to get away and relax, to stay.

Not knowing anything about Waikiki, I booked this stay based on reviews and because the price was right on an Orbitz deal. When I first arrived, I was not overly impressed with the hotel's exterior, and I didn't like that there were only stairs and no ramps to drag my rolling luggage on. But I got inside and immediately realized that I had found a gem. Retro contemporary theme...clean and vibrant...chic and comfortable. All in one package. Got up to my room and it was the goldilocks effect, if you will--not huge...not tiny...the size was just right. Delicately appointed with just the right touch of flair. An awesome city view...a nice balcony for morning coffee. Lush bedding, nice big flat screen TV on the wall, microwave, mini fridge, and a perfectly sized bathroom. Again, everything clean and fresh. A touch of class.Walking from the hotel to the desirable sights of Waikiki proved quick and easy. Walking score...I'd give it a 10. Don't judge a book by its cover. I sure am glad I didn't with this hotel. This was a great stay in Waikiki and I would definitely stay here again if I ever come back to visit Oahu.

Love, love, love this property! Anytime JDV puts their touch on a hotel, it's always a good thing. They did a nice job incorporating the aloha spirit with their uniquely JDV stamp. When looking to book a hotel in Waikiki, here are the best things to consider about the Shoreline:- Location: it's only one block from Kalakaua so it's quiet and not as loud and boisterous as the other hotels right on K, but it's close enough to all the action. It's centrally located and close to Royal Hawaiian Center and the Beach Walk. The International Marketplace is a quick 5 mins (or less) walk. Waikiki Beach is blocks away. There are plenty of restaurants and shopping areas all right downstairs. - Staff: Everyone here was genuinely helpful and friendly. The front desk staff were even so generous to extend our late check out to accommodate us since our flight was canceled and we needed to travel instead on a redeye. The housekeeping staff were always so pleasant when we would see them in the mornings. Sonny, Dustin, and Alex, the bell men and valet staff, were always prompt with retrieving our car for us. - Cleanliness/Style: the hotel is newly renovated and well appointed. - Rates: Moderately priced and great value for location. Additionally, there is always hot coffee, tea and water and a business center in the lobby available at all times. I would not hesitate to stay here again when in Waikiki. I love boutique hotels and there are so many great reasons to stay here.

The Shoreline was less expensive than many of the other hotels in Waikiki. It is ideally located, within walking distance to the beach and many restaurants, stores, and attractions. We did not rent a car, and except for a cab ride to and from the airport, we did not require a car to get to any of our activities. The hotel does not look like much from the outside, but inside is nicely decorated, looks a bit more upscale, and is very clean. There is a pool on the rooftop with a view of the ocean, which we visited a few times and always had to ourselves. The staff was gracious and accommodating, and the beds were comfortable. The rooms are on the small side. There is room to walk around the bed, and that's about it. There is no dresser, so you have to either keep all your clothes in the closet or live out of your suitcase. We did not spend much of our vacation in our room, so the small size was not a concern. My only complaint was that the towels were rough. I definitely felt that I got a great value for the price, and I would consider staying there again.

We stayed here 2 nights a couple weeks ago on our first trip to the island. I had done so much research and read tons of reviews trying to find a place that was affordable, in a good location, and nice. The Shoreline really exceeded our expectations! The decor is modern, the room was very clean, it's so close to the beach, but the friendly and accommodating staff were definitely the best part. We had an issue booking through Expedia, and the manager bent over backwards to help us on their end. I would definitely book directly with the hotel next time, and I would definitely stay at The Shoreline again!

I love the location...off the main drag but still within very easy walking of the Royal Hawaiian center and Waikiki beach. I wanted to try this boutique hotel style because I like the joie de vivre chain out of the San Francisco Bay area. Granted the price was exceptional - $147 a night but it is very basic. Some pluses and minusesPlus - Location, clean, updated to modern 60's style, friendly staff, free wifi in room (this is big), comfortable bed, across from Ross store, rooftop pool but all concrete/good view of ocean.Minus - air conditioning directly on the bed/can get cold, no room service (Mexican restaurant next door that is OK), forgot to clean my room once and no towels another day, can't print docs except boarding pass - not really a business center, no green landscape around.So..overall a good stay for the price. No frills but clean if you want just a place to sleep.

We really enjoyed weeks stay it was VERY clean, short walking distance to beach (1blk) and other stores. The staff was very helpful, always smiling and knowledgeable. Will definitively recommend. It was our first trip to Hawaii and you helped make it very enjoyable.THANK YOU FOR A JOB WELL DONE!M n J

I loved this hotel! First off this hotel has been recently remodeled and they did a fantastic job! We knew that we were going to be spending more time outside of our hotel then in it and so we looked for one that met our needs. So our room was small, but had a refrigerator, coffee maker, safe for our items that we wanted locked up, wifi(which we needed to download our pics) and a very clean room. It also had a nice balcony as well. We loved the employees as they were extremely helpful on locations to visit, places to eat as well as making sure that we were happy and comfortable. Things to note: We rented our car and had the option of valet parking or for 2 dollars less we could pay 24 dollars a night to park our rental across the street. We picked Valet. They were considerate and prompt when we needed our car. Wonderful wonderful stay here and I would highly recommend!

I spent hours looking for a reasonably priced hotel in Waikiki and after a lot of indecision finally decided on the Shoreline Hotel.I was blown away by the service and the cleanliness of the hotel. I also had really low expectations based on previous reviews, but when I arrived all of the construction/renovations were nowhere to be seen and everything looked fresh and new.The location is also fine - it's a quick 10 minute walk to Waikiki beach, and you're right in the middle of the shopping district.

This hotel is amazing. Great location with a main drag of Waikiki just up the road and a revolving restaurant on the corner and Starbucks at another corner along with two ABC stores in walking distance (as in like two minutes at most walk!)The staff are friendly and attentive and you must dine at the restaurant ChaChaCha.We came here for our honeymoon and loved every minute of it.My only issue was the bed could have been a King or Queen sized and not a double bed, but since we were out and about each day from early till late taking in sights and tours etc, it's really not a big deal

Stayed here for 10 nights recently and we couldn't be more pleased with every thing. All members of staff, from the cleaners to front desk officers, were particularly friendly and helpful. Their professionalism is simply wonderful.The hotel is close to shopping, restaurants, Waikiki Beach, transport, etc....really, it is so central! The rooms are maintained tidy and clean each day, and we find its comforting that hygiene is viewed as an important issue for guests.We highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

I checked into the Shoreline Waikiki a week and a half ago and I was immediately impressed with the property! The location is fantastic, right down the street from the best shopping in Waikiki. The building is small and intimate- a lobby with a beautiful high ceiling adorned with bright colored comfortable orange leather sofas and warm inviting lighting in the evenings. The lighting fixtures swayed in the breeze coming through the louvered windows. Upon Arrival on my four day trip, I was given an upgraded room ( so thankful, wish I remembered the desk agents name)- imagine my surprise when I stepped onto the lanai in my room on the 12th floor and saw that I had an amazing ocean view!! There's a chalkboard across from the elevator with pertinent local info. I learned the Hawaiian word for child (Keiki) , was kept abreast of local sunrise/sunset times and was given a tip for the day, which I followed and was quite happy I did. My room was well appointed , with comfortable clean linens, a cute white desk chair, beautiful flat screened tv, an alarm clock that doubled as an iPod/iPhone speaker, and the toiletries were plentiful and nice as well. The outdoor pool is located on the 14th floor rooftop. It's small but sparkling and secluded. I enjoyed the ocean view while sun bathing and swimming in relative solitude. The adjoining restaurant Cha, Cha, Cha has delicious tacos and an impressive selection of tequila. There's a wall of fame for those that have tried every kind on the menu! Front desk agent Jun was more than happy to help me with my questions and my late checkout request and the bell desk stored my belongings after checkout so that I could enjoy my last day in Waikiki until my shuttle picked me up that evening for my red eye flight back home to LA. I didn't wanna leave the Shoreline. I'd live there if I could. Alas, that isn't possible right now, but a girl can dream, can't she? This was the fourth hotel in Waikiki that I have stayed in in the last three years and I enjoyed every moment of it. Thanks again and Mahalo Shoreline Waikiki. Hopefully ill see you in November to celebrate my 35th birthday with my Ohana, Keiki included :)Aloha!

My wife visited Honolulu 4 times in the last 10 months, and have stayed in different hotel liked the Hyatt, Outrigger and Seaview Waikiki, (now the Shoreline Waikiki hotel). On our recent trip she convinced me to stay here because she was very happy when she stayed here with her brother just before Christmas. She was absolutely right and our 10 days stay was a very happy and memorable one. The staffs were very knowledgable of the events around town and tremendous in offering advices and directions, and not to forget mentioning their happy SMILES. . Special commendations goes to Vikky, Alex and the filipino girl on the front desk.( Sorry forgot her name). The room service was excellent and front desk is always ready to check to see if we need anything and to send up clean towels if we need any. All in all, I wished anyone looking for good location and excellent hotel at a very reasonable price, to stay at the Shoreline Waikiki hotel. You will not regret it.

I stayed here for 4 nights and it was good for the price you pay. I guess it's about a 5 minute walk to the beach, there are restaurants, coffee and shops all very close and it's very centrally located in Waikiki. The rooms are clean and comfortable, the decor is nice, and I liked having a mini fridge, microwave and coffee maker in the room. There's no pool or fitness center but they have $10 passes to 24 hour fitness which is about a half mile away. The staff is very friendly and welcoming but there's no concierge or bellman since it's such a small hotel. I paid extra for the partial ocean view room and as you can see from the picture, it was just ok. I almost wish I had gone with the cheaper room without a view. I usually woke up at 6:30 or 7 everyday when the sun came up, but I noticed a lot of noise in the hallway from 7 to 9 or so; doors slamming, keys jangling, walkie talkies, so if you wanted to sleep in at all, it would've been impossible. Housekeeping did an ok job, but tended to leave at least one thing unchecked each day (not a big deal, but I wasn't going to call the front desk everyday; just not much attention to detail).I would stay here again - the location is good, the staff is friendly, rooms are nice, it's just very basic. Also, the Mexican restaurant in the lobby is very good (and budget friendly).

Fantastic, stayed here 5 nights in total, large rooms with fridge and nice bathroom, just a short stroll away from everything. Fantastic mexian restaurant next door, free tea and coffee. Very helpful and friendly staff. Would stay here again, great value for money and less crowed and noisy than the large waterfront hotels.

The best thing about this hotel is its great location (for the price)! This was our first time in Waikiki but I wouldn't have picked any other location to stay in Waikiki. Easy beach access, close to all shopping and dining. Everything within walking distance. The room was clean and everything was pretty new. It was decent for our stay, however it was pretty much the smallest hotel room I have ever seen/stayed in. It worked for us because we just used the room for sleeping. If you are a person who enjoys hanging out at the hotel you are staying at, this probably wouldn't be a good choice. Refrigerator and microwave in room. Staff is friendly and helpful. Walk to bus line, if needed. Make sure to make time during your trip to visit the North shore! Don't spend all your time in Waikiki.

For my 39th birthday I ventured off to waikiki for 8 days of fun in the sun! After 22 hours of commuting I arrived at seaside only to find the hotel under renovation!! Wasn't happy considering my 10 day trip in oct 2012 was at the park shore and they too were under renovation at the time. Seaside staff were impeccable...the rooms were clean, relatively quiet despite the construction! The pool was closed but despite not being a huge ocean swimmer I ventured outside my comfort zone and loved every moment. The staff are helpful, prompt and the in hotel restaurant has amazing food! I wish seaside had studio kitchenettes for rent....I would love a long term stay unit! I wasn't disappointed and Loved the personal attention I received from the desk staff! Mahalo....

this hotel is in a great location, close to beach, shopping, dining, e.t.c. our room was clean comfortable,had a fridge,and mircrowave.small balcony to hang out on.the staff were all very nice, and helpfull.i think this hotel is a bargain compared to others in the same area.thanks for a great week shoreline!

The hotel is now Shoreline Hotel - just changed the name not too long ago.The location is super- everything is within walking distance. We got the renovated room but the renovation is just half-done. They probably changed some decor and (maybe) the carpet in the room but the old tiles and part of the old sinks/tub remains, a bit weird imo. We have stayed in quit a few boutique hotel and I cant really call this a boutique hotel. A bit disappointed with the room. It certainly looked nicer in pictures. We didnt get a very high up room so it was pretty noisy as it's at the heart of waikiki. Didnt bother us but could be a problem for light sleepers. If you like to party and don't mind too much for the room, this would be a good choice. P.S: there is no swimming pool due to the renovation
